A small and somewhat hidden restaurant lurking in the darkness wasn't exactly what I was expecting when my friend suggested I try some of the best food I've ever had in my life. And after perusing through the one-page menu, I was disappointed to see that I wasn't interested in trying anything...already not off to a good start.

Luckily, my friend was much more interested in the food selections and we ended up ordering several items: grilled unagi, deep-fried salmon roll, shrimp and chive dumplings, sea bass with garlic noodles, and angus flatiron steak with wasabi noodles. 

OKAY. I CAN'T EVEN DESCRIBE THE JOY MY TASTE BUDS EXPERIENCED THIS NIGHT. 

The dumplings were pretty mediocre and the fried salmon roll tasted like overcooked dry salmon...BUT EVERYTHING ELSE? WORTHY OF BEING THE LAST MEAL YOU EVER HAVE. 

The unagi roll was rich and full of heavenly eel sauce flavors. WOULD RECOMMEND. 10 OUT OF 10 IF YOU LIKE SALTINESS. 

The grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy was so soft and buttery that I felt like taking it home and spooning with it. And the garlic noodles? ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME? How could I fall in love with noodles? They're not supposed to be the star but hey, these noodles definitely made the spotlight. 

And finally, the warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak. Holy. Crap. The meat was cooked perfectly and the noodles have enough kick to it to make you wanna tango but not enough that your spicy tolerance was hit (and trust me, we almost missed out on this because my friend CANNOT handle spicy foods but luckily there were no complaints).

I'm literally salivating as I'm writing this review right now. You guys, it was incredible. It stands as one of my favorite meals of all time. Hope you guys give it a chance!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
This use to be a gem and we still go here and take all friends and family.

The noodles are the best and the meat is always so tender.

SF needs more places like this.

The service is also perfect.
author: Bubble W.

description:
The House is definitely a must try if you're living in San Francisco. It's my favorite Asian Fusion restaurant in the city and I can't get enough of the Wasabi Noodles here! 

My go-to dish here is the Flatiron Steak with Wasabi Noodles! The thin pieces of meat are cooked to perfection and the wasabi noodles has a nice spicy kick to it. I'm obsessed! I even saved it as leftovers to eat 2 days later, and it was still equally delicious after microwaving it! The Seabass here is also worth trying. The fish literally melts in your mouth every bite and tastes so soft and buttery. Order one these two dishes and you won't be disappointed!

If you're looking for a nice place to take your significant other to dinner and don't want to break your wallet, then definitely give The House a try! It's also really easy to make reservations over the phone too! Beware parking is quite a challenge since it's located in a busy part of North Beach!
author: MyTien P.

description: Hands down my favorite Asian fusion restaurant! Wasabi noodle with salmon is a must. Sea Bass and Black Cod (or any fish) are excellent protein choices! The flavors so balanced. Delicious! Desserts are also amazing. Such a great place!
author: Brenda L.

description:
Been going regularly since it first opened.  After many years I conclude
it is actually getting better.  From excellent to more than excellent.
10 years ago I'd say "better than the Slanted Door"--but now it's simply
incomparable.  I now listen closely to the Specials and pick amongst them---especially the black cod or scallops.  It is of course "loud"--
like all San Francisco restaurants--but at least there are no "screamers"
(like at China Live).  For a little peace go to Yuet Lee.
author: Joe P.

description: We were in San Francisco for a week, and we actually considered coming back here again....it's THAT good!! Every dish was amazing. Our family of 4 each chose a different dish, and each was heavenly. Our next trip to SF, this is our first dinner stop!!!
author: Marsha B.

description:
FOOD:
The House has well-portioned and delicious Asian fusion food that is unpretentious yet inventive at a reasonable price point ($$).  
Three of us ordered the deep fried salmon rolls, pan fried scallops (daily special), and tuna poké with avocado (daily special) to share, and I ordered the chicken salad for myself. This was the perfect amount of food for us, and we even had leftovers.
The salmon rolls have a great mix of textures, and are super flavorful without being too heavy.
The pan fried scallops were perfectly cooked. 
The tuna poke with avocado was good but nothing mind blowing.
The chicken salad was also good but again, nothing super special.  It was overpriced for what it was.
SERVICE:
The staff are very attentive, trying to accommodate everyone, including walk-ins.  
SPACE: 
The House is a very small but cozy restaurant and is often busy, so it can get loud.  
RESERVATIONS: 
I would suggest making a reservation because the restaurant is small and busy.
author: Aimee P.

description: Despite the crowded room, and no cocktail list; this was some of the best food I've had all year. My recommendation is to make a reservation, or expect to wait. The wait will be well worth it though. When you first arrive the waiter will give you the specials list. The list can be pretty lengthy, so don't be afraid to ask twice. My fiancé and I started with the mussels as an appetizer. The sauce was so delicious that I had a few more spoonfuls after the mussels were gone. I order the flank steak over wasabi noodles, a dish I was hesitant to get but was not disappointed. The steak was medium, just as I ordered it. It was already pre-sliced but savory. The noodles were fantastic and left a sweet hot aftertaste in your mouth. Before you know it, you're full and with a smile on your face. Next time I'm going to make room for dessert.
author: Joel G.

description:
I LOVE THE HOUSE! I think it is one of the most amazing asian fusion lok key hidden spots in the whole city! I lived in North beach for almost 2 years walking by it daily and never went in (not because it didn't look cute/wasn't always packed...bc it is) but because I did not understand what I was missing out on!

THE SALMONS ROLLS ARE TO DIE FOR! DO NOT EVEN COME IF YOU DO NOT ORDER THESE! sorry for all caps..super passionate about this one I guess. 

Additionally, from someone who likes pretty much everything but pickles...this place has some amazing pickle (swear they cannot be) that they bring out before the meals.  I OBSESSES OVER THE SPICY STEAK NOODLES and THE CHICKEN ENTREE WAS MELT IN YOUR MOUTH (best chicken i have ever had in my mouth to be exact)! okay I will calm down now..

PS. It only has about 10 tables and is hard to get into sometimes so try and make a reservation or plan to come early and go next door to another bar for drinks while you wait !:)
author: Ellie J.

description:
Dinner companion said The House doesn't do reservations. WRONG. Absolutely wrong. 

THEY DO RESERVATIONS HERE!!

Either way, it was a 30 min wait (got there at 6:30p on a Saturday) and they shoot you a text when your table is ready. Plenty of bars nearby to decompress and build your appetite!

Started off with the chive dumplings. Mehr, it was good, but not so good that I'd come back for it. 

Then had the octopus. Yaaaaaassssss. So good. Must-have. Had to resist ordering this one twice. They definitely give you the good cut of the octopus. 

Steak was a bit charred. Medium rare. Super juicy still and a nice plate to share between 2 people. 

Love, love, love the service here. Definitely felt "at home" with how sweet all the waitresses were!
author: Vee B.

description:
One high chair available. The restaurant will fit a smaller umbrella stroller. My toddler ended up falling asleep en route to the restaurant and fortunately, we were able to place the stroller next to our table. But it seemed only one table would be able to accommodate this situation. 

They started us off with some pickles which were good. They were a bit spicy from the chili oil. 

The seared scallop was a special and very good. It was tender inside with a nice sear. I can never get scallops I make to be as tender as restaurants. :( 

The sea bass with noodles and green beans was simple and tasty. 

The flat iron steak was a bit on the chewy side. Overall, I still liked the dish and the flavors.  

I was a bit disappointed that I wasnt able to order the rib eye, since that was the reason hubby and I made reservations.
author: Hae A.

description: Tried the salmon, very delicious. Tried the salmon appetizer, pork chop and lemon dessert. All amazing.
author: Levin C.

description:
This place is so good!! Everything we got was amazing! 
Tempura green beans, oysters on the half shell, and scallops for appetizers. Sea bass, ribeye, and flatiron main dishes and a bottle of wine. 
Every single thing was top notch! Service was great too, impressed by the knowledge of our waitress! Will return when in the area
author: Callie D.

description:
What an amazing dinner experience!  

We made a reservation same day & arrived 15 mins early ... table was ready & we were promptly seated.

Within a few minutes they brought a complimentary order of sesame pickle & took our drink order.  Great selection of wine for a small proprietor ... we had a delicious French Pinot; Puligny Montrachet! 

From there the server shared the chef's daily specials for apps & entrees ... nothing like making the choice harder!  We ordered a sampling of the big eye ahi poke, grilled octopus & the seared hokkaido scallops plus a shrimp salad w/ crunchy pork skin to share.  The grilled octopus was absolutely tender and tasty!  The poke was sweet & savory & I could've eaten a dozen more scallops.  The scallops were perfectly cooked ... I hate when they're over cooked.  

We then moved on to entrees ... we ordered the Chilean Sea Bass, Black Cod & Halibut.  All of the fish was perfectly cooked & paired w/ great complimentary sides!  

Overall the restaurant service was attentive & informing.  They shared our table & were always there to ensure we didn't need something while refilling our waters regularly.  In fact, they brought new silverware for each course!  

The FOOD WAS OFF THE CHAIN DELISH!  Highly recommended!!
author: Rob F.

description:
Reservations are a must!! We made a reservation @5pm on a saturday and boy, was there a line! even for people whom made reservations!!, i've only been here two times and i've gotta say, color me impressed!

I got the wasabi noodles this time with a open faced eel roll and it was just amazing!!! i also got the steak and scallops last time and those were great as well!. it is on the pricey side, but i highly recommend!
author: Nancy W.

description: Small restaurant, quite intimate. Really fast and attentive service. Came on a friday night and good thing i made reservations! It was packed. Food tastes great, i love their small plates more than their entrees. Had the unagi over avocado rice which was amaaaaazing. Life changing and really saucy. Also had the fried salmon roll which was okay, wouldn't reorder. The dipping sauce was a bit too tangy for me. We shared the entree which was the wasabi noodles with steak. Very flavorful!
author: Iris W.

description:
Been wanting to try this place since vday, rating and # of reviews speak for themselves!

Excellent food and service! The servers
were so attentive throughout, and the atmosphere was perfect. I made a reservation for my family of 4 today, and we couldn't help but say "omg, this is sooooo good!" every bite. Even my picky 5 year old
and 9 year old were impressed . We ordered the dungeness crab with avocado toast, and jumbo scallops for starters, they were soo good we devoured them in seconds! For our main dishes we ordered the prime ribeye steak, kurobuta pork, and grilled sea bass, and all were superb, perfectly seasoned and cooked, so flavorful!! For dessert we chose the bittersweet cake and mango tapioca, we finished all of it and left super full! Highly recommend!
author: Loriean M.

description:
Oh my gosh. YUMMY. 
Appetizers:
Seared scallops. Blown my mind.  Super fresh and cook to perfection. I could taste Sweetness from the scallops. 
Shrimp dumpling. Very fresh shrimp. 

Main courses
Salmon was cooked to perfection. It was not over cooked. The sake bonito broth was light. 
Sea bass was also very fresh and naturally sweet. The sauce was ok. I wish they put more ginger. The garlic noodle was delish although a bit greasy for me. 
The prime ribs was tasty but a bit tough and not tender. So our waitress changed to sea bass for me which was very nice of her. 

Desserts:
Espresso bread pudding with strawberry sauce was ok. Nothing special. 
Cheesecake with raspberry sauce was yummy. It was light and not heavy. 

Every dish was seasoning just right not too heavy.
author: Malinee S.

description:
We came here for an anniversary dinner on a Friday night -- the place is nestled in a little side street just off Columbus, so it's a good area if you are planning on going out in North Beach that evening. It's a bit small and cramped, and it seems pretty clear that the place is still figuring out what it wants to be exactly, but I feel like it was worth the shot in the dark even though it didn't blow us away. 

The food portions were really intense. Normally for a fusion place like this I would expect a series of smaller plates, but the server recommended only one starter and two entrees. He rattled off a list of specials that was quite long and a little hard to keep track of, but we did end up going with his recommendations to varying degrees of success. The sake, wine and beer list was alright -- we just went with a few Hitachino beers, which was a nice touch for the place. 

We started with the Hokkaido scallops, which had a nice sear and a pretty good texture. The flavor was alright and about what you'd expect for someone who knows how to cook them, but nothing out of this world. For entrees, we went with the black cod and short rib specials, which again was kind of a mixed bag. The black cod was very flavorful and cooked at a perfect temperature with a nice seat on it, but the miso flavor was a straight kick in the teeth strong. It wasn't bad, but it was quite intense. I didn't order it for myself and I'm not sure I could have finished it. 

I should probably mention that the portion sizes are massive. This felt like the kind of size you'd find at a restaurant in the south. The short rib came served with some shredded sweet potato (good), kimchi (great, but easy to find), and at least 8 or 10 ounces of short rib. I didn't come away from this dish feeling like it wasn't something I could pull off myself with a sous vide setup, but the temperature and flavor on it was quite good. It just didn't feel like something truly unique -- just a short rib that they nailed as good as you can get. 

The desserts were fantastic. We went with the coconut cream brûlée, which had a very rich cream, but the passion fruit flavor cut through it very nicely and it felt lighter than the actual content. The coffee and truffle chocolate cake was also great with a nice rich flavor and texture, though a bit unwieldy at times. Both of them were relatively inexpensive, but again, the portions were quite robust. 

The total price of entry was just about $160 for two, which is something you'd expect for a mid- to upper-range restaurant. This place was pretty loud and I felt like I just about got my money's worth based off the whole experience. I did enjoy myself, but the meal did feel a little rushed, so I couldn't tell if they were trying to turn the table over quickly or things were just hectic. I would recommend it as a nice Friday date spot if you're looking for a little splurge, but not a place for a celebration as there are a lot of restaurants in SF that punch way above their weight at that price range.
author: Matthew L.

description: Had my gal's night here on a Friday night, we were amazed with our orders. Started with the house salmon roll and their special made wasabi sauce, such an perfect combination. Main course we had sea bass and ribeye steak both are well made. Will definitely come back for their pork chop dish and other super yummy food!!! Oh did I forget my most favorite Unagi plate?! Yummmm!!!
author: Xiulan P.

description:
Came for a birthday dinner and was absolutely blown away. 
We started with the oysters, which were fresh and beautifully plump. We also ordered the special scallop entire which were in the perfect light buttery cream sauce. 
For our main entrees, we got the wasabi noodles, pork chop, and special halibut in truffle cream sauce. 
The halibut was my absolute favorite!!! The fish fell apart perfectly and the sauce was absolutely Devine. The baked sweet potato strings on top were a pleasant texture change. 
The pork chop came on top of an amazing pomegranate sauce. All the meat and fish was cooked to perfection. 
The wasabi noodles were a favorite of my boyfriend. 


As for the sake, we got the Wakatake. I've never had such smooth and tasty sake. Worth every dollar. 

Waitress and service was great!

Hands down would come here again and again and again!
author: Miranda N.

description:
This is my 1,900th review. And I am giving the restaurant's 4,000th review. I had the two coincidently planned all along. 

The House has been on my radar for a long time. And when I first started yelping back in 2006, there were only 50 positive reviews. Now the restaurant has 4,000 with the latest review given by Joe Cool. 

What deterred me to dine here? And why did I wait this long?

This somewhat tiny restaurant is always crowded. It is also a bit swanky for me. But every now and then, I do like to treat myself.  

I was here for lunch. The restaurant does have daily specials: one with seafood, which I don't like and one being a Rib Eye steak entrée. It is not rocket-science to figure out what I opted for. For $30.00, the rib eye steak is an 8oz cut and flamed broiled to my liking. My entrée also comprised garlic mashed potatoes and grilled cauliflower florets. The presentation of this dish was a work of art. And the tender steak is cooked perfectly. Honestly the House's version can give any steakhouse a challenge. 

I also added a large bottle of San Pelligrino mineral water for $5.00. The House also has a wine bar for all you wine-lovers. 

The long-awaited visit has finally been accomplished. And the food and service by the cute waitresses were 5-stars. I will definitely be back here very soon, instead of waiting another decade.
author: Matt G.

description:
My photos do not look very good as the lighting was not conducive to quality photography, but the food here was really good and loved dining here.

The area is pretty tight and we went on a Friday night for a second dinner during the hottest weekend in sf, so the place felt like a sauna but I really liked it nonetheless. Perhaps from who I was with, possibly from the friendly table neighbors. 

We ordered the scallops, mussels and the crab. Everyone was getting the fried crab appetizer and we were highly encouraged by the woman next to us, but it was pretty average. I'd definitely get the scallops again. Cooked perfectly and the sauce was very flavorful but not too overbearing. The mussels were also pretty good. I'd like to be back to eat more of a hearty meal here.

Service was great too! Photos on the wall, not so much. Strange momotaro images made me a bit uneasy. 

Tbh 4.5 but still worth the wait imo!
author: Juliana P.

description:
3.5 stars. 

I was super stoked to give The House a try, but I guess my expectations were way too high.

We came in on a Friday night, around 7pm, without a reservation. The wait time was estimated to be about 30 minutes. They have a reservation system where it'll text you when your table is ready, so no need to linger around and wait.

Along with the standard menu, they have a long list of specials that the server will describe out. I found this to be unhelpful as items were easy to miss and we had to ask him to repeat the list.

We ordered the softshell crab appetizer (special), kobe beef tartare (special), and dumplings for our appetizers. For the main entrees, we ordered the korean short ribs and sea bass. Presentation here was on point!

The softshell crab appetizer was unique and was served alongside a side of spicy soba noodles--pretty good. I'm not a fan of raw beef so I didn't try the tartare, but my s/o said that there was way too much sauce to taste the beef flavor. Last and most disappointing, were the dumplings. For some reason, I thought that they'd be pan fried, but nope, they were boiled and kinda sad looking TBH. The flavor of the dumplings were nothing special.

Onto the entrees: the korean short ribs were delish! Served with a side of rice, some broccolini, kimchi, and a mountain of fried sweet potato ribbons. The short ribs were nice and tender, but I wish there was a bigger portion of it. Half of the dish ended up being kimchi and sweet potato.

The sea bass is probably what The House is known for, and I completely agree, the fish was cooked perfectly! However, everything else that came along with it was extremely salty. The fish was already well seasoned, but paired alongside the noodles and green beans and dipping sauce, it was a salt overload! 

Service was attentive, our glasses were never empty for more than a minute or so. 

Overall - glad I gave The House a try, but sadly, I don't think I'd come back for more.
author: Shirley H.

description: This place was recommended by an Elite Yelper Yasaman J; the food was incredible, the service was outstanding. The pork chop, lamb dish and my husband's vegan dish were all so delicious. As far as desserts; coconut creme brûlée and pineapple upside down is a MUST
author: Hedi R.

description:
This place was fantastic. The atmosphere was so beautiful. We went around lunch without a reservation and happened to get a table. There was another couple who came right after us and couldn't be seated. If you intend to eat here, make a reservation. 

I have to start off by saying that the "ramen" wasn't really what I thought it would be. Which is probably why they didn't name it "ramen" on the menu. The Udon noodle soup with grilled chicken and toasted nori was delicious, but not really my speed. I wasn't a fan of the noodle texture, but wanted to try it anyway. It was seasoned to perfection, I just didn't like the mouth feel of the noodles. I'd use the broth for something else though! kudos!!!

The grilled octopus was to die for!!! I hadn't paid attention to the word "grilled" so when I got it, it was a surprise, but a beautiful one! The sriracha aioli was fantastic! I'd put it on everything! Actually we were dipping our food in the left overs because it was that good!!! 

The Wasabi house noodles with grilled pork was one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. The pork was seasoned well, it fell apart in my mouth. The noodles were perfect, and there was the most fantastic seasoning ever! I'd honestly eat it by the buckets and didn't want to share. If nothing else, go at lunch to have it! I was too excited to get a photo of it, so I'll have to go back to add it! I'm content with that!!!
author: Amber T.

description:
I love coming here for delicious Asian fusion food. I used to think it was just an expensive dinner spot but I came here for weekend lunch recently and discovered I was totally wrong. The food quality is super high and the price point reasonable. 

We started with a cream of mushroom soup with truffle oil. It was rich and balanced and did not sacrifice any of that mushroom flavor with the cream or truffle oil. That was followed by mahi mahi served in a coconut curry with shaved sweet potatoes on top - simply heaven. I could have poured that sauce over white rice and eaten it for days. We ended with two desserts because, well, weekends. A strawberry rhubarb tart and another dessert with coffee ice cream that I can't remember  because that rhubarb tart was so good. 

To top it off, service was sharp. Servers were knowledgeable about all ingredients and specials. Worth your consideration!
author: Aaron F.

description:
Came with friends a random weekday evening. They stated had large party reservation maybe an hour from when we were coming in. So we were told if we were to sit then we would only get that time before the next part. That is the reason why I took a star off because we don't want to feel like we are being rushed to enjoy a meal. The place isn't large but we came early in the evening with plenty of seating opened. 
As for the food it was very delicious and presentation was really nice. We enjoyed our meal and made it out before that party was suppose to come. 
Again, I didn't think it great customer service to have to rush guests through their meals. And I'm sure the rest of the other people prior to us left before we did which allowed for more seating for the next party.
author: Diana N.

description: I've been here multiple times. Long wait if you have no reservations - probably not worth it. But if you do have a table with a short wait or reservations, then I've never been disappointed with any of the items in the menu before. Service is mediocre, on the slow side. Intimate. Good food.
author: Tina B.

description:
I was reluctant to give it 5 stars so that less people would eat here so I won't have to wait!
Pros: The only entree I get is the Sea Bass and noodles...you won't regret it. Don't order it or else they'll run out when I go there! ;)
Scallops appetizer, Miso Clams (both not on the menu). Fried salmon appetizer is good too.
Cons: the restaurant is small so prepare to hear other people's conversations while you're trying to make your own. Didn't bother me much but I know some people want space and privacy.

Bottom line: Don't go! Don't reserve!...yeah so I don't have to wait to eat delicious food!
author: Bryan R.

description: My dad likes to treat us and his clients to this restaurant. Every time I leave happy. The appetizers are delicious. We tried the specials today and they were delicious. My favorite was the scallops which were very juicy. They were very soft and melted in my mouth. I wish I ordered more because they were so good. The pork chop is always delicious and cooked perfectly. It's very juicy and with mashed potatoes and asparagus, it's the perfect entree. The desserts were another favorite. I had the chocolate cake which was perfectly soft and chewy. It went perfectly with the ice cream and caramel sauce. The creme brûlée was sweet and the tangerine on sauce on top was delicious. The service was a little slow as it gets busy at times. It took us a little while to order desserts and get our checks, but the food was great.
author: Kaitlyn C.

description:
Tucked away on Grant Ave., you would totally miss the place if it weren't for the people lining up outside waiting for their party to be called. Luckily, my friend made a reservation in advance, we showed up early, and we were promptly seated shortly after.

The restaurant is busy. There's no way around it, yet their service and staff are on their A game, juggling their many to-do's and customers. My glass never saw the halfway mark and the waitress knew exactly how to describe flavors and answer my party's questions.

My friend and I shared two small plates for our appetizer. The first was the Caesar salad with the deep-fried scallops. I'm a sucker for a good Caesar salad and the scallops were a nice treat to accompany the greens. But the grilled unagi appetizer, holy moly! The thick eel filet was hearty and succulent and perfectly matched with a seasoned avocado sushi rice. I still think about that eel dish to this day and if you do decide to get any kind of small plate, get the one with the unagi #casualFriendsreference

For my entree, I had the flat iron Angus steak with wasabi noodles. You're not getting his with the overbearing, sinus-cleansing type of wasabi you would normally get globbed up in a dish at your casual sushi joint. The flavor is subtle and expertly dressed on the noodles which are accompanied with housemade kimchi and other pickled vegetables. The steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare as ordered.

My friend had their lamb special that was being offered for the night of our visit. I'm not a huge lamb guy, I'm not fond of the gaminess in particular. But I had a bite and I could tell right off the bat that this lamb was cooked with care and precision. No gaminess and it just melted into your mouth. The three double-boned lamb lollipops were served with what seemed to be normal white rice. Be wary though, my friend's special was double the price tag of my steak dish and I feel like I ultimately got the better deal taste to price wise.

Long story short, order that unagi dish!
author: Jonathan N.

description:
Came to The House with high recommendations from our friends. Do make reservations here, the restaurant is tiny! We made reservations on Tuesday night and were able to get seated right away.

We got the uni appetizer. For our entrees, we ordered the specials which were the miso cod and the lamb dish. It was good, however I think this place is over hyped. I think my favorite thing was the kimchee that came with the lamb dish. I'm Korean and I eat kimchee almost everyday. However the kimchee tasted a little different with a bit more sesame oil. As for the lamb, it was good but it wasn't the best lamb we have had. Miso cid was good but it wasn't amazing. 

I thought it was priced very high but it seemed normal for SF restaurant. The service was good and attentive but expected for high priced dishes.
author: Jean K.

description:
Unbelievably delicious! Make a reservation or expect to wait - this place gets busy and it's no wonder why. They have daily off the menu specials so be sure you hear the waiters out before setting your heart on something. 

They have a short list of alcohol options, listed from  light to dark. The IPA was awesome and complemented the meal well. Will be back!
author: Shawn J.

description:
Had a really delicious late lunch on Saturday. We tried the poke appetizer (it was a special), the tuna BLT (my dining companion LOVED this), curried noodles with chicken, and shrimp & chive dumplings (we asked for extra dipping sauce and then dumped this sauce on everything...it was delicious). 

The best part of the meal was the bittersweet chocolate truffle cake with vanilla ice cream. It was AMAZING.
author: K. D.

description:
love love this place

the menu is fresh and delicious

the location is walkable from chinatown and north beach, including the financial district

the staff is friendly and warm

inside the space is tights

the food is all good!
author: Charlie B.

description: Nice place, kinda small, but its SF. The food was great. I recommend the oysters with Pork chops. I would recommend a reservation as well or you will be waiting a while. I parked in a parking structure in China town and walked over, it was pleasant.
author: Tim L.

description:
Came here for my boyfriend's birthday via a reservation and this place did not disappoint. I ordered the sea bass with the udon noodles and green beans and omg it was soooo good. Everything was extremely umami tasting and so flavorful. Even the green beans were very well-seasoned! 

My boyfriend got the rib eye with the fried garlic on top and it was delicious as well. We also got the deep fried salmon rolls and those were great, however the sauce that came with them could have been better (in my opinion). It was like a mustardy wasabi sauce. 

We were extremely satisfied with this place, despite having to find parking for 20 mins.
author: Donna T.

description: Everything we ordered tasted amazing! Presentation was done very well too. Our waitress did an excellent job with refilling wine glasses and telling us the specials repeatedly (it was a little loud in there). I will make it a point to come back to this restaurant anytime I'm in the SF area. Go and enjoy, you will leave happy and full!
author: J J.

description: A friend recommended this place and we were not disappointed. Everything on the menu is delicious and very flavorful without being salty (like Kin Khao is horribly salty). So far, we've tried their scallops, salmon roll, sea bass, grilled octopus, mussels, BBQ pork ribs, soft shell crab (seasonal) and ribeye. Be sure to go back and try everything on the menu.
author: K L.

description:
I like to spend the day in the city and try a new restaurant. This time was The House. If you're coming by on a weekend afternoon, it might be a good idea to have a reservation, as it can get full inside. Here is what I tried:

Deep Fried Salmon Roll - Simply incredible. It came out hot, crunchy, and the salmon was not overdone. Don't be afraid to try it with the chinese mustard-- it seems like it might be spicy, but it's delicious. I'd come back just for this dish alone.

Unagi Avocado Sandwich - I really wanted to like this, but there were a couple of things wrong with it-- the bread was way too toasted. The toastiness/char on the bread took away from the unagi and avocado. I would have preferred that the bread by lightly toasted so that I could get everything in a single bite.

Udon Noodle Soup - A wholesome, hearty soup, and perfect to help you get over a cold. I was prepared for the chicken breast to be slightly overdone (which wouldn't have mattered to me, since I know it'd be swimming in the broth), but to my surprise it was simply perfect. Still juicy and tender. The broth itself packed a little bit of a kick, and the cherry tomatoes packed a neat little burst of umami in every bite. Impressed and pleasantly surprised.
author: Nick L.

description: Wasabi noodles were delicious!! Interior is nice. Service was also great (although the line was long).
author: John S.

description:
The food here is artfully presented and very, very good. It looks unassuming from the outside but the inside is quite spacious - my only gripe is that the tables are placed pretty close together so you can overhear a lot of other conversations. The service was prompt and our waters were refilled multiple times. There were also 4 appetizer and 3 entree specials, so be sure to hear what those are before deciding! 

We ordered the following:
Deep fried salmon roll, Chinese hot mustard ($13): after reading all of the rave reviews about this appetizer, we had to order it. I think this was the only part of the meal that didn't exceed expectations. The deep fried roll was crunchy and warm and stuffed with a lot of salmon, but the flavors didn't blow me away. The hot mustard was a nice touch and definitely cleared the sinuses. I like the pickled vegetables that are served with the dish which can help temper the hot mustard.
Curry noodles with grilled chicken ($14): this was delicious, and a huge portion! Definitely a great deal. The curry was thick and fragrant, and the chicken was super tender and flavorful. Some of the best grilled chicken I've had in a while. The presentation was also beautiful and this is probably the first dish I've had with carrots that I didn't dislike (I normally- the carrots were mainly a garnish on top and were thinly sliced and fried for texture and crunch. 
Grilled sea bass ($29): enough has been written about the sea bass on Yelp so I won't recapitulate, but suffice to say this is probably the best sea bass I've had. It was buttery and flaky and delicious, and paired really well with the salty soy dipping sauce and the garlic noodles and green beans. Again, a hearty portion. 

Overall, I think this restaurant is a 4.5 rounded up to a 5.
author: Amy C.

description:
Another special place that we will return to in the future.  
The place a little small, but we got seated right away, because we had reservation (take notice CHINA Live).
Service was fine, they were busy, but still try to be attentive.
Food is very special.... It doesn't belong to any group really, it is Asian fusion, mostly Japanese, at least the ones we ordered.  
Appetizers, we ordered 2, first one the soft shell crab.  Looked sensational!!! Tasted good also....  served with a little soba noodle.
The other appetizer was unagi, with sushi rice....  tasted fantastic.
I ordered the ahi tuna, and the wife ordered the special of the day, cod fish with sushi?  Although the ahi was great, done very well,the cod was really something special.  It was so good, my wife swore it tasted more like Chilean sea bass.  
The kids split the mushroom rice with lobster....  also tasted pretty epic.  I wish I grew up half as nice as they are :).  All and all, great meal....
author: Steve D.

description:
Amazing asian food. I was seriously saying "oh my gosh" after each initial bite of every food!  You seriously can't go wrong with anything on the menu and the server thought we were crazy when we wanted to order so many dishes! What's great is that this restaurant is super accommodating -- we really wanted to try the wasabi noodles but also wanted the sea bass. He was able to swap out the steak w/ the sea bass! Win!

All the dishes were flavorful and well thought out. I personally thought the appetizers were the star dishes -- We started w/ the fried salmon rolls (sounds weird, right?) but the mustard dip complimented it so well. the scallops and the ponzu yuzu sauce was amazing, and so was the unagi avocado rice. Clean plate club! Finished everything!

The main dishes were pretty good, too. I thought the pork chop was a bit overcooked and dry...so i was not impressed with this. It's a huge portion btw, I was surprised a lot of people were eating this as their main dish. The sea bass was cooked perfectly and so buttery and melts in your mouth! We wished that the sea bass was served on the side and not on top of the wasabi noodles because we felt the sauce and flavors of the noodles overpowered the fish. We were also a bit confused because we didn't really taste any wasabi flavors? It tasted pretty garlicky and savory so we thought they cooked us garlic noodles by mistake. Nonetheless, the noodles were delicious.

I definitely will be back! :)
author: Janet H.

description:
This place was my first time trying Asian Fusion, and definitely not my last. I liked sticking to the traditional roots, but nowadays there are cultural influences in all types of dishes and Asian Fusion is so prevalent. I'm really glad that my friend brought me here and it really opened me up to something new. 
I had their soft shell crab appetizer, it came with these delicious chilled noodles and the presentation was really nice! It tasted so good I ordered two. My friend had their famed sea bass. It was so flaky and the garlic ginger soy sauce was amazing. 
The place was really small and seating was tight though. I hope they do expand.

The next time I'm in the area I'd definitely come here to see how the place has evolved.
author: Kali Y.

description: I was a bit wary trying an "Asian fusion" restaurant, but I most say I was pleasantly surprised. This was some high quality food. You can trust all the glowing yelp reviews on this one. Yum :-)
author: Michael D.

description:
My boyfriend and I had been eyeing this restaurant for some time now, and we weren't disappointed! The outside is very unassuming and could be easily missed, and that speaks to how good this restaurant is, since even though the exterior isn't particularly flashy, it always has a full house! He interior is modern and cozy, perfect for a date night! We started our meal with the salmon rolls and the unagi. The unagi was tasty with a really delicious sauce covering the whole roll, but we decided when we come back we probably won't order it again since it is so similar to an eel roll you could get at other sushi places. On the other hand, those salmon rolls were amazing! Crunchy exterior and nice meaty pieces of salmon on the inside- we could've eaten a couple of orders of those! Next we got the black cod which was one of the specials. It has 2 little rolls on top of the fish which were tasty, but that cod was definitely the star! It had a subtle sweet flavor and was cooked to perfection with an awesome buttery texture. That was definitely my favorite dish! We were still a little hungry after splitting those dishes, so we finished the meal with the sashimi which had 2 pieces of each of 3 different fish. The fish was super fresh, and it was the perfect palate cleanser to end the meal. Overall, this restaurant was definitely worth the wait, and we'll definitely be back!

Also FYI, we called to ask about what the corkage fee was, and I think it was either $30 or $35!
author: Rachel D.

description:
This is my 2nd visit to The House. My first visit was probably about 3 years ago (wasn't a fan of the steak wasabi noodles). Anyway, I tried 3 different items on this on visit and they were all pretty darn good. Parking sucks around the area and it's a dim, cramped, little spot but I think the food and service make it worthwhile. 

So, the bf and I came on a Saturday around 10pm. The restaurant was pretty full. Surprisingly got a table with no wait & with no prior reservations. The server brought us waters and menus. A few minutes later, he brought out complimentary pickled cucumbers and told us the specials. We went ahead and just ordered some items from the regular menu.

Grilled unagi, avocado sushi rice, shaved bonito - $13
Steamed mussels in garlic infused shrimp broth - $13
Kurobuta pork chop, pomegranate currant sauce - $28

The mussels were savory and had like a garlicky, brothy flavor. The sushi was good (wouldn't say it's the best ever but nonetheless, good). The pork chop was super yummy! Not dry. We were a little hesitant at first (pomegranate on pork sounded a little strange) but someone told us it was good so we tried it and it did not disappoint! Servers were very attentive and kept refilling our waters. Good food & service!
author: Karen L.

description:
We have been to this place many times and always find the taste and services amazing. Various types of Asian food items to make your dinning experience lovely can be tasted here. This time had some salmon roll and grilled unagi perfectly served with saltiness balanced and rice mixed. Would recommend it to all.
But don't forget to make reservations. Thanks
author: Ellie S.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night without a reservation. Wait was long but well worth it.

- Grilled unagi: Very tender and melts in your mouth, saltiness is balanced out perfectly by the rice.
- Grilled octopus w/ potatoes: Good, but definitely not the highlight of the meal because I forgot what they tasted like already
- Ribeye: Rich, tender, juicy, and full of flavours. So dynamite! It was the best steak I've had in months. The mashed potato also had a nice Asian twist and was not as heavy as you'd find from western restaurants.
- Apple pie: Way too sour for my likings and I was a little disappointed. My friend's desert (think it was mango tapioca?) was also disappointing, but maybe it was due to our expectations skyrocketing from the wonderful main dishes.

Food was excellent overall, and service was prompt. 100% would recommend.
author: Sydney W.

description:
The House is consistently one of the best Asian Fusion restaurants in SF. The food is great, and it's great spot for a dinner date.

My favorite dishes are the deep-fried salmon roll appetizer, grilled sea bass, flatiron steak with wasabi noodles, and pork chop. The salmon is incredibly tender and cooked perfectly medium rare. The grilled sea bass is their signature dish, you can't miss it. The fish is so soft, and the sauce is incredibly flavorful. If you get the steak, definitely don't get it cooked further than medium rare. I've had it both medium and medium rare and it makes a huge difference. Lastly, the pork chop is incredibly tender on the inside, with a nice char on the outside.

Their specials are also a highlight! Parking is a nightmare in this area. Definitely get a reservation or you'll be waiting 45 minutes on most nights for dinner. Luckily, you can leave your phone number if you're a walk-in and they'll text you when your table is ready :)
author: Tim X.

description:
The House has been one of our favorite restaurants.  The Asia fusion flavor is so on point.  The Seabass is a must try and the home made desserts are yummy.  Try the mango tapioca which is so light and refreshing.
 
The pork chops are amazing too.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
My boyfriend surprised me with dinner at The House, and oh my god I hope I'm "surprised" with this place again and again! The place is packed and for good reason. 

We started off with the grilled octopus and I could have died happy in that moment (mind you I was 2 glasses of wine in though so that might be a bit of an overstatement). The dish itself was beautiful and twice as delicious as it looked! Then we shared the prime angus ribeye and the grilled seabass. I thought the ribeye was gonna be the winner here, but the seabass stole the show. The seabass was me dying happy pt 2. 

This place is a new favorite of mine and I can't wait to come back. If I could change one thing, I would  take the seabass and serve it with the spicy noodles that came with the ribeye, and that would be the perfect dish for myself. Also if you're hesitant to try the place because of the $$$, I would rank it more of a expensive $$ considering this is SF.
author: Divleen B.

description: The food was so fresh and tasty. We went here to celebrate a birthday, not much ambience or fanfare just really good food. Our server was friendly and helpful. An overall pleasant experience.
author: Cathy R.

description:
This place is my FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN THE WORLD! It is such a hole in the wall restaurant in San Francisco! I would literally fly to SF for lunch and head back to LA just to eat.... It's that good and that's how much I LOOOOOOVE this restaurant!

When I was in SF, I literally ate here 4 straight days! I am addicted! 

I suggest to order the PORK-CHOP WITH THE POMEGRANATE! MY FAVORITE!!! The presentation is amazing! It's almost like it's for a 5 star fine dining restaurant! 

Steak is pretty good! When I went for 4 consecutive days, one of the days, I went for lunch. They didn't serve the steak for lunch. They made an exception for me because they got to know me!

The calamari is good! The fried salmon roll is bomb!

The servers and the manager/owner are good and friendly! 

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO MAKE RESERVATIONS IN ADVANCE. The restaurant is fairly small because it's literally a whole in the wall and usually can't take walk ins.

I CANT WAIT TO COME BACK!
author: OG R.

description:
This was a great find for a very special birthday dinner. The food really took "Asian Fusion" to new heights. They had three appetizer specials, three entrée specials and one dessert special. The waiter told us all about them but when it was time to order it was pretty difficult to remember what everything was and would have been great if we had a specials menu, but that really was the only downside of this place.

To start off, we had the deep fried salmon rolls and the grilled octopus as appetizers and man were they delicious! For our entrees we had the yellow tail with California roll on top of it and the halibut. Both were cooked to perfection and phenomenal. We paired our dishes with a glass of the Malbec (peppery!) and the Chardonnay (smooth and delicious). We ended our night with the rich flavors of the bittersweet truffle cake with ice cream on the side.

During our dinner, we had an elderly family sitting next to us who gave us recommendations for dishes and honestly, it made the dining experience that much more special. They have been coming to this place for 20 years!! So, yes you should start coming here too.

The restaurant is pretty small so I would recommend making a reservation ahead of time. The only way to reserve, as far as I found, was to give them a call. 

The food and the atmosphere of the restaurant was great and we really enjoyed dining here.
author: Berke T.

description:
This was one of the best ahi tuna dinners I've had in years!
Great job House - five star rating all the way!
author: Bob B.

description:
Such an amazing restaurant tucked away in the city. I would say this is an awesome date spot, as the restaurant is cozy and very intimate. The inside is not too big and not too small, and the food is absolutely amazing. I had a great experience while I was here. I would recommend calling in for reservation beforehand, so you can get a table. It can get pretty packed in the evenings around dinner time. 

They have small plate and entree options. We decided to order two small plates and an entree and share everything. We started with a daily special that the waiter recommended, which was poke with beets and rice crackers on top. It was incredibly flavorful and had a hint of citrus/ spicy taste, which complemented the fish well. For our second small plate, I had the unagi, which was SO GOOD. I absolutely love unagi, and it came baked and was placed on top of rice. The rice was seasoned and had this magical sauce mixed on top, which made it taste so good. For the entree, we ordered the pork chop, which was cooked just right. Not only was the pork chop itself good, but the potatoes on the side were just amazing. I'm not sure how you can make something simple as mashed potatoes taste good, but these potatoes were top notch.

Overall, awesome food and dining experience. I will definitely be back if I am ever in the city.
author: Julie Y.

description:
I made a reservation for a small group for dinner on a weekday. The reservation was for 5:30 (which is when they open), so I was really disappointed that we were seated all the way in the back, near the bathroom, where it is so, so stuffy (because the kitchen is nearby). We asked to be moved but they told us that the other tables were "reserved" even though the restaurant was empty and remained relatively empty for about 45 min after we had ordered, we had a reservation, and we really didn't fit in the tiny table given to us in the back. 

We ordered a bunch of things to share including an ahi tartare, tempura, the cod, noodles with sea bass and green beans, salmon rolls, something with steak, among other things. Everything was fine, but either too salty, too sweet, too cold, or just over - sauced. I didn't like any of the cooked fish dishes as they were over cooked and the sides served with them really didn't pair that well with them.

 We didn't find the food to be memorable or creative, just salty.
author: Nelya T.

description:
It's been a few years since I last visited The House.  The food is just as good as I remembered it to be, if not better!  This is a small restaurants so I would recommend making a reservation in advanced.  

We started off with the phenomenal Grilled Unagi with Avacado Sushi Rice.  The Scallop Appetizer Starter was a special of the day and it was also one of the highlights of the meal.  Beautifully plated and each bite was divine!  The Grilled Seabass with the Garlic Noodles is a no brainer- you must order this as the Seabass will melt in your mouth!  The Ribeye is juicy and perfectly cooked.  A timeless restaurant serving up creative Asian American food in North Beach,  I would bookmark this place for the Seabass alone. =)
author: Melanie N.

description:
Asian Fusion can be a hit or miss, but this tiny little restaurant in North Beach turns out some tasty dishes. Reservations definitely make things easier, but walking in for dinner on a Friday evening, our group of four got a table right away--just before the restaurant filled up! While the decor is nice, the place is definitely cramped, so be prepared to bump elbows.

We started with the deep-fried salmon roll with Chinese mustard sauce--the salmon was partially cooked and the rolls were beautifully presented. They went so nicely with the slightly spicy sauce on the side. The scallops (a special on the appetizer menu) were fried and served with a tasty sauce, but some of the coating was burnt and there was a slight bitter tinge to them. The homemade shrimp and chive dumplings were tasty, though I didn't find them all that memorable. While the appetizers were decent, I think the main course dishes are really the ones to come for!

First, we had the wasabi noodles with flatiron steak, dressed with cucumber and kimchi. The steak was cooked to a perfect, tender medium-rare, but the noodles were a miss for me--they were too garlicky and didn't have much other flavor (certainly none of the wasabi flavor I was expecting). My favorite dish overall was the seared ahi tuna--the middle of the tuna was still rare, and the slices were so tender. The tuna came with rice and strips of taro, along with a spicy mustard aioli--combining all of these components yielded perfect bites of contrasting textures (soft and crunchy) and amazing flavor! While my favorite dish overall was the tuna, by far my favorite protein from the menu was the sea bass (which came with a garlic ginger soy sauce)--seared to perfection and so soft, buttery, and flavorful--this was some of the best bass I've ever tasted!

Overall, I found the dishes here very creative, and the entrees were especially memorable. The dishes here are definitely pricey for what you get, but many of them were executed so well and were so tasty. Though I'm not in a rush to come back, the House is worth a visit if you're in the area!
author: David K.

description:
Normally I'm not huge on Asian Fusion restaurants but was really impressed with The House. The service, server knowledge, and food was all amazing. We had a group of 8 for dinner so we had the opportunity to try different things from the menu. We started with salmon eggrolls, thai style clams. For main courses many in the group went with the Grilled sea bass in garlic ginger soy sauce, a couple people went with the warm wasabi house noodles with the angus flatiron steak, there was also the grilled octopus, and I went with one of their specials for the night - a miso black cod. Maybe I'm biased, but I liked the black cod the most. I thought the sea bass was tasty and so were the wasabi noodles. Through the entire meal we enjoyed multiple glasses of wine. I must say, the malbec they carry is pretty good. For dessert we ended up sharing multiple creme brulees and multiple blueberry cheesecakes. 

I think everyone at the table enjoyed their experience at The House. Their 5 stars is well deserved and this restaurant will most likely be on our list of places to visit again the next time we are in town.
author: Kenny T.

description: Been eating here for years. This is my stepdads fav spot. The consistency of their food product has never failed or wavered. Definitely try their wasabi noodles and the mushroom rice. Those are my fav on the menu  Everything here is delicious. I work around the corner n order to go quite frequently. Try and make a reservation ahead of time because this place is always busy
author: Justynne B.

description: I am a fan of this place. I like the food and the neighborhood.   Try the octopus.   The scallops were also tasty.  The service is also very good.
author: Philip D.

description: Every time we come back to this place we exclaim about the deliciousness of the food, and also about how small the restaurant is.  We almost wish they can have a bigger space, but hey it is working pretty well so why change it.  We were able to get reservations and we got there right on time. They were very busy but we were seated right away.  The place is loud. Lots of people having a great time.  I was able to hear the specials and ordered everything from the special list comprising of Manila clams, scallops, Yellowtail and Sea bass.  I mixed up the sea bass to come out on a bed of the wasabi noodles. This was excellent.  What can I say. It was a wonderful meal...again
author: Daniel C.

description: Wow, amazing Asian fusion. Full of flavor and creativity. Was here on a Monday and seated quicky. Great service as well. Highly recommend. And also located in a great area.
author: Michael N.

description: Still haven't found a grilled sea bass dish better than The House's. Highly recommend making reservations!
author: Carol N.

description:
I was in San Francisco and met N for lunch. He works in North Beach so we went to House. I was limited on time so I grabbed a 30 minute parking space-REALLY limited on time. 

We ordered

 St Louis Rib appetizer special- ribs were crispy on the outside, moist inside. The sauce was too sweet for our liking, but they came on this amazing slaw that was fresh, crisp, with a sucker punch of heat!

Grilled Octopus- this was also good, perfectly cooked and served with crispy potatoes. 

We were in a hurry so we ordered two more apps--we should have ordered a noodle dish and one of the fresh fish options..... but we ordered two more starters:
Fried Green Beans- just okay, would have preferred a different sauce. They were fresh but I felt did not pair well with  the vinegar sauce.

Shrimp and Green Onion Dumplings: again, fresh, but were really lacking flavor. I did not really taste the shrimp or the green onion.

I will be back, service was good and the entrees looked amazing!
author: Kris M.

description: A cozy place with awesome food. We ordered several items to share.
author: Wilson L.

description:
Finally tried this famous house in San Francisco.

It is very small in the crowded North Beach, very surprised such a hole in the wall looking place is easily one of the highest and most rated restaurants in SF.

The food:
. Soft shell crab. 3 stars. This is the most popular dish here but like elsewhere it is overrated. Soft shell crab is barely a food since it is typically small and with little meat. The house wins by presentation, I guess the bread sticks wows most people including us. It is also better than average, crab has enough meat for such a small specie of crab, and texture is crunch yet meaty.
. Steak. 5 stars. In my opinion this is one of the best dishes. Chinese style sauce and I think it was likely grilled. This is one of the best Chinese restaurants in terms of sauce, no wonder its popularity. The tender yet crispy texture is the best I've tasted.
. Miso cod. 4 stars. Cod has great fatty and crispy texture combined with again great sauce. I don't think the fusion like sushi roll was that good though.
. Scallops. 3 stars. Nice presentation but average.
. Other dishes I can't remember well but they are average.

Overall I struggle to give it 4 stars, it is a bit pricey and portion small but we ate all premium seafood and steak, i felt weird sitting in such a tiny crowded restaurant to have expensive food.
author: mengzi w.

description:
Came here for lunch (Mon-Sat) when my friend was visiting from Singapore. And we wanted a nice meal but not extremely formal or expensive. Made a reservation a few days before hand and it was extremely easy. I'm not sure if it was necessary because people seem to pop in for lunch breaks. But the food was goand the plating excellent. 

- Deep fried salmon roll (4/5): As a small plate it was deliciously worth a try at the beginning of the meal. It was crisp and came with a hot mustard sauce. 

- Warm wasabi noodles with grilled pork (5/5): Very good flavors. I loved the texture and fatness of the noodles. And although it didn't blow my mind with new fusion flavors, it was really good. 

- Kurobuta pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce (5/5): the presentation was lovely. The pomegranate sauce worked perfectly with a nice medium cooked pork chop. The highlight for me was the two long taro chips that were stuck into the mashed potatoes. 

I would definitely come here again for the noodles and pork chop, and also to try a couple other things!
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
Have been here twice and both times are so mediocre. I try to be wowed by this place, but now, it's no fluke! 

Got the cod and the sea bass, along with their fried salmon bites and shrimp dumplings. The best parts were the incredible softness of the dumplings (how so soft?!) like velvet, and the fish dishes were fairly good. But the taste of the actually dumplings and the fried salmon were not very good (fishy), while the fish dishes were actually pretty good. Also wouldn't recommend their highly recommended chocolate cake, which is so dense and pretty dry. Skip dessert here and head to Cornology down the street for some homemade popcorn. 

Four and a half stars on Yelp? Not feelin' it.
author: Bonnie G.

description:
MAKE A RESERVATION.

Even though we got there, we still had to wait about 30-45 mins when we checked in. There's really no "waiting area" as you are literally in front of the door with several other people and kinda creeping over the people sitting down and eating (yes, it's that cramped...and it was TOO cold to wait outside).

OVERALL...the service was amazing. We had this women (Asian, long black hair in a braid) and she was great! She has such a positive vibe even though it was kinda hectic and busy, we explained what the specials of the day was and helped us by giving some recommendations. 

My cousin and I got the wasabi noodles, scallops for apps and the pomegranate pork. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING. You can't go wrong. Great quality, presentation and taste. Everything was cooked perfectly. 

No compliments here! The crammed wait was definitely worth it.
author: Kathy T.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco! I can truly say EVERYTHING on the menu is beyond delicious. A must order is the wasabi noodles!
author: Bonnie T.

description:
The four of us came here to celebrate a belated birthday with a reservation at 630pm. We were so glad we made the reservation because the place was packed with a line when we arrived. 

FOOD: 
The food is a little pricey here, but you can definitely taste why. The specials of day are not on the menu. They list the specials verbally when you sit down. We ordered: 
+ Oysters (6) $15: very fresh oysters served with a soy sauce mixed with cilantro and jalapeno
+ Grilled Octopus w/ deep fried potatoes: super crunchy octopus with sauce that complimented it very well 
+ Scallops (3): this was soo good! The scallop was cooked perfectly and the sauce was delicious! Everyone went back to spoon more sauce on their scallop.   
+ Truffle Halibut (Special) Halibut: this is a creamy dish. With halibut served on a bed of mash potatoes and corn, topped with deep fried beets. This was a very flavorful dish, but the truffle flavor wasn't strong enough. 
+ Black Cod: Best dish of the night! Best cod I've ever had! No wonder everyone orders it! The cod was so tender it practically melts in your mouth! and the 2 slices of sushi was a great touch to the fish. And the sauces worked very well with the dish. 

SERVICE: 
Super attentive and friendly! The food also came out pretty quickly! 

AMBIANCE: 
Very cozy! It's actually a lot smaller than it looks like in the pictures. They fit mostly tables of 2-4 people. Although, I'm sure if you make reservations they can accommodate for more. They are located in North Beach (aka: impossible parking) so I would recommend parking in the parking lot under the park in Chinatown and make the short walk here.

Verdict: I would definitely come back to check out their other entrees! Or perhaps for lunch!
author: Samantha F.

description: I was here for a large group dinner (10 people). Food was excellent, great quality and impressive presentation. The ambience can be casual or dressy, since it's very small and intimate with flattering lighting yet simple interior design. It's not good for big groups but I would definitely come back here for a date.
author: Sora M.

description: Brought a friend on a birthday lunch... Small place in Grant Ave SF. Tried the appetizers and main course noodles. Being a professional chef that focuses on Asian Fusion Cuisine I am very much impressed. Also I believe that all is well that ends well so we tried the dessert. Soo delighted I have tried this place out. Definitely will be back and tell a friend about this place
author: Mikoyan C.

description:
My brother and his girlfriend took me here for a late bday dinner. Holy guacamole it was sooooo delicious. Both of them straight up said "you can only get the sea bass or the pork chop." They were right! 

APPETIZERS 
-Scallops: 5/5
I don't know what they made it with.... magic? But it was like a party in my mouth! Soft scallops that melt in your mouth, topped with sea crest and an amazing olive oil sauce? & caviar.... FANCY! 

-Deep fried salmon rolls: 3/5 
I read so many good things about this fish. Must say.... I wasn't that happy with it. The soft raw salmon inside and the crunchy wrap on the outside, YUM! But the spicy mustard.... eh. 

ENTREES 
-Sea bass: 6/5
Yaaaaas! You get a perfectly cooked piece of meat, with a side of bomb dot com garlic noodles &I also yummy greens. Everything about this dish is "YAS!" I literally wanted to lick my plate. 

-Pork chop:4/5
The pork chop came with a pomegranate sauce, it was pretty tasty! The pork chop was cooked medium- perfect! Overall it was yummy yummy, but having a bite after my sea bass... nothing compared.

DESSERT
-Creme brûlée: 2/5
It was a coconut creme brûlée with a passion fruit glaze. The creme brûlée alone was good but the passion fruit glaze made it very tart, my eye was twitching by how sour it was. 

Overall it's a VERY SMALL place. A reservation is a MUST! There's around only 15 tables? And they're all very close together. Imagine the wait? Nightmare! But this place was amazing! I'm so glad my brother & his girlfriend introduced me to it!
author: Kathy T.

description:
Food was good! I liked the pork chop because the taro on the side added enough crunch to the meat. Friend liked the warm wasabi noodles, but the noodles were heavy and kind of greasy towards the end. 
The dishes tasted good because we shared, not sure if it will be too heavy/boring if you don't share plates. 

3 stars because service was just ok, if not kind of snobbish.
author: Julia C.

description:
We walked in on a weeknight around 6:30 p.m. and had a 20-30 minute wait. You're able to venture out and about since they text you once your table is ready.

Things we ordered:

Soft Shell Crab - This was the perfect appetizer! You get a full soft shell crab, fried with wonton noodles sticking up and a flavorful sweet but spicy dipping sauce. 
Grilled Sea Bass - This was cooked perfectly and came with spinach and some fried udon noodles! 
Kurobuta Pork Chop - This was our favorite dish of the night! The pork chop was cooked to medium and it was juicy and so flavorful with the pomegranate currant sauce. I would recommend this dish out of the three we ordered! 

Service was great and I'd recommend you check out The Baked Bear afterwards for dessert.
author: Jane C.

description: This is a good restaurant but I am in no great hurry to revisit. The food was beautifully prepared and extremely tasty and the service was quick and very nice. The fish was awesome - tasty with flavors very well balanced. It is a small and unassuming spot. Pricing is a bit high and I did not feel fully sated, but I did enjoy the restaurant.
author: Sonj H.

description: Yeah- tried this place out on a "whim"- not really knowing what to expect. It was way more than I expected. Had the sea bass, and it melted in my mouth. The shrimp dumplings were exquisite (yeah, I used that word), if you're looking for a really great place, this is it.
author: P B.

description:
Small, packed and if you aren't on your game  you might be challenged with parking and a wait for seating. 
Once you are seated you are in for something special. 
Went with a few friends and shared so we can get a chance to try different things. 

The flat iron steak and sea bass was my absolute favorite. Cooked perfectly both were filled with good flavor and made flawless- not over cooked. I often worry about salt being the assault weapon with these types of dishes, nope not here.
author: Marlee B.

description: The House was one of my favorite restaurants in SF. I always thought The House was making Asian food with a French food making attitude. I've been there many times and had brought friends over many times for that reason to enjoy the beautifully created and delivered food. However, I was very disappointed with the current menu as many of the iconic options are no longer available. For what's available, nothing stood out to me. Additionally, the food quality is no long the same in my most recent visit last week. I hope the restaurant will keep the bar high and continue developing more memorable dishes.
author: Sharon Z.

description:
18.04.15         5th visit at current location

Food --------------------------- 5
Service ------------------------ 5

Like I said ... the only reasons I don't revisit some of my FAVs ...
     so many hot potential places to visit ...
     having too much of even the best stuff can lose it's specialness

Salmon Rolls
    Raw salmon wrapped in egg roll wrapping then deep fried
    Seasoned
    The salmon center is still beautifully rare like seared Ahi Tuna ...
        the heat from the frying allows the salmon's fat to liquidfy ...
           thus you have this moist silky salmon interior with 
              an yet an contrasting crispy exterior
     Blissful

Octopus appetizer
    - Very very tender grilled octopus
      Have this nice just right amount of charred to give it a little umph ...
         (Don't laugh - other places ... "soft tender charcoal" ... chuckle
                  seriously ...)
       Generous portion ... the past 3 to 4 other restaurants ... 
           I was surprise the portion was so paltry ...
               [the other places 1/2 the portion for the same price]
     - Tempura potatoes ... seasoned ... al dente ... interesting texture 

Pork Chop
     Neiman Ranch Pork Chop ... soo good I can be fooled thinking it
          was steak meat!
     Cooked perfectly!

Sea Bass
     Warm Wasabi Noodles
     Ginger Garlic Soy Sauce


My review are always evolves as my dining experience builds and
     wisdom every years ...
Why food ... 5 and service ... 5 a super rare ...
Show me a place surviving 20+ years (including the old location in
      Sunset) where 
      - the food consistently come out at this level and 
      - service evolved to a level that I cannot find fault ...
      - portion is generous (finding in decline at other places)
           not a fan of "French French" portions
      - Reasonable price (... Have YOU noticed that some places ...
                      [ half of chicken for under 27 bucks ... yes HALF ...
                        that's 50+ BUCKS FOR WHOLE BS ]
        GOOD PORTION

 

18.04.16 - Rough Draft ... will finish tomorrow ...


Past review ......
Ate at the old 9th Ave location and relocated space on Grant St

Food ----------------- 5
Service -------------- 4.5

When it first opened on 9th Ave ... it was the best Asian Fusion food
     that I had the pleasure of eating.
After more than a decade ... It is still exceptionally great ... 
When an establishment survive and yet did not waver in taste and
     quality is rare... thus a 5 star
Many other places skimp on ingredients or use cheaper substitute thus
    compromise the dish
Still serve superb food.

These are few of the dishes I ordered and sampled over the dozen visits
  Salmon Roll 
  Miso Black Cod
  Blue Lake Bean Tempura
  Hamachi Sashimi
  Ahi Tuna Tartare
  Grilled Shrimp Salad
  East Coast Skate

It must have been 1990's or was it 80's when it first opened in Sunset?
I haven't visited it within 2 years ... too many restaurants to try!
So I won't detail the above dishes.
I am going to re-visit very soon
author: S.K. Y.

description: Everything we had was delicious here tonight. Compliments to the chef! Will definitely be back here again. One of our party said, "If I lived here, I'd be back once a week."
author: Amy L.

description:
Suggestion #1  Make a reservation
Suggestion #2  Order the sea bass

This place is always packed for a reason.  Restaurant is small and the food is fantastic.  So reservations is a must.

I've been coming here for years and I've tried almost everything on the menu.  I've had grilled sea bass everywhere, and other places just don't measure up.  Cooked in a garlic ginger soy and served with warm wasabi house noodles and green beans, this is my favorite meal on the menu.
author: Bevin H.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Monday. It was still my birthday weekend and we were in town as a stop-over on our way to Palo Alto. Looking at the reviews on Yelp and seeing how crowded they were on that overcast morning, we were suddenly very excited to try out their offerings from the moment we walked in. We tried the Salmon spring rolls to start--this was a direct result of some of the reviews we read. They were very well flavored and with just the right amount of crunch. Good so far but I've had similar in a popular chain of restaurants so I wasn't blown away as I thought I might be. Next, I tried the halibut and while I would say the amount of food offered was not a lot, the fish was cooked absolutely perfectly with just the right amount of crispness on the edges. It was placed over thick noodles that seemed to be high in liquid smoke, but quite good. I was definitely happy. And as it was my birthday, we opted for flourless chocolate cake and a scoop of coffee-flavored ice cream (which they comped). It was surprising how typically American the desserts were. Not a problem, but just an observation. 

I'd say we left happy, though maybe for the amount we spent, we felt like the value wasn't the greatest. Still very good.
author: Brad S.

description: It was great. Food and service was great. Lemonade was a little bitter it needed extra sugar but overall good experience.
author: Stacey A.

description:
Went here for date night, and thoroughly enjoyed my dinner here! Portions are generous, and they allow for easy sharing!

Service was very nice! I'd recommend trying to get a reservation if you're under more of a time crunch, otherwise the wait seems to average ~1 hour. They text you when your table is ready though, so you can be free to walk around the area and explore SF for a bit while you wait, which helps pass the time. 

Environment is very cozy, nice for dates. We ordered the special scallops, the sea bass (popular item it seems) and the special mahi mahi dish with California roll. 

Scallops: Super tender and flavorful! Pretty plate :) would recommend! 

Sea bass: So much good flavor! A little oily but honestly worth getting since it's so tasty. Plating was standard, but 5/5 on flavor. 

Mahi mahi: Beautiful plating, and unique serving of California roll. Made it taste better since it looked so unique! Almost like a CA roll cut longways. Fish was so so (sea bass was much better in comparison) but overall a lovely dish as well!
author: Tina T.

description: The House is what I imagine good Asian fusion to be like - you don't love every dish on the menu, but a few dishes, the ambiance and the curt but appropriate service keep you coming back. What the place lacks in creativity, it makes up in execution. Its the place I would bring a date or a group of friends to. I thoroughly enjoyed the grilled sea bass and wasabi noodles/flank steak. The salmon roll wasn't that impressive so I would skip that. The dessert was a nice touch but not a must have either. Overall a great dining experience in a very short amount of time (50mins).
author: Sophia W.

description: Visited this place with family and friends.Quick service with tasty food at a reasonable price suitable for all vegetarian people.Loved the food and the staff was very professional and friendly in terms.Enjoyed the service
author: Giorgi K.

description: Good stuff - been here 2x and always have a great experience. Food is amazing, watch out for that sake - it will get you! Place is really small though, so if you like your personal space, good luck!
author: Peter S.

description:
Food:  id rate this 3.5 stars.

I forgot to write down all the things I had and since the menu changes I'll remember what I can.

Ahi tartare - this was not a bad dish.  Had some good flavor to it and presented well.

Prawn salad (I believe there were prawns in it) - also a pretty good dish and pretty hearty with the vegetables.

Grilled lamb - the two dishes prior were actually better than this main.  The grilling made it a little dry and it was pretty bland.  

Chocolate trifle - if I were to choose a dish that I remembered the most it would be this.  The trifle was amazing.  Very dense and moist.  I'd come back for this dish alone.

Service:  friendly waitstaff and attentive as well.

Ambiance: so the place was packed and felt slightly claustrophobic.  I remember seeing a table of 6 probably packed into a table meant for 4.

Overall: given that the area is hard to park I would probably not really venture to come back.  But then again the trifle...I wouldn't mind coming for that alone.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
Trust me and eat the following incredible dishes: grilled octopus appetizer ($16), grilled sea bass and garlic noodles ($31), and coconut creme brulee with passionfruit glaze ($9).

You'll be too engrossed in your dishes to notice the other patrons sitting millimeters away in the cramped space or to be angry about North Beach's lack of parking. 

This place is that good.
author: Cin-Yee S.

description:
I've been to The House a few times. Half of those times it was delicious. Last time I went we ordered the Cod and the Sea Bass. The dishes came out cold and the fish was undercooked. I felt nauseous a few minutes after I ate it. When notified the hostess, she offered to cook it a bit more :D
Despite the above they charged the full amount (even though the dishes clearly came out bad).
Not going back to that place. If you do, don't order the fish ;)
author: Yevgeny K.

description: Literally as small as a house but food quality is larger than life. We went during lunch and were one of the first guests to arrive. It was pretty easy to walk right in but I've heard it gets busy. Parking will be rough. We uber'd pretty much everywhere. Man was this place a treat. I'm so glad I asked friends for recommendations. Will visit again.
author: Ashley W.

description:
I didn't want to leave a review for The House because I felt it could never really explain just how great this place is.. so I kept just putting it off. 
So instead - let's keep it short, sweet and incredibly superficial;

I've eaten here maybe 20 times for lunch and only ever twice for dinner.
The food is simply perfection. The service is just fine. The atmosphere is whatever, 
The food here is everything. Quality is just top notch, taste is just superb and the price is really reasonable.
cheers.
author: Adam O.

description: We visited the area and was pleasantly surprised by this find. The restaurant is small but the experience was great from start to finish. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Food came out quick and was delicious. We walked from downtown area because of parking limitation. Great find!
author: Tai C.

description:
Great food. The rib eye is right on point and sea bass is tender and fresh.
