description: Service was fantastic. Ordered the soft shell crab, curry noodles, and scallops. Everything was good but would pass on curry noodles the next time. A little overpriced in my opinion but would go again.
author: LE F.

description:
Having been here a second time, this 5-star review is needed to be written. 

Location/Ambience: North Beach being as diverse as it is--food-wise, socially--this Asian-Fusion restaurant fits right in. Tucked between bars, culture, upbeat energy, The House is a perfect place to wind-down for a glass of wine and dinner, have a date, take a friend who's seeing SF for the first time. Limited seating, sure, but dynamic in said aspects. 

Food: Had the Teriyaki Ribeye twice, with the second time having tasted like the first. Flavorful. Presentation. Very reasonably priced for a steak its size and taste. Deep Fried Salmon Roll was the perfect appetizer. DELISH. I've tried the Seabass before and that was also a pleasure to have on the palette. The dessert with the coffee ice cream, truffle, and coconut cream was the cherry on top. My taste buds are--til this day--thanking me for having ordered such. I tell them, "Don't worry little taste buds, we'll be back for more." Lastly, tried their Ozeno Yukidoke IPA: among my favorite IPA's to date. Citrus notes, Simcoe hops (but not TOO hoppy tasting for those who prefer otherwise), tasty, tasty, tasty. 

Service: A1 all around. Attentive and informative. They deserve lots of credit. Great job House Team. 

Save further review reading and go head and reserve a table here. It's a great spot. Love it.
author: Julian G.

description:
The House is a tiny upscale Asian fusion restaurant in San Francisco that cultivates superb in ingredients in a style that modernizes Asian cuisine without sacrificing its heritage.  In other words, I experienced a fantastic Asian fusion meal due to the ingredients alone.

My Overall Rating - 5 Stars (Atmosphere, Service, Food, Return)

Atmosphere - Make reservations!  It's a small restaurant so you'll get the best experience if you plan ahead.  San Francisco is hilly, so parking is a challenge but the restaurant is cozy and inviting.  There is raw wood featured throughout, giving it a very nice upscale, Asian feel.  1 Star.

Service - We had a team of great servers.  A restaurant like The House requires the staff to know and explain the menu.  We learned a lot about our dishes and they certainly made recommendations based on our likes and dislikes.  Throughout the meal the staff was attentive but not overbearing.   Great service.  1 Star.

Food - Three standouts:  Wasabi house noodles (I paired it with Seabass), Kurobuta pork chop, & the Masami rib eye.  Bring a group of friends and order these items. The noodles were fantastic.  You can pair them with any protein, so I chose soy glazed seabass.  The fish was delicate, flaky, and absorbed the flavors well.  The Kurobuta pork chop is a Berkshire breed.  It was the juiciest and most tender chop I have ever eaten.  It was almost like a steak - but pork.  But surprisingly the rib eye was just as amazing.  I recommend splitting this dish into 3 or 4 parts so you can share.  The steak is well marinated and so tender.  The rib eye Asian flavors were subtle but delicious.  2 Stars.

Will I Return? - Yes.  Every item we ordered was fully devoured.  The House is a great place for special occasions.  It's worth a visit whether you are local or visiting.  Quality comes first & it certainly shows.  1 Star.

My Yelp Rating Scale (Sum of all parts):
1 Star - Atmosphere - Is it a cool dive?  Perhaps an upscale place?  No matter the type, atmosphere plays a big part and I'll give a star if I like it or thinks it has great charm.
1 Star - Service - You can have a great meal with bad service.  But that's also what can make a five-star joint drop to four.  It's important to the dining experience that service is great and on point.
2 Stars - Food - I'll award up to two stars for the food, since this is the main reason we dine out.  Sometimes the extra star is given for value, but it's really all about the food.
1 Star - Will I come back? - If I know for a fact I'll return, I'll give this a star. A place has to make an impression for me to return. 

Each Category can be given up to 1 star except food (2 stars) because I consider all these categories important to the overall dining experience.  I will sum them up to provide my final Yelp score.
author: Trinh T.

description: I can't believe I haven't found this fusion gem earlier. The scallops, kimchi, and sea bass were all delicious, albeit slightly on the sweet side. Seating is a bit cramped which takes away from some of the atmosphere.
author: Mike S.

description:
I've been here twice and I love the environment and the food here! 

I previously ordered: 
Warm wasabi house noodles, flatiron steak
Miso black cod, crab avocado maki 

The noodles were fantastic! 

This is a pretty small place so I would recommend getting a reservation!
author: Kelly L.

description: I had probably the best sea bass of my life here. It was one of those dishes that made you just close your eyes and savor the taste. The sea bass was incredibly soft and juicy. Interesting Asian flavors with garlic ginger soy sauce dip with green beans and noodles. The scallops were also delicious with a sweet sauce. I am definitely recommending this restaurant for anyone who visits SF.
author: Sean L.

description:
Service: made reservation and was waited for 15 mins before seated 

Food quality:
A+. Came here 4th time and the food is quality has been very consistent 

Personal favor Sea Bass
author: Mack A.

description:
Even though the place is kind of pricey, it was definitely worth the $$$ because it was super delicious, original and even filling! We were lucky because the line wasn't too long when we arrived (I think around 6) but when we were leaving it was pretty crowded with a line outside. Sometimes it was hard to get a hold of the waitress because they were kind of understaffed but when they did interact with us, they were polite and courteous. The decor was also very simple and minimalistic which allows our senses to fully enjoy the food at hand!

I had the Warm wasabi house noodles with flatiron steak cooked perfectly to a medium rare. The dishes here were unique and I've never tried anything like them before.  A truly unique and original Asian Fusion place. The noodles were thick noodles, almost like udon noodles and had a great blend of spices and flavours, so it wasn't too bland but wasn't too overpowering. It was hard to describe in the moment but I remember it has something delicious to eat. It was a bit spicy which added nicely to the overall composition of the meal.

Also tried the Mushroom Cream rice with Shrimps! This dish was more saltier than the house noodles but it worked out very well. Sort of had the texture of risotto but was different at the same time and was put together very well. I think I might of enjoyed this dish slightly more than what I had. But they both were very good!

If you're in the area, this place is a must try! But remember you have to be willing to spend the money and to come early because this place is always packed.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Was recommended by a friend. He had spoken very highly of The House, and he was correct. The ambiance is pleasant, the wait staff is great and friendly, and the food was great, both presentation and taste.

Would definitely go back next time I visit San Francisco and would definitely recommend to locals and tourists.
author: Brett D.

description: Sailed in a little after 6 o'clock and scored a table right away. Things only got better from there. As it was our first dinner we had no idea what to order. After a quick checkin with our server we decided to go with whatever small plates she felt like delivering, 5 in total. We had the poke, scallops, salmon rolls, octopus, and capped things off with garlic noodles. This was just the right amount of food for us to share. All great selections, great service, and a cozy welcoming atmosphere. There's a reason this place has so many top reviews. Five stars all the way.
author: Adam M.

description:
The place was mostly full on a Thursday night. Service was friendly enough. The space is on the smaller side, and you'll probably catch a draft from the door opening and closing.

Flavors overall were good. We started off with the sashimi special, which had pretty sizeable pieces. I don't even remember the other appetizer we got. The grilled ahi tuna and the seared scallops were both solid options.

Surprised this is rated a 4.5?! I mean the food was good, but nothing standout tbh.
author: Eva W.

description:
Hands down the best Asian fusion I've had in the city. 

We ordered the salmon rolls to start (the hype is real!) and devoured them in minutes. The entrees didn't last much longer. Our entrees in order of preference: the sea bass with soy ginger noodles, korean-style domestic kobe short ribs (special), pork chop, and warm wasabi house noodles with flank steak. Don't let the uninspired plating of the sea bass fool you - the fish was cooked simply but perfectly and melted in my mouth like butter. Far above and beyond the best dish of the night. In contrast, the pork chop was presented like a mouth-watering work of art - almost too pretty to eat! Their noodles appear to be made in house which is always an added bonus for me in any meal. We finished off with the coconut creme brûlée and a soufflé for dessert. The creme brûlée was underwhelming after the amazing meal we'd just had but the soufflé was warm, fluffy, and perfectly moist.

Make a reservation or expect to wait at least 30-60 minutes! Luckily they will call you when your table is ready so you can go to any of the nearby bars for a pre-dinner drink while you wait.
author: Nerri Y.

description:
This is probably one of my favorite restaurant places in San Francisco. Although i'm not much of a seafood person, I really love ordering the sea bass (instead of steak) with the wasabi noodles. The noodles - very thick, with hints of sesame, and a slight spicy touch to it - really complemented the sea bass. 

The sea bass had such a rich flavor to it. The fish was very tender (almost as if it melted in your mouth) and this became my favorite meal at the house.

As for service and ambiance, I was pretty satisfied. The waiters and waitresses are dressed up and there's dim lighting which makes this a great date spot!
author: Julie N.

description: One of the best dining experiences I have had. From the sashimi appetizer/shared plates like fried salmon rolls to soup to miso cod and ending with pineapple upside down cake. Everything was fresh and flavorful. We had excellent service too, which made it even more pleasurable. I hope I get to go back some day.
author: Shelli C.

description:
This little spot just blew me away, with their food, ambiance and presentation. everything i had here was amazing. We showed up and didn't have a reservation on a Saturday night. we had to wait for about 20 mins to be seated, so not bad. (we ogled other ppl's food till then and obviously checking yelp for photos).

The menu has something for everyone, really covers all the bases. its got veggies, meat(pork, beef, sometimes lamb), fish (halibut, sea bass) so you will find something to your liking. 

we got green been tempura and Clams to start with, they are perfectly crispy and not battered heavily. liked it a lot, didn't care that much for the vinaigrette that it came with. Clams were awesome, came with toasted bread which you could dip in the scrumptious gravy. 

For the entrees we got Pork chop and Halibut. 
First thing you see is the presentation and the quantity. They are huge, i love that. I feel like lot of fancy and top restaurant skimp on the quantity saying that a perfect bite is better that have a stuffing of a good portion. But there is not skimping at the House. You will be full after you eat here. 

The taste: it was one of the better pork chops i have had, The pork chop was perfectly cooked and the pomegranate sauce with bits of pomegranate was perfection. Loved it. 

The halibut came with i think sweet potato strings. the halibut was flaky and again perfectly cooked, and really packed with flavor. Loved it. 

I have heard a lot of good things about the sea bass so i will get that next time although its hard for me to deviate from the pork chop. 

Just get here and try it for yourself.
author: Anuj C.

description:
So much hype about this place and I only heard about it a few weeks ago from my roommate LOL. Came here on a Saturday night with a few friends around 5 PM. We didn't have a reservation, but since the restaurant had just opened there was plenty of seating and we were seated right away. 

The House is very very very very SMALL. Emphasis on small. There are only a few tables, and even though you're sitting at different tables, it feels like you're literally bumping elbows with the people sitting at the table next to you. It's cozy though LOL. Decor and ambiance is very warm and cozy feeling, but still very chic. The staff is also very friendly and efficient! The service was excellent. 

The menu included a lot of different items and the waitress also recited the specials to us when we got there. I sort of always hate that -- when they recite the specials instead of having it printed somewhere -- because I ALWAYS forget what the specials were/what's in it, etc. But the menu items were mid-level price range, ~$15-$35 depending on what you got.

I ordered the grilled sea bass of course -- I needed to see what the hype was about. And our table ordered the scallops from the specials menu to share. It's $5 for 1 scallop, so we ordered 4. OK SO. SCALLOPS. SO FREAKIN DELICIOUS. They were probably the best scallops I've ever had. Pretty large, but a good one bite sort of deal for an appetizer. They were tender and perfectly cooked and flavored. The presentation was beautiful as well. Worth the $5 per scallop for sure. The sea bass came with green beans and garlic noodles. Overall the dish was delicious. The fish was cooked so perfectly. Like I am in awe of how soft and buttery and delicious the sea bass was. It astounds me how someone can cook fish like that. Because I definitely can't cook fish like that LOL. The garlic noodles were pretty good, but I love me some green beans. So they were a winner in my book. 

All in all, I thought the food here was pretty delicious. I'm not a HUGE fan of semi-upscale Asian fusion food (hence the four stars instead of five). But definitely give this place a shot if you get the chance
author: Amy T.

description:
Took my parents here to eat lunch on a Saturday afternoon. I had made reservations for 1pm, but arrived a bit earlier and was able to get seated before that time. Tip** parking might be hard to find in that area, especially on a busy Saturday! My dad had actually started leaning towards eating somewhere else less crowded but we ended up just parking near Pier 39 and walking to the restaurant - fortunately it was a nice walk and didn't feel long at all.

We started with a few appetizers (small plates) and then each got an entree. I have to say that everything was SO DELICIOUS. Every dish tasted so fresh and the seafood was cooked so well.

Deep Fried Salmon Roll: This reminds me of an egg roll, but with salmon in it. The salmon tasted super moist and I liked the crunch of the wrap. I however can't handle spicy food and so the wasabi sauce was probably my least favorite part of the meal.

Ahi Tuna Poke with Avocado and Crispy Rice (one of their specials of the day): So good! The ahi tuna tasted really fresh and accompanied by the avocado and crispy rice (which reminds me of rice crispy cereal) was perfect. I only wish there was more to go around.

Me: Unagi Avocado Sandwich ($14): I would definitely recommend getting this if you're a fan of the dragon roll. I really enjoyed this dish, especially the bread. The way they seasoned and toasted it was super good. This dish also came with a side salad.

Mom: Hokkaido Salad with seared scallop and shrimp: I had a taste of my mom's scallop and it was .... so good! (for lack of better words) 

Dad: Wasabi warm noodles with grilled king Salmon: I also tried some of the noodles and a bit of the salmon and thought this dish was rather tasty as well.

Our plates were clean by the end of this meal. I would definitely recommend coming here and will have to come back for dinner one day!
author: Michelle C.

description: After much contemplation of dining here, we finally made.  Most of our orders came out and were pretty good.  However we ordered a bottle of wine and it was at very warm temperature.  We asked the waiter twice to put the bottle to chill but he kept forcing us to drink it before it even reached a temperature we wanted.  With that, here comes their famous noodles with beef.  We ordered them medium and they the beef came quite rare.  We asked them to take it back to Cook and they made us put the beef in a separate plate so they can recook it.  Why would they not take our plate and cook the beef for us? I found that odd. At the end, place is alright, service was okay.  Not really friendly but I guess being so small you have to rush people out as quickly as possible.
author: Ami P.

description:
I would rate the House four and a half stars.

We started with raw oysters served with a spicy cilantro mignonette. The oysters were fresh and fantastic on their own though I was very curious about the mignonette; I tried the sauce on one of the oysters and it was great as well. I'd compare it to a fresh sriracha sauce. We also had the scallops. They were seared perfectly; I tasted the char, yet the inside of the scallop still retained the raw ocean flavor. I would highly recommend both of those appetizers. For the main course we shared the sea bass with string beans and noodles.

Our service was outstanding. The atmosphere was very intimate making it perfect for a date or an outing with a small group of friends. There was a 30 minute wait for dinner on a Wednesday night, but there were plenty of bars to pass the time nearby.
author: Joseph T.

description:
Wow I felt privlaged to eat in the number one rated Chinese  resturant in China Town. 
     I was blown away. This place is not cheap but worth the money.  Wasn't sure what to get as there was such a selection, but the waiter was very helpful and made great suggestions. 
     It was a very good meal
author: John H.

description: OK this place is perfect if you don't come here you're stupid. The food is awesome Service is awesome very small but  We had the best time. I'm telling you if you don't come here you're stupid the flavor  on everything Was perfect.The whole experience was awesome.
author: Gordon F.

description:
North Beach is full of great restaurants, The House is right up there. I agree with most other reviewers in their praise.

My wife and daughter went tonight. We were seated promptly at the time of our reservation. Our server clearly explained the specials. We had soft shell crab and the poke appetizer. For the main course we had wasabi noodles, sea bass and rib eye. All were perfect. We noticed other dinners sharing. That would be a good idea as the tastes are varied. It is hard to go wrong here.
author: Steve B.

description: The food is fabulous - fresh, creative, delicious! The grilled octopus appetizer was so tender, the best I've had anywhere. I got the hamachi special, and highly recommend it. Next time, I'm going to get either the halibut or the sea bass (with garlic noodles). Go early if you can, and reservations are a necessity.
author: Tassie C.

description: It looks better online than in person. The restaurant is cramped and I felt like I was about to elbow the guy next to me while eating. On top of that, you can clearly hear everyone's conversations around you. The food was decent but the atmosphere was lacking.
author: Christian T.

description:
I wish I could give 5 stars to this place but I can't.  My girlfriend and I made reservations ahead of time and were seated by the window with a great view of the bustling city streets.  The ambiance was great.  The appetizers we ordered, the unagi and the mussels, blew us away.  They were the best appetizers we've had in a long time.  We ordered a nice, albeit overpriced, bottle of Riesling to accompany the meal.  

When it came to the main course, we were extremely underwhelmed.  

My girlfriend ordered the steak atop "wasabi" noodles.  There was no detectable wasabi here, only red pepper, and the seasoning was just "meh," salty and spicy but not much else.  The steak on top we ordered rare and rare, indeed, it came - complete with a huge gristly line of silver skin connective tissue running straight through the middle.  It was inedible and we didn't take the time to send it back for fear that all the meat selected in the kitchen was so terrible (not to mention it was just a bad dish composition in the first place!)  

I ordered a special of the day, whitefish with a truffle cream sauce on top of mashed potatoes.  My first thought was that everything was rather bland and I could make better mashed potatoes at home.  There were some completely unseasoned fried cabbage sticks sitting on top.  The only redeeming quality of the dish was that the fish was well cooked, not overdone and nice and tender.  My girlfriend and I ate this together with sullen hearts.  

A note to the management:  Would it kill you to get some new plates?  The white plates our food was served on looked like they had been around since World War 2, with plenty of knife scratches and weird discolorations from years of abuse and repeated washing.  

Two stars instead of one because I recommend you come here just for drinks and appetizers and then go elsewhere for some real food.
author: Julian W.

description: Great place to have tasty dinner with family.  You can't  go wrong with this place.  Come try it out and you'll know.  Don't forget to make a reservation though.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Luckily my friend made reservations, strongly recommended because it seemed pretty crowded even around 9pm.

Very casual place with exceptional food.  As part of their specials, they had the scallops and they were absolutely one of the best I've ever tasted! Nothing else mattered, but I want everyone know to get the scallops if they're available!!!! PLEASE
author: Diana C.

description:
For ADHD readers: 
After the above great reviews, you really don't need to read my review. However, I emphasize on the fact this is a fantastic Asian Fusion restaurant in the heart of San Francisco. Don't hesitate about where to take your wife or date or friends; just come here.  It's the best in SF area, hands down!. Fried Salmon roll is a MUST.


Experience..

Make sure you call for a reservation couple days in advance. Came here with newlywed, one of the greatest friends and his wife. Staff and waitresses are ever-smiling, hospitable and still chipper even for our late 9:15 pm reservation. Tables and chairs were clean, simple and non-extravagant. Your expectations are neutral if you just look at the atmosphere. It's a cozy and warm place with a family-owned vibe. 

Salmon Phenomena.. 

Deep fried salmon roll with Chinese hot mustard and roe is a MUST here. Ordered one and then had to ordered another one. We could've ordered 6 of these, finished dinner and left super happy. The taste of this roll is just phenomenal!. They were perfectly cooked, rare in the middle. Be careful not to pour too much of the hot mustard. Raging smoke will come out of your ears if you get too much of that sauce (like what happened with this dude). Seriously, you can eat only these salmon rolls and leave happy. 

Entrees..

1- seared ahi with spicy mustard aioli on top of sticky rice
2- ribeye steak with teriyaki, toasted garlic butter sauce
3- pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce

I tried the ahi and ribeye steak. The seared ahi was spectacular! It was the best ahi I've ever had. Ribeye was great, but between the awesome salmon roll and ahi, its thunder was stolen. 

Prices here are the most reasonable.  

My friend and his wife were super happy with the experience. My friend is a high class fastidious foodie and hearing how happy he was, made my night.. He paid for the food which makes anyone happy :). We left with a big smile, took a glorious stroll, loafing around in North Beach, praising The House and enjoying the Christmasy air.

It is indeed the house of San Francisco!
author: Ahmad A.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place for a while and finally found the time today, for lunch on Friday.  Booked lunch reservations same day and arrived on time to snag the best seats in the house - directly in front of the window.  

The lady who greeted me, well, actually didn't greet me but kind of just looked at me when I arrived.  Had a cold and blank stare while she worked.  I didn't like her energy; but another woman, who was dressed in plainclothes was much more friendly and nice.  She reminded me of Yoko Ono due to her straight black and somewhat tousled hair. 

We ordered the salmon fried rolls with mustard sauce.  These were cooked to perfection and the meat was not overdone.  I had the ribeye for $30 over mash and greens.  This was totally worth it and I enjoyed it a LOT.  my friend ordered the steak sandwich with a side of cauliflower with white sauce.  Hers was fair...I didn't try the bread but did get some of her meat and it was tender. Cauliflower was excellent.  Will go back but it is kind of pricey here.  Lunch is obviously much cheaper.
author: Jill P.

description: Got the tofu curry noodles and wasabi noodles with pork and it was the bet we've ever had. Really delicious food!!!!! Great service too.
author: Dan H.

description: Amazing restaurant!! You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. The sea bass and sashimi appetizer were to die for, will be coming back soon!
author: Alex N.

description:
Small, cozy place that really knows how to do Asian fusion!

I thoroughly enjoyed their ahi tuna tartare to start & my taste buds jumped for joy when moving onto their masami ribeye. I also had a little bit of the lobster tempura, which helped after I washed it down with some Hitachino Nest White Ale. 

All in all a perfect meal, worth the price.
author: Roger D.

description:
Holy shit this place is good. 4 of us. 3 diff appetizers. 4 different plates. All good. I had the mushroom rice with grilled prawns, shaved bonito. 

3 days later I'm still thinking about it. 

Service was great. Staff was friendly, knowledgeable and super fast. 

Just go and try it yourself. But maybe make a reservation? There were coming in non stop the entire time we were there. (Sunday night)
author: S F.

description:
Food ordinary so not worth the price

Ambience - small, cramped and LOUD. Couldn't hear each other well. With some imagination it can be described as cozy 

Fried salmon roll- not crispy and served cold. Clearly was prefried

Wasabi noodles- it's like fried noodles . No big deal. Steak was decent and cooked as ordered .

Grilled sea bass was good- fatty and soft but firm. Very Small piece though.Taste good. It came with some noodles and green beans. I didn't like the green beans. It was bland and uninspiring

Pork chops with pomegranate- decent. It was big portion. I didn't try that but looks the most impressive.
author: Dixie B.

description: I will come back to this restaurant every time I visit San Francisco. It is hands down one of the best Asian fusion restaurants I have ever been to. The food is unique and amazing quality. I ordered the miso cod and my boyfriend had the ahi tuna. We also had the ahi tuna tartare to start. The shop itself is quite small so I'd recommend making a reservation, especially if you plan on going on the weekend. I've been here three times and ordered something new each visit and I am continually impressed. The dessert is fantastic too. Do not hesitate to come here, the high ratings are accurate!
author: Heather C.

description: Everything is perfect... I love this place. Definitely we'll go back and I'll Recomend to my friends and family... you can't go wrong with all the menu
author: Christine Joy B.

description: The food was perfect. The wasabi noodles were amazing and the short ribs were fantastic. However, the service was one of the worst I've had in San Francisco. Throughout the entire meal, we saw the server three times. Each interaction was short "you ok" while an empty water and sake glass sat on the table. The gentleman who brought the food literally didn't say a word as put the food on the table and walked away. As the night went on, I looked at the three servers and didn't see them smile once, to anyone. Tonight was a perfect example of how poor service can ruin amazing food.
author: Justin L.

description: Top notch, delicious food & amazing service.  They go out of their way to make your meal be special.  It is very pricey but very good for a special occasion.  If you have a celebration for birthday or anniversary, they bring you a nice dessert.  Great ambiance.
author: Kim M.

description:
My friend recommended this place so hard like I really had to visit and give it a try. 
We had very difficult time trying to find a parking spot for 30min.
Ugh finding a parking spot in SF is worse than in LA. 

It was a small place w room full of people.
Oh and its always good to make a reservation(like we did). Our waitress gave us a table right next to the front window which was the best spot as we thought.lol 

We ordered(I forgot the exact menu names):
-Grilled Unagi w sticky rice and avocado(5/5, I've never had grilled unagi this tender and juicy. The sauce was perfect not too sweet or salty and the sticky rice w avocado made the dish more savory and well balanced.) 
-Steamed Octopus with potato n avocado(4/5, steamed octopus was super tender that my friend and I were very suprised cuz we always had chewy ones before.)
-Wasabi Noodle w beef steak(5/5, I hate wasabi but this dish was amazing. Whenever the taste of wasabi came up(not a lot), sliced cucumber and cabbage made a well balance to cover it up. I loved the combination of little spicy sauce w bit of wasabi taste + fresh veggies + tender and juicy med. rare steak. Drool**) 

Definitely coming back here soon!!!
author: Angie S.

description:
this is an excellent restaurant and the chefs are very creative with their choices. The portions are very generous and the flavors are perfection. It is a small place and a gem
Judy
author: Judy G.

description:
Wow!! I'm so blown away by this spot.  Whoever is in the kitchen is sending every dish sent out to perfection.  We had the rib eye and it was grilled and seasoned perfectly.  The scallops...:made me roll my eyes and orgasm! Sweet, crispy, buttery,  all my favorites!!! 

I want to try everything on their menu!!
author: Vi Y.

description:
Fantastic little spot across from The Stinking Rose off Columbus Street in San Francisco.

Tight little menu of seemingly Asian inspired classics including mussels and grilled octopus and other delights. Wound up having the muscles and a pork rib special - pork ribs were over this spicy asian slaw with avocado and were absolutely incredible. And I've never eaten a mussel that I probably should have taken in two bites until now.

Presentation is impeccable and service is great. Definitely try this place out. A real find.
author: Bob K.

description:
The House has been bookmarked for a long time.  And finally, over Christmas break we zipped up to the city just to get some good eats.  Found THE perfect parking spot, literally right in front of the restaurant door.  Love when that happens (never).   :)

Small place.  We knew that going in, but still it's difficult when you arrive you're being squeezed into a tiny spot between folk that are already eating.  Not the place for a quiet, romantic evening out.  And loud, very loud.  Very difficult to hear the server announce the specials.  Wow, I'm not old, but I sure sound like it.

Service was bare minimum.  I don't think our server checked back with us even once, but luckily we weren't in need.  The servers didn't strike me as experienced and everything felt so rushed.  No real time to talk about the menu and get opinions and recommendations.  This would be a great restaurant to come right at opening when they're not crazy busy.  That way, you could probably get some quality attention. 

What did we eat?

DEEP FRIED SALMON ROLLS (5/5) These are bomb. Order these for sure, especially if you like salmon.

GRILLED OCTOPUS (5/5)  Different from the way other restaurants serve it, this one had a sauce and was entirely tender and delicious.  Highly recommended.

SEA BASS WITH GARLIC NOODLES (4/5)  My wife's dish.  She loved the sea bass.  She loved the fish more than the noodles. I thought the noodles were pretty good.  Thick, almost like udon.

FLAT IRON STEAK WITH GARLIC NOODLES (3/5)  My daughter's dish.  She said it was not memorable, and that it's a steak you could get anywhere. She said the noodles were good, but again, nothing special.

SHORT RIBS WITH MASHED POTATOES (4/5)  Not your average short rib dish.  It felt more like a tri-tip.  And it was served sliced, with a good amount of pink.  I was confused a bit when they asked me how I wanted my short ribs cooked.  Short ribs typically come braised or slow-cooked so sliced and pink came as a nice surprise.  I enjoyed the meat but the mashed potatoes were sorely lacking.  Served pretty much cold and lifeless.  Tasted like day-old Thanksgiving leftovers.
No thank you on the potatoes.

TUNA POKE (3.5/5) Good but not great, somehow tasted too salty.

COCONUT CREME BRULEE (3/5) Good, but I had a problem with the consistency.  It was too loose for me and not strong enough on the coconut. And had a problem with the portion.  Like a 1/4 inch deep, what?

TRUFFLE CHOCOLATE CAKE (4/5) If you're a dark chocolate fan, you will love this.  I'm not, but my wife and daughter are.  They raved and I let them eat it all.

PERSIMMON PUDDING (5/5) Star of the desserts.  LOVED this. Rich and creamy, warm and inviting, full of persimmon flavor, big-time comfort food right here.  Inspired to make at home.  Kudos to the pastry chef. I hope this is still on the menu by the time you arrive!

I think The House has the potential to be great.  The chefs are good and you can see and taste their talent on your plate. Down side is the crowded and rushed atmosphere, but I think the food is worth it.
author: Darien R.

description:
The food here was amazing. We had the salmon rolls and crabmeat avocado sushi rolls for an appetizer. Incredible flavor on both, and the salmon rolls were lightly fried to perfection. 

I took the suggestion for the Sea Bass and garlic noodles and it did not disappoint! This was probably one of the best fish dishes I have tasted in a long time! My wife ordered the flat iron steak (medium) with garlic noodles. Also cooked perfectly and tasted wonderful!!

Highly recommended restaurant!! Kind of small inside so call ahead to see if you need reservations. The menu changes frequently as well. Great service and quick!!
author: Dennis N.

description: We had the oyster appetizer, sea bass with garlic noodles and the wasabi noodles with flat iron steak. I must say, they should rename their sea bass to sea-bad-ass, it's delicious!!! Must get. The steak, not so sure. The wasabi noodles was just ok and the steak is just like a steak without seasoning. Overall we enjoyed the dining.
author: Mike T.

description:
My favorite restaurant in SF hands down.

From their appetizers to main course to dessert, nothing disappoints. For appetizers we got their scallops which were really good, made me wish it was a main course instead. We also tried their chicken salad, sounds boring but it's not your traditional salad, had more chicken their veggies in proportion with an Asian twist.

Now onto their main courses. Their Wasabi Noodles with skirt steak has the balance of a perfect meal. Packs a lot of great contrasting flavors and the steak was cooked just right. Probably my favorite item to order. Of course you can't forget the Seabass which is also a popular dish here and I definitely see why. It comes with noodles, sauteed green beans, and side of sauce (fish already has a lot of flavor so try not to drench it or it'll be too salty). The Pomegrante Pork Chops are also a must try! It was tender and the pomegrante sauce added a sweet flavor to the meat.

Lastly, dessert. I've only tried one item from their dessert menu so I definitely want to come back to try the others. We got their seasonal persimmon bread pudding and it was heavenly. Though the flavor closely reminded us of a pumpkin pie.

Unlike a lot of popular restaurants in SF, I've managed to snag reservations a few days before 2 times now. This place is small unfortunately but worth it.

Overall fantastic food, fantastic service, whats not to love?
author: Kathy L.

description: The service are very rude. Went into restaurant, one of waiter sit us down, and served water and small dish. After couple minutes this bitch come just picked up our water and dish, then she come back tell us we have to get up because she have other reservation just arrived. Her word" you guys need get up, I have an reservation just got here". We were arguing with her the server sit us down and it is very rude she just ask us to get up. She said she don't care because she didn't told the server to sit us and she is running the place. WTF? She must just caught her husband cheated on her, fucking rude bitch deserve it.
author: Yifan Y.

description: An absolute pleasure to eat at this restaurant with a cozy environment, amazing food. The pork chop was the best I've ever tasted and the scallops were so good we ordered them twice. What I enjoyed almost as much as the pork chop was the crepe brûlée, It was coconut with a dragonfruit topping, very unique and delicious.
author: Travis B.

description: This is my go to dinner spot! I love the atmosphere, service and food. I've tried other similar restaurants in the area and the food does not compare.
author: Annabelle A.

description:
I desperately wanted to love this restaurant but left slightly disappointed. The space is small but cozy, and service was very attentive and warm. I would give the restaurant 5 stars except for an issue with one of the dishes. 

Ordered the deep-fried salmon roll, unagi sandwich, and udon noodles. 

The salmon roll was AMAZING and probably one of the best salmon dishes I've ever had. The roll itself is quite simple, but when you dunk the roll in the spicy mustard sauce, magic happens. Spicy feels all over in the good way. 

I tried udon noodles and was impressed at how clean and simple, yet deep and complex, the broth was. The chicken didn't end up over cooked which is always a worry in hot soups. 

The unagi avocado sandwich was the major disappointment for me. I'm a lover of unagi anything, and was looking forward to it based on the rave reviews. But the concept of the dish is flawed - it treats the luscious unagi like deli sliced ham and crams it between thick bread and lettuce. Between the bread, tomato, and avocado, the eel got incredibly lost and the whole sandwich tasted like just a mushy sandwich. 

The salmon roll will keep be coming back during my future trips to SF, next time I'll just avoid the unagi and try something else.
author: Constance C.

description: Simply said This place never fails! It's amazing every time! Every dish I've ever had was a slam dunk!
author: Brenda B.

description:
#149

We ventured over to the House for a little date night dinner.  My companion had never dined here before so I suggested we try since I thought he would love it.
#ilovebeingright

Parking is a nightmare, so an Uber is probably the way to go.  This place is tucked away in North Beach, hidden among the Italian restaurants and various strip clubs.  

I was smart enough to call ahead for reservations.  The wait can be incredibly long and the space is so tiny.  You literally are standing on top of others while you wait for a table.  This is not the case when you call ahead, so make sure to do so.

The service is always on point.  Once you arrive at your table you are quickly greeted by your server, the wine comes out super fast and the food begins to arrive shortly after you place your order.  

I have never made a "bad" choice from their menu.  The food is always spectacular.  I am a HUGE fan of Asian fusion--how could you not?

Stephani Smiles for the House ;)
#asianfusionfan
author: Stephani M.

description: We made a reservation for 7 PM on a Thursday. It was pretty full when we arrived with a line forming as we got seated, so we were glad we made a reservation. We ordered the grilled unagi, warm wasabi house noodles, and sea bass. The sea bass was SO GOOD. The seared shell encased a buttery meat and I'd love to go back just for that. Its paired stir fry noodles were also quite good, but I didn't care that much for the beans. The grilled unagi is basically a deconstructed roll, and if you like lion king rolls (as I do!), the style of this is similar and worth trying. The house noodles were delicious, and the steak that it came with was decent, but I thought the contrasting flavors didn't pair well together. The portions were generous and certain to make you full, which in my case, too full for dessert.
author: Stephanie C.

description: This has to be one of the best if not THE BEST restaurant we have eaten at in the city. The steak, seafood, and noodles were some of the very best we have ever had. We will most deft be coming back many times in the future.  Small atmoshere, tables are close together, service is good and the food comes fast.
author: Sarah M.

description: Food was great service was bad...went there for a company dinner with my co workers and when my co worker arrived one of the male server greeted us we had a reservation so he lead my coworkers to the back table and when my coworkers were seated one of the female server came over and told my coworker that's she can't just sit in that table ....so my coworker told her that we didn't just sit here the other server leaded us here. So by the time we are ready to order our food the same female server took our orders, she told my boss that my coworker was being rude ! Really??? In front of my coworker? My coworker was not rude she was the rude one even if she was rude are you even allow to say that in front of the customers??? The manager really need to train her better on customer service !!!
author: Alicia W.

description: I took my girl her for our anniversary and she absolutely loved it. For a Asian fusion spot they had a heavy fish selection but we made it work and will definitely be back ! Need more option on the menu though.
author: Jevell R.

description: Always a go to for a nice dinner celebration. I make sure to call a couple weeks in advance. The host and servers are great. They thoroughly go through daily specials and the rest of the menu. I've tried many items on the menu and have not been disappointed by anything. The servers are very attentive as well. MUST TRY!
author: Briana H.

description: This was my second time here and I couldn't wait to come back! The food has so much flavor, fresh and served quickly! I had the sea bass and it was cooked to perfection. A great place to buy some different dishes and share a taste of everything
author: Jasmin S.

description: Just when I thought I've seen it all I discovered two new items that blew my mind. Get the ahi poke instead of the famous salmon rolls. It was delicious but highlight of this trip was the chocolate macadamia tort with coffee ice cream. Hands down the best dessert I've ever had. Id go again just for the dessert!
author: Dan A.

description: Good restaurant with yummy food . I got the scallop special with ahi tuna as the main course and split with my date. Totally yummy
author: Ayush M.

description: Perfect date spot or just hanging out with some friends. Menu is small but I'm sure everything taste just as good. We ordered the special of the day menu which they only tell you on the spot. Best tasting food I have had ever guaranteed. I did not know food could have so much taste and was still filling. They matched the perfect wine for our meal! Price is average for SF $20-30
author: Anjelo S.

description:
#datetable next to me, dude got caught up w the chick due to his "gun views". Yeah watch out, bro. I was on a #firstandlastdate once where she was like "what did youuuu do today"... I had just gotten back from a live-fire marksmanship exam (which I aced btw); she was so not into it. Re-examed today too. So you know my gun views - my gun views are downrange, beezys! #safety1st

Many Asians. #tokenblackperson worked there = didn't count. Good service. Gets loud, as in I saw the waitress' mouth moving but heard nothing & ended up laughing.

(^_^) Grilled Unagi $13 (http://bit.ly/1RugREs)
The struggeel is reel.

(^_^) BBQ Pork Ribs $17 (http://bit.ly/1FTHP7n)
Ketchupy tangy sweety slightly crispy.

(^_^) Lichee Black Iced Tea $3 (http://bit.ly/1j9kVOJ)
Unsweet how I like it. Bottomless.

(^_^) Storm Halle Berry Ribeye $35 (http://bit.ly/1N0wime)
You already know "as rare as possible".

(^_^) Grilled Octopus $14 (http://bit.ly/1FTHSQQ)
Dat avocado x fried potato combo doe.

Some dishes are quirky in a good way. I'd return, but only with a woman #straightoutta Texas or Terminator 2 or something. #tuntuntuntuntun #tuntuntuntuntun #TUNTUNTUNTUNTUN
author: Dan B.

description: Wow!!!!!!!! It is a hole in a wall but wow!!! We are vegetarians with very few fish options (no shellfish). When we came here they told us that basically their salmons AND noodles are premarinated with oyster sauce. That was so disappointing for us since everything just looked so good. But we were def thankful for our knowledgeable waiter and all the info. So we were left with their veggie tempura green beans (wow!!!!) and their Seabass with rice since we couldn't have it with the garlic noodles. It was all so amazing and i left actually kind of upset we didn't have more options lol  if you are in San Fran this is def a place to try.
author: Setareh E.

description: Great and tasty Asian style cuisine. Very popluar and crowded locate around Chinatown. Lot of fun bars around the vicinity for post dinner drinks
author: Patricia F.

description:
A local friend recommended The House to me. It's walking distance from the Exploratorium and the piers, convenient!

My rating is purely based on the one dish that I had - wasabi house noodle with grilled pork. As soon as the waitress brought up the dish, I immediately feel extra hungry! No joke! The smell of grilled pork and slightly spicy wasabi immediately opened up my appetite. Sooooo good! Drooling good! Highly recommend it.
author: Christine Y.

description:
We found The House from all the awesome Yelp reviews. 

First time here, we noticed that The House was an extremely small restaurant. The hostess brought over some menus which consisted of smaller portions (appetizer type food) at the top and mains at the bottom. Everyone was given a plate of pickels with sesame seeds to start off. The waiters were also awesome with the distribution of water as I had three glasses of water and they refilled it for me everytime without me having to ask. 

We got the first two things on the mains menu (I'm pretty sure the menu changes often). I got the rice with mushroom and shrimp while my friend had the warm wasabi house noodles with steak. I LOVED the rice with mushroom and shrimp. The shrimp were large and cut nicely so that the whole tail is there and the shell was removed. The rice tasted like risotto and was sprinkled with dried bonito flakes. As for the wasabi noodles with steak. The wasabi noodles tasted like udon mixed with kimchi (not my favourite, thankfully to wasn't my order), and the steak were cooked and cut the way it was ordered. Delicious.
author: Kristy N.

description:
Love at first bite ! Me and my lady have been coming here for a decade now for our anniversary. I can say that we pretty much tried almost everything including specials and they're all delicious!

My favorite things would be;

Deep fried salmon rolls
Ribeye steak
Pork chop with pomegranate sauce
Sea bass
Black cod (specials)

Serves are always on point with customer service.
They're usually pretty packed with RSVPs so if you're just in the neighborhood you should go right when they open.
author: Michael S.

description:
So delicious I could cry. 
Hubby and I chose this place because house of prime rib was too long of a wait. 
The best decision ever. 

Definitely a hole in the wall and small.
But don't let its humble looks fool you.

Each dish is mouthwatering and leaves you wanting more. 

Oysters- $15 for a half dozen. Fresh and does not leave a briny, salty taste in your mouth. 

Unagi- perfectly cooked and not at all rubbery. It's like butter and the flakes were divine, not at all stale. 

Sea bass and garlic noodles- the fish was prepared perfectly. The fork just slices right through and is very moist and soft in texture. Garlic noodles were a bit heavy on the soy sauce or oyster sauce, and were udon noodles. 

Rib eye, cauliflower, and mashed potatoes- again, they have an exquisite expertise in cooking meat. The meat was so tender and the fat was just a bit crispy, perfectly complimenting each other to not leave a very heavy grease taste in your mouth. Cauliflowers were flawless, in texture- perfectly cooked but still a bit crunchy and in flavor-so so delicious. 

To top it off we had the pumpkin pie with Japanese custard/whip cream. If I died, I would have died happy. I can never have another pumpkin pie...AGAIN. 

This was one of those experiences where I wanted to cry because the food was so good. I was mad I was missing out on such delectable delights. But ecstatic overall, this place is a gem.
author: Christina O.

description: I ordered two small plates - scallops and octopus. I love seafood. Scallops are great. I loved it. Great sauce as well. Octopus was not eatable, like rubber. I could not eat even half of the dish. Keeping in mind prices - it is a big disappointment.
author: Natalie L.

description: Came across The House on a recent visit to Chinatown and North Beach. Small in size but huge in welcome and deliciousness. The oysters were super-fresh and the Tuna BLT and Seared Ahi with California Roll and wasabi/unagi sauce were both beautifully presented and incredibly delicious.
author: Shirley M.

description:
Make sure you come here with a reservation by calling their phone number! I had made a 7:30 reservation on a Saturday night and was seated within 10 minutes. The restaurant has limited space, but was able to accommodate two large parties (6+ people) in addition to two and four-top tables. 

There isn't much decor to the restaurant. The signage is very simple, there is a small house stamp on the place mat, and small pieces of Japanese art throughout the restaurant that aren't very noticeable. It's actually very minimalist, focusing on the food. The vibe is very casual here!

food
+ CHICKEN VERMICELLI SALAD: As a starter, we were debating between this appetizer and the warm kale salad. I am so glad we started with this! The vermicelli noodles were light, accompanied with peanuts, chicken, cucumber and topped with nori. It was like a spring roll but in salad form!

+ GRILLED UNAGI, AVOCADO SUSHI RICE: This is an amazing appetizer as well. The unagi is presented on top of the rice like a maki roll, but under the fish you'll find it is just a rectangular bed of rice topped with wasabi and avocado. It was simple, but I've never had unagi presented this way. 

+ SEARED AHI TUNA, SPICY MUSTARD AIOLI: Looking for a lighter dinner, we wanted a fish entree. The tuna was perfectly seared along the outside and soft in the middle. The chips on top added the perfect crunch and wasn't obnoxiously big to distract from eating the fish itself. 

All of the dishes were simple, but executed really well. The Asian flavors were prominent, but not overpowering. Nothing was too salty or spicy, and everything was pretty light (at least our options were). 

service
The restaurant gives a family-owned vibe, as there was no formal hostess or bussers. The same long, black-haired Asian woman greeted us at the door, asked us if we had reservations, sat us at our table, and cleared our table when we were done eating. Our server accommodated changes to our order really easily when we wanted to change our entree last minute. I would definitely come back here when I visit SF!
author: Sophie P.

description: What a gem!  This place is the bomb. I think it's our new favorite place to eat in North Beach. The fish was fresh and the flavors were amazing. I can't wait to come back.
author: Anne M.

description:
The house is the bomb!

I've been wanting to come here for so long! Finally my bae took me here yesterday night! We ordered seven dishes and two lychee black ice teas (good). 

Appetizers: Ahi tuna tartare, roasted nori chip, deep fried salmon roll with Chinese hot mustard, grilled unagi, avocado sushi rice and shaved bonito! 

Entrees: Angus flatiron steak, kurobuta pork chop, pomegranate currant sauce! 

Dessert: Bittersweet chocolate truffle cake serviced with coffee ice cream and coconut caramel, coconut Creme brûlée passion fruit purée 

Omg! Let me just tell you this! Everything that we tasted were delicious and the customer service was great! We wanted to get another entree but we were too stuffed after everything that we are!Just a tip! Make a reservation if you don't want to wait which is what we did!

Definitely will come back !!! Love this place so much
author: Shirley G.

description:
My favorite restaurant in San Francisco, by far! I've lived in SF for 14 years and The House is the one restaurant I always return to.

Totally random location in North Beach, very unassuming in attitude (and not a huge amount of "ambiance"), yet the food is always delicious, fresh and interesting.  Everyone loves the sea bass with garlic noodles, though I almost always get the fish special (whatever it is).  The caesar salad with scallops is amazing, as is the pork rib appetizer. Really, you can't go wrong with anything here.

Two pieces of advice:
- Make reservations, even on weeknights
- Do not order all of your food at once, otherwise you'll be out of there in 30 minutes
author: Sara S.

description:
Warm wasabi house noodles, flatiron steak. Best steak I have had in the city. It's sooooo good. At medium rare, the cook was perfect and just melted in my mouth. We also tried the Chicken dish, it was lack luster. The chicken was pretty dry and I wouldn't get it again.

I'm definitely coming back for that steak. I'm sad it took me so long to get out and try this place.
author: Raemond B.

description: Extremely pricey but very good. Great date spot. Would recommend if you're ballin and not on a budget. I dropped $130 here on a date.
author: Matt H.

description: Easily one of the best places I've eaten in San Francisco. The calamari was served in huge chunks and was seasoned perfectly. The sake menu was limited but each one I tried was delicious. I had the flat iron steak with noodles and it was easily one of the best meals I have ever had. I will be coming back here again... What a great place!
author: Lyndy W.

description:
I was trying to decide whether to try this place or slanted door.  The reviews on yelp were much better for this place and I had some friends that also recommended it.  We were able to get a last minute reservation for a group of 7 on a Saturday night at 9pm.  The service at this restaurant was great. The staff was friendly and very knowledgeable.  We tried a bunch of the dishes and everything we tried was excellent.  Our group ordered a bunch My personal favourites was the salmon spring rolls, halibut, clams and the miso cod. 

I would say this is a must try if you enjoy asian fusion food.  This is definitely one of my top picks in San Francisco.
author: Anh T.

description:
This place is just incredible! 

The service is pretty great, although I wish they had the specials written out somewhere instead of just reading them out. Sometimes the servers' accents are hard to understand and you miss out on the items. They should also have a system for keeping the door closed as it usually flies open - in windy North Beach, this can be annoying for diners. 

The small plates and specials are usually pretty great. I loved the scallops, mussel broth, and poke bowl. The chicken, curry noodles, and wasabi noodles were also amazing! Overall, I really like this place.
author: S S.

description:
Wow!! A SF city guide said this was her favorite fusion restaurant. I went straight over after the tour. They had just opened. Small place but the food was incredible. I had a passionfruit salad. It was wonderful. I also had the salmon appetizer, also excellent. I made reservations to go once more before I leave, that good!!

Went for dinner. Apps: had Hamachi poke, grilled unagi. Entree: sea bass with green beans and New York with chanterelles. All were excellent. Loved everything!
author: Robin L.

description: The House is excellent. I'll keep this short, because clearly the Yelp community unanimously agrees that this place is a five star gem, but also because if I think about The House too much, I'll get hungry. I came here for dinner and shared an appetizer and two entrees with a friend. We shared the unagi appetizer, the pork chop and sea bass. Everything was delicious, fresh, and perfectly cooked. If I had to recommend just one item from what I tasted, it would definitely be the sea bass which is served with udon noodles and green beans. The sea bass was buttery and smooth and lightly grilled to bring a depth of flavor. The quality and portions justify the price. Decor is minimal (true to Japanese architecture and design), and echoing everyone here, the space is small, so make reservations in advance or come early. I'll be back!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
A wonderfully superb meal! Our group had lunch today and ordered the mushroom soup, caesar salad with crispy scallops, warm wasabi noodles, the short rib sandwich with caramelized cauliflower, and ended with two kinds of dessert: a rhubarb pudding and a chocolate torte with coffee ice cream. Everything was so great that it made me think that if I had ordered other items from the menu, it would have been just as comparable and delicious.
We were seated exactly at the time we made reservations and the service was excellent.
We can't wait to dine here again.
author: Linda L.

description:
Probably the WORST dining experience I've ever had!! 

First the server showed up to tell us about the specials. She couldn't remember the last few... so she tried to play it off by naming the first dish twice. When we asked for drink recommendations, she simply said, "People usually order beer or wine" and walked off... 

Food presentation was great. I think we have enough reviews about that, so I won't be focusing on it. 

We aren't from San Francisco. I get that there's no way that the host/owner or the server could've known that. We had a table for six, everyone was there except one. He was on his way from the airport. We tried to help expedite things and order as he was en route. The hostess/owner came and said "you can't place any orders" and walked away. Later when the server walked over to try to take the place setting away, we said he was almost here and tried to order again. Her response? "The food just going to get cold." She put the order in and came back to snicker with the hostess/owner "oh he's not here yet." Seriously?!?! What are we in kindergarten? 

Oh and PS - the paintings on the wall are just not pleasant.
author: Karen L.

description: Omg this place! I was kinda suspicious with the hype on Yelp. But after my partner and I got our food we just love it! We are tourist here otherwise I'd definitely visit again.
author: Gigi H.

description:
My cousin and her boyfriend picked this place for their birthday celebration. Let just say. It was a great decision. 

Food: OMG delicious.  We ordered 3 appetizers, 3 entrees, and 1 dessert.  We shared since the dishes were big portion.  
We ordered few of their daily specials and they were all so good. 
Scollop special. Comes with 3 decent size scollops and seared in perfection. Crispy outside and soft in the inside.  Flavor was on point. Will order that again 
Deep fried salmon roll:  I can see why everyone was waving about this dish. It was delicious.  Lightly fried and salmon is medium rare and it was so good.  I ate most of them.  Definitely will order again. 
Poke special: poke with some veggies and rice crispy. Nice flavor and texture. 
Rib eye special: medium rare steak with special sauce serve with mashed potatoes, cauliflower, and mushroom. Delicious!!!!! Great flavor and portion was huge. Definitely will order that again.  
Pork chop: perfectly cooked even it was medium rare and it was very juicy.  Serve with pomegranate sauce, mashed potatoes, asparagus, and taro chips. Will order that again. 
Wasabi noodle with steak. Noodle was good but don't care too much of the steak. It was flavorless. We actually ate that with the rib eye.  Perfect paring  hahaha. 
Mango tapioca: great flavor and texture. Reminded me of mango pudding a little bit
 
Service was great.  Very attentive and knowledgeable with the menu and patient.  

Our reservation was at 5:30pm and it was perfect timing for dinner. When we were almost done with dinner there was a line waiting for dinner.  I would say come early. 

Parking.  There's a valet parking behind the restaurant. Since I work in the financial district. I just walked over here. Not a bad walk. 15-20mins walk.
author: Candice Y.

description: Small quaint restaurant on Telegraph Hill with an interesting Asian Fusion twist. We went for lunch time and went straight for the main dishes as we were hungry after walking through SF. We got the pork steamed dumplings, Tuna BLT with wasabi mayo, and the sashimi platter with baked cauliflower. Each dish was very delicious and packed with flavors. There are times when I wish the portions are bigger because of how good the food tastes and this was one of those times. However, for the price it is definitely worth it. The staff is very nice and prompt with their service.
author: Rohan P.

description: It's a nice place if you want to satisfy your appetite with Asian dishes. The food is tasty and fresh, but more on the sweet side. The restaurant is small and cute. However, service isn't as good as I expected, and their price isn't cheap. I mean I'm willing to spend more and stay longer and come back if their service gets improved. I would give 3.5 star.
author: Naviv N.

description: The food was excellent. Everything was tasty but the Curry Noodles were my favorite. I would definitely visit again
author: Michele Y.

description:
Perhaps Asian fusion means loudness, rude waitress and greasy food without the tastiness, then this place worth a 5 star rating. 
Sea bass tastes bad tonight, and nothing the restaurant offered to do about it. 
The answer is: "Our chef did this for 25 years, you are sensitive to the taste." 
This place is small and offers little space for movement, the girl next to us speaks loudly and we can do nothing about it. 

This was the third time I dine here and will be the last.
author: Effi W.

description:
Great restaurant with delicious food. We had the Oysters on the half shell and the grill octopus as appetizers, and we had the grilled sea bass and wasabi noodles with steak as entrees. The Octopus had a great texture, probably the highlight of my meal. It was neither too tough nor too soft. Kind of that perfect balance you want with squid and octopus. It was served with deep-fried sweet potatoes and a few slices of avocado. Eating those three items together really rounded out the flavors and textures. We had the sea bass per the recommendation of other Yelp review, but I didn't find it too be as amazing as the hype. Still, it was a great dish. I've just had fish with more of the "melts in your mouth" quality in other restaurants. Overall, the food was delicious, not to get anything twisted. It just didn't have that "wow factor" I was hoping for. (Except for the Grilled Octopus appetizer. That was amazing!)

Service was very prompt and professional. No complaints there. Unfortunately, I didn't catch our servers name.
author: Ubi K.

description:
My boyfriend and I were able to make a reservation 1 week in advance for dinner at 7:30 PM on New Year's Day. We arrived 5 minutes early, and waited maybe 10-15 minutes to be seated. The restaurant felt *almost* cramp with almost no waiting/standing area and the tables arranged quite close together. The decor was minimal and we were soon seated by a lovely waitress (unfortunately the other waitress we spoke with was slightly less lovely)

We were given a normal menu, a drink menu, and verbally told the day's specials. Personally, I am not a fan of verbal menus because restaurants are usually loud and I can't decide on/remember every item they recite. I listened closely, and kept my ears out for the black cod special. Unfortunately they were sold out! 

We settled for the Sea Bass (with Garlic Noodles and Green Beans, which is not listed/described in the menu and I honestly can't say why they don't do so), the Scallop appetizer (one of the specials), and the Fried Salmon Roll appetizer.

Scallop appetizer: This was on the special menu that was verbally recited to us and I honestly don't remember the details anymore. These scallops were simply absolutely phenomenal and were definitely the best part of our entire meal. The aesthetic was on point, with the sauces dripped artistically on the plate, the 3 scallops arranged in a triangle, and a watermelon radish with green fish eggs (?) in the center of the plate. Also note that this dish cost $17, which we didn't know as the specials are recited without the price. If I had known this before tasting the scallops, I would not have ordered the dish. Even after tasting the scallops, I still find this ridiculous for the expected price point of this restaurant.

Deep Fried Salmon Roll with Chinese hot mustard: This was a dish of 2 rolls cut in half on a bed of salad, paired with a hot mustard dipping sauce that provided the perfect amount of crunch and zing. Following the scallop appetizer, it was not mindblowing in any way, but the price was much more reasonable for a reasonably tasty appetizer.

Grilled Sea Bass with garlic ginger soy, garlic noodles, and green beans: This was delicious! The sea bass had that buttery melt-in-your-mouth quality. It paired very well with the ginger soy dipping sauce, the noodles, and the green beans. The green beans were soft and perfectly seasoned. However, I have to say that the garlic noodles were my favorite part. The noodles were thick and chewy. I would have eaten an entire plate of just garlic noodles! 

Overall: The House is a small restaurant with simple decor. In comparison, the delicious Asian fusion food is quite extravagant. If money is not an issue, I highly recommended the Scallop appetizer special and the Grilled Sea Bass with garlic noodles. Otherwise, I would still recommended the Grilled Sea Bass! I would love to come back and try the Wasabi Noodles and Black Cod.
author: Vivian L.

description: Lived up to the rep. Portions are very large for SF and the Kobe beef was outstanding. Halibut special was a solid B+. Will definitely be back.
author: Orange M.

description: Small joint. Definitely make reservations. Asian fusion, lovely menu. Can't really say anything bad. All the times I've been here food cooked perfectly. Nice and juicy. There was one time when a steak and the noodles were a little sodium heavy but just eat more with the greens or drink some more water to cut down on it. Miss this place. We usually try and make a stop whenever we visit SF
author: Sam S.

description:
Make reservations beforehand because this restaurant is extremely small. We were a party of seven and I guess the only availabilities for parties that huge are at 5:30pm or 9 (I forgot what they said exactly, but we could only stick with our 5:30pm reservation). It might be difficult to find parking around the area because it is in the city so I do recommend parking at the North Beach Parking Garage right across from the police station (0-1 hours is only $3). 

We all ordered similar items on the menu. We started off with two orders of their deep fried salmon rolls and their calamari (it was one of the specials for the night). I wasn't a huge fan of the sauce for the salmon rolls. The wasabi flavor was too strong for me, but the rolls themselves were pretty good and crispy! The calamari was really good too! 

For our entrees, we all got either the grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy as dip, kurobuta pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce, or the rib eye. The sea bass was so tender and tasted amazing with the sauce, garlic noodles, and green beans. The pork chop was MY FAVORITE. I wish I had gotten this as my original entree, but I only had a couple bites of my boyfriend's. Literally...it was perfect in flavor, in texture, in EVERYTHING. My brother was the only one who ordered the rib eye steak and I didn't get a chance to ask him how it was, but he seemed to enjoy it. I really liked how they didn't prepare his steak until he got there (he was 30 minutes late to dinner) to make sure it wasn't overcooked or too cold. Something I was truly amazed with was how fast they cooked everything. I swear the waiter had just taken our order and fifteen minutes later our food was here. Maybe it's because the restaurant is so small that they aren't backed up on so many orders? 

Definitely a great place to celebrate a special occasion. I would love to eat here again and try other things on their menu!
author: Sydney C.

description: A small, little, homey place.. Everything was so good here! We got lucky with parking. Started with the half dozen oysters and shares the wasabi noodles and sea bass. I usually don't like cooked fish because of the fishy taste and how cooked fish leaves this sticky texture when it's too cooked but it did not taste fishy at all! One thing I regretted was finished the whole bottle of nigori with my bf. One downside is that the tables and menus were sticky and wet but the service made up for it. Will definitely be back to try the other appetizers and entrees.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Wow - this honestly might be my favorite restaurant in San Francisco, and that's saying something! Every single dish I've had here is fantastic. As far as what's on their regular menu - you can't go wrong with the steak and wasabi noodles. However, the real key is to order off the specials menu. It's almost as long as the menu they have everyday!

From the specials menu, I've had amazing poké, sashimi, the best sea bass I've ever had, additional steak dishes, you name it!

Seriously, get yourself to The House. 

** Pro tip: while waiting for a table, check out The Saloon next door. You're likely to catch some great live music and the drinks are cheap!
author: Ellie J.

description: I love The House! All of the dishes are so delicious! An explosion of flavors and the proteins are alway cooked perfectly. The chicken and pork are NEVER too dry and so moist and tasty. Definitely a must try in San Francisco if you're in the North Beach/Chinatown area.  I would recommend coming for lunch because it's a similar menu at a lower price point. Plus the restaurant is so small, it's less hectic and more casual during lunchtime. My favorite go tos are the wasabi noodles with pork and the curry udon with chicken. The sea bass is to die for! Best fish dish I've ever had! I would recommend ordering that for dinner. Not your  typical run of the mill Asian Fusian food for sure!
author: Linda H.

description: Absolutely fantastic food. So creative and flavorful. A true fusion restaurant with heart and passion! A must in San Fran.
author: Zach M.

description: Everything here is wonderful and delicious. The food is fresh and the service is consistently great.
author: Bailey R.

description:
The best meal I've had in a long time. Delivered on all levels: drinks, appetizers and entrees.  Everything was fantastic, but the highlights were the octopus, curry noodles. 

I could eat here all day.
author: J T.

description: My son took me here today for a birthday lunch.  Wow, one of the best meals I have ever had.  I walked there from the Montgomery BART station with a sciatic leg and I would do it again!
author: Sarah B.

description: Very good restaurant! Always remeber to ask for the day specials! Be careful though, as an asiatic restaurant, lots of things are spicy!
author: Leonardo M.

description:
The sauce for the claims is to die for. Especially when you dip the bread into the sauce.. The Salmon roll is perfectly cooked because its not dry like many other places. The sauce for that Salmon roll is also perfectly matched for it too. 

My favorite of all was the Sea Bass. The way they made the skin/outer meat so crispy. That was by far one of the best Sea Bass I had in a long time, especially here in California in general.

The steak is also amazing but, the Sea Bass is even better.
author: Calvin N.

description:
"Asian Fusion" is such a loaded term. I feel like I can count the number of times I've had actually good Asian fusion on one hand (and not using all of my fingers at that) because so often you find that it ends up as just a lackluster combination of inauthentic various Asian cuisines.

Thankfully, my dinner at The House was most definitely delicious, most definitely fusion, and most definitely worthy of our time there. I mean, I'm sure that my review will do very little to paint a picture different than that literally thousands of other amazing reviews on Yelp, but I'll break down what I had in case any of you are looking to take a trip:

I started with the lychee black iced tea, which was delicious and had a nicely de-pitted whole lychee for me to fish out of the bottom. I also got a tsing tao beer because balance.

For our appetizer, we took Yelp's advice and went for the deep-fried salmon roll. It was oustanding, with a warm mustard sauce to drizzle or dip (however you like it), and just the right amount of crunch. I could have eaten five of these. Yum!

For my entree, I went with one of the specials mentioned, which was a miso black cod (or maybe a black miso cod, haha) served over choy with a slightly sweet sauce. It was beautifully cooked and super flavorful. 

I also got to try my friend's seabass (a classic dish here, I'm told), and it was perfect. Tremendously well-done, and I like the noodles that it was served with as well.

I highly recommend making a reservation at The House, as it is teeny-tiny and many people got turned away or had to wait a long time. Our table was right next to the door so it got a little noisy, but our waitress was very attentive and we never felt rushed.

Thanks for an amazing meal, The House!
author: Gretchen F.

description: Worst service ever!!!  My friend tried to make a reservation and was told they do t take them.  When we arrived we were told that there was a 30 min wait so we went for a walk around the block.  We came back 45 min later to check in because we still had t heard from the restaurant.  The host told us 3 times that he was cleaning a table for us...yet then proceeded to sit someone else.  When I confronted him about the wait and that everyone that came after is was set before us, he didn't so much as apologize.  All he said is that everyone except for us had a reservation.  I call BS on that and will NEVER try to go there again!!!!!
author: Olga K.

description:
Wasabi noodles with poem are delicious. The salmon rolls are also good here 
Service is good, it is a small busy busy restaurant
author: Jessica G.

description:
We've avoided The House for the last few years, with the problems described in my earlier review outweighing the continued benefit of outstanding food.  I decided to give them another try for a Saturday dinner.  This time we were seated right at our reservation time, but the other problems were still present and in fact worse than before.

I had reserved three weeks in advance but even so we were seated at the worst table in the house, right next to the door, cramped against a wood panel on the inside and in the pathway of entering diners on the outside. This wouldn't be so bad if they didn't allow the waiting patrons to crowd into the tiny entry way.  My husband, who had valiantly taken the outer seat, had to endure multiple bumps of his chair and person throughout the meal.  In addition, the door crowd added to the deafening din in the restaurant.

How loud you ask? So loud that I was completely unable to hear the server recite the long specials list.  Pleasant conversation was equally impossible.

The server did the bare minimum, not bothering to take drink orders until she was ready to take our food order (20 minutes after being seated). There's a busser, but for some reason all he does is drop off the first glasses of water. The server was busy clearing plates and re-filling water glasses while not taking our order.

Excellent food + an unpleasant, uncomfortable atmosphere + sub-par service = not such a great meal.
author: Martha M.

description:
Very yummy lunch and first time experience! Thank you E!! You are so generous!

From the lychee iced tea to the salmon rolls to my tuna sandwich, to the flavor-packed noodles, I was happy as a clam with the food.

Soft shelled crap tempura was also great-- the hero running throughout being the delectable sauces provided with each plate.

Even the flavor of the iron skirt steak and chicken were undeniably seasoned and moist.

Not the biggest fan of fusion, I am , though, of The House, a SF Classic !
author: Jana C.

description:
Wow! This place really knows what they are doing.
Special props to the chef! This person really knows what he/ she is doing.
Absolutely everything I had was delicious, flavorful, and nothing like I've had before. I also like that the quality of the food is superb. You're not getting all fried junk here.
Get their warm kale salad. It sounds weird, but it's the BEST kale salad anyone could ever have. 
I'm not the biggest fan of salad, but this was THAT good. 
We ordered the entrees that were off menu- they were the specials of the day. 
The lamb chops complemented well with the kimchi and veggies side dishes.
My bf got a fish dish - I forget which fish but it melted in my mouth with the mash potatoes. The carrots (?) or sweet potatoes (?) on top of the fish to garnish was SO crispy and delicious. 
I will definitely be going back to this place. It's one of my new favorites of SF.
author: Kate A.

description: This is one of the best meals I have had in San Francisco and that is saying alot.  It a city known for its food this stands out as an amazing taste treat.  From the delicious small plates to my perfectly cooked fish, every bite was a treat to the senses.  It's  very small and there is no parking around so be prepared for tight tables and take a taxi,  but go eat there and you will not regret any effort you took to arrive at a  foodie's  heavenly destination.
author: Tina G.
