description: All experience of dining was top notch :) food was delicious and perfectly executed !! Server was friendly!! Come back soon :)
author: raja g.

description: The House shows up under Yelp searches for sushi and Italian food.  It serves neither.  The food is good.  The service is attentive.  Three of us got watery diarrhea after eating here last week.  We enjoyed the meal.  We might return if we are in the area, but it is not worth a special trip.  Minus one star for watery diarrhea.
author: Zeus M.

description: This place has always been the best, as it is now. The food is absolutely delicious, the service was friendly and attentive, and because of the size of the place the atmosphere is cozy.
author: Triston O.

description:
Awesome food. There wasn't a single dish our table ordered that wasn't great. Some of my personal favorites: 


-Unagi Appetizer
-Scallops Appetizer
-Sea Bass Entree
author: Bert J.

description: Overrated. Overcrowded. Not many Asian flavors in this Asian fusion spot. The food was sort of bland.
author: Serguei B.

description:
I love The House!! Great service, atmosphere, and most importantly FOOD!

We went to The House last week on a Friday night. It was packed! For two people we waited for about 30 minutes around 6:30. It was worth the wait.

Ordered the deep fried salmon roll appetizer, the ribs, grilled sea bass, and pork chop which was more than enough food. The food presentation was elegant. The grilled sea bass and noodles were my favorite dish. Finished with a chocolate truffle dessert. 

I would definitely come back. Be careful of a wait and try to make a reservation.
author: Christina G.

description:
Tried the steak with noodles. It was fine, nothing great. Nothing special with the service either.
Reservations ahead of time will be helpful.
author: Arjan N.

description:
Last Thursday night, around 7:30, my boyfriend and I came here for dinner without making a reservation. We tried calling in to make a reservation the whole day, but it kept leading to voicemail. But luckily, we were seated instantly when we arrived. 

It's a small and intimate restaurant with very dim lighting to set the mood. The tables are kind of close together and the atmosphere was pretty loud. 
Trying to find parking in Chinatown is a miracle so good luck! 

Anyways, the meal. We had ordered the unagi appetizer (grilled unagi over avocado sushi rice), the warm wasabi house noodles with flatiron steak and a special halibut dish with mashed potatoes. 
Unfortunately, I only have a picture of the appetizer... I was too hungry to take a picture of the entrees. 

The food came out pretty quickly and the service was very nice and attentive. The total came to be around $70-$80. 

I only took one star off because of how we couldn't call to make a reservation the entire day. Other than that, everything else was great!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Been meaning to eat at The House ever since it opened many years ago but the opportunity never arose until recently.  Was walking by at 5pm on a Fri, asked for a table and surprisingly they had one available.

As noted in other reviews, the space is VERY small and crowded.  Need to use the urban habit of ignoring your neighbors and their conversation even though they are only a foot away from you.  And, if you are a larger person, don't even think of trying to squeeze between tables to get to a seat along the wall; just take the seat on the aisle. There is only 1 bathroom and if you don't pick the right time to "go," you could face a long line to get in to do your business.

As for the food, it was ok but not what I'd consider exceptional overall.  My GF and I shared a unagi appetizer which presented a long piece of eel placed on top  of what appeared to be a deconstructed sushi roll w/rice, avocado and a sauce that you would typically find adorning such a roll.  Nothing really special about it. 

My GF had a shrimp salad w/pork rinds and I had the kale salad w/Pt. Reyes blue cheese and pistachios.  I liked the shrimp salad which was made w/shredded veggies (daikon and carrots among others I believe) and a light citrus dressing but the shrimp were cut into very small pieces and were frankly hard to find.  The fried pork skin added a nice crunch.  Didn't like the kale salad as much.  Too much oil dressed the cooked kale.  The pistachios were numerous but, like the shrimp, the blue cheese was almost invisible.

For the mains, my GF had a flat iron steak w/wheat noodle dish and I had sea bass w/wheat noodles and long beans.  We asked for the steak RARE assuming that it would come out overcooked (and hopefully, medium rare) instead BUT it actually came out RARE, which pleased me but not my GF so much.  I ate almost all the steak and it was good but I didn't care for the noodles or the sauce it came with.

The bass I got was cooked perfectly; buttery and delicious.  Again, didn't care for the noodles at all; bland and covered in too much oil.  Same for the beans; too much oil dressed them and they seemed bland and tasteless.  However, kudos for the bass which was the star of the dish.

Add a couple of glasses of white wine, tax and tip and it was a $140 meal.  Ok but not great.  Better than what you'd get at some other trendy North Beach establishments but you could fill yourself up on an equally greasy meal at one of the Chinese restaurants nearby for a fraction of the cost which is what I think we'll do the next time instead.

It was worth the opportunity to say that we've eaten there but, based on this experience, I don't think we'd bother going back again.
author: Martin C.

description: The food is absolutely delicious, service was friendly and helpful. Believe you will not go wrong. It may be hard to score a reservation.
author: Madilyn H.

description:
We had a fantastic meal at The House. The only regret is that we live too far away to come more frequently! Most of the dishes were 5 star dishes with a couple of 4 stars (although many other reviewers loved those dishes).

The restaurant is on the small side, so I'd recommend advance reservations if possible. We arrived promptly for our Saturday night, 6:30pm reservation. A table was there waiting for us. It's great when a reservation means you don't have to wait 10 minutes for a table.

The 3 of us split 3 appetizers and entrees and 1 dessert. We asked our waitress what the most popular dishes were and primarily went with those (mixed with a couple of specials of the day).

Appetizers:
1. Scallops ($18): 3 medium sized scallops (although I think they were described as "large," they seemed more medium to me. However, I don't know enough about scallops so say that my size estimate is correct). This "special" was absolutely delicious. I've raved about the scallops at MB Post (in Manhattan Beach, CA) in the past; these were better. A bit pricey, but I'd order these again.

2. Deep-Fried Salmon Roll ($13): Accompanied by a mustard sauce. Think of this as an eggroll stuffed with salmon. Nice crispy exterior. Unfortunately, this dish did not wow me and was my least favorite dish of the evening.  I just didn't find the deep frying as making it any better than a nice cedar plank salmon. 

3. Grilled Octopus ($16): Loved this. Tender pieces of octopus perfectly grilled and matched with a wonderful sriracha aioli. 

Entrees:
1. Grilled Sea Bass ($31): This is one of their signature dishes. Unfortunately, I did not love it (it was good, but not something I would order again). Agree that is was perfectly cooked and the garlic ginger soy had nice flavor, but to me, was just not special. I did, however, really love the garlic noodles and thought the green beans were also very good. I will also mention that I typically don't order fish as I generally don't enjoy it as much as meat/poultry.

2. Kurobota Pork Chop ($28): Loved this. Succulent, tender, flavorful. Pomegranate currant sauce was a wonderful alternative to apple-based sauces. The mashed potatoes were good, not extraordinary, but no complaints. My favorite dish of the meal.

3. Kobe Short Ribs ($35): If you like kalbi, you'll love this special. All the same flavor as great kalbi, but incredibly tender. Served boneless over Chinese broccoli with a side of rice. Having said that, it's certainly very pricy. If you want the most tender kalbi ever, this is a winner. If you don't care about the premium price, go for it. But if you are basing solely on flavor and don't care about the chewiness at your typical Korean restaurant, then pass. Personally, I loved the dish but probably wouldn't order it again.

Dessert:
Bittersweet Chocolate Truffle Cake ($9): I was so full, that I had only a very small taste of this. Served with ice cream. I thought it was a nice dessert, but was surprised that the crust was not tastier. 

Even though it has been four days since I ate here, I still think about the great meal we had. Combine that with the food, a 5 star rating from me is a no brainer.
author: Terence T.

description:
We chose this place for dinner since it had such high reviews on Yelp and unfortunately we were not thoroughly impressed. We had reservations for 8PM on a Friday and came in a few minutes early. They didn't seat us until nearly 20 minutes after our reservation time. What's the point in making reservations if they don't seat in a timely manner? That is one of my pet peeves!

The food here was pretty solid but not impressive or phenomenal for me. The service was severely lacking. When we asked the waitress to clarify what main ingredients were in the dishes she rolled her eyes and her attitude grew tenfold. 

We had the pork chops, sea bass, and an appetizer that were nothing to write home about. Food was solid, service was crappy. I wouldn't come back for another visit.
author: Vicky L.

description:
For anyone who's tried it, The House is always on a list of favorite restaurants in San Francisco! I finally got to come here to celebrate my and my mom's birthday with my family and boyfriend, after it being in my bookmarks since forever!!

We ended up getting 2 appetizers and 5 entrees to share. Sound like a lot of food...? It was!!! I got to try:

- Deep fried salmon rolls: I really wanted to try these after seeing so many pics of them on yelp, and they did not disappoint! The salmon was cooked perfectly and was slightly rare in the middle, which I loved! The only thing I wish they had was a different dipping sauce because I don't like hot mustard. I probably could've asked but ehhhh

- Seared scallops (this was a special!): The waitress told us this comes in orders of 3, so she added on 2 more for an additional fee. The scallops were beautifully seared and had the perfect bite!! I also really liked the lemon ponzu that came with it, and it all blended together really well. 

- Grilled ahi tuna: Another great dish!! Came with shredded taro chips on top and I really enjoyed those, I even started eating them with my fingers hahaha. Tuna was good quality and had a great sear on the edges. 

- American kobe skirt steak: This was a huge piece of meat!!!! Covered in fried garlic and cilantro so yummmm. Not my favorite of the night because nothing stood out to me, but the meat was still delicious and executed well.

- Kurobuta pork chop: Tied with the seabass for my favorite dish of the night. Normally when you think of a porkchop, you think dry and tough. But this was the complete opposite!! So tender and easy to cut, and the pomegranate currant sauce was amazing!! I've never had meat with a fruit sauce, but this was sooo good. I ended up wiping the sauce with last few pieces of the meat, trying to get every last bit haha. Must order!!!

- Grilled sea bass: Last but certainly not least... The famous sea bass!! The fish was so tender and flaky, and I even enjoyed the garlic noodles and string beans that came with it!! The garlic normals are not your usual PPQ/thanh long noodles, but are covered in a smooth garlic sauce. The garlic ginger soy poured on top of the sea bass really made the dish though. The sauce is slightly sweet and so flavorful!! We actually got 2 orders of this because we knew it was so good!!

The service was good as with any expensive restaurant, and the ambiance is open in the front but more dark and intimate in the back. This would be a great place for a date!! Except parking sucks haha.

Overall I was very happy with my experience here! Keep in mind the place is very small and seems like a popular staple restaurant in SF. My mom made reservations for us a month prior for 5:30pm on a sunday and it wasn't crowded at that time, but once we left, the restaurant was full and people were waiting outside.
author: Tara A.

description:
Reservations are a must! The place is small and packed. Small is not a problem, unless you sit next to obnoxious diners. Rather than order an entrée, I had appetizers in order to try more of a variety. 
1) White shrimp and Chinese chive dumplings- It was good, but nothing special. I liked the dipping sauce.
2) Ahi tuna tartare with roasted nori chips- The fish was fresh, but the 3 chips with the tartare were not worth it.
3) Unagi with avocado sushi rice- This was my favorite appetizer. It was a nice piece of flavorful unagi. I thought it needed more rice underneath though. The unagi was topped with bonito flakes.
I only regret not ordering the crème brulee. I love crème brulee!
author: Helen H.

description:
I LIVE for meals like this.

My boyfriend and I went here for dinner today with a reservation for 6:30 pm. We arrived around 6:20 and we were seated promptly once we walked up to the counter and asked.

We started with the Salmon Rolls since we had read on Yelp that they were amazing. I'd warn that the mustard sauce contains wasabi and definitely gives you that sting. That being said, neither my boyfriend or I are a fan of wasabi but we both liked the dish.

We split the Sea Bass and Pork Chop for our mains. The sea bass was grilled to perfection - crispy on the outside with an inside that just melts in your mouth. The green beans that came with the sea bass were delicious as well, and the garlic soy sauce was a great accompaniment. 

I usually wouldn't choose to order pork but I loved the Pork Chop dish as well. The presentation was gorgeous and every bite was cooked to perfection. The pomegranate sauce was just slightly sweet and went very well with the meat.

We ordered the Chocolate Macadamia Tart with coffee ice cream for dessert. The texture was similar to a thick brownie, with generous portions of macadamia nut mixed in. A delicious end to our meal.

My only complaint is that the restaurant is small - I ran into a friend but could barely say hi to her since there wasn't any space by her table. There is also only one bathroom for the entire restaurant. The ambiance is homey, but the food tops anything I've had at fancier establishments.

We'll surely be back!
author: Anna M.

description: Wow, The House was a great surprise! Came here for dinner with some friends and everything we ordered was great. Service was quick and easy. Our food came out within 20 minutes. I had the sea bass and noodles dish which was delicious and so tender. My friends had the mushroom rice and short ribs which was also great. But the sea bass dish was the winner for me. I would definitely come back here.
author: Trang H.

description:
Wait was well worth it!

I highly recommend the ribeye steak and the deep fried crab.

Small quaint restaurant with lots to do after
author: Allen G.

description:
My second time at The House was just as great as the first. The Asian fusion here does not disappoint. Small and cozy or small and over-crowded? This restaurant definitely leans to the over-crowded, slightly uncomfortable size. If claustrophobia is an issue for you, reconsider. 
Soft shell crab and somen noodle appetizer: small, but worth it. The crab came with a lemon sauce on the side and the noodles were sweetened. Interesting combo- would order it again. 
Wasabi Noodles with steak: yes, yes, YES. I'm not a huge fan of wasabi and was scared to try this dish initially, but ended up loving it. There is only a hint of wasabi on the noodles. 
Mushroom rice with bonito flakes and ...?: Good, but not memorable (I can't even remember what was in it). 

We made a last minute reservation around 5PM on a Saturday night and the only available reservation was 10PM. We were told walk-ins were welcome, however it didn't look promising even 945 when we showed up. Their lunch menu is the same- half the price.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco - a true 5/5 for me. I've heard so many great things about them from friends and decided to try my luck on a Monday night since I didn't have a reservation and luckily there was a table available! Definitely lived up to the hype for me.

Started off with the unagi over avocado rice with bonito flakes (~$15). It was a large tender piece of eel and the rice was soo creamy. I absolutely loved this dish! Could have been a meal on its own.

The waiter told us a long list of specials. I tried the Kobe skirt steak with truffle sauce ($33). It came with cauliflower and mashed potatoes. The sauce was extremely flavorful and had a strong truffle taste. I thought the meat was great but nothing extraordinary.

My boyfriend got the ribeye ($35) that came with vegetables and mashed potato. This was the highlight of the meal. The meat was perfectly cooked and flavored. It was juicy and the serving size was huge!

Finished off with the mango tapioca dessert ($9) which was honestly one of my favorite desserts of all time. You have to try this. Very interesting chewy creamy texture that quickly melts in your mouth.

AMAZING meal! Feels upscale but the prices are very reasonable! Make a reservation!
author: Linda X.

description: Wonderful owners and staff with amazing food! Every small detail was carefully executed.  They offer exciting flavors with such a flair. You really can't go wrong on ordering. Everything was so good! I feel lucky to have been a guest.
author: Laurie C.

description:
I am in love with The House! My second time here, and I always want to order everything on menu. 

My boyfriend made reservations here on a Monday night. For our appetizers we got the seared scallops (comes with 3) and the soft shell crab which were both on the house specials for the evening. Both apps were beyond delicious--the crab came with a sweet sour lime dipping sauce and a noodle salad which tasted just right--tangy and citrusy.

The main entrees!
*PORK CHOP PORK CHOP* 
My favorite dish here hands down. I am going to say this is the spot for the best pork chop until I discover something else! The pomegranate sauce is soo good. I need not say more.

He was in between the popular item: Miso Butterfish vs house special Black Cod. In the end....the Black Cod took the win! It came with a ponzu ginger sauce topped with California rolls and a side of greens! The fish was super buttery and yummy. We both thought it was a great choice. 

DESSERT! We had the coconut creme brulee with a passion fruit puree. OMG. Perfect ending to our dinner. We will be back to try the Miso Buttafish
author: Alice Z.

description:
This was my 2nd experience dining at The House and overall it was an enjoyable meal but a tad overpriced for what it is. We had made reservations for 8pm on a nice Saturday evening. We checked in early and were seated before 8pm. Seating is cramped and this is not a very large restaurant so you're almost elbow to elbow with the table next to you. Since it's pretty compact space, conversations from the other tables will carry across tables.

I went with the Wasabi House Noodle with Angus Flatiron Steak entree, and we also shared the Grilled shrimp salad. The salad had crispy pork skin bits to give the salad a nice crunch and the flavors were mild and blended well together. For my entree, the wasabi noodles had a subtle wasabi kick and the flatiron steak was a bit bland for my tastes.

Overall, service was what you should expect, prompt and quick, but not overly warm. I can honestly say that as many reviews and rave comments I have heard, I do not think I would return any time soon, but it is a solid if not overpriced choice.
author: Angela L.

description:
Loved this place. This may be my favorite restaurant since I like tapas and Asian Fusion. My friend made a reservation for right when it opened at 5 and even though it is empty, walk in waits would be an hour and a half since they are waiting for reservations. The four of us shared the dishes and was the perfect amount.

1) Fried salmon rolls- This was delicious! I love salmon so when it is fried, you cant get better than that. You must get this.
2) Sea Bass- This was my favorite dish! the Sea Bass was so tender and delicious. The garlic noodles were bomb. When I get noodles from another place, it tastes so basic but these ones are so flavorful. The string beans are also yummy. Get this.
3) Miso Cod- This comes with cali rolls on top. This was good as well but I would get sea bass instead.
4) Pork Chop- This was so tender and delicious. The texture was smooth and the sauce was super yummy. 

Now I know why this place is so poppin. I bet there are so many more delicious places in Little Italy. The desserts didnt seem special so I just got some gelato at Alimento.
author: Amy H.

description:
We loved this small Asian fusion place on the border of Chinatown and Little Italy! The food & service were wonderful!

Appetizers: We started off with the seared scallop special. The scallops were very fresh, cooked perfectly, and a great small starter. Next our server made an excellent suggestion of fried soft shell crab which was beautifully presented and comes with a side of cold pasta. The dipping sauce made the dish and we asked for more to pour over the entree. We also had jasmine tea on the side as a palate cleanser and it was fragrant and subtle.

Entree: We had the mushroom rice and shrimp and the sea bass with noodles. Wow! Both were excellent. The grilled shrimp had a perfect grilled, almost tandoori style flavor, and the rice was very good. Huge portion. The sea bass...wow...I would order that again next time. The fish was melt-in-your-mouth buttery and the sauce paired with it was superb. Also loved the garlic noodles on the side.

Dessert: The creme brulee was excellent with a citrus orange sugar crystal top. Only a little less liked was the bittersweet chocolate cake as it was a bit too bitter for a milk choc lover like me, but overall still liked it with the vanilla ice cream.

Service: Excellent! Our server was so helpful in giving good recs and the team runs like a well oiled machine removing and adding plates for each appetizer and refilling drinks very quickly.
author: Sara A.

description: This happened to pop up in my search for a restaurant near China Live.  They were booked on Opentable, but since we were only a few blocks away, some friends walked there and put our names down.  We were seated about an hour and a half later, which is pretty much what they predicted, but we were able to get drinks nearby.  They don't serve cocktails here, only beer and wine, but the food was fabulous!  The scallops were cooked perfectly and so flavorful - I was sad I didn't get a plate for myself.  I ordered the sea bass, which came with thicker noodles and green beans - the fish was moist and tender and I liked the sweet soy based sauce that came on the side.  I'm missing the photo of the Rib Eye for some reason, but it was larger than we thought it would be ($35 I think).  It was also a tasty piece of meat.  The fried black cod was also prepared well, though I preferred the sea bass.  The only average dish was the Ahi - it was a little overcooked and dry.  The place is super tiny and our table was right next to the door/waiting area, so we had people staring at us while we ate the whole night - not the most comfortable but the food is worth it!
author: Caroline K.

description: Loveee this place.  Its so delicious.  Make a reservation here, it gets booked fast.  My favorite when i come to SF!
author: V M.

description: SO GOOD! We were lucky to get in without reservations, but totally recommended to make one. The service was solid and food AMAZING! They didn't have what i originally wanted so they recommended the cod fish dish, which was fantastic. The unagi dish was also mind blowing! It gets busy, so like I said, make a reservation...totally worth it!
author: Julia D.

description: Could have given a 5 star but the service was so terrible. The fish was so fresh and tasty. Even the desserts were so good. The server was asking me then before I had the chance to answer she asked the customer beside me. If you are ok with bad service but with some great food then definitely try out this place.
author: Wendy S.

description:
I can't believe I have never wrote a review for this place. This is my favorite restaurant in the city. It is also my top recommendations for any friends from out of town. The place is very small. Either make a reservation or come at when they open, or it will be a long wait. And be ready to sit really close to the table next to you and hear their conversations. 

But the food and price is unbeatable. I always recommend the salmon egg roll for appetizer and sea bass or steak with wasabi noodle never disappoint. After drinks and food, it is usually around $40 to $50 a person.
author: Lilly W.

description:
Asian fusion was the biggest culinary revolution 10-15 years ago. Since then, the movement has shifted to California modern (whatever that may mean). Where many have faltered, The House is alive and well. I'm not sure how often they update their menu, but all their dishes, from the appetizers to the entrees, were solid. A quick rundown of my dinner:

- Deep-fried salmon roll with Chinese hot mustard: This could have been better if my salmon wasn't thoroughly cooked on the inside. From the looks of some of the pictures, it should be pink. Otherwise, nice mustard.
- Caesar salad with crispy scallops: Nice pairing of scallops with a classic salad.
- Unagi with avocado, sushi rice: This was my favorite appetizer. Unagi was on point with flavor and texture. 
- Seared scallops with ponzu sauce: A nice addition to the menu topped off with watercress.
- Charred octopus salad: the octopus was tender and I loved the accompanying sauce.

Some of the entrees are synonymous with this restaurant. One is the Kurobuta pork chop with pomegranate currant glaze. This dish is spectacular. I couldn't get enough of the pomegranate sauce and the pork was cooked to perfection. I'm not a fan of pork chops,  but this one hit the spot. The other two are fish dishes, the grilled sea bass and the miso cod special. Of the two, I loved the cod, which I found to be more flavorful and tender. Interestingly, it was topped off by a California roll with real crab meat.

The service was excellent and they have a great selection of import beers. Make reservations at least a week in advance.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
There was ZERO food left on any of our plates. The food was SO SO good. Thanks to all the awesome Yelp reviews we tried The House the evening we arrived in SF. We ordered the Angus Beef steak w/mashed potatoes & cauliflower, black cod special w/sushi and sea bass w/garlic noodles & string beans. We also ordered the most delicious shrimp salad that was light and flavorful. It had little pieces of pork rinds for a bit of a crunch. Everything was delicious.

For dessert, we ordered the mango tapioca, macadamia nut ice cream with accompanying macadamia cake,  and flourless chocolate truffle cake with coffee ice cream. The mango tapioca was light and SO good, much better than we expected. Again, nothing left on our plates not even a crumb. 

Make reservations if you can as this is a small place.
author: Kim L.

description:
Made a reservation two weeks ago for today, Friday, at 7pm to take two guests from out of town to what should be one of the cool/unique restaurant experiences in SF. 

Come 4pm, am surprised to have not heard from them to confirm the reservation. Call them to confirm and am told that the reservation was canceled by text yesterday.

They claim the reservation could not have been canceled except by text message reply. I can absolutely guarantee that I did *not* receive any text message from Yelp (who apparently manages their reservations) or the restaurant.

Given the glitch on their side, with their reservation management system, I should still have a reservation right? They should do something to accommodate us and our guests? Nope. They didn't even apologize; just said they had no tables for us but we could come in at at 5:30p (an hour from the time of the call) or at 9p (well after reservation time, and too late to make the show we have tickets for afterwards).

The woman on the phone showed zero empathy for the position she put me in with my guests. I know this is a small and popular place, and they will be sold out for months to come on busy nights, but that doesn't mean they should not treat their customers well.

TL;DR they canceled my reservation of two weeks with no notice and no real offer to make it up to me. Will never (try to) go here again. 

And no thanks to Yelp either, who apparently texted the wrong person or otherwise canceled my reservation (according to the restaurant!).
author: Armen A.

description:
This tiny restaurant has a very nice atmosphere and very unique array of fusion dishes. But it is TINY. More likely than not, you will have to wait close to an hour to be seated. The portions here are surprisingly very good for a "fancy" restaurant. I've been quite satisfied both times i've been at the House. The fish here is delicious. They are cooked superbly. But if you are adventurous , you should try the beef steak with noodle. It is very unique in ingredients with kimchi, american bbq sauces, and a tinge of spiciness. The appetizers are delicious so be sure to try one of those while you are here. 
Everything here is a bit on the pricy end but you are definitely getting the whole package by dining here. If you have a specifically occasion that you are celebrating this is a great spot to visit. The ambience, the food, the service, and location are all very good for a great night out!
author: Jack Z.

description: I've only had lunch here, but this place is consistently good.  They do a great job of melding japanese styles with traditional dishes.  The service is always fast and friendly and I love their house made pickles.
author: Aaron G.

description:
The food was alright but the service was so bad 
The manager lady took back our plate and it was more than half of the entree and we sxpected for them to take it off of the bill that was over 500 dollars 
She argued and said just take ten dollars off of the bill but stuck us with a 60 dollar service charge for a mandatory tip for their nasty ride service
author: Gal E.

description: I have been frequenting The House for many years and the food keeps getting better and better! We had the deep fried salmon roll, an order of octopus, and the short ribs last week. Each dish had a complex blend of flavors that was unique and delicious. Presentations of each dish we ordered were works of art. We were seated promptly and the staff were attentive and helpful at every turn. This restaurant is truly outstanding!
author: Linda L.

description: The staff is usually very quickly. Seating capacity is small based on the demand. Making a reservation is always a good idea. Lot of fun bars around the vicinity for post dinner drinks
author: Bella H.

description:
Next day, I tortured myself looking at photos of the food I ate here. 
~ Note: erase photos from phone. 

RESERVATION: Yes, make one. It's a small restaurant and popular, so be smart. If you want to quickly get an opportunity to come here, starve yourself for most of the day, and make a late reservation like 8:30pm. 

ORDER: Came here with a Hawaii crew and the only way we know how to eat is family-style. Coming to this 4.5 star restaurant, it's only right to want to try everything. We were a party of 7 and had a total of about 7 dishes, which came about to be $37 a person. Even got a compliment from the server in making the right choice in sharing. Yes!
My favs: 
~ Warm wasabi noodles, flat iron steak: *Recommended by the server and must-try to me. It lived up my expectations. Great wasabi flavor from the noodles (I was afraid of it being too oily/saucy) and a great compliment to the tender steak. That steak was melt in da mouth for me. 
~ Kurobuta pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce: I regret not taking a better picture. But presentation was beautiful. I wished I ate more of this!
~ Fish? with roasted portabella white truffle sauce: Okay, I'm unsure if my friend ordered this dish with fish, but I swear it was! I remember there was a white truffle sauce that was AMAZING (plus from my picture the sauce is clearly white).  Dat sauce, I would lick the bowl for. 

I'll make more money to be a regular here, but for now, I'll keep staring at my photos. Great restaurant!
author: Casie C.

description:
Short Story:
Fantastic restaurant, well worth the price!

Long Story:
We came here on a Saturday evening with a reservation.  We were promptly greeted at the door and seated.  We ordered the tempura appetizer, house special Korean beef, and pork.  All dishes were fantastic and well worth the price.  The place is pretty small so reservations go out fast!  Also, the service here is top notch (given what you pay for) and the ambiance and decor is relaxing.  However, the place is always buzzing with noise and energy (in a good way) due to it's small size.

Verdict:
I'll definitely be back!
author: Michael W.

description: We made reservations for this place. We got a seat within 10 minutes. Although it's kinda cramped, I enjoyed the food! The wasabi noodles were VERY flavorful. We also had their salmon rolls, ribs, and cod with noodles. The fish will literally melt in your mouth. It is well seasoned so to me the sauce was not necessary. Good service but felt a little rushed. You must make reservations, otherwise be prepared to wait a while
author: Sui N.

description: I love this place.  They do seafood so well you can't go wrong.  I had the clam special the other night and the broth was so delicious, I just wanted to a bowl to drink for dinner.
author: E K.

description:
Main tip: wait to hear the specials before deciding what to order. 

There are a lot of specials (like 4 appetizer options and 3 entree options) and they are all very interesting. My boyfriend and I happened to choose all specials for our meal. We got the softshell crab and scallop appetizers and the miso marinated black cod and curry halibut entrees.

Second tip: make reservations! Otherwise you will have to wait 40 min to an hour to get a table. 

My boyfriend loved the food here, in fact The House is now hands down his favorite restaurant. I, meanwhile, thought the food was good but not amazing. I usually don't like foods that are too creamy/rich and the halibut was overwhelmingly so because it was served on top of potatoes and topped with taro along with that creamy sauce.

The miso marinated cod dish had excellent flavor but I thought they took the sushi inspiration a little too far. It was served with a sliced California roll on top of a wasabi ginger sauce and with a soy based sauce that tasted similar to eel sauce.

The appetizers were on point! Loved the soft shell crab, it was fried but done so well. The scallops were large, perfectly cooked, juicy, and SO flavorful. A+ job on those.
author: Rica Z.

description:
All the reviews were great, so we were super excited to dine here. We were really really hungry after hiking all day above stinson too! Unfortunately, experience was bad enough to make me want to write this warning others...definitely do not go within 30 min of them closing the kitchen. Showed up and asked if they could serve us, they said of course just order within the next 10 minutes, so we did.

Ordered the scallops, Kobe beef short ribs and a special cod roll. Cooks must've been in an a rush to get out, as everything served they served was undercooked. Scallops had a good flavor on the surface but we're wayyy too soft (felt like you were eating watery slime). I liked the Kobe beef fine, but think that was the hunger forcing me to eat. The cod was similar to the scallops, surface flavor was good, but felt like we were eating it raw. Think it was the sauce that made it edible.

After that ordeal, we ordered the creme brulee, figured something sweet would make up for it. It tasted super sour. Told the waitress we didn't mean to be rude but the dessert tasted like it had gone bad, something was really off, she got incredibly defensive and snapped back at me claiming no one had ever complained about the dessert EVER. Even if that was the case...felt like she should have been apologetic for two customers trying to have a nice dinner, really having a terrible time.

Ended up paying $140 for a dinner we really disliked. At least the wine was good...

Think there are plenty of better places to go in SF.
author: Ivan C.

description: 5 stars for food and service. Everything was delicious. So good the place was packed!
author: M. v.

description:
Make reservations! 
We had a 730 PM reso for table of three, but one person was late. Unfortunately, they didn't seat us until the whole party was present, which is understandable. 
We ordered two appetizers: salmon roll and  seared scallop; three entrees: sea bass, house noodles with steak, and the halibut(special) . 
Sea bass was excellent, but the sauce that it came with was too salty- good thing it is on the side. The wasabi noodles were great, nice bouncy noddles that aren't over cooked. The cod was their special of the day, came on a bed of mashed potatoes. 
The restaurant is really itty bitty, so come with a few friends only. Service was nice, our lady made sure our sake cups were always full. 
Our bill was pricey- 160$+ but that's expected with 3 entrees, 2 appetizers, a bottle of sake, & a beer.
author: Maria C.

description: My co-workers and I love this charming little restaurant.  We come for special occasions and casual lunches.  The curry noodles are off off the hook. You can choose chicken, prawns or veggie and tofu which is my favorite. A generous portion of thick mild curry with udon noodles in a pretty presentation.  Another facorite is the ahi BLT with wasabi mayo. Every time we try something new we always come back to these dishes. The wasabi noodles with pork is awesome too. Don't bother paying extra and getting it with salmon. The flavors don't meld and the salmon seemed bland to me. They have many specials but they tend to be expensive. They always look delicious if you are willing to spend the money.  There are only about 12 - 13 tables so be sure to make a reservation. Service is great. You won't be disappointed.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Simple menu, which I like. Solid food and drinks. I'll be back.
author: Adam P.

description: Great food and service!! Very small menu but the food is outstanding. Presentation was spot on and all the employees were very helpful.
author: Todd T.

description:
This place, by far, is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. We came here based on a friend's recommendation, and it was definitely worth checking out. My friend and I were able to call in and make a reservation without any problems on a Tuesday for dinner.

1. Seared scallops - I believe this was a special appetizer for today; it came with three pieces, and each bite was delicious!! The sauce went great with the scallops.
2. Halibut with truffle sauce and sweet corn and a side of mashed potatoes - THIS WAS SOOOO GOOD. This was also today's special, and it did NOT disappoint whatsoever. Everything just blended together so well!! The fish was cooked perfectly and the flavors were wonderful. My friend and I practically fought over who got the last bite for this dish.
3. Kobe beef with a side of cauliflower mashed potatoes - The beef was very tender and juicy. It was perfectly flavored!
4. Chocolate truffle cake with coffee ice cream - The chocolate cake alone was a little bit on the rich side for me, but I thought it was perfect if you ate it together with the ice cream and sauce. I probably would share this one with someone else though.

The service here was great also. Everyone was always extremely attentive and made sure that our dining experience was great. The atmosphere felt very intimate and cozy.

Overall, it was a wonderful experience, and I definitely would come back here again.
author: Tricia N.

description:
This place has such delicious food and such creative presentation that it's hard to avoid ordering everything. And so I have a mission to continue going until I have absolutely everything. 

Recommend: soft shell crap tower of
Amazing glory. (Not actual name)
author: Claire H.

description:
Pros:
-Food, all of it 
-Scallops Appetizer 
-Fast service
-Scallops Appetizer
-Intimate setting
-Scallops Appetizer 
-come as you are dining (come in a suit or in jeans and a tee)
-A small but great selection of good wine 

Cons:
-Maybe that I can't hear or remember all of the specials when the server tells me, maybe a visual would help.  

If you love food, please go here.  Seriously this is one of the best restaurants in all of the Bay Area, if not the best.   I have been going here for dinner for years now and I feel guilty about just writing a review.

This is a very small intimate place so I wouldn't bring more than 4 people here, it just feels right at 4.  If you're planning to go on a Friday or Saturday night you may want to book up to a week in advance.  

The food, the food is delicious.  Seriously I have been here many times and I have never heard anybody even begin to slightly complain.  

I usually have a default entree which is the wasabi noodles with skirt steak and one default appetizer which I do highly recommend as a must get which is the scallops.  The texture of the scallops is out of this world, you have the crispness on the outside and the soft flakiness on the inside.  

I've had most of the appetizers here and they are all great and I've tasted many of the entrees because I have friends who share. Seriously come here, try it all, you'll have found your new favorite place to have lunch or dinner.
author: Eric A.

description:
my second time at this restaurant! but took a 4-year hiatus between visits - probably this place doesnt take online reservations and i hate calling. totally my fault. was on the hook for treating some friends, so i booked a table for 4 at 7 pm on friday. i called same-week and was lucky enough to score a reservation.  prime time ressies are so hard in this city! 

the dinner menu looked fantastic - literally everything looked so good. and there were 6 additional specials - 3 apps and 3 mains.  i did the ordering for the group and shared everything family style.  we started with the crispy salmon rolls (because duh you have to), grilled unagi (a huge piece of eel on a bed of rice plus avocado - this was fantastic), a warm salad, and the bbq ribs - so tender and flavorful! the cole slaw was excellent as well - i could eat a tub of this.

for mains - we shared the ribeye with teriyaki sauce, a fish special, and the pork chop (this was my fave item from my first visit so had to try it again).  the fish special was probably my favorite item of the evening! it came with a cream sauce, but it wasnt overpowering and complemented the protein really well.  but to be honest - everything was pretty awesome. no complaints! 

we also shared a bottle of beaujolais and a bottle of sake - both great.  ive been meaning to drink more beaujolais since watching somm - into the bottle, hehe :) bill came out to be $300 after tax + tip for 4 - not bad at all!  really glad i came back to this spot - a real sf classic!
author: Christina L.

description: Small but delicious. The sea bass with green beans and garlic noodles is so tasty. You would be doing yourself a disservice by not eating here. Walking in you would think it's a so so joint but the food is 5 Star all the way. I appreciate places that really pay attention to flavor and don't just rush out a meal for the money. I could eat here all the time if I lived in the city. Service was great as well, can't wait to come back.
author: Marco R.

description:
So I been coming here every now and then for lunch for about two years now since my work is nearby but today by far would definitely be the worse experience I've encountered. My coworker and I had a reservation at 12 and we got seated as we arrived. 

Our server went over the today specials and handed us the menu. No one came back to take our order for a good 10 mins, and it wasn't even busy. We finally ordered. My coworker ordered wasabi noodles with pork. I ordered curry noodles with flat iron steak medium rare. Server did not write this down as she probably remembers. Then we sat around, no water no nothing. Wasn't until I waved down this other lady who might have been the owner for water that they gave us water. 

Finally our entrees arrives, however they got my coworkers wasabi noodles with pork correct. Then when they handed my plate to me it was wasabi noodles with flat iron steak. I instantly told the server. This is not what I ordered. I ordered curry noodles with flat iron. She then says oh okay, let me go check. She walls back to the kitchen, comes right back and says this is what you ordered wasabi noodles with steak. I repeat myself to her no this is not what I ordered. I ordered CURRY noodles with steak. Then she goes on saying this is the house noodles with steak. At this point I'm really frustrated already as I have to repeat myself for the third time. I ordered CURRY noodles, not wasabi and not the house noodles but curry. Then she got confused again and went to the server who took my order. I repeat again what I ordered and she said oh ok we will make the new one for you. 

Geez, first of all you took my order down wrong, maybe you should write it down ? And then after getting it wrong, your coworker seems to be so confused and can't even differentiate between wasabi noodles and curry noodles and I have to repeat over and over and she still don't seem to get it. And even after saying they will make my original order, there's no even apology for getting my order wrong or anything ?!

That completely ruined my mood and I didn't even feel like eating much after. Anyhow, I finished most the plate and asked for the check. When she brought the check over she didn't even bother to say thank you or anything. 

Don't know whether these 2 servers are new or what not but that is definitely some poor customer service. Took a while to take our orders, no water served or bother asking what would we like to drink, getting my order wrong and when I tell her that it is incorrect she can't even admit to being wrong and kept insisting that is what I ordered, did not even apologize at all, and finally when bringing the check can't even say thank you. After all this, this would most likely be my last time dining here. Food is decent but with that kind of service, I probably won't even have the appetite to eat.
author: Rosanna K.

description: I eat out quite a bit so it's rare that I find food that amazes me but this place was amazing!  The flavors and the food preparation were perfect.
author: Michael C.

description:
Obscured on the Italian side of Columbus in Chinatown, this tiny hidden gem has Chinese and Japanese elements but is more Cali Asian fusion...

Sans reservations, we managed to stop by for lunch and waited about a half hour for three people.  Was it worth it you ask?  That depends on your disposition.  Playing tourists in the city we grew up in I guess it's ok but there was a time we wouldn't have bothered.  Still I was happy we came and once we sat down everything was fine.  Once I was sipping on my Lychee Black Ice Tea things were copacetic...

If you like Steamed Mussels then you'll love the sauce and garlic liquor;   It's a shame to let it go to waste, I wish I could have thrown this appetizer over a bowl of pasta and gobble it up.  The green roe was an interesting touch.  You need the Caesar Salad because the mussels are not enough to fill you.  The salad was well tossed and seasoned, the crispy fried scallops take the place of the usual croutons...

The Grilled Sea Bass was beautifully done with garlic ginger soy, it's the same combination that we like using whenever we steam a whole fish at home, here served with green beans and thick noodles...

The Kurobuta Pork Chop was already nice with the pomegranates but the currants were dope,  all you need would be blood oranges...

An indulgence for lunch to be sure, but I'm also glad we had the chance to try these dishes at that time of day.  Flavors were delightful...
author: Lawrence L.

description:
I absolutely adore this establishment. How any restaurant can pull off "Asian Fusion" is beyond me, but The House did it with flair. The entrees we ordered were perfectly cooked. We ordered the sea bass and pomegranate pork chop. Both are must tries in my book! The sea bass were so tender and flaky, and the accompanying beans and noodles made this a really homey yet innovative dish. The pomegranate pork chop was fantastic. It was cooked to a perfect medium, and it was also very tender and bursting with flavor. The mashed potatoes it came with were very plain, but the actual star of the dish, the pork chops, more than made up for it. The fried salmon roll appetizers were a disappointment for me though. Was very unmemorable and boring. but my bf enjoyed it. Our meal ended with the chocolate truffle cake with coffee ice-cream and coconut caramel syrup which was also delicious :)

My only gripes with this place is that the bathroom was not very nice, and the tables were very cramped together. Several times during the meal, I had to physically move my dishes so that people could pass by (and I only had two dishes on the table!). The decor is also pretty minimal as stated in other reviews. However, minor details that didn't spoil my wonderful meal here.
author: Claudia C.

description:
I have had a few friends recommend this place to me, so I finally decided to give it a try during one of my visits to SF. I was glad I did, because this place is divine. This spot is a cute little asian fusion restaurant. 

I ordered the wasabi noodles with flat iron steak, and that was fantastic! My friend ordered the rib eye, and OMG that was phenomenal. You literally see the flavors oozing out of that piece of meat when it was brought out. Flavor and the way the steak was cooked was perfect.

Portions are huge, so definitely recommend sharing! That way everyone also gets to try a little bit of everything.

Thanks for the amazing food & service The House, will be coming back!
author: Sophia L.

description: After coming back here for three separate meals, this is again my favorite restaurant. Yes, the silverware and water glasses could be better, but the food is by far so much better than your liholiho and other popular new restaurants around. The scallops, the OMG grilled octopus, and the black cod are unsurpassable. Keep up the good work.
author: Peter T.

description: Amazing food! Everything I ate was absolutely to die for! The appetizers, garlic noodles, the steak, the Caesar salad with scallops, and dessert were all the exquisite!
author: Brenda H.

description: I'm still dreaming about the Broiled Unagi over avacado wasabi rice!  Every dish was delicious and flavorful and the fish was fresh. We shared as many dishes as the three of us could eat.  I'm glad that we tried this favorite spot for locals.  The service was excellent and the food came fast.  I will be back when visiting San Francisco.
author: D H.

description:
A bit of a walk to get here..but it was still open. This place is an asian fusion place and I had the special..halibut..i must of not heard what the waitress said, because what I got was fried fish..sorta like fish and chips without the chips..The cauliflower was pretty good, but the fish was so so. 

The menu wasn't mind blowing to me..not sure what the rave is all about, although service was decent. Wished I had refill on my water though.
author: Minerva L.

description:
I come here all the time 

My favorite is the fried salmon roll appetizer and everything you order here is delicious
author: Es L.

description:
FLAVOR.
We ordered the seabass and the mussels and we were practically licking the plate afterwards. I think any of the dishes would have produced the same results. I looked around and everyone was equally satisfied with their food. They are quite cramped and there's a huge line. Aside from that, man oh man.
author: Ming C.

description: This place is super tiny, but they serve very reasonably priced and delicious Asian-fusion cuisine. I highly recommend the porkchop or their ahi tuna with California rolls. Be sure to make a reservation, and to head towards the city a little earlier because of parking.
author: Sandra S.

description: I visited this place a few months ago. The service was a bit fast but not rushed. Everything from appetizers to main course was delicious.  I had a sashimi appetizer which was as good and Angus Prime Rib Eye for my main course. Both are awesome and the price was fair. I was impressed with the quality of the food. I would definitely recommend and I will be back for sure.
author: Natasha R.

description: Wow, THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!! Don't even think about it, just come. Very small place but the food is out of this world. I had the grilled Octopus and it was some of the best I've ever had. My wife had the tuna poke and it was soooooo good.
author: John T.

description:
We had never been here before, the reviews online were good, and we absolutely love Asian food and seafood so we decided to give it a shot. THE BEST. We loved every single dish that landed on our table. This spot is an absolute gem - here is what I ate.

Shrimp & Chinese Chive Dumplings. I would slap babies for these dumplings, I'm serious. They were filled with noticeably delicious, fresh ingredients and the dumpling wrapper was perfect - not too thick and not too thin. All of the dishes are garnished with different types of radish so that crunch was a nice compliment to the soft steamed dumpling. But, the sauce. Da sauce that came with the dumplings was divine. I saved the sauce and dipped everything I ate it in - that's how good it was. The sauce was a soy sauce and green onion base and that seems simple but it was perfectly acidic with the right amount of vinegar.

We also started with a special appetizer that's not on the menu. Seared scallops with micro greens. These were unique because most of the time seared scallops are only seared on the two flat sides, but these were seared all the way around. They were perfectly cooked. I am not sure what the yellow sauce was but it was good but not the star of the plate. I actually don't remember exactly what the sauce tasted like. It was lightly sweet which complimented the savory flavor of the scallop but I liked the fact that the flavor was secondary and forgettable.

I had two appetizers for my entree because if you've read my blog before you know I can't choose just one thing. The Mussels and The Deep Fried Salmon Roll with Chinese Hot Mustard. The mussels were in a tomato based broth with tiny pieces of tomato and onion. I could have drank the stuff. They were savory and the flavors were really developed. The fried salmon was crispy and perfectly cooked which I know is really difficult. That part of the dish wasn't extremely special but the DA SAUCE - it was amazing. It was spicy and the flavor went perfectly with the salmon. I also mixed the dumpling and hot mustard sauces because yolo  - do it.

This is one of my favorite new restaurants in the city, hands down. I will now recommend it to every visitor of SF in my network. Thank you House for being there for me after a series of let downs.

pics on my blog:
https://browngirlspov.com/2017/02/06/the-house-san-francisco/
author: Jazmyn W.

description:
I've finally had the chance to try this restaurant after having it on my bookmarks for almost 2+ years now *cries tears of joy* My bf made reservations a few weeks ahead and we came in on a Thursday night. The tables were full and a few walk ins were crowding the entrance waiting for seats to clear up.

We got seated towards the back after a short wait. The tables are tiny and closely next to each other, so expect to have a cozy meal. The décor is minimal and it can be a little loud in there, but who cares when the food is so good!

We're more of red wine drinkers, but they did not have many by the glass options however the pinot noir turned out to be perfect. For starters we chose the deep fried salmon rolls and the steamed mussels in shrimp broth. I've been dreaming about the deep fried salmon rolls before even trying them just from pictures of it and they tasted even better than I expected! It has a nice crunchy outside, almost like an eggroll but the salmon inside was so soft. The Chinese hot mustard dipping sauce was a little strong, but with the right amount it made the perfect pair. The mussels were good, but not really outstanding.

I ordered the seabass with garlic noodle and green bean sides with no hesitation based on all the hype from previous reviews. The seabass was a slightly flaky on the outside and each juicy piece really melted in my mouth...so good! I enjoyed it even more with the garlic ginger soy sauce on the side. The garlic green beans were cooked perfectly and the noodles complimented the whole meal real nicely. I seriously had to tell myself to slow down and eat smaller portions at a time otherwise I would've finished my plate before my bf, which rarely happens. It was too tasty and I pretty much cleared out my plate haha.

My bf had the kobe beef ribeye with the mashed potatoes and cauliflower sides. It was a huge cut and he asked for it medium rare. The first bite from the edge seemed to be a little cooked passed medium rare, but it turned out to be perfect. It was super flavorful and juicy.

Everything was very delicious and I now know why this place is always packed (aside from it being small). I highly suggest it if you're in for a nice dining experience--I feel that some restaurants don't do Asian Fusion well, but this place has mastered it tying in all the right, unique flavors. Not too fancy, but definitely a treat! The only thing I regret was not trying anything from the dessert menu (what was I thinking!) Well, that already gives me another reason to come back!
author: Georgina G.

description: I come here for the sea bass. Fantastic. At $31 it's over priced - but hey it's San Francisco and let's face it - this isn't a place you frequent regularly. I've dined there three times now - most recently this evening. The tempura salad was a nice surprise - and unique menu item; I highly recommend. Ordered the fried salmon rolls app and they were not as good as I remembered / very dry (actually looking at pictures other diners posted I see that ours looked nothing like it was supposed to. Ours was not rare - it was fully cooked and chewy.) The wasabi sauce helped moisten things up and my friends didn't seem to notice. Next time I would pass on this one. The rhubarb strawberry pie was a perfect dessert. I wasn't as thrilled with the mango creme brûlée. The mango flavor was overpowering - the dessert looked like it was swimming in mango juice. Would have been better in my opinion if it was just a hint of mango. As far as ambiance, you'll be sitting elbow to elbow with the diners at other tables (my first dinner here we actually had a group convo our entire meal with the table sitting next to us).  It's also loud AF in there - the waitress repeated the specials twice and I still couldn't decipher what she was saying. Perhaps put them on paper? Service was annoyingly very rushed for some reason for a Monday evening. The waitress cleared away wine glasses when we still had wine in the bottle. Odd. Don't want to deduct stars for service but just slow it down please - we are paying good money to eat here! So reading this back over it sounds pretty negative - so I'll say my 4* are all for that sea bass!
author: Robin P.

description:
I have walked pass the House many times and have always wanted to go there. I could never plan for a reservation so I thought that I could never get a place for 2 people. Finally I broke down and on a Friday evening I decided to go at 9.00 PM with my wife. They were very accommodating and within 15 mins we got our table. I am vegetarian but I accompanied my wife as she is a big Salmon fan! Her appetizer and main entree were outstanding. However, they had nothing on the menu for a vegetarian. The server said: Don't worry let our chef make you something with noodles and vegetables and I wanted extra spicy. My entree made up by the chef was just amazing. Noodles were perfectly cooked with Asian spices and vegetables. I am sorry that Shirley H was not happy, but being a vegetarian they created my entree exactly what I had in mind....I call that superb service and willing to go few more steps to make everyone happy. House--keep it up. 
P.S. We went again and it was a repeat amazing performance!!!
author: Rex T.

description: Lucky us.. no reservation needed for Friday dinner.. just walk in. Great foods selection
author: Linh T.

description:
I wish these dishes were served at MY house because everything was so delicious! (Although my mom does make really good food :D). One thing I was totally looking forward to was the Miso Black Cod, which is one of my favorite fishes and I'm so glad they did not disappoint! The fish was so soft, cooked perfectly and flavored well with the miso glaze. I'm thinking about making another reservations just writing about this! It also comes with some sushi rolls which was a good compliment to the protein. It was good and fresh, but not as amazing as the fish.

We also got the deep fried salmon roll which was really good with the Chinese hot mustard sauce. The salmon was cooked perfectly and it wasn't over battered. The veggie fillers were really good as well - tangy.

And lastly, we also got the popular flat iron steak with wasabi noodles. The steak was delicious and the flavors of the dish was great. The noodles were really good as well, but I just wish there was actually more of the wasabi flavor. I wish I could have poured some Chinese hot mustard on it. That would have totally made it. 

Overall, it was a great meal. Everything was fresh and cooked perfectly. I would come back if I was feeling like spoiling myself with a really good meal.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
This has been my favorite restaurant in SF for the past 3 years (since my first time eating there). This was maybe my 10th visit to the restaurant and the food is consistently excellent, service is great, and ambiance is warm. My favorite go-to dish is the Warm Wasabi Noodles with Flank Steak, absolutely amazing. At times I am just craving those delicious noodles but want to pair it with the Salmon or Miso Cod and they will usually accommodate my request. The Unagi BLT is to die for and the Scallop appetizer is perfect. 

During this last visit we started with the Scallops which were extremely fresh. I had the Warm Wasabi Noodles with Miso Black Cod and it was cooked to perfection, the noodles were extremely flavorful and the Cod just flaked apart with the touch of a fork. My friend had the Kobe Short Rib special and he melted at the first taste. For dessert we had an Apple Crumble.

I can't wait to go back again!
author: Moneeza P.

description:
The House is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco with an amazing all around menu and friendly service. The food is asian fusion, however, the flavors are so approachable for everyone and I think you'll agree with me that it's impossible to not find something here that wow'd you.

For main course, I loved their sea bass, black bod, wasabi noodles, and pork chop. Honestly, nothing here is bad. Just, which one will your taste buds a bigger satisfaction than the other! :)
author: Navi R.

description: I've been waiting to try The House for a while now, and I always had my eye on the Grilled sea bass so I finally went for it. My friend also got the pork chop. Both dish presentations were nice, but the taste wasn't as good as I had expected for the price. The sea bass was cooked well - it practically melted in my mouth. My biggest complaint about the meal was that I was constantly drinking water after every single bite because the dish was one of the saltiest dishes I have had. Maybe my taste buds are more sensitive, but I do think the meal was way too salty so I ended up not being able to finish. I do think it's great that they serve the fish with some noodles and green beans to help give you a well-rounded meal.
author: Catherine S.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of Asian Fusion but woah, "The House" is simply delicious! I even been to their first location before they became super popular here in the north beach area. 

My favorite dish is their **Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy. Comes with a side of noodles and green beans. The sea bass just melts in your mouth. YUM! So full of flavor. I also love their **Kurobuta Pork Chops. A perfect combination of a little sweet and savory. Very tender, not over cooked at all. Not as good as NOPA but comes very close. 

My favorite appetizer is their **Deep-fried salmon roll with Chinese hot mustard. So pretty good. Crispy and full of flavor. Delicious!

Services is always friendly, causal. **RESERVATION recommended.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Line out the door, no reservations, long wait time.....is it really worth it?!? #Yes

Strolled in here on a busy Saturday night because I had to see for myself if the hype was real!?!

Hostess: Do you have a reservation?!?
Me: No, how long for a table of 4...
Hostess: Right now without a reservation anywhere from 45mins to an hour!?!
Me: Ummmm that's fine, can we put our name down.
Hostess: Sure I'll put your name down.
Me: We'll be outside
Hostess: Try to see if you can find another place to eat, if you do not want to wait that is ok with me.
Me: No we'll be back (she don't want us to eat here or what?) #BrownPeopleProblems


Wait ended up being about 45mins and it was well worth it.  Place is not that big and the tables are tight, and elbow space is limited at best.  Service was amazing from start to finish and the food was OMFGoodess:

Pork Chop Entree - this is what everybody was raving about on the quick tips and yelp reviews and it lived up to the hype.  Pork Chop placed on Mashed Potatoes with sauce drenched around the plate and a side of asparagus. #MustOrder

Sea Bass Entree - Sea Bass served with noodles and green beans with a special dipping sauce as well for the sea bass.  So fresh and tasted scrumptious!

Don't make the same mistake I made, make a reservation before hand.  This place is a must eat in SF, the 4.5 star Yelp Rating don't lie.  Before we even walked into restaurant, we heard people walking out raving about it and that is why we decided to wait almost an hour to eat here and it was well worth it yo!!!
author: Deep S.

description: One of my fav fusion food restaurants in SF. The scallops melt in your mouth. Almost everything is good here on the menu so you don't have to worry to order the wrong choice! I've been eating here for 13 years, took my clients ,friends and family here, they all loved it. RSVP is a must as the place is small and if you have more than 2 people, it could take 1week to a month advance for RSVP.
author: Ann T.

description: Sea Bass is the reason you come here. So so good!  I'm typically not a big fish connoisseur but I have a weakness for Sea-Bass and I'm not talking about the Raiders kicker (which btw , congrats on making millions upon millions dollars for so many years kicking an oblong pig-skin).
author: Rod M.

description:
An oldie favorite. 

TIP: always make reservations since they are always fully booked. This is a small restaurant but I've seen them accommodate a big party. This place is perfect for a date night, birthday, anniversary or just a nice dinner.

My favorite: 

Appetizer: ahi tuna served with nori chips: the tuna is fresh and complements well with the nori chips.

Entree: grilled seabass but change the side to a wasabi noodle. They usually serve the wasabi noodle with steak but the perfect combo to me is the sea bass with wasabi noodles. You get best of both worlds. The seabass is always cooked to perfection. 

Dessert: only winter seasonal is the persimmon if is so delicious! Perfect dessert in the winter months. 
In the winter time try the
author: Joanne K.

description: Awesome fusion asian food! Oh but there's always a line. Make sure your reserve a table ahead of time if you're planning to come here on the weekends.
author: J L.

description:
The House is still definitely one of my favorite places to eat in the city. Just went today and got to try two specials that weren't on the menu.

Ahi and yellow tail poke with avocado - yes, poke is trendy and the hype these days. So, of course, The House has their own version and it's delicious. The fish is fresh.. and you get plenty of avocado. Definitely a great way to start your meal.

Miso black cod and CA rolls - it sounds weird, but it's definitely tasty. The cod is cooked perfectly and sits on a stack of Chinese broccoli. The sauce is flavorful (might be a tad bit salty, but I enjoy it!). It may be a new favorite! 

So, if you haven't tried The House already... it's time you go or if you prefer not to wait, then make a reservation. They get pretty busy!
author: Cassy H.

description: Lives up to the hype! Went for lunch today and got the fried salmon roll, steamed clams in a spicy miso sauce and curry noodles. Everything was to die for and the service was great. Really reasonably priced for lunch!
author: Mileen Z.

description: I got the mushroom soup and the Korean style Kobe short ribs.  The mushroom soup was alright, but the Kobe short ribs has issue.  Too much fat and barely any meat.  Didn't taste good at all.  1 star if it wasn't for the mushroom soup.  Don't get the Korean style Kobe short ribs!!
author: Tim B.

description: I was taken to this restaurant by a long time San Franciscan native and it didn't disappoint. I had the sea bass with garlic noodles; super delicious!  The restaurant was packed..it's a tiny place, glad we had reservations. Staff was super friendly too. The pickled cucumber was yummy too.
author: Kesha M.

description:
Still my favorite place in the bay.

Sadly prices have risen but whatever the food is so worth it!

Love the aesthetics and the flavor. Anything on the menu is a sure thing but I always go for their cod special.  Sooooo beautiful and tasty!!!!

Don't forget to save room for dessert!!!
author: Jun K.

description:
I always avoided walking on the street of where The House is located. I was always annoyed with how many people bombarded the streets as they waited for their name to be called in order to be seated. This time, I went directly to The House. It was time to see what the hubub is all about. 

We made reservations beforehand, but even when we walked in at around 12:15pm, the place wasn't entirely packed. (Maybe because it's a Wednesday). Anywho, we were seated near the back and I found it pretty dark and I couldn't help but feel extremely sleepy. I had to keep drinking tons of water in order to stay awake. 

We started our lunch with the fried string beans and mussels. The beans had a nice crunch due to the light layer of fried batter. The mussels were okay, but the sauce is what really made it for me. We ordered a side of bread in order to soak up what was leftover. 

For entrees, we had the wasabi noodles with salmon, chicken with mashed potatoes, and sea bass with garlic noodles and green beans. The wasabi noodles had an interesting taste. A hint of spice and a lingering seasoning of wasabi. The salmon was spiced and cooked to perfection. The chicken was juicy and tender and the mashed potatoes reminded me of Thanksgiving. The sea bass was also cooked perfectly. It had a nice texture that complimented my crunchy green beans really well. The garlic noodles wasn't garlicky enough, but it was still extremely delicious.

We ended our meal with an a la mode, mango tapioca pudding and a creme brule. Everything was extremely delicious! Nothing was too sweet and the texture of the desserts were perfect. I would recommend all of them!
author: Linda K.

description: I was invited to come to this restaurant with my new coworkers on my first day of work.  The food and service was still superb as I remembered a few years ago.  I forgot the name of the plate I ordered, but it was super delish! I will be back again soon! :)
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I've eaten here with my coworkers a few times over the long time this place has been open. Always busy but not too long a wait. The food wasn't as great as you would have hoped. And isn't as good as many years ago. Food was too salty to my liking. I don't think I will be back as there are too many other places to try.
author: Laine G.

description:
When Miss Bad Idea Bear and I used to work together, she would frequently get on my case for daydreaming and not paying attention.  She once threw a stuffed animal over our shared cube, which smacked me in the face, to knock me out of daydreaming.

What was a daydreaming about? Sometimes Julianne Moore, but other times it would be something practical, like what to eat for lunch.

I found myself daydreaming about The House's tuna BLT sandwich the other day, and wound up coming here for the second time that week.

This place gets crowded during lunch time, and since I'm never sure when I'll be pulled into another meeting, I wasn't able to make a reservation, so I found myself sprinting to this place to get a seat.

So, it was just me and my tuna BLT in a wonderland of food bliss until my co-workers showed up and joined me.

SF is a small place, where everyone seems to know me or run into me, so they pulled up a seat.

I had eaten my sandwich so quickly that I actually ordered another one because it was just so good, and because I was still hungry. That wasabi mayo with the grilled tuna is so addictive.

So if you catch me staring off into space during lunch time, or at work, know that I may be thinking of Julianne Moore....or this sandwich.
author: Jack R.

description:
When my dad and I show up to this tiny place, I wasn't sure what to think. We showed up 30 minutes before they opened, so we walked around for a bit. We came back 5 minutes before they opened and there was a line. WHAT?!?

He normally doesn't take over, but he orders three things that knock my socks off:
1. Fried salmon rolls
2. Green bean fries
3. Roasted scallops

OMG. ALL were yummy. We also ordered the shrimp and chive dumplings, short ribs, and more of what we had before. 

We topped our meal off with the house made almond cookies which were were a delicious and light way to end the meal. 

Service was great and the food was even better.
author: Kischa J.

description: The House is my go-to place for lunch. Everything about the service to the flavor of each dish puts you in a great mood for the rest of the day. Each dish has a simple ingredient that somehow elevates your taste buds to another level and leaves you wondering how did they do that? The rice flakes in their poke, the wasabi dip with the deep fried salmon roll, and the corn in the curry noodles are all great examples of this.  I highly recommend ordering the deep fried salmon roll, curry noodles with grilled chicken, and wasabi noodles with grilled pork, which were all $12-13. The ahi-tuna poke, also a must try, was a lunch special so listen to all of their specials of the day ($16)!
author: Kevin T.

description:
What can I say except YUM?!

Food:
Appetizers:
-Yellowtail and tuna poke: Delicious but small plate of raw fish marinated with soy sauce and topped with little rice crispies and a side of avocado. Definitely a must try, though I wish they offered a larger portion.
-Deep fried salmon rolls: Saw everyone ordering this on Yelp so we had to try it. We were a table of 6 and the rolls only come in 4 pieces. The kitchen was nice enough to accommodate for all of us by cutting the rolls into 6 instead of 4 pieces! Extra star for that :)

Entree:
-Warm wasabi noodles with angus flatiron steak: Noodles have a strong wasabi flavor, and the steak was grilled to a perfect medium rare. The portion was just right (though I did end up taking home the leftovers!). 
-Sea bass with green beans and garlic noodles: My friend ordered this so I didn't try the sides, just the fish. The fish just melts in your mouth, so delicious. The sea bass itself was pretty big sized. I've been to restaurants that serve fish as an entree and it's as small as half my palm so this was definitely a crowd pleaser! 

Desserts:
-Coconut creme brûlée with grapefruit purée: this dessert is a MUST try. The cream is so silky, brûléed to the perfect crisp. The tartness of the grapefruit purée eaten alone is extremely sour, but it pairs wonderfully with the sweetness of the creme. And it's a huge portion, wish I had the stomach space to finish it!
-Pineapple upside down cake: this was one of their special desserts. TO DIE FOR. The cake is soft and moist, and pairs so well with the fresh pineapple and vanilla ice cream. 

Overall:
This restaurant is pretty pricey, and you have a two hour limit. However, for the quality of the food and service, totally worth it!
author: Ava F.

description: Our reservations were for 6pm. Early, and the place was already packed - which was a good sign. We had heard good things about The House and were not disappointed. I would eat here again & again! It was fantastic. I recommend the tuna tartare and unagi starters, but everything was delicious... and everything on the neighboring tables looked good too. One suggestion for the staff would be to print the specials or put them on a board. It was hard to hear the server.
author: Diane C.

description:
Listened to the reviews about making an appointment so I made one right at 530, when they open (Sunday).

The ribeye steak was mouthwatering and delicious. It was so tender and the flavors were amazing. The sauce of the ribeye leaked onto the cauliflower which made it on of the most delicious cauliflower I ever had. The mashed potatoes were just average to me but it did seem to compliment the other stuff on the plate. 

The pork chops were seriously so good. That sauce though!! It was delicious. I even dipped my steak into the pork chops sauce. I enjoyed coming here. Service was great and the atmosphere was tiny, yet doable. I would come again if I was in the area. Definitely recommend if you are in the area because this is something you don't want to miss!
author: Heather N.

description:
It was a dark and rainy night... after a long day in the office, and I admittedly was ready to head back to my hotel, put on my PJs, order room service, and call it a night.  But thanks to Miriam W planning ahead, we had a dinner reservation for 7pm at The House to look forward to, and it did not disappoint.
