We arrived a bit early for the reservation and the restaurant was bustling.  I hear this is often the case at The House, so reservations are indeed required.  We waited a few minutes for our table to open up and then settled into a cozy spot in the middle of the restaurant, perfect for our party of three.

Service was attentive enough.  Our waitress went over the specials, ensured we had water, and gave us sufficient time to look over the menu and decide what to order.  We decided to order family style and share...  We started with the Deep Fried Salmon roll and Unagi as appetizers, followed by The House's signature Wasabi Noodle with Steak and Black Cod special entrees.  (The Unagi and Black Cod were the winners in my eyes!)  We also shared a bottle of Viogner, many laughs and some memorable conversations.  

I almost forgot... we ended the meal sharing the Mango Tapioca, which was the perfect sweet ending to the evening.  If you like Asian Fusion, you can't go wrong with The House, especially if you have some fun friends or colleagues to join you.  Needless to say, I am a fan!
author: Gabi M.

description:
Usually it takes me a while to admit to a favorite restaurant in any city, but The House stole my heart right away. The House IS indeed my favorite SF restaurant. I love that the ambiance is so simple and unassuming. Nothing about it tries hard at all. The House lets the dishes speak for its name. 

+ deep fried salmon roll - Ok I know it doesn't SOUND appetizing. I was expecting a Philadelphia roll-esque mayo/cream cheese-filled sushi roll deep fried in tempura batter... gross. This appetizer is far from it. It's like a .... salmon egg roll. Simple. Flavorful moist salmon wrapped in a crispy eggroll exterior and topped with salmon roe. Served with a yellow wasabi sauce. A must.

+  sea bass with noodles and green beans - SEA BASS is on hit. So fluffy and buttery and just melts in your mouth. and the garlic soy sauce with the noodles was the perfect side. I don't even know what to say except YOU HAVE TO ORDER THIS and experience it yourself. Words can't describe.... Drool.

+ wasabi noodles with steak -Another stellar dish. OBSESSED with the wasabi noodles. The steak was flavored and cooked to a perfection. 

+ miso black cod - One of their specials of the day. Cod was (you guessed it) cooked to a perfection and  served with an AMAAAZING SAUCE. Topped with a slice of a California hand roll. Why did the California roll taste so bomb? I have no idea, but it is so next level. 

I was seriously wow'd by every dish. Decently priced and so bomb. I vow to ALWAYS visit the House when I'm in the City. I almost went twice during my 4 day stay...
author: Elysse P.

description: I really enjoyed this restaurant. We ordered all of the specials and I sampled all of the sakes. I thought the price was very reasonable for uniquely prepared japanese inspired dishes. We will return and a bonus is Cafe Trieste is a few doors away.
author: Michael A.

description:
Wow. where do I start with this place?

This place started simple enough, a humble location with a well decorated interior. Nothing crazy.

Now to start off with the food, I'll begin with the appetizers.

The first thing we got was the baked salmon roll. This dish was very solid and tasty. The salmon was clearly very fresh, and every ingredient was well thought out. The horse radish sauce was really good as well. The flavor was not anything mind blowing, but was solid.

The second thing we got was the cooked octopus dish. Now this is where it got really crazy. After the first appetizer I thought I had my mind wrapped around what kind of a place this was, boy was I wrong. This appetizer was incredible. I mean seriously mind blowing. I have not tasted anything close to this in my life. It was asian inspired, along with some sweetness and bbq to go along with it. I only had octopus once before, but this time simply blew my mind apart. Everyone at my table's eyes opened wide after tasting this dish. In addition the octopus was extremely fresh, wasn't too chewy, and cooked to perfection without being too much dry. 

After the roller coaster that was the second appetizer, we entered the entree.

We each ordered 3 different entrees, which I got the liberty of tasting each. We got the pork chop, the seared ahi tuna, and the rib eye. Between my group of friends, my friend and I agreed that the rib eye was the best, while my other friend decided that the pork chop was the best.

Now for the rib eye. Oh boy... 

After the octopus, I had no clue what to expect. The salmon started off good, but still within expectations, and the octopus went above and beyond. I didn't know what to expect. When my steak arrived, the first thing I notice was how gorgeous the plate looked. What I also liked at first glance was that aside from being very visually appealing, it looked like a good sized entree. Aside from portion size, it smelled and looked incredible. Also being an asian inspired dish, it was made with a house-made teriyaki sauce, with toasted garlic butter on top. This thing was seriously a good-looking piece of meat. It even glistened when I took a picture of it, I swear it was sent to me by the heavens.

As I cut into it, I notice it was cooked a perfect medium-rare (just how I asked). This was already a fantastic indicator. The meat was also super tender to cut through. The first bite of this mystical piece of meat was something for the storybooks.

The first thing that I remember hitting my mouth was the steak marinated in teriyaki. Oh my god, this is not regular teriyaki keep in mind. This is there own version which is extremely delicious, yet gentle as to not kill the flavor of the meat. The next that hit was the beef flavor, which was cooked to perfection, and finally the garlic. This single piece of meat tasted better IN MY OPINION than Mastro's Steakhouse, Flemings, and other restaurants of the such. The reason is because this place truly added a unique flair that really brought the steak to the next level.

I was so enthralled by the steak that I could barely pay attention to the other dishes, being the pork chop and the ahi tuna. 

The pork chop was also extremely good with pomegranate currant sauce which once again was good but not overpowering. This entree was arguably as good as the steak, but I would pick the steak over this personally.

The ahi tuna was also cooked perfectly, but in my opinion didn't have the same wow effect as these two other entrees.

Finally was the dessert, which was a apple crumble. It was a solid dessert, with everything being cooked perfectly. Nothing crazy was really happening here, it was just very well made and tasted great. The apples were cooked perfectly, the ice cream had a good texture and flavor, and the breading was moist and flavorful. Best of all the dessert wasn't too sweet, and it was easy to continue eating this dessert.

Overall this meal combined great service, EXCEPTIONAL food, and a nice ambiance and therefore deserves and easy 5 stars in my book.
author: Yanir R.

description:
This review has been long overdue. 20 years overdue. If you haven't had a chance to dine at The House, you are in for a treat. The restaurant is small, so reservations are a must. When the restaurant gets full, it gets loud. The food is worth the volume. 

Standouts on the menu are; the Salmon rolls or mussels as starters, the Sea Bass with ginger soy glaze and noodles for the main entree, and the mango tapioca for dessert. If you like calamari and it's available when you are dining, you would be doing yourself a favor to order it. All of the food on the menu is delicious. 

Parking is tough in the neighborhood, so allow time for parking. The North Beach garage on Vallejo Street is an easy walk away.
author: Loren S.

description: Friendly and knowledgeable staff support your gastronomic adventure which will surely lead you to positively surprising experience. There are a lot of directions to go with the menu, but you'll be rewarded if you plan to save room and a budget for the full course spreads. This is especially true for the changing dessert options. We recently really enjoyed the coconut créeme brûlée with passion fruit toppings...Yum...
author: kyle M.

description:
If Asian Fusion was all like this, no one would ever be knocking it.  If you can, try to come here with at least a party of four so that you can sample more things because everything on the menu looks that good.

We had no reservation, the restaurant was packed so we were told it would be about a 45 minute wait.  Less than 10 minutes later a party of two is gone, they call the next name, that party isn't in front of the restaurant, the hostess was too lazy to call the name again so "BAM!" we got a table just like that.   Awesome.  This was the last stop on our one day whirlwind tour of San Francisco and we were hoping to finish it off right.

Pickled Cucumbers - Complementary, a palate cleanser.  Sweet, sour, vinegar, sesame seeds.

Deep Fried Salmon Roll with Chinese Hot Mustard - A must get.  Fresh, fatty glistening salmon wrapped in seaweed then wrapped in an egg roll skin and deep fried. It further tempts you with black roe on top. The Chinese mustard sauce is nose clearing, but a little sweet too, like they might have mixed some miso in.  Whatever it is, the combination is tongue orgasmic.  Comes with red cabbage slaw (that you should eat it with to get all the flavors).

Warm Wasabi Noodles with Angus Flat Iron Steak - The flavor of the steak was good, but it came out more pink and rare than the medium rare we ordered. It came with their signature red cabbage slaw and thick wasabi noodles.  The noodles are good, I could eat a whole plate of just that.  Sweet soy, but with wasabi kick.

Grilled Sea Bass with Garlic Ginger Soy (and Garlic Noodles) - This dish came with green beans and thick Garlic Noodles.  The sea bass was grilled just right, with a few char lines on the outside, was firm but tender and fresh with buttery juices that just melted away in my mouth.  Pretty much perfection.

Let's pause for the great noodle debate.  Garlic or Wasabi Noodles?  Both use the same thick noodles that sop up the juices of what they are cooked in so well.  The sea bass was better than the steak.  The wasabi noodles just barely edged out the garlic noodles as our favorite.  You cannot go wrong with either.  You can go wrong if you don't have some noodles in one of your dishes.

Lichee Black Iced Tea - This was the most plain thing that we ordered.  If it was infused, I didn't taste it.  I think it was simply black iced tea with a lychee dropped in it.  If you want iced tea, it's fine.  If you were expecting lychee sweetness, you'll barely taste that, if at all.

Coconut Creme Brulee with Passionfruit Puree - I love creme brulee.  I love coconut.  I almost creme brulee'd in my pants before the dessert came out.  It was so good.  So so good.  And it's a large portion for $7, enough for two people to share.  I would just come here for dessert all the time if I lived in the area.

The House is a small place.  It's nice, dimly lit but not fancy inside.  You'll question if this is romantic and intimate enough for a date, but once that first dish hits and that fork gets lifted, you'll know you won her heart.  What I loved was that each sauce had a purpose, with many layers to accentuate its dish.  You will be distracted by all the sexy dishes being served around you... that's a good thing as it'll help you expand your choices.   If you get flustered and overwhelmed, let your servers be your guide, as they are knowledgable about all the dishes, alert and efficient. Creative menu, lots of different elements combining to make an extraordinary meal.  So good!
author: Howie C.

description:
My date just recently graduated from SJSU and I wanted to surprise her with a nice dinner along with spending some quality time with each other, so I decided to choose this spot just because she was craving steak and I wanted pork chops. 

Although The House is a small restaurant, it still felt very cozy, modern atmosphere along with good food and service. We came here on Sunday around 7pm and it was pretty crowded by the time we arrived. We waited for about 5 minutes before being seated.

When it came to the appetizer, we ordered:
- Maine Crab Cake with pickled ginger remoulade
- Half dozen of their raw ousters with their special house sauce which was fabulous. 
Main Course:
- My date ordered the American Kobe Skirt Steak with porcini mushrooms and mash potatoes which came out great. I ordered their Kurobata Pork chops which turned out great, also we shared their Wassbi House Noodle with Angus Flatiron Steak.

With all the food I ordered, the bill came out to be around $140 after taxes. All of the food including the appetizer and main course was all good. Our waiter kept us in check and made sure everything was ok with our meal. I would definitely come back again and recommend this spot to anyone.
author: Danny L.

description:
My BF and I came on Valentine's Day where The House had a special V-Day menu. The restaurant was certainly booked full. The place is rather small, but the atmosphere was cozy and warm. Our waiter was very kind and efficient, even though it was busy.

We started with the Kobe Beef Lettuce Cups and the Salmon Rolls. We personally really liked the Kobe Beef Lettuce Cups - the different components worked well together, though it looked very difficult to eat at first, and made for a great appetizer. The fried Salmon Rolls were pretty good and unique as well.  Nicely presented.  

The sea bass was perhaps slightly overdone, but the dish's soy ginger flavor was pleasant and I enjoyed it.  Some other reviews say this is served with mashed potatoes (which I think I would have preferred), but this dish was served with udon noodles.  The green beans were nice and green, as well as slightly crunchy, which is good if you like that.  The wasabi noodles were served with ahi tuna on this menu.  These noodles were also prepared with udon noodles and the flavor just didn't pop or stand out, though it seemed well-done overall.  The ahi tuna was cooked right, but could have been seasoned more.  The protein just didn't seem cohesive with the rest of it. 

The dessert we got was the bittersweet chocolate bread pudding, which was probably the best of the night.  When I like a dessert that is not very sweet, that's saying something!  We thought it was delicious and would recommend it.

Overall, we didn't think The House quite lived up to all of the hype.  It was a good meal for sure, but for the price, it was a little underwhelming.  Would try somewhere else new over this place easily.  Maybe we should have ordered differently?
author: Rachel L.

description: Small place, always a long wait, but amazing food. Beef wasabi noodles are really good, even though I'm not a big fan of wasabi. If it wasn't for the long wait I'd be here more often
author: Jeana Y.

description:
Liked it! The Korean beef ribs were amazing.  So was the coconut creme brûlée. Could have done without the scallops (served with a very strong green that obliterated the flavor of the scallops) and the mango tapioca, which was tapioca with the consistency of bread pudding, served with an insufficient amount of a very nice mango purée on top. 

A bit on the pricey side. Two each of appetizers, entrees, desserts, and glasses of wine, for $150 plus tip. 

Super busy!! We had no problems because we had a reservation. But some parties waited 30 minutes for a table on a weekday night.
author: Paula H.

description: Absolutely love this place!!!! Drive 2hrs to come eat here, it's AMAZING!!! It's small and crowded with long wait but definitely worth it. Reservations highly recommended. The absolute BEST FOOD in SF!
author: Whitnie M.

description:
One of the best meals I've had in the city! Great sake selection. Come hungry, everything is delicious and you'll want it all! The starters were the best. Our favorite was the Grilled Unagi on Avocado Rice: a delicious piece of melt-in-your-mouth eel on top of avocado sushi rice. Highly recommend it! We also had the deep-fried salmon roll, which was absolutely delicious. We were already full at this point but the entrees were delicious as well. Dessert was mediocre, definitely could have done without it.

It's a small place so go at off hours or be prepared for a wait. We went at 9 PM on a rainy Saturday night so got seated instantly.
author: Julia M.

description: Nice and small place. I have tasted the best scallops ever. Try it. Great customer service. Parking is difficult. If you are lucky you can get a street parking or ensure you research the nearest public parking.
author: Mary M.

description:
My friend and I were lucky enough to get a reservation at 9:00 on a weeknight here and was definitely not disappointed.  We started off with the spicy miso clams, which were absolutely delicious and full of flavor.  The next course was the grilled garlic bass with wasabi noodles. It was already pretty good on it's own but we made it better by saving some of the spicy miso sauce from the clam dish and then drizzling it over the noodles.  It was culinary heaven and I highly recommend people trying that if they like spicy noodles.  The last dish was the amazing pork chop with pomegranate.  It was so soft and tender. It's definitely the best pork chop I've ever had.

Yes fellow Yelpers, I've been pretty much following your lead with those wonderful photos!
author: Nick A.

description:
If I could afford to eat at The House every day, I just might do so! Seriously, I wish this was the type of food found at my house. I need to up my cooking game.

From start to finish, I loved every bite. My date and I started off the night with seared scallops; the dish came out with three large scallops, perfectly cooked, and topped off with microgreens, all set around a little mound of tobiko. Our second appetizer, a grilled octopus and pork rind salad, was surprisingly delicious! I'm usually afraid of cephalopods being overly chewy or fishy-tasting, but if this were a blind taste-test, there's no way I would have guessed! 

Onto the main course: I ordered their infamous sea bass with soy ginger sauce. Having recently experienced some sub-par sea bass at another restaurant, I was a bit hesitant, but I would happily come back here EVERY WEEK just for this! The skin was perfectly crisped, and the fish and sauce went together perfectly! Honestly, the fish was so amazing by itself that I wouldn't have even noticed if there were no sides or sauce, and that's really how all fish should ever be cooked from now until the end of time. My date ordered the pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce, and ate every last bite! 

Now for the only two things that were so-so in my opinion: lychee iced tea and bittersweet chocolate truffle cake a la mode. While it was kinda cool to have a lychee in my tea, it would've been nicer to really taste it in there too. As for the truffle cake, it was plenty fine, I just didn't have that crazy desire to finish every last bite, especially with all the flavors of the coffee ice cream mixing with the coconut caramel sauce. Overall, AMAZING meal, and it's rare that I leave a restaurant as satisfied as this!
author: Christine L.

description:
Clap! Clap! Clap!

We wound up sitting next to a couple of rich, elderly ladies and couldn't help but to stare at their food.  The one with lots of bright red lipstick gave me the stink-eye! 
We could not locate what they were eating on the menu-- so we asked our server about it when she came to take our order.

She mentioned in a hushed tone that they were regulars and, this was a special order dish --"scallops and spicy, garlic noodles."
Who knew that The House had a secret menu?
We both ordered this dish --one with spicy noodles and one with mild noodles.

We added the white shrimp dumplings, (pot stickers) and the pork bbq ribs to start things off.  TsingTao was our beer of choice.

Everything was excellent ---but,  the garlic noodles and scallops were the BIG hit at the table.

Service was wonderful.  Get a reservation--even for lunch.
author: Thomas D.

description:
I inadvertently had lunch here once, many years back before the notoriety of Yelp and its reviews, and I remembered how I was pleasantly surprised with my meal.  

Fast forward to now, and I had a chance to revisit The House, but this time for dinner. The House offers Asian fusion fare. I am always a little bit hesitant when it comes to Asian fusion because I simply am not a fan of the marriage between these two types of cuisines. From my past experiences, the dishes always end up being a little too sweet, or all of the flavors are compromised to create a heap of confusion on a plate.

I think that the food at The House defines what Asian fusion should taste like. 

My dining companion and I ordered the best hits of the menu:

-deep fried salmon rolls: This appetizer is simply fatty salmon rolled up into a wonton type wrapper, deep fried and served with a hot Chinese mustard dipping sauce. The salmon is generous in portion and I really enjoyed the hot Chinese mustard. Gave the dish an extra level of flavor.

-warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak: the warm noodles had a tinge of wasabi so the flavor wasn't too overpowered. The paired well with the perfectly cooked, medium rare angus steak. Oh so good.

-grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy: This was definitely the best dish of the night, hands down. The garlic ginger soy really complemented the sea bass which speared into perfect, flakey morsels. This dish was divine.

The House is one of those San Francisco staples that everyone should try at least once. The menu may not rotate often, as with the growing trend in the restaurant scene, but what the menu does offer is refreshing. It's a nice step outside of the New American dining menus that San Franciscan restaurants heavily favor.
author: Trung N.

description: Love this hidden gem, tucked away in a side street. Everything we ordered was fresh, full of distinct and clean taste and presentation was beautiful. Mushroom Risotto was a little heavy but otherwise all was delicious. For what you get, price was fair. I've recommended this place to others and will be back. Surprisingly family friendly but would suggest for reasonably behaved children given its small and tables really close together
author: Grace C.

description: One of the best kept secrets in the city. Definitely, make a reservation before going. Everything on the menu is to die for. I've gone there for a few years and have never been disappointed. Highly recommend!!
author: Jon B.

description: Wow!! Love this place. The crunchy salmon roll was so good we had to order another. The sauce was like crack... gosh it was good. We ordered the rib eye steak and my daughters and husband said it was the best steak they've ever eaten. It was juicy, tender and had the perfect seasoning with an Asian touch. The roasted cauliflower that came with it was amazing. Wish they gave more of it. The sea bass was also very good. The garlic noodle that came with it was very tasty. Place was very small. Staff was friendly. We wanted to come back one more time before leaving SF but just didn't have the time. Definitely will be back.
author: Debbie T.

description:
Glad my husband and I got to visit here on a quick weekend trip to SF. We love seafood, scallops and octopus happen to be two of our favorite dishes, so when we saw those on the menu we decided to check it out.   

Appetizers: Scallops - AMAZING. Cooked to perfection, super silky. Can't recommend enough. The fried salmon rolls were also good, especially with the spicy mustard dipping sauce. The octopus was okay, seemed slighlt on the salty side to use. 

Main courses: Sea bass - like others have said, the sea bass is great. Ours was cooked perfectly and the sides were nice. We also tried the flank steak with the wasabi noodles. The wasabi noodles were delicious and were the highlight of this dish for me. The flank steak didn't have much flavor on it's own and lacked seasoning.
author: Stacie T.

description: Yellowtail special was amazing! Service was decent, but not always very attentive. We went during peak dinner hour and felt a little rushed to get out of our table. Otherwise, will definitely be going back.
author: Jennica R.

description: I've been here three times already and each time I leave more and more impressed! Their food is top quality and their prices are very reasonable. I recommend the pork chop and angus steak SUPERB! If you have a larger party I would definitely book one to two days ahead, DO NOT wait until last minute.
author: Jessie S.

description:
Made a 7pm reservation on a Monday and was seated right away. This place has been bookmarked for quite some time and my sister reminded me to try this place.

WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED.

We started with the hamachi appetizer and it was amazing!! The flavors were so great. I went for the cod special which was outstanding. Perfectly cooked. I ended with the house made cheesecake which just about made my life. I wanted to order another one...it was THAT good.  Not overly cheesy, it was fluffy, and the blueberry compote and cream it came with was just magical.

Don't miss this one!
author: Michelle K.

description: Delicious from the seafood apps to the dessert. Excellent and pleasant service as well. It's small and crowded, but not noisy and the food will make you forget all about that anywat. Be sure to make a res.
author: Susan B.

description:
Come here 1-2 times a year, and always get the same thing - the Sea Bass. Have brought many clients from across the US, and everyone loves this place.

This place is small and intimate.
author: Peter T.

description: Absolutely amazing food!!  Everything melts in your mouth! We had the sea bass, shrimp dumplings, angus beef, and octopus... all were fabulous!! I do recommend you make reservations. It's very popular in SF and the wait time could get long without a reservation. I will be going there again when I'm back in the bay!!
author: Candace H.

description: Great food and service. Best to get a reservation. The sea bass with garlic noodles is fantastic. I come here every time I visit.
author: Keith B.

description: A San Francisco-style fine dining experience. I came here to celebrate my birthday with a few friends, and overall we had a decent time. The place is tiny and cramped. You can literally eat the plate of your nextdoor neighbor if you would like. The service was very poor and rude. The woman didn't want to give us more than a couple minutes to decide on what to order. As for the food, it was all good, but nothing too amazing. The salmon rolls were good, but your standard salmon, just wrapped in a roll for uniqueness. The soft shell crab was very good and in a fun shape, but small in size. The seabass had a nice glaze to it. And the beef was very soft. Overall, the food was good, but I can not say they were worth the wait and price.
author: Nikita K.

description:
I don't really understand why this place is so popular. I would like to start by saying the service was poor, rude waitress who didn't check up on the table and didn't care. Also the food was not good, ordered the steak and was super bland. Also had salmon rolls and they were not appetizing. Bottom line, would not come here
again. Over priced and tasted bad.
author: Hiusan W.

description:
Omg amazing. As if you didn't already know that by seeing the number of reviews and 4.5 stars. (Although I HAVE been steered wrong with Bi-Rite and Brenda's ugh). Here's what I tried:

Pickled cucumbers: complimentary small plate - LOVED this! Sweet and sour and oh so refreshing! If you want more it's $3!

Scallops appetizer: special of the night. Comes with 3 and they're AMAZING. Great sear, taste, and sauce. Seems like they have this app often so it's def a MUST get!

Crab cake appetizer: this was good but my only caveat to you guys is that it didn't really taste like crab but more like mushiness. Tasty nonetheless. Came with a white wasabi-like sauce so be warned! 

Flat iron steak with wasabi noodles: steak was chewy and not too seasoned. Wasabi noodles alrite - wasabi taste wasn't too strong. Came with slicely thinned cucumbers, radishes, etc.

Seabass with garlic noodles and green beans: LOVED! Fish perfectly cooked and flaky, noodles amazingly flavorful, and beans delish! MUST GET THIS DISH!!

Notes:

1. Make reservations!!! If not you're probably going to wait 90 mins or more
2. TEENY tiny place. Not much standing room and the tables are super close together
3. Casual spot - no need to dress up!
4. Hope you're using taxi/uber because parking will be the biggest bitch ever! Very steep and hilly
author: Sheena P.

description:
This is officially one of my favorite restaurants in SF! The food is amazing and very high quality, and I have never been disappointed.

Small Dishes:
Grilled Octopus - The octopus is so good! I've had it multiple times, and it's very fresh each time. I also really like the (slightly spicy) sauce that serve on top.
Fried Salmon Roll - This is not like "sushi" roll but more like an eggroll with salmon inside. Very delicious, and the dip is very good too, with a very light hint of wasabi. 

Main Dishes:
Pork Chop - My favorite main dish. The pork is so tender and extremely well cooked. Flavor is perfect as well-- not too salty, which can be the case sometimes with pork chop. I really like the cranberry sauce it's served with and the mashed potatoes and the display is also super cute with the yam chips.
Wasabi Noodles with Skirt Steak - So good as well. The noodles are the thick Shanghai-type noodles, which I really like, and the flavor is great, with a little bit of spice!

The dishes might seem pricey but are totally worth it, especially with the huge portions! When my mom and I came here, we split two small dishes and a main dish, and when my boyfriend and I ordered a small dish and two main dishes, it was more than enough.

Service is great as well, attentive but not overly so. Definitely make reservations; the restaurant is small. I had tried to make reservations the night before, but they were booked completely up until 9pm. They open at 5:30, and we went in a 5:30, and we were able to get a table right away, but the restaurant was already almost filled then! 

This place is also great for a casual catch up or a nice occasion, great for dates too! :)
author: Tiffany J.

description: The food here is amazing, but when I came a few years ago, it was a much more relaxed experience compared to this weekend, and sadly it's not my favorite restaurant anymode. This time the tables were cramped, the lighting was super dim for a Saturday night, and I was asked 4 times in 7 minutes if I was ready to order my main course, 10 minutes after getting my appetizers. It was such an aggressive style of service that I felt uncomfortable eating at my own pace. 5 stars for the food, but 2 stars for the smothering service and din, sad ambiance.
author: Jenn H.

description:
Great spot for couple or a place to go on dating.
The food is just mouth watering and the place is relaxing. Great place to pass some time too and the food is really affordable.
I had a great experience here when me and my girlfriend went out to try this place out.
Will be coming back soon, I already told about this place to my relatives and they will surely check this out when they get a time. Keep up the delicious food. Try the sea bass Thanks for having us.
author: Jamaeca A.

description: The hype is real. Thank you Yelpers. We would not have tried this place without you. Salmon rolls, grilled scallops (special that night), grilled sea bass with garlic noodles and awesome greens, and garlic ribeye steak were ALL amazing. And we had to try dessert even though we ate too much already. I was afraid the food would all taste the same, but each had a slightly different flavor profile. Wow. This place was worth the cold walk in the rain from our hotel. Did I say we had 9pm reservations on a Saturday night? Worth it.
author: Stella L.

description:
My new favorite upscale restaurant in San Francisco. The staff was great to accommodate a walk in request and I was seated easily. They'll take your number and tell you when the table is ready. There were 3 of us and we shared a ton of food. I recommend these:

Appetizers, in order favorites:
- salmon roll
- kale salad
- mussels

Mains, in order of favorites:
- Cod
- Prime Rib
- Sea Bass

Deserts were all great as well.
author: Jared B.

description:
The food was spot on, fresh and special 
Every dish was unique and tasty.
Excellent service,
Order in advance
author: Amit S.

description:
Went to this restaurant based off of Yelp reviews: and it did not disappoint. Food was some of the best I have ever tasted. The service was extraordinary. 

The restaurant itself is very small and they don't have air conditioning. When we went tonight the temp outside was in the 80s and it felt the same temp or hotter in the restaurant. However, the food and service made the temperature bearable. 

My only suggestion to them is to invest in a few ceiling fans to move air around on the hot days. 

Definitely don't miss this place while in Chinatown or San Fran.
author: Jamie N.

description:
It's always a pleasure eating here, definitely on of my favorite restaurants of all time, the quality taste and texture is always on point! The process are reasonable as well!

Salmon rolls
- crispy enroll on the outside and half cooked salmon on the inside, the best of both worlds! And on top of that the mustard sauce it comes with is just the best condiment on the face of the planet!! It's like a yellow wasabi soy sauce with added spices and it's absolutely delicious

Wasabi noodles with steak
- super flavor packed noodles with perfectly cooked steak seared on the outside with butter, this is always a must get at every visit! This is my favorite entree

Sea bass
- no it's not that super flakey huge Chilean one that you think about in the fancy Chinese restaurants, it's actually small and small-fish-like in terms of texture but it's certainly buttery!! It's a solid dish as well

Ribs over an Asian slaw (special)
- fall off the bone perfectly cooked rack of 5! Even Phil's BBQ could not have done better! Superb quality without being dripping wet in sauce.  Fall off the bone and flavor soaked through to the bone as well

Cheesecake with strawberry (special) 
- omg so soft and light with a touch of sweetness! Is swimming in some awesome leche cream and fruit sauce which was so addicting. It can be eaten by 1 person.  It's that light and that good

Brownie a la mode
- always a winner and a crowd pleaser, it does get thick so please share between 2 people at minimum

This is a restaurant with trying, worth returning to, and just amazing.  After coming here 7 times, I'm still not tired of it! 

Tip: call in reservations a week in advance or prepare to wait or not eat
author: Tina A.

description: Such fabulous food and great service! Made reservations here a few days ago because of all the good reviews. Wowwww! Like everyone else, we started with the salmon rolls which were so crispy on outside yet tender inside and the mustard sauce was yummy. Then we shared the miso cod special which was incredible! Our server Jun was witty and attentive. All the employees were kind and helpful. One of the best dining experiences ever!
author: Keri L.

description:
This place absolutely lives up to the hype.

GET THE SEA BASS. PERIOD.

Also, my family tried the scallop appetizer (amazing!) and the kale salad was another highlight (who would've thought?).
author: Justin H.

description: The sea bass noodle is really good! I like the source, the chewy noodle and the way they cook the fish! Other dishes are also good and creative. Sea bass is my favorite! They also put effort on service and even the logo on the paper which made me feels very welcomed. I had a good experience.
author: Nan T.

description: The House has good food and great service.  First place I think of when hosting friends and family gathering.
author: Jimson Z.

description: At the end of the day, most restaurants I visit (after doing some research) end up being "good" but not memorable. The House however stood out head and shoulders above the rest both times I visited. Food, atmosphere and excellent service especially the second time (don't remember the gentleman's name unfortunately). My visiting friends from France were impressed. I'll be back soon.
author: Alexis R.

description: Came here for my daughters birthday. Every dish we had was so good! I would definitely return. A bit pricey, but I think it's worth it.  Would've gave 5 stars but the service was a disappointment.  Restaurant is not that large so food came in a reasonable amount of time. Waitress however, was less than friendly and the guy that refilled our glasses of water must have been tired cuz he'd continue pouring  as he was pulling the pitcher away spilling water onto our table.
author: Betty H.

description:
Peter Buffett once said, "It didn't matter how big our house was; it mattered that there was love in it." And for me, love comes in the form of food. And at The House, there was A LOT of love!

More than a handful of my friends have raved about The House, so when Gary H.'s birthday rolled around, instead of picking the typical HOPR or Alexander's, I made reservations at The House. It is a small-ish restaurant, so reservations are highly recommended. 

- Hamachi sashimi with an avocado topping (appetizer special): five pieces of fresh fish. Sigh, I am in love! The avocado/sauce they had on top was refreshing too.
- Kurobura Pork Chop with Pomegrante Currant Sauce: I don't normally eat pork chops, but wowza! The pork was juicy and had a great contrasting taste to the sweet sauce it was laying in.
- Steak on a bed of cauliflower and mash potatoes (entree special): pretty big portions and cooked perfectly. What was surprising was the cauliflowers were out of this world. Who knew veggies could taste so good? ;)

By the time we devoured all the meat (Sorry, pig! Sorry, cow!), we were too stuffed to get dessert. Biggest regret EVER! I should've followed my there's-always-room-for-dessert rule... But I'll definitely be back for that creme brûlée.
author: Christine S.

description:
The Seabass with soy ginger noodles and Flatiron steak with wasabi noodles were heavenly!!!!

The place is small but food is top notch. Better do a reservation because this place is always full.
author: Ash M.

description:
This was meant to be a nice birthday dinner with a few good friends. But by the end of the night, we all left frustrated and unsatisfied with our evening. Let me present you with the good, the bad, and the ugly.

THE GOOD: They were able to add two additional people to our reservation the night before. We were all very satisfied with the food (the sea bass was very fresh and the garlic noodles were well flavored). The staff was attentive with refilling our water. 

THE BAD: We had two people that were running late, but the server kept coming back and asking if we were ready to order, when we were clearly still waiting for the rest of our party. Once one more person came in, the waiter came quickly over to take our order, not even giving the chance for that person to look over the menu. We brought in our own birthday cake and candles and asked for a lighter. Sounding very rushed, the waiter asked if we were okay with the cake fee without mentioning the cost of the fee. I didn't think a cake fee can be too bad, so I said okay. However, when we got the bill, the fee came out to be $18. WHAT. $18 for them to cut and serve a tiny cake is absolutely ridiculous! 

THE UGLY: With that said, we reduced our tip because we felt the service was subpar and it absolutely should not cost $18 to serve a cake that I purchased myself. The waiter came back out with the bill and had the audacity to say "Do you have something you want to say to me? It is customary to tip." EXCUSE ME?! We never said we were not going to tip, and I have never experienced a waiter asking for their tip. That is the exact reason why we felt like their service is unacceptable. The waiter was cold and extremely rude, making us feel very unwelcome. I am appalled by how unprofessional this waiter was.

Overall, this waiter has damper the evening for all of us, especially as this was suppose to be a birthday celebration. I wish I can say I'd recommend this place for the food, but with honestly shitty service from this waiter, along with a ridiculous charge for birthday cake fee, I will not be going back.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
As one of the most reviewed restaurants in the city, The House had a lot to live up to. Although my meal was great, my socks stayed snuggly on my feet. Too much hype unfortunately. 

They start you off with some sweet & sour pickles as you look over the menu. Quite refreshing.

Deep Fried Salmon Rolls: I recommend these bad boys. The rolls are fried to golden perfection, but the salmon is still tender. The Chinese mustard sauce really packs a punch too. Use sparingly if you're not big wasabi.

Grilled Sea Bass: The restaurant is most known for this dish so I had to order it. You can choose between rice or garlic noodles. While I don't know why anyone would choose plain white rice, the garlic noodles were disappointing. The sea bass was cooked perfectly and went well with the garlic ginger soy. Overall this dish was good but nothing to write home about really.

Warm Wasabi House Noodles with Angus Flatiron Steak: I didn't taste much wasabi flavor. The steak was tender and grilled to perfection though.

Pomegranate Pork Chop: Easily my favorite entree of the 3. The pomegranate sauce was tangy and delicious. The pork chop was moist and perfectly cooked. The buttery mashed potatoes soaked up the sauce as well as the flavor from the meat. Divine.

Japanese Pumpkin Pie: SHOWSTOPPER. This isn't on the menu but it's currently a special so make sure you order it. Who would've known that the best pumpkin pie I've ever had would be from an Asian Fusion restaurant? I would come back to order this alone.

Make sure you call in to make reservations bc this place is tiny and famous, an unfortunate combo. Will be back for the pork chop & the pie!
author: Lucy N.

description: The last I was at The House was to celebrate my divorce. I wasn't feeling that well but my sister insisted so I gave up and the two of us choose this restaurant for the special event. We shared their grilled octopus with tempura potatoes and the pork chop as main courses, and for dessert we got the pana cotta. I really enjoyed their grilled octopus, as I have had very chewy octopus meat before but here at The House, it was done to perfection. It was mouth-wateringly good and beyond any of the dishes I had here. The pork chop was also good, I just wish that it came with more of the pomegranate sauce it was garnished with, as the meat was a little tough. The dessert was fine although it wasn't as good as the main courses. We had a good time and we'll definitely be coming back. If you decided to try this place out then make sure to make a reservation, especially on their busy days to avoid long waits.
author: Juliet L.

description: Small Chinese restaurant great location super busy so be ready to maybe wait outside  awesome Chinese food we ordered dumplings, Sear scallops, noodle steak great flavor.
author: Mercedes S.

description:
I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT.
I've been here 3 times now and each visit, the food is impeccable and the service is on point! 

My favorites:
Green beans and deep fried salmon rolls
Seabass with wasabi noodles
Kurobuta porkchop
Soft shell crab appetizer (Seasonal?)

Price-wise, a dinner for two with appetizers and wine is about $100-$120 but well worth. 

Make sure to make a reservation or come early because this place is tiny and fills up fast!
author: Shana N.

description:
Went here with the family to grab a bite to eat in the city on a Monday night. Since it was Xmas week, the place was bustling, but we were able to be seated within 10 minutes because we had made a reservation on Open Table.

First off, the place is quite small. In fact, when we arrived we had to crowd into the corner of the space just to be able to close the door to the entrance. Following that trend, the four of us were seated at a small table that was placed between a couple of larger tables, which made for a compact dining experience.

We had eaten not too long before this meal so we decided to get some appetizers and main plates to share family-style.

Salmon rolls (3 stars): Though these were raved about online, I found myself to be slightly underwhelmed. They were cooked perfectly, but I thought that the salmon was a little more fishy-tasting than I prefer.

St. Louis BBQ ribs (4 stars): This was about a half rack and came with a sweet chili BBQ sauce. There was plenty of meat to go around, you just had to eat around the bone and gristle. This dish could have definitely been a little more tender, but it was decent enough for an appetizer. I have to highlight the slaw from this dish as it was one of the tastiest I've ever had--a great level of spice, paired with the coolness of the avocado, delicious.

Tempura Blue lake beans (5 stars): Yum! I love tempura anything and these beans were no exception. They were quite thick, which provided a nice contrast to the tempura batter. This dish was also a good portion size, especially for the price.

Black cod (4 stars): This dish was cooked well as the fish had nice flavor. The sauce it was served with was a crowd favorite and the veggies were good as well.

Wasabi noodles with flat iron steak (4 stars): The noodles were tasty, as was the meat, but I found the meat to be a little tougher than I was anticipating. Nevertheless, the flavors were there and the two worked well together. 

Sea bass (5 stars): Wow--just wow. This dish had quite a lot of praise on Yelp and rightfully so. I am a huge fan of all types of fish, but this definitely had to be one of the best fish dishes I have ever had. The portion size was good and the fish was cooked absolutely flawlessly--so flaky and flavorful, yet there was still a nice crust from the pan sear. It was great by itself, but even better in a little bit of the soy sauce they provided. Though the fish was the star, the garlic noodles were also out of this world. If I hadn't had the fish, I would have been happy with just these noodles--that's how good they are.

You might be a little perplexed by the 5 star rating, especially when adding up all of the individual items--and that should show you just how special that sea bass dish is. Yes, this place is tiny but the flavors are big. The main dishes may be a bit expensive, but they are worth the price tag. In addition, our waitress and the wait staff overall was very attentive and friendly. Definitely check this place out if you are looking to grab a bite to eat around the area, you won't be disappointed.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Excellent food and great service!

Make sure to make a reservation or else you'll be waiting for awhile. The restaurant itself is very small so getting a table is quite difficult. Due to the small space, prepare to be seated very close to the table next to you. 

Service:
The service was great! Considering the quick turnover of the tables, I watched closely how efficient they were. The wait staff worked well together to get people seated as soon as a table opened up. We were sat down right when it was our reservation time. We were served water right away and another person came up to tell us the specials of the day. Somebody always checked up on us throughout our entire meal. That's what makes for great service!

Food:
We ordered the scallops which were part of the daily special menu. Soooooo good! I'm glad we went this because it was cooked just perfectly! You get 3 medium sized scallops.... The micro greens that topped it and the light sauce that was drizzled over it and tobiko made this dish very flavorful!!! Loved this dish for sure!

I ordered the sea bass with garlic noodles. DELICIOUS DELICIOUS DELICIOUS! The sea bass was flavorful and not overwhelming... the portion was very generous too. Now although the garlic noodles lacked the garlic aspect of it, it was YUMMY! I would order the garlic noodles by itself if it came as an entrée. Both the fish and the noodles complemented each other well. You have the option to get rice instead of the noodles, but I would definitely recommend the noodles. This dish also comes with green beans and it was also very good. 

My friend ordered the ribeye steak, touch over rare. This came with mashed potatoes and charred broccoli. It was an excellent choice and cooked accordingly. I was impressed at how perfectly cooked this was. We do wish we ordered the porkchop instead but the ribeye was amazing nonetheless.

Probably our least favorite was the dessert portion of our meal. The coconut crème brulee with the passionfruit sauce just didn't excite us. The brulee itself was great, but we were not a fan of the passionfruit for sure. It didn't complement the brulee and was overpowering. We ended up scraping it off and made the best of it. 

Minus the minor things, this place is amazing overall! I can't wait to be back and try their other menu items. I'm already planning to try the salmon roll appetizer, unagi and porkchop!!!
author: Jasmine B.

description:
The food here was quite tasty; what was disappointing was the service.  There are plenty of good restaurants in the city; I will probably choose to go elsewhere rather than coming back here because the shit service left such a bad taste in my mouth.

FOOD
The garlic noodles are delicious!  They come as a side with the sea bass (good) and my BF ordered them instead of mashed taters with his steak (he enjoyed his steak).  To start, we had the shrimp dumplings which were tasty and the fried salmon roll thing (which neither of us loved but seems to be highly rated on here so do you).

We finished with the creme brulee which was fantastic.

SERVICE
We had a 9:00 p.m. reservation that my BF had made 5 or so days in advance.  No one called to confirm the reservation, but he didn't think much of it.  We showed up only to be told that there was no reservation in our name... The hostess, who was pretty gruff, didn't apologize or seem to care.  She just told us that she would put our name on the list.

I thought this was pretty bad -- the very least you can do is apologize and offer us a drink or something while we wait (since it was clear she did not plan on honoring our reservation).

Our waters were constantly refilled which was great but our waitress was pretty cold.  She also was looking away when we ordering, and then asked us to repeat our order not once but twice.
author: Ashlee C.

description: The place is heavy on seafood. Not vegetarian friendly. The sea bass with noodles was yummy. The halibut in light creamy sauce was crying out for flavors - some chili flakes or a squeeze of lemon would have fixed it. The scallops Caesar salad was good, not sure of it was worth $13 though. The mango pudding was AWESOME! Portion sizes are about right. Service was just ok. I understand they are a busy place, but servers can be a little more friendly.
author: Sharanya A.

description:
Dear House,

What a delightful little place you are.

I was worried, as everyone here said the wait will be long... I thought we might have to wait for an hour to check you out, but figured we could roam the neighborhood..

I confess, we went actually to your place on a whim. We happened to park at a nearby parking structure because it is the cheapest parking structure in the area. (north parking something). We wanted to get some lunch so we hopped on yelp and BAM there you were. Oh my House! You were so close! I've wanted to try you out and you were right there! Lucky me.

Though it was around 11-11:30 at the time, I was still a bit worried of the wait because hey it was a saturday but figured it can't help to hurt to see how long the wait is...

BOOYAH. You were so empty, I actually thought you might have been closed! We walked in around 11:30 only to find one other group there and tons of empty seats! W00T!

Maybe I shouldn't tell people this but... forget what others say, just go right when they open. Perhaps it is packed at night, but it sure wasn't then. Instant access to yum.

So I just did the yelp thing, ordered stuff people recommended, ordered pictures that demanded me to eat it. Then took pictures that IMHO was so much awesomer. 

Salmon roll - Good (7 out of 10)
Wasabi Noodles - Gooder (8 out of 10)
Pomegranate Pork Chop - Goodest (9 out of 10)

Yea your food was pretty good. Yea it was worth the impromptu visit. Especially without the wait.
I liked you. pretty small place, quite quaint. 

But just look at my pictures - speaks better than my words.

thanks
author: Paul L.

description: I ordered the salmon roll and octopus. Both were pretty good. The hot mustard sauce was a star and complemented the salmon roll very well. The octopus meat was nicely prepared. And the dish came with a very small portion of fried potatoes which I enjoyed. No complaints there. However, the seats we had right by the entrance weren't that great (the restaurant was so tiny) and I felt rushed to leave.
author: m y.

description:
We've been here a few times now. The food is always great, the service is so-so.
Last night, we did a walk-in and were hanging out at a bar nearby for waiting for the text message. Walked over right away when I received the text message and were completely ignored by the servers or the wait-staff (they don't have dedicated host). Eventually, they told us there was a minor mistake but it'll only be a few more minutes. We ended up standing and waiting for a table for *40 more minutes* (and there isn't much room to stand since the restaurant is pretty cozy).
There was no apology from the wait-staff or even  an acknowledgement of what just happened. Definitely put a damper on the mood and the experience.

As for the food, we got the soup special, mushroom rice, sea bass, and the prime rib. The shiitake soup was amazing, the mushroom was great too. The prime rib was a very fatty cut and I ended up cutting out most of the un-rendered fat (If I had to order it again, I'd probably get it medium instead of medium-rare, considering the meat itself wasn't absolutely stellar). The sea bass tasted good but nothing to write home about.

All in all -- decent food, shoddy service.
author: Nick M.

description:
Make a reservation! This was the most fabulous food. 

The sea bass was delicious! The warm wasabi house noodles with flatiron steak is not to be missed! Wish we had this restaurant in Chicago. 

Service was fantastic and the host recommended some great bars to try too!
author: Samantha E.

description: Haven't been back in a while, but was my favorite restaurant in SF when I first visited. The pork chop is amazing.
author: Evelyn L.

description:
This place is so darn good, the location not so much.

It's located in that sketch area between North Beach x Chinatown. It's next door to an adult shop. It literally looks like a hole, in the wall (from the outside). Inside, it's small, with clean/modern decor. Dinnertime, there's always a line out the door...

But the food is soooooo worth it. Especially if you like fish, the miso soy glazed salmon and the sea bass are to die for. Perfectly cooked fish paired with a starch and veggies. The price point is also extremely reasonable, hence why there is always a line out the door here.

The chefs know how to pair food here with perfect complements and juxtapositions. Be prepared for foodie flavors without the anorexic portions ;)

Make reservations or come right when they open. It is definitely #worthit.

PS. I don't recommend large parties as this place is SMALL and POPULAR!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
LOVE this place! 4.5 stars.

Asian fusion at its best. 

This place is always packed. We had a reservation for a friend's birthday. With a group of about 8 people, we decided to share meals family style with both vegetarian and meat dishes.

The execution is fantastic and the presentation is lovely, such a site to see. I can't really do this place justice by telling you more you'll have to try it (and love it) yourself.

I love that each placemat has a small cut out of a house, so cute and a great touch.

Parking is sparse.
author: Shereen A.

description:
My favorite restaurant here in SF. My friend brought me here a few years ago and recommended I order the sea bass. At that time I never tried sea bass before, but after having it here I was hooked. I haven't found any other restaurant that serves it as moist and flavorful as The House. Paired with garlic noodles, you have one crazy delicious dinner.

After I moved up to SF, I took my family here and they loved every dish they ordered. For the size of the restaurant (pretty small) it's usually easy to score a reservation. Definitely a must try if you're here in the city.
author: Elissa S.

description: Relatively original dishes and the black cod was great, only drawback were the copious amounts of sauce and mayonnaise-equivalent for our dishes which left an overly heavy aftertaste. Presentation was very good though. Would go again.
author: Rod F.

description:
Heard The House had a lot of great Asian Fusion dishes to try, so I came here with three friends for dinner on a weekend.

We ordered a few things to share. Food was amazing though on the pricey side. Some highlights:
- Deep fried salmon roll: superb - tender salmon in an crispy roll
- Scallops: seared perfectly, very tasty and juicy.
- Sea bass: very tender and flavorful, melts in your mouth
- Wasabi noodles: had a good wasabi kick that isn't overly powerful

The place is small and cramped.
Do try to make a reservation before going!
author: Alvin W.

description: Good food overall BUT 1) too much garlic; 2) too noisy; 3) too crowded; 4) too rushed; 5) sake glasses small and expensive.  Steak and noodle dish was not good--meat flavorless and chewy.  Overall not a relaxed atmosphere and not worthy of 4.5 stars. I suggest they add rugs/carpets to reduce noise and reduce tables per square foot so you aren't on top of each other.
author: Eric W.

description:
So good! Best meal we had in SF - hands down! Everything was delicious. The grilled octopus was definitely my favorite but everything else from the scallops, salmon rolls, shrimp wasabi noodles, and seafood risotto was all very good!

After a few days of hits and misses in the city, our dinner here was very pleasing because for the first time in all the meals we had in SF, every single item we ordered tasted good! 

Will definitely come back here if I visit SF again!
author: C L.

description:
Okay, so I had been here about 2 years ago and didn't drop in a review, so today for lunch a co-worker suggested we go here, man it was really good. I remembered their Sea Bass was amazing, not a cheap lunch choice for $27 bucks, but it was frankly one of the best pieces of fish I have had  in restaurant. I had been to place in Los Altos the night before for Salmon that I gave a 3 Star review, this was just the opposite.  I can say that the other items people had looked great, I remembered those pot stickers/dumplings from my previous visit. It came with some noodles that I was told and assured by my wife that were amazing, but I am on a low carb to drop some LB's so I didn't taste them. But the green beans on the side were delicious.

Highly recommend, but it is spendy for lunch.
author: Jeff L.

description: Looking for a good dinner our first night in the city and found this on YELP. Food was excellent. Recommend the Deep Fried Salmon  Role and the the BBQ Ribs!!! For the Main course we had the Sea Bass and the Garlic noodles, very very good. Also had the Pork Chop which we liked a lot. Would have given them 5 stars based just on the food, but the restaurant is a little crowded and run down, no atmosphere. But, if your just looking for great food this place is worth the visit. A little on the pricy side considering the interior decor.
author: Jim M.

description: I would leave 0 star if there's that option. We were told tonight special Kobe beef dish was $38 but it was $48 when we paid. They didn't apologize for the mistake but made it seem like it was our mistake
author: Lucia L.

description:
I think I found my new favorite restaurant! This place is right next to my office and might just be the find of the year ;). 

The restaurant is small but the food that comes out is so amazing. I could see it being such a fun place to bring a small group of close friends for dinner or even lunch. It's quiet and quaint and the decor is not super posh or swanky which I appreciate because when the food comes out you're just blown away by how a cute little kitchen could make such bomb food. All the small plates are delicious and feed about four people. Can't wait to take more friends here. 

We got : salmon egg rolls, baked oysters, clam special, unagi sandwich, sea bass. 


To get again: 
Salmon egg rolls 
Clam special 
Saw a lot of people with a salad entire that looked good 
Also want to try garlic noodles
author: Kristin C.

description:
SF-ers sure seem spoiled in the Asian/Asian fusion department.  Wanted to treat my friend to dinner on my last night in SF as a last hurrah.  After a bit of research, this spot seemed like it would leave us both happy.  

Reservations would probably be useful as the space is small and was crowded (not surprising on a Saturday night). The decor was tasteful. The staff clearly take their food seriously and are proud of what they offer.  

To start, we ordered the sashimi sampler (a special at the time).  The selection of fish was high quality and perfect for sharing.  I went with the sea bass as my entree. It was served a little blackened on the outside and tender on the inside. A ginger and garlic soy sauce accompanied the dish and complemented the fish boldly. This was served along side a saucy but delicious udon noodle preparation.  I can't recall the name of my beer, but it was a Japanese IPA that went down smoothly.  The dessert offerings were straightforward.  We decided on the apple pie with vanilla ice cream. No surprises, but delicious nonetheless.  

Overall, an excellent last meal in SF and deserving of the praise.
author: Joe J.

description: This place is so yummy! Haven't tried anything I don't like. Started with Manila Clams, scallops and ribs. Main course was sea bass and house special cod. You need to make reservations though. I will definitely be eating here again
author: Sherrie F.

description: GET RESERVATIONS!!!  Cool social atmosphere and great cuisine!  My Wife and I love it!
author: Jon B.

description:
Love this place for the quality, taste and presentation of their dishes! 

- Deep Fried Salmon Rolls: Cooked PERFECTLY - salmon was moist, a little underdone with an overall crunch and crisp from the batter
- Seared Scallops: A delicious delicate appetizer, paired wonderfully with all the textures, sauces and spices!
- Grilled Sea Bass: Served with garlic noodles and string beans. Sea bass was cooked well, but I've had more tender and moist sea bass elsewhere. Garlic noodles and string beans were very flavorful... if I were to tweak it I would have liked it cooked being a little less salty. The saltiness can be overpowering, especially when this dish is served with a little tub of garlic ginger soy. Overall, still a delicious dish. 
- Kurobuta Pork Chop: Probably one of the best pork chops I've tried. The sweetness from the pomegranate currant reduction contrasts well with the saltiness of the other sauces. It's cooked extremely moist and tender too!
- Masami Rib Eye: Love the Asian flavors in this! This dish is made with their house made teriyaki and toasted garlic butter! Cooked medium rare, this was completely phenomenal! Tender and super flavorful!!

Service is great. Tables can be situated a few inches from each other which is annoying, but the food here makes up for it!!
author: Kris C.

description:
The Best Japanese Beer I've Ever Had.

Hitachino nestbier, ginger, Japan $9.  I drink a lot of beer.  No, I don't think you understand, I drink a lot of beer.  My beer belly is so fat that even Dora can't explore it.  Seriously though, my beer belly is so big we took a family photo last Christmas and the photo is still printing.  This Hitachino Nest Ginger Brew is brewed with raw ginger! That means you can drink this and at the same time be curing your motion sickness.  It's a much more full bodied beer with hints of spiciness flavors that make an amazing pairing with Asian dishes.  If you like Belgian Beers or more full German beers, line up for this one.

Kurobuta Pork Chop with pomegranate currant sauce

What's Kurobuta? Is that a place? Is it a verb? A noun? An adjective? Whatever it is, I feel like I should know it now because it's the best pork chop I've ever had.  Think about the last pork chop you had, I bet you the slab of pork didn't literally jiggle from the softness of the meat as you passed it around the table.  I bet you it didn't slice thru like a hot knife to ice cream.  I bet you as you chewed it, it didn't remind you of filet mignon.  I bet you didn't...well...you get the point.  It was freakin' delicious.  Worth the 400 mile drive to SF.  While you're at it try the Grilled Seabass, Miso cod, signature salmon roll, and ahi tuna tartare.

What do you call a Kurobuta pig that does karate? Porkchop!
author: Alex P.

description:
Visited this place with my coworkers -- because of all the hype!  It was pretty good.  It's a small and very popular place, so definitely make reservations or you probably won't get in...

I recommend the ahi tuna tartare w/ nori chips (which is an appetizer), it was probably my favorite dish there -- absolutely delicious, and I'm not even a big tuna person.  We also got the scallops appetizer which was delicious as well.  I will say I was a bit disappointed with my entree -- I got the ribeye and honestly it was really dry, which was even more frustrating because it was the most expensive menu item.  I ended up using the sauce my coworkers got with their fish, and it was much better.

Overall definitely worth a taste, lovely food with beautiful presentation -- very intimate setting.
author: Michelle S.

description: Love the wasabi noodle here also the sea bass is super tender, one of the best I've ever had! Definitely recommend making reservations if you don't want to wait.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Our favorite dining experience in San Francisco! 

The House deserves a Michelin Star! Why do I say this? Because my friends and I went to State Bird Provision the night before heading to The House. We waited over 2 hours to get seats and was underwhelmed by the food at this well known Michelin Star restaurant. Then we went to The House and it exceeded all expectations!

We got a couple appetizers and 2 entrees to share for 3 people. Everything was outstanding and service was on point.

1. Sashimi Special - 2 pieces each Salmon belly, blue fin tuna, and yellowtail hamachi - Every piece was thick and melts in your mouth. So fresh and only $17, we should've ordered 2! 

2. Grilled Unagi with Avocado Sushi Rice - The unagi was really fresh. The dish was flavorful from the unagi and creamy from the avocado sushi rice. This was my boyfriends favorite dish.

3. Salmon Egg Roll - I'm usually not a fan of deep fried rolls since I like raw fish, but the salmon was cooked to a medium rare temperature. The egg roll wrapper was light a flaky. Not to mention they serve this dish with nice hot Chinese mustard. Yums!

4. Kobe Beef Short Ribs with Truffle and Mashed Potatoes Special - The holy of all grail! So yums! This was on their nightly special and it was spectacular! The kobe beef was sliced into thin pieces at medium rare temperature. On top of that, they had a truffle oil sauce that made the whole dish heavenly.

5. Grilled Sea Bass and Garlic Noodles - This was our least favorite dish, still yummy but more on that salty side. The portions are very generous though. Our piece of sea bass was pretty thick. Can't go wrong with that.
author: Trang L.

description:
Everything was phenomenal from appetizers to dinner.

Appetizers
Scallops- amazing
Unagi with rice- the sauce was so good
Grilled octopus 
Deep fried salmon roll

Dinner
Seared ahi tuna
Grilled Seabass - get this if it's the last thing you do!
Wasabi noodles and sirloin

Service wasn't incredibly friendly but the food surely made up for it!
author: Isabella L.

description:
We came here to have a catch up dinner date w/ my old friends attending UCSF pharmacy school. They recommended this place or chez maman and we decided to try The House because it seemed unique w/ the asian fusion flavors. The don't take reservations and won't seat you unless your whole party is there (hate when restaurants do this).

The restaurant is really small, but that seems to be the norm since SF is limited in space. Our server was really nice and she gave us ample time to decide what to order.

Appetizers:

Deep fried chicken liver w/ baby greens - we started off w/ this and I'm not too much of a chicken liver or chicken heart person, but everyone else at the table seemed to like it.

Softshell crab - The soft shell crab looked so awesome! The batter on it was nice and crunchy, not oily at all. I liked the noodles that accompanied the appetizer

Entrees:

Halibut w/ coconut creme sauce & mussels - O..M..G.. BEST Entree here hands down!! Halibut was grilled to perfection, very flaky and soft. The coconut creme sauce added richness to the dish as well w/out overpowering the fish.

Sea bass w/ green beans and udon noodles in ginger soy - For some reason, the halibut was more tender than the sea bass. 

Angus Flat Iron Ribeye steak - cooked to medium rare and was a good sized portion of steak. Some parts of the steak were a bit dry, but not bad for the price. Had a nice terriyaki glaze to it

Kurobuta Pork Chop - Many reviewers mentioned how good the pork chop was so I ordered this. IMO, it was a very dry pork chop! Instead of mashed potatoes, I substituted it w/ veggies. It was a very nice and big pork chop & the sauce was tangy/sweet, but the meat was just too dry. The best pork chop I've had still goes out to The Ranch in Anaheim (OC).

The menu is unique here, but tastewise it wasn't anything special. Stick w/ the halibut and softshell crab here!
author: Tracie L.

description:
Probably one of my favorite restaurants in SF. The menu changes, but if I had to recommend one thing and one thing only it would for sure be the sea bass and garlic noodles!!!!! THEY'RE LIFE. CHANGING. I always thought I thought garlic noodles were just okay, and maybe I still do, but the garlic noodles at The House are so good! and the sea bass! I don't usually choose (cooked) fish entrees either. Luckily one of my friends ordered it the first time I went because I probably never would've ordered this dish lol but now my eyes have been opened. I've actually been here a couple times and everything else I've ever had here has always been really good too so don't be afraid to try other things, as long as you also get at least one order of the sea bass and garlic noodles.

It isn't a *cheap* place to eat, but the quantity and quality of the food makes it worth it. This isn't one of those $$$-$$$$ places where you'll leave and pick up some mcd's on the way home lol. Oh, and make a ressie if you can or be prepared to wait.
author: Terra C.

description: I've been here a number of times for lunch and this was my first time for dinner. And it didn't disappoint!  Great food and friendly staff. Good sake. Shared 4 small plates between the two of us and we're stuffed. The tempura soft shell crab was awesome!
author: James S.

description:
Great experience. Great service. Phenomenal food. 

We had the Porkchops and the Steak Wasabi Noodles. Everything was perfect. I just only wished they served more sauce with the Porkchop because THAT was orgasmic.

This place is busy, like super busy. You can't really expect to be seated without a reservation. There was a line of people out the door... all with reservations. Make sure to let the hostess know who you are and when is your reservation the second you get there. If there's a mix-up, you can be sure someone is going to steal your reservation. Yep. The food is that good.
author: Devin H.

description:
Fails to impress.

Ordered the fried salmon egg roll thing to start.  I wasn't expecting much, and my intuition was correct. The salmon was good but the roll itself wasn't so memorable. And 2 rolls for $11 wtf.

I sprung for the kurobuta pork chop with pomegranate sauce ($25). This was actually good. The fat from the pork went well with the sweet pomegranate sauce and spicy orange sauce.

Service is lacking.  I came in during Friday lunch and there was only one server. She couldn't remember all of the specials. She tried to take my plate away even though I was just taking a break. She forgot to swipe my card even though I gave it to her 15 mins prior.

The dishes are not authentic. Skip this place; you're not missing anything.
author: Stephanie N.

description:
My friend and I came here to check out what the hype is all about. 

Well, it lived up to it. 

We went to town at The House! We got the Sampler Sashimi, Salmon Roll, Octopus appetizer, Sea Bass Dish, Side of noodles to go with it, Chocolate Cake, Creme Brûlée.  #foodcoma #foodbaby #foodhappiness

These are mainly the highly recommend dishes here, and they all lived up to their name. My favorite out of all of them? The Sampler Sashimi which has fresh catches of the day in it (major bonus), and the Sea Bass Dish with the infamous noodles on the side. 

The place is small and quaint, the service is good. I felt at ease while I ate, drank and caught up with my friend. Those are things that truly make up dining experience on top of this food; and make this foodie, like every other foodie really happy. 

I will certainly be back one day, and in the meantime, you should definitely give this place a try. You will leave happy and content:)
author: Sonia A.

description:
Came here with a coworker for dinner on a Sunday night. This place is tiny so definitely call ahead to get reservations since I'm not sure how long one would have to wait. As my friend and I concluded, this is one of those places that sets your expectations at the appropriate level and then exceeds those expectations -- thus, you walk away pretty happy with your experience.

The House serves Asian Fusion but not the kind where it's drenched in a disgusting amount of sauce -- but good simple Asian fusion that focuses on bringing out the flavors of the natural ingredients. Prices are decent given SF and the portion of food. Appetizers run for around $10 or so and then mains are in the $20 range. We got:

Hamachi appetizer special -- pretty delicious hamachi -- was particularly interesting to see how they dressed it up with a salsa to add flavor and served it on top of a marinated piece of radish that almost served as a chip. Red tobiko was a nice touch to this

Diver scallops -- served with mixed greens -- black tobiko added extra kick to this perfectly seared scallop with yummy sauce too

Grilled unagi -- I don't even like unagi but this was DELICIOUS. Comes on top of a avocado rice that complements it all too perfectly

Sea bass with garlic noodles and green beans -- very simple dish and HUGE portion. Thank god we split this because eating this by yourself could have easily been enough. Generous sea bass portion that was properly cooked, soft and flaky in the way good fish should be, and good noodles and green beans.

Thai iced tea panna cotta with fresh fruits -- this was seriously an amazing dessert. I didn't know one could make these simple ingredients taste oh so delicious but this was amazing.

Coconut creme brulee with passionfruit puree-- pretty good creme brulee, I found the passionfruit puree to be a little tart, so wasn't a huge fan.

Overall, really, really solid experience. I didn't find myself mindblown by anything, but given the price I was paying and the nature of the place, I was just happy to have pretty decent dishes across the board. 

tldr; would highly recommend as a less avant-garde Asian fusion place but still delicious enough and at reasonable prices!
author: Jasmine X.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I love everything about it. I love how affordable it is (for SF) and how easy it is to walk in/get a reservation (again, for SF). My most recent experience was a double date with my boyfriend and his just married cousin from China. I perused Yelp for something that's different from traditional Asian fare but still suitable to their palette. Then I remembered my previous experience here and knew The House would be modern Asian fusion done right. I called and was able to make a reservation for 4 for the night after! 

It's one of those restaurants where anything you order turns out to be fantastic. A couple of my favorites entrees are the sea bass with garlic noodles, pomegranate pork chop, and steak with wasabi noodles. I didn't get to try the tuna tartar appetizer (it's on the small side) but the cousins seemed to really enjoy it! 

My review is completely unneeded given the 3,000+ reviews but it's hard to not rave after eating such great food. Go check it out! Yelp doesn't lie :P
author: Xinxin W.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for our 7th year anniversary. We had reservations at 5:30 pm, and I was late due to traffic and the scarcity of parking spaces (Don't drive here if you can avoid it!). I chose this place because I wanted to try their yelp-famous black cod, but it was not on the menu or on their specials :( I ended up ordering their sea bass, which turned out to be a well prepared equivalent with a side of green beans and garlic noodles. My boyfriend ordered the steak special which came with a side of mash potatoes and mushrooms (no greens, so I shared some of mine with him, gotta make sure he's eating something somewhat healthy haha). To end the night, we delighted in their also yelp-famous mango tapioca. 

The place is fairly small and cramped. I had trouble hearing our waiter name the appetizers and specials menu along with their descriptions. There is little space between tables, so when I stood to use the restroom, I had to gingerly squeeze through the small space betweeen our table and the table next to ours, careful to not let my red dress catch on any corners and cause chaos. In addition, our conversations easily bled through to other tables and we were able to hear conversations from the tables sandwiching ours when we were eating rather than conversing. Funnily enough, an older couple on our left had also chosen to come to this establishment on their anniversary. All it all, it was a fine dining experience in a dim-lighted environment.
author: Fanny T.

description:
This place was a fantastic find.  Our friends made reservations here for a friends night out.  As we arrived, it was truly a place you can miss in the craziness of the North Beach area.  It was quite small inside, and busy.  So I am very happy our friends had made the reservations.
