Service was very prompt and attentive after we were seated.  We had some appetizers to start including a sashimi plate with salmon, yellow tail and big eye tuna.  The dipping wasabi, soy sauce had a punch but also had great flavor.  The fish was very fresh and tasted fantastic. I believe we had a seared scallop appetizer as well that had a nice semi sweet sauce and the scallop was cooked to perfection.

For dinner, I had the wasabi noodles with flat iron steak.  The steak had a nice caramelized crust and was cooked perfect.  The noodles were also cooked perfect with a good spice.  The combination was absolutely great.  At the table was also a shortrib special, sea bass as well as lamb chops.  Everyone enjoyed their food greatly and if you can eat with your eyes, I am not surprised as everything looked fantastic.  

For dessert, I had a blueberry bread pudding a la mode.  Again, it was not to disappoint.  Great flavor in the bread pudding, not too mushy with a good texture and a fantastic topping with the ice cream

I would definitely come back here but would make sure that I had reservations.
author: Scott P.

description:
***4.5 STARS***

The House lived up to the high ratings on Yelp! The House is a small restaurant, but they sure know how to create some delicious dishes at a very reasonable price. 

// SERVICE //

The service here was great. The staff was very attentive and they were constantly stopping by our table to clear plates or refill our drinks. 

// FOOD //
Complimentary tsukemono: Tastes similar to a pickle. The brine was great and it had that great crunch to it.

Calamari: The calamari had the perfect crunch to it which made it great. The tomato sauce on the side had a kick to it. I believe they added horseradish or wasabi to it in order to give it that Asian flare.

Miso black cod: Amazing! The black cod was cooked perfectly and had a delicious sauce that went well with it. Be careful of the green sauce which is pretty much a liquid wasabi sauce. They topped the black cod with a sliced sushi roll which was an interesting, but nice touch to the dish. 

Mushroom rice with grilled prawns: This was pretty much a mushroom risotto with shrimps and bonito flakes. The risotto was absolutely delicious and the shrimps gave it a nice texture. 

Grilled sea bass with garlic noodles: Delicious! The sea bass was cooked to perfection. It literally melted in your mouth! The garlic noodles were also packed with flavor and had a nice chew to it. 

Overall, I would highly recommend The House to anyone in the SF area. The food will blow you away and honestly, the prices were really reasonable. I can't wait to come back to SF and eat here again!

**Make sure you make reservations otherwise you will not be able to get a table here.
author: Ryan W.

description: Food was okay. Wait time kind of long. Bartender had an attitude the entire time were there which ruined our experience.
author: Riley F.

description:
I came here with one of my friends for a weekday birthday dinner. Upon arriving I thought the restaurant had a very warm and cozy atmosphere as the restaurant is pretty small (which is not a bad thing- just make sure you call for a reservation). 

First off, the flavor of the food here is phenomenal. This place does a fantastic job to cater to your palate:

-Garlic Noodles with Steak (I replaced the wasabi noodles with garlic noodles): This was filled with so many great and contrasting flavors that it definitely made an great impression! 

-Mushroom Rice with Prawns: This dish was savory and also had an interesting presentation. This was my favorite dish of the night due to the unique taste!

-Sashimi appetizer (a menu special of the day): Of everything we tried, this one did not stand out. The flavor was nothing comparable to the main dishes.

The service here was courteous and made my friend and I feel welcome. The one thing I wish would have been done, was if we had a written down description of the specials of the day. When the waiter told us about the specials they had to offer, we were left confused as he went through the list so quickly. 

Overall, I would recommend coming here since the flavor of the main dishes are so delicious.
author: Grace Z.

description: My family, friends and I have been going to The House for about 20 years now.  It is still our favorite restaurant of all time.  If you are looking for a new restaurant to try in San Francisco, The House is a Must try!  Angela and her husband Larry are always the most gracious hosts, the service is excellent, Summer is always so sweet and lovely.  The appetizers are all so delicious.  Miso clams, scallops, calamari, unagi rice, kale salad, salmon rolls, calamari, tempura green beans, poke tuna,  there was never an appetizer I didn't like and I'm a picky eater.  Unbelievable!  For the entrees, my favorite is always the ribye steak, black cod or seabass.  You will not be disappointed and of course the dessert, Oh My gosh!!  Mango Tapioca, chocolate cake, creme brulee!  It's all so unbelievably good.   Trust me! Thank you Angela and Larry!  You are the best!
author: M W.

description:
with one word? no way to describe it.
It is always packed and you should make sure you had a reservation. 

The do asian fusion food and thats what they do very successfully!

After Mandarine has gone this is our favorite asian fusion restaurant.
Why i just put away one star? Cause it is so small you even can share a plate with you direct neighbors table. I know the prices for renting that space will be ridiculous - but i have to comment about that since it is leaking a bit of atmosphere therefore - but the food is fine stars!
author: Martin W.

description:
Located in the heart of DTSF in between the tall skyscrapers and little authentic historical business of Little Italy and boarder line Chinatown. 

I was here for one night only, and the sister remember dining here once and suggested we go. It's an Asian fusion type of place. Small and narrow restaurant. They were able to accommodate our party of 8, surprisingly. We had some difficulties at first when we called in to make the resi. The gal on the phone stated they can only reserve for 6 max but will only make our resi for 5 ppl. She wasn't very pleasant on the phone. But after having our guy friend call and make a resi for 8 ppl, the gentleman on the line was happy to do it.

Tuna tar tar - for the table; great starter

The food overall was great, packed with flavor and spices. 

I ordered the Flat Iron Steak with garlic noodles. The noodles were on point. It wasn't too oily and too garlic-y, and had a nice kick of spiciness to it. I was slightly disappointed that my steak wasn't cooked well enough. It was more on the med-rare rather the well side.

Pork chop - cooked perfectly and not chewy at all.

All the other dishes from the party was well presented. Everyone enjoyed their dishes. I'd say it was a successful dining evening. I'd definitely come back again if I'm in SF.
author: Helena H.

description:
This restaurant is fantastic! It is small and cozy. The food was amazing. We had brunch here. Their service was exceptional. We came in 30 minutes before they close and they still took our orders. ( some restaurants have their last call an hour before closing) 
We ordered avocado sandwich, steak, curry noodles, beef wasabi noodles, and deep fried salmon roll. 
Definitely would come back!
author: Lia H.

description: Excellent food and good, cheerful service. We had a group of six for lunch and tried a wide range of the fresh and wholesome options. Every meal was beautifully presented and delicious. Easily the best Asian meal we've had visiting SF and well worth the prices.
author: Paul W.

description:
Place: Pretty small place but they make it work. We were seated right next to the register/kitchen opening, so definitely not ideal to always have someone standing behind you.

Service: Service was pretty good. Waters/teas were quickly refilled. They have their specials of the day that the waiter/waitress recites to you and this is always hard to hear anytime someone does this anywhere, but at least she didn't go on and on about some minute details on how it is specifically cooked to convince me to get the special.

Food we ordered:
Appetizers
- gnocchi: hard to see the gnocchi since it was covered in sauce + other stuff + wasn't much of it, but this was good for sure
- fried salmon rolls: just get this if you come here, don't think twice

Main
- sea bass: pretty oily dish since it comes with garlic noodles and green beans, but the sea bass is good
- pork chop: I was debating between this and the steak and I'm glad I went with this. It's harder to make a good pork chop than a good steak. Very nice flavor without the porky taste.

Dessert
- upside down pineapple cake: comes with ice-cream, solid dessert.
- creme brulee: not too sweet and the passionfruit puree on top gives it a kick

I'd come back - food is good and is ideal for this price range. Probably better for dates though - I wouldn't come here with a party of greater than 4.
author: Vincent C.

description: The House is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. My party and I ordered the clams in spicy miso sauce. We love the sauce so much that we ordered two extra orders of bread to dip. We also ordered wasabi noodles w/ steak and the sea bass. Sea bass was so good and buttery. The wasabi noodles never disappoint and satisfied my cravings. I am never disapppointed when I come here and the service is always good!
author: cadence p.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with three other friends without a reservation.
We arrived around 5:30pm and didn't have to wait long for a table though it was quite busy and packed.

This place is good.

After second thought....
yeah, this place is good.

The service? It's good.
The atmosphere? It's good.
The salmon roll? It's good.
The pomegranate pork chop? It's good.
The grilled sea bass? It's good.
The wasabi noodles? It's good.
The scallop special? Okay. Get this one. It's really good. I mean it.

I could go on and on about each dish, but just hear me out on this one.
They're all good.
You don't need to hear me explain about how each one tastes.
Go taste them for yourself.
They're all good.

Summary:
Get the scallops. Share the scallops. Eat the scallops. Enjoy the scallops.
Go home happy.
author: Joshua M.

description:
FOOD:
Although it has 3 money signs, I would say this place is 2 money sign! I was here on Valentine's day, my boyfriend was able to reserve seats! But he booked way in advance, in Nov/Dec so I would suggest you book early if you want to eat here for VDAY. I always order the wasabi noodles with flat iron steak but this time around I ordered the Sea Bass! My boyfriend ordered the Sea Bass times before, and he said the texture of the sea bass I had was definitely more dry. Not sure if it's because it's Valentine's Day and they are a bit more rushed but it still tasted good! The sauce is what makes the Sea Bass so much more enjoyable. Without it, it's not complete! An entree costs about $30, for two people your bill comes out to be less than $100!

SERVICE:
The staff working are extremely nice, very accommodating and polite. They would come and check up on you from time to time! 

PARKING:
Extremely challenging.. Up hill street parkings. Street is extremely narrow so parking is really challenging during dinner hours! I would suggest coming 15 minutes early to look for parking!
author: Monique W.

description:
i recommend the black cod (if available) and scallops (if available). These dishes were full of surprising flavors. I have no idea what was in them... but they were sooooo good! I would pay double of what they charged, that's how good I thought they were (especially the scallops). presentation was awesome as well - very colorful.

wasn't a fan of the wasabi noodles / flatiron steak. they were not bad, but completely forgettable.

the place is small and crowded. definitely get a reservation ahead of time.

also, the place was darkly lit. so don't expect to get good Instagram photos of your food during dinner. hehe
author: Azriel R.

description: My boyfriend and I came to celebrate a late Valentine's Day and I'm so glad we chose this spot! At first I was a little skeptic about having elbow room because the pictures make the space look relatively small, but the place is actually bigger than it seems. We started off with some drinks, a beer and a rose, which was a great way to start off our dining. My boyfriend loved the Japanese IPA. Our servers were wonderful in informing us with the specials. We ordered the pan seared scallops for the appetizer, which was phenomenal! Perfectly cooked with a delicious lemon purée on the side. For our entrees we ordered the ribeye and sea bass. I've never had a more delicious piece of ribeye! Definitely satisfied with my choice. The sea bass was a hitter as well, and for dessert we ordered the mango tapioca, which in my opinion might have tasted like any other Asian dessert spot. Overall this place is definitely a must-try spot for any SF visitors, plus there's a nice nightlife around the corner!
author: Clarissa C.

description:
Went here for dinner with the bf on a Saturday night. I wasn't expecting the wait to be too long, but it almost took an hour to get seated. I would suggest making a reservation if you want to go here as the place is very small. Luckily, they take down your name and phone number so you're free to wander around the area (btw, there's a bar next door that played some pretty awesome live music). With the place being so small, the tables are practically touching each other so don't expect too much privacy. 

We ordered:
- deep fried salmon roll
- grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy w/ garlic noodles
- angus ribeye steak

The food was delicious (and came out fairly quickly after we ordered, which is a plus after the long wait--I was hungry!)! I would say that this place is definitely worth a try.
author: Trina V.

description: Like most eateries in San Francisco, the cost of living are added to price of merchandise or services. Food was good but nothing exceptional like the Yelp reviews. We had order of oysters (flavorful), ribeye and noodle strip steak. We went next door to the Saloon while waiting.
author: Brian J.

description:
Highly recommended place by my friends (and Yelp) so excited to finally get a reservation and try out the wasabi noodles and sea bass!

We started with a bottle of French wine and the tuna tartare and oysters as appetizers. Oysters were so buttery and the roasted nori chips that paired with the tuna tartare made it delightful.

For entrees we chose the wasabi noodles with flatiron steak and sea bass (DUH! obviously!) The wasabi noodles were delicious and the wasabi was not overpowering at all. My dining companion only let me have one bite before he inhaled the rest of it, lol. The sea bass was really buttery, flaky and perfectly grilled. The soy ginger sauce was a great accompaniment. 

For dessert we chose the chocolate cake and creme brulee. The chocolate cake was pretty good........ the only caveat was that we found a blonde hair in the sauce..........and it was after we ate it  :( The creme brulee came with a passionfruit sauce and it was wayyyyyyy too overpowering and sour! :((

Overall, I would give the wasabi noodles and sea bass 5 stars but overall the experience was 3 stars. Service was not that great and that hair in our dessert was pretty disgusting.
author: Angela D.

description:
Ridiculous.  So Delicious.  

The menu is quite simple.  One page, which has appetizers and entrees.  We got oysters, mussels.  They also had a few specials that were not on the menu.  I heard yellow-tail sashimi, and that was that.  

For entrees, we had 2 people order the noodles with steak, 2 orders of the ribeye, a salmon and a seabass.  

The noodles were very good.  From what we saw, that was the most highly recommended item by other yelpers.  Yelp did not fail us.  The ribeye was very flavorful.  I'm a steak lover, so I would say the quality of the meat was not top notch like at steak houses, but this place focuses on the marinade, and they did a fine job of that.  The cauliflowers that went with it were the best I've ever had.  The Seabass (I stole a few bites from my friend's plate), was the best Seabass I've ever tasted.  but then again, I don't eat fish too often.

I definitely would come back here again.  The only reason why I wouldn't come here EVERY single time, would be because it's in San Francisco....way too many other restaurants around to try.

Warning: This place is small, and it gets crowded.
author: Tienanh C.

description:
Finally tried The House for dinner and I must say I was a bit disappointed. Came here on a weekday and it was quite packed. My friend and I missed our reservation but they were still nice enough to accommodate us. 

We ordered:

Oysters on the half shell- The oysters were shucked perfectly and was paired with a ponzu sauce I believe. These were good but nothing too special.

Soft shell crab appetizer- The presentation of this dish was beautiful and the crab had a nice crunch to it, but again it was not a wow factor

Kurobuta pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce- I ordered this dish based on a friend's recommendation and I must say the flavors were unique and interesting but the pork chop was a bit too overcooked to my liking which made it less enjoyable

Rib eye- My friend ordered this dish and he said it tasted exactly like the beef from Vietnamese restaurants. Needless to say he was not impressed.


Maybe we should've stuck to the crowd favorites such as the wasabi noodles and deep fried salmon rolls but I felt a bit adventurous that night. I'm willing to give The House another try in the future but for now I'll just leave this review here.
author: Karmen T.

description:
How do I even start...

We got to the restaurant a little before they opened for dinner and there was already a line forming. I would suggest coming before they open if you can't make a reservation because we were seated pretty quickly. 

The ambiance of the small restaurant is really casual, which was surprising because I was expecting something fancier to match the $$$ signs it has on Yelp. The food, however, was fancy and everything more. 

My friend and I shared the Deep Fried Salmon Roll. The inside is perfectly cooked with rare salmon in the middle. Comes over a kimchi-style salad and with a Chinese spicy mustard sauce. The sauce was a overpowering for me because it's wasabi aroma went straight up my nose but that's because I generally don't like wasabi. 

My friend decided to get the Grilled Sea Bass and I went with the special of the day, Grilled Mahi Mahi.

The Grilled Sea Bass came with garlic noodles and string beans. The sea bass was soft and buttery! The stir fry noodles had a mild garlic taste.

The Grilled Mahi Mahi was served over a coconutty/miso broth and with potatoes and mussels and topped with some kind of fried crispy grated noodle texture vegetable (unsure). The House really knows how to whip up broth because whatever was in it was really flavorful- sweetish and savoryish. The fish itself was so moist and the mussels didn't have a fishy flavor despite being in a fish dish.

FOODGASM ACCOMPLISHED !

I wish they wrote the specials down on a piece of paper instead of having the waiters say it all in one go, because there were so many specials and I have the memory of a goldfish D: But they were nice enough to repeat it for me like 3 times hahaha

Believe the hype! It'll be worth all the $$$.
author: Christine K.

description:
This place got some friggin bomb fish! and appetizers! I came here on a Sunday night at 7 ish and this place was packed out the door! 

Deep-fried salmon roll, Chinese hot mustard - really yummy! I dont remember much from it but I do enjoy the Chinese hot mustard. It's not like spicy hot. it's like.. horseradish and wasabi type of hot

Miso black cod, crab avocado maki - super soft fish! It was very well flavored, but a little on the salty side. The crab avocado maki was like a long california roll pretty much.

Very good place, their fish, their garlic noodles are really good. You can't go wrong ordering any fish here.
author: Carmen C.

description:
Though very small, The House serves excellent food at affordable prices. The establishment itself is clean and comfortable, and there was little if any wait for our table.
Service was quick and easy, a blessed relief, and the menu had so many excellent options that it was extremely difficult to decide. I had the wasabi house noodles with king salmon, which, as the name suggests, consisted of some of the best salmon I have ever tasted and equally impressive noodles. My companions were served sandwiches and well done steaks, all of which were enjoyed very much. I like the variety in the menu; it gave the restaurant a little bit of everything, but funnily enough helped me to distinguish it from other Asian cuisines.
Overall, I think The House is a must-visit for anyone in San Francisco. The place is easy to miss, so keep an eagle eye out! I promise, you won't regret it!
author: Guide S.

description:
Already anticipating our next visit to this nose tingling, mouth watering, visually appealing restaurant!  So many wonderful places to eat in The City... go to The House!
My husband said to stop mentioning it... Pavlov's dog.. starts salivating and tummy talking!
author: Michelle K.

description: My fav restaurant in the City. Everything I mean EVERYTHING is perfect!  All items are tasty and enjoy the presentation. I especially enjoy the pork chops with pomegranate sauce.
author: Patricia L.

description: So good!!! Super consistent, everything on the menu is a hit. Great veggie options. Service is always on point too!
author: Ryan G.

description: Found this place off of a Yelp search one evening for dinner.  All the reservations were taken for the evening but they accept walk-ins. Located in a great spot of SF next to little Italy the wait was only 20 minutes; it's a very small, spot You can definitely do some walking around while waiting for a table. The food here is delicious. I had the chicken salad, Sea bass, green beans, and noodles. My partner had the ribeye with mashed potatoes. All of these items were served as very large portions.
author: Michael C.

description:
Went to The House for an early dinner before seeing Beach Blanket Babylon this past Friday evening. Really 4 1/2 stars as everything from start to finish was delicious, spot on preparation and presentation.

The food and flavors here are distinctive and savory.  We wound up sharing everything. We started with Deep-Fried Salmon Roll served with Chinese hot mustard and seared scallops with a ponzu citrus based sauce. Could not have two different appetizers but each was a standout. 
For mains we went with Grilled Sea Bass served with garlic ginger soy and Kurobuta Pork Chop served with pomegranate currant sauce. As with the starters both were excellent, my wife said the pork chop was one of the best ever. The garlic noodles with the sea bass were outstanding.

Often with great apps and entrees, dessert is a letdown. Not here, we shared a special chocolate macadamia torte with chantilly cream and a scoop of espresso ice cream. Delicious ending to a great dinner.  
There is a nice little wine list and glasses are reasonable.  We were able to snag the front table next to the window which gave us some extra room. Service was friendly and efficient. The House is an excellent choice for Asian Fusion in North Beach.
author: Tom D.

description: FANTASTIC. Make a reservation, but you will have to wait anyways...but its ok, its worth it. On the outskirts of Chinatown, but my favorite asian cuisine in the city!
author: Leah B.

description:
OMG!!! This food is amazing!! I was a bit turn off by the typical crowded, Chinese food place, but all was forgotten after the first bite!  Even the cucumbers salad was good and I don't even like cucumbers. We had the Sea bass and angus flat iron steak in wasabi noodles that just to die for. 
We'llmake this a regular stop while in San Fran.
author: Terry S.

description: Everything was delicious! We made reservations at 530pm got seated right away. The service was excellent, we had the fried salmon roll it was incredible. I had the grilled sea bass with the garlic soy noodles very tasty , my husband had the steak with the noodles as well. He was very happy with the food we will definitely be back. I want to try it all... can't wait
author: Naifeh G.

description:
I usually am not a fan of Asian Fusion places, but I was intrigued to try their fried salmon roll and their wasabi noodles. 

First off, make reservations as this restaurant is small. My party ordered the fried salmon roll to start, the wasabi noodles with flank steak, the grill sea bass, and the pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce. The fried salmon roll is unlike your typical salmon rolls as this was perfectly cooked medium rare fillets of salmon inside a wonton wrapper. Think of it as a fried salmon egg roll. Out of the entrees, I enjoyed the grill sea bass best. What's not advertised is that the sea bass comes with a side of garlic noodles, which I actually preferred over the wasabi noodles. Funny because I came here for the wasabi noodles haha. But to me, the wasabi noodles tasted like regular Lo mein to me, with very little if any wasabi taste. The garlic noodles on the other hand had a distinct garlic taste which is why I liked this better. Also, the steak was a bit chewy and hard, while the sea bass was perfectly cooked. I'm not a big pork fan, but I took a bite out of the huge pork chop and it was fairly sweet in taste; the sauce reminded me of the sesame chicken. 

Definitely worth a visit!
author: Wendy L.

description: We enjoyed the intimate atmosphere and the quality of the food - interesting asian fusion - the sea bass especially was delicious. Space is a bit crowded but service was awesome. A good place for a weeknight date night.
author: Gwen H.

description:
Worst service I've ever received at a supposed "nice" restaurant.

Not only did the Asian male waiter explain incorrectly the menu to me, but he overcharged us. He refused to admit his mistake, and was condescending and dismissive to me when I brought it up. We ended up paying it anyway because it wasn't worth talking to him/the manager further. He actually smiled thinking he won an argument. People like this are hard to fire, I'll bet, they'll just say it wasn't their fault. 

Your food might be nice, but it's not worth this.
author: Mingmei N.

description:
If you want to study a successful restaurant, this is where you should go.

It's tiny & cramped.  You're not going to be able to have a private conversation.  Eat here first, then go have your private conversation somewhere else afterwards.

It's that good.

They've been packed every night since they opened.  And that was about 20 years ago.

Order the sea bass.

Even if you don't like sea bass.

I reached a point where I'd only order the sea bass.

Seriously.

In a kitchen this busy, you'd expect at least one dish on the menu to be subpar, at least once in awhile...

Right?

Never happens.

Honestly, you can't go wrong w anything on the menu here.

They have found the right amount of finesse to employ in feeding you a stellar dish, in a crowded space, in a timely manner.  

The flavors are purely orgasmic.  This kitchen is rock star all the time.  If the service isn't, just be sure to remember that.

A former roommate of mine was a waiter here.  And my other roommate at the time was a waiter at Rose Pistola.  I was a very lucky & spoiled girl.

5 stars totally.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Basking in the warm embrace of the knowledge that black cod was soon to be mine, I sat contentedly in the tiny space that had been afforded me. Yet I wondered, "Will it live up to all the other black cod I have had?" Well, it did.

Though the special of the night was delicious, as all black cod always is, it did not surpass any before it, nor was it raised to a level appropriate for such an establishment. 

This being the best dish of the night, I must confess I was a bit underwhelmed by The House. Rushed service, cramped quarters, and decent but not outstanding food, especially at these prices, brought this down from a 5 to what should be a 3.5.

The wasabi noodles were hit and miss in flavor, with the steak being various shades of doneness. The seared ahi is standardly good. The dumpling app is worthless, while the unagi and poke are good but pricey.

The presentation is perhaps the highlight, so enjoy that for as long as you can.
author: Andrew R.

description:
I came here with some friends for dinner on a weekday night. The restaurant is pretty small, so definitely make a reservation before coming!

Pros:
- Delicious asian fusion food, probably the best I've had. I think the flavors are pretty simple, but the highlight is that everything is very well cooked. I ordered the sea bass with garlic soy noodles and really enjoyed my meal. The fish was crispy on the outside, but so soft on the inside. I would say it ranks in top 5 of best fishes I've had. 

- Generous portions. There was a good amount of veggies (green beans), noodles, and fish in my dish. I was very full after finishing everything.

- Good dessert. We shared a Mango Tapioca and it was tasty. 

Con:
- Service was just okay. I think because it is a smaller restaurant, they try to get people in and out more quickly. Our waitress seemed a bit impatient with us since we were chatting a lot. It might be a good idea to get dinner here, then move on to a bar to continue conversations.

Overall, I would like to come back and try some of their other dishes. They also have specials that sounded really good!
author: Sophia H.

description: Great and consistent and really great service that makes you feel like family.  Best miso cod I have ever had and the server recommended the grilled calamari- it was amazing!  Scallops here are also amazing!
author: Danielle B.

description: I've eaten here several times, waiter service and the food is always good. However, during my last visit I was very disappointed, the food was quite tasteless.
author: Charlee O.

description: Came here for my bday and we all had good time since we didnt have to wait in line for a table (reserve a table before you come please!) We were so in love with the food especially the pork chop in pomegranate sauce ; everything else also melts in your mouth every time. The con is its not great for intimate atmosphere if you plan to bring your bf/gf and want to have good time; its too crowded!!
author: Jenny N.

description:
Had a chance to end the day here and lucked out on a Friday afternoon because me and the wifey were seated upon arrival. Nice little spot off Broadway that I have frequented a couple times previous so I'm just a tad bit overdue. 
        Waitresses greet you and if busy have a good gauge on the wait. You can call ahead for reservations, but be prompt because you may loose your spot especially on the weekends. The seating here is a bit tight so be patient and mindful of your surroundings. 
       I usually enjoy the flat iron steak but today's special was halibut. So I had the urge to change it up, and I'm so glad I did because the buttery seasoning was so delicious. Like the Asian in me I poured the sauce on top of my bowl of rice to get the most out of the meal. The halibut was cooked to perfection and with the added clams you get your shellfish craving quenched at he same time. Felt a little guilt free but unfortunately white rice was the side. I'm sure I could have substituted it for brown but I was pot committed at that point. 
       Wifey got the garlic noodles with steak, and as usual a big winner. One slight downfall was she had asked for the steak medium rare, but got it a little too pink for her liking. It's a good thing cause that's how I like my steak so naturally we shared meals. 
      It's always a joy to come in and enjoy the delicious foods here. I'm never disappointed and love coming back.
author: Omar R.

description: The House blew me away completely. If you're looking for exquisite Asian fusion, this is the one for you.
author: Jay H.

description: The House never disappoints! Small , crowded, loud ! So what ! The food is impeccable as is the service. This has been my go to restaurant for a long , long time and I always walk out of this place completely satisfied with the amazing food and efficiency of the servers. Everything on the menu is fantastic. I have had just about everything. If somebody was new to this spot I would say go for the pork chop , salmon roll , or special fish dish that is told to you by the server in the beginning of your order. Make sure you make a reservation. People that know about The House continue to go there all the time. A good move is make a early reservation when they open. It's rare that I do , but when I do things are definitely a little more relaxed. When you do before you know it. The place is packed ! It's a testament of what a great place it is.
author: DARREN M.

description:
The owner at my favorite thai restaurant of all time (Opals thai on oahu) told us about The House a few years ago. He said the chef there is his inspiration for food. Finally got a chance to go a few months ago and it was definitely as amazing as I imagined it would be. If you're in to Asian fusion or just Asian flavors in general, you've got to give it a try!
Get the sea bass! You won't be disappointed
author: Donna H.

description: Great food- low key but really enjoyed the grilled octopus and the oysters. June was a great server and took his recommendations for all our dishes which were all spot on.
author: Jim M.

description:
We had dinner here on a Friday night right when we got into San Francisco and it was absolutely delicious. We started off with the salmon roll and it was cooked to perfection. The salmon inside was moist while the outer tempura roll was crunchy. 

I had the sea bass and there aren't enough adjectives in the English language to describe just how delectable it was. My date had the Kobe beef special and I've never tasted Kobe done so well. San Francisco is definitely the foodie Mecca and this place is at the top of the hierarchy. 

Do yourself a favor and make a reservation because it's not a big restaurant and it fills up quickly. The restaurant doesn't look like much when you pull up to it but it more than makes up for it with the amazing food.
author: Claudia N.

description: The food was Delicious and he Sever June was even Better! My husband and I shared: Beef Noodles, Ahi Tuna and the Special Crab Avocado Toast Appetizer. We were not disappointed and would definitely go back! Also, we went to the restaurant 30 mins before they closed and still had delicious food and great service.
author: Ericka T.

description:
I've stopped by here so many times, every time it was a 1+ hour wait. 

FINALLY on a Sunday night, my date and I arrived at 8pm and was seated right away (squeeeee!!)

The ambience is cute, nice and intimate, not too loud. I ordered one of the specials of the night - halibut with mashed taters, truffle sauce, and some fried (taro strings?) on top. It was delicious! Date had the ribeye which was equally awesome. It was moderately priced (for SF - 70$ for two people including tip and tax).

Would love to come back!
author: Angela L.

description:
Solid 4*

Got the mussels, flatiron steak with noodles, the sea bass and their special (scallops).  The food was great!   So flavorful.  The scallops were cooler just right and the cod melted in your mouth.  

Also ordered their apple pie a la mode (pretty disappointed in their dessert which is the -1 star)

They could improve on seat spacing. My god I felt the people next to us were seated with us.  Surely know how to pack its customers like sardines :).   I'm not too surprised since this is SF.  

Overall, I think this restaurant is still a must-try.
author: George Y.

description:
A hidden gem!!! Walked in without reservations on a Sunday at 530pm with no issues. Tables are a bit cramped but it is a small restaurant so definitely forgiveable. We shared the mussels, octopus and the sea bass with the noodles with a couple glasses of rice wine. I've never had such plump and delicious mussels before. They were huge! Each of the dishes were fantastic and very well put together. Noodles are an absolute must!

Really solidly executed food in a cozy setting for very reasonable prices. Can't wait to come back!
author: Cathy F.

description:
Pretty good food!

This place doesn't have much of an ambiance as it's a whole in the wall joint in downtown San Francisco. If you're not paying attention, you might easily walk right past it.

But it seems to be really happening as when my bf and I stopped by at 930 PM, the place was completely packed. Fortunately, we made a reservation in advance so we were seated within a matter of 5 minutes. A lot of tippers say to reserve in advance, and we're glad we took their advice as you may be waiting a while if you just show up.

Between my bf and I, we got the fried soft shell crab and fried green beans as appetizers and the sea bass, wasabi noodles and ribeye for entrees (I know...we eat a lot). My personal favs were the appetizers and the sea bass. They tasted really fresh and had tons of great flavor. I wasn't a huge fan of the ribeye or the wasabi noodles though. My bf, who ordered the ribeye, also mentioned the meat was a bit grainy. As for the noodles, I loved that the noodles themselves were really thick and chewy, but I really didn't like the flavors.

Service was average. When taking your order, the servers were really nice but they rarely came by to check on how things were. I really wanted a soda but never got a chance to ask for one.

Overall, it was a good meal. Portion sizes are good for the price, and service is decent. We may or may not go back.
author: Claudia C.

description:
This has to be the tastiest meal you'll have that's near the Financial District and Chinatown area. Come after the rush which is 1-1:30pm. There's always a table during those hours. 

To start, order the DEEP FRIED SALMON ROLL! It's soooooo good!! It comes with a wasabi dipping sauce which can hit you out of no where. For entrees, I suggest the Tuna, BLT, Pork Chops, Sea Bass and the curry noodles! 

- PORK CHOPS - Everything about the pork chop dish is delicious! It was cooked to perfection!
- SEA BASS - Super yummy!!!
- TUNA BLT - The tuna in the sandwich is nothing like the tuna that I've ever tried. It's crazy good! 
- CURRY NOODLES - Simply delicious!! It's my favorite item on the menu and I always order it with salmon. The House cooks their salmon to perfection and I always end up ordering an extra piece of salmon to eat by itself!! IT'S A FREAKING GOOD PIECE OF SALMON I TELL YA!!!! 

I know a lot of people on Yelp rave about how good the warm wasabi house noodles are but after trying the curry noodles, I think those are 10x better!

Everyone who works here are super nice! 

The place is kind of expensive but it's totally worth if you go with a group during lunch time!
author: Alice X.

description: Where do I start!?  Had four appetizers (in order preference):  grilled octopus, scallops, muscles and tuna roll.  My husband had the porkchop, perfectly cooked.  Me and the others had the seabass with garlicky fresh noodles.  It's a small place but with with it!
author: Jill S.

description:
People often ask me for restaurant recommendations when they travel to various cities and I tend to keep a few places in my back pocket that I shoot off like ammo when these moments arise. In San Francisco, The House makes the cut.  Anyone who I've ever recommended it to has come back raving about how delicious it is, so now I (along with 3000+ reviewers) am sharing this with the Yelp community. 

I don't often like fusion cuisine because it tends to miss the mark and is overpriced.  But by golly, The House has gotten it down pat.  The seafood dishes are particularly noteworthy, and the miso black cod is worth all the hype.

Don't ask any more questions, just make reservations and get your booty on the floor tonight. I mean...here, just get your booty here.
author: Virginia T.

description: The food was excellent all around. I suggest you try the soft shell crab and the deep fried Salomon rolls as appetizers. For entrees, the warm wasabi noodles with steak was very nice, a bit spicy, but very good overall.
author: Evie H.

description:
You can get any protein on the menu with the wasabi noodles!!! I got the sea bass :) Dinner was really rich and tasty, but dessert was actually the best part for me.

It's a small venue so definitely try to make a reservation. The four of us arrived at 5:30pm (when they open) with a reservation. They claim our reservation was for the next day, but luckily they still sat us! There were at least 7-8 specials and they all sounded amazing. We got the sashimi and skirt steak from the specials menu. My iced tea was refilled throughout the night which was a pleasant surprise and also helped stop me from getting a massive food coma :) I'll be back for dessert, specifically the mango tapioca and the passionfruit creme brulee!
author: Crystal L.

description: Generally the place is clean, modern. Service is slow and double check your bags they are bad for forgetting stuff.
author: Delilah H.

description:
When I first came across The House during my "most reviewed" searches I was really surprised I hadn't noticed it before.

Came here for a special date night and decided to walk around the area and get a few drinks before. We had reservations at 830 and it was fairly busy so we waited a while to get seated.

Like most places in North Beach it's quite tiny and cozy which I didn't mind on cold day. 

We had read so many things about the wasabi noodles we knew it was must try with the steak and  I ordered the sea bass. Our food smelled and looked delicious , but the taste and quality was subpar . All of the items we order were drenched in oil, literally soaking. I am not a fan of eating food that makes my face feel greasy after.

Since we didn't eat much of our food we decided we would make up for it by getting dessert (my fav part of any meal) another disappointment. The service was also very spotty throughout our meal 

There are so many amazing Asian fusion places in the city, I def will not be back.
author: Hetal P.

description:
Okay honestly, I had lunch here a couple weeks ago and I still dream about how amazing it was. I went with my boyfriend at around 2 and was seated immediately. I would probably recommend making a reservation for any other time though, we just got lucky. 

We started out with the deep fried salmon rolls and the tempura green beans. The green beans were crispy and the flavor of the dipping sauce made it super tasty. For one entree, we ordered the wasabi noodles. I don't like wasabi at all, but saw how many fellow yelpers raved about it so I had to try it, and it didn't disappoint. The one thing that made this meal for me though was the pork chop. It was perfectly grilled and every bite was so juicy. The vegetables that came with it complimented it nicely. Open one in Arizona soon, please!!
author: Madeline L.

description:
Went to the House based on the great reviews on Yelp. Happy to report they were very accurate. Ordered the following:

Deep Fried Salmon Roll- perfect crunch outside with delicious salmon on the inside. Came with spicy  dipping sauce. I think there were 4 good size pieces. Underneath was a Kimchi like salad

Oysters on half shell- oh they are spectacular. No more is needed to say. 

Hitachino ale- what a nice touch to a great meal. I'm not much of a beer drinker but really enjoyed the taste.
author: Judi H.

description:
This place is worth the hype and although it has thousands of reviews, I really need to talk about how I am deeply in love with this place. Next time I am in SF, I am going again and again and again...

PROS:
*The sea bass with garlic soy noodles. GET THIS, you will not regret it. It is cooked to perfection and the fish meat just melts in your mouth like butter. I haven't had anything like this before.
*Deep fried salmon rolls. Excellent execution and cooked to perfection. Lightly fried on the outside and the salmon on the inside was cooked just right, not too dry/raw.
*Aesthetics. The presentation of each dish is creative.

CONS:
*Small place and gets packed quickly, reservations are a must!
author: Stella S.

description: Cool little place by Broadway in North Beach, with great unique Asian fusion dishes. Everything was very good, and i would recommend this heartily to my friends and family.
author: Larry R.

description:
Another year back. With so many choices in SF, it's easy to avoid going to the same place twice, but with the call of a scrumptious sea bass that I devoured last year, I was in. 

I've been super into sea bass lately, with its excellent fluffy texture, that's all I want in life! And you know what? It did not disappoint! I love the soy dipping sauce too, such a great compliment. 

I felt like getting the noodles was also a great option because they're tasty and the ratio they give you is great. Tack onto that a hefty portion of very fresh green beans and I'm won over.

The only thing I did not like was their Malbec choice. It tasted cheap and bland. 

I really enjoy the intimate spot too. Makes you feel all cozy. Add on great food and it's a win!
author: Rachel C.

description:
Food was great! Reason I did not give it 5 stars was because our service was not good . Not sure if waitress  was having a bad day but it seemed like it . We were so excited to be at this place since it had great reviews but the waitress made it a little unpleasant. We asked her about specials and she went so fast at the end we just picked anything . We ordered the Halibut, mussels and grilled octopus.  They were all delicious !  Glad food ended up being great. But then I noticed the table next to us ordered the same thing and a different waitress brought them the same dish with bread and rice ( we did not get bread and rice ) and she said it was complimentary. I was a little offense because I was already uncomfortable about the service and we weren't getting all the extras there's were getting . 
Anyway overall great food if you can manage to get a different waitress without attitude.
author: Gabriela B.

description: Came here on a Friday night because my girlfriend said I couldn't make reservations for this place because it was always booked out of fridays.  called on a monday and boom reservations were set on friday at 7:30.  we ordered a bunch of food and omg everything tasted AMAZING.  she was recommended many times from her coworkers and they say this place is very good so we thought we would try it as well.  NO DISAPPOINT AT ALL..
author: Ben Z.

description: Great food and staff. Amazing spicy kimchi, delicious short ribs and what a desert. Avoid the table next to the door on a chilly night though.
author: Marc S.

description: Yum. Yum. Yum. I have a new found love for garlicky noodles. Be sure to make a rez cuz this spot is always jammed. Be sure to order the white shrimp dumplings, they taste like someone's short lovable grandmother made them!!
author: Erica R.

description: This an interesting Asian fusion small restaurant. The food (seafood is their strength) is excellent with fresh ingredients and a relatively high preparation. Their small plates were the highlight with scallops, dumplings and sashimi scoring very high. Their main dishes are pretty diverse and all very solid. The space is simple, but nice-casual and their service is very good. Highly recommended (not a secret, this place was packed)
author: Carlos V.

description: I always take out-of-town guests here and they all love it! I have tried everything on the menu several times over and all the dishes are well-made and consistent! Cute and cozy!
author: Bell A.

description: Always go here with the friend. He is showed me this place. Would recommend to anyone who loves sandwich and tacos.
author: Vivian D.

description: I don't think I've written a yelp review in 2 years or so, but this meal was too deserving. I've lived in SF for 3 years and I cant believe I didn't know about this restaurant the entire time! If you're still reading this review you should already be making a reservation, best meal I've had in a really long time. Hopefully Surakasha is your server she is great.
author: Jason D.

description: Delicious Asian Fusion food. Dinner was spectacular in true San Francisco fashion. I recommend the mushroom, prawn and shaved boudin rice along with the chicken dumplings. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu along with daily specials. Truly exciting for the refined pallet.
author: Anandy C.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in the city. I've been here many times, and I've never had anything short of an awesome experience. 

My favorite appetizer here is the spicy miso clams. It's a special appetizer, so it's only available sometimes. The spicy miso sauce has a somewhat creamy texture that is perfect for soaking the complimentary garlic bread it comes with. It's to die for. I always order more bread just to dip into it.

The salmon roll is probably the most popular appetizer here, and it's for a reason. It's cooked perfectly every time I come here, and the sauce pairs well it. 

My go to dish is the kurobuta pork chop. The pork chop is cooked medium and has a sweet pomegranate sauce that's just amazing! It comes on top of some mashed potatoes that also pairs well with the sauce.

I've also tried the sea bass, wasabi noodles, and miso cod which are all really good.

The service is good here also. They're pretty attentive, but they could smile a bit more... Other than that, they switch out appetizer forks and all that, which is cool.
author: Derek T.

description:
Checked out The House with a buddy a couple of weeks ago. I hadn't heard of it before but he found it on Yelp so we met for dinner.

It's a pretty small place, packed to the gills. You'll sit close enough to your neighbors to chat with them, which is handy when you're not sure what to order. We received recommendations from the groups on either side of us as well as the waitress, and I have to say that no one steered us wrong.

We sampled three appetizers and two entrees. Great flavors abounded. The only thing that didn't really shine was the fish special that the chef prepared medium done. I took the suggestion because I like to go with the chef's vision, but I have to say that medium was just too cooked for this protein. I had one bite that was more on the medium rare side and it was BY FAR the best bite of that dish. 

Service was really good, too.

I won't have much opportunity to get back here with any frequency because I like on the Peninsula and my wife is soy-allergic, but next time I can escape to the city with a friend I'll definitely try to swing by here again.
author: Jason G.

description:
AWESOME FOOD.  Probably my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  Prices for entrees range from $20-$35 on avg.

Upside:
- Delicious food - season menus and specials make the menu even better!
- Quick service

Downside:
- Very busy...make sure to make reservations
- Street parking, brace yourself to spend 20-30 minutes finding street parking nearby

What to Order:
- Black Cod (on special) - this comes with a California roll
- Mahi mahi (on special) - this comes with lots of veggies and crunchy noodle toppings
- Soft shell crab (seasonal) - delicious appetizer
- Pork chop - cooked so tender that the meat almost melts in your mouth
- Garlic noodles are also pretty awesome
author: Sophie L.

description:
If you are interested in a tasty twist to Asian fusion faire, welcome home.  

This place is small, with an ambiance that offers hard and hideous wooden chairs, tight space between you and your neighbors, and florescent bulbs reminiscent of hanging garage lighting.  However, the service and food are worth the visit.  The garlic noodles, chicken with black bean sauce, and the ribeye are crammed with flavor.   The dish of the day, besides my hot GF, was the mushroom soup drizzled with truffle oil.  

When it comes to Asian food in San Fran, this place takes it to the house.
author: Eric T.

description:
I was going to be the area the next day and decided to search for Asian food. This place popped up in my search and I decided to try it. 

The place itself is small. I came during a busy lunch time but since it was only a table for 2, we didn't have to wait that long. We got seated quickly. I recommend maybe planning ahead and making reservations for parties of bigger than 4. That being said, don't come here bringing a whole mob. This place isn't that big. Parking can be difficult too, but then again so is the rest of SF. 

When we were seated, our server was really nice. She was also very knowledgeable of the dishes they served there. I'm kind of picky, mostly because I have to ask if the food has meat or if it's spicy. She answered all my questions nicely. I also witness her making good recommendations to the table next to us and they loved their food. 

So we needed up ordering the deep fried salmon roll with Chinese hot mustard and wasabi noodles with salmon. The salmon roll was delicious. It reminds me of a salmon eggroll. It has salad on the side which goes well with it. I tried a bit of the hot mustard which gave it extra flavor. Don't put too much if you can't handle spicy foods like me. As for the wasabi noodles, I was really surprised. You can't really taste the wasabi so I enjoyed it. The noodles are fat and chewy. The salmon was really delicious!  It was BBQed and soaked up a lot of the sauce so it was really flavorful. 

This place is great for pescetarians! :) I would recommend it!
author: Kim C.

description: 1 star for rude service. Not expecting excellent service because of the busy restaurant.  Just some civil obedience and social decorum given out free at any Panda Express.  Food was excellent. We ordered several dishes: cod, salmon, steak, tempura, salad, noodles, clams, and other stuff I can't remember. Small restaurant so high noise.  We had a party of 7 and the biggest table in the restaurant. Bad service but was contained to just our waitress. Everyone else seemed very pleasant.  She sped through the specials mumbling and got irritated when I asked her to repeat it again while ordering.  And then she kept dropping off dishes in front of me while I was masticating without telling us what it was and forced me to rearrange the plates on the table. Ordered a wine and a beer - she dropped those off on the other side of the table and had to be passed down to our side.  We assumed that she must be related to the owners or is family given how she acted like she owned the place. Avoid her and still come here for the excellent food (5 )
author: Andy W.

description: Wasabi noodles with flat iron steak amazing. warm kale salad super good! They also do specials every night so best to check what's on that menu too!
author: Sara B.

description:
I paid a visit here just recently as a part of my friend's last hoorah (aka bachelorette party) and had a lovely time here. The food was on point- previously I had mentioned how salty the shrimp risotto was but when my friend ordered that it was perfectly seasoned. My besty ordered a rack of ribs, her sister ordered the steak and I, the sea bass of course.

 Everything was beautifully done and the setting was ultra romantic...men, take it from me and bring your ladeez hurr! But seriously, the steak was probably my favorite part of the meal and I'm not a huge red meat eater and that's saying something.
author: Sheila B.

description:
This has got to be one of the best restaurants in North Beach! This little place is so sweet, and the food is really quite good. 

It is a little crowded inside, and you may wait a bit even with reservations - but it is worth these small inconveniences. The real inconvenience here is that you won't be able to order everything on the menu; which is very likely what you'll want to do after browsing the day's menu offerings. I have been here only a handful of times, and every time I am so surprised by how good it is EVEN when I am expecting it to be good!

The wait staff is very friendly and will probably struggle to help you with recommendations because there are no wrong choices. Service is very fast (you may be on your last bite of appetizers as mains come out), but you won't feel rushed like some other small restaurants.

Finally, don't let the Yelp price discourage you. The $$$ must be in reference to meals ordered with appetizers and alcohol. I went here with a sober date and had one glass of sake myself, and our bill was under $50. That said I definitely don't recommend skipping appetizers! You will and should eat as much as you can here!
author: daria f.

description:
one of the best restaurants i've ever been to! it's a small place but totally worth the wait. so much flavor with eac bite! we got the sea bass with garlic noodles, the salmon egg rolls, and scallops with coconut creme brûlée with passion fruit purée. 

the staff here were amazing! super friendly and super attentive. very fast service. i would definitely recommend coming here! you won't regret it!
author: Jenny Y.

description:
This place has been booked mark for quite some time. And recently I finally had a chance to check it out and I have to say I am very happy it lived up to the recommendation and hype. I came here with my boyfriend after spending the day at the exploratium and walking around the pier so we were both hungry and ready to eat.

Kurobura Pork Chop with Pomegrante Currant Sauce: The pork chop was nicely season but it was a little over cooked in the center which caused it to taste dry.The sauce was really taste and it did help balance out the dryness.

Deep Fried Salmon Rolls: These were good but not great. I did like that the rolls were super crispy and the fish was moist.

Seared Scallops in Sweet Ponzu Sauce: YUM. My only complaint was that there was not enough scallops. The scallops were perfectly seared and the sweet ponzu sauce totally tied the dish together. I would get this dish again.

Bitter Chocolate Truffle Cake with Coffee Ice Cream: We originally wanted the thai tea dessert but they didn't have anymore available so we had to settle for the truffle cake. It dessert was decadent but not sweet enough even with the ice cream.

Overall, I had a really good experience here. The food was satisfying and the service was great. I can't wait to come back to try the other dishes.
author: Judy V.

description:
I had an early dinner at The House on a Friday and it wasn't completely full, at least not yet. Aside from the set menu, I was surprised by all of the specials they had which are waitress shared with us. I wasn't daring enough to try one of them since this was my first visit and ended up ordering from the menu:

--Pickled cucumber: Complimentary and served at the beginning of the meal. Very yummy. 

--Deep-fried salmon roll with chinese hot mustard: Lotsa delicious salmon wrapped in seaweed and an egg roll wrapper. Four pieces are served (two long rolls cut in half). Take it easy on the hot mustard dipping sauce. It can burn your nostrils. 

--Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy: This dish is served with a veggie side plus rice or garlic noodles. We chose the garlic noodles (I like the thick noodles but it could have used more garlic) and the dish came with green beans (cooked perfectly). The sea bass is melt in your mouth goodness. It doesn't really need the garlic ginger soy sauce. The sea bass was the highlight of the meal for me. 

--Warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak: The wasabi noodles weren't overly wasabi-ish so they didn't give that burn but they were tasty. I didn't really care for the cucumber in the dish. The steak was cooked perfectly medium but I much preferred the sea bass. 

--Bittersweet chocolate truffle cake with coffee ice cream and coconut caramel: This dessert tasted like a yummy brownie. The ice cream was a bit icy but the coconut caramel had a nice deep coconut flavor. 

Our waitress was very sweet but I felt like the rest of the wait staff wasn't very friendly and looked almost po'd, especially the gal who greeted us when we entered the restaurant. Very off-putting. If you decide to pay a visit, given the popularity and size of the restaurant, reservations are in order.
author: Maya S.

description:
One of my favorite places to eat in SF.
The restaurant itself is very tiny and cozy. It's a super popular dining spot so expecting a wait all the time is ideal but I promise it'll be worth it. Either you come as early as possible or make reservations. 

I've tried about 90% of the menu and I loved everything. Seriously. I can't say that about much places but I can say that with confidence for the house. The food is always consistent and delicious. Super flavorful and portions are perfect. Everything from the appetizers to the dessert is great. I especially love the picked cucumbers they give you to munch on while you wait for your meal to come. A bit sour but it's so yummy! 

The staff is efficient and friendly. Always on top of their game and constantly checking on you.

You really can't go wrong with this spot. I've been here dozens of times and not once had a mediocre experience. Only downfall is parking. This area blows for parking and that's the only thing that keeps me from coming to dine around here more often.
author: Joanne L.

description: This place is very good. Highly recommended. I would come back again. The wait time is short. Called for reservations. Came in 30 mins early and was seat within 5 mins. This place is packed.
author: Tuan L.

description: Over rated. Food was good. Very American though - everything is salty and sweet. I was there three homes - first and 3rd time didn't have reservation so can't get in. The service for people who don't have reservation was bad. They ignored you for over five mins and finally came to tell you that you have to wait for one hour. Loved the appetizers though. Very tasty and good presentation.
author: Anya C.

description:
I liked it! Went here for lunch. I had the wasabi noodles and M. had the curry noodles. Both were tasty and well executed. Of course there isn't hon-wasabi in the noodles, but whatever they did for flavoring worked for me, although I wouldn't have pegged it as wasabi.

I liked also that they had reasonably priced lunch options. I didn't have to fork out $15, or $20, or $25 for lunch, although there were options. It seems these days like everything is $10 wherever I go, so I might as well get decent food for my money.

The wait staff here was excellent--made eye contact w/in 2 seconds of us walking in the door, had us seated and ordered promptly. Which was good because our time was limited. 

Interesting to note that at ~1pm, it wasn't so hard to find metered street parking. We did see the meter guy on the prowl though, so pay attention.
author: Paul K.

description:
EAT HERE IF YOUR IN SAN FRANCISCO 
Everything tastes fantastic and is super affordable. 

Went here for a birthday dinner and fell in love with this casual asian fusion resteraunt.  We ordered the mussels, scallops, ahi tuna tartare, and salmon rolls. I normally don't even like fish and we all decided to order another round because the food was so good. However, serving size for apps were pretty small to share for 4 people, more designed for two people.  

Entrees we got their special steak and halibut. Then sea bass and like seafood rice thing. It was all amazing. The seafood was as easy as warm butter to cut through. Honestly one of the best meals of my life.  Dessert was just as impressive. 

When the check came for 7 appetizers, 4 entrees, 2 bottles of wine, 1 glass of wine and 4 desserts.  It was only like 300.... which is insanely cheap for how amazing it was

10/10 would recommend. So good you can write home to momma about it
author: Alexander L.

description:
I had high expectations for The House.  Being from Chicago, I expect the Asian food in San Fran to be a good notch up from what we can get here.

The House was good, not great.  I started with the Fried Salmon roll.  The portion size was large, as my boyfriend does not eat salmon.  The roll itself wasn't all that flavorful, but the accompanying mustard sauce packed a punch...and was my favorite part of the dish.  For my entree, I had the Wasabi Noodles with Pork.  The noodles were very tasty - I'd rate them 5 stars, but the pork was overcooked and dry.  My boyfriend had the BBQ chicken sandwich.  It was tasty, though light on the chicken.

I have to think there's better Asian food elsewhere in San Francisco.
author: Christy H.

description:
One of the most reviewed places in San Francisco without a doubt. Unfortunately this fell quite short of expectations.

I didn't have reservations and came around 630. Waited for about 45 minutes which wasn't too bad as I walked over to Quince and had some scrumptious cocktails.

We ordered the Grilled Unagi, the Rib Eye Steak and the Salmon in Miso Broth. The Grilled Unagi was great but the other two dishes were very mediocre and disappointing. I've cooked steaks better than the one I was given at the House. 

In addition the service was bad. One of the waitresses totally forgot that my girlfriend had not ordered her main course and disappeared for 20 minutes before we could get a hold of her again.

Unfortunately from this experience, I do not think I will be visiting this place again for a meal.
author: Ray H.

description: The food was some of the best I've had in my life. My boyfriend took me to sf for my Christmas gift and surprised me by taking me here. We started out with a crab crostini appetizer and for my dinner I got the scallops which were the best seared scallops I've had in my life. My boyfriend got the each of lamb which was delicious as well and for dessert we got the coconut Crete brûlée with a passion fruit topping and mango tapioca pudding! It's a small place and very crowded but so worth it I will definitely be coming back.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Simple concept. Amazing food, simple decor and outstanding service. Will be back again for sure...need to try the house made wasabi noodles!
author: Launa C.

description: We came here and were so excited because it was so hyped up don't fall for like we did. I ordered the Sea Bass which tasted like fish sticks and was the smallest piece of fish I've ever seen.in the plus side the sauce was good , My husband ordered the iron steak and wasabi noodles , he had ordered it med rare and arrived purple. The service is not very friendly. The only positive  to this was that the presentation is beautiful. Other than that don't waste your time. I guess I'm just spoiled with our Scottsdale Eddie V's who knows real Sea Bass
author: Leah F.

description:
Friday night was a reminder of many things, least of which not being how it seems the collective monkey-brain is seduced by the Next Great Thing, often to our great detriment as there are many, many established establishments passed over because they are sans a patina of the embryonic fluid.

This recognized, but for the red asterisk, my portal to the Next Great Thing, the slippery slope that replaces yesterday with tomorrow, but for this I'd not have thought of The House for the lovely evening out with The Men.  I just wouldn't have.  I'd have fancied some other lovely establishment and our evening would have been fabulous simply for the company and I'm sure palates would have been satisfied and as good a buzz established.  

But I browsed the red asterisk for ideas and as I have a passel of friends who know what's what I placed the proper emphasis on the proper things and when I saw The House and the O at the top of the list proffering all her stars my mind was made up.

The House is to me understated elegance.  I've been walking past it for 20 years, never venturing in because I was always on the way from One Place to Another.  The scene never marked itself in an indelible pen perhaps because on this stretch of sidewalk I'm pretty sure 9 times out of 10 I already had half of North Beach in my belly and my mind was on other things.

Not any more.  Thanks to JZ and Rene and the O this is where we ventured Friday for Yet Another Birthday Meal.  Rene in what he wrote does a better job with the foods so all I'll say is we had a battered string bean app with dipping sauce, the black cod special, a pork chop from heaven with smashed taters and asparagrass and the flatiron steak with noodles all washed down with a wine recommended by her name I can't remember I was so happy.

The staff is incredible.

For a change more other diners actually talking though a few were playing Candy Crush instead.  One SLR but she kept the flash off most of the time and her man didn't hide his head in his napkin I should take a page from his playbook.  I hope her pictures were lovely and no, this place is so amazing, it didn't detract from my dining experience one iota.  

It wasn't on purpose that I didn't try any of the dishes She recommended but perhaps that's kismet.  As now we can go back and it will be almost new.  Old and new together.  Perfect company, I think.
author: Markus N.

description: This is, without question, the best Chinese food I've ever eaten in my life. As a New York City native, I've traveled to Hong Kong, been to Chinatowns all over the world; nothing gets close.  The Seabass with Ginger noodles was the best I've ever had. The scallops were also completely out of this world. Not to be missed.
author: Harvey W.

description:
This was one of the best meals I've had all year. Asian food can either be one of the most incredible or lackluster meals. This meal came through like Lebron in game 7 (I had to do this since its an SF resto and I loved watching the GSWs lose lol) ... highlight after highlight and one unforgettable moment which was the Garlic Noodles that came along with the SeaBass.  Those noodles were some of the best I've ever had.

I love quaint and understated restaurants like this. I'd recommend this as the go to resto for anyone visiting SF.
author: Parham N.

description:
What: Dinner Date Night

Eats: appetizers-deep fried salmon rolls & hamachi; entrees: sea bass & ahi special

Takes: You can't go wrong with the salmon rolls. Their crispy outside is reminiscent of a lumpia/egg roll wrapper. Just beware of the spicy mustard dipping sauce; you may feel the spicy sensation in your nose! Hamachi and ahi each gave a plentiful helping of fish. The complimentary pickled veggies complemented both dishes. However, the sea bass was the hands down favorite of the meal. Succulent. The seasoning:sea bass ratio was on point! You get enough flavor without losing the natural meat of the fish. The sea bass is served with a choice of rice or noodles and green beans.

Service: Our waitress definitely took care of us. She even made sure we got our check right away when we mentioned that we had to leave ASAP since something came up.

Price: Appetizers range from $10-$12 depending what you get. The sea bass is the more expensive entree at $27, but that was definitely worth it for the quality of fish we had eaten.

Ambiance: Modern. Most diners wore casual attire while we were dressy. This is a great romantic spot for your date. It does get a bit loud, but really, the food speaks for itself.

Tips: Make a reservation beforehand. It is a small restaurant. 

Bottom line: Go here for your dates in the city!

Highly recommended.
author: Jash P.

description:
No idea what the hype is about. Waited 1.5 hours, no reservation. Ordered a salad and a main and got the salad in an hour--not spicy and with tiny pieces of grilled shrimp--and nothing else but our drinks. Our server came by and asked if we had everything, nope missing that sea bass. No apologies, no description of our entree once it came. Nothing from management when they came to grab our plate with tons of food still on it.

Sea bass didn't have any flavor aside from salt, was served with a super salty sauce that wasn't explained and then upon explanation it was conveyed to us not to use it. Why put it on the plate man? The noodles tasted full of sodium and the green beans were the only semi decent thing on the plate. Nothing done by anyone we were in at 9pm and not out till nearly 11 and all we ordered was two drinks, a main and an appetizer. 

TL; DR The food was bad, service was worse and the wait was epic. You're better off grabbing a slice of pizza or anything else. They may treat you like they treated us (like poop) and honestly there's much better Asian food in the city to be had.
author: Zaviera R.

description:
One of the best asian fusion and home-y restaurants in the city. The only downside of this restaurant is they do not take online reservations so hopefully you can manage to get them on the phone to secure a reservation.

For appetizers I would suggest starting off with the oysters.

For the main courses I loved the grilled chicken breast (organic) with the black bean mushroom sauce. It melts in your mouth and very flavorful and cooked perfectly. I would also try the ribs - great sauce, slightly sweet and great texture added to it.

The place is relatively small so I would recommend going there with a group of less than 5-6 and get ready to do some hot yoga while you're dining (gets a little hot).

The food is amazing, service is great, and the atmosphere is very cozy. This place is a gem in north beach and must visit.
author: Kunal T.

description:
Petite restaurant with great tasting food.

I came here prior to a concert to have dinner. A reservation was made for 8pm on a Friday night. I was sorta lost trying to find this place. My GPS took me around the block a couple times. I was able to find parking at the North Beach garage and hoofed it for a couple blocks.

When I arrived, the reservation that was set at 8pm was right on time. The host was very friendly and the table already prepared. I already had a good feeling about this restaurant since it had been non stop busy here. I tok a glance at the menu and was interested in a few items. For my meal, I went with:

Appetizer:
Calamari

Main dish:
Warm wasabi noodles with flatiron steak

The dishes were served separately, which was a good thing for me. The calamari came with a quarter cut lemon and a small side of seaweed/nori salad. I garnished the calamari with the lemon and tasted my first piece. Crispy, chewy and tangy is what flavors partook in that bite. 

After enjoying the appetizer, the main course was brought out. A nicely plated entree was served before my eyes. As for the taste of the entree matched how it looked. The steak was cooked to my favorite style, medium rare. Tender and juicy and well paired with noodles. When you think of wasabi, you think of hot. It wasn't the case here. I did taste the wasabi, but no burn. The noodles were soft and separated easily from each other. This dish was also served with the seaweed/nori salad. A unique taste, but I really did enjoy them in both dishes.

I really recommend coming here. Great food and staff. Be sure to call and make a reservation. This place gets busy and you may be waiting a long time if you walk-in.
author: Jay G.

description: Absolutely incredible food. Words cannot describe how perfect each of the flavors complement each other in all of the dishes. We tried 4 separate entrees and all 4 are in the top 10 foods I've ever tasted (and I'm a foodie!!) You MUST try this restaurant
author: Will P.

description:
Let me start off by saying that after reading reviews on here, my expectations may have been too high going in. It was overall good, but it didn't live up to the hype. 

My boyfriend and I drove into SF from Napa for the day and he read about this restaurant so we made reservations at 5:30. This restaurant reopens for dinner at 5:30 so we had no problem getting a table right away. Tables filled up quickly so be sure to make a reservation if you want to go at peak dinner hours. 

We started off with the shrimp and chive dumplings. These were really good but the best part was the sauce you dip it in. Wow, so much flavor. I would order these again. 

We knew we were going to share a meal because we literally spent the whole day eating our way through SF. We narrowed it down to the ahi tuna or wasabi noodles with flat iron steak. The waiter suggested we get the wasabi noodles so that's what we went with. From looking around the restaurant, I would say 90% of the people ordered either the flat iron wasabi noodles or the soy glazed sea bass. These were obviously the most popular items. 

The flat iron was cooked to perfection but the noodles were a bit greasy for my liking. The flavor was decent but it didn't wow me. 

We also shared the apple crumble pie which was really good. The crust tasted like heaven and the apple slices were cut bigger than what I'm used to and I liked that. 

I wouldn't make it a priority to come back here but j would try it again.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Walked in for dinner at 9 pm on a Friday night and only waited about 10 min for a table. The restaurant is super small and compact which adds to the experience. The neighborhood is super trendy, between Chinatown and Little Italy. The food was AMAZING! Had the unagi for appetizer which was incredibly delicious with a great texture. The off menu items all sounded awesome, and we decided on the Kobi ribs which were to die for. Overall great Asian fusion restaurant with hipster crowd. Plenty of bars nearby to hop to afterwards.
author: Katherine L.

description:
600th review goes to the lovely House that is settled right in the little neighborhood of North Beach!

The House is extremely small, dimly lit and intimate with a required reservation if you are planning to dine there during the peak lunch and dinner hours.  However, with the limited seating, The House surely offers delightful Asian fused American entrees that comforts the palate and satisfies your stomach, undeniably.

The House hosts best with a date of 2 or a group of no more than 4!

The Sea Bass entree with Asian noodles and signature house soy sauce is my all time, classic favorite from here.

Let''s just put it this way - the presentation for any dishes that you order up from here, looks and tastes delectable, such as their nicely Seared Ahi Tuna, fresh Raw Oysters and flavorful Mussels in Tomato Sauce.

The servers here seem like they have been working around the clock and scrambling around in this cozy dining space.  I'm not surprised because this place is popular.

A lovely House that shelters and provides homely entrees that you just can't quite find anywhere else!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I honestly wasn't as impressed as everyone else was with the food here. It all was just OK. Honestly the best part to me was the  spicy, tangy, pickled cucumber palate starter. I got the salmon wraps, the special of the day which was sashimi, and that noodle thing with albacore on top. All just OK.
author: Roya A.

description:
I finally checked off The House from my bookmarks.  It was a long overdue visit because I've been to North Beach so many times but The House always came as an afterthought with so many places to eat over there.
