It usually wouldn't cross my mind until I eventually  would walk by it on my way out of North Beach.  So with me dining solo, getting a table was really easy that I didn't have to make reservations.

Because of yelp, it pretty much became a no-brainer for what I wanted to order:  The Salmon Rolls and the Wasabi Noodles.

Deep-Fried Salmon Roll with chinese hot mustard -- http://bit.ly/1blYVdl
I ate these with an open mind.  I do eat salmon regularly, but never prepared this manner.  They were really good!  For an appetizer, the portion size for this was pretty big.  I was almost full after finishing.  But I had to press on and move to my main course.

Warm Wasabi House Noodles with angus flatiron steak -- http://bit.ly/1blZ0xJ
The noodles were actually sweeter than I thought they'd be and really had just a subtle taste of wasabi.  A little disappointing but still good.  What really saved this dish was the angus flatiron steak.  It was cooked perfectly and and seasoned well.

The House has lived up to the hype for me.  Creative and tasty dishes, service was on point, and a great atmosphere.  Definitely worth going back again.
author: Rodney H.

description: Great lunch option, little to no wait compared to dinner - with the same menu. The food and the service is consistently excellent. You cannot go wrong with the daily specials.
author: John W.

description:
I DO NOT understand all these great reviews... I DO NOT understand all these great reviews... I DO NOT understand all these great reviews...

Now that I got that off my chest... I was brought here for my birthday by a few of my friends. It's a nice, very small, Asian-fusion-y type of place, with what seems like a cult-like following by the locals. With all of these 5-star reviews it's not going to matter much what I say. So I'll just say the food here is strictly average- below average for the neighborhood. And I tried everyone's dish- same result.

With the size of the restaurant, the location, the wait, the parking, the food, etc... I would never go back.
author: Art C.

description:
I had lunch  today  with my friends. The food was good, but  little salty. The staff were very  friendly and nice.
I really enjoyed the lunch today
I am recommend to people who are like very good food, warm service, and nice downtown  restaurants. 
The problem is the parking.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Amazing amazing amazing food!!! I came here with my family to celebrate my birthday and I was quite suprised at how small this restaurant is! It was a full house and a line of people out the door but luckily we has reservations! The service was excellent and with the amount of people in the restaurant we got our food pretty quick. And the owner was nice enough to give us a clam appetizer on the the house :)

Appetizers: 
-deep fried salmon roll- good but watch out for the wasabi sauce!! 
-asparagus- sooo good!!!! But it's served cold so beware 
-fried calamari- fried calamari is never a disappointment 
-steamed mussels: amazing and I usually hate mussels 

Entrees:
-sea bass: melt in your mouth goodness!! Get it with garlic noodles!!
- kaurobuta pork chop: very flavorful 
-mahi mahi with shrimp curry: yummy!!
But the best item we ordered was definitely the angus ribeye steak! Everything about it was perfect. 

Dessert we had the mango pudding, chocolate truffle cake, and apple pie a la mode. I thought the mango pudding  was the best out of the three. It was beautifully presented and tasted just as good as it looked! 

I can't wait to plan my next meal here! Next time I'll have to try their lunch menu
author: Linz C.

description: The food here was fine, but the service was horrible. We ordered 3 entrees, and the 3rd entree came 30 minutes later than everything else. I asked the waiters at least 3 times for the missing entree, but none of them tried to speed things up or communicate with the kitchen.
author: Betty T.

description: Excellent food.  Get the black cod in miso sauce! Actually everything we tried was great: unagi app, ahi tuna poke, bay scallops, oysters on the half shell.
author: C C.

description:
Call ahead the day of to ask for a reservation, so that you can avoid the wait

Small restaurant in the midst of Chinatown and Little Italy, but the food is pretty phenomenal. Quality at a decent price (Entree's are ~$20-25)is definitely worth returning too. Came here for the first time last weekend, while looking for a restaurant that opens late. My friend and I were both quite impressed.

Entree's range are average portioned, meaning they're large enough to be filling but not so much that you'll have leftovers. We left quite satisfied after 1 appetizer and 2 entree's. 

Since it was our first time, we looked upon our fellow yelpers for advice. Everything was delicious!

If this is your first time, I recommend getting The House's signature dishes:

Fried salmon roll: yes, indeed, it's a deep fried salmon sushi roll (no rice). Absolutely divine---crispy seaweed on the outside, marked by tender and slightly sashimi salmon on the inside. The appetizer comes with 4 rolls to share, fyi.

Wasabi house noodles with steak: it's pretty good! I was a bit skeptical, as always when restaurants try to fuse wasabi with American flavors. It's either shadowed in the dish or overwhelming. The House has somehow figured out how to incorporate the pleasant spiciness of wasabi into their soy-glazed udon noodles. Wasabi added a great taste to the dish. The steak was not necessary to accompany the noodles, but added a delightful star to the dish. It was well cooked, medium-rare done right! Even though the steak lacked a little in flavor, the wasabi noodles played well with it

Grilled Sea Bass: O.M.F.G. probably one of the best sea bass's I have had. Quite possibly comparable the sea bass, I have had at a michelin restaurant. It's so freaking tender, soft enough to literally melt your mouth. You shouldn't even bite it, just let your tongue melt at it's beautiful texture. It was wonderful. It's served with sauteed green beans and either fried udon noodles (I recommend) or rice. DELICIOUS. I can't wait to have it again!
author: Jenny Z.

description: The House is a really great restaurant with delicious food.  The charred Spanish octopus salad had a good flavor, with pork skin and red chili vinaigrette.  The warm wasabi house noodles with flatiron angus steak was tasty but a little spicy for some people.  The Kurabuta pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce was very delicious as the combination of the pork and the sauce is very tasty.
author: Jason G.

description:
I had dinner on Saturday night.
I tried to make reservation  for 5 pm
The gal that answered the phone would not take a reservation but told me first come first served.
I arrived at 5 ....;Restaurant was empty
I picked any table: 
Long story short.i liked the free cucumbers that were given instead of bread .
They were good ,I asked for extra,the waitress said the price was 4 dollars ,for a very small portion of cucumbers 
I Paid 2.00 for 4 large cucumbers today at at the grocery.
I also asked for extra ginger and wasabi for a sushi roll That cost 1 extra dollar . Really !?!?
I own several restaurants in the Bay Area, and would never think of charging my customers for basic items like these. 
The food was good but I don't like to be nickeled and dimed. By the way, they charged 8 dollars per draft beer. If you go next Doir to the bar, drinks are 3.50 .
No I won't return
author: Jeff G.

description: Service was great, but for all the hype this food is just okay. Expensive for average food ):
author: Tessa W.

description:
Came here on a Monday night for my boyfriend's birthday and it was a great experience. I made reservations at 8pm ahead of time bc I was reading reviews saying it's best to make reservations since it gets packed which was true! Parking wasn't too bad on a Monday but it does get difficult finding parking by North Beach so get there early if you can. 
Service was great, we got seated right at 8pm. It's a small cozy restaurant. We started off ordering 3 different appetizers  (my bf eats alot lol). We had the ahi tuna, the octopus salad and the shrimp salad. They were all tasty and made my tummy happy.  For the main course I had the pork chop with the pomegranate sauce my boyfriend had the grilled miso seabass. The sauce for my pork chops was on point! It's sweet but it's perfect with the pork chop. Both portions were a good size and we got to try each others dishes.
Finally, we ordered desserts! I know, we're fatasses but how can we skip dessert! All the pictures I saw on yelp made me wanna eat them! I had the coconut creme brulee and my boyfriend had the raspberry cheese cake  (the special). I told our waitress it was my boyfriend's birthday so she put a candle on his which was nice. Both desserts were so good! Creme brulee is one of my all time favorite desserts and definitely had me wanting more even tho I was full. My boyfriend's cheesecake was yummy too and it looked fancy with the little swirly designs that was on there. 
Overall I had a great time at the House and I definitely will be back again! Nom nom nom
author: Monica W.

description:
Great food and prices for lunch! Unique flavors and lovely presentation. Only downside was slow and inattentive service but would still definitely recommend!

On Thursday, we made a reservation earlier that morning for lunch for a party of five. About half the restaurant was full, and it seemed like some tables were being held for other reservations. We were seated near the door - it was quite a cold day, so the wind got in whenever the door was open, which was quite often... 

As for service, our waitress was soft spoken and when she told us the daily specials, she kept firming her head, making it extremely hard to hear her. She also forgot many of the things we asked her for: water refills, dessert menu, and extra bowls. The other server ended up helping us get those things.

The salmon roll ($11) was a delicious appetizer. The salmon was cooked perfectly and fried. The wasabi sauce also complemented it very well. It came with some spicy, preserved vegetables. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! 

The shitake soup ($10), which was one of the specials,  was also great! Strong flavor, perfect for mushroom lovers!

The curry noodles with prawns ($16) was a great combination of flavors - it had a kick of spiciness and some coconut taste. 

The house wasabi noodles with pork ($12) also had a kick and interesting sauce! The pork was cooked just right. We also got those noodles with salmon ($14). Once again, perfectly cooked. 

The flat iron steak with a mushroom sauce ($20) came with mushrooms, mashed potatoes, greens, edamame beans, and crunchy cabbage on top. Great tasting and lovely presentation. 

For dessert, the mango tapioca ($7) had just the right amount of sweetness. Would also highly recommend!

The chocolate and macademia nut tart with coffee ice cream ($8.50) was one of the special desserts. It tasted like a brownie baked in a pie crust. Probably the one dish that you can skip. It wasn't very outstanding or unique compared to the other dishes. 

While service was lacking, the food was so great and unique for very reasonable prices.
author: Grace C.

description:
3000+ reviews...so I'll keep it short and simple.

Here's my two cents:
1) Get a reservation!
2) They only hold reservations for 10 minutes. They'll give your table away if you're later than that.Get there early because parking is tough!
3) They have specials that are not on the menu! Be open to other dishes! I ended up getting the sashimi sampler ($17)
4) I wouldn't come back for the wasabi noodles. It was basically stirfry noodles with a hint of wasabi. The pork chop, however, was cooked to perfection! 
5) Dessert was the cherry on top! The mango tapioca is creamy and delicious!
author: Fanny H.

description:
Came here for a super late dinner on a Friday night. It was packed! The restaurant is really small and there's barely any elbow room. Waited for 45 minutes but in the end it was worth it. We waited around because we were visiting and not sure when the next opportunity would role around. 

I tried their warm wasabi noodles with grilled flank steak and it was quite amazing. Had soo much flavor! It was a little on the pricy side but it was absolutely delicious. I would highly recommend it!! Staff was also very friendly and attentive. 

Definitely coming back (with a reservation next time) to try other things on the menu.

PS not the ideal place if you're looking for a quiet romantic dinner date. Since it's so small it's pretty loud and tables are quite close to each other.
author: Antonio T.

description: This is a small restaurant not fancy, however the food is amazing. Great quality and presentation. One of my favs in SF.
author: Ellen K.

description: Very Recommend visit with friend and some on special for check something new Italian dishes and very Tasty !
author: Marina S.

description:
It was a cozy birthday celebration for our friend and we wanted to surprise her, but as it turns out, she's been here plenty of times. #surprisefail.

I can't deny the deliciousness from everything we had here. Asian fusion is a cuisine that's hard to get right. And they got it right at The House as attested by 3,000+ reviews! 

The wasabi noodles with flat iron steak. The roasted chicken with white truffle sauce. The deep fried chicken liver. The massive portion of that garlic studded rib eye. MMMeat! :) 

I didn't like the lukewarm service. Or the non-smiling staff. Or the fact that their dishes are a tad overpriced. 

I'd rather dine at my own home.
author: Janice C.

description: I absolutely love this place. The seafood here (and everything else is cooked to perfection). We came here with a party of 4 with reservations on a Saturday night. Reservations are recommended! There were a lot of walk ins but the wait seemed like they were more than an hour. The place is small dark and cramped but it wasn't too horrible. We got the Salmon deep fried roll, scallops appetizer, wasabi noodles, salmon, ahi tuna and the miso cod. Everything was great!! We all love the scallop appetizer, that was seriously the best scallop dish I have had in a while. I seriously cant wait to come back. Its been a while since I have been to a restaurant and everything we order was great! They definitely deserve to get all the recognition that they are receiving. If you love food this place is a must!
author: Eileen H.

description:
This was one of the first meals I had as a California resident! 

The salmon egg rolls were absolutely delicious, and the dipping sauce was on point. Hands down best innovated concept of egg rolls I've ever had.   I also had the salmon with warm wasabi noodles. The salmon was cooked perfectly, but I do wish there was more of a wasabi kick to the noodles. But the overall dish came together nicely.

I came here late afternoon, so luckily there wasn't a wait. 

I must revisit for dinner and try the dessert! =)
author: Noelle H.

description:
It gets a little crazy in here during dinnertime, but it's a relaxed spot for lunch. 

We ordered:
* grilled Chinese chicken salad
* deep-friend salmon roll
* steamed shrimp Chinese chive dumplings
* poke

My friend even indulged with a glass of white wine.

North Beach remains an oasis from the work week.
author: Cecelia Y.

description: This is a restaurant that my husband and I go to for special occasions. We have never had a bad meal here. The restaurant is small but they do not have a problem with quick service. I think this is mainly due to the fact that they do not allow people to come late for their reservations. If you miss your time, you miss your time. This is respectable since they always have a line of people hoping to be fit in. This restaurant has very good food. One dish in particular I crave and think about often, beef wasabi noodles. You can tell the noodles hit a super hot wok and they are slightly smoky and earthy and spicy. The steak is cooked perfectly. Honestly the dish is perfection and a must try.
author: Carla K.

description:
This is probably one of the best date night restaurants you can find in SF. Amazing food, reasonable prices, and great ambiance.

I'm a pretty traditional Chinese food eater and most fusion food taste somewhat offensive to me - too much fusion and not enough Asian. It was not the case at all with House.

Stuff to try:
* Tuna tartare - good consistency and texture, nice deviation of the usual tartares.
* Sea bass - very nicely cooked, not too tender or tough. has a nice natural sweetness that really makes the bass shine.
* Pork chop - nicely cooked, not dry or tough at all. sauce and flavoring is fusion style and very delicious.
* Fried salmon roll - somehow these are deep fried and yet the salmon is still nice and juicy and raw on the inside. Definitely worth a try.

Their wine menu is also very reasonably priced and have some of the best wines locally from Napa. Had a great grenache to go with the sweet pork chop for $8. Very reasonable.

Dinner for two came out to be around $100 with appetizer and wine, tax and tip included. For SF prices, it's really worth the money.

The restaurant is very small and intimate. Most tables only seat 2-4 and are placed very close to each other. Be sure to call a few days in advance or get a reservation via OpenTable. You'll receive a call reminding you the night before.
author: Daniel D.

description:
I've been trying to go to this place for a while now. I heard the wait was always really long but totally worth it. I made reservations a week prior to my visit and I'm glad that I did. I arrived about 10 minutes before my reservation to check in and was seated within that time. The place is very small. The environment is very loud and tables are very close to each other.

Here's what I tried:
-Deep Fried Salmon Roll - I love how the rolls came out. Perfectly deep fried with a crispy outside and the salmon was soft and still a little raw in the center. This came with some type of hot mustard sauce. I'm usually not a big fan of hot mustard, but it went perfectly with the roll. Just don't douse roll in the sauce.

-Black cod special with California roll - This was one of their specials that's not listed on their menu. The first bite I took, I feel like I was dreaming. The cod just melted in my mouth and was full of flavor. My favorite dish of the night.

-Sea Bass with soy ginger - I love eating sea bass and the sauce that came with it was delicious! It also came with string beans and a choice from mash potatoes, noodles, or rice. I picked the mash.

-Wasabi noodles with flat iron steak - I really liked the noodles in this dish. I ordered the steak medium rare and it came out a little more on the rare side. No big deal for me though. The steak however was very difficult to cut and a little chewy. The more cooked pieces at the ends were a little easier to eat. The noodles definitely saved this dish.

Overall, everything was was very good. With everything I ordered, all the plates were licked clean. Biggest tip I can give is make reservations early.
author: Michael C.

description: This is a pretty small restaurant. It got kind of cramped and stuffy but the food was good overall. I recommend the soft shell crab appetizer, pomegranate pork chops and the creme brule for dessert ! I also ordered wine but it came out warm.. Tasted pretty weird so we asked the waiter to chill it. The waiter gave it back to us a few minutes later and it still tasted the same :/ the prices are decent, not too expensive. I would come back to try more things on the menu! Be sure to make reservations! Good food, small restaurant = most likely you'll have to wait.
author: Bailey L.

description:
Delicious!! 

Make sure to make reservations because this place is tiny!
Small dishes are pretty small, but the entrees are decently sized!

We tried the:

Salmon roll - 5 stars. DELICIOUS. One my favorite items
Hamachi special appetizer - 4 stars. Small portions, but high quality
Baby octopus and pork skin salad - 4 stars. Not quite a healthy salad, but good! They do skimp out on the octopus though :(
Skirt steak with wasabi noodles - 3 stars. This was good, but not as great as yelp hyped it up to be
Rock cod special - 4 stars. Good, but weird with the sushi on top.

Anyways... overall it was good! A definite must try.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Tons of room for improvement when it comes to Service!  Food about 3.5 stars but the service dropped this rating down!

Short, thin, asian woman had no personality--at least with our table!!  Cordial, smile, and pour wine for a neighboring table but none of this courtesy to us?  How rude!  We are tourists.  We travel with bank roll saved, are happy people not caring of the stresses of the real world, and tip generously!  Turn your frown upside down and smile!  

Enough ranting on the deplorable service.

Food here is a mixed bag.  Asian Fusion in SF can't stack up to Hawaii's top shelf asian fusion eateries--at least The House doesn't... yet...

Special on this night--oysters in bbq sauce.  Sorry, bbq sauce & oyster, not a good combo.  Back to the drawing board on this app...  Pass on this folks.

Salmon rolls were good.  They worked wasabi into this app, and it worked well.  This would be a safe pick for most patrons.

Crab cakes also had wasabi, but I didn't think it enhanced this dish.  OK on the crab crakes.

Sea bass was excellent.  Can't miss entree!

Pork chop was too sweet. Too much teriyaki sauce?  Where is the balance?!

Coconut creme brulee too runny. Our stiff server acknowledged, "the creme brulee is a little loose tonight."  We expressed our displeasure with the creme brulee and she responds COLDLY, "Ohh I had it removed from your bill" and briskly walked off...

If service was stellar, it would have improved on our overall experience, but instead it dragged it down.

Definitely not worth a repeat visit in my book.  =(
author: Mark H.

description:
If it wasn't for my old co-worker, I would probably never have discovered The House. It's been around for a while, and based on chatting with other friends, things haven't really changed over the years. Food is great, in fact, pretty amazing, but service isn't the greatest.

The House is a small joint in North Beach. It can't really accommodate large groups well. Reservations are recommended, and even with a reservation, you may need to wait a few minutes.

Recommend everything that we ordered, and of course, we were overzealous and ordered more than we could even handle.
*Deep Fried Salmon Roll
*Grilled Octopus
*Soft Shelled Crab
*Black Cod
*Scallop
*Wasabi Noodles with Flat Iron Steak

Even though 6 dishes among 3 people may seem like not that much, it ended up actually being a ton and we were STUFFED!

We were impressed by every savory dish that we had so it only made sense that we had to check out dessert. Unfortunately, dessert was underwhelming.

As far as service goes, it was just a little strange...staff was very attentive, kept refilling our water, and kept trying to clear our plates even before we were done with each one. They even seemed confused when we weren't ready to give up our plates. Was this a sign of getting us rushed out of the restaurant?

It's a toss up between a 3 and 4 star rating. What trumps - amazing food or awkward service?
author: Audrey C.

description:
The House had been on my "must eat here" list for eons. It is always so busy, that I usually give up when I hear that it will be 1 to 2 hrs before I can get a table.

Tonight however was different, I was on a early schedule and got a table just before 6pm with no wait at all.

So with all this built up anticipation, did it live up to the hype? You bet and some extra!!! 

What an awesome place. The food is asian fusion done really well. I followed yelp advice and had the Salmon Rolls, Chilean Sea Bass, and Flat Iron steak with Wasabi noodles. They were all amazingly good.

Also tried the evening special an Unagi roll and the shrimp dumplings. These two were good but not in the same class as their signature dishes.

I also found out they do take phone reservations which I had not known previously. A reservation certainly beats waiting forever for a table. With this nee found knowledge I am sure I will be back soon.
author: David T.

description:
Holy jamoles- that skirt steak on top of the wasabi noodles is unforgettable.  Super tender and flavorful, cooked perfectly...I don't know how they got it so flavorful but it was the best part of the dish.  The wasabi noodles themselves were pretty good too, not as spicy/wasabi-y as I expected but it was really good.

We also got their miso cod which was delicious- it tasted like butter melting in your mouth, perfectly cooked again.  It was served on top of some greens.  They put a whole CA sushi roll on top which didn't add much to the dish but I appreciated it because it made the dish more filling.

Dessert was disappointing, I would skip it altogether.  I ordered their mango tapioca pudding thinking it would be creamy but it was a gelatinous mush that tasted stale/old with mango jelly on top (no chunks of real mango).
author: Jenny H.

description:
I admit that I was skeptical. I was wrong -- this place is all that and a bag of chips!! I thought it was one of those Chinese joints that fool white people because everything is super salty and deep fried, alas, the food here is expertly prepared and full flavored (and not just salt, either!).

The hubby took me here for my birthday. We shared the fried salmon rolls, the baby octopus salad for appetizers and had the pork chops and wasabi noodles with steak for the mains.

The salmon rolls were super crispy on the outside and the fish wasn't over cooked. It didn't taste greasy either. The dipping sauce had a nice kick and the little side salad provided some respite from the deep fried goodness. 

The octopus salad had amazing flavor, although light on the octopus. They should call it a salad topped with baby octopus instead of octopus salad to adjust expectations. The crispy pork rinds gave it nice flavor and crisp. If I could do it again, I probably wouldn't order it and go for something else.

Sadly for me, the highly of the night is the wasabi noodles (such a peasant at heart!). The wasabi was subtle and there were some chilis, too, to give the noodles some bark. The texture of it was perfect and not too greasy. The slivers of cucumber was a nice touch. The steak was simply seasoned so it wouldn't clash with the noodles. All those people that rave about the dish are absolutely spot-on!!

The hubby mentioned that he's generally not a fan of pork chops, but he loved his dish, probably the best pork chops ever! The sauce is pretty sweet, though not cloyingly so, and compliments the natural sweetness of the swine. The whole kernels of pomegranate provided a bit of crunch and is visually appealing. The sides were simple -- mashed potatoes and blanched asparagus, which allowed the pork and sauce to sing.

Altogether, this is one of the better meals in SF. The prices are reasonable and the service was hands off. The food comes out very quickly, even though the place was busy. The service is nothing to sing about, but the food more than makes up for it. Can't wait to come back again :).
author: Alice W.

description:
This place didn't blow me away with invented flavors or seriously yummy entrees. We had the salmon egg rolls, pork chop in Thai sauce, and noodles
With skirt steak. As foodies, me and my husband felt that we could have made these at home (we live in LA-OC). I didn't really get their concept and the wait was way to long
author: Melanie L.

description:
Good food, rude staff and absolutely horrible seating. We were seated at a table with no more than 6 inches of space on either side, with the waitress constantly bumping and knocking into my food, body and shoes. There was a nice spacious table next to us that we weren't seated at for some reason, but the next two folks who arrived were.

Definitely won't be back until they expand a little bit or accommodate for smaller parties.
author: Edwin N.

description:
I am always incredibly impressed by this place. Very affordable for delicious well-portioned food. Brings Asian fusion to a completely new level. The small restaurant has quite a lovely atmosphere and from my experience has great service. Went on a whim and was unable to make a reservation, but just walked in on a Sunday evening (8/30) at 7pm with three other friends, put our name down, walked over to 15 Romolo for a quick drink, and a table was ready for us upon returning! Although it is Burning Man week so I wouldn't recommend always counting on the same experience.

We started with the deep fried salmon roll, which was pretty standard as far as the roll goes, but what really made the appetizer was its Chinese hot mustard that had the perfect wasabi ratio. Asked to keep the remainder of it even after finishing the roll 

For our entrees we got the flat iron steak with wasabi noodles, which I ordered on my last visit and got it again simply because I was craving it. Those noodles are to die for. The best part of this dish is that the portion size is huge, especially considering that it is the cheapest entree on the menu. I was more than satisfied afterward. 

My favorite of the night was the Kurobuta Porkchop my friend ordered. It was tender, cooked perfectly, and served with this delicious pomegranate currant sauce. Although I do hope that management reads this and takes this into consideration: the mashed potatoes it was served with was ATROCIOUS!! I would go as far to say that KFC mashed potatoes are better, which is a tad embarrassing for a restaurant of your echelon.

Other noteworthy dishes: The creme brulee with a passionfruit puree is mind-blowing. The sea bass we've ordered in the past has also been another favorite.
author: Andrea D.

description: So far one of my favorite places in San Fran. The food was amazingly delicious with complex flavors. We started with the soft shell crab special, beautifully displayed. Also had the Octopus and shrimp and chive dumplings. All very good. I had the Warm Wasabi noodles and Flatiron steak. Again, decadent flavors. Good mix of Kim Chi for texture and  the steak melted in your mouth. The space is small so make reservations! Overall fabulous.
author: H. H.

description:
It's been a while since I've eaten here, but from what I remember it was pretty good...not off the charts, good enough to go back.:)
I remember the salmon rolls were really good:)
author: Al T.

description:
My family's favorite restaurant ever. Period. We've been going here for years now and are never disappointed. And that's saying a lot because everyone is picky. First off, always get a reservation!! They are always busy and the restaurant itself is tiny so getting a table will take a while without a reservation. Even went on a Monday night and there was a couple people waiting outside the door. 

I highly recommend the deep friend salmon rolls, miso black cod, and the pork chops with the pomegranate sauce. The black cod is cooked so perfectly and the pomegranate sauce on the pork chops is absolutely amazing! Service is great too, everyone is very friendly and professional. 

If you are trying to impress someone with amazing food while in SF, definitely go here.
author: Christina N.

description:
A very small restaurant that is so inconspicuous that you might miss it if you weren't paying attention. I had a reservation here to meet with some friends for dinner. We arrived at our reservation time and we proceeded inside. The place is cozy to say the least. Very small and at one point we could have been elbow to elbow with the table next to us. We were a party of 5 so the seating arrangement in the back was a little awkward so one person in our party had their back on the table next to us.

The service was good. As each course came out we were given explanations as to what we ordered which was nice to hear. We started with oysters and they were fresh, salty and fishy. Just the way I like them. The vinegar sauce that was paired with it was a little spicy. Other than that, just your regular oysters. We also got the salmon roll. The salmon inside was a little dry and bland. The sauce that paired with it was a mustard sauce of some sort which was okay.

For entrees I got the fish and my girlfriend got the beef with wasabi noodles. The fish was moist and tender and paired well with the green beans and noodles (no wasabi). Even though the skin had a little char on it it didn't take away from the flavor which was nice. If anything it enhanced it for me. For my girlfriend's dish the beef was cooked to a perfect medium rare and for the noodles, I appreciated the wasabi taste but at times it was too overbearing. 

We finished our night with one of each dessert from the menu to split. We had the creme brulee which was pleasant. The custard was made well and the sugar on top was not burnt. Well done. We also had a thai tea pana cotta which was to die for. I love the flavor profile of thai tea and this dessert had it. I can't recall the other one we had but it was okay from what i remember.

All in all the service was good, the food had good flavors but there were just a few execution flaws which prompts a 4 star rating. Good place to try once.
author: Jeromy G.

description: The House is quite small and a bit cramped, but certainly worth trying for excellent Asian fusion cuisine.  I recommend sharing a few plates among the table, especially the eel from the appetizer menu.  I am not sure when I will be back in San Fran, unfortunately, but I would certainly return to this restaurant.
author: Caroline B.

description:
Finally came here on a Friday night after hearing so much about it. I made reservations ahead of time because I read about the long waits that entailed if you didn't have one. 
We came 20 minutes before our reservation & were seated in about 5!

SERVICE: +5/5
Awesome! Our water was refilled often & the waiters visited us often but not too often too. 

FOOD: +4.5/5
The only reason why I don't give it a +5/5 is because we were so disappointed in the much-raved-and-hyped-up dish of the Wasabi noodles. Both my SO & I had a bite and looked at each other in surprise because it lacked.. a lot. I felt as if we could go to Panda Express & order something better.

The other 2 dishes were amazing!
The grilled octopus appetizer was my SO's favorite. THE MISO BLACK COD is a M-U-S-T. I've never had fish that literally melted in your mouth. Ugh - I would go back just for this anytime. 

PARKING: 
We ended up lyfting to the location since we were planning on bar-hopping in the area after but parking is pretty brutal. 

Overall, this restaurant definitely did not disappoint & is a perfect date night spot. (=
author: Rachel Y.

description:
Everything I put in my mouth here was delicious!

The best was the sea bass. I've never had a sea bass cooked so perfectly... but what was even better than the sea bass was the noodles it came with. OH MY GOD. It was so amazing!  Next time I go to san fran I will definitely be returning her. It was one of the best meals..
author: Debby T.

description: Decided to bring my lady here for a date, unfortunately we were exhausted and could barely keep our eyes open. All the food was amazing but I honestly couldn't even chew because I was so tired lol. We started with the soft shell crab with spicy Korean noodles on the side. The crab was fried but tasty still and the noodles had lots of flavor as well. Second we decided on the spicy noodles with beef and kimchi which was amazing. Then to finish it off we had the glazed pork chop which was definitely my favorite. If your ever around the area and looking for a good meal make sure to stop by...
author: Yung W.

description: Live the creative fusion food. Had spicy clams and unagi as starters, and steak as entree, it was perfectly prepared medium rare.
author: Song G.

description:
The House is a small restaurant that's located in the Red Light district but as long as you get there early enough, it isn't too sketchy.  

I had called beforehand to make a reservation but they were booked.  The hostess said the wait usually is a minimum of 30 minutes during peak hours.  However, when we (a party of four) got there around 5:30 PM on a Friday, we were seated immediately.  I'm guessing it was because we were there pretty early and it was Memorial Day weekend.

We started off the deep-fried salmon roll and soft shell crab as the appetizers, which were delicious and full of flavor.  The roll was served with hot mustard sauce while the crab was served with a side of cold noodle dipped in a semi-sweet sauce.

For the main course, I ordered the Miso Black Cod special while my boyfriend ordered the Angust Ribeye Steak.  The special was served with these uniquely shaped California sushi rolls, which were made with real crab meat, on top and laid on a bed of green vegetables.  The sushi was freshly made and the cod was AMAZING...practically melted in your mouth!  It filled me up just right so I had enough room for dessert hehe :)  I tried some of my boyfriend's ribeye steak, which DELICIOUS.  It was very juicy and had the same melt in your mouth texture as the cod.

We ordered the dessert special, which was a pecan chocolate pie topped with chocolate/peanut butter ice cream and drizzled with salted caramel sauce.  The two went very well together.  I also ordered the Jasmine Pearl green tea which helped me wash down the delicious pie!

Food was hands down amazing and service was on par as well.  Would definitely take my friends who are visiting here next time!
author: Mei W.

description: Came here for the first time on Saturday 11/11/2017 to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. For appetizers we got the fried salmon rolls and the ahi tuna tartare. Both were yummy and I found myself enjoying the wasabi sauce for the salmon rolls more than the amount of wasabi placed in the ahi tuna tartare. It can be a bit strong for the unwary but I enjoyed the myriad of flavors nonetheless. For entrees we ordered the Sea bass which comes with garlic noodles and some string beans along with the special of that night which was a Korean bbq dish served with rice, kimchi, greens, and topped with some type of fried root. Both. Were. Amazing. For the Sea bass I can see why this is a staple. The fish had a comforting melt-in-your-mouth flavor and left me coming back for more. The Korean bbq gave me flashbacks of my wonderful time in South Korea and I loved the kimchi though just as a heads up it has a sweeter taste than other kimchi which I still appreciated. To round us off we ordered the mango tapioca for dessert and all I have to say is get it! You will not be disappointed. All in the all the food was amazing and left me with the strong urge to come back as soon as I can.
author: Janice Z.

description: Every thing here is bomb AF! Love love the food!! Nothing has changed. Still by far my most favorite restaurant in sf.
author: Hang H.

description:
3.5 stars for the food, 3 stars for the overall experience

I brought my little sister here to celebrate her birthday.  It's a cramped little restaurant, with not much atmosphere.

Black Cod:  4 stars
Delicious, but so overpriced.

Ahi Tuna: 3 stars
Did I come on an off day, the unload-expiring-seafood day?  It wasn't terrible, but nothing to shout about.

They even charged a cake corkage fee for the cupcake we split at the end of the meal.  Really??
author: Letitia L.

description:
LOVED everything about this place! My sister made a reservation for 4 on Valentine's Day and I'm glad she did or else we would be waiting forever for a table. Since it was Valentine's Day, they had a different menu for the night. We ordered:

Seared ahi tuna on wasabi noodles: ahi was seared perfectly with a melt-in-your-mouth texture. The wasabi noodles was fantastic! I personally loved the size of these noodles and the wasabi taste was not too overpowering. 

Black cod: LIKE BUTTER. Creamy and fresh. 

Steak: I forgot what kind of steak it was but it was cooked to a perfect medium rare. Served with mash potatoes and grilled cauliflower and a special sauce. Delicious!!

Lobster tempera salad: probably one of my faves! I like this better than the deep fried salmon roll. BIG chunks of fried lobster and the dressing was godly. 

Poke: pretty good! The others loved it more than I did tho. 

Deep fried salmon roll: this was definitely an impulse order as we ordered this, EVEN WHEN WE WERE TOTALLY STUFFED, when we saw it on the table next to us. 


Overall, I highly recommend this place for all occasions. Date night with your boo, gno, family catch-up dinner, you name it! BUT MAKE SURE TO MAKE A RESERVATION!
author: Jenny C.

description:
OMG...
Maybe i didn't expect a lot..? that's y i just fell in love w their food immediately??
No matter what, their food were fantastic! 
We ordered fried scallop & shrimp with some green leaves and some mussel dish, and pork chop, sea bass, udon w chicken..(wished I took a photo of the menu so that I'd know the correct names)
I usually don't pursue a fusion style restaurant but how they cook the meat and fish and all ingredient were great...! The sea bass was probably my #1 sea bass I've ever had in restaurants-even in high end- in my life. 
Pork chop was fantastic and for some reason, some part of the flavor reminded me of a taste I had experienced in my childhood.. 
Also the appetizer, fried shrimp and scallop w some greens was so good.The fries themselves were excellent and the sauce or puree, whatever they call, was really something..real essence.
The udon soup w chicken... well it wasn't as much tasty as other menus and personally I didn't like the chinese style of flavor from the udon.    
Another drawback was the level of cleaness in the kitchen, I got a chance to peek inside and I felt not so clean around the cooking areas..  
But this time I couldn't help forgiving this after tasting the foods...
author: JS P.

description: This was the first time for me whereas my cousin Pamela has been here since they opened ten years ago.  For a Monday lunch hour they had 6 tables then we went in for lunch and 4 more tables were seated!! They have several specials for the day. We had the tempura string beans with a sweet spicy sauce and the deep fried salmon roll.  That sauce was delicious!!! We shared the seabass with a spicy garnish and another great tasting sauce served with garlic noodles and green beans.  We also had their special dessert for the day!  Wished I took pictures but was enjoying my meal.  They close from 3 to 5.  Very special place with the Asian Fusion flavors!!!  Please look at the pictures posted from other customers
author: Stephanie C.

description:
To START: the grilled unagi with avocado sushi rice and bonito flakes that writhe around from the hot steam. "It's ALIIIIVE!!" 

To FINISH: the crème brûlée with a passionfruit purée. 

Those two dishes will forever haunt my dreams. Definitely a must.
author: Taylor W.

description: love love love this place. its really small. would recommend making reservations. im from out of town so going to a place where every dish we got was delicious = 5 stars! wish i could remember the name of the dishes i got, the octopus appetizer, wasabi noodle dish with steak, seabass with noodles.. id highly highly recommend this place. all my friends agreed this was the best place we went to on our trip.
author: Rosanna W.

description: I know it's pricey, and the wait is long, and it's Asian fusion, but it might just win you over as well. I know what you're thinking - "Another super trendy Asian fusion place...how can this be good?" And, in some respects, you're right. There are some things that you don't really need to improve upon because they're already great in their own rights. I have to give it to the House though. Even if they don't do an authentic ethnic cuisine, their execution of their dishes is excellent. From the perfectly seared crust of rare ahi tuna to the flaky interior of a pan-fried cod, food here is cooked impeccably, and sauces are rich and lavish. Service is wonderful and expedient, and you'll leave feeling full and happy. Recommendations definitely include the tuna and cod (if it's available as a seasonal special). I wish we had tried the soft shell crab appetizer because it looked amazing, but I guess that will mean a return trip! By the way, the apple crumb pie a la mode is warm and crumbly and delectable. Make a reservation. You'll thank me later.
author: Danny C.

description:
The food: 4/5. We had salmon rolls for an app, and sea bass and salmon for mains. Salmon rolls were good, but nothing special. I would've preferred if the salmon was a little more rare in them. Grilled sea bass was excellent. I loved the sauce that came with it and the noodles were delicious. Salmon was great too, although the broth it came with was a little bland. Overall, an excellent option for seafood. 

The service: 2/5. Our waitress wasn't very friendly or attentive. We asked for recommendations on the mains, but she was not able to provide more details. Also she never checked on us and didn't offer to check out their dessert menu. 

Overall: I'd return for the food, but not for their service.
author: Kateryna G.

description:
Without hesitation, I can say this is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I am not a huge advocate of Asian Fusion restaurants - but this place exceeded all my expectations. The restaurant is quite small so unless you have a reservation the wait can get pretty long. But you can easily just grab a drink nearby at Vesuvio or check out the City Lights Bookstore across the street. 

Anyways, as an appetizer I would recommend the salmon roll. And as main entrees the Seabass is a must, and the Wasabi noodles with steak - you will not regret either choice. Every single dish was incredible, they all blended perfectly together. No where else can you get quality food at such an affordable price. I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting SF for the first time.
author: Karen C.

description:
Being in from out of town this was my "take a risk" restaurant and boy did it pay off. My and my husband favorite of the trip. Started with an awesome scallop Cesar salad, the salmon rolls and tuna poke. All top notch. 
I had the octopus for dinner and hubby had the ribeye
author: Liza H.

description:
Wow. Went on a date here and it was hot, cramped and the food was nothing too special.

The tables are so close together that I don't understand how they expect their ventilation to work.

Had to ask three times for water without ice. And It took forever to get seated and get our food, despite having reservations!

Don't go here if you like being comfortable, expect good service, or want to be impressed with original, well prepared food.

I litterally went and ate somewhere else after we left. It was that mediocre.
author: Lilah L.

description: This place is to die for. Love the food. I keep coming back for more and more. The truffle halibut is my favorite.
author: Karoline P.

description: Excellent restaurant with nice and kind service. I can recommend the Angus steak - delicious!!!
author: Alex G.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF!! The pomegranate glazed pork chop was amazing and also the garlic noodles w/ the fish dish. I love lots of the appetizers there and the service there is great. Definitely will visit again!!
author: Clare L.

description:
Came here for birthday celebration. Had made a reservation a week prior so didn't have much of a trouble with getting in at desired date and time. Parking was a toughie in this neck of the woods. But hey, isn't 7x7 parking like this anyways? Use public transit or Uber/Lyft is highly recommended. I was able to find a spot by the Vallejo Steps so definitely check that out if you're into scenic views of the bridge and some glutes-tightening to impress your date. Nonchalantly flexing while going to and from your vehicle can either be an appetizer or dessert. All based on perspective, my friend. 

Upon arriving, there were already groups of people around the entrance hoping to get a table. The place is very small. I appreciate the dim lightning for romantic/fine dining ambiance, but it was quite loud from the close proximity of dining neighbors and the restaurant itself. I would deem this as a not so intimate 21 questions-type restaurant to get to know your date because it's hard to hear and to keep up with conversation without the repeated banter of "what did you say?". Tables are seated very close...almost communal seating. We didn't mind too much because we were there for their much anticipated uniquely presented great food. Generally we tend to dine for a long time (3 hours) time frame, but given that it was a semi-rushed setting (from groups of people waiting outside like there's a drought-oh wait, there is!) we were there for 2 hr instead. I did noticed other patrons dined for roughly 1-1.5h (a fairly normal turnover rate).  

We ordered:

Appetizer: 
-grilled unagi avocado sushi rice, shaved bonito $13

Mains: 
-warm wasabi house noodles, angus flatiron steak $21
 -grilled sea bass, garlic ginger soy $28
 -kurobuta pork chop, pomegranate currant sauce $27

Desserts: 
-their special strawberry rhubarb pie with vanilla ice cream

Drinks: Prosecco & pinot noir

Apparently this was a lot of food for normal people because we happened to order as much food as the family of 4 next to us and the dad said to us "you two sure don't look that big!!" because he was too astounded as to how we were able to finish all our food. This would be the mystery of the universe we have yet to understand. The food was phenomenal. Although I wish my steak didn't come out medium to rare, I think our server may have misheard medium-well done. We didn't want to send it back because we were just so wowed with the taste and presentation that we had already ate majority of the steak. I just love looking at food art and this place does not disappoint. The balance of food pairings were there. Thank you asian fusion. Although I didn't make it public we're celebrating a birthday, it would've been a nice touch if we were asked if we're celebrating anything in particular. General rule of thumb, time is money so our server was tipped fat. Our server did not rushed us which I appreciated, but it is a tiny place and it's courteous of us to not hog our table too long. Let's not forget that we are here for the food and it was great! I hope to eat my way through their menu next time around.
author: Diana W.

description:
The House is a small and cozy Asian fusion place with a load of interesting menu items. it was where we finally reunited with fellow Yelper Meredith M after flying across the country, so major props to her for the suggestion as well as taking us around San Francisco!

the appetizers were good, but my entree - angus steak over wasabi noodles - was really jawesome. had a great kick to it and was a great cut of beef. they're supposed to be best known for seafood here, and I tried a bite of unagi don which we shared and it seemed good.

prices are pretty fair and the portion size is good.
author: Mike B.

description: I love Asian Fusion Cuisine and The House was absolutely delicious! My favorite dishes were the Pork Chop served with asparagus, mashed potatoes, and a taro chip and Sea Bass served with noodles and green beans. Both dishes were cooked perfectly and I highly recommend ordering them! This restaurant is a little on the pricier side but the food is totally worth it, I'd go back just for that Pork Chop dish!
author: Jessica N.

description:
This place has high Yelp reviews for a reason. 

Salmon and sea bass were TO DIE FOR. 

I wish I could explain how much my fiancé and I enjoyed the food, but words are simply not enough. All I can say is: absolutely amazing.
author: Jessy R.

description:
Came back again and everything was lovely! :)
I remembered the food just being OK the first time I visited, but this time all the dishes were on POINT. Food, flavors, aesthetics, it was all there!


The scallop appetizer is a must-try. Solid solid solid and a new favorite date spot for future SF trips.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Confession: I have a personal vendetta against Asian fusion. Mostly because I'm Asian, and I love the way the food tasted as I grew up -- but also because I've yet to see it work (besides in taco form).  Imagine how surprised I was when I walked into the House.

The House is situated in quite precarious location at the edge of North Beach and Chinatown off of Columbus. If you're walking, you might hit a few racy images but not much you can't get past. Anyways onto the restaurant. It's TINY! Get a reservation if you can since it might not work out otherwise. I came with a group of 4 and we were easily seated (although there might be challenges if you're aiming for 6 or more). 

The food is utterly amazing. To be honest, I didn't care for the Yelp favorites like the deep fried salmon roll and the grilled sea bass was decent. What I loved the most though was the daily special -- I believe it was mahi mahi with a white miso butter sauce. The fish melted into a pool of deliciousness. Yes it was Asian, but it had a richness to it that couldn't be achieved with Asian ingredients and a finesse that reminded me of French cuisine. Tip here - order the special! We also had the chicken entree which was as good of a chicken dish you could get at what seemed like a seafood house (don't worry, your non-fish-eating friends won't mind at all). 

In whole, I had a great time. The spot was a little tight but the service was good and the food was impressive. I don't recall being so happily disappointed often - but in this case I was.
author: Tammy T.

description:
So why does an Asian Fusion restaurant decide to locate in the middle of Little Italy?  I can't answer that, but the food makes this a spot to keep high on your list.

I was surprised by the simple nature of the restaurant. It is in a plain building with a large picture window and open dining room.  Clearly people go for the food. I had flat iron steak on a bed of noodles. Great diversity in the flavor.  My wife had a cod special, also very flavorful.

Looking down the menu, I don't think one could go wrong here.
author: Robert D.

description:
Alright ladies and gentlemen,

You all know that I love to eat and The House is the best restaurant I've been to since moving to SF. I was afraid that the "Asian Fusion" restaurant would be pretentious and overpriced. I was happy to discover that The House did not have those characteristics at all. It's just delicious.

The four of us ordered salmon rolls and crab cake for starters. The salmon rolls were crunchy and tasty; however, the mustard sauce was so strong that I almost cried. The crab cake was also good but it was probably the weakest item that we ordered.

Two people ordered the seabass and my other dining companion ordered the wasabi noodles. I ordered the miso cod that was on the specials menu. The fish was cooked to perfection and it had the perfect buttery texture. I was very satisfied!

The total damage (including tax and tip) for 2 appetizers, 4 mains, and 1 alcoholic beverage was $180, certainly not cheap but very fair for the quality and quantity we got.
author: Yi Z.

description: So today as we were driving back towards San Francisco from the Alameda County Fair in Pleasanton, my friend wanted to take me to The House and as she was driving she asked me to call to make a reservation and we took the 7:30 PM slot. We got to North Beach around 5:45 circles to find parking, I had a feeling this area would be very difficult and on a Saturday evening but by the grace of God, we found a diagonal parking space on Vallejo that wasn't metered and had no time restriction just as someone was backing out! We were really early so we walked around and came back around 7:10 and we were seated at the first table right by the window around 7:40. Immediately our servers brought us water and hot waters on request we looked at the menu and then our server told us about the daily special for appetizers and entrees. My friend and I both feel like having fish so we both ordered from the daily specials, she ordered the grilled halibut topped with julienned yams on top of garlic mashed potatoes and cauliflower with shimeji mushrooms and some spinach and I decided to go with the miso glazed cod topped with avocado crab rolls on top of a bed of gailan (Chinese broccoli). First, to start we had cucumber slices pickled in rice vinegar and sugar and topped with sesame seed. We waited about 15 minutes before our entree came out and their were so many people waiting for their reservation time and this is a pretty small hole-in-the-wall restaurant mind you. My friend and I wanted to share our dishes so I started off with the cod. I started cutting into the buttery cod  and dipping it in the miso glaze that covered the plate, it was DELICIOUS, so much umami and the fish just melted in your mouth while the skin has a perfect crisp. The cod was very reminiscent of the traditional Japanese gindara saikoyaki. I then cut into one of the odd shaped crab avocado rolls on top and it was a nice contrast from the warmth, buttery and sweetness of the cod to the cool crab and avocado filled roll with sushi rice and nori. The Chinese broccoli stems on the bottom was perfectly cooked as well, I'm guessing it was most likely blanched. So I had half my cod and my friend had half her halibut so we switched. Halibut is one of my favorite fish, I love the firm texture and mild taste. In this case the halibut was grilled to perfection, with the perfect amount of seasoning. It's served on top of some very creamy  and heavy on the roasted garlic mashed potatoes and cauliflower with shimeji mushrooms through and some spinach. We ended up finishing both our dishes and my friend was raving about their creme brûlée earlier so we had to give it a try since we were already there. The creme brûlée came out in about 2 minutes, so that means that the top was torched earlier but it was still nice and crispy. So what's unique about their creme brûlée is that it's a passion fruit creme brûlée, a typical creme brûlée with passion fruit purée on top which is slightly tangy and acidic which contrasts the richness and sweetness of the creme brûlée itself. When you crack the caramelized top, the passion fruit just drops down into the the smooth, sweet and rich cream. I'm glad I was able to try The House tonight, I highly recommend this restaurant to others for Asian Fusion because they have their standards set quite high.
author: Christopher W.

description:
So, let's talk The House. The first time I came, I wasn't even a Yelper yet! And, I fell in love already! After that, I knew I had to come back again soon.

 And soon enough, after 4 years, I am back! 

The menu offered a good variety of food and with very decent pricing! We all decided to share appetizers. We got the Maine Crab Cakes, Steamed Mussels, and their daily special, Seared Scallops. Oh my, those scallops. They were moist and perfectly cooked! We shared 3 scallops amongst the 6 of us, and we were very tempted to make another order of the scallops. It's a must get if they have it! The crab cake was fluffy and was beautifully deep fried, Well for the mussels, definitely the weaker of the appetizers, and I would probably not order again. 

Funny, my friend and I shared and we actually ordered the same thing I got last time I came, I guess my taste hasn't changed in the past few years. We got the Special Miso Cod with California Rolls. The cod melts in your mouth more than cotton candy melts in your mouth. Yes, it was that soft and amazing. The whole dish was great! The California rolls also mended very well with the fish. 

My other friends got the Kurobuta Pork Chop with Pomegranate Sauce, Wasabi House Noodles with Flat Iron Steak, Mushroom Risotto with Shrimp, and their daily special of some kind of steak. Overall, the pork chop was my least favorite. It was tough and the sauce was overly tangy for my taste. Everything else was delicious though! 

Overall, I'm already looking forward to my third visit. The specials are more pricey than the items listed on the menu, so ask for the price!  (The scallops was at a alarming expensive price for three small pieces! But, no regrets!)

P.S. Ask for their daily specials! It's not on the menu but rest assured, it will be delicious. 

You can find free street parking after 6PM a few streets up and to your right.

Also, make a reservations a few days ahead! They will probably have room the day of, but at unconventional times.
author: Winnie I.

description:
Delicious food. Wife and I split the salmon roll, the wasabi noodles, and the sea bass. All three were delicious. Our favorite was the sea bass.

Docking a point for ambiance. Restaurant is pretty loud; we couldn't hear our waiter as he described the specials. You also are sitting pretty close to your neighbors. The couple two tables down from us was in a nasty fight and we could hear about every word of it.

Despite the dings for ambiance I'd definitely go back. Food is delish!
author: Larson T.

description: This place is great and I can't wait to go back for more!  It's small so plan ahead and make a reservation.  Everything we had was delicious!
author: Mike M.

description:
I've never been a big fan of Asian fusion cuisine.  But Mike C. has been saying that I've got to try the food at The House.  Well, the moons aligned and he was able to arrange a dinner for our party of six.  We arrived for our 6:00pm reservations and it is highly recommended that you get reservations as the restaurant is not very large. 

After hearing the specials from our waitress, we checked out the menu and came to a consensus on some starters to share and our entrees. Our orders:

Starters:
Salad with walnuts and apples.  Nice lightly dressed salad with candies walnuts. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ)

Caesar salad with grilled salmon.  The salmon was perfectly cooked medium rare.  This salad was delicious. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#oLn2KGWERRINlV39T-mLmA)

Deep fried salmon rolls with Chinese hot mustard. Egg rolls? No, these are salmon rolls. Unique and quite tasty. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#ST-Oc2-QqiLASHN-vbd5hg)

Blue lake bean tempura with pickled ginger soy. Lightly battered, the beans were artistically assembled and presented.  
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#mKR_rsQPRgzcrPd91Zb_Ow)

Grilled scallops with ponzu sauce. Perfectly cooked scallops were complemented by a nice ponzu sauce. 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#nlfmRmnajnfe54HLa_heuw)

Entrees:
Kurobuta pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce with asparagus and a sweet potato chip.  My entrée was very good. The perfectly cooked pork chop was very moist. The sauce was different than what you would expect on a pork chop, more on the sweet than savory side. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#aqGAOaG0Iep2dlJQmHa2GA)

Miso cod topped with CA rolls. This is one of "The House's" specialty dishes that's not on the menu. If you're in "the know", you can ask your waitress if the miso cod is available.  Tonight it was.  Score!  Had a good taste of this dish and enjoyed it more than my pork chop. The cod was so moist and accompanied with a delicious miso sauce.  The cod is topped with a CA roll. Nice presentation. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#R76h0g6j7qPqwjv0yD1-cQ)

Warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak. Tasted a piece of steak and it was moist and tender.
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#BM7wWsji5DVfSdW7YCiWXw)

Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy. The person with this dish complemented on the fish and enjoyed it very much.
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#yyLL8yOjVhuPkgR-LSp-Sg)

Desserts:
Mango tapioca - If you like mango and tapioca, you'll enjoy this delicious dessert.
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#ZFblEWUZVIYzxzz_5QkKhA)

Persimmon pudding cake - the favorite of the three. Perfect for the season, the cake was so moist and topped with a nice dollop of whipped cream. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#v7GuzvJatA1a9t-gNKhgSQ)

Apple pie a la mode - a slice of crumb topped pie with a scoop of ice cream.  Good but nothing special and unique as our other two selections.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Z6dCvaDl_yMSHU-OJZdNxQ#AkRNvvckoPXEKWTwWjCndw)

Maybe I wasn't a fan of Asian fusion cuisine because I never had good Asian fusion. Now I know where to go for great Asian fusion.  The House.  The dishes that we had were beautifully presented and amazingly delicious.  I recommend highly and I will be back.
author: Al L.

description:
When my Elite friend heard I was flying in he insisted on taking me to The House, calling it one of the best restaurants in the city. It does have some pretty incredible reviews (and reviewers). We made a reservation, unfortunately they could only accommodate us at 9pm. Since I'm usually in bed at that time, we decided to arrive at 8pm to see if we could get in early. Lucky for us they were able to get us a table right away! The place is tiny, like 10 tables tiny. The decor is clean and the staff is attentive.

I was instructed to get the angus ribeye steak, my friend settled on the pork chop, and a colleague got the swordfish special. They started the table with some homemade pickles, they were delicious and I couldn't keep my fork away. If they sold them I would have bought a mason jar full. Our food arrived shortly after we ordered. My steak was huge and covered in garlic. It was cooked to perfection but I would have liked a bit more salt. It laid on a bed of mashed potatoes which were a little dry and some Chinese broccoli, which was cooked well and delicious. I was able to steal a piece of my friend's pork chop and it was perfection. The pomegranate currant sauce was the perfect accompaniment to the pork chop, I was a little hesitant when I saw it on the menu, but it worked so well. 

Of course we had to get dessert and they have a dessert for all tastes. I was immediately drawn to the coconut creme brûlée and it didn't disappoint. The coconut flavor in the custard was subtle but present. I wasn't a hug fan of the passionfruit sauce on top, it was a bit tart too for my tastes. My friend went with the apple crumb pie ala mode, which I found to be pretty standard, nothing special. My colleague went with the bittersweet chocolate truffle cake, which wasn't for me. It was dense like a flour-less cake and too dark for my tastes.

Overall, the meal was solid and I would definitely come back, especially for the pork chop. The meal had a few misses for me but I can see why people love it so much. I love that it's good hearty American food with a subtle Asian twist.
author: Jessica P.

description:
The food is amazing . The restaurant is pretty small so don't try to walk in ! It's best to have a reservation !  Nice ambience ...great  for dates !   

The service at this restaurant could be a bit better . They seemed tired or grumpy; this was around 8pm. However our waiter was super friendly and informing . 

We skipped appetizers because we wanted to get 3.5 main entrees ! 

We ordered... 

Kobe beef ribeye with reduced truffle sauce. We asked it to be cooked medium rare! It came out perfect and delicious ! The dish also came with mashed potatoes. Can't go wrong with potatoes. The truffle sauce was light but very tasty ! I wished It had more truffle sauce though. Overall the dish was good but nothing outstanding compared to other restaurants  that serve similar dishes to this. 5/5

Wasabi noodles. Omg delicious. So good that I would just come back for this !!!!!!!!!! Omg I would give this dish ... 10/5. The taste and texture  is sooooo good. Lol idk how else to describe it . The orange veggy thing made the bite more crunchy too . We asked for mild wasabi though, so in the end I didn't really taste the wasabi at all. But this dish was different than the garlic noodles . 

Grilled seabass w/ garlic noodles . Omg this dish is heaven. The fish was so moist and juicy. It was coolly perfectly and just like the wasabi noodles, the garlic noodles were just as good. The taste and texture of the garlic noodles were perfect. This dish is worth to come back for again n again and def. better than the Kobe beef ribeye with reduced truffle sauce. This dish also came with a sauce . The fish was so good that you don't even need the sauce ! 

Last but not least but my ultimate favorite dish out of the other main entrees ... The miso black cod topped with CA rolls. Omfg ... I would def. come back for this too. The fish was on POINT. The seabass already blew my mind away ( like how can a fish be perfectly cooked.. * soooo juicyyyyy ) ... But the black cod even blew my mind away even more !!! The fish was super juicy and moist ! More moist than the seabass . The natural juice of the fish had more flavoring too ! The sauce in this dish ( the green and brown sauce surrounding the fish ) was very tasty !!!!! I kept dipping the fish in the sauce .  honestly though, the fish was so good that you don't even need to dip it in the sauce ! The ca rolls were  a typical ca roll but I think it had cream cheese in it . CA rolls were very good and simple . 

In general, the fishes here .. AMaZING! So if you are a fish person.. You def. need to try their fish dishes !!!!!!!!! If I'm craving fish, I am def. coming here . 
 
For dessert we ordered the coconut creme brûlée, passion fruit puree and Keemun Mao  tea. The creme brûlée was very good! The passion fruit  gave it the tangy taste . The tea was good too but it tasted like every other asian tea ! ( then again I'm not a tea expert) 

This place is worth 5 stars.  On yelp it has 4.5 stars, with 3000+ reviews . It definitely holds up to it's ratings !
author: Alicia N.

description:
3.5 Stars

My friend and his girlfriend stated that The House is their favorite restaurant in SF and make it a point to come here for lunch or dinner whenever they visit SF. This past Saturday was no exception. They had made reservations for 4 at 5:00 right when they opened. Parking can be a nightmare so keep that in mind. We ended up parking at Portsmouth Garage and walked the couple of blocks. 

We decided to try the 

Deep Fried Salmon Roll-spicy mustard sauce had a good balance of heat and savoriness however the roll itself was bland and felt the salmon was overpowered by the fried shell 

Crab Cake-while appealing to look at, the crab flavor was muddled by the mayo sauce but the crust was done well  

Special Appetizer: Fried Softshell Crab-breading was crunchy but bland and could taste the oil, presented quite well, the bed of spicy cold noodles helped to add flavor but overly aggressive 

Main Entrees

Salmon over Wasabi Noodles-flavors were decent but felt it lacked depth, didn't find myself wanting to go back for more, noodles were too oily but had a good mild kick

Grilled Seabass w/ Garlic Noodles-amazing portion, fresh quality, center had a good opaque color, seared nicely, thoroughly enjoyed this dish the most. 

Chicken over Mashed Potatoes and Sautéed Mushrooms in Truffle Oil-chicken was moist but one note, no highs, no lows
 
Teriyaki Glazed Steak over mashed potatoes topped with ginger and scallions-massive piece of steak, topped with a beautiful hue of green and yellow (scallions and ginger) cooked well, balanced with sweetness and saltiness and relatively fork tender.

Dessert consisted of Coconut Crème Brulee topped with passion fruit puree and a chocolate torte with a scoop of ice cream. The crème brulee had a great crisp burnt sugar layer that broke well however didn't care for the actual coconut flavor or the minimal amount of passion fruit puree. Felt the puree on top lacked finesse in presentation considering how much effort they put in some of their other dishes. 

Chocolate cake was fudgy and had a good amount of sweetness. I say dessert aren't their strengths but a good effort.

Service was ok, definitely nothing to rave about 

Overall Thoughts

While I can see the mass appeal of The House, what with its generous portions value friendly prices, and familiar flavor profiles, it was too straight forward for my taste
author: Eddie W.

description: This place was very nice. If we make it to San Francisco again.. this will be a place to go again. great service, cute little place, and awsome food. I would love to  stop by another time.
author: Ira J.

description:
At the end of our conference, my coworker and I wanted to treat ourselves to a nice dinner with great reviews on Yelp.  We decided on Asian cuisine.  Down the road from our hotel, I was directed to a place that was rated 4 1/2 stars overall with over 2500 reviews!!!!!  Man, we REALLY needed to check this place out.

The best thing to do is to make reservations.  They do take walk ins, however, it's not a guarantee that you'll be seated right away.  The place is SMALL!  When I arrived there, my first comment was, "wow, it looks like a small store front property!"  It literally looks like it.  In the restaurant, there's no more than 20 tables.  Luckily, we were able to get seated right away but had to promise the servers that we will out of our seats in an hour.  This made us more curious to try their food as it seemed soooo popular.

We started off with the Scallops that were on special for the evening for about $12.  Three grilled scallops, accompanied with green sprouts and ponzu sauce, garnished with radish slices and caviar.  The scallops were sooo fresh, grilled and seasoned to perfection!  WOW!  I would get that again in a heartbeat.  For my main course, I got the Angus Ribeye Steak for $26.  Grilled Ribeye on a bed of mashed potatoes with housemade teriyaki sauce, garlic butter and sauteed garlic chunks.  OH-EMM-GEEE!!!  I was in heaven.  This steak was so tender, perfectly grilled.  The huge chunks of garlic really enhanced the flavor of the meat and the mashed potatoes were creamy.  This dish is a meat-lover's dream.  Trust me, you NEED this dish in your life :)

For dessert, we got the mango tapioca and the apple crumble ala mode for about $10 each.  What a great way to end this amazing meal.  The mango was manipulated in the tapioca to look like a flower!  The crumble was crunchy and delightful.  

If you're in San Francisco, there's no doubt that you should check this joint out.  I've done over 220 reviews in different cities.  This place has to be in my top 5 places so far....EVER!!!  Please check them out and make reservations!
author: Rockne H.

description:
After my last review, I did end up returning to The House for one last delicious meal before leaving San Francisco. The memory of the sea bass stayed with me for so long, I jumped at the opportunity to have it again during my current visit. Some friends and I scored a reservation for an early Sunday dinner and, aside from some rogue oysters (which were removed from our check), everyone really enjoyed their meal. 

My friend started with the salmon rolls which were absolutely delish. I went with the tuna tartare which was good, but the salmon rolls are the way to go. Of course, for my entree I had the sea bass, which was just as buttery and delicious as I remembered. I had the option of rice or wasabi noodles, so I chose the noodles which was wise. The snap peas held up to their name, providing a sweet taste and snappy crunch. 

Even as I write this review I'm waxing on to a colleague about how much I love The House. If there's a way for me to sneak back before I leave San Francisco, I will find it. If not, I will certainly be back the next time.
author: Michelle C.

description:
OMG! Loved this place!!  So glad we made reservations.  It is quite small and after we were seated there were gads of people waiting to eat.  The food was incredible - the best ever!  Loved the menu - full of fun items to share. We tried tons of different items but our fav's were their sashimi plate and miso glazed cod. To die for!

Can't wait to go back and try more there. Loved the whole crowded ambiance and cool atmosphere. It's a great Asian Fusion restaurant!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
I had dinner at The House last weekend, and after a co-worker had talked about it so much, I had some pretty high expectations. We had a 6pm reservation and I highly recommend making one if you're going to visit this place. It gets completely packed, and I felt pretty bad for the groups of people waiting awkwardly by the front door. Also, be ready for a very crowded atmosphere even once you sit down. Tables are close together and it gets a bit chaotic, but I found the environment buzzing & charming. 

Service was great and I started with the salmon rolls. These things are deep fried and not at all what I was expecting. I've been trying to make myself try things I don't usually like (such as salmon) but I absolutely loved this appetizer. The wasabi dipping sauce packs a serious punch and the flavors just exploded. For my entree I had the steak on top of wasabi noodles (this girl loves her wasabi, what can I say?) It was one of the best steaks I've ever had and was perfectly cooked. The wasabi noodles were as amazing as I had hoped.

I left completely full, buzzed on wine, and a total fan of The House. It's worth the hype and I highly advise a visit on your next trip to San Fran!

Side note, I had several friends that were absolutely in awe of the sea bass. If you're not in the mood for steak, definitely go with that.
author: Aimee K.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city! The food is always delicious. Super small dining area so it's important to make reservations in advance. Service is not always consistent but the food makes up for it.
author: Diana A.

description:
I drove from Sacramento with my hubby to try this place out and I'm not quite sure what the hype is about. We called a few days before our trip out to the city and was told there were no reservations available for the day we wanted to come in. We still made plans to come here nonetheless and waited a few minutes around the door prior to opening. Luckily they were willing to seat us considering we were the first patrons to arrive upon opening, however we were told we had to be out of the restaurant within 45 minutes. Of course, for not being on the reservation list we were seated in the very back corner right next to the smelly restrooms. Just wonderful.

We ordered a few dishes that were said to be popular on yelp. For appetizers, we tried their sashimi, scallops and kobe beef. The sashimi here is nothing compared to what a a real japanese sushi restaurant serves. It wasn't fresh as I expected it to be. The scallops were fairly good. I think it was my favorite dish of all.
