It was very flavorful and tender. What's dissatisfying about the appetizers we had is that they were not made to order. The minute we placed our order, our 3 appetizers were brought back out to us within the next 2 minutes. Who knows how long these dishes have been sitting out for?! 

For my entree I ordered a sea bass with garlic noodles. Sea bass was nothing spectacular; not a dish I would recommend to others. Accompanying side entrees were green beans and chinese noodles drenched with a tremendous amount of msg. Chinese noodles taste like hot wok noodles from a Asian supermarket. 

Dining here reminds me of P.F Chang's. Overpriced and non-authentic.
author: Mei W.

description:
Had lunch at The House as a celebration. We had several starters; their signature salmon egg rolls, grilled octopus and a soft-shell crab. The egg rolls were crispy on the outside and cooked just right in the middle. The grilled octopus was a little tough, but had awesome flavor. The crab was the most creative of the starters, and came with a vinegar and Sriracha sauce that worked well.

The mains were great for lunch. Soups and salads were light, yet filled up everyone. I got the seared tuna and it was awesome. The tuna was rare on the inside and simply seasoned on the outside - a standard, but great job. On the tuna was a small salad with tiny seaweed pieces. Inside was a mound of mashed potatoes to soak up the sauce that rounded the plate. 

Service was solid - wait staff is friendly and knowledgable of the menu as expected.

Come here if you like Asian fusion and you're in the neighborhood.
author: Julian T.

description: I first tried this restaurant during a trip to San Francisco in the fall of 2016 and loved it then so I made sure to go back again this year. We had a reservation for a Wednesday evening at 8:45 and were seated as soon as we arrived even though the place was full and there were people waiting for tables. As before the food was fantastic including some of the best octopus I have ever had.   The only slight negative I could note is the ambiance as tables are incredibly close together and the noise levels get very loud making it difficult to carry on a conversation about anything other than the food (which is certainly worth talking about). If you go with awareness that you are not going to experience an intimate evening, the ambiance will not be an issue. I would highly recommend this restaurant.
author: David S.

description: This place never disappoint !! Food here is terrific!! The Sea bass is really really good but is going to be pricey. Anything you order from here will be good. I highly recommend this place.
author: Wain C.

description:
Came with my lady friends for a weekday brunch. We got in right when they opened, and the place quickly filled up within the hour. We started with the fried salmon roll, which was filled with large chunks of delicious salmon, delish. My sea bass, one of their signature dishes, was good but really didn't live up to the hype. It was a big chunk of sea bass though. The steak and pork were alright too. The garlic and wasabi noodles were a little underwhelming -- if that's the only ingredient you should make it REALLY taste like wasabi/garlic, no? I ain't scurred.

The waitresses were really nice but the hostess or boss lady who was standing there looking kinda mean and disheveled really confused me and put me off.

I love the little house punch out on the placemat.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Very popping new American style restaurant.

Service: Good and above and beyond. I can see they set a very high standard for themselves by making the dining experience very seamless. 

Food:
Scallops appetizer: nice and juicy. Seasoned perfectly and the sauce pairs very well with it. 

I also got the wasabi noodles + steak as recommended by Yelp. It was very good; had a very nice wasabi kick to it. The steak was also cooked to my liking, although didn't have much blood in rare form. The noodles were also a little bit too greasy for my taste, but still delicious nonetheless.

I can see myself coming back for their pork as it also looked good when my friends got them.
author: Justin S.

description:
Man, I kept seeing lines out the door on this tiny place, so I had to see what was the haps.

And what can I say? They got their food game on point, gah daym.

We took a shot at the wasabi noodles. Frickin' amazing. Like sex with your taste buds amazing.

Next up, sashimi on cauliflower bed. It's super simple, but so fresh and delicious. Really makes me want to go home and try it myself!

Bonus: Vibe is super chill! Our waiter was amazing and made us feel at home instantly. What more could you ask for? We're definitely coming back for a 3rd or 10th time!
author: Anthony N.

description: Went with 5 people - every single dish was outstanding. Mushroom rice with shrimp and bonito, chicken salad with fried kale and peanuts, BBQ pork ribs...generous portions and extremely flavorful. We would love to come back.
author: Emily S.

description:
Came back here with my boyfriend and for my drink I had a Lichee black iced tea. I was pretty disappointed because I could barely taste the lichee. We got the mussels which were very good just like last time. The broth is so tasty.

Boyfriend got the wasabi noodles and steak. The steak was good, but I've had better. Boyfriend didn't like the wasabi noodles because the wasabi was too strong for him. I tried some and wasn't a fan either. I had to get the sea bass again and it was just as good as I remember. The fish was so buttery and soft. The soy sauce dipping sauce that came with it was good too but very salty so I can't use that much. My veggies that came with my dish were good and the garlic noodles were good as well.

Service was good. Nothing really to brag about here. Another good time here, that's all!
author: Katherine L.

description: I discovered this place through Instagram. From just looking at the photos, my mouth was watering. So I came here with my boyfriend for a lunch date. We came close to closing time but the staff was still very welcoming and helpful in helping us select from their delicious options. Most places would have rushed our meal and would have provided terrible service but not here! The food was phenomenal and the portion was filling! HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend this place!
author: Kimberly T.

description:
Great menu, great service. It can be a wait so be sure to call ahead for a reservation.

Never a bad idea to have dinner here.
author: Christina R.

description:
Read about The House on Yelp and decided to visit with a friend on our next trip to SF.  
Walked over from the BART Embarcadero station through some rather shady parts of the town (location is the only major complaint I have for this amazing restaurant).

Came for Saturday lunch and though it was small, the restaurant wasn't busy so we got a table immediately.  My friend and I decided to split the sea bass and the wasabi noodles w/ salmon.  I believe we ordered an appetizer which didn't come out, but we definitely had enough food so it turned out ok.

If you come here, please get their fish.  
The sea bass melted in my mouth and it was the taste of pure happiness.  The salmon was a delight as well.  
Greens were crunchy and delicious.
There were a lot of noodles; portions can be large which is a definite plus.
In total the sea bass was around $26 (worth it) and the noodles were $12 (great deal!).
author: Emily Y.

description:
The House is one of my best friend's favorite restaurants in SF, so I feel guilty about stealing it from her and saying it's my favorite too. It's a small, quaint restaurant with a bit of an upscale feel to it. 

The sea bass is everything everyone says it is and more. Someone in your dinner party HAS to order it. Personally, it's too much fish for me to be my whole meal, but it's honestly incredible. My friend hyped it up and it STILL delivered. The House is pretty good about making substitutions too. You can add/sub out different proteins if you're a bit more picky. My friend loves the scallops here, so that's probably worth mentioning...

Update (1/8/2018): I originally wrote that the sea bass was "too much fish for me to be my whole meal." Today, I changed my mind. I enjoyed every single bite. Yummmmmmmm.
author: Charles L.

description:
I heard this is a nicer asian restaurant, but I feel like I'm sitting in an old dumpling house: the furniture is from the 80s; the dishes are chipped and worn out. I don't understand why they can't invest on the basics. 

The food is ok. The flavor is decent.  I did not like the crab cake.  It had too much breadcrumbs.  I could not even see any crab meat.
author: Danielle W.

description:
I first had the House about 5 years ago when I visited and always have said that it is the best Chilean sea bass I've ever had ANYWHERE!!  Since then, I have recommended this place many times to friends who visit and everyone has been happy and satisfied with the food.  So my last trip back in November 2014, I definitely had to come back.  And OMG, it didn't disappoint!!  Everything was delicious and amazing.  And yes, still the best Chilean sea bass I have had anywhere!  We had a friend who lived in San Jose join us who never went and his exact words were "panty dropper!" lol

We ordered clams, sea bass, pork chop and flat iron steak and all were very good.  I would definitely come back here every time I visit SF!  Make reservations in advance bc they book pretty early since it's such a small restaurant.
author: Vanessa N.

description:
I've been here a few times, and all my experiences have been consistently superb and delicious! It's a small place, so make a reservation. While the ambiance and food presentation is definitely a bit more "upscale", the food itself is pretty affordable. Great date night spot. 

Of the few appetizers I've tried, my fave is the SALMON ROLLS. I make sure to order this every time! The rolls are filled with generous portions of salmon and wrapped in a wonton-like wrapper. They're served with the most AMAZING sweet, wasabi sauce. The sauce is so good that my bf & I asked for it in a to-go container ;) 

My favorite dish is the MISO COD, served with Asian veggies and avocado rolls. The cod is unbelievably smooth and flavorful. 10/10 would order again. I also recommend the warm wasabi noodles, which are chewy with a very, very, very subtle wasabi flavor. The accompanying steak is cooked perfectly (medium rare or to your preference) - juicy and bursting with flavor. 

The only entree I was not a fan of was the sea bass. Overall the dish felt a bit too oily, though the flavors were good.
author: Samantha C.

description: We ordered the Sea Bass as recommended. It was delicious! The garlic noodles are delicious and the flaky soft yummy sea bass was so good!!! Worth the $31!
author: Becky L.

description:
this is a restaurant that you need to try when you are in San Francisco. located in North Beach area between Little Italy and Chinatown.  family owned and operated. 
place is small, make sure you make a reservation.
author: Rudy H.

description:
Word to the wise: When you make a reservation call a few times before the actual date of your dinner to confirm your reservation.  

The food was good, not amazing, good. 

Servers are very friendly and accommodating. 

The salmon rolls were ok and the accompanying sauce was a bit intense. The wasabi in it was like an aunt overstaying her welcome in my nose and throat. 

The noodles with steak was quite good, but the sea bass was the winner of the evening. 

Was the food good? Sure. Will I come here again? No.
author: Neesh Q.

description:
Great, refreshing take on Asian Fusion.  Food was a 5/5, everything else really knocked down the rating.

Really a 3.5 because we were sat right next to the entrance and I had to deal with cold air and a crowd of people standing next to me as I ate. The food was fantastic but the ambiance was seriously lacking.
author: Kevin D.

description: Really good place. The prices is good every thing really yummy got to try!!! Suggestions are the curry noodles with chicken and the steak and potatoes
author: Andres L.

description: This place is a little Gem in Chinatown I LOVEEE my pork-chops here they are a must try . I am usually such a picky eater and I was very ehh about trying their food and especially one with pomegranate sauce . But I have to tell you that pomegranate sauce is super delish . This plate is everything just try it you won't regret it. However this place is very tiny so when you sit down it's very cramped and you feel like you are basically sitting all together as a big table, but on the bright side you get to see everyone's yummy food. Enjoy!!!
author: Marjana S.

description:
Granted I haven't tried everything on the menu, but of the items I did try, I couldn't get enough. The first bite down to the very last was perfection... Yes, I'm talking about the pork chop. I know PETA says "A porkchop stops a beating heart", but sorry PETA. This carnivore is going to enjoy every bite of my juicy, succulent pork chop, paired with creamy mashed potatoes and asparagus. The serving is huge, so yes, it's worth every penny. 

Reservations are highly recommended as every party who just walked in had a 1 hour + wait time. The restaurant itself is tiny, so not good for large parties. The tables are set up mostly with 4 chairs. If you plan on driving, come early to look for parking because parking in North Beach is a nightmare!

The pickled cucumbers they provide as a starter was nothing to rave about but it was nice to nibble on something while we waited for everyone to arrive. Beware that if you ask for seconds, they will charge you. Pretty lame, but I guess you wouldn't want to fill up on that before the entrees arrive.
author: Mindy D.

description: Absolutely perfect (if you know what to order). The specials change daily, but are great every time we try them. The sea bass entree is a consistent winner. Also pretty easy to get a reservation for this restaurant, given its calibre.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Went to this place without any expectations. Left the restaurant very impressed. Food is cooked to perfection. We had the following dishes:

- Clams with a slightly spicy sauce. Fantastic texture and amazing taste. Only thing portion was pretty small. Also doesn't bring enough bread to go with it. We asked some more bread and were charged 3 dollars for it 

- Pork chop with pomegranate sauce. OMG! Simply amazing! You can't afford not to try this dish!

- Wasabi noodles with ribeye. Good. Special taste. Well prepared. Would prefer this dish a bit warmer temperature though. 

Waitress was also very nice though in the beginning a bit pushy for us to place our order

Will come back again.
author: Nuno S.

description:
Between 3 people, we ordered 3 dishes and 3 appetizers. Everything was good here - everything. The salmon rolls were amazing and the oysters were decently fresh (normally not a fan of oysters). The sad part was that the signature wasabi nooodles didn't come due to miscommunication. That's okay - just save it for next time.

Secret tip: super difficult to get a reservation but if you show up right when the restaurant opens (or a little before), you can generally get seated if you promise to finish your meal within 45min - 1 hr.
author: Gary Y.

description:
I was disappointed, unfortunately. I think the hype of this place got me so excited that I was let down in the end. 

It's a very tiny place with very limited seating. Typical, and nit at all bad. It does make for long waits, but they take Reservations, so MAKE ONE! The atmosphere is cozy and intimate, which is enjoyable and lovely. 

The food. Not great. I had the Kobe ribeye. Yuck! I love Kobe, but this was as either a bad night or it was just bad. my friends ordered various other things that were better, but nothing wowed me. Nothing stood out as "I MUST try this again," or "I HAVE to come back here" 

Sorry to go against the grain here, but my plus three stars are for the service which was lovely. Pleasent and kind. Informative and attentive. The atmosphere and the overall enjoyability of the enviornment. But minus two stars for not great food.. this is a place I'm glad I tried, but I won't recommend it to others and I probably won't be going back.
author: Kate B.

description:
Happy birthday to me! If you're coming here on any day, make reservation quick!!

Started with jumbo scallops for starters. Presentation was nice and the scallops were damn near perfect! Lightly crispy outside and juicy inside, the scallop are lightly seasoned and with the lemon ponzu sauce, it's delicious!  Couldn't help but ate another piece 

I ordered the house wasabi noodles with flatiron steak.  If you have a sensitive palate, don't get this but for someone who kind of likes wasabi, this dish isn't bad! You can taste hints of wasabi but it's not bad when you have the shredded cucumbers and teriyaki sauce all mixed it. The noodles are chewy and soft but not mushy.  I got my steak medium rare which they did very well.  I sorta of wish they season the steak just a bit more but it would have been a overwhelming heavy dish in all.

Other dishes I have tried - seabass, black cod, ahi tuna and the glazed salmon.  I'm not a big seafood fan, esp fish...but I have to admit that I kind of wish I ordered the seabass or ahi tuna!  The ahi tuna with the spicy aioli, a perfect pair for someone who doesn't like the fishyness and the aioli is so creamy and good!! The seabass literally fell apart in my mouth and had a bit of a fluff I guess I can say, lightly seasoned but not letting its fishness come out.  Salmon was ok, I can still taste the salmon so I didn't like it and the black cod, nothing too fancy and small portion.

Overall, service was ok and I would come back.  Each dish range from $18-26.
author: Laurie W.

description:
Finally had my long-awaited dinner at this place. Was very excited to eat here after all how can a place with over 3200 reviews and four and a half stars be anything less than excellent? 

Upon arrival to this place, first of all they got our reservation time wrong we had called the night previously and reserved a table for two for 8:30 PM but they had us down for 930. This was a big hassle as we had to go walk around for a whole hour and almost didn't come back. But once we finally came back at 930 we still have to wait before two other parties were seated before us; maybe they had a reservation ahead of us I don't know. We were finally seated and greeted immediately our waiter was nice and respectful and everything came out pretty quickly. 

The biggest problems I had with this place were first of all the hostess. I don't know if she was also the manager or the owner of this place but she had a very cold attitude and was very withdrawn. Didn't at all give us a feeling of warmth and welcome. Secondly the place is very small and cramped we were seated right by the entrance and the people waiting to be seated were literally hovering over us and to our rights was the next table and the people next to us or less than a feet away. Next, which is a huge pet peeve of mine, was that my Diet Coke was brought out in a can. For supposedly nice restaurants such as this bringing out a soda and I can is very cheap. I like to drink 2-3 glasses of soda every time I have dinner and these places limits me and of course do not offer a free refill. Next, they messed up our bill we ordered an entrée but quickly changed it to another however on the final bill they had left initial entrée that was more expensive. Next I ordered coffee with out dessert and it's never came out finally when I reminded about the coffee it was later brought out pretty cold and they added it to the bill. Any decent place would not have charged for a small cup of cold coffee after forgetting to bring it out. 

What I did appreciate about this place was their food. Our appetizer which was the salmon roll and my main entrée which was the Kobe steak were great. I have had better before but have nothing negative to say about my meal here. So for the food alone I would give this place four stars but for everything else mentioned above I would give this place fairly two stars for a total of a very weak three stars.

I don't know maybe my experience was just unlucky since everyone else seems to love this place but I would definitely not come back.
author: Farbod F.

description:
The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating which made the entire experience much more enjoyable.

We were having trouble finding parking since it was a Saturday night so we called ahead to tell them we were going to be late. They were extremely understanding & said they will hold our table for us. 

We had reservations at 9:30pm & the restaurant closed at 10pm but they were in no way rushing us to order, finish eating & leave right away. The restaurant was still pretty packed way after 10 but the staff kept a smile & accommodated everyone.

I ordered the wasabi noodles with flat iron steak & I didn't want any vegetables in my entree & they were happy to make that possible for me. The food was absolutely perfect & they made my steak exactly the way I wanted. My boyfriend ordered the ribeye & it was delicious as well. We definitely will be coming back! Our waiter kept refilling our water cups without we having to ask which shows that they were extremely attentive to their guests. 

The only downside is the size of the restaurant & the area it's located in. which is why I had to minus one star. It's extremely hard to find parking, we had to circle the area for about 20-30 minutes & we had to park 4 long blocks away from the place. Inside the restaurant, we felt pretty claustrophobic with the people sitting next to us. It was a tight squeeze & we felt like we were touching elbows with the table next to us. We felt pretty uncomfortable but the food made up for it.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I have to thank Craig R. and his impeccable taste in Asian fusion cuisine for putting The House onto my radar.

Thanks to him, I think I've discovered my favorite flippin' restaurant in ALL of San Francisco.

No joke -- The House is a foodie paradise.

Admittedly, The House doesn't look like much.  It's in the heart of North Beach, surrounded by strip clubs and other tourist traps.  Look for its (relatively) modest neon sign on the corner of Grant & Columbus avenues -- and the aroma of fresh wasabi emanating down the block.

The interior is also quite spare -- and small.  Reservations here are a must.  My party of 4 would've been waiting for hours on a Tuesday night if we hadn't made reservations.  Luckily, with reservations on the books, we were seated immediately.

After ordering a round of wine (a delicious Sauvignon blanc for me, natch) and snacking on the complementary pickled cucumbers with sesame seeds, I decided to start with the deep-fried salmon rolls.  These were excellent.  The salmon was fresh and delectable on the inside, while crispy on the outside.  My favorite part was the wasabi dipping sauce, which provided just the right amount of kick.

For the entree, I had the wasabi noodles with flank steak.  I could eat tubs and tubs of these noodles.  They were just that orgasmic.  The depth of flavor in the noodles was out of this world, and the flank steak was cooked to a perfect medium.  (And YES -- this may be the only restaurant in California that actually knows NOT to overcook the beef.  It's a miracle!)

The desserts at The House are outstanding as well.  I had the mango tapioca, which was smooth, silky, sweet (but not too sweet), and beautiful to look at as well.

In fact -- *everything* served at The House is beautiful.  Every dish is a work of art on a plate.

The service is genial and prompt, but never rushed.

The House gets absolutely everything right.  Like I said -- it's foodie paradise.
author: David G.

description: This place has some of the best food I've eaten in a long time! Came here on a Sunday evening to celebrate my husband's birthday. We had the fried salmon rolls, sea bass with wasabi noodles, and pork chop with pomegranate sauce. Everything was to die for! And the prices weren't bad for the portion size. I have nothing negative to say about the food. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the ambience. It's pretty small/cramped, and we could hear all the cars and motorcycles revving up right outside the door. It's also hard to find parking so we used Spot Hero to reserve a parking space in a lot nearby ahead of time.
author: Chelsi A.

description: Super impressed. We lived the good and the service, and I'm not even a huge fan of steaks. If your goal is to impress, this is where you go.
author: Mali E.

description:
Dined here Wednesday Sept 14
Glad we had a reservation .. Too bad parking needed divine intervention but got lucky near Coit Tower
Food fabulous and wine list fun
Will dine here again 
The House is definitely worth the effort
The Gnocci-Ceasar salad fabulous
author: Patrick H.

description:
It's been a long time since my first visit to The House, which was probably before Yelp even existed. I finally had the chance to revisit one of my favorite restaurants when I booked a reservation for my family on Christmas Eve. We made a reservation for 7pm and were seated immediately when we got there. 

I ordered the Sea Bass which was served with sauteed green beans and a choice of rice or garlic noodles, I went with the garlic noodles. The Sea Bass was rich and grilled to perfection, the green beans were crisp and deliciously sauteed, and I also really enjoyed the garlic noodles. My mom ordered the Pork Chops with a Pomegranate Currant sauce and served over mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus. My mom is very picky when it comes to food, and she admitted she really loved this dish... I could not believe it. I've been working so hard to find a restaurant that she would like and I FINALLY found one =) I also had a glass of the Sauvignon Blanc which was delicious, and we ordered the Coconut Creme Brulee with Passionfruit Puree to share. The Creme Brulee was ordinary, I could barely taste the coconut and I thought the passionfruit puree was a little overpowering. 

Parking gets a little rough in the area, so be sure to bring some coins with you to feed the meters. The restaurant is small and very popular so I would definitely recommend making a reservation in advance.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Went to this place with a bunch of friends for a birthday. 


The special clam in spicy miso appetizer was delightful. The deep fried salmon roll was okay. The dipping sauce was spicy. The food was just mediocre. If you like wasabi in every dish then you'll like this place. Personally, I don't like wasabi so the entrees weren't spectacular. 3 stars for the above reasons. 

The dishes definitely seemed overpriced. Seems like the price reflects the presentation of the food rather than the quality. 

This place was tiny but love the ambience and decor. The music didn't really compliment the atmosphere.
author: Jenna T.

description: This food is delicious! The service was prompt. You must try the wasabi noodles, amazing! It is a small restaurant, and hard find on the street. Also make sure to make a reservation!
author: Gena C.

description: What an utter disappointment in service. After we ordered a beverage clearly stated on the menu, we were told by the server that we were wrong and that we had to keep the drink when in fact the server had brought out the incorrect drink. She did a lack luster job of keeping our drinks replenished and she never asked us how our meal was.  I will never return and will never recommend this place due to the service.
author: Axedentol S.

description: The House is a very special restaurant to me.  I've been coming here for years and the food is amazing.  The food is so amazing that for my birthday, my fiance surprised me by having the chef cook us a special "off the menu" dinner.  It was truly a treat and I'm so thankful for the experience.  I come here with groups, as a date, by myself.  It's a fantastic restaurant in the heart of north beach.  Don't miss it and ask for the specials of the night!
author: Christine L.

description: Long wait but worth it. Make sure to makes reservations. The Sea Bass was amazing, as well as the pork chop. These two are a must when eating at The House.
author: Maggie L.

description: We got in without a wait on Saturday at 210 pm right before they closed their lunch hours. We had the sea bass, the pomegranate pork chop, and the wasabi noodles.  My favorite was the wasabi noodles but my wife loved the sea bass. The pomegranate pork was good but dries out pretty quickly if you don't eat it fast.
author: Jerry H.

description: Friend took me here for dinner and we ordered octopus and tuna for appetizers and sea bass and steak for main. Everything were good, but noodle with sea bass was not something i expected and little too strong, salty. Not really perfectly match with sea bass. Other than that, everything was great! (One more, less cheese w octopus will be great)
author: Juyoung P.

description:
Solid good food, but noisy and cramped restaurant.  But what do you expect from a place that's 4.5 stars with 2300 reviews? =P

I was taken out for a lovely birthday dinner here (although I don't think House does anything special for birthdays..), so my date and I dressed particularly nice.  Looking at others, some were dressed pretty casual, but for the most part, semi-casual/formal.  But it's my bday, I can dress however I want hehe.

1) Yellow tail appetizer: 4.5 stars.  Whoa! I love sashimi but how did House add so much flavors that blended so well with the yellow tail?!  This wasn't on the menu.  The waitress told us 6 different things that were special of the day, and glad we got this.  It was great!
[http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Qo-eoz8T9K0FqmEcEOndrA#Wy25JKOQ95OxSMQVnH4VCQ]

2) Kurobuta pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce ($24): 4 stars.  I'm more of a seafood person which was why I got the sea bass, but this was actually tastier because of that pomegranate currant sauce.  Pork was nicely cooked too, and they said they only cook it one way (I believe medium well? sorry!)

3) Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy ($26): 4 stars. Mmm delicious sea bass with wasabi noodles and a side of green beans.   Now I know why this place is so popular.  Perfectly grilled sea bass that tasted great by itself, even without the side of ginger soy. Yummm!
[http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Qo-eoz8T9K0FqmEcEOndrA#UEYYZjOqqpSy9IVjYqfUZg]

I also learned that nigori is the same as sake, but really strong! It was $7 and I thought it'd be a wine glass since that's what it was titled under, but it came in a shot glass.  

WHY people come here: solid food, and prices are reasonable with their portions.  

Tip: You must reserve a week in advance.

FOOD: 4 stars
SERVICE: 4 stars 
ATMOSPHERE: 3 stars (noisy, and there was a person sitting in between our table and the table to the left with her back to us so she can fit. Weird...)

OVERALL: Great food! I'd come back to try more dishes. I enjoyed my birthday dinner with my date :)
author: Raquel Y.

description:
It's a small place. Tables next to each other. We went by the help reviews. I ordered the salmon roll. It's good not great. The dip is  interesting it had roe and wasabi in it. So I'd say be careful and use very little of the dip or you might feel uncomfortable. 
The next dish we ordered was excellent. Pork chops in pomegranate currant sauce. Absolutely loved it. Service is fine.
Ten dollars for the roll and twenty-seven for the pork chop. Plus taxes and tip! Not bad!
author: Amrita G.

description: This place absolutely lives up to the hype.  Outstanding meal with high quality seafood. Our waitress was a bit grumpy, but that was the only minor blemish on an otherwise great meal. The Octopus appetizer was insane. The tuna and salmon were both excellent. Would definitely go back.
author: Y E.

description:
Reservations are required for The House to avoid hour long waits. 

I made a reservation here for a party of 15 a couple days in advance for a friend's farewell party and they did everything correctly and professionally. 

I had both the Grilled Seabass and Angus Flatiron Steak both priced at about $26 each. 

Grilled Seabass: 5 stars. The entree came with the grilled seabass, garlic noodles, green beans, and ginger soy. The seabass melted in my mouth and put my mouth in absolute paradise. The seabass was grilled to perfection and the noodles were extremely flavorful. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#MNGSUMC2opGkwB_6BdsFVw
Angus Flatiron Steak: 4.5 stars. This entree arrived with mashed potatoes and vegetables. The steak was extremely tender and everything was made impeccably. I wish it came with garlic noodles to fill me up more. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#Bh-6X6nZDMnfmrHhYIhfhg

I definitely recommend both of these dishes!

The House is small, but like it's name, it is very cozy and comfy like your own home. The ambiance is classy and elegant mixed with a familiar homey feeling.
author: Chena N.

description:
The sea bass and garlic noodles are the sh*t. Honestly, I dined here for lunch the day after dining at Gary Dankos and I was more impressed with The House. The food is definitely more unique and tastes delicious. I've been recommending this restaurant to all my friends who have recently moved up to SF or planning to visit for vacation. This is A MUST when you are in SF, I don't care if you're there for only 1 day. It's that good. Sometimes, I think about making a trip out to SF just to dine here again.

Remember to make reservations because this tiny hole in the wall has very limited seating!
author: Jody C.

description:
I cannot stop talking about this place. This place is amazing. 
I usually don't order fish at restaurants - I guess because I cook fish very well myself, and eating at restaurants is not very impressive. However, sea bass at The House is something beyond heaven. The fish is very good quality, and usually very well cooked. They serve it with some bomb sauce that implements sea bass amazingly. The fish is served grilled but extremely soft. It melts in your mouth. 
We also ordered Ahi Tuna. OMG. I am in love with their Ahi Tuna. Must to have. 
We also had wasabi noodle and garlic noodles. I still cannot figure out what noodle dish is my favorite. 
We ordered dumplings. I didn't find dumplings amazing the wasabi sauce is extremely good. Fried salmon rolls are tasteless with sauce as well. Appetizers are so so but main dishes are HEAVEN. 
I cannot wait to have dinner there again. 
Enjoy
author: Jenna F.

description:
Service: *
Food    : ***
Atmosphere: ***

The Sea Bass was delicious, but the angues beef was smelly. Told to the server who doesn't know how to do. Another lady came to our table, she said the angues beef is good. Suggested us to try another piece. I told her my hubby and I both tried it already. She seems not believe in us. I said u can try it, and then u will know what I said. She did not try it. I said can u replace other food to us? She said I can replace, but I will still need to charge you the Angues beef.  I feel upset about the way she told to us. I said its fine u can just leave the plate there. I lose my appetite. After she looks my unhappy face. She said she can give us some pork instead. She brought an empty plate and took out the beef, leave the wasabi noodle on our table. After 5-10mins, she brought some pork in a small plate back to our table. And she still charge us the amount as Angues Beef.  I don't think it's a right service for customers. I totally lose my appetite. Won't come back again.
author: Chanel P.

description:
Snagged a valentine's day reservation. The lady and I came late and were scared to lose our reservation, but the hostess was chill and we only waited ~20m.

Ordered the crunchy salmon to start based on overwhelming recs from Yelp. It was awesome.

Also got some plum wine and sake. Chilled, smooth, tasty, but I'm not a connoisseur so can't comment with a sophisticated palette.

We shared cod, a side of veggies, and pork chop. The former was tougher than I expected from the typical tender fusion miso cod recipe. The latter was tender. Both slightly over seasoned - too salty.

The food was good, but expensive. Plating unimpressive especially for dinner on a special occasion. Service was fast and attentive. Small venue (typical for SF) but clean, minimalist interior.
author: Erik R.

description:
Enjoyed our dinner here tonight. This little restaurant is tucked into a hill right by Caffe Trieste (where Coppola wrote Godfather). 
We made reservations 3 days before and were promptly seated when we arrived. 
For apps, we ordered the Unagi roll and their special Scallops. For mains, we had the ahi and the salmon. And for dessert, we had the chocolate cake with coffee ice cream and the mango tapioca. Everything was plated beautifully with an Asian fusion flair. They have a knack for baking yam and molding it into the most interesting shapes and adding some caviar on top as garnish. 
Really a memorable meal and I'll continue to come back until I try all of their dishes!
author: Patricia S.

description: While this is a seafood place -they had a wonderful vegetarian curry dish. Wonderful simple and polished place for a date night.
author: Maude B.

description:
The food at The House is really exquisite.  The ambiance is fine - tries to be quaint, but falls short in the quality department. Our table was so dark we could hardly read the menu. When we asked for a candle we got a very staunch "no."   Which leads me to the service. Our waitress was cordial and seemed to be knowledgeable. She didn't give us any more than we asked for. The "other" waiter had massive attitude and I'm assuming it was because he was not going to be benefiting from our table. Two servers for the restaurant might not make sense if the servers can't handle the pressure of actually serving tables. Just one persons opinion. 

On to the food. 

We started with three "small" plates; butter lettuce salad, crab cake and scallops. All really solid. The salad was perfectly well dressed (my husband would have been in heaven), the crab cake was in a shape none of us have seen before - de-lish!! And the scallops (they added a 4th to the plate for our party of 4 - for a fee of course) melted in our mouths. 

We shared our mains - noodles with flatiron steak  - very flavorful and the steak perfectly cooked

Tuna was seared to perfection - we all agreed a fav of the table. 

Pork was really beautifully paired with the pomegranate sauce. Incredible. 

Sea bass - hearty and flavorful paired with green beans and yet more noodles - yum!!!

Dessert was a special: blackberry crisp a la mode. Fine. Wish we ventured to the mango tapioca I've been reading about. 

All in all - food was amazing but the service and ambiance almost drop this to 3 stars.
author: Courtney D.

description:
The House is my favorite asian fusion restaurant in SF of all time!! Never have I walked out of here disappointed! I've came here for lunch and dinner and the food is consistently good.

I love to start off with the deep fried salmon rolls. The salmon is cooked to perfection every time and the crispy skin on the outside gives it a nice crunch. The hot mustard sauce gives it a little heat and really goes well with it! Everything about this dish is great that I even eat those purple cabbages that they have on the bottom of the plate.

I probably have tried everything on this menu and I love them all. It's really hard for me to decide what entree to get when I am here because they're all equally delicious. I do love the sea bass with garlic noodles. The sea bass is so mouth watering and just melts in your mouth!
author: Brittany L.

description:
The house is probably my favorite restaurant in SF.

Here's the reason why i didn't give 5 stars - When I got there with my friend, there were already a lot of people waiting for their romantic dinner or whatever (we ate on valentine's day #galentinesday). we checked in for our 9'oclock reservation and waited. and waited. and waited some more. then this couple comes in and i overhear them checking in for their 9:30 reservation and they got seated right away!!! I was furious! i marched up to the hostess and gave her my rbf - she apologized and seated us. but seriously?!?! pay attention woman!

anyway, onto the food - they had a special vday menu so the rib-eye steak wasn't on it. although i heard amazing things. We ordered the filet mignon and the seabass (everyone told me to order this).

Seabass - lived up to my expectations and then some. it was soooo buttery and soft and seasoned to perfection. I ordered a side of noodles and it complemented the dish very well. the soy sauce that comes with the dish is NOT needed, the flavors were perfectly balanced

Filet Mignon - it cut like butter (i'm sensing a theme here). i thought it was just ok.

we wanted to dessert initially but the portions were very generous and we were too stuffed to order anything else at the end of the night. To sum it up - order the seabass.
author: Andy H.

description:
One of my favorite places to eat in the Bay Area. Anytime somebody visits me from afar I try to take them to The House. 

I've been here several times, but my last experience we nothing short of amazing. I was there for an anniversary dinner and I had ordered the rib-eye and she had the pork chop and of course we shared. I think these could be the best two dishes at the House. I've almost ordered everything by now, nothing will disappoint whatever you get. 

The food here is amazing and the prices are great for the portions. Also, save room for dessert! I recommend the apple pie and the chocolate cake.
author: Allen C.

description:
If you're a potential customer that can occasionally look past your reservation by half an hour for very decent cuisine, Asian fusion in this case, then keep on reading.

To celebrate a friend's a birthday, the five of us started the evening off here. We shared such dishes as:
-Octopus Salad with Crispy Pork Skin
-Seared Ahi Tuna
-Grilled Sea Bass
-Braised Kurobuta Pork Belly
-Wasabi Noodles
-Green Bean Tempura

I enjoyed them all, including the soft octopus, but my favorite was the Ahi Tuna fish because of the tangy sauce at the bottom -- wasabi aioli, served with green roe.

Must say, I enjoyed their dessert wine sake selection, too: their "Red Mountain" sake was smooth and sweet.

Our birthday guest *ENJOYED* a candle on top of her dessert, and that now seems to be the descriptive word of the night, too.

I just know that some folks out there are not willing to wait for anything, no matter what. For this place, waiting could very well be worth it.
author: Garett T.

description: Food was good but owner just not a warm & friendly person. My friends commented that she should definitely not be in the role as maitre-d.  I knew it wasn't just me...see past reviews. My best dining experiences were when the smiling chefs/owners stopped by to see how you were enjoying the food.  Here, you feel as if you're looked upon as a wallet as opposed to a valued patron.  Part of dining is enjoying the atmosphere.  Many more fun places in SF.  Say "cheese" for the camera.
author: Danny T.

description:
I don't quite understand the hype about this place. I mean, it was fine and all, but the whole "Asian fusion" thing going on here falls well into the standard flavor profile of most mid-range sports bar food that I'm used to back in Hawaii.

Salmon Rolls - Probably the best thing my bf and I had at The House. Crispy crunchy on the outside and soft and luscious salmon in the middle, and not at all fishy.

Wasabi Noodles with Steak - The noodles are good, but there is no wasabi flavor whatsover, and the steak is bland.

Kurobota Pork Chop - I like the pomegranate sauce, but the pork was overcooked and dry.

Somewhat reasonably priced, but I do feel a little ripped off paying $25 for an overdone pork chop. Service is a little slow as well.
author: Lynvi S.

description:
Very cozy restaurant. The menu is very limited, but on the up side, service is super fast and efficient. 
The best part was the food - Very yummy. We would definitely come back!
author: Sophia D.

description:
Was just in San Francisco for a business trip and saw thin place on Yelp as a highly rated place. The reviews did not mislead. 

The sea bass is a must have. Absolutely amazing and is almost as addicting as candy. It was so flavorful and something I would order every time I go. 

I also had the steak and wasabi noodles as this was also a highly recommended item. This was great as well but not as great as the reviews hyped it up to be. 

I would recommend this place among the top 5 places to go while in San Francisco
author: Kyle Z.

description:
Wow, hard to find a place with this great food, fast service, and not extravagant prices. The inside isn't particularly ornate but I appreciated the bare bones approach. Definitely make a reservation as it's very packed around dinner time!

Foodwise - the sea bass was the best fish I've ever had in a restaurant. Our whole party commented on how it melted in our mouths. I've definitely paid almost double the price for fish and had it come out only half as good. The portion of noodles and delicious green beans was also generous for $30. The steak and wasabi noodles were also very great and well cooked (I think around $23?) but fish won in my book. Loved how thick the noodles were. My friend ordered the ahi tuna and even though it was an appetizer the portions were also very generous. The only food that I felt was mildly overrated due to other reviews was the deep fried salmon roll. The fried aspect took away the freshness of a salmon roll I normally like. However, the Caesar salad exceeded expectations and was delicious.

Service was similar to the decor - not fancy, but efficient and appreciated. 
I will definitely come back next time I'm in SF!
author: Angela C.

description:
Amazing.

I've been wanting to come here for so long and randomly one day, it happened! Once I saw the menu, I was too excited (by how good EVERYTHING sounded and the fact that we had a decently large party for me to nibble off of everyone's dish). 

We started the meal with an array of appetizers including scallops, mussels, and crab cakes. All of them were amazing, especially the scallops. The scallops were tender and perfectly seared. Super flavorful and exactly what I wanted. The crab cake was atypical; deep fried served over a pickled ginger remoulade and a plantain chip. The contrast of textures were done so well, super tender soft crab inside, crispy outer balance with the remoulade. The mussels were really well done too but definitely outshined by the other two appetizers. 

A friend and I shared the miso glazed cod, which is topped with a sliver of a california roll, playing with the japanese concept I guess. The fish was sooooo moist and completely melts in your mouth. I hear that if all their fish dishes so I would definitely try another fish dish next time. 

All in all, great experience. I am seriously anxiously awaiting my next visit.

100% recommend you make a reservation. We got lucky that someone canceled and we swooped or else we would have waited at least 1.5 hours.
author: Becky M.

description:
If all fusion food tasted like those of The House, I'd say "never again!" to any other ethnic-centric cuisines!   A massive feast unknowingly awaited us...

Starters:
* Special: Seared scallops = Whatever the multiple elements were, the one-bite app per person was effin' awesome.
* Charred octopus salad, crispy pork skin (aka chicharrones), red chili vinaigrette = Light and delicious.  My one wish is they would've incorporated more octopus & less-filler lettuce.
* Ahi tuna tartare with roasted nori chips = Bite-size raw tuna cubes, served beautifully atop rectangular nori chips, slight overpowering wasabi-heat sauce.
* Oysters on half shell = never a fan but according to others, super-fresh & best they've had in a while.  

Entrees:
* Sesame soy glazed salmon in bonito sake broth = decadently tasty.
* Special = Halibut with coconut curry sauce = fish cooked just-right but that curry sauce was the absolute winning part.
* Grilled ahi tuna with spicy mustard aioli = wow.  All I can say is wow.  (and not a speck of accompanying rice nor a lick of sauce was left on my plate)
* 2010 Chateau Lamothe Haux Bordeaux is a light delicious white-blend.

Desserts:
* Mango sago pudding = we sang this dessert praises all the way through each bite.  Almond-creme-y, sago texture-y goodness.  The slight mango drizzle atop perfectly complemented this dessert.  We had to order a second portion right after.  Go figure.
* Blueberry bread pudding a la mode = Perfectly textured bread pudding, warm and perfect with that vanilla ice cream.

WOA:
- Definitely make reservations.  Not a large restaurant and lines were forming right upon doors opening for dinner.
- Zero idea about parking.  This is SF.  We walked up from Union Square.

Hands-down, a perfect foodie fest.
author: Sandee T.

description:
Finally had the chance to try this place but I'm kind of disappointed about it. My boyfriend and I agreed that this place is like a 3.5. It may be because we expected it to be SOOO good due to high volume of reviews and ratings. We definitely came on an empty- if not starving- stomach so we're taking that into consideration.

We got the deep fried salmon roll, Wasabi noodles, and the pomegranate pork chop. The salmon roll was okay, for some reason it felt like it was too dry. The sauce it came with was something mixed with Wasabi and it was giving the after taste a weird sensation. I wouldn't recommend breathing through your nose after having your tongue touch the sauce. However, we liked it because the moment you taste the sauce you can taste the spiciness but after you're done chewing you're not left with a spicy tongue. Amazing.

I also would not recommend the Wasabi noodles as an entree for yourself. It's good to get if it's going to be shared. The flavor/ sauce was too strong. I found myself constantly looking for some noodles that were untouched by the sauce or I had to eat something else immediately after eating some noodles. I was not able to consistently eat the noodles normally. Thankfully my boyfriend and I shared everything so I got a good balance to the taste. 

The pork chop was definitely better than the other two dishes. The meat was really good and the sauce complimented it well. Service deserves A+ which makes this review a 4 instead of a 3.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend's family to celebrate his birthday. We ordered several appetizers and entrees to share together. They first give you a small appetizer to start: pickled cucumbers. Although a simple dish, it was super flavorful with a kick that complemented the pickled flavor. 

Some of the appetizers we ordered included the chicken kale salad, tuna tartare, unagi, fried salmon rolls, and the mussels. We thoroughly enjoyed every appetizer! The chicken kale salad was a simple dish but the chicken was very moist and the kale was nice and crispy and not bitter at all. The salad was dressed appropriately with the dressing and was not overwhelming. The tuna tartare comes in a tower that are stacked in between tortilla chips. The flavors were absolutely wonderful. The tuna was nice, moist, and seasoned appropriately. The salmon roll was also very delicious. The salmon was not overcooked and you can see still the rawness in the middle, which definitely was a good thing! It was so tender and flavorful, I could eat another plate! Hands down my favorite was the mussels. The mussels were nice and plump and the sauce was amazing. We even asked for a side of bread to finish off the sauce because it was just so flavorful. 

For the entrees, we ordered the BBQ pork ribs, the porkchop, sea bass, and the angus ribeye steak. They are known for their wasabi noodles which comes with some of the entrees. It is delicious! The wasabi is not overpowering and has a kick to it that complements the meat. Some of my favorites would have to include the sea bass and the porkchop. The sea bass literally melts in your mouth from how moist it was. Super flavorful and the sauce just takes it to another level. As for the pork chop, the pomegranate currant sauce is such a great pairing with the flavors of pork chop. It helped enhance the flavors and definitely provided a sweet/tart component that goes well very.

Overall, we were very pleased with the service and quality of the food. Highly recommend coming here if you enjoy asian food! Definitely recommend making reservations because it is a very popular restaurant to try.
author: Wendy Z.

description:
Delicious!
I had ordered the wasabi noodles with the steak cooked at rare. It was so yummy. You could definately taste  the wasabi but it is not strong enough to clear your nose. The steak wasnt too chewy and very juicy. 
I had questions about the sake abd our waitress explained some of the options and recommended the Nigiori ( dont know if i spelled that correctly). It was a little bit strong but it was fruity and also sweet

My friend had the special that night which was the kobe beef dish. The kobe beef was amazing. I regret not ordering the kobe beef that night. It was super tender yet chewy.
author: Stacy W.

description:
Found this small restaurant on a whim. Randomly walking around the area and from the outside, this modern building seemed like a nice spot. No wait at all on a Sunday night.

To start, we ordered the daily special - scallops with a lemon glaze sauce and it did not disappoint. Also had 6 oysters with a nice spicy/tangy sauce, mussels cooked in a tomato broth, and the tuna tartare, all amazing

As for our main meal, we ordered the black cod with a California roll sushi on top. It was equally as delicious as the steak and potatoes.

However the only negative was the portion sizes. Small enough to keep the toddler next to us hungry.

Had a good selection of wine.
author: Jasper L.

description: Used to be a great restaurant but this last visit was disappointing. Flavors were off and the of standout dishes are now much worse IMO. The mussels were fishy, salmon rolls bland, ribs were meh, octopus was OK but didn't compare to other restaurants, and the flat iron steak had no seasoning and the noodles were salty. Quality is down but prices still high and just not worth it anymore.
author: Robert K.

description:
I came here for a friend birthday. It was our first time here.  We had reservation at 10 and got there a few minutes early. We got seated right away.. it's a tiny little restaurant so it was packed.. it's an Asian fusion type of restaurant. I'm not a big fan of Asian fusion cuisine but the house sure did surprise me with their food.. my friends and I ordered a few appetizers and an entrée each. We all shared and picked off each other plate.  I ordered the special  entrée they had that night. I got a kobe steak medium with mashed potatoes.  It was delicious and my friends also agree.. 

for appetizers we ordered: half shell oyster, fried calamari, white shrimp tempura salad, steamed mussles

Entrées: kobe steak, sea bass with garlic ginger soy noodles, Wasabi house noodles with Angus steak, pork chop with pomegranate sauce, mushrooms rice with grilled shaved Bonito

We ate everything we ordered except the pork chop.. my friend who ordered didn't even touch it bc she didn't realize it was gonna be drench in the sauce. my other friends n I did give it a try and we didn't care much for it. It was too sweet for us.. so if you don't like it drench or sweet, maybe ask them to put the sauce on the side. We also didn't care much for the oysters.  The sauce for it wasn't all that. Tasted plain. We asked for Tabasco sauce and the waitress said we didn't need them because there is hot sauce in the sauce already.. she should've just still gave it to us because we asked for it. Other than that, we had a wonderful dinner and we enjoyed our dinner. Definitely make reservation if you do planning to eat here.. will recommend this restaurant to eat at. Will be back.
author: Lexie H.

description:
Came here for dinner with a group of girlfriends about two months back, and I'm so glad I did! It was really hard to get reservations last minute, but luckily my friend got there early and they happened to have a table open. It's a cozy but really cute restaurant so our group of 6 was pretty packed in. Overall food quality was fantastic, but expect a long wait, and portions are a bit small for the price.

I ordered the special: Ahi Tuna w/ a California roll ($23.00). It was presented very nicely with the roll cut open (the long way) and draped across the fish, and two long plaintain(?) chips sticking of it it. The dish went pretty heavy on the wasabi/horseradish sauce though, but I also hate wasabi, so take that with a grain of salt.

https://instagram.com/p/27OcYUTZpa

However, I had a bite of my friend's order... the Grilled Sea Bass with garlic ginger soy ($26.00). This was absolutely heavenly, and was the melt-in-your-mouth fish I was looking for. I know this is what they're known for, but sometimes I like to be "different," and sometimes I'm wrong, and this was one of those times. If I come back, I will definitely order this.

It was a little hectic when it came time to pay the bill, since there were six of us, but I calculated all the amounts (with tax and tip) and wrote them on the receipt next to the card numbers to charge. Our waitress still messed it up, however, and charged the wrong cards, so we had to figure it all out again and re-divide the money.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
The House is a truly awesome restaurant. My friend brought me here after she grew up in the city and wanted me to try it. We had reservations and were seated fairly quickly. Some dummies come in or leave without shutting the door so that's one annoying thing, and probably the only one.

The server was a bit slow, but we had these deep fried tempura asparagus spears and fresh calamari for appetizers. They nailed it on both of them. Before that they also had a pickled item for a table appetizer. I had a Japanese beer with my meal.

After listening to the specials, I settled on the fish special: blue fin tuna caught in Mexico. The presentation was magnificent. At the bottom were these green vegetables I had never tried before, with the seared tuna, and two avocado sushi rolls on top. Check the photo I uploaded.

My friend ordered the cod. This is what I will order next time! It literally melted in my mouth like butter when I tried it.

I didn't think we'd get dessert but we did. We got some sort of berry pie that was great. I'm sure this place is considered expensive, but it's well worth trying it. We also got some of their fresh made almond cookies to take home. This is a hidden gem in North Beach amongst a plethora of Italian restaurants. This Asian fusion restaurant stands alone.
author: Marty J.

description:
The more I eat in San Francisco, the less I understand the food... I always hear about how great the food in SF is compared to LA, but I've yet to find a restaurant that blows my mind. Perhaps I'm coincidentally eating at places that just don't mesh well with my taste. Exhibit A would be The House.

After a failed attempt to eat at State Bird Provisions on Labor Day, we came here shortly after opening time without reservations. I'm not a huge fan of Asian Fusion but with The House having over 3,000 reviews averaging 4.5 stars, I figured the chances of me disliking the food were slim. And I was right -- I didn't dislike the food, but it was pretty mediocre.

A server sat us after informing us we'd only have 90 minutes to eat, before we had to give up the table for a party with reservations. For my main, I ordered the Wasabi Udon with Flat Iron Steak. The dish was flavorful and cooked well, but didn't particularly stand out. For dessert, we got the Mango Tapioca and and Coconut Creme Brulee. Both were good, but nothing mind-blowing.

The restaurant was filled to it's max capacity, so it's obvious this place is popular and reservations are recommended. Unfortunately, I probably won't be coming back.
author: Ivy W.

description:
All I gotta say is WOW, the food is amazing here. Decided to eat at The House the day before running the SF RNR 1/2 marathon. I made reservations for 2 a week in a half in advance as reservations are highly recommended here. 

The inside is very modern and quaint, has a homey atmosphere. For appetizers we ordered and shared the deep fried salmon and their special of the day appetizer which was clams in this yummy broth with garlic bread. I literally wanted to drink the broth, it was that good. We ended up splitting the wasabi noodle with flatiron steak (med rare).  

Everything from the food presentation, flavor, and service was impeccable.  Between the both us, we still had one more deep fried salmon roll and left over wasabi noodle with steak. We were so full.  For sharing 2 appetizers and one entree,  we spent  $41. Not too shabby for a fancy Asian fusion restaurant.  Looking forward to coming back here to try the other items on the menu.
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
Still yummy after all these years!

Love this neighborhood gem. I discovered The House when we both lived in the Inner Sunset. After my move to North Beach, I was so happy they opened up here.

This is one of about 5-6 "proper" artisan restaurants in North Beach who shine brightly in a monotonous sea of pizza and pasta for the masses. 

Lovely Cal/Asian synchronicity never fails to disappoint in all its flavor spectrums. Always fresh, perfectly prepared and thoughtfully presented.

Even if the space is very "cozy" (euphemism for small and cramped), the deliciousness is worth the sacrifice in personal space. On the upside, if your dining companion is boring, just tune into your neighbor's conversation instead. ;-)
author: bon w.

description:
12/6/14: Well, perhaps they were just "off" tonight, but this meal unfortunately did not live up to the hype...

1. Deep-Fried Salmon Roll with Chinese Hot Mustard $10: It appears this is their most popular appetizer cause every table had one.  My friend came here often and I guess got this one many times before.  It was good--nice and tidy wrapped salmon in egg-roll skin.  But this time around the salmon was cooked mostly through and was a little drier than I would have liked.  She said is is usually  medium-rare and tonight's was just overdone.  The sauce was really great--spicy with a real kick.  The vegetable salad side tasted weird.  Was probably a fluke, but overall, nothing too special to me... 5/10.

2. Creamy Shitake Mushroom Soup (tonight's special) $10: Holy cow... this is some of the best mushroom soup I've had!  Creamy yes, but still managed to have an earthy mushroom texture, and of course the very familiar shitake taste.  The whole thing was super savory and tasty.  Looks like they added some kind of oil over the top (see pictures) and though I couldn't really identify what it was, it all melted in my mouth.  Awesome.  Absolutely must have if they still have it when you come!  10/10.

3. Kurobuta Pork Chop with Pomegranate Currant Sauce $26: Before I ordered this I asked the waitress if it would be dry (cause we've all had dry pork chops and they suck)--she said as long as I let the chef cook it the way he wants to, which is about "medium" it would be juicy and great.  Well... I dunno how "medium" it was, but certainly I've had juicier at other places.  Wasn't bad, but for a fancy place I expected better.  The actual pomegranate sauce and seasonings were SUPER good.  Of the sweet type pork chop sauces I've had, this is among the best.  The mashed potatoes kinda sucked and were a little plain and watery, but the oil they were served with really helped out the flavor.  The chips were pretty good--I'd love a whole bag full to snack on.  Anyway, it would have been really awesome if the meat was better prepared  (I think maybe even a 10/10 if the meat was perfect!).  6.5/10.

4. Warm Wasabi House Noodles with Angus Flatiron Steak $19: This would be kinda their version of Jja Jiang Myeon (Korean Chinese noodles), topped with steak.  Given the extremely reasonable price--hell, pretty much a bargain--I think even if this dish wasn't the best, it's still quite a deal.  And well, I would say given the price it's pretty good.  The meat was super good--very high quality steak and extremely tender and flavorful.  The vegetable toppings weren't great tasting though.  And the noodles, though tasted fine, were not really what I expected from a fancy restaurant.  Jja Jiang Myeon is kinda the "commoner's" food, and the way they prepared it wasn't even as good as the stuff served in hole-in-the-walls.  But anyway, the steak was great and is the highlight.  Note the "wasabi" in the title--both me and my friend could not taste it at all!!!--but she said she got it before and definitely could taste it then.  Another fluke.

Throw away all the weird tasting veggie salad they have.  Can do without the cheap noodles too.  Steak's perfect--should just make that the whole dish.

Too bad the rest wasn't the same quality as the steak.  For the price, 6.5/10 (but if they charged more I'd probably lower the score).

5. Blueberry Bread Pudding (tonight's special) $8.50: So, I think one's taste in bread pudding is really subjective.  I've had all kinds ranging from drowned in syrup to very dry almost like straight up loafed bread.  I'd have to say, I like mine like dessert--sweet and gooey.  But anyway, this is not that--it's the bready cakey kind.  Is about medium density and has good moisture.  The blueberry topping is good, but even with that it's not very sweet.  Maybe it's-too-sweet Asians like it this way, but it's not my kind of dessert.  5/10.

I think this restaurant is a good attempt at Asian-influenced American food.  Price-wise it's a bargain, but I think the food needs a little work.

Btw, this place is UBER popular.  I mean, we got there at about 5:30 and there was no line we saw and it was still a 1hr wait!  Then by the time we left there was a huge crowd outside.  I'd hate to see how long they'd have to wait.  Reservations are highly recommended!

I think I'd like to come back for another try, for another chance... especially given the relatively good prices.  Definitely has potential to be much better.

3/5 for tonight's subpar performance.  Hopefully next time it'll be better.

#fusion #Chinese #american
author: Dean C.

description:
Ordered: 
1. Seared Sea Scallops. A+
2. Mussels. D+
3. Carb Cake. B+
4. Wagyu. A
5. Ribeye B+
6. Grilled Sea Bass. B
7. Wasabi Noodle with Flat Iron Steak. B
8. Pomegranate Pork Chop. C-...Toooo Sweet

This place is really small, but service is quick.  I would go back and order 3 orders of the Seared Sea Scallops as an entre.
author: Patrick D.

description:
This was our favorite meal on our most recent trip to SF. Our beer and bike tour guide recommended this place and I'm so glad we followed her advice. We came on a Sunday evening before Labor Day and got out on the wait list around 6:30. We got a text message an hour later saying our table was ready. 

We had the fried salmon rolls, soft shell crab (one of the specials that day), wasabi noodles and steak, and the king salmon in miso and all were so so so delicious. The wasabi noodles had a wasabi flavor but they didn't give you that warm, nasal sensation you normally get with wasabi.  The salmon was cooked perfectly medium and so was the flatiron steak that went with the noodles. 

Staff was pretty friendly and attentive while we were there. Would definitely come back - probably make a lunch reservation next time.
author: Cat S.

description: Visiting San Fran for work and me and some co workers went and checked this place out for lunch. Very small, cozy place which I liked. Service was very good. I have a gluten allergy and they were very accommodating in telling me the things I could order. I ended up getting the Angus Steak plate and it was very tasty.
author: Kyle R.

description:
Maybe my expectations were too high for this place from reading all of the 5 star reviews. Parking in the area sucks but if you're lucky you can find street parking going up the hill right around the corner.  We went for lunch on a Monday and got there about 10 minutes before they opened. There were a few other groups that lined up but we were the first. 

Salmon Rolls - This was my favorite here. I don't even like Salmon but i thought this was a good dish. It went well with the hot mustard dipping sauce and didn't have much of a fishy flavor to it. 

Wasabi Noodles with Steak - Overhyped. The noodles were ok I liked that they had a nice wasabi punch to them but it just tasted like wasabi flavored udon noodles to me. The steak was a bit on the tough side and i got mine done medium. 

Kurobota Pork Chop - It went really well with the pomegrante sauce but the piece of pork chop that we had was a bit on the overcooked side and hard to eat.
author: Brandon Y.

description: great food. salmon roll to die for. i had the pork with noodles and the wife had the bass. we also tried the pork chops. needless to say everything was amazing. staff is super friendly and food quality is great. but u don't need my review to believe it; this place has almost 5 stars with over 4k reviews. great food!
author: Willie Y.

description: My favorite restaurant I have been to in SF. The food is thoughtfully and tastefully made and everyone I went to dinner with enjoyed it tremendously. It was a great experience.
author: Nathan B.

description:
Have been wanting to try this place for a while now..I'm so glad I finally did!!

I usually am a chicken eater, don't each much meat or seafood... but this was the  first time that I actually ate no chicken whatsoever.. and I loved it.

We had the prawn tempura and crab cake to start with. Both super fresh and tasty. Loved the presentation too.

For mains we shared the much talked about garlic noodles with angus  and the Black Cod.... The noodles were good..I found a meat a little chewy, but then I don't each much of red meat, so I'm not sure if it was just me.... 

BUT the start of the eve... was the black cod... so so so awesome!!! I loved the fish itself and the preparation. the sauce complemented it so well. Think it was miso It was a daily special dish, so if they happen to have it on the menu... def must try!!

For dessert had the chocolate cake ... yumm!!

P.S. They are pretty accommodating with requests. the table next to us asked for the angus to be replaced with salmon on the noodles and they gladly agreed.

The restaurant itself is a little small, not too fancy looking...both the food and service was was soo good that you can choose to ignore that.
author: Insiya N.

description:
"I dare you to find a better tasting piece of halibut in The City." - Me
Although The House is a small place, the food is BIG on flavor. We recommend the Shrimp Dumplings and Grilled Unagi small plates to start. For dinner, consider the Angus Steak with Wasabi Noodles. (Sorry folks, the outstanding Halibut was one of the specials tonight.) Take our advice and finish your meal with the Truffle Chocolate Cake. It is ridiculously delicious! It's at places like this where they realize how important small touches are. Table settings are clean and includes a cute surprise. Used plates are removed between courses. Reservations are gladly accepted. So the next time you're going out for a special dinner, call ahead for an experience at The House.
author: John B.

description: AMAZING! Didn't have a reservation but they fit us in on a busy Monday holiday. Soft shell crab tempura with Sriracha somen, Warm kale salad with Bleu cheese and pistachios, Kurobuta chop and Fresh grilled Halibut in a beautiful sauce.
author: Stacey Y.

description:
This place is a hidden gem. The atmosphere is casual but the food is top class (beautiful presentation and awesome flavors). The wine list is also very good, small selection but high quality.

Among the appetizer, I really liked the octopus and the scallops. Kudos for the tuna steak as main course.

I discovered this restaurant 2 weeks ago and I've already been there 2 times since then. It will  definitely become one of my go-to place in SF.
author: Corrado C.

description:
For my last night, my friend and I came here for dinner. To be quite honest, despite the reviews, I wasn't very thrilled about coming here since my dining experience at SPQR. 

BUT.. I was surprised. After our dinner, I told my friend.. "I think this may be the best dinner during my stay here" and she goes "wait..I just texted my boyfriend the same thing" 

I was so surprised.. EVERYTHING was so perfect. We ordered the crispy salmon roll appetizer which was MY FAVORITE. Not too crispy and the salmon wasn't over cooked. It was.. just perfect. I ordered the seabass with the miso noodles.. I'm not a big fan of  seabass but because my friend wanted to try both dishes, I went for it.. and it was perfect. I apologize for using the word "perfect" too much but I can't think of any other word than that.

For dessert, my friend ordered the coconut creme brulee which I'm also not a big fan of.. but when I tried the first scoop, I was amazed. I mean.. for a girl who wasn't a big fan of a lot of dishes that were ordered, I ENJOYED THEM ALL. 

Best dinner during my stay at SF, hands down :)
author: Lena C.

description:
Went here for V-day after hearing a lot of good things about the place....and honestly, I was not impressed  This place is without a doubt OVERRATED.

the portions were super tiny and the flavors were just OK, when considering the premium price you are paying (dinner for 2, 1 app, 2 drinks = $120+). Not to mention the service was pretty average, I've had better customer service at chain restaurants than I did here. 

Probably won't be coming back here again...
author: Mario P.

description:
Came here a couple of times with my boyfriend with and without reservations and it's always been great! Service has always been decent but more than that, the food has always been on point! My personal favorite (like many others) is the wasabi house noodles but every other item I tried so far has never disappointed me. 

Place is a bit small so definitely recommend making reservations beforehand and finding parking in the area is tough!
author: Joanna K.

description:
Their GRILLED SEA BASS! Get it. Get it. Get it. 

  I came here with friends after wandering around Chinatown and I recognized it as one of the more popular restaurants on Yelp. The outer facade was pretty simple, grey with their restaurant name on top stating, "the house". After peering inside through their front window and liking the cute and quiet interior, we decided to eat here! 

   We came maybe an hour before closing and thank god there wasn't that many people. I got the grilled sea bass and my friends got the flank steak with wasabi noodles and the pork chop, respectively. 

    But back to the SEA BASS! The fish of course was cooked very well. The taste was very sweet, but not the sugar type of sweet but the innate seafood type of sweet! The texture was superb too and the fish was just melt in your mouth. The garlic sauce that they had on the side provided just the right amount of flavor without being too over-bearing and didn't take away the innate taste of the sea bass. Also the texture of the sauce complimented it very well! It was a thicker kind of sauce but not too thick. 

    Also they add a side of garlic noodles and some greens to the fish plate. Now onto the noodles--they were really bomb. Good texture and really garlic-y like it's supposed to be. BUT a little too salty. 

    But really guys, the sea bass is definitely the star here. Although the other dishes are all very good as well!
author: Janet K.

description:
Price meets quality!  The food is fantastic and the prices are actually quite reasonable with good portions. It's truly a great value!  

The food was fun, looks pretty and had good flavor.  I didn't find anything especially unique however. Don't get me wrong, you should go here and eat!  I was amazed how the cod was cooked. I have never had it seared so well and yet so light and flakey as it was.  It wasn't accompanied by sides that lifted me up with it however.  The green beans were generic and the noodles were good but the sauce was a bit generic as well.  

Overall, I would come back here for a quality meal for a great price but it lacks that final pizzazz that hits my five star rating
author: Mike S.

description: Went on Valentine's. Food was good and was more of a fusion between different Asian cuisines. Interior felt clustered and though the dish were pricier, it didn't give an up-scale ambiance.
author: Linda K.

description:
Honestly this was one of the best meals I have had in SF, which is saying a lot bc I hate grocery shopping so going out to eat is an every night thing.

The place is small, and gets packed very quickly. Make a reservation!

The ambiance is whatever but honestly the food is so good it doesn't matter. 

We ordered:

Fried Salmon Roll: Unbelievable: tasted like a cross between a sushi and an eggroll and came with a spicy mustard sauce that made your sinuses sting sooo good.

Crab Cake: Honestly the best crab cake I have ever had. Juicey, full of real crab, and extremely flavorful.

Strip steak with Wasabi noodles: Unreal, the seasoning and melody of flavors in this dish were great, the portion was huge so I get to have the other half for lunch today. 

Daily Special: Soy Cod fillet with a sushi roll on top: Cod was perfectly cooked and the flavor of the sauce didn't overpower the meat but complimented it perfectly. 

We just had some black tea to drink but the total was about $100 with tax and tip for 2 people. Not terrible but honestly so worth it!
author: Michelle A.

description:
We got here before they open so we only had to wait for 15min, but the line got crazy real quick.

It's a tiny place that does not have much decorations. However, the food was not bad at all. I'd recommend the black cod - super buttery and tasty. Another must try is salmon rolls, since everyone is raving about it. 

Food quality: 8/10
Ambiance: 7/10
Service: 7/10

Verdict? I would recommend, but there are other better Asian fusion places in SF.
author: Mandy D.

description: Recommended by a local and this small restaurant did not disappoint!  Every bite was full of flavor!  It's not great for large groups unless you can reserve ahead of time and if you are impatient like me make a reservation even if it's just for two people so you don't have to wait!  BUT this meal would have been worth the wait had we not had a reservation!
author: Ali C.

description:
I would probably rate this more like 3.5 stars. 

Here's what we got.

Appetizers:
-- Yellowtail (appetizer special) - Only okay, nothing special. 
-- Mussels - Good, not great but would order it again.
-- Tuna Tartare - Good, not great but might order it again (only 3 chips prepared).
-- Grilled Octopus - Great, favorite appetizer! Very tender. 

Entrees:
