-- Sea Bass - This is the entree my parents and I got. Loved it. Almost finished the whole thing! The sauce for the sea bass was so yummy. And the garlic noodles...weren't very garlicy but I love noodles so I didn't mind. Tasted more like chow mein.
-- Wasabi House Noodles with Steak - My brother got this so I only tried the wasabi house noodles but they were pretty good. Didn't really taste like wasabi but had a kick to it. It was a little spicy for me but if you like spicy, you'd probably like it.
-- Seared Ahi - My boyfriend got this and he enjoyed it but would probably get the Wasabi House Noodles with Steak next time. In my opinion, the seared ahi was pretty plain. Didn't even taste like there was salt used on it at all. He also wasn't given the option for noodles so it was plain ahi with plain rice so overall it seemed like nothing special. Would probably be great with either the garlic noodles or wasabi noodles instead to kick it up a notch but don't think they give that as an option.

Reservations:
- In the past I've had so much trouble getting reservations for a couple weekends in advance for a peak dinner time but I got lucky and scored reservations at 5pm on a Sunday. They have no online reservations so you always have to call which kinda sucks. Also, because my reservations were for 7 people, it was such a "big" party they needed credit card information to reserve it, which I don't get why they need...but I gave it anyway because I was desperate to make the reservation and try this place. 
- Also, on the Yelp, it says it opens at 5:30pm on Sundays but on the website it says 5pm. It doesn't seem like many people come at 5pm on Sunday so that might be your best bet on the weekend if Saturdays are too crowded. 

Service:
- I don't know what it was but the service on the Sunday we came was not friendly at all. That's all we could talk about once we left. It was THAT noticeable. But it's so weird because not many reviews mention bad service. When we got there, it was still closed and they have no hours posted so I was confused and nervous I got the reservation time wrong. When a lady finally opened the doors, she kind of just gave us a blank stare, no friendly welcome. I just explained we had reservations and she led us to a table. Our waitresses didn't seem too happy explaining the specials to us. We noticed no one working there ever really smiled. It was just so strange. 

Honestly, the place is not bad, but because of how far it is, how difficult parking is, and the service, I would come back BUT I'm not RUSHING back. I don't have to have it.
author: Amanda L.

description:
This place is grade-A awesome!  Highly recommend it.  

Went there during the day and happened upon it after a quick yelp search. This place did not disappoint.  The thing is, its hard to convince you on this place. As others have mentioned, its unassuming and looks like nothing special. Nothing on the menu, jumps out at you as something amazing, in words that is...but once you order, you will see, this place comes correct!!

The food was great and the service, even better.  If you have a chance to check this place out, do it.
author: Josh M.

description:
Fried Salmon Roll - 4.5, delicious
Pomegranate Pork Chop - 3.5, juicy and flavorful
Sea Bass - 4, like an upgraded version of a homey Chinese meal
author: I Fan L.

description:
Ok, I think it is about time for me to finally write a review for this lovely restaurant! I stopped by this place again for dinner with a couple of my friends, who have never been here before (WHAAT!?). Even though it was a Monday night, it got pretty busy as it got later into the night, so it's always a good idea to make reservations just in case! Oh and parking here can be a little tough but after a few circles, you should be able to find a spot. 

We started off with some appetizers: the fried Salmon roll, tuna tartare, and the Hamachi sashimi. The Salmon roll is a definite must try because the Salmon is really moist and the crispy coating on the outside compliments it really well. It also comes with a wasabee dip, which I didn't really like because I'm not a fan of wasabee. The tuna tartare was really good too. The piece of chip that the tuna pieces were placed on was very tasty and eating it with the tuna tasted even better. The Hamachi sashimi had a vinegrette taste to it which was topped off with some avocado. Yumm!

For my entree I decided to try the sea bass this time, which also comes with green beans and garlic noodles. As first timers here, my friends got the wasabee noodle with the skirt steak and the tuna entree. My sea bass was seared perfectly and flaked off easily. It tasted really good with the garlic noodles and the green beans was very flavorful. The soy sauce that came with my sea bass was really good too. I dipped both my sea bass and green beans in there! :d My friends really enjoyed their entrees as well. We were all too full by the end of our meal to order dessert soooo...we decided to go to Purple Kow right after instead! :P Loll...anyways this place will always be one of my favorite gems in SF with excellent food and good service. I feel like I can eat the same dish here every time and it would still be like a totally new and satisfying experience everytime! I love The House!!! =)
author: Mary C.

description:
Located in North Beach district, parking is very difficult. The House is a very tiny restaurant where tables are nearly right next to each other. I wouldn't really recommend coming here with a big group but they do accept reservations (which I highly recommend no matter the size of your party). There's only one bathroom for both men and women, so there's usually someone waiting.

We had reservations but everyone showed up late so we lost our spot. We ended up waiting 30 additional minutes to get a seat unfortunately but King of Thai Noodle House is next door so you can get a drink while you're waiting. My friend was waiting at their bar and said the drinks were good and the bartender hot. I didn't want to drink since I drove so I just took his word for it. 

Menu on 7/21/2014
Small:
Selected Oysters on the half shell w/ Spicy Cilantro Mignonette: $13
Ahi Tuna Tartare w/ Roasted Nori Chips: $10
Steamed Mussels w/ Garlic infused Shrimp Broth: $12
White Shrimp & Chinese Chive Dumplings: $10
Classic Fried Calamari: $10
Maine Crab Cake w/ Pickled Ginger Remoulade: $12
Deep-fried Salmon Roll w/ Chinese Hot Mustard: $10
Blue Lake Bean Tempura w/ Pickled Ginger Soy: $9
Deep-fried  Chicken Liver w/ Baby Greens: $9
Asparagus w/ Roasted Sesame Dressing: $8
Caesar Salad w/ Crispy Scallops: $11
White Shrimp Tempura, Avocado, Baby Greens: $11
Charred Baby Octopus Salad, crispy Pork Skin, Red Chili Vinaigrette: $11

Main:
Warm Wasabi House Noodles w/ Angus Flatiron Steak: $19
Mushroom Rice w/ Grilled Prawns, Shaved Bonito: $20
Grilled Sea Bass w/ Garlic Ginger Soy: $27
Sesame Soy Glazed King Salmon in a Bonito Sake Broth: $23
Grilled Ahi Tuna (rare) w/ Spicy Mustard Aioli: $23
Chicken Breast w/ Roasted Portabella White Truffle Oil Sauce: $19
Kurobuta Pork Chop w/ Pomegranate Currant Sauce: $25
Angus Rib-eye Steak, house-made Teriyaki, Toasted Garlic Butter: $27

Dessert: 
Apple Crumble Pie a la mode: $8.50
Bittersweet Chocolate Truffle Cake, Coffee Ice Cream, Coconut Caramel: $8.50
Coconut Creme Brulee, Passion Fruit Puree: $7
Mango Tapioca: $7
Chinese Almond Cookies: ($5) To take home

For small plates we ordered the ahi tuna tartare and deep-fried salmon roll. Both were just ok. The ahi tuna tartare came out really pretty and I liked the nori chips but I would've liked some kind of zing in the tartare (whether it be spicy, bit salty, something) as it barely had any flavor. The tuna was fresh though. The roll wasn't that noteworthy as the salmon was too cooked for my liking. The bed of Chinese hot mustard that the rolls laid on tasted like really spicy kimchee.

We ordered two specials that wasn't listed on the menu (they don't have a separate paper menu for their specials, just as told by your waiter/waitress): A pork chop and a Kobe beef dish. The pork chop was slightly chewy but not too much where it was annoying. We ordered the Kobe steak medium rare, but when it came out, it came out slightly more cooked than I would've liked. It was still very tender though.

For the mains that we ordered from the menu, we had the Wasabi House Noodles w/ Angus Flatiron Steak and the Grilled Sea Bass. The noodles for both dishes were chow mein noodles, just with different sauces. The noodles for the Wasabi House tasted more like a kimchi flavor profile than wasabi but the flatiron steak was actually tender. Since the noodles had such a strong flavor, I was glad that the steak was more subtle. I really liked the noodle sauce for the grilled sea bass as it had a light soy sauce base. The sea bass was definitely my favorite of all the dishes though. It came with a garlic ginger soy on the side but the sea bass was seasoned so well, I actually preferred not to use it (which is surprised me because I'm such a huge sauce person).

We had the Mango Tapioca for dessert as one of my friends saw the pictures and really wanted to try the dessert. Very creamy and smooth, it wasn't overly sweet. Fairly good dish but not sure if it was really worth it.

I came knowing this place is a fusion establishment so I wasn't expecting too much as a lot of fusion restaurants are all over the place in how good their dishes are but I've had this placed bookmarked for quite awhile. In all, the dishes were merely ok and the only item I'd get if I was to ever come back would be the Sea Bass. That dish is a definite must get!

Note: limit 2 credit cards / table
author: Kitty K.

description:
This has been on my list for a while and we finally checked it out.  It was sort of worth the hype.  

Sort of. But not really.

All of our appetizers were exceptionally good: the fresh scallops in lemon ponzu sauce, open-face sushi with unagi & avocado, soft shell crab tempura, and the ahi tartare.  My expectations were set high after that.

Unfortunately, the entrees were lackluster.  I had the ribeye with a demi glaze and it was just a decent cut, the sauce overwhelmed any natural flavor of the meat versus complementing it. My wife's wasabi noodles with vegetables tasted downright amateurish, like an awkward veggie workaround.  Both were disappointing ultimately.  

We sampled some desserts and they were average, ending the meal with a bland whimper.  

Service was subpar.  We were running a few minutes late and told our table would only be held for 10 mins.  So we got there just a few mins past -and then proceeded to wait 10+ mins for our table! Why couldn't they just tell us no problem, they were running late too?

Our waitress was fine but couldn't remember if the ribeye was bone-in or not and called an upside down cake a turnover.  She seemed indifferent to the distinction.

We asked one server pouring water if she knew if the side rice noodles with sauce  served were vegetarian or not and she said they were "rice noodles".  Er, yeah, didn't mean to imply the rice noodles were made of meat, lady; was asking you about the sauce.  She said she wasn't sure and walked away.  Rude. Thanks for nothing lady! 

If the service wasn't bad, this place may have squeaked out 4 stars based on the apps but I can't do it, too many things wrong.
author: Saminda W.

description:
This is not fine dining, but the food is seriously good. Yes, it's fusion, but it's good fusion. It's also vertical. I like my food vertical. 

Ambiance: it's in North Beach. Points for that. The interior is only so so ( not swanky in any way... No table cloths, paper napkins... You get the idea)

Waitstaff: efficient and nice.

Food: 3 of us split:
Salmon appetizer ( excellent)
Salad with passion fruit dressing ( ok, but overdressed...like drippy)

Mains:
Halibut special with black truffle cream
Pork Chop with pomegranate glaze

Both came with mediocre mashed potatoes ( there as a vehicle for sticking things in to make vertical presentation I think... and also to soak up sauce. The potatoes themselves were sadly lumpy and flavorless)

But, aside from the mashed potatoes, both dishes were delicious. The meat was perfectly cooked and these guys know how to make excellent and interesting sauces. 

Lychee iced tea... Meh.

Total bill with tip: 85. This was totally reasonable.
author: El B.

description: So overrated and so upset by it! We found out it was an hour wait so we thought this place has to be good! We waited for about 45 minutes, went to check on our name, and were seated right away. We ordered the deep fried salmon role to start - pretty much no taste if you didn't put the sauce on it. We then shared the noodles and steak / bass meal... Steak was VERY fatty and the bass seemed like it was a little too grilled. It tasted like I was eating charcoal. The noodles were great and made up for the poor meat and fish. To top it all off the service was bad. We never even got our water filled - we had to ask.  Not worth 100.00 for this meal... Super upset!
author: Abby M.

description: This was recommended by our hotel and it was AMAZING!  We had the oysters, white shrimp dumplings, wasabi noodles with flat iron steak, and truffle brownie with coffee ice cream!! We also enjoyed a Sauvignon Blanc from South Africa.  This is a must do restaurant in SF.  Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu!
author: Katie K.

description: Great food and ambiance. The staff is great. The food is unique. Always anticipating what is on their menu.
author: Young Y.

description: We were expecting a sushi style Japanese restaurant but what we got was 100X better! The service is super quick, the appetizers are out of this world and the mains are to die for. If I had a choice, i would eat at The House ever night for dinner while in San Fran. Great restaurant!! Even better ambience!
author: Esther K.

description:
We had a great dinner here! We got into SF late and were looking for a place that was close to our hotel. 3500 reviews on yelp with 4.5 stars...how could you go wrong!? I think we got really lucky -- it was a Wednesday night -- they had a reservation. It was packed. Everything came out really quickly and everything was awesome. Hubby said it was one of his top 5 favorite meals! The fried salmon rolls were so good -- not greasy, salmon cooked perfectly! The hamachi special appetizer was excellent -- 5 really big slices of hamachi with a really good avocado topping. The kale salad was amazing (hubby even ate it and liked it!) -- thin ribbons of kale with cheese and pistachios. As others have said, the special black cod was so good -- silky, delicious tasting, and it came with a crab roll that was really good, a slight twist on a California roll. Also, the sauce that comes with it is really good. Everyone at the table will fight over it! And, the salmon entree was also good. Oh, the entrees came with greens and they were so good (again, couldn't believe that hubby was fighting with me for the veg!). Everything was just a little different than what you have had somewhere else, which made it that much better. 

Also, service was great.

Update: Our second visit was just as good as our first! We had many of the same things and everything was awesome. We tried the sea bass that is on the menu. So good! It was buttery tasting with a perfect crust. The sauce it came with was delicious. And, typical of this restaurant the veggies that it came with were so good -- I LOVED the green beans!! Dad loved the pork chop. The special sashimi appetizer was amazing! It rivaled any sushi place that we have eaten at. The hamachi was melt in your mouth. The scallop appetizer was also amazing -- cooked perfectly and amazing flavors. The House is AWESOME. Everything is always delicious -- super interesting flavors. Husband said he could eat there every day for the rest of his life and be happy! :)
author: Jen G.

description:
It was our last night in SF and my cousin recommended this place to me. Small joint around the corner and definitely impossible to find parking during rush hour. Just walk there if you're nearby! Lighting was too dimmed for our party. There's only 1 big window by the doorway and I wish we were by the window. 

Salmon roll, deep fried to medium: A lot of guests enjoy this dish, but it wasn't for me. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but I don't like my salmon deep fried. 

Wasabi noodles and flat iron steak: It may sound a little weird, but those wasabi noodles were goooooood! Right about of wasabi flavor with a little bit of the steak and the vegetables. Perfect bite. There was also fresh cucumber in the dish that kinda of gave some freshness. 

Porkchop with pomegranate and current reduction: It may sound a little sweet, but this was definitely my favorite dish out of everything. The porkchop had a nice sear, cooked to medium with a touch of pink. Tender, juicy, had a little fat and just tasty. 

Ribeye with toasted garlic butter: It was huge ribeye steak! Can't go wrong with steak, teriyaki sauce and garlic butter. Cooked to medium rare, tender and the garlic butter added extra flavor to it. This is a safe dish if you don't want to get out of your comfort zone.
author: Ana Z.

description:
Last time we were in San Francisco, we decided not to wait this out and went for cheap thai down the block. This time. We walked by around 5 pm on a Sunday and the place was pretty empty. We were seated immediately and had a nice early dinner. 

We ordered 3 of the starters. These were quite large in my opinion. First, we had the hamachi.  This was my favorite. Great flavors and nice pieces of fish. Next we had the fried salmon rolls. These were a bit greasy for me, but the mustard and kimchee helped it. Finally, we had the scallops. These were cooked well, but were maybe lacking a little something. 

Overall, we had a nice small meal (so we could keep eating later that night).  We'd maybe come back, but it's hard to repeat meals in sf.
author: Jackie B.

description:
Real fine dining without the pretense.
So happy I was able to experience the food.
Imaginative. 
High quality.
author: B T.

description: Reservations are a must! The place is very small,  right across from The Stinking Rose. Loved the Eel Rice Sushi and half shell oysters...disappointed that they didn't have the Black Cod with cavier (as shown on most reviews). Overall, great experience! Definitely would come back again.
author: Ally T.

description:
The House has always been one of my favorite restaurants in SF for a semi fine dining experience for decent prices.

My favorites here are the Fried Salmon Rolls, Seared Scallops (when in season), Ribeye and Rock Cod. 

The Fried Salmon roll has large chunks of salmon fried in a thin layer of (what appears to be) wonton skin. It comes with a dipping sauce that has hints of wasabi that works really well together.

When available, the Seared Scallops comes in three huge pieces of scallops, lightly seared and dressed in a refreshing light citrus sauce.

The Rib Eye is a bit on the pricier side but cooked to perfection at medium rare. If you love red meat, I would highly recommend trying this at least once.

The Rock Cod is a great option for fish lovers.

Parking can be a bit difficult in the area but not impossible if you head into the residential areas. I would recommend grabbing a reservation if possible.
author: Jeff M.

description: I've been coming here for over 15 years felt compelled to write a review. It's not as if The House needs another positive review to convince people the food is good, but I can chime in that the place has been *consistently* great for over a decade. I can't even recall when I first went to The House, but I want to say it was early 2000's before the dot com bubble burst. It's always been a popular lunch spot for those who work in the North Beach/Financial District/Chinatown area, and is a great place to take clients given it's a little on the upscale side (all tables have white table cloths), but not too fancy. The restaurant itself is pretty small with the tables fairly close to each other in that NYC kind of way. The food though...simply wonderful. My personal favorites are the warm wasabi noodles with grilled salmon or the sea bass with ginger soy, and curry noodles are great as well. All of the dishes are perfectly spiced and offer just the right "kick" without it being overbearing. This is definitely a go-to lunch spot for me, and on my top ten list of favorite SF places. Never been for dinner, but I'm sure it's just as good at night.
author: K C.

description: Lunch with my family.small restaurant but it was busy even at lunch.food was good.service not bad.
author: Cindy T.

description: True, 'you cant judge a book by its cover'. Wasn't sure what to expect but the reviews were off the charts so we decided to give it a try. This little place impressed me! The food was incredibly tasty. We started off with the Deep dried salmon roll which was full of flavor. My hubby had the ribeye and i had their Halibut special. Let me just say that very minimal chewing was needed with both entrees, they just melt in your mouth. Both equally delicious. For dessert we had the bittersweet chocolate cake! That was to die for!!! Love this place and highly recommend it. Make sure you have a reservation cause the wait can be long!
author: Narain G.

description:
The besst seabass EVER. Melts in your mouth, so tender, sweet, delicious and mind blowing. I honestly still think about this dish from time to time and its been a few months since I've been here. The dish comes with some veggies and noodles I think, they were probably tasty but the only thing I remembered was how that soft buttery sea bass melted in my mouth. Ermahgad foodgasm for sure. One complaint I have is that the soy/ginger sauce that they give you to add to the seabass was WAY too salty. I could only handle a few drops from dipping my fork into the sauce and dripping it on to the piece of fish. For the most part I did not use the sauce. Would've been excellent if they made it more savory sweet with ginger than excruciatingly salty. Its a minor hiccup though, I would still get the bass. I'm all about that bass, bout that bass. YUUUM. 

The salmon eggroll thing they had was good too, the yellowish sauce it comes with is wasabi base or wasabi tasting so beware. I was not warned lol. The appetizer was tasty and flaky, I liked.

My friend got the special halibut - it was good! I liked that a lot too. Another friend got the wagyu steak, and another got the steak wasabi noodles. The wasabi noodles did not taste like wasabi so don't be scared. Everyone loved their food, we made a good choice. The food was good and the prices reasonable. We had 4 entrees and 2 appetizers 1 drink, price came out to be around $180 tip included. I would definitely come back, in fact was planning on taking my boyfriend the next time he visits! It's a small place so remember to rsvp!! We were lucky enough to get seated without reservations and before the rush hour started.
author: Ngan T.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in SF. The food is spectacular and you get value for what you are paying. I usually am not a fan of fusion but the house does it right. 

Very crowded and close seating but worth it.
author: Mariam H.

description:
Not a lot of veggie options. 

Guess that's not how they throw down here.

I had fried green beans as my app. The ginger sauce that was served with them was thin and too sour. 

I ordered wasabi noodles with tofu as my entree. Meh. The dish lacked flavor. The tofu was grilled but didn't taste like anything. Massive disappointment. 

Not goin' back.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
The House has become one of my favorite restaurant destinations. Make sure you get a reservation a few days in advance because it does get overly crowded at the restaurant and getting a table is quite difficult unless you arrive there right when the doors open. Reservations are held up to 15 minutes and trust me, those extra 15 minutes count because finding parking in North Beach is a pain. The restaurant is small and cramped and you are literally sitting elbow to elbow with other customers. With the dining area aside, let's get onto the food.

Whenever The House has the scallops as an appetizer special, Get it! It is an amazing starter with three big scallops, micro greens and with a lemon butter sauce. Other highlights is definitely the pork chop with the pomegranate sauce and the mushroom rice. The pork chop is one of the most amazing pork dishes I ever had. The pork chop is juicy and tender with plenty of sauce as well. It's a pretty dish with two towers of crispy taro and a potato salad with carrots. I have also tried the miso sea bass, wasabi noodles and even the coconut creme bruleee with passion fruit puree. Pretty much everything I have tried here exceeded my expectations. The amount of flavors from each dish gives your taste buds a little dance and makes you want more. 

The staff is very nice and they are very quick with clearing your table as well. The tables are quite small and when you order a lot of food, it takes up the entire table. There's nothing else I can say that hasn't been said already. Great food and you will definitely want to come back. Check out the pictures I uploaded as well. Expect to pay between $75-$90 for a party of two for dinner for one appetizer, 2 entrees and a dessert.
author: Danster L.

description:
What a wonderful little Date Night spot! My beloved, J never fails to impress me, even after all these years he spoils me rotten and fuels my foodie side. 

The House did NOT disappointment, he's been spying on this little gem for a while and finally decided to see if it lived up to all it's wonderful reviews.

Beautiful and fresh decor, smaller then he had expected. We were seated right away, given menus and promptly told about the days specials. 

It didn't take us long to scan the menu and decide what we wanted. 
Oysters on the half shell served with a spicy cilantro/ vinegar. The cilantro gave a completely new depth to the salty taste of the oysters, added a divine compliment to the spicy kick that hit at the back of you throat first but dissipated cleanly. Oysters were clean, fresh and creamy.
- Oysters Photo:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Qo-eoz8T9K0FqmEcEOndrA#ZIYyIIsFTZpgyOfDOfPgDQ

Crunchy Salmon Roll with a spicy Honey Mustard, PERFECTLY cooked flaky salmon wrapped in a high quality seaweed which was then embraced in a crunchy, flaky outer crust, paired with a spicy mustard that ran into our nostrils, this dish was not only beautiful but delightful on the palate. 
- Crunchy Salmon Roll Photo:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Qo-eoz8T9K0FqmEcEOndrA#VvrfhBUGg5Bb4SgLlEzJfQ

And for the MAIN EVENT! 
Wasabi Noodles with Angus Beef.
The real treasure that had us coming to The House in the first place. 
Beautiful presentation, thought it was SLIGHTLY undercooked (requested medium rare but served slightly more rare then medium). The meat was a little tough because of how it was undercooked, but it still had solid flavor. The noodles had an after the fact hint of the wasabi, which was very pleasant. This dish, paired with a Pinot Noir was amazing, the wine added an earthy, oaky but smooth dimension. 
- Wasabi Noodles w/ Angus Beef Photo:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-house-san-francisco?select=Qo-eoz8T9K0FqmEcEOndrA#7IMehiPQEX0HlJ9G-QaMIg

Pro Foodie Tip:
Make Reservations for this spot! While they try to accomidate walk-ins as best they can, it is clear they are often busy with and for reservations.
author: Meghan L.

description: Not the easiest place to find but worth looking for.  Yelp doesn't do us wrong again.  We both ordered 2 different specials and the did not disappoint.  I wanted to order 2nds to take back to the hotel.
author: David W.

description:
Man it's tough to get a reservation here! But understandably so...as its an uber tiny little popular place in North Beach.
Went for a friend's birthday and had the most amazing noodle dishes- get the curry noddles and the wasabi noodles. You seriously won't be disappointed. The mushroom truffle rice was pretty amazing too. The only thing they could try to improve is the friendliness of their wait staff. Not sure if they were just too busy, but they didn't make much of an effort to come back and ask us whether everything was good etc. 
Overall though, a must try when you're in SF's North Beach area.
author: Kinjal N.

description:
Unbelievable experience as always.
It is one of the few places where it gets better and better!

Service- great
Food - off the chart
Ambiance- casual ok.

I not only love this place I woof this place, I arf, arf!!!!
author: Chowder K.

description:
i love asian fusion, but for the life of me i cannot understand how this place is so highly rated. is it an SF thing? this is the best asian fusion you got? this place is way overrated. miso black cod covered in a california roll = asian fusion. got it. now i know what your standards are. don't get me wrong, i love miso black cod, and it's pretty hard to screw it up, but this was probably the most unmemorable miso black cod i've ever had. even nobu, king of americanized overpriced standard asian fusion, had way better. the appetizer we got was so forgettable i can't even remember what we ordered. i think it was the unagi? we also got some steak special (kobe? can't remember) that was just ok. 

servers were miserable. like, am i in a chapter of "the bell jar" type of miserable. people were packed like sardines into the joint. i'm grateful that we were able to get a last-minute reservation to try this out, but overall, i was underwhelmed.
author: Carrie L.

description: The food was impeccable.  Great tasting food, cozy atmosphere, very inviting.  The waitress was able to answer my certificate question about their Wagyu special - domestic or international. After my question, they started to promote the special as "domestic Wagyu".  My tummy was very satisfied with every dish we ordered - crab cake, scallops with miso ponzu, rib eye, and sea bass. Won't be disappointed!
author: Lisa V.

description:
Food tasted okay, service was fine, but my friends and I all got food poisoning the next day so...
Also, I thought the sashimi sampler and the octopus appetizer were good
author: B L.

description:
I've been here many times with family and friends for dinner and the food is always on point and consistently good! Its a very small and tight restaurant but they really got it down when it comes to Asian fusion food! There are so many of these Asian fusion restaurants in San Francisco and I would have to say this one is the best. They serve fresh oysters on the half shell too. 

My favorite two main dishes: The Grilled Sea Bass with garlic ginger sauce and the Kurobuta Pork Chop with pomegranate currant sauce. Oh my gosh it is so good! The pork chop is cooked to perfection and is so tender! The most tender pork chop I have ever had in my life. I've never had pork chops that are this tender ever! Tastes so good in the pomegranate currant sauce. You have to trust me on this one! The grilled sea bass is tender and juicy and melts in your mouth! 

My favorite dessert is the mango pudding! It is so mango-ey and has some white tapioca in it. So damn good! I always want to order one all to myself but don't want to seem like a pig. Haha!
author: Janny S.

description:
Oh my gosh! Can you say amazing because that's all they have. Not to mention how beautiful the food looks. The mushroom truffle soup was outstanding. The poke with the popped rice was a really delicious take on a traditional appetizer and the wasabi noodles with pork--heaven.

We popped in for lunch on a Saturday successfully without a reservation and it was not crowded. I would recommend a reservation for dinner though because it's such a great spot it is bound to be packed.

I would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Amanda H.

description: This place is fantastic. The food is simply amazing, the portions are really generous and there's a wide range of daily specials (several starters and several mains). The staff are incredibly friendly and very quick - my water got refilled really promptly and the food arrived surprisingly quickly (and it was really well presented). There usually is a line but this place also takes reservations (definitely make one!). The only drawback is that it's slightly pricey but it's totally worth it. The place is quite small but I really liked the ambience.
author: Kasia R.

description:
THIS PLACE HAS SANITATION ISSUES! 

We were served ice water promptly after being seated. We both noticed that the server grabbed the glass again after placing it on the table and rotated it in place about 40 degrees. We thought it was strange until we noticed there was this left over reddish food residue all over the outside of the glass. We pointed this out to our waitress and asked for a new glass. 

We ordered the sashimi appetizer which was two pieces each of four different types of fish. It was fresh and the portions rather large sized for sashimi. My wife had a piece of the ginger and informed me not to eat it as it smelled like urine. I did a sniff check and sure enough, it smelled rancid. We informed the staff and they said they would bring us some replacement ginger which although better, still smelled slightly funny. During this time, we kept catching fishy odors from the kitchen areas. 

As others have eluded to, this food here has a lot of sauce and it's very salty or very sweet. I think I have a high tolerance for strong flavor but even this was a bit much. 

Positive - the sea bass was grilled really well.

This restaurant was quite the let down overall.
author: Mike H.

description:
A neighborhood gem.

Small and romantic. It's great for a small group or date night. 

If you plan to have a few cocktails during dinner expect to pay around $45-$65 per person. Their drinks are unique and has a range of what they offer. 

The staff was wonderful. They were attentive and knowledgeable. 

I highly recommend!
author: Nichole K.

description:
Made a reservation for 7/27 for my boyfriends birthday and we were not disappointed. Walked in, and the 3 of us was sat down with in a couple minutes. So glad we made reservations because it was packed, even on a Sunday night!

We started off with their daily special appetizers. My boyfriend ordered the shrimp and chive dumplings, which he loved and I ordered the asparagus with sesame dressing. I love asparagus and they did it just perfectly. Fried carrots on top, which a light sauce, I couldn't get enough. I almost considered ordering another. 

All 3 of us ordered steaks. My boyfriend and his friend ordered that nights special Kobe steak in a mushroom sauce. They absolutely loved every single bite. Although they couldn't finish the plate, both said it would be a dish they would order again. 

I got the angus rib eye with house teriyaki. And it was just simply amazing on my tongue. I basically finished my plate which is a huge deal for me because I'm a very petite girl. The meat was just cooked perfectly and the teriyaki wasn't what I expected at all. It was subtle, great with the vegetables, and the meat just soaked up all the juices at the bottom. If I could, I would eat that plate weekly. 

For dessert, we snuck a chocolate truffle cake. They even put a candle in it for my boyfriends birthday! That was super nice since most places I've looked at doesn't do birthdays. 

Our waitress was so nice. She helped us out through everything and we had tons of questions which she was on top of. I didn't like my alcohol I ordered and she recommended me a different one which I did enjoy! 

Overall, we LOVED our experience. Already planning another visit within the next two weeks. As for price, I'm a chef myself so the price is actually reasonable. I recommended this place to anyone who wants to experience a great meal worth the money. If you're wallet is tight, save up because it's definitely a place to try.
author: Abbie F.

description: Absolutely delicious! I had the specials for the day - the sashimi with cauliflower. Have never tasted cauliflower this good before and sashimi was so fresh and melted in my mouth. I also had scallops topped with spring mix and aioli. Soooooo yummy. Very well put together and so satisfying to the palette.
author: Michelle K.

description: Best Asian fusion spot in the city!!! Cannot wait to go again! Got in line at 5pm and were seated first! I'd suggest making reservations though if you don't want to wait in line-very crowded popular spot. Crispy scallops are a must!
author: Roya R.

description:
Started with poke appetizer and salmon rolls, both were delicious. I'm not a mustard fan and the salmon roll sauce practically changed my mind.  4.5/5 for the apps


My gf got the ahi tuna entree which was perfectly cooked with very fat pieces of fish.  Nice piece of fish.

I got the ny steak with garlic potatoes and cauliflower.  fantastic, perfectly cooked medium rare.  

2 glasses reisling - 1 mango tapioca


Overall fanatic food. Only reason I'm giving 4/5 stars is that the tables are very close together, almost uncomfortably close. I'm being nit picky. Go to this place youll be satisfied.  $150 for all of the above.
author: Vince R.

description:
Went there for my birthday with my husband. At 9 PM on a weekday the place was fully packed and there were people outside waiting to get seated.  We had taken reservations and were seated right away. Our server explained the specials of the day to us. Having read some of the Yelp reviews, I wanted to try out the dishes that everyone was raving about. We ordered the deep fried salmon roll and seared scallops for appetizer. Loved both the dishes, esp the salmon rolls were so crispy and delicious. For entree I ordered the grilled sea bass with garlic noodles and my husband ordered the warm wasabi noodles flatiron steak. I was really keen to try out the sea bass after the reviews on Yelp and was not disappointed, the fish was very well cooked and moist, and the garlic noodles were to die for. I actually liked the garlic noodles more than the fish itself. Remember to dip the fish in the sauce they give, it accentuates the flavor of the fish manyfold. My husband liked his dish too, both the steak and the noodles tasted very good. The portions of the entree were big, we ended up packing some of the food home. 
Overall a great culinary experience, worth the money spent. Will go back again for the awesome food. Service was great, despite being so busy the servers were attentive. It can get a bit noisy with the place being small and full, but you tend to forget the noise when you get served such delicious food!!
author: Vidisha S.

description:
This review is long over due! My birthday was in April.. so sorry for the lag. 

By far the best birthday dinner I've had!

My bf secretly saw my bookmarks on Yelp and made reservations to The House.  The place is pretty small and a bit tight, but the food was soo good! I am unable to provide prices as I was not allowed to look at the check. 

We ordered the following:
Day Boat Scallops
Mussels
Sashimi plate
Garlic Noodles
Wasabi Noodles
RIbeye
Ahi Tuna entree

We had no leftovers! OK, I couldn't eat as much as my bf.. but I also wanted to try everything... I felt so bad that he had to eat most of the dishes! Still loved every item! I liked the garlic noodles more than the wasabi noodles. 

Service was good and the servers were shocked at how much we ordered and ate. 

Overall, great birthday! Thanks The House!
author: Erica T.

description:
First of all, I apologize for not including photos of the wonderful plated works of art we ate!  I didn't use a flash and the photos did not do the culinary masterpieces we devoured justice.  

Make sure to make a reservation ahead of time.  This place is very small and rarely has options for walk-in diners.  With that being said, we were able to get a same-day reservation for 10:00pm.  (thankfully there are plenty of nearby options in North Beach to grab wine and/or a snack to help our tummies until a late-late dinner)

After being seated, guests are treated to housemade pickles.  OMG- YUM!  We ordered wine off the menu, skipped the appetizers and went straight to ordering 2 entrees to split: 

Mushroom Rice with grilled prawns, shaved bonito.....wow.  This dish is incredible. The shaved bonito "melted" on the rice and prawns in such an interesting way-- the dish comes out piping hot and the freshly shaved bonito dances and moves as if it were alive.  Pretty cool!  This dish was very rich and  perfect for splitting.

Chicken Breast with roasted portabella white truffle oil sauce....perfectly cooked, rich and delectable sauce.  

Both entrees were served in generous portions.  

I will certainly be back-- My next visit will include an appetizer or two, Chinese tea, and a dessert!
author: Andrea H.

description:
Yum yum yum! Every dish that we ordered here was delicious! 

Just like everyone says, the wasabi noodles are perfectly seasoned and not spicy at all. I usually hate wasabi, but these noodles seem to retain all the good flavor of wasabi without the tears :)

I initially thought the green bean tempura was only average until I found the hidden ginger soy dipping sauce in the middle of the stack. Boy does that make the dish!

For dessert we had the strawberry rhubarb pie (home-baked and fresh!) and the mango tapioca. Ohhh, the mango tapioca! It's delightfully light and tangy. A great way to end the meal.

Vegetarian tip: The green bean tempura is vegetarian, and they will also serve both the wasabi noodles and the curry noodles with vegetables and tofu instead of the meat. Hurrah!

Non-vegetarian tip: The sea bass is supposedly so tender it melts in your mouth, and the reaction to the scallops was mostly "ooo, mmm, ahh, mmmmmm"
author: Tiffany W.

description:
As we were boarding the BART we called The House for a 10 PM reservation and were excited by the amazing reviews for this restaurant. My guy and I have been to the City multiple times but this was our first SF trip together. We arrived early, around 9:30 to see if we could be seated earlier. It is a tiny little place and the hostess/manager was on the phone deeper inside the restaurant. She said to come back @9:40 after seating the 9:30 folks so we killed some time at the nearby bookstore.

Pros:
-Restaurant was kind enough to seat us at 9:45
-Full, hustle and bustle restaurant, not an empty seat in the place
-Great specials, we ordered the pork ribs app (one of the specials)
-I ordered: wasabi noodles with the flatiron steak. The marinade on this was KILLER.
-My guy ordered the sea bass. The most popular dish our server noted. How can this fish be so delicious? It was cooked to perfect and also came with less noodles
-The wine, we ordered a merlot that was dynamite

Cons:
-Slow with water/wine
-Tiny SF place, sloshy boozy people next to us and I felt like we were sitting in their laps

There were more pros and cons and this meal was a great start to our weekend in San Francisco. Will recommend and try again.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Make reservations and must try: Black Cod and Garlic Noodles

The Black Cod is not on their regular menu, but it must be a frequent special since so many people have tried it. It was melt-in-your-mouth soft and tender. The sauce that went with it was perfect and didn't take away the flavor of the fish. They give you a generous piece of fish, and also two pieces of crab sushi on top. The sushi was alright, nothing too spectacular, but the cod was probably one of the best fish entrees I've ever had. The garlic noodles are separate, and they come as a side in the seabass entree. However, the seabass wasn't as good as the black cod so I wouldn't recommend it unless that's the only way you can try the garlic noodles. The garlic noodles are your basic Chinese chow mien, but better. Not oily and not too salty. They are perfectly flavored with garlic and soy sauce, but for some reason I couldn't get enough of it.

We also tried the soft shell crab appetizer, which was alright. The noodles that went with it were way too salty, but the crab was very tender and juicy. It also came with a sauce that was completely unnecessary because the crab was already seasoned. I think in general, most of the dishes at The House are pretty heavily seasoned and on the saltier side, but I do believe Americans are used to the heavy flavors, so it makes sense.

For dessert, we got the apple pie a la mode. It came with a small scoop of vanilla that was half melted because the apple pie was really warm. The apple pie was completely unstructured because of the nice crumble top. I really think this was the best slice of apple pie I've ever had. I'm always afraid apple pie is too tart or too sweet. However, this apple pie had the perfect combination of both flavors. My favorite part was the crumble top. I don't normally like to get the same things over again, but I'm pretty sure my next visit I'd get the apple pie again. Overall, I can see why this place is so popular because the food is very fresh and made very well but just slightly overly seasoned.

Service was excellent. It definitely helps that the restaurant is tiny, but I really felt like our waitress was always within reach. Water was always refilled, and food came really quick as well. There are lots of good restaurants in the area, but the black cod is a must try here!
author: Debbie O.

description:
Food are good, service is bad ..
The server come to our table and start telling what today specials. Well she speak so damn fast, and the restaurant is very noisy, so I asked again.. And she start look like giving me a attitude. This is very unprofessional ...
 Ordered bottle of champagne . The glasses is dirty ! Still got the lipstick stain on it ... Then food came ..  3 or 4 of the plate is all crack and got some stains on it ... 
That was really turnoff when you eating with the crack or dirty plate... 
Food is not bad just the service and the hardware need to be upgraded
author: Kevin K.

description:
There were dishes I loved (sea bass entree and an off-menu hamachi appetizer) and other dishes that didn't sing to me the way they sing to other people. The crab cake was fine, but not out of this world. It had a very nice presentation, but it had average flavor. The blue lake bean tempura is just green bean tempura that, in my opinion, is not worth ordering. The hamachi appetizer, however, was delightful - a very fresh and vibrant dish that I wish they had on their permanent menu. 

For entrees, we ordered the wasabi house noodles, the kurobuta pork chop, and the sea bass. The sea bass was perfectly cooked with a wonderful flavor. I didn't enjoy the other two entrees as much though. The wasabi house noodles were uninspiring (although the steak was well cooked) and I personally didn't like the pork chop with the pomegranate sauce. I didn't think the combination of flavors worked together; it was too sweet for me. I probably wouldn't order either of those two dishes again. 

But in general, I like this place. It's small and crowded, but they service a lot of people with generally flavorful and unique dishes. It was definitely upscale, but not pretentious and the meal didn't break the bank. It was a little under $130 for a family of four including tax and tip (no drinks).
author: Kimberly S.

description: Excellent food! Great execution, original and exciting flavors and textures.  Really solid!
author: Socheata P.

description: This place is probably one of the best places I have ever ate at...!!! But please make sure you make reservation because they make people who have reservation a priority. Came here for the first time w/ a friend for my birthday, we did a walk-In so we waited for 30-1 hour. We ordered the oysters , pork chops & the steak. (I forgot what it was called) but the oysters were super fresh with that sauce it comes with. Every bite of the steak & pork chops were delicious ! It melts in my mouth every time! The service is great, the waiter would always refill my water before it reaches halfway( some restaurants like slanted door doesn't refill your water until you ask)! I suggest this place if you do go with 1 or 2 people because it's pretty small and make sure you do make reservation!
author: Johnny L.

description:
Solid 4stars for food******
Solid 4stars for food pairing*******
extra 1/2star for service which they are very professional.
total:4.5stars 
Very impressed with 3642 reviews from a small restaurant seating about 40ish. Service was very professional attentive & friendly. 

We ordered 
Sake spring roll A 
Unexpected delicious! 
Dipper taste like wasabi with some sweet Kimchee thing. 

Unagi don C
Due to the eel was very bad quality, it was all hard thick skin, but the rice was the sauce paired well. 

BBQ ribs B- 
Super so so 

Some special tender Kobe styled of beef w/American sauce  A
Pretty goods, tender and tasty but American taste. 

Over all the price for the taste and quality was on the good side.
author: Le Chef

description:
Wow, was that one of the most disappointing meals I have experienced in a really long time.  

I not only write reviews, but I try to rely on the other  reviews for recommendations.  How in the world did this restaurant get such high reviews.  Is the Asian fusion food so bad in San Francisco that this is the best.  I cannot believe it.  Sometimes I think that a place's vibe and past reviews inflate the reality of a place's food and future reviews.  And, when going to eat dinner, the food and service come first, then the vibe; not the other way around.

When I walked in, I was quickly seated (I had a reservation).  The waitress immediately told me the evening's specials.  She did not ask if I wanted a drink (which is something I like, so she got an extra point for not asking me about a drink before I have a chance to look at the menu); I did not even have a glass of water on the table yet; nor had I picked up the menu.  I literally sat down, took my coat off and she began telling me the specials. 

I ordered the scallop appetizer.  It was one of the specials.  The dish came within a few minutes, less than 10.  I should have thought something was funny.  There were 3 scallops on the plate.  The sauce was tasty.  2 of the 3 scallops tasted good, although I thought they tasted a little bland (they really, really needed the sauce on the plate).  The third scallop was completely under cooked.

I ordered the sea bass.  If anyone thinks this is the best sea bass they ever had, etc., I really feel sorry for you.  This sea bass was, frankly, small and plain.  There was absolutely nothing special about this sea bass.  It was not tastier, softer, oiler, etc. then the sea bass I can get at my local supermarket.  1/4 of the top of the sea bass was burnt (no joke).  Yes, I could eat the sea bass with just the fork, no knife required.  But, that is the way it is supposed to be.  Thank goodness for the soy sauce with some garlic to dip the plain tasting sea bass into. The string beans and noodles were flooded, and I mean flooded, in soy sauce.  Other than being flooded with the sauce, I could not taste any other flavor on the noodles or beans.  I will say that both the noodles and beans were cooked perfectly.

I had the special dessert of the night, chocolate bread pudding.  This was enjoyable.  I could have eaten another dish of this bread pudding.

The prices were reasonable for a restaurant trying to be upscale, casual.  The service was outstanding.  I wish they had some of the wines that came by the bottle sold by the glass.



Now, for the vibe.  No doubt, the vibe of this place is humming.  However, I did feel like all the tables near my table were tourists.
author: Robert S.

description:
After having a bad seating experience at Cotogna, we left and walked over to The House and asked if it was ok that 1) we had no reservation, and 2) we have a child. They gave us a table right away and we put the stroller in the corner. 

The server was friendly. I wish I could remember her name!  Pretty Asian woman. 

Appetizers: 
1) octopus salad: omg yum!!! Cilantro, red onion, julienned red bell peppers, perfectly cooked octopus, and chicharron!!  I saw "crispy pork skins" in the description and never had it with octopus before. So good!
2) yuzu himachi (?) It was a special and I forgot what it's called. It came dressed with this yummy avocado salsa. Our 2-year-old ate more of it than we did. We learned she likes raw fish. 

Entrees:
1) mushroom rice with prawns: shrimp was great, but I wish in the description it said there was truffle oil. I don't like truffle oil at all. I realize that most people would've found this to be a pleasant surprise. I didn't. I ate the shrimp and not the rice. 
2) miso cod (special):  we got it for Jovi. The server even noticed that we called her Jovi and referred to her by name all night. Great service!  The sauce had too much wasabi in it for her, but we loved it!  It had some sort of rice roll (seaweed, rice, avocado) on top and Jovi loved it and called it "cake."
3) hubby ordered the meat special, some sort of Kobe. It was great, maybe a little too much chewy fat.

We got some great wine!  Really liked this place and they were super friendly.
author: Tiffany J.

description:
Reservations on Valentine's Day anywhere, let alone here, is an absolute must!

Space wise, it's very small but it's cute and cozy. The whole night, I think there was only two waitresses, one busser and one hostess but everything worked out due to the small space. Service was great, waitress was nice and everything was quick. Our reservation was at 9pm and we probably got seated about 10 minutes later? Not too bad. Appetizers came out about 5 minutes after ordering and entrees shortly after so definitely no complaints on service last night given the amount of people there and the amount of people working.

Food.. Omg. Seared ahi tuna with wasabi noodles. Need I say more?! The noodles were soft and blasting with flavor. I'm sensitive to spices so I kept grabbing water as I continuously devoured it but so worth it! Ahi tuna was seared to perfection. It came with a wasabi soy sauce dipping sauce on the side for extra flavoring. Honestly, with everything that's going on in your dish, I didn't really need it. But if you're just eating the tuna alone, dipping it makes everything better.

My date had the Kobe rib eye dish laying in a bed of mashed potatoes and veggies served with a blanket of sauce on top. The meat was melt in your mouth heaven and normally, the boy doesn't eat his veggies but his plate was cleaned out! Everything underneath was beautifully coated with the sauce and juice from the meat.

We were too full for dessert so I can't really comment on that but I'll definitely be back for the duck dish!

If I could give this place 10 stars, I would.
author: Christine N.

description: The waiter messed up our to-go order and made us feel as if it was our fault. We clearly repeated our order :( The restaurant is really small though. Pls consider expanding it to a larger space.The food is undeniably great. I love wasabi noodle and medium rare steak.
author: Vy T.

description: Best dining experience we had during our week long vacation to northern California!  Food was amazing and the service was great.  I had the Kobe skirt steak special that came with mashed potatoes at was super tasty!  The meat was cooked to a prefect medium rare with an Asian inspired sauce drizzled on top.  The mash was a mix of potatoes and carrots that married nicely together.  This was our final dinner in SF while on vacation and the expectations were high but this place brought down The House!
author: Kevin T.

description:
Seven years later, The House is still, by a long long shot, my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. My friends and I visit SF every year on MLK Weekend, and this is always the culinary highlight of the trip. We start thinking about what we plan to order days before, principally whether we're going to "fall back on" the best sea bass ever or risk it all on some other dish or special. 

This year I have to pay special note to their special specials, the clams in curry appetizer, mahi mahi with crab roll entree, and blueberry bread pudding dessert. And....release. That was an orgasm. The House is as good as it gets. 

I thank the Tses for continuing to share their art with us year after year (we've actually gushed to Angela directly in the past, to the point where we're both embarrassed for each other, so I thank them for allowing that too).
author: John M.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in SF! Definitely a repeat restaurant. It's a great place to go on a date or go with friends. 

Loooove the black cod and the sea bass. The wasabi noodles are absolutely delicious. 
I love Asian food and this definitely gives my favorite dishes a surprising twist. 

Only negatives: we got the oysters as our appetizer and they weren't great. Also the most recent time we went I think the A/C system was down so it was incredibly hot. Didn't love the Riesling I ordered either. 

Otherwise, definitely worth a try!
author: Sally C.

description:
I've been to The House a handful of times now, and I always come out of the restaurant with a happy tummy. The food is really good, pretty innovative too considering how everything on the menu is an Asian take on a traditional American dish. Or maybe it's the other way around? It's definitely one of the better Asian Fusion places I've been to.

Perhaps I've been spoiled with too many visits to The House, the food just doesn't stand out to me as the best. They also tend to be a little heavy on the flavoring, which I don't like s much.

It's a cozy little place with good food and good atmosphere! Definitely make a reservation if you plan on going.
author: Vivian W.

description: This restaurant and food will make you happy. Unique flavors combined with simple decor and good service.
author: Elena P.

description:
OH man. Although I am not usually a huge fan of Asian fusion, this place knocked it out of the park. Their food speaks for itself. 

Some tips to start out: 
1. Definitely, definitely, definitely make a reservation. This place is tiny. And since this place has a well known reputation its pretty busy pretty much all the time. 
2. Corkage fee is $26 I believe. We brought our own bottle of wine. 

Now. For in regards to other detail:

After doing my research on Yelp, I made some educated recommendations to the rest of my group and this is what we ended up getting: 
Appetizers:
1.  deep fried salmon roll with mustard sauce: it was pretty good. I wouldn't say amazing, but it was tasty. the mustard sauce has a pretty good horseradish kick so if you're not into that I wouldn't douse the appetizer with it. 
2. Grilled octopus, tempura potatoes, sriracha aioli: this stuff was bomb! Highly highly recommend this dish. We were originally going to go with the caesar salad with scallops but when we asked the server he recommended the octopus dish and we are so glad we asked. The grilled octopus was cooked perfectly. So tender and smokey from the grill and the accompanying sriracha aioli was creamy and a little spicy but not overpowering. The dish also came with fried potato and avocado. Overall it was the perfect comfort appetizer without being super filling. 

Entrees: 
1. Grilled Sea Bass, garlic ginger soy with a side of their wasabi noodles: This dish came with serving of the grilled sea bass and a side of noodles and green beans. I had a taste of the sea bass and it was so tender and flaky. Absolute perfection! Their execution was on point! Highly recommend! 
2. (2 orders of) the Warm Wasabi noodles with angus flatiron steak: This dish was highly recommended on Yelp so two people in my group wanted to order it. Both people were happy with their dish. The noodles were really tasty but I was expecting more wasabi taste to them since they are advertised as wasabi noodles. I didn't try the steak since I'm a pescatarian but both said their steak was cooked perfectly. The only complaint I got, was my fiancee said his dish wan't super hot when he received it, but other than that it was a solid dish. 
3. Mushroom rice, grilled prawns, shaved bonito: This was the dish I ordered. It was delicious. The mushroom rice was more like risotto with mushroom and carrots and peas. It was creamy, cheesy and absolutely delicious. It came with 4 large shrimp that were grilled and cooked perfectly. My sister who ordered the steak with the noodles said she actually preferred my dish to hers! Since the rice is really filling I was able to take home some leftovers! 

The House's strength and winning factor is definitely their ability to execute their proteins out to perfection. Everything we had was fresh, tender and just cooked beautifully. 

I'll be back for sure!
author: Sam L.

description:
Place is tiny & cramp, no wonder you need to make reservations! Atmosphere is whatever. We were seated next to the door and I wish we weren't because I kept getting whiffs of l'eau de street outside. Luckily, the good aroma of the food soon masked the smell! 

Here's what we got: deep-fried salmon roll, warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak, and the grilled sea bass with ginger garlic soy. The salmon rolls were huge and comes with this wasabi/hot mustard sauce. I give this a 7 out of 10. The wasabi noodles were good but too salty. I didn't care for the steak, it was too tough to eat. This gets a 7 out of 10 too. 

Now, the grilled sea bass deserves its own paragraph! The fish just melts in your mouth. I also really like the ginger garlic soy sauce. The entree comes with garlic noodles and green beans. The wasabi noodles was better but I really liked the green beans. This dish gets a 9 out of 10 from me!
author: Sara L.

description:
This place is a nice little oasis away from the roudiness outside. The decor inside is very plesant and sophisticated. It does get a bit loud inside if I'm completely honest since you're so close to the people around you. Had to move my table several times to let the other folks out. None of that really bothers me too much though.. as long as the food is amazing! And that it was!

I had an appointment at 7:30pm on a Sunday night and we were about 15 minutes late. Whoops! They were able to seat us after a several minute wait. I handed them my wine and the server asked if she should chill it or not. Of course I said not since it was a nice bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon. They popped it open and allowed my girlfriend to taste it. The cups however were not wine glasses I would have liked as it was a low bulb wine glass. This as well did not bother me too much. Just an observation and my own personal preference. 

My girlfriend and I ordered the deep fried soft shell crab with tomatoe sauce on noodles. That was pleasant and looked more like a sculpture from Michaelangelo than food! Looked good and tasted good. Very pleased.

We also ordered the clams. It tasted soooo good! Had what tasted a bit like curry with coconut milk and jalepenos and spicy peppers. The clams and borth was delicious! It came with some bread so it was nice to be able to dip the bread and enjoy the borth :)

I had ordered the U.S Kobe styled short ribs that was their special. That was AMAZINGGGG! The sauce was sweet and savory and the beef was cooked to perfection! (I ordered rare/medium rare and it was still nice and bloody. :D ) This paired very well with my bottle of Roebert Craig Affinity cab!

My girlfriend had ordered the Sea bass with wasabi noodles. That was out of this world as well! The exterior of the fish was nice and dry.. looked like it was over cooked but the minute I sank my teeth into that I knew I was dead wrong! The inside was so juicy and flavorful! The wasabi noodles was quite delicious as well! However the wasabi part wasn't so major as I only tasted a hint of wasabi at the very end. Either way, it still tasted amazing!

All in all, it was an amazing experience and the food was phenomenal! I will definitely make my way here again!
author: Calvin Y.

description:
Easily one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. I arrive on a Friday night at like 9:45. I did not expect the restaurant to be so small but that didn't really matter because we were seated within 15 minutes and we got a table near the wall so it was very comfortable. 

We ordered the deep fried soft shell crab, mussels in a broth, halibut in white truffle oil sauce with corn and mashed potatoes, and the popular wasabi noodles with steak. The dinner portions are generous. You're getting a good amount of food for the price that you pay. It's not even that expensive here compared to the other SF restaurants. Great quality and quantity.

Soft shell crab: a soft shell crab deep fried with a light batter, served with a small amount of these slightly sweet thin noodles and a dipping sauce. The sauce was really good. It complimented the crab very well and did not take away the seafood flavor. It's not on the menu but it seems to be part of their "Daily Specials" quite frequently.

Mussels in a broth: the mussels inside the broth were plump and cooked perfectly. The broth had a rather strong shrimp flavor to it and it was tasty; however, I thought it was very salty. You can't eat too much of it.

Halibut: this was part of the "Daily Special" and it was the show stopper. It was amazing. The sauce that sat under the fish was one of the best things I have ever tasted. It had a truffle flavor with sweet corn added to it. The mashed potatoes is not your average and the fish was flakey and moist. The fish is freaking huge too. It was about the size of a hand. I would most definitely be back for this dish.

Wasabi Noodles w/ Steak: we ordered this because it seems to be the most popular. The steak was cooked perfectly but it lacked a little flavor. I'm assuming its because the flavor is suppose to be more in the noodles. The noodles were like thick udon noodles with a slight wasabi taste which I enjoyed. It was more sweet than spicy. Actually wasn't spicy at all. This dish did not particularly stand out to me and I probably wouldn't get it again. I can see why it is popular though, the flavor is different from other noodle dishes I've tried. It is also one of the cheaper ones! Lol.

Sorry I don't have any pictures. The restaurant is kind of dark and my phone's camera was acting up!
author: Olivia T.

description: Love this restaurant and the service was very fast. Order the soft shell crab, pork chop and sea bass along with garlic noodle. Everything was delicious!
author: Andy P.

description:
Did I go to the wrong restaurant? I was so surprised at all the hype on this place. 

I had the wasabi noodles with steak (ordered medium-rare) and what arrived was red chili covered chow-mein noodles with well done sliced steak (not a hint of wasabi). My friend ordered the shortribs, only to be told they were actually sold out of shortribs (which is strange, as we were there literally right when they opened) and opted for a skirt steak and mashed potatoes instead -- her steak was also chewy and overcooked. 

Lychee iced tea was nice, but for 71$ we certainly wouldn't go back. Bar across the street is sketchy and we got to enjoy watching a crackhead urinate all over the sidewalk right infront of the front door, and have multiple homeless people scream into the restaurant. SFPD showed up to break things up, but seemed very familiar with that alleyway.
author: Laura J.

description:
The House is, hands down, my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Any time friends or family come to visit, this is the first place that I bring them. The food is gorgeous, perfectly balanced and flavor-forward. They have a nice selection of sakes, wines and beers that meld well with the food. The service is spot on. Each time I visit, I am more and more impressed. Especially when I consider the very reasonable pricing - the value is so much higher at The House than in most SF restaurants.

Everything on the menu is delicious, but the seafood dishes are truly remarkable. The deep fried salmon roll is a lovely appetizer to share. The unagi is next level, the best I've had. The warm wasabi noodles with flatiron steak, kurobuta pork chop, and the grilled sea bass are my favorite entrees. Be sure to ask about their specials because I can guarantee they are fantastic and fresh.

The restaurant is small and intimate. For dinner, a reservation is highly recommended as they do not have a bar where you can wait. I like to go for lunch; the dishes are largely the same and you typically don't need a reservation. The House is a must-try!
author: Shania T.

description:
Ever since we had lunch here coincidentally, we cannot stop thinking/talking about it.

We started off with a Seared scallop appetizer with perfectly cooked scallops & micro greens. We than got the Soft shelled crab which was crispy on the outside & creamy on the inside. I didn't get a chance to taste the noodles before the plate got taken away but they looked really good. We moved on to a Kale salad which was warm & had bleu cheese. Neither is what I am used to but somehow the result was amazing. Our last appetizer was the Deep friend salmon roll courtesy of the owners. These were crispy on the outside but still semi-raw on the inside. It's genius.

For main course I had the Halibut with truffle cream sauce. The fish was nicely cooked, the mashed potato was addicting, & the sauce was creamy without being heavy.

And if all that food wasn't enough, we started off our multiple dessert course with a Creme brûlée. The coconut flavor was not very strong but that's alright. My favorite was the passion fruit puree which provided a nice tart contrast to the creamy, rich custard. We moved on next to the Chocolate truffle cake which I only have 3 letters for: O. M. G.

We didn't finish dinner until about 11:00pm that night & I was so full I couldn't sit or sleep for hours after; but it was one of the most satisfying nights ever.
author: Karen S.

description:
Fusion well executed. Dishes were very tasty and amazeballs! 4 stars only because the hostess was not friendly and wrote our reservation name wrong. Other than that must try at 3,158 reviews and 4 1/2 stars you gotta check out this place. Reservation is a must since its a small place. 

We ordered the special spicy Manila clams in miso sauce (so good we ate it before snapping a pic), wasabi noodles and flat iron steak, pork chop (for the bf) and choc truffle cake with coffee ice cream and coconut caramel sauce. All GOOD!

Food definitely thumbs up BUT service is thumbs down!
author: Princess M.

description:
The house, where do I start?? 

The parking in sf is horrific, but there are so many parking spaces around the building, you will find a parking spot. 

We arrived, and was shocked this place was so small for being a very popular place with 3000 reviews. This nice little cozy restaurant was perfect for my lunch date with my bf. We arrived at 12 and managed to get seated right when we walked in. We ordered the wasabi noodles and curry noodles recommended by other family members. I'm so happy I listened to their recommendations because I walked out super satisfied. The salmon on my wasabi noodles were grilled to perfection. And the noodles were super soft and flavorful. 

Our server was really friendly. We told her we were on a time crunch and she made everything happen in less than 30 minutes! I will definitely be back!
author: Nga P.

description: My sister and I have loved this restaurant in the past.  Their curry noodles and deep fried string beans are excellent.  When we were there a couple of months ago for my sister's birthday, we made an error and ordered noodles in broth.  We realized it was not what we had intended to order, but we thought that it would be as good as the other items we've had in the past.  We tried a couple of bites.  It was tasteless, watery and entirely unacceptable.  The waitress came by and we told her that although it was our ordering error, the dish was not good.  She took the food away, said nothing and brought us our check.  There was no effort made on her part to remedy the situation.  We were very disappointed and I paid $30 for a poor meal.  We won't be going back.
author: Claire S.

description:
I went here a few months ago and it was decent, I guess. The food was delicious, but the service I would have to say was very subpar. I went with a friend for dinner and we didn't get much because we were stuffed from our food adventures from earlier, but it was really good! 

Place: The place is pretty tiny and could probably fit at most maybe 40ish people? So yes, reservations are a must. If you walk in, you will have to wait like two hours. IF you get a spot. 

Parking: Don't expect to park here.. I think if I were you and I was having a day trip here to park near Chinatown and have a little walk around there before you have dinner because it's pretty close to it. 

Service: Our waiter seemed a little scatterbrained and could not for the life of him remember the specials of the day and had to keep sneaking glances at the little piece of paper he "discreetly" hid in a checkbook. Subtle. And he wasn't very attentive with refilling our teapots at all. Which, of course, wasn't free at all.. I think I had to pay like $4 for it. 

Seared tuna: Very nice and soft. I was very impressed with this dish because they seared it in a way that it felt like it was melting in my mouth. 
Octopus salad: Eh, I wasn't as impressed with this. It was still good and had nice flavor and wasn't overly strong on the vinegar, but the deep fried tofu skins were not the business. It kind of ruined the salad for me, to be honest. 

I would probably go again because their fusion food is pretty good, but maybe not one of those places I would go out of my way for.
author: Jackie S.

description:
My favorite restaurant in SF!! If I had to choose one place to eat my last meal on earth it would definitely be here. Make sure you make reservations for dinner because the place gets super packed. I usually come for lunch since reservations are not required and the price is a bit cheaper. This place is located near North Beach, in a small alley. The place is intimate and the tables are squeezed tightly. 

All the dishes I usually order are delicious. I usually get the wasabi noodles with steak. The noodles are perfectly flavored and you can taste the wasabi. The sea bass is another favorite. The texture of the sea bass is perfect. Crispy on the outside and melts in your mouth on the inside. I occasionally order the special. The most recent dish was the Kobe beef with black truffle. The meat was a perfect medium rare with a real earthy taste.  Another excellent dish was the halibut, seared crispy on a bed of shrimp swimming in red curry.  It was quite possibly the best halibut I have ever had in my life.

You can't go wrong with anything you order. I'm usually satisfied with what I order. The only thing that I wish was still on their menu was the Unagi sandwich. Overall, customer service has always been great and the staff is super friendly. The price is very reasonable except the specials which can range up to $40.
author: Vivian N.

description:
Chef Larry has been serving up fusion goodness since before I can remember.  In fact, I would say I have been eating at his establishments for close to 20 years.  They even catered both baby parties for my kids who are now 15 and 12 with their famed wasabi noodles.

I recently took some out of town colleagues and went with my go-to wasabi steak noodles for my entree.  So GOOD!  Why had I waited so long to return?  We started with scallops and dumplings.  My colleague had the sea bass which he said was the best fish he ever tasted,  He had never had it before and said it was his new favorite fish.  

While I knew I was going to enjoy my meal this review is really based upon my colleague who has international tastes, prefers their Asian food really spicy and in large quantities.  He ate everything and kept looking at the menu for more things that he wanted to try, but we didn't have a lot of time.  The best part is that he said that we need to go back again so he can try the halibut which he kept looking at on our neighbor's plate.

Probably he reason I don't go here as often anymore is that with a family of four, reservations are needed in advance and the place is very small and there are usually waits.  Parking is also bad, so don't be late or they might have to give up your table.  I really do miss their Inner Sunset location.
author: Erik H.

description:
I got the Kurobuta Pork Chop with pomegranate currant sauce, and Warm Wasabi House Noodles with angus flatiron steak.
The Kurobuta Pork Chop was VERY tender. Sweet yet very flavorful because of the pomegranate sauce.
Warm wasabi house noodles- this was okay.. the flatiron steak was good but the noodles tasted very Asian. I'd recommend you try and different plate.
The place itself was very small but at the same time, very modern. 
It was a nice place to dine in.
Make sure to reserve so you don't have to wait too long.
Went at 5:30 on a Sunday night and it wasn't bad at all.
author: Catharine L.

description: This a popular place especially if you're in north beach. Tiny place, if they're pulling off a Japanese style dining then they're doing a good job. Make a reservation. We ordered the popular dishes and the cane out really good. The unagi taste great and I really like the strong grilled taste to it which reminds me of the ones I had in Japan. The sea bass was perfectly cook and the noodle came with it is amazing. My fiancé had the pork chop that he enjoyed as well. Overall, it was all good. But I guess, I've been dining to some great restaurants lately and tasted some amazing food but now, I'm looking for some WOW factor to this one and it didn't really delivered.
author: Ruth R.

description: oh my god where do I even start? Why the heck does this place have a near perfect rating - it doesn't deserve it at all. I will start with the space itself: the space is tight, so tight that it's hard to turn around without knocking your neighbor over. Because of that, it's a challenge for their server to deliver any dishes to the table. It's understandable, but their server did it in the rudest way possible. The server came to our table with our dishes, didn't say a word to anyone at the table, and pushed my head away using his elbow, before bringing the plate directly over my head. I had to experience that 4 times for the 4 dishes we ordered. It was NOT a pleasant experience at all. The waitress who was in charge of the ordering process was acting like we owe her money the whole time she was taking our order, there is no single bit of professionalism in that encounter. Food is average, it's the type of fusion that doesn't really go well together - I would rather sit down in a spacious fast food restaurant and serve myself than coming here to experience the horrible service.
author: Luki S.

description:
Well, well... wouldn't you know it? Another incredible meal, featuring seafood, in San Fran. Who'dah thunk it?
