I highly recommend for a date night, just make reservations because you don't want to wait on the streets staring at the guests slobbering all over their wasabi noodles from the other side of the window.
author: Winnie L.

description: The food amazing, it is a must if you visit north beach, even when the place looks crowds, it worth, highly recommend
author: Rafael V.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in SF. That's it.

Unique cuisine, simple but classy setting, and a cool history. It's also in a great location. Do not leave without eating the salmon rolls.
author: Anil C.

description: I took the recommendation of the server and had house made noodles in wasabi with pork. Unbelievably good! Small place but worth stopping in. Lots of specials, even at lunch!
author: Celeste B.

description:
Best Asian Fusion place I've been to! The quality and presentation of each dish was excellent.

Appetizers:
Crab Cake - Well balanced with the wasabi sauce however, we did find a few small pieces of shell mixed in.
Scallops Special - Very soft and fresh; cooked to perfection. The garnish and sauce were just right. I highly recommend this!

Entrees:
Hawaiian Swordfish with Coconut Curry - unique mix of ingredients, good sized piece of fish.
Miso Cod - soft fish with a very tasty miso/soy sauce. The sushi style rice and seaweed added a nice touch to this dish.

This place gets packed fast so it's best to make reservations. Inside gets pretty loud and the tables are close together, but that didn't take away from us enjoying the food!
author: Josh L.

description:
I hosted my mom's 70th birthday party here upon a recommendation by a fellow Yelp Elite and wasn't disappointed with the food or service! Knowing that this place is pretty tight and pretty popular, I made sure to book a reservation at least a week in advance. I initially planned for a party of 10 and they had no problems with that. My guest list shrunk down to 7 three days before my reservation and they had no problem with that. The day of the reservation, my cousin happened to make a surprise visit with his wife and kid but the restaurant was already packed so they squeezed in 3 extra chairs for a table that usually seats 6. They kind of gave me a frustrated look and I felt bad, but we were really tight sitting all together.

Anyway, they were very accommodating and were very patient with me and my Asian family...with our Asian confusion when going to an unfamiliar restaurant and taking WAY too much time deciding what to eat. I ordered their famous Wasabi noodles and steak and really enjoyed the fusion flair. Their calamari was light and fluffy with a perfectly paired marinara. Steamed mussels were also so good that my uncle literally sipped all the juice from the dish!

I brought a cake from Schubert's and they charged a $3 per person cutting fee. 

All in all, I had a great experience. I'm definitely going to go with a smaller group next time so I don't have to sit shoulder to shoulder with my relatives and actually have some space to eat. All the food was perfectly prepared with great flavor. The ambiance is nice and I hope to bring a date here next time!
author: Sam L.

description:
3.5

Lucky Rock Star Parking + Rude Dismissive Hostess + Robot Server + 

Complimentary Pickled Cucumbers + (Fave Deep Fried Salmon Roll + Sinus Clearing Wasabi Mustard + $9) + 

(Very Rare Sea Bass + Salty Ginger Soy Sauce + Green Beans + Rice + $26) +

(Pork Chop + Dull Knife + Fabulous Red Cranberry Sauce + Awesome Orange Sauce + 2 Asparagus Spears + Pile of Mashed Potatoes + 2 Long Curvy Crunchy Taro Chips + $24) =

THE HOUSE 6 YEARS LATER
author: Amy C.

description:
I like the Unagi here.  Very thick and juicy. 
Sea bass was very good too. The sauce is definitely original. Japanese * Chinese infusion. 
The lighting is good, music not so great but at least not noisy. Good for friends and dates. 
Drink list is full of wine but if you like wine, it's a good thing I suppose?
author: Yumi K.

description:
The line slowly grew outside with faces pressed to get in.  The crowd rushed for what was to be an incredible meal.  We started the night with 2 of the specials, bbq oysters and scallops with panzu.  The scallops were buttery and they were adorned with a lovely watercress.  The oysters were dressed to much as the oyster flavor got lost in a spicy sauce and cilantro.  The 3rd small plate was the grilled octopus.  I would order it again and again.  Perfectly cooked with a playful sriracha aoili.
Our main courses were; wasabi noodles and flat iron steak, kobe beef with caramlized cauliflower, and lastly the sea bass with green beans and noodles.  The plating was less than imaginative but still welcoming.  The true test was in the first bite.  The sea bass, buttery, the cauliflower had a great bite, but a little too much butter, the wasabi noodles with steak had the right heat balance.  The staff was busy and friendly.  I would go back over and over.
author: Nicholas L.

description:
With all these amazing reviews I do have to say I expected a bit more from the food. With that we were a party of 11 that took up a majority of the dining area. This modern Asian Fusion joint located in North Beach (maybe my fave 'hood) served it up though and for the most part I was extremely impressed (minus the wine).

Lets start off with the wine list, we ordered a few bottles and all just weren't that amazing. They were probably the cheaper ones but, still, have a few gems on the less expensive side. On to the food. The deep fried salmon roll with spicy mustard was super unique and very delicious however, one sliver was enough for me. I was a little underwhelmed by the homemade dumplings. They lacked any and all flavor. I'm a dumpling aficionado, trust me. 

As entrees go, the sea bass I ordered with the garlic noodles was superb. Buttery, cripsy, perfect. The garlic noodles were ever so delicious. I'm glad it was a side rather than a main but, a perfect accompaniment. My friend Peter D's steak was a little on the meh side but with more house made teriyaki that meat was kicked up a notch. We both agreed, clearly The House specializes in fish. 

Overall everything was super fresh and really good. Not everything I tasted was blow me outta the water amazing but, I definitely was glad I got an opportunity to feast here.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: By far one of the best places to go for an Asian-fusion meal. Try to book a reservation because this place is not only small but gets packed easily! I have been here a couple of times and I have to say each time it still astounds me how great their service and food is. I have gotten the sea bass and the pork chop on separate occasions and both are great but I do prefer the sea bass. The prices for the food you get is super reasonable but once you add on appetizers expect your bill to be about $50 a person if you're not a drinker as well. I would suggest getting the scallops if they have it for the special because they are seasoned and cooked to perfection! For dessert I have tried their apple pie a la mode as well as the strawberry rhubarb which both were delicious and just enough sweetness to end the night.
author: Angela S.

description:
To start, Asian Fusion is quite possibly my least favorite type of cuisine. I normally feel like they take normal Asian food, make it pretty and then charge 2x - 3x as much for it. But The House really took it away with the flavors, the execution and presentation.

Everything we had was delicious.
Black Mussels with shrimp garlic broth. Not too heavy, I somewhat expected that because of how creamy and buttery the sauce tasted but the mussels were steamed perfectly and I thoroughly enjoyed the flavor. ($12)

The Sea Bass was flakey, perfectly tender and fresh. Coupled with a strong sauce that required only a little bit in order to taste all of the complexity. ($27)

The King Salmon was drenched in a delightful soy/miso sauce that was light and hearty. The fish, itself, was ridiculously perfect. Tender, fluffy and light. ($23)

Mushroom Rice. Tastes good but depended on the Bonito flakes to give the entire dish flavor. ($20)

Wasabi Noodles with Angus Flatiron Steak. The noodles were not what I was expecting, it tasted of boiled down wasabi paste tossed in with the noodles. For this sort of price, I expected fresh wasabi to be tossed, giving it the oomph it would need to cut through the oily noodles. However, the noodles were much too oily and not something I felt like making a meal of. The steak was chargrilled to perfection with the perfect type of warm red inside. Because of this, I would only suggest ordering a steak sans the noodles ($19)

So why am I giving The House 3-stars?

Made reservations for 9PM. Waited in the doorway for 20 minutes while other people were seated. Why am I waiting for 20+ minutes if I have a reservation? That obviously meant nothing. Also, it's a super small place, standing anywhere means that you are a fire hazard. Seriously.

Place is so small that you should expect to be able to hear everyone else's conversation. You will not be able to get to the only available restroom without pretty much announcing to the 3 parties around you because they will need to move in order for you to get out.

Though it's so small, we asked for a refill on water at least 3 times.
The waitstaff was a little impatient in our large party (5 people) ordering and annoyed that we opted out of the alcohol (it's not particularly the sort of atmosphere my group wanted to drink in. Not that we had space for the glasses or anything once the food was out.)

For the type of price you are commanding, I do expect a better ambiance. Better service and even better food. If this was a hole in the wall, charging a bit less and with the same sort of poo-poo service, I would give it 4-5 stars but as a high-end establishment this is nothing I would be raving about.
author: Winè C.

description:
This place lived up to the hype, but to me, wasn't quite a 5 star. 

Four of us came here for dinner at 10 on a weeknight, and were seated within a couple minutes. The place was much more intimate than I expected; the couple sitting next to us were so close we couldn't help but eavesdrop on their conversation. We had the fried salmon roll which was a small dish but very tasty. The spicy mustard dip was addictive. 

I had the sea bass which came with noodles and beans, and while the fish itself didn't have that much flavor (it was a good portion though, and very tender yet meaty, as it should be) the sauce it came with was DELICIOUS. I dipped everything on my plate in that, and when I finished my meal, my husband used it for his kobe steak. The noodles were also a bit bland; I preferred the mashed potatoes that came with my husband's steak (which was the special that night and had a mushroom sauce). 

We had a bottle of sake and some beer along with dinner. The bottle of sake was bigger than I expected somehow and it was actually rather hard to finish. I wish we hadn't been so full that we couldn't handle dessert, but nothing on the dessert menu jumped out at me anyway...their dessert menu seemed pretty standard. Service was good. As others have pointed out, the portions are pretty big; we expected to have room for dessert, but ended up really full.
author: Claire D.

description:
I came to the House to celebrate my mom's birthday, and we all loved it!

We started with the deep fried salmon roll. I was expecting something like a fried sushi roll, but was pleasantly surprised when I found out it was huge pieces of salmon wrapped in seaweed! The flavors were excellent, and the salmon was extremely tender.

My parents and I tried three entrees:
Wasabi Noodles with Grilled Pork: This was probably our favorite out of the three dishes. The noodles were delicious, and although the wasabi flavor was quite faint, the overall dish came out well.
Pork Chop with pomegranate sauce: We didn't get pomegranate seeds like the picture shows! The sauce was amazing though, and the pork chop was cooked to be quite tender.
Halibut with truffle sauce (today's special): This was probably the only disappointing dish out of the three. It was a good portion size considering it was halibut, and the price was reasonable, but the truffle flavor wasn't very strong, nor did it seem to pair the fish well.

For dessert, we ordered the bittersweet chocolate truffle cake. My mom loved that the cake wasn't too sweet considering the heavy chocolate flavor. The coffee ice cream lacked coffee flavor, unfortunately.

As a note, they don't do anything special for birthdays. It'd be nice if they did though!
The shop is on the smaller side, so a reservation is definitely recommended. Parking in this area can also be tough too. Surprisingly, we went on a slower day and the service was quite friendly (they didn't seem that friendly over the phone). The food was worth the visit, however. I definitely want to come back to try some of their other entrees!
author: Michael L.

description:
With 3000+ reviews, and 4.5 stars, we expected amazing food and at least mediocre service.  The food was okay but definitely overhyped.  Everything was slightly overcooked/over sauced.  They had very large portions though.  The waitresses were friendly and nice but the hostess (or owner?) gave our spot up even though we called prior to our reservation time to inform her that we were less than a mile away.  Her attitude was unapologetic and cold.  I was peeved because they asked for credit card information when we made the reservation so we expected it to be easier to keep our table.
I guess we were extremely disappointed to find the food mediocre at best after waiting for an extra hour on Valentine's Day.  
I understand the rules but really the hostess' attitude can really use a change.
author: Jing L.

description:
4.5/5. The House consistently dishes out solid fusion food. Some of the more popular dishes include the Warm Wasabi House Noodles with Flat Iron Angus Steak, the Grilled Sea Bass with Garlic Soy Ginger, and the Deep Fried Salmon Roll appetizer. However, the fish dishes are the strongest: The sea bass, in particular, is perfectly cooked.

The place is tiny, tables are quite cramped, and there isn't much lighting. As such, it can get very crowded. I usually come just before closing when there's no wait or take-out. 

Also, be forewarned: If parking in San Francisco is difficult, parking in North Beach is impossible. I once spent 30 minutes circling the nearby streets for a spot.
author: Pierre B.

description:
First time in SF , decided to try this based off reviews and wow are we happy that we did...
Most amazing wasabi noodles w perfectly cooked steak, sea bass that melts in your mouth and the chocolate cake w coffee ice cream was the definition of perfection. You must try this place , 5 stars !
author: Pj P.

description:
Came here for dinner a couple weekends ago with a group of old friends, one of whom suggested this place maybe because I've been missing good Asian food in Europe.

We started out with the soft shell crab appetizer, which had a pretty cool presentation. Flavor was pretty good too.

Then we ordered a few entrees and had them family style. The only one that really stood out was the pork chop, which I'd order again. The other entrees were competent but not mind blowing (we had maybe two kinds of steak, and a fish dish of some sort). The other odd thing is every entree was served with a noodle side of some sort, but they were all almost exactly the same.

Sameness complaints aside, this place is a good value for money. Might come again next time I'm in SF.
author: Charles L.

description:
I can see why this place has so many raved reviews. My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday Night around 5:30 and thought we could get a table without making a reservation. Little did we know, this place was busy at that time. Luckily, they told us the wait would just be 30 mins. I didn't mind since it was a bit early. We had a hostess take down our name and phone number, and we walked around for 30 mins. 25 mins later we get a call to tell us our table is ready. 

Once we got back, we were seated right away. The place was really busy so I expected really good things. We looked at our surroundings and the first thing we notice is the modern sleek decor with a slight Asian feel. The table decorations are cute. The place mat is punched out with a small house. I thought it was a nice touch. 

Once we were handed our menus, our waitress asked us what we wanted to drink and told us their specials. She was very kind and patient with us, which I really appreciated. There were so many good looking items on the menu and it was hard for us to choose. In the end, we decided on: deep fried salmon roll, Maine Crab Cake, and the Teriyaki Rib Eye Steak. 

Deep Fried Salmon Roll: Presentation is spot on. Once you dig in, you realize that the salmon is slightly seared with the middle still a bit raw. I didn't mind it at all, It was actually very tasty and made the plate unique. The spicy wasabi dipping sauce was a perfect addition to the fried salmon roll. 

Maine Crab Cake: This crab cake is going to be nothing like anything you've ever tired and that makes it amazing. When it came out, it looks like a volcano with lava coming out. The crab cake itself was perfectly cooked. Crispy on the outside and crabby and soft on the inside. It's a flavor explosion in your mouth and whatever sauce is on the bottom of the crab cake added a great kick to this dish. I highly recommend this dish. My boyfriend hates seafood but he loved this dish.

Teriyaki Rib Eye Steak: For our entree we decided on the rib eye to share. We have never had rib eye before so we didn't know what to expect. Our rib eye was cooked very well and tasted delightful. My only issue with this dish was that our rib eye had a couple pieces of fat on it. My boyfriend and I didn't know if this is how rib eye is supposed to taste but we were a bit annoyed with it. I couldn't eat a couple pieces because the meat was far to fatty and chewy. Otherwise, the non-fatty pieces were delicious. The thing that saved this dish for me was the vegetables that came with it. The rib eye comes on top of really yummy mashed potatoes and amazingly spiced cauliflower. 

I really enjoyed my service here. I've read a couple of the reviews and people ragged on their service. I was very happy with our service here. They were very quick, nice, and accommodating. 

Overall, I enjoyed my time at The House. Great atmosphere, great food presentation, good service, and great food.  I would love to come back here an try the wasabi noodles that everyone raves about.
author: Stacey L.

description:
What is up with the two-star and three-star-reviews out there? I and my three other friends had an unforgettable dinner here. What can go wrong with inventive, delicious, and affordable food plus great service? Trust me! The House is undisputedly Asian Fusion at its best.

We were deeply grateful to my good friend from UCLA, Nguyen D. who recommended this gem in a hole. 

There are a few things I want to share with you. First, make reservation in advance. Second, do not be late. The restaurant is small, cramped, about 40-guest seating, and there is always a list of walk-ins, so imagine if you are late, the walk-ins take your space and then you have to wait in line for the next available table. Last, street parking is horrible, but luckily my friend found a public parking near the intersection of Stockton St. and Jackson St . Hope it helps.

The good thing about going with a group of friends to a restaurant like The House is that you get to try a lot of dishes. Portion of each dish can be shared between three-four people. Four of us ordered three entrées and three main courses. We left the restaurant feeling full but not to the point that our bellies would burst.

 
Our choices of small plates:

- Seared dayboat scallops with micro greens and ponzu sauce. The scallops were fresh and had a pretty caramelized color. The ponzu sauce was light and accompanied the scallops really well.  

- Deep-fried salmon roll with Chinese hot mustard. The outside was crispy while the inside stayed moist and tender. The miso wasabi dipping sauce and the accompanied Asian slaw together made your taste buds feel clean and definitely less of the greasiness that the word "deep-fried" called upon.

- Charred baby octopus salad, crispy pork skin, red vinaigrette. The salad was fresh, delicious, but the flaw of this dish was the pork skin. It was not crispy at all, and we could tell that the pork skin was old and it was re-fried.

Our selections of main courses:

- Warm wasabi house noodles with Angus flatiron steak. We ordered medium-rare steaks and it came perfectly cooked. The wasabi noodles were bomb. The dish was phenomenal.

 - Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy. The fish was tender and succulent. We had it with garlic noodles, however it was not as good as Thanh Long's garlic noodles. 

 - Niman ranch pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce. Pork chop was cooked medium, so the meat stayed moist and juicy. The mash potato was smooth and flavorful. The pomegranate currant sauce created a tangy but perfectly balanced taste to the dish. I am not a big fan of pork, but this dish was heaven on a plate to me.

We skipped desserts since we had plan to have it somewhere else.

Service was friendly and efficient. Our water glass was always full. Food arrived quickly. Overall, we adore the beautiful and exquisite plating and believe that each dish represents a thoughtful and harmonious blend of East and West ingredients.
author: Chau V.

description: Overrated. Their sauces were interesting and special, actual food not so much. About $140 for two. I have yet to meet Asian fusion that is good.
author: Philip C.

description:
The first time I was here it was for lunch and I had the udon noodle soup while my boyfriend had the curry noodles. Delicious! I enjoyed the broth for my udon as it was nice and flavorful, no one likes bland udon broth. My boyfriend enjoyed his curry udon, especially because of the thicker noodles. I think they use udon noodles? If not, it reminds me a lot of Shanghai cho mien noodles. The only disappointing part of this meal was the lychee tea I ordered--it was too light and I could barely taste any hint of lychee. If I didn't know it was lychee black tea, I probably would've thought it was regular tea. 

We recently returned to The House and this time we tried their more famous dishes: the house wasabi noodles with steak and the sea bass. I had the steak and while I wasn't blown away, I really enjoyed the dish. The steak was perfectly cooked and the noodles are unique, though I didn't taste too much wasabi. As for the sea bass, I was blown away and that's because I don't like to eat fish. I'll eat sashimi but I usually stay away from steamed fish, baked fish, etc. I can't stand the fishy taste. Having said all that, I loved the sea bass. I liked it more than the steak and noodles! This is saying a lot coming from me. It was so buttery on the inside with the nice sear on the outside--and the sauce really pulled it all together. I'm going back again, so I can get the sea bass for myself haha. We also had the ahi tuna with nori chops for our appetizer. It was good, but too much wasabi taste for the boyfriend. You can really taste the nori in the chips, which is nice. This time I didn't order a drink and stuck with good ol' water. 

Service is very attentive and nice here. I think they lost our reservations because after we were seated, the hostess came back to ask again. It made us feel kinda weird since we were already seated...I'm not complaining since we got seated, but I thought I'd mention it.
author: Doris K.

description:
Based on a high number of 5* reviews on Yelp, my husband and I stopped in here for dinner last week on a 3 day trip to San Francisco. SO happy that we trusted the Yelpers!

We called in for a reservation at about 5pm and got a 9pm table. Definitely seems like they fill up every night. 

We arrived 5min early and were seated right away. Service was very friendly and our waitress had a long list of specials ready for us to hear upon arrival. We ordered 2 Tsingtao and mulled over the menu. 

We ended up with 2 small plates (Salmon spring rolls, and Shrimp and chive dumplings) and 2 large plates (Seared ahi, and the wasabi noodles with flank steak). Everything was fantastic but the standouts were the salmon spring rolls - perfectly rare in the middle but super crispy on the outside and the hot Chinese mustard dip was the perfect balance. Husband said he could eat them all day long. The other stand out was the seared ahi, it was served with two delicious sauces and some white rice with crispy vegetables of some sort for texture. I did love the wasabi noodle flank steak dish as well (noodles had great chew and steak was perfect medium-rare). Could have used more wasabi flavour IMO. I would probably pass on the dumplings next time. 

Everything was so full of flavour and for two people who are generally turned off by the word "fusion", this was Asian fusion at it's finest. The prices were fair compared to most hot restaurants in SF -- around $10-15USD for small plates and $19-25 for large plates. Well worth it. 

Oh we also got the Chinese almond cookies to go for $5, perfect ending to the meal.
author: Alison C.

description:
The House is a reliable San Francisco institution.

They're continually packed and their stand-out dishes always deliver.

Their Sea Bass is cooked to melt-in-your-mouth perfection.

And really - you can't go wrong with any of their entree dishes. They've been mastering each over the years and each one is packed with simple foodie eloquence.

Make sure that you set up a reservation beforehand - since The House is always busy and make sure to save room for the Mango Tapioca.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
This is the best Asian fusion I've ever had! I came here on Valentine's day, and it was the perfect meal. We started with the deep fried salmon rolls, which was like a spring roll with seared salmon inside. I love salmon, and the combination of crunch outside and the tender inside was amazing. We also had the unagi served on sushi rice, which is definitely a must-have. Rice is so important, and the ratio of unagi to rice was also just right.

The pomegranate pork chop was cooked perfectly, and I loved the slight sweetness of the glaze. It was a pretty big piece of meat too! My boyfriend had the sea bass, which was so flaky and buttery with a really yummy sauce. I literally have no complaints about any of the food, and I want to come back as soon as possible to try everything else on the menu! It's definitely one of my favorite places in SF.
author: Ashley T.

description: Amazing food and flavors. Exactly as described. Asian fusion. Small and charming. Had the curry noodles with prawns. Worth the calories. Had special magi cooked to perfection. Yum.
author: Victoria S.

description:
Poke special with yellowtail and tuna 9/10
Deep fried salmon roll 9/10
Kobe rib eye special 8/10
Cod 9/10
Chocolate truffle with coffee ice-cream 7/10

Bugey gamay italian wine 7/10
author: Dennis D.

description:
Main course: I had the sea bass which was just okay. I've had a lot of sea bass and this was nothing spectacular. I'm not sure if it was because it was a pretty thick piece so it wasn't as tender/flaky as I was hoping or maybe my expectations were too high after other reviews! It definitely wasn't bad by any means! Just not as good as I was hoping 
The noodles and green beans that came with it were amazing. Cooked perfectly. The sauce served alongside was excellent. 

Dessert: I was torn between the creme brulee and apple pie but ended up going with the apple pie and cannot say enough about it. Best apple pie I've ever had hands down. Warm, fresh, crispy. Just delicious. 

Service: Excellent service!!!!!! I dealt with 3 different people (they seemed to share service roles) and everyone was extremely pleasant. I also got there right at 5:30 on a Monday and was able to be seated without a reservation. It was a lot busier after I left though.
author: Jess J.

description: The sea bass is SOOOO delicious. Seriously, if it wasn't so hard to find parking around the area, I would definitely come here almost everyday. 5 stars but -1 star for location/accessibility
author: C L.

description:
My good friend lives in North Beach and she said The House is her favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Now, that's a bold statement. But she swears by this place and I would have to agree that this restaurant serves some of the best tasting dishes I've had.

The wait is ridiculous and you can't get dinner reservations ever before 9pm. But it's worth it. Everything is so worth it here.

We ordered the specials of the night for appetizers: the ribs with Asian slaw. Then for my entree I got the Angus ribeye. Both were amazing and super flavorful. The ribs fell off the bones and the slaw totally made the dish. The ribeye cooked to perfection! 

One of the best meals I've had in SF.
author: Qui C.

description:
Based on the yelp reviews, we tried the deep-fried salmon roll, grilled sea bass, and the pork chop.  The deep-fried salmon rolls were really good, but my favorites were definitely the grilled sea bass and the pork chop.

The pork chop comes with mashed potatoes and asparagus, in a pomegranate currant sauce.  Meanwhile, the grilled sea bass comes with green beans and really terrific pasta.  I'm not sure which of these two dishes I'll get the next time I visit, since I thought they were equally amazing.  I definitely loved both too much to try any other main dish here.
author: Cici A.

description:
OMG THE SEA BASS. I've been here twice and seriously just thinking about that bass is making my mouth water. 

Service was good, apps were okay (crab cakes and asian salad were good, ahi tuna was meh), ambience is nice. I like how it's low key enough for fine dining that I don't feel out of place in jeans and a nice shirt. 

Definitely make reservations in advance because it's a tiny little...well, house :)

AND GET THE BASS. Better yet, order me a bass while you're there and ship it over to my place so I'll stop drooling on the floor.
author: Chris W.

description:
You cannot go wrong with any of the menu items at this restaurant ! I strongly suggest making a reservation a few days in advance. I tried to make a same day reservation for a Saturday night and was told that the earliest dinner would be at 10pm (which led me to reschedule for the following weekend). 

Parking in north beach is painful. One alternative is driving around for 20 mins hoping to "get lucky" or you can park in a garage in Chinatown. We parked in "Portsmouth Square Garden" on Clay. Was about a 0.3 mile or 7 min walk from the restaurant  , pleasant stroll through china town. 

Anywho, now for the food review. Ate the following items: 
Deep fried salmon roll with mustard sauce - kind of like an eggroll with salmon inside of if. Was delicious. Mustard sauce has a hint of wasabi in it. 

Clams with bread (special) - came with a delicious dipping sauce , highly recommend this as an appetizer 

Porkchop - had pomegranate sauce. Was cooked medium as specified. Hefty serving for its price $24. Well worth it. 

Black cod (special) - served with slice crab roll with rice. Also delicious. Fish was tender and buttery. Only minor complaint is that the piece of fish I received was rather small. Maybe it was because it wasn't the "official" special of the day ? (I asked the waitress if they had it even though it was not mentioned, and they gladly prepared it for me). 

Skirt steak(special) - super tender meat served with potato veggies and some type of sauce. Also very tasty 

Angus steak with garlic noodles - large serving of noodles with pieces of steak on it.  Also yummy but had a smaller proportion of meat compared to noodles

Coconut creme brûlée with passiofruit purée - this was only ok. The creme brûlée was topped with the purée , however the purée tasted rather sour. The dessert tasted better without the purée.  I do not recommend this. 

Service was attentive. Servers were quick to fill cups. Also , the food came out rather quickly. Entrees came out in literally 15 minutes. Very impressive. The restaurant itself is very tiny and the interior isn't anything special, food is great though. Dinner entrees don't break the bank either ranging from 18-33 per plate. Appetizers are around 8-12 each. Lunch entrees are cheaper ranging from 10-25 per entree. Highly recommended
author: Patty O.

description:
4.5

Limited seating. Good food. Quick service. 

Came for dinner both times. First time the food was alright. Had no desire to return, except to try the black cod special. 

Back the second time and the black cod special was good. I do like it better than the seabass, as it was more tender and moist. Portions were perfect, left me satiated. 

I really liked the deep fried chicken liver for appetizer. The oysters were decent. The deep fried salmon rolls were good. 

Had a $12 recommended glass which was good. Would be back, but wouldn't crave.
author: Anna S.

description: Everything I ordered was a daily special, so I'm not sure how helpful this review will be to most people, but I had a GREAT experience and the food was amazing so I would definitely recommend. I had the lamb special, and the cranberry bread pudding dessert special, both of which were incredible. To start I got the sashimi (which was also a special), which was okay, but nothing compared to that of a really great sushi joint. All in all, recommend and will be back to try other items on the menu!
author: Tammy N.

description: This place had incredible sea bass. Would definitely go back. The kale salad was good too.
author: Meghan N.

description:
I can't believe this is one of the top restaurants on Yelp right now since I really did not think it was anything special. Casually wandered in here for lunch with my boss one day and I didn't even realize we were at The House for the longest time. 

We shared a scallop salad and some salmon entree. It wasn't memorable at all and there was a fly circling us the entire time. It also seemed pretty dead during lunch. 

Oh and for future reference incase you wanted to plan a party here, my boss tried to plan a birthday dinner for his girlfriend here. It was for 15 people on a Saturday night. They said they could only accommodate us at 5pm and we would have to be done by 6:30. Since its a small restaurant, they only let you make large reservations right when they open. Obviously we went with another restaurant.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Very small place but amazing food!  Can't go wrong with anything you get here.  We go the hamachi sashimi, kobe beef salad, miso black cod, and seared ahi.  Would love to come back.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Really bad customer service...hostess was rude and unapologetic after she made a scheduling mistake. Ruined it and won't be back
author: Zach L.

description: Ok previously I have Ben impressed here but quality has gone down.  Always really busy still.  Get here early or you'll have to wait
author: N S.

description: My FAVORITE place to eat in San Francisco!  Sea bass is the best!  Calamari is an experience (when in season). A must go when in SF!
author: Brad M.

description:
The meal wasn't perfect, but my entree was worth 6-stars, so 5-stars will suffice. The place is tight, but we were sat close to our reservation time. Initially we were told that we had to be out of there after 90min, but we were not rushed out in any way. 

Got started with the white shrimp & Chinese chive dumplings. These were just OK. Not great flavor. I'm a stickler for dumplings and most fall below expectations, so take it as you will.  Moved on to the grilled ahi tuna entree. This tuna was melt in your mouth good. It was grilled just so slightly and was the perfect combo to the wasabi drizzle around the plate. My fav tuna dish of all time!

Also tried the warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak, which was surprising, in a good way. The wasabi noodles didn't overwhelm, but the steak was average. The scallops in a cream sauce, (not sure of the official name) was fantastic, but very rich. Def share it with the table. 

Overall, a great meal. Looking forward to trying more of the menu and then hitting the vibrant local area :D
author: Drew A.

description:
I think this is probably my favorite asian fusion restaurant. Came here last friday and the food was sooooooooooo good! the sea bass was cooked to perfection, the deep fried salmon roll was good, and the oysters were good especially with the sauce. 

Came here today again, sea bass, though good, did not compare to the one i had last friday. my guess is that the fish was overcooked. recommended my sister and bf to try their black cod special and concluded that the fish had gone bad. It had the texture of mashed potatoes and it was overly watery. The oysters and salmon roll are still good, but the tuna tartar is not that good imo. Based on today's experience, I would give this restaurant a 3 star, especially for the price, but since I love this restaurant so much, I just couldn't do it.

Basically, I'm going to assume that weekends are when the ingredients are more fresh.
author: Tina S.

description:
Hidden gem with delicious food.

Went here for lunch and was able to beat the lunch crowd.  Started off with the deep fried salmon roll w/ spicy mustard (a must try) and the tuna sashimi.  The spicy mustard is now one of my favorite sauces and the tuna was nice and fresh.  My bf ended up getting the grilled sea bass w/ garlic noodles and snap peas  while I got the kurobuta pork chop w/ pomegranate currant sauce.  The seabass was buttery and tasty while my pork chop was nice and juicy.  I really enjoyed the mixture of flavors between the pomegrante and currant sauces.  The taro chips it came with gave extra texture as well.

Make sure you get here early if you don't have reservations other wise be prepared to wait.  We actually parked all the way at the 5th & Mission parking garage and walked through China town to get here.  Good way to burn some calories because indulging in some delicious food.  The lunch menu seemed similar to the dinner menu with some additional items for dinner.
author: Joycelyn L.

description:
Few places that are highly touted meet their lofty expectations. I scoffed at the 4.5 average stars on almost 3000 reviews.

"Another restaurant that will fall far short of the everest-like expectations set by 3000 idiots that don't know anything about good tasting food"

Or so I thought.

Until I took my first bite into the free pickled cucumbers..

And one more into my delicious sea-bass that melted in my mouth.

One more of my friend's pork chop that may be placed in the BIHEE category.

What is BIHEE, you ask?

BEST I HAVE EVER EATEN!!!

Wow. At very reasonable prices, this may be one of my favorite places to eat. Ever.

I apologize to my fellow yelpers that have preceded me and have tasted ambrosia before me. I stand in unison with all the others when I say that this simple establishment is 5 star worthy. I stand humbled by food. By cooks that can cook such delicacies. By House. As its name suggests. Simple. Un-pretentious. Simply delicious.
author: Jack K.

description:
This place earns a 4.99999 stars!

If you come to San Francisco, you must make a visit to "The House" because I guarantee you will not be disappointed! 

I was VERY fortunate to come here with Mike C. to have the one of the most flavorful curry udon noodle with grilled chicken (no soup). This place knocked the side of my head because it was so tasty. I ordered the curry udon which was more like a stir fry ($11) with a twist on the Japanese influence. Nice and creamy and having the curry flavor surround each noodle. I tried the wasabi noodles with pork ($11) and it was unbelievable. Full of flavor and not as greasy as expected. The pork was super tender.

Be sure to make reservations because at lunch this place was packed. The interior was contemporary and clean and the staff were helpful and prompt.

As he said, "Run, don't walk here" is totally true! Parking sucks but what else do you expect in SF!!
author: Santi T.

description: The pork chop is amazing, very tender and juicy. It's a must try. The wait is long if no rsvp
author: Lin W.

description: Definitely liked the place. We waited one hour to get in but it was worth it. Small place, great service and delicious food!
author: Victoria G.

description: small place (most are here) but great food.  I am not a fan of fusion but this place is really good.
author: David Iceman L.

description: It's one of the best place in north beach. Make a reservation if you have a big group or come as early as 5pm ( in my case that's what I do). 5 stars on customer service and the food are hands down. Salmon egg rolls is a must as a starter. Sea bass is to die for. Come visit The House!
author: Jsphn T.

description: My boyfriend and I tried the raw oysters, wasabi noodles with flat iron steak, and the sea bass. The wasabi noodles were good but I didn't think they were extraordinary. On the other hand, the sea bass was melt-in-your-mouth amazing! The flavors of all dishes were unique and tasty so I would like to come back and try a few of their other dishes!
author: Annie L.

description:
Incredible. Was lucky to just walk in before they opened, had to wait in a short line, and got a seat. Apparently it's difficult to get a reservation here. The food was amazing and the only critique I have is they really pack the tables in there, was impossible to leave to the bathroom without knocking the table next to us.

The service was good as well. My family split a bunch of appetizers to starts, the fried salmon roll (WOW), a warm kale salad with blue cheese (very good), and a tempura shrimp salad (quite tasty). The main course was salmon in a sake broth (i love it but wish they put less broth since the salmon alone was so flavorful), my mother got the sea bass (possibly the best cooked bass I have ever had) and my father and brother got a steak noodle dish (the meat was tasty but the noodles I thought were just slightly greasy). Overall the dining experience was very nice and I can't speak enough of how wonderful the fish dishes were. I would DEFINITELY buy the bass or salmon here, incredible! The deserts also looked wonderful but we didn't get any.

I'd recommend this place and would definitely come back. Only reason I gave 4 and not 5 stars was the fact that the noodles were slightly greasy and other than the fried salmon roll the appetizers were very good but not exceptional.

If I could I would give them 4.5 stars, which is what their average rating is right now, so spot on yelp! spot on!
author: Daniel B.

description:
Perhaps a little hyped up by the reviews, but The House was a pleasant place to eat. We had the Ahi Tartare as an appetizer and the presentation and taste were gorgeous. I had the sea bass, which was delicious and buttery. The noodles on the side weren't great, and I could have done without them. My girlfriend had the sashimi which she said was underwhelming, but we both enjoyed the cook on the cauliflower. 

The atmosphere was nice and intimate, and of course you get the neon glow from the strip clubs next door. Kidding. 

Final verdict: was it good? Yes. Was it worth the money? Eh, not enough data, but leaning towards no.
author: Ryan C.

description:
This restaurant is a small room that serves some yummy food. If there's anything you're going to get out of reading this review, know that you should get the grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy. It will be one of the best cooked fish experiences you'll ever have in your entire life, seriously.

We got these items:
1) grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy
2) warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak
3) deep-fried salmon roll with cheese hot mustard

Honestly, the only thing I really liked was the fish. The other 2 dishes were unique and tasty, but they weren't amazing like I was expecting them to be. Ironically, I didn't think the sea bass was going to be any good but damn, that's some good cooking.

I thought that the service was on the slow side, but at least our server had the decency to realize that and apologize. Apologies can go so far when it comes to overall experiences. Be sure to make a reservation or else you'll just be waiting outside the door looking awkward as you watch and are being watched by all the people of North Beach.
author: Marlon T.

description: I had several restaurants picked out for my 40th Birthday Dinner.  House was the only available spot having an available reservation for the specific time needed.  It was an amazing dinner.  The restaurant itself is small and quaint.  Everything from the starters to the dessert was amazing.  Each course was very flavorful and truly embodied the Asian Fusion concept.  My favorite dessert is apple pie, what a pleasant surprise that they had their version on the menu.  It did not disappoint and satisfied my crazing for something sweet after the amazing pork chop.
author: Todd M.

description: Asian fusion is one of my absolute favorites so the house fits my palate perfectly. I've been coming here for a long time ever since I was a little kid because my aunt and uncle would host their kid's parties there. I miss the old location in the sunset just because it was convenient for me but it doesn't stop me from going to eat since having moved a long time ago. Appetizers are a great idea to get-they are delicious. Some of my favorites are the tempura green beans and the salmon rolls (which are deep fried and come with this tasty mustard dipping sauce). As for the entree, I'm a noodle lover so I always get the wasabi noodles and that's something you can never go wrong with. If you're going for dessert any choice is great but I love the mango tapioca. The portions aren't small so you won't leave feeling like you paid too much for so little.
author: Tori C.

description:
Not a fan of the workers here besides our main waiter who was very friendly, but overall I did enjoy the food.  I'm not usually a fan of Asian Fusion, but it was great here.
We started off with an amazing Crab Cake for appetizer.  A crunchy outside, soft inside with crab plus a nice kick from the spicy sauce on the plate.  For my main dish I had the Grilled Sea Bass.  The fish was nicely done, so soft and tasty, but the sauce that came with it was a bit salty.  The garlic noodles on the side was so delicious.  I would totally come back just to get more of the noodles.
author: Karen L.

description:
Loved this little place.  And I mean little!  It was jam packed but food was very good.  Betty and I started with the salmon rolls which were very flavorful and perfectly fried.  We also had the wasabi noodles which were nice and chewy topped with flank steak.  We also had the black cod over chinese broccoli topped with a cali roll.  

Beer list was nice and service was excellent.
author: Bob B.

description:
I love seafood and I love Asian fusion so this was the perfect restaurant for me. We'd made reservations in advance, and I'm glad we did so we didn't have a wait. The inside of the restaurant is simple - feels like a mix between a diner and a Chinese restaurant. The service was a little rushed and not super friendly, but I guess they just like to get people in and out given the restaurant is not very big. That's the only reason for 4 stars as opposed to 5.

The food was awesome. We had two of the special appetizers to start. A scallop dish and fried soft shell crab (a must for me any time it is on the menu). The crab was nice and crispy and the scallops were cooked perfectly. Both were excellent. For our entrees, my date had the sea bass with noodles, which we'd read so much about. The sea bass was grilled and relatively simple, with a dipping sauce on the side and of course the wasabi noodles (do yourself  a favor and get them instead of the rice).  I had a special, miso cod, which was a tower of asparagus, seared cod, with 2 sushi rolls on top, sitting on top of an awesome teriyaki type sauce. Both were so delicious. Dessert didn't seem that interesting to us so we skipped it. If I lived in SF I would be back, a lot.
author: Nicole D.

description: Probably the worst experience I've had dining in the neighborhood. I made a reservation a few days before, so there shouldn't be any problem getting seated. My friends and I weren't greeted upon entry, and we did have to wait a while for anyone to acknowledge us. Our server was okay. It took a while for someone to come help us, while surrounding tables had their orders taken right away. The food was just average. I've had better steak elsewhere. But that doesn't justify for the shitty service. The person who appeared to be the manager/owner along with our server seemed like they couldn't wait for us to leave.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Writing this as I'm food comatosed; stuffed silly & tired. Yes I definitely ate too much.

Everyone ordered a (red) meaty dish but me - had the prawns with mushroom rice and it was a big serving. Very yummy! But heavy... Started with the Caesar salad with fried scallop which was light & good but not as creative as others in the table who ordered the hamachi & crab cake... 

Service was decent except they didn't have a birthday candle to top our coconut creme brûlée for us (strange) and though we had reservations we did have to wait a bit... 

All in all, great group dining experience mainly because of the yummy food and reasonable corkage fee of $20.
author: Gina M.

description:
This is my absolute favorite restaurant in San Francisco. I've lived in North Beach my whole life and for the last 9 years, I've celebrated my birthday here year after year. 

It's Angela's Mango Pudding. It's magical. Get it. Hands down absolute must. 

Larry does an amazing job with everything on the dinner and lunch menu. My favorites are the following:

Appetizers-- Fried Salmon Rolls with Wasabi Dipping sauce and the tempura green beans. 

Entrees--  Pork Chop with Pomegranate reduction and mashed potatoes, Wasabi house noodles with flat iron steak (it's not spicy don't worry), and the Chilean Sea bass with ginger soy dipping sauce. FANTASTIC. But you cant really go wrong with anything on the menu. 

NOTE: Any special with Kobe beef will be life changing. Do it and come back for a regular dish another time. 

Desserts: Like i said, the mango pudding is the real winner. Angela is an amazing pastry chef though and I really enjoy her flourless chocolate cake and apple pie. 

Ah, can't wait to go back again for more.
author: Marissa S.

description:
I love this place. The atmosphere made me feel like I am eating in a contemporary (sp?) style restaurant. The presentation for the dishes is Chopped worthy and Iron Chef worthy, very clean and super pretty that it is worth taking pictures of. I had the curry noodles and it was AMAZING! The curry isn't super spicy. On a scale of 1-10, 1 meaning eh, 10 meaning HOLY gimme some milk, it fell to a 3/4 to me, someone who is sensitive to spicy foods. The portion was great. If you are a big eater, then this is the place to go. The dish wasn't over priced. I think I paid for 11/12 bucks for a food baby from this place. The service is fantastic. The waiters are patient, they don't rush you to order and they tell you the daily specials and are happy to answer any questions you have. I have never seen such nice and patient waiters before! 

The only catch is that this cute little restaurant is hidden in that part of Chinatown that isn't kid friendly, like lingerie stores and such. Call me a prude, but this restaurant deserves a better location.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
Om nom nom nom nom!!!

I LOVE this place!!! It always super packed so make sure you have a reservation! I mean sometimes you get lucky and they give you a table if you are just randomly in the neighborhood and wanted to try out their oh  so delicious food! (No guarantee though! Always make a reservation if you plan on coming here!)

Appetizers:
Deep fried salmon rolls-They are crisp and filled with yummy salmon, served with a mustard sauce. 

The steamed mussels-I would recommend getting these! The house took my mussel virginity away!!! They make me fall in love with mussels! The broth is so good that I was sipping on it even after the mussels were all gone! 

Calamari-Personally I am an asian salt and pepper calamari kind of girl so these were okay! They batter them very nicely and they tasted really light.

Entrees:
Sea bass: The house also took away my sea bass virginity and wow what a great place to lose it! They make suchhhh amazinggg sea bass! It literally melts in your mouth! Comes with green beans and garlic noodles that are made with udon so its nice and chewy with this amazing explosion of flavor of soy sauce and garlic! 

Pork chop: I never knew a pork chop could taste this amazing even with the weird sounding pomegranate sauce! My BF ordered this and I couldn't help but pick at his food and steal a few bites! PLEASE don't under estimate the sound of this entree, the pomegranate sauce actually compliments the pork chop very nicely!

Flank steak with wasabi noodles: I wish they served the garlic noodles instead with this dish because I am not a very big fan of wasabi but it is still very yummy. The steak is very tender and cooked and seasoned just right!

I would really recommend coming here for a special occasion or no occasion at all! Sure it's pricey but it's the yumminess behind their doors is well worth it!
author: Kelly L.

description:
Came here for an anniversary dinner and I must say, it was well worth the struggle of getting through SF traffic and finding parking. 
The restaurant itself is a bit small but it has a nice elegant atmosphere.. Very clean, which I like. The service at the time was great but I could see it getting pretty crazy because I've heard it gets crowded.
We ordered the sea bass and pork chop. The sea bass was cooked perfectly and paired well with the sauce. I would recommend taking the sauce lightly because it can overpower the fish. The noodles were also really great.
The pork chop had a nice pomegranate sauce and I liked how it didn't feel heavy with the pork. I was definitely satisfied with my dinner :)
author: Katie Y.

description: Absolutely one of my favorite places to visit when I lived in SF.  The house is what Asian fusion is all about.  Considering they creativity of the dishes, this place is what makes food look so appetizing and tasty to eat.
author: Tri L.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for the last year... From Los Angeles and man this place was disappointing. 

First of all the service was subpar to say the least which set the tone of the meal. Food was mediocre - not bad but also didn't blow me away. Let's just say that the food wasn't good enough to have that type of service. They were attentive but not friendly. 

Wasabi noodles 
Seabass 
Porkchop 
- the Seabass was the best

The best thing we had was: 
Asparagus salad 
Octopus salad 

With SO many great places in Sf I would not come back here
author: Bonny S.

description:
I think about this every day as I sit back in dreary TX. Me and my girl checked this place out on our last night in San Fran and DEAR GOD am I happy for tipsy, late night yelp runs. Found this place on here so THANK YOU YELPERS. We got the Deep Fried Salmon Roll which was TOO DIE FOR. I literally find myself craving this at least once a day. I then got the Grilled Sea Bass which came with noodles which was awesome as well! The almost teriyaki sauce MADE the noodles. I tried heating up the sea bass for leftovers a day later and it wasn't as great though/ didn't have too much of a flattering texture so eat up there!!

My friend got the octopus which was VERY pleasing the eyes as the owner is a GENIUS and just as pleasing to the mouth. Small portion though!!

We both got the passion fruit crème Brule. which ... I don't have to say ANYTHING because that Goddess speaks for itself. We paired this with Tea which came in the pots with the small cups per San Francisco Ritual :) 

The ONLY downfall was that since it is so claustrophobic/ a small space when you come in, if you don't fit the boho chic crowd you will get started down. Including by the employees. Thankfully the Owner changed that and tended to us herself. She seems like she likes to party too ;p
author: Monae M.

description: I didn't know it was possible and I am embarrassed to admit but since yelp is such a tight knit community here it goes. I may have came just a bit while eating dinner tonight. My god this spot is good, dinner was literally perfect. Highly recommend just don't sit at the table by the door jk
author: Jonathan S.

description:
I went here last night with my coworkers after an event. It took me 15 minutes driving in circles to find parking and was very close to just going to in n out. Would have been the worst mistake ever! We ordered 4 small panted to share between 5 of us. We got the green beans tempura - very flavorful dipping sauce. Ahi tartare - a Littleton mushy for my taste. Chicharrones salad -very light and delicious. Yellowtail sashimi - love the avocado addition to it.

For the main course I hit the seared ahi and it was cooked and flavored perfectly! The sauce wasn't too sweet that it would be overwhelming and it was served on a bed of rice and spinach, with taro bits on top. Yum!!! My coworkers got the steak and wasabi noodles which were pretty good, the sea bass and the porkchop. They all enjoyed their meals!

Dessert we got the chocolate cake and ice cream but I didn't enjoy the cake too much. I felt like it was a cross between fudge and something mushy. I don't like mushy food if you can't tell. BUT the passion fruit purée creme brûlée is to die for! OMG I could eat 10 of those! I will definitely come back!
author: Hanh M.

description: we ordered ribeyes and sea bass for main entres and oyster for appetiser!It was so great so tasty! best restaurant ever!
author: Ruiwen S.

description:
Went to The House with two others and split 3 small plates and 2 entrees family style. It was my  first time, but perusing Yelp all day before going for dinner left my mouth in a perpetual mouthwatering state. And let me tell you, I was not at all disappointed! In fact, despite going in with high expectations, The House somehow managed to surpass them!

We had made reservations beforehand, and a member of my party had already arrived by the time I got there, so there was no wait. Our server rattled off not 1, not 2, not even 3, but FOUR small plate specials and another four entrée specials. We felt a little overwhelmed with all of our choices! Between the three of us, we ordered:

Deep fried salmon roll with Chinese hot mustard - I'm not sure how they cooked this, but it was a piece of raw salmon wrapped in a wonton skin and then deep fried only on the outside so that the center part of the salmon was still cooked. I think my piece was overcooked, so I didn't get a large piece of raw salmon on the inside that I was expecting. Still good though. The sauce tasted like wasabi, which I'm not a fan of, so I can't comment on that.

Steamed mussels with garlic infused shrimp broth - There were probably 20 mussels or so steamed in this delicious broth that was slightly creamy and extremely garlic-y. In fact, it was so good that we asked for some bread to soak up the soup after we devoured the mussels!

Charred baby octopus salad - this was my meh dish of the night, though I should tell you that I'm not a huge salad fan. There were a couple bites of crispy pork skin in there that I really liked, but otherwise I couldn't get into it. The other members of my party seemed to like it though.

Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy - Our first entrée! I had read so many reviews about this signature dish that I was determined to order it. It came with green beans and a choice of noodles or rice. We opted for the garlic noodles. The sea bass was very soft and chewy, and paired with the sweet sauce that it came with, it was delicious!! The noodles and green beans were very typically Chinese, so overall it was a great dish but not mind-blowingly good.

Grilled black cod with 2 crab and avocado sushi rolls - OMG. This. This dish was the defining moment of the entire dinner. Unfortunately it is a special and not on their normal menu, but if it is available PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE do yourself a favor and order it. You won't regret it, I promise! The sushi rolls were pretty typical, though it was great to see real crab meat in sushi instead of the imitation stuff, but the black cod was the real star! It was so soft and tasty that it just literally melted in my mouth. I've had cod before, but never quite like this...I don't know if it was just the freshness of the fish or how the prepared it, or a combination of both, but I was so sad that I had to share this dish with two others! This is one of those dishes you will constantly dream about having again years down the road.

Overall had a great culinary experience and plan on bringing my mom here when she visits me in a couple months!!! 

Remember to take a picture of the menu so you can remember what dishes you ordered! I forgot to, but luckily another member of my party did :)
author: Dianna H.

description:
Saving up a special occasion dinner for a belated birthday, I decided on checking out The House after hearing rave reviews from friends and Yelp.

Reservations are definitely recommended as the restaurant is quite small. We noticed that most walk-ins were waiting 45 minutes to an hour for a table.

Enjoyed the small appetizer pickles that came out in lieu of bread, seemed fitting for an Asian fusion menu. Was really disappointed to find out that the first is complimentary and after that it's $3 but appreciated being told that instead of a surprise on our bill.

Started with the soft shell crab and tuna tartare. Both were well seasoned with fresh seafood. The presentation was simple but still impressive, which seems to be a theme for the place.

Got the steak with wasabi noodles and fish with spicy noodles for entrees. I was excited to try the wasabi noodles after reading great things about it but I wasn't impressed. They were good but not as strongly flavored or tasty as I had hoped. However, the fish was exceptionally well cooked and the highlight of the evening. Buttery, flavorful and flaky. I would suggest always getting the fish at your visit to The House.

Overall, the atmosphere was cozy if not a bit cramped and noisy. The service was fair but not great. I had high hopes for The House but unfortunately they did not live up.
author: Teresa T.

description: Stumbled upon it and the lunch was a pleasant surprise and mix of flavors and textures.
author: Tina W.

description:
It was my husband's 25th birthday, so I wanted to take him to a restaurant in San Francisco where we can enjoy a great dinner.  Checked here on Yelp and found this place. The House did not disappoint!  

What marvelous food!  Everything positive written about this place is correct!  From the appetizer, the main course and the dessert all were just a perfect delight!  The waitress made excellent wine choices for our meal.  We were in heaven.

Make sure to make reservations because this place is quite small and gets filled quickly.
author: Ana Maria F.

description: Wouldn't change a thing. Excellent salad with passion fruit dressing and soft shell crab special for lunch.
author: Theresa P.

description:
Food was good, service was so terrible I would not go back by my own choice.  4 stars for food, minus 3 stars for service.

- Service: TERRIBLE
I made a reservation for 6 for lunch the day before.  When we arrived they kept asking if the reservation was under a different name, they seemingly lost my reservation but were not apologetic at all about it.  It wasn't too busy so we were seated without too much fuss.  They forgot one of our entrees and took a while to replace it.  I had to ask for the dessert menu 3 times over the course of 10 minutes.  The rudest thing they did was to hand write in gratuity on the check.  I understand that for a group of 6 most places have auto gratuity, but usually will mention it, is printed on the receipt, and it is auto generated on the receipt so that it looks legit.  They hand wrote gratuity and the total in without saying a word leaving me a bit confused and frustrated given the lack of service we had.  When I asked about it the waitress nonchalantly said that it's been that way "for years", again no apology or consideration for not saying anything before the bill arrived.  Our whole experience was 1 hour and 45 minutes for lunch.

- Food: Pretty good
Scallop and shrimp tempura appetizer
Shrimp and chive dumplings appetizer
Sea bass with garlic noodles and green beans
Chocolate truffle cake, coffee ice cream, coconut caramel
author: Shirley S.

description:
On a Tuesday nights, decided to hit up the city.  Why not ! Hit up one of my favorite restaurant THE HOUSE! 

Ordered the specials of the day.  The Unagi hand roll and the baked oysters with BBQ sauce.  Not really impressed with the specials but it wasn't bad.  

The service here is always the best! Always there when you need them.

For entrees, we order my favorite pork chop! It a must to get the chop... No joke ' 

Then my bf got the today special cod fish, I tried it, and it was fantastic !!!

Overall, will be back and always my number one option !

Bill came out to $129, dropped $160 !! 

$15 parking aprons the corner , no problem ! But they close at 9 !! 

Time to roll out
author: Merecedes J.

description:
While the food in general is pretty delicious, I've decided to stop coming here.

Each time, I had hoped the service would get better. I was wrong. The waiter never refilled my water glass or ask how I was doing.

The owner looks like she has a HUGE chip on her shoulder. She is very nice to the white clientele but rude to everyone else. What gets me is she's Asian, too. Yes, I've  watched and observed this for several meals.

If I want bad service and borderline discrimination, I'll come here. Otherwise, no thank you.
author: A H.

description: Excellent food! Must try Soft Shell Crab and Spicy Miso Halibut! Finding a parking spot can be difficult. Walk if you can
author: grace c.

description:
First and foremost, Amazing service. The owner, Angela, was very Accommodating is sitting us early in a very busy hour. The restaurant is a family owned restaurant. 

We had the seared scallops, and the crab tempura... amazing. 

My wife and I shared a ribeye steak which was also amazing. I will ask for extra toasted garlic.  Highly recommend and will visit this place again.
author: Oscar B.

description:
If I'm in north beach, I try to come here. It's small, packed, and hard to get a reservation on the weekends, but it is just so so good. I find it's best as a date night/two person spot.

Apps:
- Scallops (usually on the special menu) are a must. 
- Ahi Tuna Tartare is delicious.
- Crab cakes are yum!

Main:
- They do a great steak (also on special menu). 
- Sea bass is always a good choice.
- Specials are always great!
author: Shaelyne J.

description: Food was excellent! Had fried salmon roll for starter. Dipping sauce was spicy Chinese mustard. Dinner was sea bass and husband has halibut which was special of the day. Both dishes were full of flavor. Fish was cooked perfectly. We will be back!
author: Linda F.

description: everything about this place is absolute deliciousness, especially that salmon roll thing
author: Long C.

description:
I want to give The House a better review, I really do but, unfortunately, I can't. The food is wonderful however, we go out to restaurants to be waited on and indulged. I don't want to feel like an imposition when I dine out and when I go to The House that's exactly how I feel. As soon as we sat down they demanded our order which is fine I appreciate the server being on top of asking but can I at least take my coat off first? Then when we did order and receive our food she hovered over our table until we finally got up and left. I never want to feel like my time at a restaurant is rushed and at The House I always feel like I am on borrowed time or that my table has already been promised to another couple as soon as I've sat down. I've given The House countless times to improve their customer service and each time is just the same. 

The food is great and when I'm taking it to go and savoring it at home, it's much more enjoyable!
author: Sarah M.

description:
This place is awesome. Angela the host is always charming and the service is always wonderful. I got the scallops for my appetizer and the pomegranate pork chop was my entree.  Both dishes were amazing! Will definitely come back soon!

PS. Yelpers make a reservation!!
author: Nick M.

description:
The house has got to be one of the best if not the best restaurant in San Francisco. Being pretty low key and in north beach this place is often not considered as one of the best restaurants in SF, but eat here once and you will feel otherwise

We actually showed up without reservations on a Friday evening at 8:30, we were told there would be one hour wait. No problem, we walked down the street for some delicious cocktails and the devils acre. About 45 minutes later we were seated. 

The sever gave us a list of specials which truly all sounded delicious, but since it was our first time we decided to stick with some of the regular menu favorites. We started with the grilled unagi which was simply amazing. The depth of flavors on this appetizer will make you want more. 

The sea bass and the house wasabi noodles with steak were our main courses. If you're like me and like spice make sure you ask for the noodles spicy. The wasabi noodles and the steak did not disappoint. In terms of uniqueness this has to be one of the most unique dishes in all the land but with flavors and spices to back it up. 

The sea bass was cooked perfectly. It does indeed melt in your mouth like many have mentioned. The ginger and garlic flavors and perfectly blended into the fish

Despite being completely packed on a Friday evening, the service was quick and efficient. For the dishes we ordered, i found the portions to be quite generous though i have to admit i do not have the biggest appetite in the world. 

All in all, this is a great restaurant which is on the expensive side but not too much either. We will definitely be back to try the specials
author: Aditya J.

description:
Made a reservation for 8 friends...

7 ordered the Sea Bass.

It's really that good!  Oh, and try their appetizers and other stuff too, the presentation is creative and the taste is memorable.

However, downside is, portions are not huge, so order lots of appetizers...
author: Adele Z.

description:
Good, but personally, I don't think they deserve the 4.5 stars. I had the flank steak with wasabi noodles, sea bass, and deep fried salmon rolls. 

Flank steak & wasabi noodles:
Steak was ridiculously tough..I had to chew each bite for like 5 minutes before giving up and just swallowing a chunk of meat.

Sea bass:
The garlic string beans it comes with are really good. Sea bass had pretty good flavor.

Salmon rolls:
Not bad. A little heavy
author: Jackie J.

description:
I ordered the Wasabi noodles with beef tenderloin and was quite unimpressed. I just thought the meal lacked flavor (hard to believe, I know, given the wasabi, sesame, and beef tenderloin) but unfortunately I just didn't get a distinct theme in the dish. The wasabi didn't deliver enough spice/flavor, the beef tenderloin was under-salted, and the noodles were a little too well done. I hate to bash the place, because I loved the vibe, the interior, and the very friendly/efficient service... but unfortunately the dish I ordered did not deliver in terms of flavor or quantity for the hefty price tag.

I could be convinced to return if someone really wanted to go, but I would not get the wasabi noodles with beef. I'll try something else.
author: Neal C.

description: Crowded and very noisy. Too noisy to stay for dinner, I'm not a fan of loud while eating as it just makes me very uncomfortable. So, admittedly did not eat (although my friends all rave of the food), because I just prefer a less chaotic atmosphere. But it's cute, so if you don't mind loud, you will probably have a fun time. I just did not--no fault of staff or food. Just noise.
author: Elle N M.

description: 3000+ reviews and 4.5 stars... You can't help but think maybe there is a little hype here. Wrong. Boy was I surprised. It really is that good and deserving of its rating. SF knows how to do Asian food right (if you go to the right places) and The House sets the bar high. Yes, you can easily find really good Asian food for cheap but this is Asian fusion that is worth the money. Try it all, the sea bass and pork chop, YUM!
author: Sarah A.

description:
5 star tiny, intimate (get reservations) Asian fusion restaurant in North Beach, SF. 

Their menu constantly rotates, but it's always amazing.
Sea Bass
Cranberry Pork chops
The scallops are also phenomenal.

It's hard to find a dish you won't love. And it won't break the bank. Think $30 an entree, not bad for the great quality.

I'll be back for special occasions.
author: Chuck N.

description:
I had a great dinner with my boyfriend at The House.  We didn't have a reservation so there was a wait but we expected that and went to a couple of great nearby bars while we waited for the call (they even called to tell me they'd be ready in 5 minutes which was nice because I didn't feel rushed, & I had a drink to finish).  
The food was all amazing, but not all very Asian; it is called Asian fusion which I guess is more vague than I would've thought.  Sauces on our entrees were nice & spicy, in a good way but not for the faint of heart.  For our entree we split the Ribeye, which came with mashed potatoes & veggies and was fantastic.  One important note is that the entrees were VERY large in portion size, which I was pleasantly surprised by (definitely worth the price).  I was happy to have more appetizers and be able to split an entree.  I like that the food was high quality without being tiny & fancy & pretentious.  They had lots of specials which sounded great though we ended up sticking to the main menu.
Overall a great experience & I hope to go back soon.
author: Rachel M.

description: Amazing food. We had oysters, muscles and the sea bass was perfect. The ambiance was great. It's small but the food is delicious. Make a reservation if your looking to eat here on a weekend it's always packed. Parking is not good uber on over.
author: Kitty S.

description: The Masami Kobe ribeye, housemade teriyaki, toasted garlic butter is wonderful.  They had a special tonight which I ordered Kobe braised ribs.
author: Peter S.

description: I and my boyfriend come have dinner for my birthday. We order salmons roll, pork chop and ribeye steak with medium cook.  We are so happy at the beginning, until the ribeye steak came. It had super super super burned on top the steak!!!and we try to test it. It test super biter. Never eat any steak horrible like this!!!! Then we asked the sever. The sever told us it is normal!  (So we have to eat!
author: Shirley Z.

description: Had the grilled sea bass which was amazing. My wife had the eel appetizer which she also enjoyed.  However, this restaurant is very small and in town where you do not want to drive your car. Take a taxi or Uber to go to this neighborhood of restaurants
author: Bob K.

description:
I've been wanting to try house for YEARS ever since I heard of their infamous seabass (and I'm a huge lover of seabass).   

Anyway, my friend took me here for my birthday this year and it did not disappoint!  Usually, after wanting something for so long, it becames super hyped up and doesn't live up to my expectations, but IT DID!!  

The place is really small and located near chinatown and little italy.  We arrived and they had the table set up for us.  The waitress was super friendly and recommended us a good wine to pair with our dinner.  We had the mussels which was interesting!  Not what I'm used to because it had an asian flair to it, but the house is an asian fusion restaurant afterall!

Anyway, I already knew ahead of time I was going to order the sea bass with garlic soy noodles and my friend had the kobe steak with wasabi noodles.  Not sure about his dish, but mine was BOMB.  The noodles were chewy and flavored nicely, maybe a little on the salty side (but my tolerance for salty is lower than most).  That SEABASS tho!  Amazing texture, not mushy, not chewy, but just melt in your mouth perfection.  If you come, you must try!  Seafood aficiando or not!  BUT, make sure to make reservations because this place is crackin' even on week nights! 

**GREAT DATE PLACE:  fancy food presentation, nice atmosphere, intimate but well lit, great service, and a wine list that pairs great with the food!**
author: Jae W.

description: I've eaten here a few times and never written a review, but the food is amazing. Really creative blend of flavors... and unique among other restaurants I've been to. Really small space so better for an intimate dinner of 2-4 than larger group. An unexpected gem in North Beach.
author: seema s.

description:
This is easily one of my favorite restaurants in all of San Francisco. My parents love it. My friends love it. I love it. Its just....amazing. Its really hard to infuse Asian cuisine with American food but somehow, 'The House' does it impeccably. I usually put in a reservation before I go here because overall, the restaurant is very small and has limited seating. 

I have gone to The House numerous times but the first time I went, I ordered the Warm Wasabi Noodles with steak and its was AMAZING...Oh god.... Although I thought they could have given you more in terms of amount, the food hits you later because some of the dishes are quite rich. 

Salmon rolls: Amazing. I usually don't like salmon because its quite dry but they made the rolls impeccably well. 

Halibut in Coconut Red Curry: Tasteful, flavorful and well portioned. 

If you want to go somewhere nice but not like fine dining-nice, then this is the place to go. Seriously, like go...

Prices: If you go HAM and order drinks and get seafood, it will come down to 50 per person. But it all depends on what you order. I love this place and will be coming back for more.
author: Eileen W.

description:
I was so excited to try this place after reading so many awesome reviews on yelp. I ordered the wasabi noodles-- after seeing picture after picture on yelp, my choice was made. It seemed like the best idea, after all the pictures alone were enough to make my mouth water. When I took my first bite, with the highest of expectations, I suddenly found myself disappointed. The best way to describe the dish would be to mix wasabi and soy sauce together, put it on some noodles, and add some reaaally chewy steak-- not impressed. 

The service however, was impeccable--very friendly and efficient. I would definitely make a trip to the house again to try something else on the menu.
author: Sydney Y.

description:
Review for dinner. 

Fried Salmon Rolls - 5/5 A must try!
Wasabi House Noodles - 3/5
