There was nothing special about this place. Food presentation was very nice and impressive but the taste wasn't so much. We had the deep fried salmon, it was very dry and tasteless. 
We had the house noodles and they were very oily and  didn't have any flavor. 
We also had the steak and that was also very oily and flavorless.
We also had the sea bass and again it was very tasteless.

Overall one thing that they were consistent with was the flavorless and oily dishes.

As far as service I tried to make reservations multiple time and the person who answer the phone had no phone skills.. She was very rude..
Oh we couldn't make any reservations, in addition to being rude she would not give us any options.. needless to say, i refused to call back after talking to the rude lady few times and instead we just showed up..
And we were seated right away.. Go figure.. I guess you shouldn't bother to make reservations..

Continue with the food, after the tasteless meal we decided to eat some  desserts.. We had everything on the dessert menu as we were desperately hoping for some good taste.. Wrooonggg again! And once again they were consistent TASTELESS!!!! 

As far as the service, there was nothing special.. Servers were more like order takers, I think you get more attention through the fast food drive through order takers than servers at the house.,


Overall this place was a huge disappointment.. I would not recommend it to anyone.. Not worth your time, money and   Most importantly not good for the tummy..
author: Seda M.

description:
Food was good as expected. 

I took out one star for their policy not sitting people before all parties arrive. 
I mean we also have to eat and leave soon, we are not going to take any longer time to finish our meal because one of us is being late. These people just don't give a damn about people's experience. Seriously what do they gain from this policy? Just rude.

...and when the last person just arrived they gave it away and we had to wait since then.
author: Esther L.

description: I see my friends check in here often on FB so I decided to give it a try! The place was packed and the wait was long but it was worth it! Do yourself a favor and get the pomegranate pork-chop! Very unique fusion of flavors! I also got the fried salmon roll and grilled sea bass that were also very good.
author: Blaine S.

description: Recommend the Grilled Sea Bass with garlic ginger soy (though the soy was not necessary as the flavor of the fish was perfect on its own) and the Mango Tapioca (this was creamy but light and refreshing). I was not too wild about the wasabi or garlic noodles. They were just okay and good to complement the main course. Bathroom was big and clean.
author: Reena C.

description: AMAZING DINNER!!! The Grilled Seabass was unreal and the garlic noodles it came with were life changing. Yes... I did just call noodles life changing. We also got the ahi appetizer which was a bit spicy/ wasabi-isn for me tasting but my boyfriend enjoyed it. He loved the grilled sirloin too but agreed that my dish was better. The green bean tempura was excellent as well! I would recommend this to anyone and everyone visiting SF!
author: Megan W.

description: Read the Yelp reviews and finally decided to try it and see what the hype was about. After reading all the reviews I have tried the grill sea bass fish. It was very moist and tender and juicy serve with the long beans and garlic noodles for the price of 26 bucks. I would totally come back again for this fish. When I first arrived at 5:20 p.m. There was a line waiting for it to open at 5:30 p.m. And then I only waited for 5 minutes before I got seated and accordingly they were trying to upsell me be daily specials but I already knew what I wanted so I ordered that right away and the food came out about 10 mins.  within next 10 minutes I observe the place and it was packed because people made reservations or walkins. I did the walk ins because it was just a party of one. The service was good and fast and kept on checking my water.
author: Alex T.

description:
I've heard so much amazing things about this restaurant. I had a reservation for 3 on a Monday at 7:30 for my sister's birthday. We got lucky and found parking right outside. YAAAAY! This never happens! It's going to be a great day!!

It's about 7:20 when we walk in and see a server has seated a party of 3. These people have clearly just walked in, too. After the server has seated that party, he comes over, not to greet us but to stare at us, waiting for us to say something to him. OK. I tell him we have a reservation for 730 which he then looks upset because he clearly messed up and gave away our table. Were we late? No. He quickly walks away, leaving my party confused... do we follow him or is he coming back...? Excuuuuuse me? Hello? Nope. Not coming back. So we walked up to another server (I guess they don't have hosts/hostesses) at the counter and tell them we have a reservation at 730. She too looks a bit distraught seeing that all the tables were taken up and tries to cover up with the usual "ballpark" waiting time. We were told 15 min. Hungry and slightly peeved, we had nothing else to do but stand by the door, that opened every two minutes and threatened to hit me every time, and wait. During this time, more people came in to be "greeted" by the rude/mute server that clearly hated his job. 

To speed this up, we were seated at 7:45. 25 minutes after we arrived, 15 min after our reservation. I know what you're thinking, "wow, you can't wait 25 minutes? Other people wait hours!" The place was filled but not packed out the door. We were the only ones waiting. I made a reservation ahead of time, got there early, our table was still given away before we arrived, and then had to wait an extra 25 minutes after dealing with an awkwardly rude unapologetic server. *grumble*

SO LETS EAT THEN.

The mussels ($11) seemed like they were picked from the bottom of the barrel and were just babies. aka no meat! Flavors were delicious though, wished we had bread to soak up the sauce.

Wasabi Noodles with Flatiron Steak ($18) was pretty good. Cooked perfectly. Some wasabi tickled up my nose. Nothing I can't handle!

Angus Ribeye Steak ($26) was delicious, as was everything else on the plate.

Grilled Sea Bass ($26) had great flavors. Wish there was a larger portion of the fish! It came with garlic noodles but tasted more salty than garlicky. Would've preferred rice at that point.


One last complaint. Why is it that our server(s) couldn't fill our waters up to the top? Each time it was filled, it would be either half full or slightly above the half line. I didn't realize there was a shortage of tap water in San Francisco... 


All in all, food is great and deserves all 5 stars, however, service is in need of improvement.
author: Arleen F.

description: Two friends and I stumbled upon this place while wondering on the edges of Chinatown and North Beach. The place is small and we were asked if we had a reservation  We did not but they quickly found a table for us. We ordered the fried salmon appetizer to share.  It was so good. Perfectly cooked with a spicy dipping sauce   I had the octopus and it was the best I've had. My friends had an unagi avocado sandwich and a tuna BLT they were very happy. A light salad came with the sandwiches  nice dressing.
author: Sue A.

description:
Reservations would probably be useful as the space is small and was crowded (not surprising on a Saturday night). The decor was tasteful. The staff clearly take their food seriously and are proud of what they offer.  

To start, we ordered the sashimi sampler (a special at the time).  The selection of fish was high quality and perfect for sharing.  I went with the sea bass as my entree. It was served a little blackened on the outside and tender on the inside. A ginger and garlic soy sauce accompanied the dish and complemented the fish boldly. This was served along side a saucy but delicious udon noodle preparation.  I can't recall the name of my beer, but it was a Japanese IPA that went down smoothly.  The dessert offerings were straightforward.  We decided on the apple pie with vanilla ice cream. No surprises, but delicious nonetheless.
author: Dana C.

description:
This is such a little restaurant tucked away in a little section of Grant Ave. that I did not expect the flavors to be so big and bold.  We had a shittake mushroom soup with truffle oil, seared toro tuna salad, Chilean sea bass, and a braised pork shoulder.  I loved most of the dishes, especially the two appetizers.  The Chilean sea bass is seared really well, locking in all the flavors of this fish.  The side of green beans and noodles it came with were mediocre though -- kind of like dressed up Chinese food a la P.F. Chang's.  The braised pork shoulder had a piece of crispy skin fried separately and placed on top of the pork meat, which I loved chewing on.  The soy broth it came with was so flavorful that I drank it all up.

The House has their food presentation down.  Every dish was plated in an artful way.  Lots of people take photos of their food here...so bring your camera if you are one of those people who post instant photos to Facebook everywhere they go.

1 star off: Desserts need more work and creativity.  The chocolate truffle cake just tasted like any frozen chocolate cake -- or a la P.F. Chang's as well.
author: Ally W.

description:
The wasabi noodles with salmon is delicious and addictive. Service can be better with the servers being more attentive and friendly.

Overall experience good, just be prepared for minimal parking.
author: Stefanie K.

description:
Our party of 4 ordered almost every dish on the menu just to taste. We enjoyed almost everything - that is hard to do but mission accomplished at The House! 

My favorites were:

Salmon Roll
Tuna Tartare
Garlic Noodles AND Wasabi Noodles
Black Cod (I'll be dreaming about this dish)

The reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars is the actual restaurant is on the smaller side and no decorating effort was put into it at all. 

Food - LOVE, LOVE,LOVE
author: quynh n.

description:
I came here on the recommendation of many family members because they swore that it was AMAZING! So maybe because I just heard people rave and rave about it, that I felt that my dining experience was so-so. The boyfriend and I came here for a special occasion and after a 2 hour drive, we were super hungry. For a Monday night, the restaurant was still super packed and I saw a line form as we got seated. However, the seating was HORRENDOUS. We sat so close to our neighbors that I could literally reach over and borrow their napkin, if need be. I didn't like how neighbors could hear our conversation and vice versa. 

I give the restaurant four stars based on the food. Granted, we were early for our reservations so we got a little buzzed at the place next door. So by the time we ate our food, I was eating solely for the fact that I was drinking on an empty stomach. I didn't even notice that the flat iron steak with wasabi noodles were rare when I ordered it medium. After a few bites I noticed that the beef was too red, but felt bad for asking them to remake it when I already ate almost half. We also ordered the calamari appetizer which had an amazing slaw on it. The slaw was the boyfriend's favorite and he couldn't get enough of it. However, the calamari was so-so. The portions were smaller than I expected and I didn't taste too much flavor to it. The bf ordered the sea bass, which was highly recommended by the family, and it was super tender and the green beans made the dish very bright. Overall, I think we should have switched plates because the sea bass was too boring for him and the wasabi noodles were too heavy and spicy for me. 

A big downside was how the servers bend down SUPER low to tell you the specials. The restaurant is soooo filled with close tables that it was hard to hear your server. Not to mention how uncomfortable they look bending down for such a long period of time. And let me tell you, when they tell you their specials it is SUPER LONG. I really REALLY REALLY wished that they wrote down their specials on a small menu because I couldn't hear our server and felt like I would've liked something better on that menu! I didn't want to make her repeat all the specials because I saw that she was in a big hurry to greet other tables. Sad to miss out, but hopefully I will come back and try more dishes!
author: Anh Thu P.

description:
This place is delish! Came here for dinner on a Saturday night. Please make sure you make reservations, its a really small place and you would definitely have to wait otherwise. It was cold outside and people were huddling up next to the small entrance.

Once we sat down we were greeted with a little plate of pickled cucumbers. Our waitress let us know the specials of the day and got to look over the menu, which doesn't have at on of options but so many things sounded tasty. We had the fried salmon roll and grilled calamari (special) for apps. The calamari was perfect - not over cooked and chewy at all. It came with a tangy tomato sauce. The salmon roll was mostly cooked all the way. It looks like they just diagonally sliced the whole roll so pretty big serving. The sauce was great and so was the cabbage slaw that came with.

I ended up ordering the special which was a miso black cod that came with a California and avocado roll. Again sliced diagonally length wise. The rolls were laid on top of the miso black code which was just so flaky and tender and delish! Below that was some broccoli which I thought was a bit too bitter for me.

One of my friends had the wasabi noodles with flat iron steak which I had a taste of. The noodles were great! They used udon type noodles (a fav of mine) and it was mixed in a sauce that had a taste of wasabi but not the overpowering spice of it! 

Yumm all around! Food came out of the kitchen pretty fast, and the intimate setting was really nice. You could actually hear the convo you were having - loved this place.
author: Lucy F.

description: A very good place in San Francisco. I like to go there with my wife. Nice food, nice service. The only minus, we were waiting too much. But in general recommend this place for everyone.
author: Robert M.

description:
Finally convinced my bf to bring me here for my 24th birthday. I've been dying to try the seabass as everyone raved about it so much. We arrived at 6:30pm on a Wednesday and tables were just clearing up as we arrived, even though we had reservations. 

I ordered the seabass with wasabi noodles while my bf order the steak. My seabass was incredibly juicy yet crispy. The wasabi noodles were  flavorful but not pungent as you would expect from wasabi. The service was absolutely attentive and the servers were extremely friendly. 

Definitely a must try if you're ever in the city, and try to make reservations for dinner!
author: Connie C.

description:
Why am I leaving a 5 star review for a restaurant with thousands of 5 star reviews? Because OH MY NOM. It is absolutely amazing. 

I had my second magical dinner last night with the same crew as the 1st magical dinner (in April) and once again, we were floored by the flavors, creativity, and pure awesomeness.

Both dinners combined , we had:

Apps:
grilled calamari special 
deep fried chicken livers
chive and shrimp dumplings
fried salmon roll (the only thing I didn't absolutely love)
tuna tartare


Entrees:
the famous seabass
flat iron angus steak with wasabi noodles (my brother had it both times)
kobe beef special 
halibut special
angus flatiron steak

Everything was delectable, cooked to perfection,  and the service was perfect. 

Mm!
author: Yelena E.

description:
Great services and great food! I recommend only a party of 2. This place is small and it will take longer if u have 3 or 4 ppl. We had 3, our wait was about almost an hour. I will be returning!

Deep Fried Salmon Egg rolls-  this dish was very good! It is an appetizer and comes with some kind of wasabi sauce for you to dip your egg rolls in. 

Clams steam in shrimp infused broth..??? Something like that. It was the special of the day. Actually it might of been mussels.- very bland and boring. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Sea Bass with garlic noodles( u can get rice instead)- very delicious and flavorful. The sea bass was tasty and it came with some ginger soy sauce which was tastier. I guess your suppose to dip it in the sauce. Either way it was good with it or without it. 

Another special of the day was some kind of fish in a coconut curry sauce- I think it was halibut ?? Cant remember but it was very good as well. 

My favorite would be the Sea Bass dish and Deep fried Salmon Egg rolls!!
author: Jangalina J.

description: Love their food, service, and atmosphere here  Aroi makkkk  server're very nice. Cant wait to come back here again.
author: Hong L.

description:
Great food, fun atmosphere, make a reservation... Seriously, they are really good and tiny, we had a reservation and we still had to wait like 5-10 minutes, there was a couple without one that said they had been waiting 1.5 hours when we got there and still didn't get seated until about 15 minutes after we did.

I think everything we ordered was from the specials and not the menu. 

We got:
Curry clams appetizer - great flavor, wish there was more bread to sop up all the delicious curry sauce.
Scallop appetizer - perfectly cooked, good sauce, I think there was some caviar on top too?
Miso Cod - What can I say, it was fantastic.
Black Truffle Kobe skirt stake - Just enough truffle flavor to enhance things but not in your face or oily, also an awesome dish.

For dessert we got a tapioca thing (I no longer remember what they called it specifically) which was really good, and the coconut passion fruit creme brûlée. Flavored creme brûlées tend to always be something of a let down for me. I like standard creme brûlée but it is pretty much always the same, even when it is supposedly some flavor. This one was different though because the passion fruit was a sweet sauce they put on top so you actually got a ton of that flavor mixed in, definitely enjoyed it!
author: Ely L.

description:
With 1800 near-perfect reviews - you can't go wrong.  I am pretty sure that restaurants like this one in SF is the reason why Yelp was started.

This place doesn't look like anything special.  But let me just say that as a Yelp Elite for the past two years and having eaten more than my fair share of awesome meals in my 43 years (so far) on This Planet, I ate one of the best meals (top 10) I have ever eaten.

It is not big, maybe 15 tables with seating for 40 people.  The wait started at 7pm when we walked by on our way to a bar up the street.  There are going to be people who write bad reviews about this place based on the fact that seating is somewhat chaotic.  Our group of 6 walked in and were seated before a couple who were waiting before us.  This would be understandable except we sat a 4-top with two extra seats on the ends and any other restaurant would have seated a couple at it.

We started with an appetizer of unagi over wasabi rice - Incredible!  And albacore (tuna) tartar that was the best sushi-grade I have ever tasted.

I had the Sea Bass - the combination of fish, SAUCE on the side, rice noodles and green beans was awesome.  One of the specials was prawns on a mushroom risotto. The steak on noodles was equally good. 

Did I mention the amazing service!? Nothing was bad about the meal.  I took five of my co-workers here and every one of them thought it was equally as good.  I think I may get a promotion out of it!
author: Marc M.

description:
If you are the manager - owner or the short lady with long salt n pepper hair, please read.

I would give them A+ for their creativity, B+ for the execution of their dishes, B for the over all service and D for the manager - owner(the short lady with long hair). 
After reading all the rave reviews, I had to check it out myself. I was the first to arrive when they just opened. 

The manager(short lady with long hair) open the door without any greeting. After I was seated, she gave me a very forced smile. I'm not trying to be mean, but she was wearing a sleeveless blouse, her hair was not tied up, and all loose, and she was wearing  sneakers. While her servers were all professionally dressed, and had their hair nicely done. I have to ask, if she demand her staff to dress and look professionally, why she is not leading by example? She looked like she just rolled out of bed, and worked in a fobish, 99 cents Chinese fast food place. 
Her manner, she was icy cold. Simple as that. Why was she icy cold? who knows? After all the rave reviews, I would assume that she would be jumping up and down with joy, but she was icy cold to most of her customers. 

Does this place deserve all the raves, not really, but it's not bad at all. 

Would I go back? Hmmmmm, not so sure....
author: Sergio L Y.

description: It's a cute little corner restaurant with very attentive staffs. It gets crowded so do expect a wait. I highly recommend their wasabi noodles and pork chop. I think the price is decent because you can't get those taste anywhere. The flavored prom chop goes very well with the wasabi noodles. Thumps up!
author: Hong T.

description:
I don't what it is, but I REALLY like this place.  Possible reasons:

1. I went here with a friend who I normally eat at 3 star places with.  He chose the restaurant, so I was expecting something 3 stars.  Low expectations = easy to blow away my expectations?
2. Really cute, sleek wood interior.  Small space.  Feels cozy like a home. 
3.  Each placemat on the table has a tiny house stamp!!  Like a little house is cut into your placemat.  I thought it was really cute.  

Ok, onto the more substantive stuff.  We ordered the specials of the day for nearly everything.  The day we went the appetizer special was seared scallops.  WOW!  Really divine scallops.  I don't even know how they cooked them, but they were better than the scallops I had at Spruce ( imagine that!).  When the first bite exceeded what I had tasted at Spruce, I knew that I was in for something spectacular.  At times like this I wish I had gone to culinary school so that I could describe the food better....but I didn't so I can't.  The scallops were amazing though.  

For the entree, we ordered the 1) Grilled ahi tuna with spicy mustard aioli and 2) Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy.   Both dishes get an A+ for presentation.  

I am terrible with spicy food, so I was a bit nervous about the ahi....it would've been awful if it was too spicy for me to enjoy.  But, the ahi wasn't spicy at all - it just had a lovely mustard aioli flavor to it.  The ahi was served with white rice and some leafy greens (maybe bak choy?) that had been stirred in the fry pan.  The leaves were a bit too salty for my taste, but complimented the ahi nicely since the ahi did not have a lot of flavor on its own.  The ahi quality was excellent.  

The sea bass just melts in your mouth.  It is served with thick noodles and some greens.  The fish comes with a good garlic gingery dipping sauce....the sauce was great.  I found myself even dipping the ahi in it.  

For dessert, we got the special of the day.  Peach and nectarine pie with vanilla icecream.  Holy $jsfs.  Move over Marie Callendars!  The pie was served warm....perfect crust thickness, fresh peaches and nectarines, perfect sweetness.  

I was blown away the whole meal.  I really liked that the ambiance wasn't over-the-top fancy (I hate over-the-top fancy), but yet the quality was still very high.   The restaurant itself is small so I can imagine that there's a huge line on the weekends.  Highly recommend!
author: Naomi P.

description: This was our favorite restaurant during our trip to San  Francisco, great food, amazing and efficient service.
author: Rodrigo S.

description:
The best restaurant in this price range in San Francisco.

Seriously, this blend of Asian fusion with modern American, the decor, a small and exciting atmosphere, and most of all the food--the food!  Where to begin:

- Soft shell crab. 10/10 for taste, 12/10 for presentation
- The ahi tuna tartare: YES. Great flavor combination.
- Ribeye steak: grilled to perfection, with the tang of teriyaki and the savory umami of their homemade garlic butter. Perfect every time

Plus, the waiters introduce the dishes so you know more about the complexity that comes with each bite.

I will return many times over. Great experience!
author: Foodie B.

description:
I took my fiancé here for his birthday two years ago. I forgot what we ordered since it's been awhile, but I remembered the food being good (just a little salty for me that day). It's a very small restaurant and the service was good. We ordered two appetizers, 2 entrees, a dessert and 2 drinks and the bill was $110, what a steal for great food!!! 

I would come back to try other dishes and recommend it to my friends.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
When I read all the reviews, I had pretty high expectations for The House, but I didn't think it was going to be blow-my-mind-amazing, well I was wrong. Hands down best food I've eaten in SF (so far at least)!

Service, food, and presentation were all impeccable. The only thing area for improvement would probably be to get a larger space. The tables are pretty close together so it gets a bit cramped. Make sure to make reservations! I came on a Wednesday night, so reservations were easy to make, but if you're coming on a Fri/Sat, be ready to wait for a bit.

We ordered:
- seared scallops
- ahi tuna tartar
- pork chop
- black cod
- chocolate pecan pie
- creme brulee

Total = $96.

I don't like scallops or cod, but the way the House made it changed my mind. I wish i tried the seabass, after hearing all these raving reviews about it, but I guess that will have to wait till next time. The pork chop was literally falling off the bone and pretty much melted in my mouth, which is rare because pork is a bit hard to cook to get it that tender.

Both desserts were good, but I enjoyed the creme brulee the most. It came with some pomegranate sauce? and the top layer was baked to a perfect crisp.

Overall, I was very impressed by every aspect of this restaurant. House, be expecting me back again soon!
author: Angela K.

description:
Came here on a Saturday 530p.  30min wait time.  They will take down your phone and call you so you don't have to stand there waiting.  There really isn't a waiting spot other than outside.  

Food was great.  It's pricey but worth it. Their pork tenderloin is super tender. Wasabi noodles was delicious

The vibe is kinda noisy. Place is small and table space is tight. You can hear conversations around the whole joint. So if you want privacy. This isn't the spot.

This spot is for socializing loudly with great food.
author: Adam L.

description:
Small and crowded. Line is long.

I like the food and the quality of service here. 

Salmon roll is fantastic. Wasabi noodle is delicious. Scallop is just exceptional. Check out their special menus.
author: Khoa N.

description:
Yummo!!! I work a block away from this place, and have heard nothing but amazing things, so I thought I'd try it for myself. 

We had the sea bass and garlic noodles as well as mushroom risotto. Both wonderfulll, with amazing sauces,which I'm all about. 

This place is super small and a reservation is basically mandatory, and very hard to come by on weekends during dinner time. But totally worth it! Service was nice as well, they know how to deal with a huge crowd in a tiny space.
author: Zahra K.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in SF-- pretty much every special occasion dinner happens here for me. 

Wait is always forever long, and I wouldn't recommend for a big group-- it's very, very small. 

Found my favorite wine here, and am always happily surprised by their dinner specials. 

Can get pricey quickly, but worth it. 

Thank you for existing, The House; you're the best of the best.
author: Caitlyn D.

description: I came here the Saturday before Mother's Day so that could be the reason I'm giving this place 3 stars (ok, it's more of a 3.5). The food and presentation was amazing and did not disappoint, but the service and atmosphere left me wishing for more. We made reservations, but since it was so crowded that Saturday, we didn't get seated til 20 minutes after our reservation time. Since the place is so small and crowded we end up squeezing 6 people in a table fit for 4. Each dish came out in a rush and I felt I didn't have any time to enjoy each course. The seafood was really delicious and I'm definitely willing to give this place another try, but probably will be coming with a smaller party.
author: Cindy A.

description: Amazing food! They are consistently good. I come few times per month and it is always top quality. Great service, great food, keep it up!
author: Mary S.

description:
A hidden gem in North Beach, does Asian fusion really well.

Dishes to try: blue lake bean tempura, deep-fried salmon roll, warm wasabi house noodles, sesame soy glazed salmon, grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy.

And ask about their specials!
author: Jarlin S.

description:
I officially dub 'The House' as my new favorite Asian Fusion place. 

My amazing boyfriend catered to my obsession with Asian Fusion by taking us here for our monthiversary!

Our reservation was for 7:30 and we were seated right away when we walked in. For drinks, I had two glasses of their Sauvignon Blanc and he had two glasses of the Chimay beer. Don't know what Chimay beer is? Don't worry, I googled it for you. It's a Trappist beer. Trappist beer is beer that is brewed in a Trappist Monastery under the control and responsibility of monks. Revenue goes to social service. It's a Belgian beer. I tasted it and thought it was pretty damn delicious! Very easy to drink and got Vincent buzzed after just one hehehe. Our drinks were all $8 each and totally worth it. 

We ordred two appetizers to start. First, we ordered the selected oysters on the half shell with spicy cilantro mignonette. Yes, they were raw. Then, we ordered the deep-fried salmon roll with chinese hot mustard. Your mouth should be watering right about...now!

The oysters were SO GOOD. I've never had such amazing oysters. They were very fresh and the sauce had a nice kick to it. The deep-fried salmon roll sounded so simple, which it was, but it was also jam packed with flavor! The chinese hot mustard sauce was amazing. I had to drench my salmon roll in it. Both appetizers blew my mind. I think that it is absolutely imperative to use great quantities of both sauces when eating these appetizers because they really take the dishes to another level.

As for the entrees, we ordered the warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak and the grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy. We had the steak cooked medium and it came out perfectly. The steak was tender and delicious. I really liked the wasabi house noodles as well. You could definitely taste that wasabi flavor, but it didn't overpower the dish by any means. There were also some cabbage on the side that were really well seasoned. I don't even really like veggies, but I loved whatever they put on that plate. The sea bass was AMAZING! It was cooked so well. I like sea bass because it's got this buttery flavor to it. That dish also came with some noodles as well as snap peas. The dish also came with a sauce similar to soy sauce, except a little bit thicker. Salty and delicious!

I was so impressed by this place. The food was out of this world and service was great. Even though it was crowded, we were checked on consistently throughout the night. It couldn't have been better. It's definitely on the pricey side, but it's so amazing. I really really really really hope my boyfriend takes me back here soon! I really hope he's reading this because I AM ALREADY FIENDING!
author: Enza P.

description:
Came in here last week and was impressed. Put this on the shortlist of spots to hit up while in San Francisco if you're into community food, creative grub and solid atmopshere. I won't bore you with me being impressed by the kamachi, oysters & the mussels while thinking the crabcakes were ho-hum, but I will say this:

"The House has done for sea bass what nobu has done for black cod." Ridiculously good.

Second Visit in 2016 was a bit different:
 - Softshell Crab - average
 - Japanese Dayboat Scallop - A+
 - Octopus - huge miss
 - Ahi Tartare - A
 - Cod - good, but regret not getting the Sea Bass
 - Probably will be back since they have Hitachino White
author: Jeff F.

description:
YUMMM, I'm still thinking about the food I had for lunch today. Started off with the $10 (only during lunch) steamed mussels with garlic infused broth http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZoZjbOYR-apY8XvommlNUA?select=3HRoWg2wYmn-8ZEEC63QJQ. The mussels were on the small side but the broth was so good. I licked the bowl clean until it was white, just kidding but I would have if I was at home. 

Then for entrees, we had $11 warm wasabi house noodles with grilled salmon http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZoZjbOYR-apY8XvommlNUA?select=64qRzryTLOw6OeIFM6bKdQ and $10 curry noodles with grilled chicken http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZoZjbOYR-apY8XvommlNUA?select=0FjC3-2L44tmrNF_StnrfA. The wasabi noodles were good at the first bite because I didn't taste the wasabi but then I ate from another part of the bowl then I tasted a hint of wasabi blehh. Bf likes this one but I don't. He's had this before so I guess you can say this is his usual. I had the curry noodles, now that was DELISH!!! Bits of corn, stringed potatoes?, lots of curry sauce (just the way I like it uh huh uh huh), noodles, and chicken yummm I wish I could make this myself, I would eat it all the time. The only reason I knocked down a star are for the grilled salmon & grilled chicken. It tasted too burnt and cancer-ish. Other than that burnt taste, the rest of the food was good like DANGGG  I have to come back here good.

I think I can only come here during lunch any day Monday-Saturday  because their prices are reasonable, dinner prices are crazy $$$.
author: Kylie L.

description:
With almost 2000 reviews I am pretty hesitant about writing a review BUT I figured since I enjoyed this place so much I should. Came here with my parents and my cousin last month. We were visiting from LA and was looking for something different to eat since we wanted to try a new place than our usual places that we would go to when we are in San Francisco. So after going through Yelp we decided to go to The House since it was walking distance from our motel. 

We walked in and it took awhile for someone to acknowledge us. When they did they told us that there would be an hour wait since they were all booked and that they would call us when they had a table. 15 mins later they called us to tell us someone had not shown up for their table so they were going to let us have the table. 

When we came back we were seated right away. Inside is really small and you can kind of hear the conversation at the table next to you. 

They offer a lot of different specials for the night there was something for each course and we took advantaged and ordered most of them. 

For an appetizer we ordered the grilled calamari. This dish was okay it didn't amaze me. 

I ordered one of the specials of the night scallop and orzo pasta. This was AMAZING!! The scallops was cooked perfectly and mixed with the orzo pasta it was a nice smooth flavor. Around the outside of the bowl they had some spicy oil so every now and then I will mix it with the bite I was having so it can give it that kick. I took a picture of it but my flash was acting up (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZoZjbOYR-apY8XvommlNUA?select=9ZvjcoppLsKn71mIYrlwtg) 

My cousin got the other special of the night Black Cod with California Rolls. Their rolls are not cut like traditional cut rolls this one cut down the middle leaving you two long pieces of California rolls. In addition they didn't use imitation crab meat but actually crab meat so that was a plus. The fish itself was very moist and the sauce with it accompanied it very well. 

My parents got the popular dishes that The House offers, one the grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy and the Angus rib eye steak, house made teriyaki, toasted garlic better. Both dishes were very good and lived up to the hype they have been getting with these dishes. 

Finally we ended up the night by getting the chocolate cream pie and the special Japanese pumpkin cheesecake. Personally, I really enjoyed the Japanese pumpkin cheesecake more, but that may be because I am not a chocolate person. The cheesecake was warm and had a scoop of ice cream on top and the best part is that it wasn't too sweet. 

Oh and we ordered the Almond cookies to go because we saw some other people ordering it. It wasn't the traditional type of almond cookie this one was more like a butter cookie with a giant kick of almond. I enjoyed being able to take this home and enjoying at my own pace.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
My new favorite restaurant in SF. 

Starters:
Fried Salmon
Poke - (Orgasm in your mouth)
Scallops 

Entrees:
Sea Bass - I don't usually like fish that much but this was better than all of the other meals (and they were fantastic). It melted in your mouth. 

Wasabi Noodles and Steak - The steak was cooked to perfection and the noodles were amazing. 

Desserts: - I don't have a sweet tooth and these were ungodly good.
Coconut Creme Brûlée
Japanese Pumpkin Pie
author: Jessie L.

description: A bit cramped for me, but the food was great! Soft Shell crab, scallops, and the SEABASS! OH THE SEABASS! Heavenly! Presentation was beautiful too! Service needs some work, but overall a nice place.
author: Nicole N.

description:
Wonderful dining experience. Everything we ordered tasted great! The service was really nice too.

Make Reservations. The place is smaller than we expected.

For some restaurants, what you order might come out better than what other people recommend, but for the House, go with recommendations on Yelp!

What we ordered:
Appetizer: (favorite to least favorite)
1. Scallop (today's special) [strongly recommend]
2. Fried Salmon Roll [strongly recommend]
3. Sashimi (today's special)
4. BBQ oyster (today's special)

Main course:
1. Pork Chop [strongly recommend]
2. Salmon King

WILL COME BACK FOR SURE!
author: Sally W.

description:
Came here last night for the first time to have dinner with some good friends. I am simply blown away.

Ahi Tuna Tartare is so freaking delicious.

Porkchop was so tender and flavorful. 

SEA BASS is a MUST. Melts in your mouth GOOD! 

There are two downsides to this place. Its VERY small and crowded. You are basically bumping elbows with the table next to you. Parking is horrible. If you ever go to SF, you know that parking is a total b*tch. Make reservations and come EARLY to find parking. There are also parking garages around.

Besides that, I highly recommend this place. I already want to go back!
author: Vivian T.

description: I finally had the chance to dine at this place and it was amazing! We started off with the oysters which came with this spicy sauce which was so good we kept the leftovers to use on our other dishes. For our entree we ordered the sea bass and the flat iron steak, and they were both were great. Service was outstanding, very attentive and never had to ask for anyone for anything. Will certainly return to try their other dishes.
author: Matthew L.

description:
I would have given this place a 5 star rating, but after the sub par service, I had to bump it down a star.

The waitress took over 15 mins before even getting our drink ordered, let alone greet us at the table. For a restaurant of this caliber and price, I don't think that was acceptable. 

The food was great. We ordered the crab cakes and the tuna tartare to start. I think they over did it a bit with the wasabi though. Some bites were tough to eat because of the wasabi kick to my nose. Other than that, the flavors all seemed to merry well. 

They ran out or skirt streak, so I got the porkchop with wasabi noodles. The meat was a perfect medium and the noodles had a lot of flavor. My girlfriend got the steak which I had to admit tasted better than my porkchop. 

I would come here again because of the food. I don't except the service to be this bad again.
author: Brian C.

description:
Probably one of the best Asian Fusions I've EVER had.

I was treated out to this lovely restaurant for our 7 year anniversary at this small "house" but hoppin' place! We had reservations for 7pm and called to informed them that we would be a few minutes late. They told us they were only going to hold it for ten minutes max. I'm glad they kept their word unlike many restaurants that give it away regardless and you would still have to wait!

We were seated right away, by the window. Best seat in my opinion! And quickly read our specials of the day.

We ordered:
1) Soft shell crab with spicy soba noodles (their special of the night)
2) Ahi tuna tartare with roasted nori chips
3) Warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak (my bf swapped for NY steak, DEFINITE MUST!)
4) Angus ribeye steak, housemade teriyaki, toasted garlic butter

1) Crab was a-ok, however presentation was nice. Spicy soba noodles had a nice balance of sweet/spicy.
2) MMM, ahi tuna was fresh and tangy! The chips add a nice crunch to the tender fish.
3) The NY steak just melts in your mouth, the noodles had a strong but not overpowering wasabi taste.
4) MAN, I LOVED my Angus ribeye steak. I proudly devoured it! Tender, perfect medium rare, topped with crispy basil and garlic. The mash potatoes were such a delight. It was also nicely paired with the gai-lan veggie.

I think one of the reasons that THE HOUSE is so successful is that they have both nice textures and a WOW factor in their flavors. Many restaurants lack one or the other, at times both. PLUS, their portions & prices are awesome!

Cheers to The HOUSE! You guys just raised the bar for Asian Fusion!
author: Karen L.

description: So loud but so yummy! Every dish i have had here did not disappoint. The salmon tartare and and sea bass is always great!
author: Agent F.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants of all time. Yes. Really!

I have been here a number of times and I am not a local. Every time I end up in San Fran I make it a point to dine here.

The dishes here are full of fresh, high quality ingredients. I have never been disappointed with the food here. I have never ordered any of the typical main dishes on the menu... I have always ordered whatever the special was. I recall a skate fish filet with truffle mushroom sauce and roasted vegetables. It looked beautiful and it tasted incredible. Another dish I remember was the grouper. Wow! The fish was so tender and flavorful! 

Other dishes I have had the opportunity to nibble on are the pork chop, the soft shell crab with noodles, and the fried salmon roll. Everything I have had here has been exquisitely prepared! So many amazing flavors - so fresh! All of the dishes here are a work of art for the eyes and taste buds to feast on. 

The customer service is rather inconsistent... sometimes it's perfection. Other times it's unfriendly and uninterested. For that reason this review teeters on the edge of 4 starts, but the out of this world food tips the scales in their favor.

If you are looking for a romantic, quiet, place with an amazing wait staff, you might want to look elsewhere. However, if you are ready for uniquely delicious and visually appealing Asian inspired dishes, I highly recommend this place. I also recommend you make reservations - this place is rather small and the tables fill up fast for dinner.
author: Nina R.

description:
My "Foodie" son suggested we try out "The House" based upon the rave reviews. Well, the public was right on target with this restaurant. Everything from the sweet pickles to the wasabi noodles with chicken, to the grilled pork chop and sake, was absolutely delicious. The waitress was helpful and the service was quick. The cliental was a mixture of locals and food crazed tourists.

My negative criticism has to do with the restaurant's physical space. It was small, crowded, and we were seated at the worst possible table: adjacent to the bathroom and directly across the tiny isle to the kitchen. Our area was dimly lit and very noisy.
author: S R.

description:
I'm pretty sure I won't be saying anything in this review that you haven't already read, but oh well.

My boyfriend and I went here last week for my birthday dinner and loved everything we ordered. We started with calamari and shared the Seabass and the Wasabi Noodles w/ Steak. For dessert we ordered the Creme Brulee. Everything was amazing.

As everyone has mentioned, make a reservation. We made one but due to traffic on the bridge we were an hour late and ended up having to wait for a table. Not a big deal cause House is nestled between a few bars you can kill time at. The only thing that bothered me about our experience at House was that we were told it would be an hour for a table and that they would call our cell when it was ready ... we went next door to King of Thai to grab a couple drinks and after 30 minutes we decided to check in... we get there and the hostess tells us she called and we didn't answer so she left a voicemail; yet, we had no missed calls and no new voicemails. Kinda suspect if you ask me.

Aside from that, our server was great and the food was amazing. Can't wait to go back!
author: Latisha W.

description:
A solid restaurant with excellent dishes!

The House is one of those little gems that you come across every now and then, and once word gets out, seats/reservations are difficult to get! 

Although they specialize in Asian Fusion, what makes them different from others is their consistency in high quality as well as the delicious flavors, as well as the creativity that goes into their plating.

The restaurant is small and cozy, so you'll be dining close to your neighbors. Also, may not be the best of places for a quiet dining experience.

Prices are fair, especially for the portions..in the $18-$30/dish range. Make reservations during Friday/Saturday nights!
author: Veronica S.

description:
Oh my goodness, this place is DIVINE.

Made reservations for a party of 8 last night at 6:30pm. We were promptly seated. The two highlights of our dishes:

1) Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy ($26)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZoZjbOYR-apY8XvommlNUA?select=f6Ls3fNMbdIOLaZXuwYbnA
My favorite dish of the night. My first bite of the meal was the sea bass. It was PERFECTLY cooked, and PERFECTLY seasoned. It melted in my mouth - I thought I was going to die and go to heaven right then and there. The sea bass is complemented with flavorful garlic noodles and tasty green beans.

2) Angus ribeye steak, housemade teriyaki, toasted garlic butter ($25)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZoZjbOYR-apY8XvommlNUA?userid=28FZnuUJi7G9MPdwMCNyVA
A steak lover's dream. This ribeye is enormous. Every bite is filled with garlic buttery goodness, and it rests atop a bed of seasoned mashed potatoes and kale (?). I loved everything except for the vegetable, which I believe was kale. It was dark and bitter.

Service was quite good. They thought we had left behind a credit card, and called us immediately so we could get it. Even though it wasn't one of ours, I appreciated the call. 

While pricey, the portions were large and I left extremely full and satisfied. I ended up paying $32 after tax & tip. 

A few tips:
1) Maximum 2 credit cards per order, so bring cash if you come in a large party
2) Parking is incredibly difficult to find, so come early if you want to make your reservation.
3) There is a no-show fee for reservations, so they will take your credit card # down when you make it.
author: Anita C.

description:
This restaurant is small, trendy, and is always packed! I'm glad that reservations were made that night. This was my first experience eating at an Asian Fusion restaurant. 

-Side: small plate of pickled cucumbers & roasted sesame seeds. They were so small and cute! They were definitely not sour at all. 

-Warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak: the noodles were a little salty and the steak wasn't overcooked.

-Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy: the fish was finely cooked and melted in my mouth. The noodles were a bit salty too.

The environment was dimly lit, a bit noisy, but I still felt comfortable. I thought that the food overall was a bit salty to my taste, but I feel that it was attributed to the "Fusion-ness." Their menu has so much more to offer and this was a good Fusion experience overall :)
author: Yumi H.

description:
This place had an hour-long wait at 8pm on a Sunday night, but it was worth it. We took advantage of the scallop appetizer and the cod special, which were both incredible. (Seriously, if the cod with avocado roll is available when you're there, don't hesitate. The sauce that came with it was amazing). The wasabi noodles were great too, and we shared a nice pot of tea with the meal. Service was great as well. 

Unfortunately, we were too stuffed for dessert. Next time, I guess.
author: Ivana J.

description:
Amazing wasabi noodles with angus beef. The meat was so so good! The noodles were great too, but the quality of meat definitely made the dish.

Same other tips as the other 1000+ reviewers:
- sea bass
- oysters
- salmon roll (wasabi sauce was so good!)
- Coconut Creme Brulee

A scanty review only because this place is already so renowned. A quick new piece of information: I'm pretty sure they do most of their reservations (at least for 2-tops) in 1-hour blocks. Our check was handed to us before we were asked if we were done ordering (we wanted tea..). Anyways, they're nice enough to continue to host you but you can tell you need to go when you gaze towards the door and see all the people waiting for you to get up. Not a long, relaxed fancy dinner, but definitely great quality and friendly service.
author: Ami D.

description: House is one of my all time favorites. If you're looking for some eclectic asian fusion food in SF, this is your spot.
author: Gianni A.

description:
It was my birthday, and I wanted to spend it in an old part of SF with some delicious food.  The House was on my radar for a while, and I figured now would be as good as ever.

We started out with a few appetizers, half dozen oysters, baby octopus salad, and a couple other items.  They're all good, not mind blowing, but they essentially serve as a teaser for the main course.

I wanted the wasabi house noodles, but not the steak that came with it.  They're able to substitute any item on the menu for whatever else you would like from the menu.  I opted to have my noodles served with some mussels on the side.  It turned out to be a perfect companion.

But oh man, those noodles, I may never get over them.  They were cooked perfectly, and the semi-spicy, ever so slightly sweet sauce was AMAZING.  I tore through those noodles like it was nobody's business.  And the mussels were fresh, didn't have a funky soapy/amonia taste like some restaurants who don't know how to store & treat their mussels.  These were succulent, and served in a sauce that just worked.

The hostess has the low down on the place, and the wait staff are super friendly and quick to accomodate you, with a smile.

I'd defiinitely recommend it to anyone looking for a super meal in the Chinatown/North Beach area.

It is a little small inside, and they've tried to install noise cancelling materials on the walls.  But they need to find a different solution, because noise does carry in that place.
author: Jonathan B.

description: The food here is good but the restaurant is overrated.  We tried many things on the menu and the Octopus was the standout.  The vaunted salmon rolls were average, and the pork chop was pretty good, but too sweet and not amazing.  I enjoyed my meal but I probably wouldn't return, too many other places to try in SF.  Prices were reasonable, and service was good.
author: Marc P.

description:
I finally was able to stop by again with C, a House first timer. We had a 30 min. wait on a Thursday ~6:30pm, which is not surprising. We got to explore the area a little bit.

I don't know why, but I get a bad/unfriendly vibe from the maitre d. She rarely smiles and seems constantly stressed - I guess it is pretty stressful running a busy restaurant and maybe she was having a bad day, but for such a highly esteemed establishment, I guess I expect a little more. 

Our server was definitely more friendly than the one I had last time. She was really sweet. We had the terriyaki rib eye and the sea bass with garlic noodles. The rib eye was different from the one I had last time and wasn't as good. It was a little charred on the outside, which turned bitter in my mouth and masked the natural flavor of the meat. The sea bass was, like everyone says, amazingly soft - it felt like butter in my mouth. But my absolute favorite part of the meal was the garlic noodles, I could eat a WHOLE bowl of them.

Although this House experience was a little disappointing in comparison with my amazing first time, I would definitely come back. It has so much potential for being one of my favorite restaurants.
author: Jen L.

description:
One of the best meals I have ever had in life.  Blown away!!  Ordered the steak in truffle oil as an app our family for three 

Main courses : pork chop - wow one of the best...flat iron steak in noodles very nice dish steak cooked liked silk.

The star of the show the sea bass I have never had fish this amazing with the green beans I was blown away so much flavor the balance of the dish was outstanding 

We ordered one dessert creme brûlée I made one nice comment about the food to the manager she brought another dessert on the house

This kind of service and food you have a customer for life.  Each time I am in the area I will come here
author: Abbi B.

description:
Fantastic food! We shared the salmon roll, which was a blend of raw and cooked (not over done) as well as the soft crab tempura which had a nice spicy/vinegar sauce. The entrée was the angus steak which was very flavorful. Great place because it is small and intimate, not loud. 
Would be nice if they had some Asian fusion cocktails. I am assuming SF liquor license does not permit them to go beyond beer and wine.
Nice place for a date or small group.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
I've been trying a variety of restaurants in the city for the past year, looking for that "WOW!" moment, and I've only found it twice. The House is one of those places. The pork chop here is the best I've ever had and has redefined for me what to expect in a pork chop. Tender, moist, and flavorful, it was balanced perfectly with the pomegranate sauce.

To top it off, service was perfect. The servers were very friendly and accommodating, without being overwhelming.

Parking can be a pain, there's a wait (make reservations!), and everyone is packed in that tiny place like sardines, but it's all worth it.
author: Newton L.

description:
I seriously enjoy the food here but customer service is HORRIBLE. I come here randomly for lunch on weekdays and sometimes for dinner as well but I do not know why everytime I come here, the waitresses are just not friendly at all. If it is only once, FINE but cmon this happens quite often to me. 

Last recent time I was here with two friends and they even noticed how rude the waitress was to me. I needed a take out box for my food since I wasn't able to finish it. Waitress was going to dump my rice when I actually wanted the rice as well because I wasn't going to eat my food without rice the next day! She totally was not happy about boxing my rice (I know it wasn't like a full bowl but good half a bowl). I think she was just upset that i needed another box for the rice. 

Seriously, work on this customer service because its to the point where I have to post it up on yelp.
author: Willa L.

description: The wasabi noodles with skirt steak and passion fruit creme brûlée were amazing. All around SOLD on this place.
author: Russ M.

description:
SEA BASS. SEA BASS. SEA BASS.

It was the softest, juiciest, and most tender piece of fish I've ever had.
I thought the sesame soy ginger sauce & green beans complemented the fish very well. Every bite of fish melted in your mouth. This place deserves 10 stars.

Only gripe I had was parking. It took us a while to find street parking but it was so worth it in the end. 

Please go here and get the sea bass!!!!! It will change your life.
author: Belinda Y.

description: The food was okay. The service was good and the meat was very soft and moist. However, I think the meat should have more flavor.  The wasabe noodles did not amaze me. The place is tiny so you may bump into people as you walk in and try to get through to the restroom.
author: Helen H.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Everytime I'm thinking of a place to go for dinner this place lingers in my mind. 

Get the black cod special if they have it...seriously. Also great items are the sea bass, rib eye special, and wasabi noodles. Wine wasn't great but the food makes up for it. Make reservations, its a small place. Great location too, near a ton of north beach bars.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Truly DELICIOUS!  Excellent Service! 

I came here for lunch without a reservation because I didn't want to fight the dinner crowd. It was 1pm and my friend and I got the last table available to the little restraint. This made us super happy because we didn't have to wait. I am sure at most times this would not be the case. We shared a salad with fried to perfection fish salad as an appetizer, and each ordered an entree. I had the steak from an iron plate and my friend had the glazed salmon. Both tasted fantastic. The steak was tender and thinly slices while the salmon to grilled to perfection. We ended lunch with the creme brulee. The sugar was thinly torched and every bit melted in to my mouth. Sadly I didnt not like the sour sauce that was on top on the sugar but overall it was still good. Not too sweet, just the way I like it. 

The waiters were super friendly and refilled our water when needed. The decor is romantic therefore I feel that it is very date appropriate. I will definitely come back and try out their dinner menu next time.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Small hidden gem of what SF has to offer. Coming to the city? Add this to your itinerary. You won't regret it!
author: Jon L.

description:
Some of the best and unique seafood I have ever had. The cod is the best dish here (it's not on the menu so you need to ask if they have it that day); the grilled ahi tuna and the scallops are excellent too. Every dish I've had has been fabulous and I've been going to the house for 3 years. 

Be sure to make a reservation before you come, unless you don't mind waiting for an hour at least to be seated. It's a great place to go for an intimate evening, or with a large party.
author: Kat F.

description:
If you're looking for a healthy asian fusion place, this is not the one.  This is more of a place where many of the menu items are fried, so unbuckle your belt and start ordering.  I usually can decline all the fatty, luxe foods that get pushed my way like a pro, but for some reason, I had to try everything here!  We had:
1. The fried soft shell crab appetizer with bibim noodles (spicy Korean style)
2. Scallop appetizer (comes with three scallops)
3. green bean tempura appetizer stacked like Jenga
4. Sea bass with noodles and string beans
5. prawns and risotto topped with the fish flakes you find on okonomiyaki, so yes, it moves!
6. wasabi noodles with veggies instead of steak
7. lemon creme brulee

The scallop appetizer was small, but my fave.  The crab appetizer is insane and looks like something you'd see in Beetlejuice.  The tentacles are edible but extremely crunchy.  The bibim noodles that came with it made the Korean in me very happy.  My favorite entree was the sea bass.  The texture of the fish is excellent, flaky, and tender, which is what makes this restaurant stand out from say, a PF Chang's or Roy's fushion chain type place.  Everything here is prepared with expert care. The noodles that come with everything are of the udon variety and are very oily, and remind me of jjajangmyun.  Their greatest downfall is that they're delicious and you'll eat all of them.  I'll definitely be back.  Make a reservation!
author: Terry K.

description: Excellent food, excellent service, and I'm loving the octopus dish with the tempura potatoes. A must try!
author: Winter L.

description:
Favorite restaurant in SF! Been here a handful of times, and it never disappoints. 

This is an extremely small place in North Beach that doesn't have any special exterior, so it could be easy to miss or just pass by. The place gets very crowded, and if you don't have a reservation, you could be waiting quite a while.

The best part about the restaurant is the unique flavors. Asian Fusion definitely defines the type of food they dish out. The chef combines so many flavors it is hard to put your finger on each and every one. 

Portions are large, and worth the price.

Musts: Deep Fried Salmon Roll, Garlic Noodles, Sea Bass, and whatever the special of the day is. 

Down side: Service is not the best. They are very quick and short. I go out to dinner to get an overall excellent experience, which includes the service. However, the food at the House definitely makes up for the poor service here. Just go in knowing you will not be pampered.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Just adding a quick update since I just went back to the House after some time and it blew my mind. They had a braised pork shoulder in spicy miso and it was one of the best dishes I've ever had -- definitely in the same league as their crispy pork belly (that I raved about so much in my previous review). I also got the soft shell crab tempura appetizer and it was incredible as well. 

In my book, the House has just jumped leaps and bounds to become one of the very best restaurants that SF has to offer.
author: Roy C.

description:
Despite everyone's rave reviews about House, I'm not ever that impressed with their food. After dining there three separate times, I've concluded that House gets 3 stars.

This time I ordered a special - the kobe beef with mashed potatoes and greens. The beef was so chewy that I had to spit some pieces out. However, I only did the opposite with the mashed potatoes. 

On a positive note, for apps, I did like the chicken liver salad with its toasty chicken liver crunch. The ahi tuna strips are also always good. And in their defense, my friend is a huge fan of the seabass entree.

I applaud the House for their coconut creme brulee as it was extremely decent.

Will return for Apps and Dessert only.
author: Erin C.

description:
For the price, this is one of the best Asian fusion places in SF. Tiny so actually eating there may be a miracle in itself, once seated the food is fun, interesting and tasty.

This is kind of like the perfect find. That tiny place no body knows about that hasn't figured out that their prices don't match the quality. The only problem is that all the locals do know about them.
author: R. W.

description:
Totally unassuming restaurant, only about 40 seats and nothing to reveal the true essence of the cuisine served. You'll need reservations, even before the restaurant opened at 6:00, there was a line outside.

Before my ass even grazed my seat our waiter shuffled over and started reading off a lengthy list of specials. It was a bit abrupt and I'm used to at least 1. Sitting down, 2. Being offered a beverage before being expected to focus on my food selection... I get it its a small restaurant and the food is in great demand, so the need to flip tables is tantamount to the waiter's success.

With that said, the menu was simple, but exciting. We started with the salmon roll dipped in tempura batter and lightly fried, accompanied by a spicy mustard dipping sauce. The texture of the crispy outside and the rawness of the salmon was really interesting and delightful. A perfect starting dish to share.

Despite the lengthy options of specials, the wasabi noodles with marinated steak on the regular menu immediately caught my eye. I wasn't sure I'd be able to handle the spiciness, but was willing to try. I was so happy with my choice, the noodles weren't spicy the way you'd expect wasabi to be, instead there were a variety of other spices that really added a delicious flavor with a mild spiciness that persisted with each bite. The steak, cooked medium rare was the perfect topper. I ate every bite and would definitely go back for the same dish.

My friend and I were enjoying our second glass of wine and I got the feeling we'd need to order more food just to feel comfortable staying. I hadn't even finished ordering our dessert order and it was already on our table... I swear I have had Starbucks orders take longer to make. 

I'd give the food a 4.5, but the service a 3.5. Definitely would go back without hesitation.
author: Jess K.

description: If you are in San Francisco close to China Town, this is a great restaurant for Asian Fusion. Everyone in the restaurant was a repeat except for me and my husband.  That only tells you this is a restaurant to try.
author: Dawn E.

description: We went here for a company lunch.   Cute little place. My biggest gripe is that,  for our party of five,  we were squeezed into a table for four in a very cramped corner.   We had made reservations ahead of time to ensure we got a decent table...oh well.   When I voiced my concern to the staff they just scoffed at me and told me that they can actually fit six people at our table... Six what? I wondered.. Six toddlers??  We ordered drinks appetizers and our main courses all at the same time.   Service was a bit slow to get our drinks since they weren't that busy at the time.   Once the food came though.. It was actually fairly decent... The seabass was divine.. Soft shell crab, salmon roll appetizers were good.   The Pork chops were nice and juicy. Overall the food was good... Space and ambiance,  along with the service was a bit lacking. Not sure if I'll be back..the substandard service ruins the whole experience for me.. ....and it's a fairly pricey place too..
author: Marvin D.

description:
I am so glad i found this place on yelp. I am usually not a fan of asian fusion but this restaurant changed my preferences. I was desperately looking for a late night place to eat after my flight and the house was open till 2am! My boyfriend booked the reservation for 10pm (yes it's a very late dinner) and when we got there, the restaurant was still very crowded. 
We shared the wasabi house noodles with steak and the sea bass with noodles. Everything was full of flavor and you can definitely taste each element that they put in the dish. 
The restaurant is pretty cramped and you can literally eat out of the neighboring table's food and parking took forever to find (we walked like 6 blocks) but overall I think it is worth it to make a trip out here.
author: Shirley W.

description: Pomegranate pork chop was good nice pomegranate sauce it was sweet not dry, must try there scallop.. also I also saw a soft shell crab deep fry  looked great  will try next time
author: Patterson N.

description:
I came here with coworkers after a company meeting. We made reservations and already let them know what we all wanted in advanced over the phone, since we only had a hour for lunch and needed to travel back to our normal work site. This place was surprisingly loud, and it was a good thing we had reservations because it was packed full. 

One of my coworkers ordered one deep fried salmon roll to try since so many people rave about it. The staff assumed we probably wanted to share the appetizer and actually cut it into 6 pieces instead of the regular 4. I got the wasabi house noodles with pork and it was packed full of wasabi flavor. A coworker got the sea bass and she loved it, and the portion wasn't enough for her because it was so good. Another coworker got the flat iron steak and it tasted so good I wish I had gotten that instead.
author: Jay L.

description: The food wasn't mind blowing... Not sure what the hype is about. Also the service was a big issue for our table. I understand that you are a busy establishment, but you can't just force your customers out letting them know that they have one hour to sit, eat and leave. I feel like that completely tainted our experience. So I guess a word of advice. Get reservations and don't expect them to be nice if you try to show up and follow through with their regular seating policy.
author: Alex S.

description: Total gem that's tucked away in North Beach. Super crowded almost all the time, but there's a couple reasons for that: great food and a nice cozy room that doesn't seat a ton of people. I don't like super-cavernous places where you get lost in the scene - so this is my kind of place. I go for the sea bass and wasabi noodles.
author: Adam S.

description:
The food is really THAT good!

So I ended up back at The House 3 months after my first visit. I was with 5 other friends and I have to say that everyone had a wonderful dining experience. Even my vegetarian friend was raving about her curry noodles and her side of asparagus with sesame.

I made sure to order the pork chops and it was so tasty! The soft shell crab with vermicelli noodles appetizer was impressive and the skate with trouffle sauce ("trouffle" is magical) made me drool.

Still one of my favorite places!

---------------------------------------------
Yelp you never fail me. 

The food at The House was AMAZING! The rib-eye was the perfect blend of flavors, the yellow tail with chinese broccoli topped with wassabi cream sauce melted in my mouth, and the california roll was made with delicious fresh crabs. The fried salmon roll we ordered for appetizer was addicting (watch out for the hot mustard dip though; just a little dip is enough to fire up your taste buds).

The restaurant is small and the tables are set almost too close for comfort. Because of the tiny space, the noise level can get pretty high. And you definitely should make a reservation. There was nothing special about the service, but you receive your order pretty timely and everything on the menu sounds so delicious, who cares if the server doesn't know how to smile!

I live in LA but I would readily drive to SF tomorrow to try the pork chops everyone raves about (the five girls at the table next to us all ordered pork chops and left none for me).
author: Dawnabelle R.

description: Awesome awesome food here! We picked the Kobe beef and halibut, they are surprisingly great! Definitely will come back and try other courses!
author: Hellen W.

description: Definitely worth coming to! We made a reservation a few days in advance and they were able to accommodate even though we arrived late to our reservation. We started off with the unagi with avocado rice and the fried salmon rolls. The unagi was amazing with smokey flavor and tastes nothing like the typical unagi nigiri. The avocado sushi rice paired very nicely with its acidity. The salmon rolls were good but were average when compared to the unagi. We shared the kurobuta pork chop and black cod with miso for mains. The pomegranate sauce really elevated the pork chop and is a must get! The cod was equally as delicious and you can really taste the individual components. Overall it was a great dinner and will be coming again in the future!
author: Jessica Z.

description:
This place definitely worths the wait! it's very small so you have to expect a hour/ a hour and a half before taste the heaven. 

The staff is very friendly, the atmosphere is not that loud and pretty intimate, I think it's a really nice place for a date. 

The food is really amazing! Their crab cake is the best that I've ever had, and I just want to try everything on their menu, from the appetizers to the desserts.
I'm looking forward to come back as soon as I can :)
author: Carole P.

description:
Food: 5/5 - The presentation of the food, and the combination of flavors here is what I would expect of a top-end restaurant in San Francisco.

Service: 5/5 - Despite being a busy/small spot, the servers are always friendly and accomodating - the fact that they prefer phone reservations only goes to show that they emphasize on human interaction despite the convenience of OpenTable/online reservations.

Ambiance: 3/5 - The space is very small, so expect that you will be in tight quarters. The ambiance is not particularly nice, but the food and value makes up for it.

Value: 5/5 - Prices are very reasonable considering the quality and presentation of the food, with entree options in the low to mid $20s.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I've been coming to The House on a regular basis for the past couple years for both lunch and dinner.  During my recent lunch outing, I could not believe how bad the service had gotten!!  

There were only a few occupied tables.  There was no greeting by the 2 waitresses.  We were glared at and then seated.  I understand the House usually takes reservations over walk ins, but does that mean you serve us lunch with your nasty attitude.  It took us 20 minutes to get the waitress' attention.  When she finally came over, I politely asked her what the specials were and she replied, "Oh, I thought you were ready to order!"   I was completely stunned.  Am I not paying for this meal?! I was actually quite ready to walk, but since we were on our lunch hour, we went ahead and put in our orders.   The food was okay.  Definitely not as amazing as it used to be.  As the lunch hour wore on, I noticed there were still quite a few empty tables.  

Throughout our meal, I saw the waitress 2 times - put our down in (we waved her down) and for the check (we waved her down)

There's nothing I dislike more than terrible service.  It doesn't matter how delish your food is if your service stinks!

I'll really have to reconsider going back.  Maybe if they bring back the male servers with the pleasant attitude.
author: E C.

description:
My biggest issued is the waiter 
I can't understand what the today's special he's talking about.
heavy accent, and constantly looking at his note (because he can't remember it)
all the words sticking together I can't not understand when one dish he is describing ends and when the next one starts. he dose not pause except when he try to look at his note.
when I try to ask him to repeat and he seem annoyed.
so we can only order what few words we can make out ..... ordered  blah blah blah "scallop" dish and fried chicken liver from the menu.
main entrée I want to try the special but couldn't understand him so again just pick out words --meow meow meow seabass meow.
so I ordered seabass..............

all the dishes are just ok. not thing worth mentioning.
I thought the sauce on my sea bass dish is too salty. 
service is not good.
ordered wine and didn't come until we asked for it again in the middle of having appetizer........
we said to the waitress.........
" excuse me , we ordered wine earlier..."
and the waitress is like
"um...............and?"
so we said
"can we have it now?"
very bad attitude.
  

the only thing worth mentioning.............if you must go to the house to eat don't pass on the desert.  kabocha pumpkin pie is really good.
author: Rina C.

description:
I'm always so disappointed when restaurants don't live up to my Yelp expectations.  I mean this place is ok...but I was expecting so much more!  

We had reservations which was good because it's a small space.  When we first entered, we were followed in by a homeless man.  The staff quickly took care of that.  This doesn't affect my ratings at all because hey, it's SF.  And not the restaurant's fault.

The food was good, but nothing was memorable.  I'm sad to say, but I actually can't remember anything that I absolutely loved that I can remember eating.  Maybe it was an off night?  I don't know.  Unfortunately, there are so many places in SF that I still need to check out that it's unlikely that I'll return to give them a second chance.
author: Chantal T.

description:
I would have given this place 5 stars but the last time I came here the wait staff were rude as f**k. 
Other than that their food here is delicious. My favorite is the seabass. OMG so good.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Oh, The House. If I had a more nicely padded wallet, I'd try everything on this place's menu. After eating here, I made a joke that I would come back to accomplish just that, but every time I think about it, it becomes less and less of a joke. 

My first time here was on a double date w/ friends, and I was pretty happy we all were okay with sharing dishes : ) Yay more things for me to try, hehe. 

Our table ordered the salmon rolls as appetizers. I didn't get to try this because the salmon looked kinda raw, and I am not a fan of raw food. I heard afterwards that you could ask for it well done, which i will have to do next time... My friends at the table who DID try it liked it though. I tried the sauce while it was there - and it was very very strong (wasabi-wise). 

As our maincourse, we shared the wasabi noodles, the steak+noodles, and the mushroom rice. ALL OF THEM WERE SOO GOOD. My personal favorite was the mushroom rice - it was very rich in flavor, and had a very melt-in-your-mouth texture, ahahha. 

For dessert, we had the passionfruit creme brulee and I think pie ... a la mode... I liked the creme brulee better between the two =) 

The House definitely does Asian Fusion right. It's not cheap, but I think you get what you pay for. The portions aren't ridiculously small either. 

However, it is super small, so make reservations before you go!
And probably take public transportation to avoid having to find parking ... it's not too far of a walk from Union Square!
author: Ashley N.

description:
I absolutely love pan Asian food so I was really excited to check this place out when I saw all the great reviews on Yelp. We made reservations and got seated right away. It's a small restaurant and the tables are a little crammed but honestly, it didn't bother me a bit. Our server was nice and our food came out quickly. 

My husband and I ordered the crispy salmon rolls to start. I loved crunching into these and the fact that the rolls were cut into large pieces, unlike typical maki rolls. For dinner, I ordered the seabass over garlic noodles and Husband ordered the wasabi noodles with steak. Oh my gosh. A few months later, we're still talking about how good our meals were. There was so much flavor in the noodle sauces without being too salty or overpowering the meat. My fish was perfectly cooked and so was the steak.

I really can't say enough good things. Highly recommend!
author: Tiffany B.

description: Super small maybe they should call it Studio :) Food is well done and unique, but if you have a man/women that likes to have a full belly when all is said and done then you might want to go to one of the Italian restaurants and load up. My honey had to grab two slices after dinner.
author: Hilary J.

description:
I have wanted to try this place for sometime and finally got around to it on Sat 11/16.  We had dinner reservations for 7pm.
