It's a cute little place (emphasis on LITTLE), make sure you have reservations and you all arrive on time so they can seat you. Parking is a nightmare, but save yourself $25 on lot parking and park on Vallejo and Sansome.
author: Jess C.

description:
Again and again this place just amazes me...!!

So for the last 4-5 times I've eaten here in the last couple years, I've always ordered the same things--either the sea bass or the steak with wasabi noodles.  This time around we ordered everything new!

Appetizers included deep fried salmon roll, ahi tartare, and kobe beef tartare.  Main courses included the kobe beef served with chanterelle and mash special and the black cod in miso sauce special. And for dessert, a cup of coffee and  I believe it was a chocolate torte with coffee ice cream.

The deep fried salmon roll was not as great as I expected it to be after reading all the reviews.  It just tasted like a wonton eggroll wrapped around slightly cooked salmon and the chinese mustard sauce that accompanied had quite a bit of a kick to it which kind of killed it for us since we had no idea how strong it was and put too much on our first bite.

The ahi tartare was exceptional, to me at least.  My husband enjoyed the kobe beef tartare more but it was a bit too gourmet for my taste.  I couldn't put my finger on what it was suppose to taste like.  It didn't taste like beef or any other meat for that matter but it was presented beautifully!

My husbands kobe beef steak was SUPERB. Cooked perfectly at medium rare and so tender.  The chanterelle and mash were also perfect sides with this lovely piece of meat.

My black cod dish--beyond words--I've never had a better tasting fish.  I took the advice of another reviewer which said to order the cod if it ever was a special and I did and I can't thank them enough!  PLEASE ORDER THE COD!  It was so luscious and really just melted in your mouth.  It was 10 times better than my favorite (or was) seabass dish!

The chocolate torte was okay.  It was a bit heavy for my taste--think coffee ice cream on top of a thin sliced but very dense brownie.  I think it's because I ate it myself and it really was a dish to be shared but hubby was trying to be good so I was on my own.  He claims his coffee was superb which I'll have to take his word for it since I'm not a coffee connoisseur. 

Service was excellent as usual.  Our reservation was was for 7:30 and we sat down at 7:32.  Parking is, of course, HELL on Broadway but we always park at the Vallejo parking garage which is just 2-3 blocks away.  The only downside is that they close at 10:00 PM on weeknights so expect to move it before then if you plan to stay on Broadway the whole night.

Proven again and again, The House is a must-try San Francisco treat!
author: Ivy Z.

description:
Favorite restaurant in the city. Here are some of my personal favorites:

1. Wasabi Noodles with Flatiron Steak: This is mostly my favorite dish because it comes with wasabi noodles, which are absolutely to die for. I'm pretty sure I dream of wasabi noodles.
2. Sea bass in garlic soy sauce: SO GOOD. I always ask for wasabi noodles to replace the regular garlic soy ones.
3. Kobe steak special: they don't always say this when listing the specials, but they always will make it for you if you ask.

We also get the hamachi appetizer special when it's available. If it's not, we usually will get an order of calamari or fried spicy salmon rolls. I think the calamari is pretty standards but I love the salmon rolls. 

The House is tiny and always crowded so you NEED to make a reservation. I try to make it at least a week in advance and even earlier if I have a big party.
author: Alli Q.

description:
Went here for my last meal in SF before heading back to the cold Midwest.  My friend said this was her favorite restaurant in SF so we figured we should try it.  

We couldn't get a reservation until late, so we decided to just risk it and head there to put our names down for a table and wait.  We got there at 7pm on a Sunday.  They said it would be about 30 min or less for a table of 5...but within 5 min we got a call back saying our table was ready (no joke!).

It's kind of a tiny place, but it was homey and not too pretentious and the service was great.  For starters we got the tuna tartare (comes with 3 pieces) and the crab cakes.  They were both delicious! Usually crab cakes are too dense for me, but this came in a volcano shape and were more tender and crumbly--definitely recommend it.  I got the sea bass for my entree which came highly recommended via fellow yelpers (yay!) and it didn't disappoint.  It was super moist, and the sauce was perfect with it.  Make sure you get it with the garlic noodles!  My friend got the ribeye and substituted the potatoes for garlic noodles, no problem.  Someone else got the lobster salad, which was a appetizer special and they said it was the perfect size for a light appetite and still tasty.  We were too full for dessert so we just got the almond cookies to go.  Also quite yummy and wrapped nicely.

Overall, I highly recommend The House! I'm usually weary of asian fusion, but everything was tasty and wonderful.  Great food, great service, great ambiance!
author: Jessi N.

description:
I think I might have a new favorite restaurant in SF! I was taken here yesterday for my birthday after a friend highly recommended it and it blew all expectations. 

I was hesitant of being disappointed with such high yelp reviews, but this place is the real deal. I also rarely get my mind blown away with restaurants because I typically feel I can cook most dishes almost as well as the restaurant, however these dishes were phenomenal. I've never been able to cook a piece of fish as perfectly as this!

FOOD:

Big-Eye Tuna Sashimi with salsa verde- a great portion of super fresh sashimi over a yellow beet sliver topped with a slice of nori, salsa verde, avocado chunks, radish and tobiko. There was a lot going on in this dish but it all worked in perfect harmony.


Deep Fried Salmon roll: very tasty and served with a chinese hot mustard sauce. Fantastic a must try


Seabass with Garlic ginger soy noodles: I was hesitant to order seabass just because most fish doesn't ever really impress. However this seabass and the black cod that we got were the best two dishes of fish I've ever had. I didn't understand melt in your mouth until eating these dishes. You could take the back handle of a butter knife and "cut" into the fish. Be careful of the soy ginger sauce (served on the side) though the fish is amazing on it's own and doesn't really need the sauce.

Black cod served over some greens and topped with an open faced "california" roll- definitely the wow dish of the night. Take a look at the picture below but it was just beautiful. Another perfectly cooked piece of delicious fish that just melted away in your mouth- that's what she said! seriously though I had to ask the waitress what the dark sauce under it was and all she could say was soy and ginger anything else and i'd have to kill you. I literally scraped up a bit of it with my finger just to get a better taste of it. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZoZjbOYR-apY8XvommlNUA?select=SCk9IP1-rTkVXTwaIu0sTA

Chocolate truffle cake with espresso ice cream, coconut cream, caramel- deliciously solid dessert.

The food was absolutely delicious, beautiful and creative. The dishes came out with little lag between them. The service was great too- very efficient, almost a bit rushed. 

I highly recommend coming here and can't wait to return. FYI the  $15 corkage fee is a great option to bring some great wine in.
author: Mike K.

description:
I LOVE THE HOUSE! 

The place is small, but super cozy and friendly. The staff is extremely attentive, but my one lone compliant is that the waitress who read the special said it so monotonously that it didn't even sound appealing after she was done.

Had the steamed mussels appetizer-- great, not amazing. The broth was interesting but was it worth $9? Not so sure. The sea bass and steak were both amazing; perfectly cooked and full of intense flavor. The sides for both-- mashed potatoes, noodles, asparagus-- were delicious. It's a little pricey, but so, so worth it. Trust me! It's definitely one of the hidden gems in the area, and I can't wait to come back again!
author: Allison S.

description:
We were able to snag last minute reservations to The House. We had reservations at 6pm but unfortunately due to the weather we were late 20 minutes so the waitress advised us that she had given our table away and that it would be a 20 minute wait. Strangely, after she said that, she pointed to a table for us to be seated at. Nice!

We ordered the cod and the sea bass. Both dishes were delicious! So tender and flaky. I love fish like that! Nice and fresh!  For dessert we got the apple cobbler ala mode.  It was only okay.  Nothing outstanding.  Towards the end we felt really rushed to leave the restaurant because they started clearing out table.  Not the best way to end a dinner but we understood since there were people waiting to be seated and we were late.
author: Janet E.

description: Walked in at 6:45p. Told it was an hour wait. Got seated within 45 min. Wait staff was friendly and patient. Deep fried salmon rolls for the appetizer were incredible. Not overcooked at all. Husband had the skirt steak special with truffle oil. Meat was cooked perfectly medium. Flavor was excellent. I had the sea bass. Mouth watering. The ginger soy sauce complimented the fish amazingly well. The crumb apple pie rivaled home baked, served with some creamy vanilla ice cream. Great way to top off the evening. Worth the wait.
author: J R.

description:
The House has been on my list for a while since all of my Yelp friends have given it 5 stars. Maybe we were there on an off day, but if I wanted delicious Asian food with grumpy hurried service, I would've gone elsewhere in Chinatown with less dollar signs. ;)  Don't get me wrong, the food was tasty, but our non-smiling server rushing us out put a damper on dinner. Oh and they lost my reservation when I called a few days earlier to confirm. That didn't help. 

Food: Like I said, the food is yummy. In order of deliciousness - 
-Ribeye steak - My photo says it all. You can't go wrong with anything smothered in garlic butter. Perfectly cooked, beautiful marbling, amazing teriyaki sauce.
-Kobe steak with chanterelle mushrooms - Well cooked, incredibly tender steak. Chanterelle mushrooms and sauce were perfect. 
-Unagi with avocado sushi rice - Unagi was melt in your mouth delicious. Avocado sushi rice was interesting. 
-Apple crumble - Warm apple center, crunchy crust, vanilla ice cream. Pretty good, but didn't blow me away.
-Calamari - Crispy and tasty, but nothing special. 
-Wasabi noodles - Steak was juicy and tender. Noodles were bland. Wasabi was not overwhelming. Dish did not mesh well together.
-Chocolate cake with espresso ice cream - Exactly what it sounds like. Average. 

Atmosphere: Felt small, crowded, and loud. They stuck our big party in the corner of the restaurant near the entrance so everyone  waiting for a table was rubbing against our backs. 

Parking: Parking is a pain in North Beach but there are several garages nearby. 

Reservations: Each reservation is only 1.5 hours so if you make a reso at 7:30pm, you have to get out at 9pm. Doesn't make for a very leisurely dinner. ;)
author: Connie C.

description: I din't know how they got a high overall rating but I am sure that is not real. Food was ok. Service was really bad. The restaurant was so small that you can hear whatever everyone else is saying. I would not recommend it to anyone. Nothing special, pricy food but average quality. Very poor ambiance. Poor service :(
author: Reza F.

description: It pains me to say anything bad about this restaurant because I loved everything about this place except for the main course that was way too bland.  Everything was phenomenal until I got my main course, pork chop with pomegranate glaze, which wasn't that good...the pork chop was dry and the sauce had too much butter. I really wanted to like this restaurant but my main course did not impress me at all. I will still come back in the future to try some other dishes though. I believe the chef had a bad day and that was it. Nothing but a bad day.
author: Serafin K.

description:
Ordered the wasabi noodle.. it's good. I tried their mani entree.. it's grill perfect. Not dried. 

I ordered the spicy miso clam.. I didn't like it. You can't taste the clam.. it was slightly overcook.. garlic taste was strong. The sauce it's good when you dip with bread
author: Shirley L.

description:
Very popular and super crowded.  I had such high expectation because of many of great reviews here.  Well, I'd give 4 starts. 

We ordered
- Fried calamari: not bad
- Manila Clam: excellent taste
- Wasabi noodle: good taste, I loved it
- Sea bass: good (my friends said it was OK)

** reservation is a must!!!
author: Mike M.

description: Holy crap, that sea bass is amazing. The moistest fish I have ever had. The sauce is likewise delicious. The wasabi and garlic noodles were delicious. The pork chop, oh man, fuhgeddaboudit! The prices are so very reasonable I would considering eating here on the regular. The salmon rolls were packed with salmon and made a very nice appetizer. It's amazing that such an unassuming place can pump out such gourmet dishes. I have never been a fan of "Asian Fusion" but this place just proves that all you really need is good execution with classic flavors. Can't wait to come back here next time I'm in SF.
author: Peter K.

description:
4.5 stars

I brought my girlfriend here for lunch on her birthday as she has been to The House before and loved it. After dinning there I have to say I love it too! The place is small so reservations are definitely required. 

We were shown to a nice table and ordered some house-squeezed lemonade which was thirst quenching. My girlfriend wanted to try their pork belly and crab cakes, but they weren't serving it that day. The menu can change on a daily basis. For starters we tried their Fried Calamari and Salmon Roll. The Calamari was a mix of crispy rings an tentacles paired with cocktail sauce. The calamari tasted good and the breading didn't fall apart. The Salmon Roll was delicious! Salmon wrapped with seaweed wrapped with what I think was the shell of eggrolls and fried. The sauce was amazing. It reminded me of mixing wasabi, ginger and soy sauce when eating sushi. 

For our entrees, my gf ordered the Wasabi Noodles topped with grilled salmon and I ordered the Angus Flatiron Steak with roasted shitake mushroom sauce. The gf described the wasabi noodles as the best noodles she has ever had! The salmon was equally as good, melting away in our mouths dispersing the flavor. The Flatiron steak was a little tough but the flavor quickly made up for it. The whole mix of meat, asparagus, mashed potatoes, radicchio, shitake mushrooms blended well together. The sauce was perfect and didn't overpower all the other flavors. By far the best dish I have had in a long while!

Final Thoughts: I love this place and can't wait to return to try them out for dinner! I will return to this place many times! The only reason they didn't get all 5 stars is because of the tough meat.
author: Anthony P.

description:
I come here every decade, but I should visit more often!  This is a hidden gem for good eats with a refreshing variety of Asian fusion dishes.  Start off with their signature deep-fried salmon skin rolls with hot mustard, fried calamari or scallops.  The unagi avocado sandwich and the wasabi house noodles with tenderly grilled pork is scrumptious.  Whether you have their crispy sea bass, tender kurobuta porkchop with pomegranate currant sauce, or angus ribeye steak with fried garlic bits, you'll be satisfied with what I call fancy comfort food that makes you feel at home without the tendency to critique food.  Normally, I don't drink, but their German riesling is sweet, smooth and uplifting.  Save room for the coconut passionfruit creme brulee with a crispy crust and delicately balanced filling.  The bittersweet chocolate truffle cake topped with ice cream hits the sweet spot for sure.  Everything is cooked just right!

Service is friendly, fast, and helpful especially when it comes to suggestions and refills.  Parking is tough on the street, but there are local garages within walking distance.  The ambiance and decor is simple with a contemporary and classic feel in a cozy, small restaurant.  However, the food is cooked with heart with flavors and aromas that fill the room to make you savor every bite =b
author: Jenny L.

description:
Compared to the other reviews for The House I'm going to chalk my experience up to an off night for the kitchen.

My girl friends surprised me with a birthday dinner on a Monday night and I was super excited to eat here because of all the rave reviews.  

This restaurant is TINY, no joke, so expect to have a very cozy meal.

For starters I split the deep fried salmon roll with Kat C..  I love the crispiness of the exterior and it's perfect with that spicy chinese mustard.  They're definitely not skimping on the salmon either, it's super dense.

A couple of the ladies at the table including myself ordered the warm wasabi noodles with flatiron steak.  A couple minutes later our server came back to tell us that they only have enough flatiron for two orders!  Crisis averted since they were able to sub in some ribeye for the third order.  I really like the colorful vegetable slaw that comes with this dish and the portions are definitely generous.  I wish the noodles were more wasabi-y,  I didn't taste wasabi in them at all.  Someone at our table also had a difficult time cutting through her steak and had to have it re-fired a little bit, which slightly helped.  Someone at the table also ordered the chicken breast dish, which she was happy with.

When it came to dessert time we didn't really see anything on the standard menu that we fancied but we wanted to try the bread pudding that was on special for that night.  Three seconds after we ordered it, our server came back to tell us that they had JUST run out..... really? UGH. 

Service was okay.  It seems like there were only two servers that night and they were running around like crazy.

At the end of the meal everyone was lamenting about how the last time they had eaten at The House it had been better... oh well.  Maybe I should heed Anthony Bourdain's advice and not eat out on Mondays...
author: Kim-van T.

description:
Awesome meal. We'll definitely be returning.

The good: 
- pristine oysters, exquisitely fresh
- crab cake tower that convinced me that crab cakes could indeed be good eats
- skirt steak with wasabi noodles, perfectly cooked with very gentle wasabi spice
- coconut crème brûlée with passion fruit syrup for a creamy finish

The bad: 
- parking, but there's a pay lot in the alley way behind the restaurant
author: Norman G.

description: One of the City's best restaurant. Loved the Sea Bass. This is a hidden gem. The servers know their food and drink. Very knowledgable staff. Service and food was outstanding
author: Orlando B.

description:
I have been to The House few times before about 5-6 years ago, and I remember liking the food very much, but didn't like the dessert (pineapple upside down cake) than. And I actually had the same dessert I didn't like many years ago, my taste buds probably changed because this time it wasn't as bad as I remember. 
My Birthday celebration.
Made reservation one week in advance, because I called restaurant quiet a few times  to get in and they gave me estimated time waiting for a table around an hour and a half two hours. 
So, make reservation. 
Ask for a table next to the window, doesn't feel so cramped, if you would have been seated in a middle. Place is small. 
Food is as delicious as I remember. 
Salmon roll (salmon wrapped in egg roll wrapper and dip fried) served with mustard sauce.
Salmon cooked medium, fresh, mustard sauce strong and bit overpowering the taste of salmon, but still delicious. 
Wasabi noodle with Flat Iron steak another good dish, steak like butter, soft, juicy, cooked perfectly. Noodles cooked al dente were delicious, but didn't taste wasabi at all. Not a big deal.
Sea Bass with noodles, green beans and soy ginger sauce is another great dish, the only complain the sauce is too strong for light and buttery taste of the Sea Bass. But it did work perfectly with my pork chop, which needed some "Kick" which was served with mushed potatoes, asparagus and pomegranate sauce(was too light). Pork chop was cooked medium, juicy and really good. 
Service was just okay not personable, but fast and officiant. 
The dessert.. When I asked the dessert menu, they brought dessert of their choice warm pineapple upside down cake with a Birthday candle. It was just okay. I would definitely order something else. It was a little annoying. I would understand if I wasn't charged for it. 
Very good overall!
author: Natasha S.

description: Loved the food. Definitely on my go-back-and-try-more list of restaurants. Little too cozy and loud for my taste but I'll still go back to this place for the food alone.
author: Syed A.

description: They took us very quick on a busy Saturday night as a walkin. Food is killer and so is the service and ambience. It's tight in there but everything is well orchestrated and professional. We had a couple appetizer specials, steak with garlic noodles and the ribeye entree. Everything was fantastic. Hot, fresh and speedy. The manager is great and super friendly. Great energy in there with a personable staff.
author: Robert A.

description: Made reservation 2 weeks ahead of time no problem! The place is really small and cramped, it was a bit hard to listen to each other talk. However, the food was pretty amazing. We ordered the seared scallops appetizer. For main dish, we had the pork chop (pretty decent portion), swordfish in curry sauce (YUMMY!!), and halibut (my girl friend said it was pretty good!). Service was pretty ok given it was really busy and not much room for them to move around.
author: Julisa L.

description:
I feel like when a restaurant on Yelp is rated as high as this one, people don't read the reviews that are 4-5 stars. Instead they seek out the 1-2 stars to scope out negative aspects. 

Anyways, I came here on a saturday night for a dinner date with my girlfriend. With our fancy pants on, we got to the restaurant at 8pm for 8:30 reservations, and were seated immediately. Pretty awesome.

-Instead of bread, they gave us pickled asian cucumbers. I liked it but I think I would have appreciated the bread to sop up the garlic ginger soy sauce mentioned below.
-The jasmine tea was fragrant and light. Actually, I'm stealing those adjectives from the menu. But they rang true.
-The deep fried salmon roll with chinese hot mustard was SO GOOD. Mustard was more watery that I expected but it was delicious. It goes straight to your sinuses. The coleslaw was really good too.
-The wasabi noodles and flat iron steak wasn't as good as I expected. The noodles were a little bland, weren't as spicy as I hoped. It was still better than average though. 
-The grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy noodles were great. I really liked the sauce on the noodles. The fish was flakey and perfectly cooked.

The funny thing is the food at The House could be seen in an average chinese restaurant. But the execution of the dishes are really well done. So much so that the upscale prices are justified. Two people, one appetizer, one drink, two entrees for around $70 tax and tip included. 

One complaint. The place is so small, it gets so loud. I had to talk over the people sitting at the next table. They should put shag on the walls to absorb the sound. Works in vans and old people's houses. Why not House? Oh and MAKE RESERVATIONS.
author: Aron L.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  Quick service, excellent food and reasonably priced.  If you are in the North Beach area, be sure to check this place out.
author: Nick V.

description:
I came here today with two of my girl buddies. We had reservations for 3 at 1pm. My friend led the way. The place is pretty small but they can probably have a total of 25 customers. There was no line during the entire 1.5 hours we were there. Easy to find seats.

It was pretty comfy and the atmosphere was nice. The only problem is that the tables were really close to one another. You didn't even have to try to hear the conversation the people sitting next to you are having. 

They have a lot of fish items. I don't really like fish so that limited my options. I ordered the udon with chicken. I thought it was okay. I felt like I could have made it and the soup is pretty oily. My friend ordered the wasabi noodles. I tried some and it was good. You can order it so it is not spicy. I would probably get that if I come again.

The main waitress looks very bohemian. Another waitress looked pissed off. Only one of the waitress looked happy. Probably make the whole dining experience better if the people who worked there looked more enthusiastic. 

We ordered the chocolate cake for dessert with ice cream on top. We shared among the three of us. It was plenty even though it looked small. The chocolate was too rich but the ice cream was good although they don't give you much.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Definitely enjoyed House. The appetizers were reasonably priced and the service was solid. The food was ready, warm and amazingly well plated VERY quickly. Big fan of seafood and this place did it well. Normally I am skeptical of asian fusion.

Tip:
--4 apps will easily fill two diners up- no need for a main course. However, all of the food here is great. Decent wine selection too.

--Make reservations, saw folks waiting outside for awhile and we went on a weekday.
author: Rick M.

description:
Had the wasabi noodles and flank steak... Delicious!  Not too spicy. Great flavor. 
Ambience is nice. Service was good. Kept our waters full. 
Good
Portion size 
Would order flank on side so it would be easier to cut up.
author: Jessica L.

description: Best. Restaurant. Ever. We came here three times within a four-day vacation. Make sure to order the wasabi noodles and make reservations. I once waited an hour and a half for a table. It is a small restaurant but food is made to order, they have daily specials, and service is wonderful!
author: Hector L.

description: My wife and I came here for a trip a while back. We found this restaurant on yelp and were beyond satisfied. All of their menu items were amazing and the service was great. The bar menus was also great!
author: Brett M.

description:
Overhyped.

We had dinner reservations on a Saturday night.

We ordered: 
Tartare w. nori chips
Mushroom & Prawn Risotto
Chilean Sea Bass

When I look back upon it (and my pictures), the risotto was really oily, and the chilean sea bass was really salty. The tartare appetizer was good, but it was kinda pricy for the amount you get.

This place is really noisy, and AVOID getting the table at the very back (next to the kitchen door) at all cost!!! It is so dark there and especially noisy there because you can hear the clinkclanks of the dishes in the kitchen. They really need to install a light there. It was so uncomfortable to be eating in the dark. It is only when the waiters bust out of the kitchen door giving you a quick flash of light so you can actually see your food. 

Also, since the place is so busy it's hard to grab your waitress sometimes to just refill our water! Oh, and FYI, they do not do anything for birthdays, anniversaries, etc.
author: Jess C.

description:
All these 4 stars can't upgrade to 5?? You're kidding me!

I work for a small company and my boss loves this place so she made reservations for this restaurant for our holiday dinner at the end of the year. The place is *really cramped* so it's good we didn't have too many ppl (like 6 ppl would've been too many lol)
But let me tell you this: every single bite of every item we got that night was divine! Perfect! Like tasting food for the first time! Seriously, remarkable!

We got the salmon rolls, clams in mushroom sauce and tuna chips (not the real menu names, fyi) for appetizer and the flavor combos were mini explosions in your mouth! YUM! I got their famous Sea Bass and couldn't have been more pleased! I have never tasted a piece of fish cooked to such perfection. It was very buttery, melted in your mouth, and had a very distinct "grilled" type of singe to it. My bf was over the moon for his seared stake (especially the cauliflower in it)- and everyone else was more than pleased with their meals. 
Dessert was great, we got the truffle cake (which is more of a brownie...there's no "cake" about it) and the coffee icecream was delish.

Honestly, after only eating here once, I can't imagine ordering anything and not liking it!

-staff was so/so. Indifferent; neither rude nor memorable.
-make reservations NOW! it takes awhile!
-kinda seedy area, too. topless bars and bums mixed in with cute shops and scenery- very sf!
author: Shianne D.

description:
It's tough in a place like SF CA because people like me come in to town with high expectations.  But the fact is there are excellent new American and Asian Fusion places in many big cities--even cow towns like Denver.  So the  place is small and the guy at the door has decent manners and they couldn't fit us in but a few blocks down the street he gave me a call which was cool and way above standard.

The asparagus was okay in from-a-jar Chinese sauce.  We got the ribs and you'll get  better barbecue ribs at a hog shop in a midwestern town (Montgomery Inn in Cincinnati, say).  And then there was some kobe beef with some sauce on some mushrooms and mashed potatoes with some brown sauce.  A very 1978 Ohio kind of dish.  And we had a fish special and it had some kind of sushi roll thing on it which was weird.  And it was sitting in a pool of the same from-a-jar Chinese sauce that was on the asparagus.

I mean all in all it was good but with all these stars in a town with a good reputation for food you should blow my pants off with anything over 3 stars.  Blow. Pants. Off.  Try harder.  It's not time to start coasting yet.
author: Mark R.

description:
I was a bit skeptic about this place since I am not a big fan of asian fushion but wow this place amazes me. 
First off, this place is packed and small. I liked the fact that I can leave my phone number and the host will call you when your table is ready, 
We waited about 30 minutes and was quickly sat. We ordered the ahi tuna tartar and the butter scallops. I think that was the best scallops I have ever had. It was nicely seared and rare so when you bit into it, the juices come rushing into your mouth. 
When the entree arrived, I was happy with what I picked. The pomegranate pork chops wasnt overly sweet and  the asparagus was cooked perfectly. My bfs dish was also very delicious and quite common since I saw that on every table everyone had order it as well lol. I could see why since the wasabi garlic noodles were heavenly. Then to end the meal we ordered the passion fruit coconut creme brulee. Oh my.. the flavors worked well with each other and just tasted amazing in my mouth haahaha.  

I would definitely come back!
author: Amber H.

description:
Every time we come here, it's an amazing culinary experience. My wife and I really dig the salmon rolls with the spicy miso dipping sauce, which is an amazing blend of umami and bite in one dish. We also had the black cod with a phenomenal sauce and I've had the fresh Yellowtail in a citrus, thai-style broth, and also the Scallops on Orzo. The scallops were delicate and the orzo tasted so much like risotto, we couldn't believe it. No complaints on the food.

Service on the other hand, that's why they lose a star! The first time we visited, we made a reservation and despite being there on time (the hostess didn't see us), she went ahead and seated a walk-in before us. We ended up waiting 45-50 mins, and we wanted to try the food so it was fine, but it buts a bit of a damper on the evening. When we sat down we were served water by a waiter who literally looks like he is in pain to be there. I mean, complete grimace on his face, doesn't smile, say hi, nothing. Our waitress was fine, nothing outstanding, but did her job. 

The second time we came for NYE, this time with a reservation again. We were made to wait outside by the owner/hostess in the cold because there were too many people in the tiny corridor by the tables. Again, we were ON TIME, yet made to wait around 15-20 mins, for no reason. I'm fine with making a reservation and them sticking to it, but if that's the case, hold yourself accountable and seat the customer on time. Guess what? We're served by the same waiter, with the SAME grimace on his face. Looks so unhappy to be there and just doesn't muster up a hello or even a smile. Our waitress was quite nice, which was a nice relief. 

Management really needs to re-check it's staff personalities, maybe some ice-breakers or something? And not being held to my reservation time is getting really old. Will I be back for the food thought? For sure. I just hope next time this bus boy greets me with a smile...though I won't hold my breath.
author: Varun B.

description:
Amazing food
Amazing presentation
Great service
Great speed (I've never been served food so fast)

Satisfied all around!!!!
author: Dalia K.

description:
Likes: wasabi noodles with salmon was good, better to get this for lunch instead of dinner because it's about the same stuff but you're paying different prices

Dislikes: Restaurant is small so expect to wait in line outside
author: Karen M.

description:
a dear friend suggested this restaurant when we were in town for just a few days..so many places to choose from but so glad this is where we ended up. I called last minute and not only got a reservation but we got the PERFECT table (second from the window). We LOVED everything. We are heading back to SF in October and will be back to dinner at The House.
We can't wait!
author: candy l.

description:
Came there again for dinner on a Wednesday. Our reservation was 6:30pm and we were seated right the way. 

The waitress was so friendly and helpful. 

We ordered: 

Grilled ahi tuna (rare) with spicy mustard aioli (5/5) - It was delicious! The presentation of the dish was nice and the tuna was fresh. I really like the sushi rice on the side. Very good combination. 

Pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce (5/5) - Again, it was so good. The pork chop was so tender and juicy. The sauce was flavorful but not too heavy. The portion was good too. 

Can't wait to go back to try other stuffs beside pork chop!
author: Liza T.

description: It was worth the 45 minute wait on a late Wednesday night. The three scallops we got in our appetizer were as good as any this Midwesterner has eaten. I also thoroughly enjoyed my main course, the halibut special. I felt a strong urge to go back during my trip, though I didn't make it.
author: Paul B.

description:
I looove love love Asian Fusion and The House did not disappoint :)

My boyfriend & I decided to have our "Valentine's Day" dinner here a week before the actual day to skip out on all the hoopla & crazy crowds. I'm glad we chose The House...the service was great, ambiance was nice & most importantly, the food was delicious. For our appetizer, we got the Oysters on the 1/2 shell with Thai salsa & for our entrees I ordered their signature Grilled Seabass and my boyfriend got one of the specials of the day: Braised Pork Shoulder with Foie Gras. 

The oysters were sooo fresh and the salsa complemented the dish well, it added a little spice which was nice. My Seabass was a pretty big portion and it came with sugar snap peas & homemade soy garlic noodles. Everything on the plate was delicious and the fish was perfectly cooked...like everyone on here says, it melted like buttaah! But the highlight of our visit was definitely my boyfriend's dish...I was soooo jealous! I kept on going back for more and more!! The pork had really great flavor, the foie gras was to diieee for and it was sitting in a KIMCHEE CURRY BROTH. Yessss, it was unbelievable! We also ordered a couple of Lychee Black Iced teas which were refreshing and tasty too.

I can't wait till my next visit here! Next time I'm ordering dessert & I'll have my fingers crossed they'll still have that special dish my boyfriend ordered *drrroooool*.
author: Faye G.

description: Everything we are for dinner was delicious, highly recommend the ahi tuna dish! The pork ribs were also a fantastic. And to add to the already great experience the waitstaff was attentive and very friendly! Definitely coming back again.
author: Katherine H.

description: I love, love, love the house.  It's my favorite place to feast when I'm in San Francisco and I've been going there since the late 90's.  The food has always been consistently great and friends I've referred to have all had a great experience there.  The place is small so make sure to make reservation if you want to give it a try.
author: Happy L.

description:
Don't be fooled by the fresh modern interior and sleek decor, this place has been here 18 years! And for GREAT REASON!

For appetizers, we ordered the Deep-fried salmon roll with chinese hot mustard, and the Asparagus with roasted sesame dressing. I typically don't like fried appetizers, but this one was great. The salmon was slightly cooked and only lightly fried, allowing you to taste more of the salmon than the fried shell. The Asparagus was sliced into bite size bits, with a pungent and tangy flavor.
author: Miles H.

description:
It had been years since I had been here for dinner, and I don't know why I waited so long!  This place has been around for a reason because it's cozy, homey with nice service and food that is sooooo tasty!  You can see how much care they put into every dish as each one looks like a mini work of art!  

For our July birthdays, Christine and I started out with a shared crab cake that was perfectly crispy on the outside and oh so meaty and tasty on the inside!  Mmm!  We had a hard time picking among the many meat, fish, chicken and seafood entrees on the menu, and plus, they had a good list of specials that made choosing even harder.  

I chose the pork chop with pomegranate sauce -- loooooved it!  Tender, yummy and the pomegranate sauce was nicely complimentary to the pork.  I would definitely order this again.  Then! I had the apple crumble a la mode - if I see a dessert with apple in it on the menu, I am automaticaly drawn to it, and I was not disappointed!  Sweet, crispy with creamy vanilla ice cream - a nice birthday treat!  :)

Definitely make a reservation because this place is relatively small, but it's small enough so that the noise level doesn't get too crazy.  You can catch up with your friends without screaming.  And the service was nice and attentive.

Thank you, House!  I will be back!!
author: Maile N.

description:
A very trendy city guy told me about this restaurant. He said "the house is my favorite restaurant right now". And I thought this was some new fusion joint.

When i finally got around to going, I asked the friendly waitress how long they've been around.  They've been around for years! Like a decade!

But the decor is modern and the menu is interesting.

I noticed a lot of yelpers tried the large sushi roll dish, but I didn't notice it on the menu.  Although, I saw it come out to a different table while I was dining there --- food envy!

The food we DID order was pretty good.  We tried a deep-fried chicken liver with greens.  I like liver and I like deep fried food so this was enjoyable... but it wasn't anything to RAVE about.

The curry noodles were delicious - the curry was flavorful, the veggies also absorbed a lot of the flavor and added texture to this dish.  The noodles combined with the sauce was an ideal comfort food dish, especially on a gloomy day! 

This would be a great spot for a date or for a casual get-together!
author: Christina C.

description:
This is a great place to go on a date - if you don't mind it being a little loud.  It was a really cute and quaint restaurant, very tiny.   You're pretty much elbow to elbow with the table next to you, but the food was so good I think its worth it. 

 Food was good, it was a little over cooked.  We got the fried salmon rolls, which were delicious, but I would have liked a little bit less cooked in the middle.  The dipping sauce was amaazing. I was pleasantly surprised by how good this appetizer was. 

We also ordered...
1) Wasabi noodles with angus steak: Angus steak was coooked perfectly. Wasabi noodles were good, but I didnt taste any wasabi in them what so ever.

2) Mushroom rice with grilled prawns: This was amazing. Doesn't sound amazing but trust it was delicious. Rice was cooked really well and the sauce was very flavorful. Prawns were fresh.

3)Niman ranch pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce: This dish was okay to me.  Nothing spectacular.

OH and for desert. ---creme brulee with this tangy mango sauce? it was amaaazing. Creme brulee had a great texture and the sauce on top had a nice kick to it. 

Price was a little steep for me...but it wasn't too bad considering the amount of food they give and how yummy it was =]
author: Christine N.

description:
This place was amazing! I made a reservation for 9pm and it was rather busy! I will say the place is small and gets a bit loud, and I'd definitely never try to come here without a reservation, but the food was definitely worth checking out!

We started off with the fried salmon rolls with hot mustard. Now, I love spicy things, but one dip into this mustard left me reaching for my lychee iced tea. (Though, lesson not learned, as I kept dipping!)

I then had the black cod with california rolls. This was beyond amazing. I have never had fish this flaky and perfect and melt-in-your-mouth amazing! The sauce that came with the fish was also perfect - a little spicy, a little sweet and a lot delicious.

I would definitely come back here (and possibly order more cod, though I know I should actually try new things).
author: Maria G.

description:
We were here for a conference function, and the sea bass was as good as reviewed. It has to be eaten with the seasoning in order to appreciate the full flavor. 

Crab cakes were good. Truffle cake is like brownie on steroids...amazing!
author: Thomas L.

description:
It was good food but will I come back? Depends. If it's just a small party of 2-4 of picky eaters, I might.

The House offers pretty solid Asian fusion meal, which is a pretty rare find. Asian fusion dishes are usually over-sauced, deep-fried rice based dumplings with some weird western ingredients like mayo/creamcheese. Fortunately, this wasn't the case here, although some items on the menu might sound skeptical.

Seabass, the most outstanding dish, was fresh, perfectly cooked and seasoned. The scallops were very fresh and not overcooked as well.  My husband really enjoyed his noodles, and yes, he loves and knows his noodles so his approval should be pretty a valid one. So why not likely to come back?

First of all, parking was extremely challenging. The restaurant is tucked in the middle of North Beach. If you've been in SF at least 3 times, you would know that on weekends, it is almost impossible to find a parking spot regardless how much you're wiling to pay. All garages were full so we had to park far far away and had to walk through the sketchy areas. So why does the number of people matter? The restaurant is very tiny and loud. Although tables are small, it was very hard to hear each other because of the background noise.

Thankfully service was good so overall, I'm giving this place a 4 star review although I hope they'll find a better location with more space soon!
author: Effie G.

description: It was ok. We chose this place based on the reviews. It is totally 2 not even 0.1 more than that. The service was not that good. It was so noisy. The appetizers were 2.5/5. The main food was actually 3.5/5 . I ordered wasabi noodle with steak and I really liked it but it took them a long time to bring our food! The portions were also so small for the price!! In general I give them 2. And trust me they don't worth more than that.
author: Sara K.

description:
How is it possible that two impossibly delicious restaurants are within a 2 minute walk from my apartment? Ideale and this place, heaven in food form.

Five Stars
The Food. Came here with a few food friends (for my birthday yay) and we all loved the dishes! My preference, from good to awesome.
Sesame Soy Glazed Salmon - I'm a big fan of Salmon, and this dish was cooked well. But maybe because I'm not a big fan of rice, and this dish comes with rice, and the salmon isn't enough to curb a big appetite.
Warm Wasabi House Noodles - For the price, this thing served up a whole lot of steak. More of a guy-dish, I think, since it comes with a bunch of noodles and steak.
Kurobuta Pork Chop - The presentation on this one is quite the showstopper. Tender and carnivore-rific.
Grilled Sea Bass - I'm a huge fan of seafood and this sea bass really nailed it. Perfectly flaky and perfectly tender, order it with the noodles and you're in for a treat. Comes with green beans too - that never happens! 
Salmon Roll (appetizer) - This is a great starter! Unique and the perfectly balance of textures.
Great ambiance, very cute inside and definitely a must try.

Tips
Save space for dessert! They serve up large portions and I was naive enough to finish my main entree.. little did I know how great their desserts looked! Next time for sure.
They always have a similar lunch menu, but with much lower prices. I will be back.
author: Linda X.

description:
Very high quality Asian fusion food with a good variety selection of entrees and appetizers. The wait for the food is long and seating can be cramped when it's busy, but the food more than makes up for it!

My favorites are the unagi (eel) sandwich, wasabi noodles, flat iron steak and salmon spring roll.
author: Philip K.

description:
The next time I'm in SF to the House I go!  Really delicious flavorful food! I'd have to say that of all the dishes, I loved the grilled sea bass the most and it was not even my dish that I ordered out of my party of 5. 

Dinner reservations are a must if your party is big. I ordered the angus flat iron steak cooked to medium rare set on a bed of wasabi flavored noodles. The steak was delicious but the noodles were too much to finish.  The grilled sea bass is to die for. I didn't know sea bass was such a delicious and silky fish to savor! More please!! 
Another friend got the pork chop dish and it was good but nothing spectacular. The Halibut on a bed of mussels in a coconut curry sauce was delicious too but if you take a side of rice drenched with the coconut curry sauce with a squeeze of lemon then your mouth is in for a party! The rice was delicious and mouth watering - albeit my palate is always bias to pickled, tangy, and sour flavors.

Desserts looked delicious but I didn't have any room to try. Until next time!
author: Lendy L.

description:
I came here with a party of 4 before watching Wicked. Like my previous review, this place does everything right. Make sure to make reservations! This place gets packed quick.

5 star service. Our server was very friendly and attentive. She was very patient with us as my party had some difficulty deciding what to order off their delicious menu. They constantly refilled water as needed. Our hostess listed some special items of the day and the moment she mentioned the swordfish with curry, I was immediately sold! 

Swordfish with curry - The meatiest, tastiest, flakiest, melt-in-your-mouth swordfish I've ever had in my life. Major major foodgasm. The curry complemented the swordfish perfectly. Mind you this was a pretty fatty piece and they were very generous about that.

Mango Tapioca - very creamy. not too rich. this was sooo freaking good. i would have definitely loved to order a second....

Their menu changes periodically so I am sad that the swordfish won't make a regular appearance.

**Reminder** 

Make reservations!
author: Desmond T.

description:
This is the kind of place you're taken to or you take a date to

Or people take you here with date in mind, and you're just thinking friend..awkward

Food makes up for it though and you can always smooth over any bumps with a nice glass of wine
author: Whitne Y.

description: Having family dinner hear. Great seasoned dishes but a bit crowded. Mushroom rice and grilled pawns and grilled sea bass were my personal favorites.
author: Xinyi C.

description: Amazing bday dinner! I came here with 9 friends which we were told might not be possible but we got seated right away because we came on a week day and later on in the night at 9 and we got our food fast! I ordered the pork chop and it was amazing! I was extremely happy with my choice and my bf and I ordered an app of asparagus and those were good too my other guests really enjoyed the place as well it was a bit pricey but well worth it! So glad I went here !
author: Kathryn B.

description:
This must have been an off night for The House because I came here before (on my first date with my now husband) and was completely happy with our meal. This time was definitely "meh".

We ordered the deep fried salmon roll and octopus salad to start. The salmon roll was cold. Not even lukewarm. Cold. The octopus salad... maybe had 4 tentacles in it? It was also a bit bland. 

For our entrees, we ordered the wasabi noodles with steak and the pork chop. The noodles were ok, could have used a bit more kick from the wasabi. Steak was cooked pretty well. The pork was cold, completely bland, and had large sections of it that were so charred that they were completely inedible.

We also ordered a couple glasses of wine. One of the wines was a wine we have had many times before and actually have a bottle of at home. Upon first taste it was sparkling. Obviously corked. When we mentioned to our waitress she got very annoyed and actually argued with us, saying she had the same bottle at home too and that's how it is supposed to taste. I wasn't impressed with her attitude. All she had to do was offer my husband a new glass.

We decided to skip dessert.

I am really sad because I remember this place being so good, both food and service-wise. Again, maybe it was an off night or they were just overwhelmed and the quality suffered (it was VERY crowded after all), but I am hesitant to try this place again.
author: Erin B.

description: Had dinner at The House the other night and generally speaking we were happy with the food. I'm deleting one star because the"jumbo" scallops appetizer special mentioned by server consisted of three little scallops the size of a quarter (and therefore was way over-priced at $16.) Thumbs up on the steak with noodles and the miso cod special.
author: B T.

description:
I heard so much about how good the food was at The House, so I had to finally try it for myself.  I needed to pick up something from my friend, so we decided to grab dinner as well.  We were able to get reservations easily on a Wednesday night.  Parking was a breeze, too.  We found a spot 2 blocks up and didn't even have to circle around.

We started off with scallops as our appetizer, I got the Grilled Sea Bass with Garlic Ginger Soy, my friend got the Kurobuta Pork Chop with Pomegranate Currant Sauce, and we finished off with a Coconut Creme Brulee with Passion fruit Puree.

The scallops were very good.  Perfectly seared on the outside and still nice and tender inside.  My sea bass was awesome.  I really liked the garlic ginger soy dipping sauce.  And the sweat peas that came with it were nice and crispy.  My friend kept ranting and raving about how good the pork chop was, so I had a bite. And yes...it really was that good.  The pomegranate currant sauce gave the pork a sweet glaze, and it was nice and moist on the inside.  The passion fruit puree on the creme brulee shocked me with its tartness.  But after I got over that, it went quite well with the coconut flavor of the creme brulee.  

Our waitress gave us good service.  We were seated at the farthest possible table by the window, but we were still checked on regularly.  Our water glasses were always filled and our food came out quickly.

This is a very small place, so make sure you get a reservation.  And be sure to arrive early to look for parking.
author: Patra I.

description:
OVERALL:4.5   FOOD:5   SERVICE:4   AMBIANCE:4.5   VALUE:4.5
I vowed to be strong, to play hard-to-get, to keep it buttoned up--my days of putting out and giving my heart to eateries everywhere were s'pposed to be behind me.  But then along came this cute little number outta nowhere with all kinds of tricks up his sleeves: cozy space, wonderful smells, mad kitchen skills, and before I knew it...*whimper*.... please touch my taste buds there and THERE....and don't stop!!

As much as The House had my knees a-knocking, the Yelparazzi have already thoroughly exposed this hotshot's impressive body of work (Sea Bass, Coconut Creme Brulee), so no need to gush any further about how gorgeous and drool-worthy everything is.  Just give this soft-spoken studmuffin a whirl....EVERYONE will leave sated, glowing, and dreaming of an encore performance.
author: Amy K.

description:
Extremely overrated.  Got the wasabi noodles with steak and was disappointed.  very bland. Sake selection is horrible. But the rice beer was great. 

Service was awful. While our waiter (dory from finding nemo) was really nice, he would literally forget anything we asked him.

My two star rating is based on food. .. if I took into account the service, I'd have to drop it down to 1 star.
author: Prashant C.

description:
The House is a small restaurant serving Asian-fusion and American cuisine, has a casual atmosphere, and tables which are closely arranged (you will be seated intimately near your neighboring patrons and likely hear bits and pieces of their conversations or more).  I've eaten here once so far and everything I tried was delightfully plated and very tasty.

Most memorable was the moist and flavorful sea bass.  Also the mango tapioca pudding (a must!) it was tasty and sweet without being too sweet, just perfect.  I also had the sliced pork and noodles (garlic or wasabi noodles?) - the pork was tender and moist and the noodles were tasty.  I normally don't like or eat pork meat (except bacon) but I make exceptions now and then when it's well prepared and not gamey.

We also had a hamachi appetizer and a soup.  I don't remember the names.  They were both delicious.  There were a lot of other items on the menu which I wanted to try so I'll definitely be going back to explore more dishes and also have the mango tapioca pudding again.  I normally share desserts (like on this visit) but the pudding was so good that I will be greedy and get my own bowl next time.  :)

Service was brisk and efficient (likely because it was packed) though still friendly and helpful.  Reservations are highly recommended especially during peak hours.
author: Bertina N.

description: You will not  be disappointed.  We ordered two appetizers soft shell crab, pan shear scallop.  Three entree  lamb, halibut and unagi   All the dishes were creative.  A nice twist on typical Japanese food.
author: H S.

description: Our new favorite for Asia fusion. Excellent courses across the board. Tiny though, so make reservations.
author: Mith R.

description:
I should have written a review a while back .  I guess today is my yelp day to give all the nice and bad restaurants I have been to recently.  The house was very good,  my friend and I came here few months ago.

We came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch and it was not super crowded.  Sat down immediately.  The restaurant is not big,  a little bit cozy, but its okay.

We ordered the scallop appetizer, it was seared perfectly with matching sauce.  

Sea bass - cook to perfection with tasty sauce on the side 

Kurobuta pork chop was the best,  they cooked to medium.  That was one of the most tender pork chop I've ever had.

Love this place and definitely come back when we have the time.
author: Wasabi L.

description:
I think this place is pretty darn good. I am trying to expand my horizons in the noodle world, so this place is great for that. 

Mussels in miso broth-bland
Clams in spicy broth-Yummy, I could have eaten 2 bowls of this
Curry Udon with veggies & shrimp-Just the right amount of sweetness and crispy veggies

It is a smaller restaurant, so it can get a lil loud, but since I've only been there for lunch it was fine.

Parking is not the easiest, especially with the recent construction going on with the exterior of their building. I would suggest parking at Garage and then walking the couple of blocks over.
author: Eboniña E.

description:
Went there with my gf while visiting San Fran and OMG!!! BEST MEAL OF MY LIFE!  I am definitely not a small man, and I sure as hell know my way around restaurants, but this place destroyed all other asian fusion places for me.  

To start off, we ordered the deep fried salmon rolls with wasabi sauce...AMAZING! My gf ordered the special of the day, cod fish, while I ordered steak on wasabi garlic noodles.  No joke, I still wake up in the middle of the night, salivating over those noodles. SO GOOD. Everything was good. Those noodles, though...

The only downside is that you have to make a reservation because the wait is ridiculous otherwise. But hey, it's sf. The place isn't that big either. Who cares. These two cons are nothing compared to how bomb the food was. In total, we paid around $60, which is well under what I thought the meal was worth. I'll miss you, The House.
author: Jose J.

description: Sooooo good. Super flavorful and fresh. Try the Wasabi noodles with salmon or curry noodles with tofu
author: Alexsandra G.

description:
I thought this place was OUTSTANDING.
Honestly EVERYTHING stood out.
We got a reservation about 45 minutes before we showed up.
We ordered A LOT. The portions were large. Everything was incredibly tasty.
It wasn't as noisy as expected.
I LOVED the salmon spring rolls: mmmmm.
The pork in currants was soooo good too.
The sea bass was so delicate.
And, even the caesar salad knocked my socks off.
When can i return? WHEN WHEN WHEN?!
author: Andrew K.

description:
As soon as you walk into The House, the ambiance of the restaurant is bright, upbeat, and friendly.  I don't usually notice this about a place, but I just got this vibe that everyone there was very ..nice.  It really does kind of make you feel like you're at home!

However, the food was wayyyyy better than I could ever expect to make at home.  Everything on their asian fusion menu looked AMAZING, and I only wish that I could have tried them all!  Everyone at all the tables around me had delicious looking plates as well!

We started off with the hamachi (night special) and octopus salad.  The hamachi came with a delicious avocado topping.  For entrees we ordered the warm wasabi noodles with angus flatiron steak, and the sea bass with garlic ginger soy (+snow peas & rice).  The noodles were good, but the wasabi flavor was really faint, almost non-existent.  I think that if they hadn't been called wasabi noodles (and therefore expecting wasabi), I would be raving more about the noodles.  The steak flavor complemented the noodles well.  I thought the sea bass was cooked to perfection!  Finally, we paired it all off with a delicious Riesling :)

Despite giving this place five stars, there are a few things to know before you go:

- the place is crowded and the restaurant has a fairly small dining area! Make sure to have reservations before you go, otherwise you will wait for a long time!  Despite having a reservation for 7:30, we were greeted by 3 different servers before being seated with about a 10 minute wait.
- Street parking is really hard in the area, and it's right on the border of the red light district, so just be aware of your surroundings.  We parked near Embarcadero/Battery and walked over


What I really liked about the place is how comfortable they make you feel.  It's an upscale restaurant with a lot of suits, but without that super snotty, bougey feeling.  There were casually dressed families sitting next to business-people.  The servers were attentive, and food came out quickly, but I didn't feel rushed at all.  Overall, I am a fan of the food and the service, and definitely look forward to my next visit to the restaurant!
author: Alex R.

description:
I've rarely seen Asian Fusion restaurants work out.
Most of the time they end up being over-priced Chinese restaurants charging $16 for mongolian beef because of the "prime cuts of beef". 
The House came very close to what I felt like an Asian Fusion restaurant should be.

Arrived at 7:30 on Sunday evening, and it was pretty damn packed. Good thing we had reservations, and I'm guessing you need one for dinner on any day. 

We ordered a bunch of small plates, as well as the sea bass dish.

Crab Cakes - Tasted like a deep fried California roll. Horseradish instead of wasabi. Pretty damn good.
Fried Calamari - Breading was ok, dipping sauce was ok. Your usual calamari.
STL Ribs (special) - Great portion. Sauce was a bit on the too sweet side, but good ribs.
Liver and greens salad - Very light and refreshing vinaigrette. Chicken liver was nicely done. 
Seabass - Good portion, well cooked. Green beans were also pretty good. 

One thing I loved was the plates coming quickly, even in a busy restaurant setting. The service was also very good.

I love dining in San Francisco because unlike many other cities, this city has a very abundant and delicious middle priced ($15-25) restaurant scene. The House fully reenforces that statement.
author: Ronny D.

description: We were super lucky tonight. The concierge told me if we could be there in 10 minutes that we could get a table so we rushed over.  We were surprised to see such a small venue but had an amazing experience. The oysters on the half shell and the crab cakes were a must have. Also the ribeye steak and Chilean sea bass were superb. We were disappointed that the bitter chocolate cake was sold out and we couldn't try it. Next time we are in town I hope it us available. I would definitely recommend this spot and would book ahead to guarantee a seat. Well worth the money.  Thank you for making our dinner such a fantastic experience.
author: Shannon M.

description: Everything here was amazing, Pork Chop was succulent and moist. The fish was perfectly cooked not dry with excellent flavor. All of the main courses melt in your mouth. If your going to eat here try to bring friends that love to share. This way you can try many different dishes. I'm pretty sure if I lived near here I would go here daily. Must Try. Not to fond of the creme brûlée, though it was little to sweet for my taste and the custard could have been chilled more. I still give it a 5 star as desert isn't my priority here.
author: Jason M.

description: Great little restaurant tucked away on Grant St.  This one of the best meals we had on our recent visit to San Francisco.  It's a small space, simple but nice.  The waitstaff were pleasant and helpful.  There was an interesting selection of beers and wines.  I had a good, complex Belgian ale.  We split a really good tempura roll to start.  The salad was really good, too.  We had curry noodles with chicken, wasabi noodles with salmon and a tuna BLT.  All were very good to excellent.  The prices were really reasonable.  This was a great, unpretentious change of pace with really good food at great prices.
author: Joel S.

description:
Went to The House for the 5th time in a year yesterday and it still blows me out of the water. Good job at staying consistently great.

Previous visits I have had the miso cod and also love their mushroom rice dish (forget the official name). Recommend them!

Yesterday my friend persuaded me to get the pork chop (which I would not have ordered on my own) and it was AMAZING. You would not think that an "asian fusion" restaurant can make such as delicious pork chop - but they can! Definitely try it.
author: Francine P.

description:
i made a reservation here for a monday night, came late but got seated right away.

Ordered the 
scallop appetizer special with lemon ponzu sauce. good
steamed mussels was ok
asparagus was good
seabass was a little burnt but you cant really go wrong with sea bass.
and fresh lemonade was good not to sweet not to sour

this place is usually packed with girls but this time we got seated in between a bunch of old guys. oh wells 

service was ok since they were busy, we didnt get out waters refilled.

i would go back if my friends wanted to check it out.
author: DOM d.

description:
5 Stars is strictly for their Rib-Eye Steak

FOOD: 
I went on several occasions now, and was able to try their deep fried salmon roll (decent, would not order again), pork-chops (recommended), and Rib-Eye(It's the ONLY sole reason I go there now.) It's the best I've ever had, if you enjoy steaks, don't waste your time or money on anything else. 

AMBIANCE: Very tight and cramped. Even if you dine in a table of two, expect to be able to hear your neighbors conversations. I would say each table is spaced less than 2 feet a part. 

SERVICE: Was decent, the waiters will name their daily specials upon your seating. Sometimes it can range to about 7 specials. I don't know about you.. but I can't memorize things that quick. I wish they had a print out on a simple page rather than naming so many. No other worthy notes, the service is what you can expect, nothing personal. 

PARKING: Sucks. Be lucky, or else you'll be circling for quite some time. Try to take public transit if possible.
author: Austin N.

description:
Love The House.  Loved it when it was on 9th Ave and Lincoln years ago.  Just recently got reacquainted with it in North Beach.
Everything that I've tried there is delicious.  Certainly the sea bass is the signature plate, but I tried two of the specials-of-the-day recently and was delighted with both.  Appetizers and desserts are also delicious.  My lychee iced-tea was only meh.
Downsides are (1) difficult area to get to for dinner with all the one-way streets and crazy traffic, (2) very small dining room so everyone is packed in and people keep bumping your chair (or your bag that you hang on your chair).
Upside is one of the best seafood meals you can get in SF.  We entertained friends from Miami at House and they're still raving about it months later...
author: Cynthia C.

description: Bday dinner in north beach at one of the more finer Asian fusion restaurant in da city had for starters pan fried scallops with micro greens frickin awesome for dinner had the Washington noodles over ribeye steak again awesome.service was at their best. I will highly recommend this fine eatery to all
author: George E.

description: Excellent. By far one of the Top 10 restaurants I've been to in San Francisco. It's so excellent that for once I don't have much to expand on except for the fact I've been here several times and every dish I've had has been amazing.
author: Monica M.

description:
The House has never let me down. I used to eat at the Judah location all the time before they shut down. For this location, it's a bit of a pain for parking at times. Their special menus are always good. The chilean sea bass or now it's probably just plain bass now... is spot on. Love their Cal-Asian fusion.

Family owned
author: Sandra L.

description:
This is my stand out favorite restaurant in San Francisco. It's casual and somewhat loud, but the food is way better than most restaurants in this price range in San Francisco. 

You can usually get a 10PM reservation same day, call at least a few days in advance for a reservation at a more typical dining hour.
author: Kevin F.

description:
My first time at The House, I was told the Grilled Sea Bass with Garlic Ginger Soy is their standout dish so it was a no-brainer as to my entree selection being the seafood lover that I am.

It was wooonderful! The sea bass was grilled to perfection and it had a soft, buttery texture. The fish was accompanied by a side of noodles and green beans. There is already a lot of flavor to the fish but you can add more of the ginger garlic soy. The Tuna Tartare appetizer was also delicious. 

That was over a year ago but I've been back recently and the grilled sea bass is just as great as I remembered it to be. For the appetizer this time, we had the seared foie. It had a nice sear on the outside and the softness inside just melted in my mouth. It was served on iceberg lettuce with a vinaigrette which worked really well to balance the richness of the foie. So simple yet so good.
author: Cyndi G.

description:
When: June 1, 2011
Location: 1230 Grant Ave in SF
Company: My boyfriend, Chris! Celebrating our 11 month Anny! =)
Crowd: Couples, Business Type People....
Vibe: Peaceful and Serene
Cuisine: Asian Fusion
Loved: FOOD and Service!!
Hate: Nothing!  
Service: Excellent!
$$$: $90.00 for 2

Side note: I collect reciepts of places my boyfriend and I go to when we celebrate something special. This place only got 4 stars just because they gave us a handwritten receipt, besides that I would of given them 5 stars!

I had the Ceaser Salad with Scallops and the Seabass! OMG! I'm still thinking about the food! Seabass was amazing! So tender, it basically melted in my mouth! 

My boyfriend had the steak salad with Mango salsa and the Halibut with some kind of curry sauce.. 

The food was so damn good that we went home with NO leftovers!!

The food and company was a great combination.. I had an outstanding evening at this place!
author: Darlene M.

description:
Excellent meal!

Salmon Roll had some wasabi fire to it and very crisp.

The Shrimp dumplings were okay, very light a delicate.

The wasabi noodles with Beef was excellent. Beef was cooked perfectly, sauce was spicy. 

Lived up to Fusion Theme!
author: Sky M.

description:
Had a terrific meal at The House.  Appetizers were off the charts great -- I'm not even a big fan of asparagus, but this one was great.  And the soft shell crab special appetizer was off the charts --  a spectacular presentation, and it was delicious.  Main courses were equally good -- we had the chicken, and the seared tuna.  All 4 dishes were interesting, complex, presented beautifully....they exceeded my high expectations.  Only the dessert -- a mousse like "chocolate pot" -- was average.  And while the food wasn't cheap (dinner for two with a $60 bottle of wine was $130 total plus tip), for food this good I think it's a great value.  

Now for the caveats -- this is not a romantic, spacious restaurant.  It's very small, with the tables very close to each other.  It's not fancy -- the decor is simple, not a dive but not real upscale either.  And this is not a place to linger -- though the place was full, the food came out at lightning speed, even with wine and appetizers and dessert we were in and out in an hour...they clearly want to turn over the tables quickly given the small space, if you're trying to make a show, it's great but some people might feel a little rushed by the pace here.  

Public parking lot off the alley behind the restaurant was nice.
author: Rob C.

description: I usually have trouble finding a tasty restaurant that's not over $50 per person.  I have to say that The House is an ideal place.  While being a bit small, it makes up for it in huge taste.  My wife and I ordered the flat-iron steak and the curry noodles with prawns. Those dishes should have costed $25 per plate and would have at other SF restaurants, but they were about half that amount.  The salad was fantastic and the dessert capped off the ideal lunch!  I definitely recommend and hope that the next time we come here, the tables won't be too filled up with all of you Yelpers! :)
author: Louis B.

description: It was really disappointing to call and make a reservation for a group of food enthusiasts, only to be told the large group reservation (6 people) was lost. They didn't seem too concerned with apologizing or working something out with us. We've been visiting and reviewing restaurants one a month for over 4 years and have never had such terrible service. We ended up at a friendlier location just down the street :-)
author: chinyere w.

description:
Food: 4
Decor: 3
Service: 3

Came here with a group of 7 for dinner on a Thursday night, around 9:15pm.

1. Deep-Fried Salmon Roll with cheese hot mustard, 9
~Really good. Roll was fried perfectly, and the hot mustard made it quite spicy.

2. Deep-Fried Chicken Liver with baby greens, 8
~Pretty good. Liver taste wasn't terribly overpowering, and the greens complemented nicely.

3. Ahi Tuna Tartare with roasted nori chips, 10
~Really good and nice presentation. Perfect 3-4 bite-sized chips with tartare.

4. Yellowtail sashimi special
~Really good. Sashimi was very fresh, and the salsa complemented very well.

5. Warm Wasabi House Noodles with angus flatiron steak, 18
~Mediocre. Noodles were pretty good, but the medium rare steak was too hard to chew.

6. Grilled Sea Bass with garlic ginger soy, 26
~Really good. Sea bass was cooked perfectly and was amazing with the garlic ginger soy. Noodles were decent, and the veg was okay.

Service was okay, although my water was empty at the end of my meal.
author: David L.

description:
Sesame soy glazed salmon: with Chinese gailan vegetable, bed of rice, topped with seaweed.   $16

Flat Iron Steak: shitake, tomatoes, bed of creamy mashed potatoes, chard.  Ordered it rare and came out perfect,  tender and a niiiice pink color, good flavor.  A definite winner. $15

Kale salad (special): blue cheese, pistachio, sesame seeds.  $13?  My first time trying kale but, sauteed, I really enjoyed it!  A small appetizer size.

Scallop appetizer:  horseradish and some sprouts, drizzled in sauce.  You get three scallops topped with some greens but it was oh so tasty.  Not rubbery or chewy at all.  Super cute looking too!

I don't think you can really go wrong here. :)
author: Lindsay L.

description:
The house was recommended by so many locals that my trip to San Fran wouldn't have been complete without a visit. Maybe it was because of all the hype but I wasn't "blown away" by my experience. 

To start we got the fried salmon rolls, which were very tasty. I was excited to try them and I was not disappointed. I then got the flank steak w/ wasabi noodles which was good but nothing amazing. With all the positive reviews I might have set my expectations a little too high, but I thought the noodles were a little mushy and I could barely taste the wasabi. My bf got the kobe beef special which he enjoyed. 

I thought the portions were generous and I could barely finish my noodles. I really wanted to love the house, but something was missing for me. In my opinion the house is more of a 3.5, but with soooo many positive reviews it might have been an off night.
author: Erica M.

description:
Three visits, three dinners, three of the best meals I've had in San Francisco.

A few tips:
* Make a reservation (obviously...)
* Warm wasabi house noodles will make you melt
* If soft shell crab is in season, get it
* Sparkling shiraz is sexy
author: Caroline M.

description: The kobe skirt steak with truffle reduction is absolutely DELICIOUS...so TENDER and comes with perfectly crunchy cauliflower with some kind of mayo on it. And rice/mashed potatoes. And the buttery truffle reduction soaking into everything. Oh my...just delicious!!
author: Jessica C.

description: Recommended by friends in New York that went to The House. Absolutely the best dinner I had in San Francisco. The Grilled Sea Bass and Kurobuta Pork Chop was my favorite entrees, and Ahi Tuna Tartare for appetizer will not disappoint you.
author: Mo M.

description:
The menu at The House should say "Sorry for Partying" on the top in bold letters because the food here brings a party in your mouth (to use a cliche.)  

The food at this restaurant (and it's all about the food) could easily command prices 50% to 100% higher if it was served in a nicer space in smaller portions with a high-end fine dining vibe.  As such, I believe The House is one of the better restaurant values in San Francisco.  

We had the:

Tempura Beans - Crispy outside, tender inside (like I like my men) well seasoned with a delicious sauce.  Simple and well executed.  

Crispy Salmon Roles - Again, crispy outside with perfectly cooked mid-rare pacific salmon on the inside.  The hot mustard dipping sauce complemented well.

Kubota Pork Chop - Cooked to medium, juicy, and served with a pomegranate and currant sauce. 

Yellowtail Special - Rare cooked yellowtail that seriously melted in the mouth.  Served with a take on a california roll.

Apple Crumb Pie - Good but hard to remember after the amazing dishes we had before it.

Would recommend all dishes we ordered.  As a tip, everything we had here (minus the yellowtail) was so well seasoned and bold from a flavor standpoint that they would pair well with a more robust wine than typically chosen for dishes made with the same ingredients.  

I'm still surprised that we only spent ~$150 before tip (including a $50 bottle of wine.)

Make a reservation and come a few minutes early.
author: C D.

description: Decided to try this restaurant while spending a quick weekend getaway up in SF. It's a relatively small space that fills up pretty fast so I would recommend making a reservation if you don't have a whole lot of time to wait or simply impatient.  Finding parking was just plain horrible in this area but we managed to find a spot. Arrived at 6pm and the restaurant was pretty much full. Luckily I had made a reservation so scored a table right by the front window. Ordered a Caesar salad and the sea bass dish. Both were very tasty. Food was perfect portion for me. Will definitely go back if ever in the neighborhood.
author: Mary N.

description:
The best dinner (and dessert) I have had in San Francisco-- now that is saying a lot!

House noodles: delicious. 
Grilled Sea Bass: AMAZING
Ahi Tuna Tartar: out of this world. 

Then we tried three different desserts. They are all so good. You cannot go wrong. (Especially Creme Brulee) 

I cannot wait to go back
author: Fallon R.

description: A little close in terms of personal space, but the food was incredible.  My favorite had to be the soft-shell crab appetizer.  Presentation was excellent!  Overall, a great meal, great wine, and great company! I'll be back!
author: Lisa I.

description: Not sure what all the rave is about...I had the yellowtail sashimi, fried salmon, and wasabi noodles with pork....it was all just ok. The complimentary cucumber is yummy though. The place is tiny.  Didn't feel it was worth the $55 bill.  The staff is friendly.
author: Madison M.

description:
We thought the food was very, very good overall. The black cod special was excellent. The House noodles with steak are consistently great. The noodles are spicy, salty, and savory, while the meat itself is a nice accompaniment.
