The little lady got Ahi tuna and gave it a big thumbs up. I got the noodles which didn't even need the beef, but I still ate all of it. I'm not a monster. I was surprised how generous the portions were. 

Seating is tight and the place is a little loud, but the service was perfect and we're going to return for the Sea Bass which looked fairly spectacular.

The option of a take away dessert cookies is an awesome idea. We got them but were too full to eat them when we got home.

I'm taking a star off because we sat by the door and all the traffic was a distraction, but I'd like to give it 4.5 stars.
author: Neil C.

description: The food here was AMAZING!  (5 stars) But really expensive! The service was horrible! (3 stars) I made reservations at 8:30 and I didn't get to my table til 10! The place is really really small. There is a lot of people there especially on holidays. But other than that you must try their food, it's delicious !
author: Leilani P.

description:
The House lives up to its hype! The funny thing I noticed about good Asian restaurants is they are located next to some shady looking places. The House can be hard to find but just look for the pink lingerie shop. You can't miss that! The inside of this place is very crowded. It's like sardines packed into a can here. Most be because they are very popular and the small-ish restaurant they have.

== Food ==

The presentation of the food here is quite amazing.

Tuna tartare is great. Quite delicious. Chopped chunks of tuna on an interesting triangle chip.

Fried calamari was alright, but there's nothing special about it. Just like any plain old fried calamari you can get any where.

Kurobuta pork chop is amazing! It's really juicy and soft and very tasty. It comes as a piece of pork on a bone with a side of mashed potatoes and some sort of chip. The chips kind of look like bunny ears especially when they're placed pointing up in the mash potatoes. There's an interesting sauce they used. It's like a Chinese bbq pork sauce. This is my favorite dish.

Wasabi noodle with flatiron steak. The noodles are a bit spicy and pretty good. The steak wasn't so great at all. It was pretty good over all.

Chicken something. I forget the name, but it was pretty juicy and the sauce was tasty.

== Service ==

Service was good. The food came out hot and really quickly and they cleared the dishes really quickly also. It seems like they try to get people in and out as quickly as possible without actually pushing you out. It's pretty nice overall to get the food quick.

== Overall ===

This place lives up to the hype! The food is simply amazing and delicious. Only down side is it's very crowded here, but they take reservations so it's all good. There wasn't an empty table so it'll probably be hard to get in without one.
author: Steven B.

description: The food was REALLY good. Tried a bit out of everyone's plate and it was all delicious and well made. Only problem is the restaurant is TINY. Expect to wait for a long time, especially without a reservation. I would definitely come back though!
author: Wynn C.

description:
Came here for my husband's birthday and had a wonderful time. We had reservations (which you should absolutely make) and were seated promptly at our reservation time. Service was excellent and food was delicious!

Here are the dishes we tried (rated on scale of 1-5):
Scallops special appetizer - 5 - OMG heaven in your mouth. Hands down the best scallops I've ever had.
Deep fried salmon roll - 4 - really delicious, but a little heavy for my taste
Sea bass - 4 - wonderful, tender and flaky. I've had equally good sea bass elsewhere also though....so not that novel.
Pork chop - 4 - cooked to perfection. I don't love sweet sauces but decided to try to this anyway, if you like sweet sauces this will probably be a 5 in your book.
Tapioca - 4 - sweet, creamy, mango yumminess

In summary, you can't go wrong with anything you order here. That said, I wouldn't wait an hour in line to eat here again, but I'd definitely come back with reservations! (Is there really anything that's worth waiting an hour for?)
author: Alicia B.

description:
What else can I say?
As every other reviewer said...the Sea Bass is fantastic! 
We also ordered the oysters (ok/good), crab cakes (super delicious), and the steak with wasabi noodles (also amazing)

Thanks boyfriend for the wonderful experience here!
author: Natasha I.

description:
The food is just as good as everyone raves!

Its a small place so make sure to make a reservation. Come hungry and order fish, it is delicious!
author: Sara M.

description:
It's a SIN and a huge disservice to yourself if you haven't tried this place yet... I considered leaving an essay-style review, but there's already enough of that available to you.  I'm here to tell you that after 6 years, this is STILL my favorite restaurant in SF.  It's by no means cheap, but it's a STEAL for the consistency, quality, presentation, and service.  So for the price, it's darn hard to beat!
For my entree, I've only ever gotten the Kurabuta pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce because it's THAT good.  I've tried most of their other entree offerings from the plates of friends and I was no where near disappointed.  
As for the appetizers, try them all!
As for the desserts, try them all! (I would especially recommend the coconut creme brulee with passion fruit puree)
If you get an appetizer, entree, and dessert, you're looking at ~$60 a person after tax and tip.  GET AT THIS PLACE!  Regardless of party size, be sure to make a dinner reservation.  For larger parties, 6 or more, do it about a week in advance.
author: Christopher L.

description: Best asian restaurant I've been to in years! I had the oysters and two special small dishes--the shitake soup and the seared scallops. Amazing flavor for all. The soup wasn't too thick or creamy, and the citrusy sauce was aperfect complement for the scallops. My entree was the sea bass with garlic noodles--yum! Definitely opt for the noodles instead of rice. And for dessert, the creme brûlée is the more popular dish, but the mango tapioca was better! Sweet and tangy!
author: Maria M.

description:
Unique, delicious, Asian Fusion cuisine! No frills decor in a casual small space, but a very refreshing change of pace from other 4+ star restaurants in the city. The food was phenomenal, and could be offered at a much higher price if it was served in a more upscale setting...but I like it just the way it is. Efficient service, and delicious food at fair prices. 

TIPS: If you're walking in, expect a wait. You can't go wrong with the Salmon Egg Rolls to start, and the Pork Chop or Sea Bass for your main dish! And don't forget to taste everybody's dishes at your table...you won't want to miss out on any of these delicious flavors!
author: Matt D.

description:
I highly recommend this place! Food is always amazing and consistent!
Must have starters: oysters, salmon rolls, and mussels.
Entree : Sea bass with garlic noodles. The sea bass is cook to perfection, nice and buttery that melts in your mouth! Finish it off with the mango tapioca pudding! Guaranteed you will be satisfied!
author: Vicky N.

description:
My friend's mother made reservations here a week ahead and heard it was good. The first time I came here was I believe about five years ago. I don't remember much from then,but I did remember the restaurant was small and we waited for a while. I've heard even though you have reservations you might have to wait for a while, about 30mins. Without reservations you could be waiting for easily 2 hours. So I suggest making reservations.

Parking is always crazy so after we found a spot we headed to The House. It was pouring rain so we got seated right away. So if it's pouring rain, it's a good time to go. We were seated and immediately served drinks. They give you a small plate of cucumber pieces soaked in vinager that was really good. Only thing is that they charge you if you want more. We ordered our food right away. My girlfriend ordered the seabass, which sounded like the most popular according to yelp. Her mother ordered the steak, and I ordered the Ono. 

The Ono was delicious and looked like a scuplture. The seabass was delicious with the yummy mashed potatoes. The green beans however were not so great. With my meal I had the lychee black ice tea and it made my meal taste better. 

For dessert we ordered the coconut creme brulee, chocolagte truffle cake, and the apple crisp. My favorite was the apple crisp because it was warm and delicious with the vanilla ice cream. The creme brulee was good, except for some burnt parts on the sugar top. The chocolate truffle cake was a little too rich for me, but it was perfect for my girlfriend's mother so she ate it.

Overall service was good. I've heard from friends and family that they haven't gone back because of the horrible service from their last visit. I on the other hand had great service and a great meal. It's on the pricey side so its good to go every once in a while.
author: Garrett L.

description: Forget about driving here, you'll find it difficult to find parking. Place is tiny and food was ok, probably cause of the rude customer service I experienced over the weekend. If I wanted poor customer service at an asian fusion restaurant, I would have taken my money elsewhere for 1/2 the cost. I had the sea bass with their garlic noddles and beans ($27) and my friend had the salmon ($25). Both dishes was not bad, but not memorable where it's like "wow!, this is the best dish I ever had".  I wouldn't go out of my way to go here again.
author: Lynnda T.

description:
I took Adam here for his 20th birthday. For the appetizer dish, we shared the deep-fried salmon roll with Chinese hot mustard. I anticipated this dish the most because he always bragged about how delicious it is. He was right, it tasted amazing. However, I wasn't a big fan of the Chinese hot mustard. It reminded me too much of wasabi. For the main entrees, he ordered the rib-eye, while I ordered the Niman ranch pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce. The thick cut of pork chop was cooked perfectly and the sauce complemented the meat well. His rib-eye was also cooked perfectly - it was so tender and juicy. The mashed potatoes that came with it had the right amount of fluffiness, not overly whipped or mushy.

$70 including tax and tip. It might sound kind of pricey but this is probably (hands down) one of the top three restaurants I have ever ate at.
author: Annie S.

description:
The best "asian-fusion" themed food I've had yet in San Francisco. Make a reservation for The House or be prepared to wait. This is destination dining at its finest with very limited seating. 

Came here with 3 other people for dinner on Saturday night at 9:30 PM. I'd been wanting to come here for a long time and nearly didn't make it! Those North Beach streets confuse a directionally challenged girl like me (yes, even with my GPS). 

I shared the calamari with kimchee (seasoned to perfection) and the mushroom and truffle oil soup. I almost died the soup was so good. For my main entree I had the wasabi noodles with flat iron steak. A little over-seasoned, but not to the point of being too salty for me. Those who prefer more subtle-flavors, be weary of the noodle dishes. As for dessert, I shared to mango panna cotta. It was heavenly, 'nough said. 

Come here for a change of pace in North Beach. There's more there than just italian food.
author: Patricia Q.

description:
As the majority of San Franciscans, I am a foodie! Period! Not to say I am obese, but food makes me happy, and The House is definitely a place to make anyone happy. 

Where to start? Better yet, where not to start; the menu is small but encompasses different dishes to satisfy you pallet. Having gone two weekends in a row, I have to admit, the food did not lose it ground. 

Having their weekend special of kobe beef with truffel sauce was spectacular...

First off, the salmon rolls- delicate, great texture, simply delicious. I recommend this dish if you love seafood. 

Deep fried chicken liver with baby greens....spectacular. Not a huge fan of chicken liver, but this is more of a salad than anything and the touch of vinaigrette sauce adds the simplicity to cut the grease (little of what there is) from the chicken liver. In simple form, elegant chicken nuggets with salad.

Crab cakes....flaky and moist....the sauce compliments it perfectly. 

Had two other appetizers but too much to describe. 

Main course: Rib-eye vs. kobe beef..... winner: rib-eye. I had the kobe beek while my brother ordered the rib-eye (not a big fan of rib-eye) but the piece I did try off his place was incredible. It completely changed my mind about ribeye....another contender to the challenge is the kurobuta pork chop, unfortunately they ran out on the second weekend I went, but awesome; highly recommend it to pork lovers. 

Recommendation to anyone, make reservation... small casual spot but food is awesome, bit on the pricey side for how casual patrons dress.
author: Sergio H.

description: The House is an excellent Asian fusion foodie spot. There wasn't one dish I didn't love. We first started with the fried salmon roll that reminded me a lot of lumpia or spring rolls. I wasn't really in the mood for it and wanted something healthy at the time but once I had a bite, it had my taste buds salivating for more. After that, I had the Singapore curry noodles. It had the right amount of spice and the noodles were cooked perfectly. I wish there were a little more veggies but that's okay. It didn't stop me from devouring it and licking my plate clean. Washing it down with a bottle of white French wine and we were set.
author: Celia C.

description:
This was one of my favorite places for Asian fusion that I have tried in SF.  I visited SF this past weekend and a couple of friends recommended this place.  

It's a small restaurant w/ very little tables.  Luckily, we came in before the lunch rush so we were able to get a table for our party of 6.  After we sat, the lunch crowd came in and every table was filled.  

We started with the salmon egg rolls.  I'm not going to lie, I was a little reserved about trying it b/c I don't like sashimi type fish.  The salmon was actually seared, and pretty much cooked.  It was much better than I thought it would be.  I would definitely order this again.

I ordered the sea bass.  Although a little more pricey than most of the other lunch options, it was hands down, the best dish of our entire group.  The ginger sauce was light on the ginger and the ginger pieces sort of fall to the bottom; so, since I don't really like ginger, I completely avoided it.  The sea bass was served on a bed of shanghai noodles and string beans that were both done just right.  The sea bass was well flavored and not dry.  Most importantly, it melted in your mouth! soooooo goood!

One of my friend's had the wasabi noodles.  It was the same type of shanghai noodles that I had but with a hint of wasabi.  If you like wasabi, then you would like it.  2 of my other friends ordered the Korean short ribs.  It was pretty good but a little sweet.  My sister had the curry noodles.  It is good if you shared b/c you can get sick of it after awhile.  My other friend had a pork sandwich.  The pork was well flavored and not dry at all.  

For dessert, we had a pecan pumpkin pie and mango tapioca.  Both were excellent.  The pie was not too sweet and had a condensed milk sauce around it.  the mango tapioca was refreshing and light.  

The service was not bad.  The waitress came back to get us refills on our drinks and to check up on us even though it seemed that they were a little understaffed.  


Great food.  My next trip to SF, I would have to make sure to go back.  My friends all said that the place is packed for dinner; even w/ reservations, they said that they still wait for about 30 mins.  So, make sure to make reservations for dinner.
author: Catherine T.

description: As perfect as pan-asian food can get. Well worth the weird reservation time. However, the salmon egg rolls were a little overrated. There were far more delicious things on the menu
author: Vivienne L.

description: What can I say? There is a reason this place is so popular. It sure isn't the small restaurant's interior. The service is okay. But, the food is simply spectacular! So many of us want to eat here. Maybe they should expand or open a second place. It would be great if the environment wasn't so crowded. Felt like I was constantly being jostled.  As uncomfortable as the seating  may be, it's still worth it because the food is so incredibly delicious. p.s. This is not an appropriate place to bring kids under 5.
author: REN S.

description:
What I AteI 
- Maine crab cake
- Deep-fried salmon roll
- Ahi tuna tartare
- Angus ribeye steak
- Apple pie crunch w/ vanilla ice cream

Would I Go Again?
I would go again, but I don't consider The House as San Francisco "must."  With that said, the food and flavors were innovative.  The crab cake was delicious--my favorite part of the meal.  The salmon roll was unique, and the tuna tartare had a good "fresh" flavor.  I was mostly disappointed with the ribeye steak and mashed potatoes.  I thought the steak was kind of dry and the mashed potatoes were plain.  The apple crunch was good...nothing special but good.  The food and atmosphere at The House are enough for me to give it a second try, but I don't think I will order the ribeye again.
author: Ben M.

description:
Ok. As my yelpers have said, this place does not disappoint!!!!

Came here with hubby for our anniversary dinner last night and everything was good!

We had: 
steamed mussels
Calamari
Salmon Rolls
Sea Bass
Chocolate Cake

The mussels were good. I really liked the shrimp sauce. I wished it came with a piece of bread or something so I can soak up all the sauce.

Calamari was good too. Not overly battered. 

Salmon Rolls were nice and crunchy. The inside was hot! The wasabi dip was a little too salty for my taste tho.

The sea bass was OH SO GOOD. It just melted in my mouth. I love how the outside is nice and crispy, but the inside is so soft!!! 

The chocolate cake is good cuz it was semi-sweet. The coffee ice cream wasnt that strong, but for some reason, it was really good.

Price here are definitely reasonable! We expected to spend over $100 for dinner but did not! 

We had no reservations but she took us in if we could finish our meal in an hour (right when they opened). The food came out so fast, we only took 45 minutes to eat!
author: Mai H.

description:
Brought my bf here for his bday.  We had the pork chop and steak with wasabi noodles.  The food is good but not awesome? I was expecting a lot more given the 2000+ yelp reviews.  The portion is not bad.

I made a reservation but still waited for about 20 min.  This place is small, but very packed.  There was a couple who didn't make reservation and ended up waiting for about an hour for a table.

The waitress wasn't that friendly, she seemed mad.

Overall, the quality of the food doesn't justify the long wait, price tag, and the 2000+ reviews.  Probably won't come back again.
author: nancy c.

description:
This casual restaurant serves outstanding food at moderately expensive, but very fair prices.  The menu changes depending upon what's available; I've never had a disappointing dish in my many visits to The House.   Parking can be difficult during the week (try parking 2-3 blocks south after 5 PM), but a short walk will be generously rewarded !

One of San Francisco's best finds.  Highly recommended.
author: Local R.

description:
Never failed to amaze me.  Seriously, I have been there on numerous occasions and that place never fails me. 

Here's what we had.
Fried Chicken liver with salad - Liver was not gamey and was very well seasoned. The salad was a little bit over dressed but was not heavy.

Wagu beef salad with papaya, tomato, cucumber- it was a little under seasoned but it tasted pretty great because the wagu beef has very intense flavors. 

Skate with black bean sauce - it was the perfect savory dish of the night. The black bean sauce did not over power the skate and the skate lightly fried to perfection.

Grill prawns with mushroom rice - very Italian dish because the rice was like a risotto - creamy and al dente. :D 

Grill yellow tail with California sushi roll and caviar. -  The yellow tail was super moist with a very crisp on the outside. YUM!

Mango tapoica - Mango is not in season but they manage to find very flavorful and sweet mango puree and mix it in to creamy tapoica pudding. It was heaven :D
author: Hubert C.

description: It was a rainy night in SF... we didn't have reservations and had to wait for an hour but it was well worth it. I am not a big fan of pork chops but I will say the House style pork chop is well worth the wait. It is a very small restaurant but cozy enough that you don't mind. A memorable experience. I will be back next time in SF and hopefully it's not raining!
author: Suz B.

description:
Amazing Asian/American fusion restaurant  in the corner of Little Italy.
Finding parking would be the biggest issue.
Food? Amazing.
Try the Sea Bass or the special Pork Shoulder. Amazing.
author: Andrew T.

description:
This place refuses to disappoint, I have been here at least 10 times and each experience is consistent and superb. Other reviews can give you a better sense of how awesome the food is(and trust me it is), but this is a well run establishment that have hard working and friendly people running it. 

Make a reservation though, otherwise your wait can and likely will easily exceed an hour.
author: yoni s.

description: Eric said it perfectly   It is one of those restaurants where you could close your eyes and point at the menu and be thrilled with  what you get.  I was very happy that the miso marinaded black cod was one of the specials. It was delicious. But I would have been just as happy with the pork chop or the skirt steak or the sea bass, Everything here is done to perfection.  Come and try anything on the menu and I am sure you will be very happy.
author: Jerry W.

description:
Thank you Yelpers, all your reviews are great and so true!

The House was amazing. Although it is small, they have a small selection but a very good selection. Whether you're looking for seafood, noodle dish, etc. They should have one dish that will culminate your craving. 

Not to mention, they are fast! The food came out quick, the presentation was great, and I never inhaled a dish so fast in my life. I ordered the Wasabi noodles with the flank steak, and the meat was moist and the noodles were cooked to perfection. 

Make sure to make reservations in advance because it gets packed! I went at 9pm on a Sunday night and there was still a line out the door.
author: Grace K.

description: Ok food....ok drinks....looks small from the outside but when you are inside the place is huge....good food selection great menu.....los PhD garlic.....everything is garlic and the place smells a lot like garlic
author: Kevin J.

description: Came here with the boyfriend because we were in the city. Made reservations because of all the reviews I read that it would be a long wait if you don't. We came a little early and were sat quickly upon arrival. The place is small, so I can understand why there is a long wait. Small restaurant, but nice and intimate atmosphere.  Service here was great and food was delicious. The pickled cucumbers were good and the staff here is great. We got the salmon egg rolls and they were delicious!! Flavors of the food were very savory and I would definitely recommend coming here for dinner!
author: Cat L.

description: Are they still open? Phone number on yelp is same as on their website but when I call to make a reservation it said the number is no longer in service?? I just want to make a reservation for dinner :(
author: Linda L.

description: I found this place from yelp and it was right! Amazing food,  so delicious. We got the dumplings, the ahi seared tuna, and the curry noodles. They were quick and very nice.  Small place but quaint. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Krystle H.

description: Met a friend here for dinner a while back. He'd made a reservation, so we were promptly seated. The restaurant is intimate without being overwhelming and the service is friendly and quick without being in-your-face. I got the classic sea bass, which was very well cooked and tasty. The garlic noodles were also great. Def a fan of the place!
author: Rowena L.

description:
The House was able to seat my 11-person party super-last minute, so they get points for that. Unfortunately we ended up waiting about 40 minutes past our reservation time in their ultra-cramped 'entry' area (that's really just the only few square feet without a table). 

I had the crispy salmon roll to start, which was predictably tasty. My entree was the other salmon dish, a sesame soy glazed fillet. It was pretty good--though the girl next to me absolutely loved the bonito sake broth under the fillet. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their dishes, and I was amused how many of them seemed to incorporate the housemade kimchi into the presentation. It seemed a little odd flavorwise, but who am I to question the chef! 

Service was good, although there were a couple issues with the bill at the end (which they took care of). 

Definitely a nice place, especially for a date.
author: David Z.

description:
The food here was amazing. Honestly, I think everything was SO delicious. Just pick anything here. Anything that tickles your fancy. 

The waitress was a little clumsy but not in an annoying way. I like the atmosphere and how they value cleanliness and stuff. Sometimes, its in the little things they do, like clear the plates and tablecloths for dessert for a clean area. YUM!

Just make reservations because it can get pretty packed in this small joint, but it's great. I loved the asparagus/peanut sauce thingy.
author: Josie W.

description: Absolutely love this place. Everything tasted amazing and light. FROM the complimentary cucumber all the way to dessert.. no complaints on food whatsoever. My Dad ordered the seabass. It was super fresh and don't even need the sauCE they give you on the side. The sauce did taste really good though but the fish by itself was so tasty and fresh that You don't want to cover any of the taste. The noodles tasted of the pan it was cooked with which was awesome! I know.. it a weird way to describe it.. but it good! I had the Mahi Mahi with mussels in coconut sauce.. I thought the coconut will be bam in your face like Thai food or Filipino food.. but it was actually subtle.. again.. more not to take away from the freshness of the Mahi Mahi and mussels.. I drank the sauCE like soup at the end.. I also ordered dessert at the end cause I didn't feel icky full like some places I go to.. I had the espresso brownie with coffee iCE cream.. again not too sweet.. leaves you wanting more..
author: Jenny Y.

description: The House is one of my favorite asian fusion restaurants. You can't go wrong with the deep fried salmon roll and calamari to start. And my go-to dish is the wasabi house noodles with salmon. It's the perfect amount of spiciness along with a generous piece of salmon. I would recommend making a reservation as the restaurant is quite small.
author: Peggy L.

description:
The Good:

The food. Mouthwatering. Everything on the menu. Cozy atmosphere. Great place! No complaints. 



The Not So Good:


If you do not make reservations you will have a long wait time.



Bottom Line:

If you are hungry, have the budget to support a meal ranging from $60+ for 2 people, and in the area this is a must! My recommendation is to 1) make reservations, 2) dress somewhat classy 3) take a hot date here 4) arrive 10 mins prior to reservation 5) make reservation towards end of the night near closing. If you wait to eat late the place becomes more cozy and intimate.
author: Eddie V.

description:
Make reservations - went for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.

Food was good - Salmon roll was okay...

Have a nice little beer selection too.

Very good service
author: Mark F.

description:
Crowded, noisy, busy, tiny. Red wine very warm upon initial taste.
Food reasonably priced, particularly for SF, but appropriate for North Beach.
Absolutely amazing presentation, flavor and ample portion sizes. 
Not to be missed if you are adventurous and dig flavor and presentation.
author: Chris O.

description:
The majority of foodies say that Asian fusion is dead. Well, I am here to confirm this statement. However, this doesn't mean that it isn't good; this place is damn good. I've been here 3 times and left happy each time.  

Each time I've visited, the menu has been the same. However, they run a number of daily specials which the servers amazingly describe to diners in full detail.  You pretty much can't go wrong with anything... except for the noodles, which were too oily for my taste. 

For me, the most memorable dish was the sea bass with the california roll on top-  it's very unique and it's pretty damn shocking to see a CA roll on top of a piece of fish. I said "WTF" the first time I saw it.  

This is a fun place for budding foodies and tourists.
author: Cris S.

description:
Delicious food - probably worth about a 30-45 minute wait. it truly is Asian Fusion at its best. 

Often times you go to a place that has memorable qualities. Maybe the service was top-notch, or the food was spiced really well. But how long is it really memorable for?

The House is memorable for weeks. For two weeks, I craved their Curry Noodles with Grilled Chicken. So delicious. I recommend going there for lunch since it's much more reasonably priced.
author: Zahir A.

description: This place has a special creative twist that no other restaurant has. The chef creates all their menu items from scratch, and there is nothing like it anywhere else! The flavor and taste is like nothing I've ever had before and its 100% original and cannot be found anywhere else. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to try something new and I know I will be returning here to try more of their delicious food.
author: Emilee R.

description:
The food: came here with a large group (7) and ordered a variety of items off the menu; all very very tasty. Great "Asian fusion" place. Some of the dishes were more Asian-traditional then others, but all had great presentation and flavor.

The ambiance: It's an okay location. Fairly tight on space and is pretty busy. This is good lunch place or to grab a bike to eat in a casual setting. The seven of us were cramped, and the place didn't feel intimate.

Service: good service. Food came out fast. Drinks were refilled promptly.
author: Oleg A.

description:
I didn't have much expectation of this place especially seeing Chinese trying to make fancy fusion food... you really never know.

And to summarize... wow, I'm impressed.

We had lunch... the sea bass was done perfectly... not a minute too long.  Must have the sauce.  It was very good.  And then we had the Kurobata pork chop, that was done with skill.  There are some fats but was grilled to crispy and the sauce was impressive.   if you don't live in the city or only eat out occasionally, must try these 2 items which we took the advice from the other yelpers.  The appetizer we chose deep fried salmon roll.  The salmon was mostly raw in the center... freshness spilled out like eating sashimi while crispiness of the spring roll skin and seaweed create a sensational texture.  Nevertheless, I wasn't crazy about the miso sauce... but that's just me.

The dessert was not impressive.  I had the chocolate cake... it's just a chocolate cake.  

I don't know if you can make a reservation, but it's not a big restaurant so you should consider.
author: Mark L.

description: DELISH! Wasabi noodles are a must. We also liked the crab cake which wasn't your traditional crab cake (looked more like a tower than a patty) and was mostly meat vs filler (e.g. bread). We tried the fried salmon rolls but they were too fishy for my standards. We got one of the specials - halibut over grilled cauliflower and mashed potatoes but the cauliflower was the star.  Highly recommend this place but only if you have reservations.
author: Carrie R.

description:
I love this place! even though its a small restaurant but everything else is good.
The food taste great and the service was good as well. You must try the sea bass with garlic noodles and the mushroom soup. The price rage here is decent here.
author: Jenny H.

description:
It's just not fair sometimes.  How can something be so good?  You think cooking a piece of fish would be a simple process... take a piece of fish, take a steady heating source, put the fish on for a certain amount of time and viola!  I cook a lot at home and I am constantly cooking fish.  Why istheirs just so much more infinitely succulent and delicious than mine.  It's just not fair dammit!  (The fish I speak of is the sea bass btw)

And it doesn't just stop there.  Scallops, same thing, delicious!  And even the meat  cuts were pretty damn good too.  This place was so good that my brother and his wife went here two nights in a row on a single weekend trip!  Shoot, I almost wanted to go again too! 

On another cute note, my friend told me that one of the things that most attracted his gf (when they were first dating) was that fact that he recommended this place and she was overtly impressed by his good taste.  Cute huh?!  Well yeah this place is legit, so what are you waiting for... GO NOW!
author: Tin N.

description:
This review is alittle late in coming. I was here in Sept for the BF's birthday and it was definitely memorable. The restaurant is small and cramp, but I think it adds to the charm.

We shared a bunch of appetizers including the fried soft shell crab. The rest seems to elude me at the time, but I do definitely remember my main course. The steak wasabi noodle. The noodles in self was great, but the steak was meh. You could tell it was not the best cut of beef.
author: Alex L.

description:
I've been to the House multiple times... since the times they had two locations... and then close the sunset location and stayed in the north beach restaurant.

I like this place.  The quality of the food is very consistent... everytime i went, I was never disappointed.  Their pork chop is juicy and thick! yummy... their garlic noodle... delish... their sea bass... juicy and fresh! I dont think i've had anything bad here.  

the house definitely deserves 4 stars!  you can't go wrong with any dish in this place...

and my all time favorite from the house? their mango tapioca!  it's creamy and light at the same time... i've called in and got a to go order on just the dessert many a times... it's good!!!
author: Kelly H.

description:
REALLY small place.

Things i've tried here:


Tuna Tartare with soy chips - pretty good, they use a wasabi sauce which can be too strong for some people. I liked it.

Crab cake - also had wasabi aioli under. I would like to taste more crab. they should have chunks of crab but its so mixed up with all the other ingredients its just a bit mushy.

I ordered their seabass - seabass was really buttery and they give a good portion of it. I asked for noodles with it and i really like the texture of their noodles. It also came with a lot of snow peas, adds a nice crunch to my meal.

Friends had:
Pork chop with pomagranate sauce- the sauce is amazinggg.. taste like a bbq sauce with pomagranate juice. really goood with everything. 

wasabi noodles with slices of steak- my friend ordered medium rare... and it was like rare. No excuse because they get to slice it and see how rare it is. 


Overall the food is really good but I think everything was a bit too oily for my taste. I know people cook veges with oil to make them look yummy but too muchhhh!! :( 


TIP: make reservations!! I went on a Tuesday night and they only offered us a table if we would only stay an hour.
author: Erica L.

description: The House was interesting and okay. I wasn't thrilled by the BBQ sandwich I got, but it was tasty. I am still hungry.
author: Denise C.

description:
My co-worker and I popped in for lunch.  I'm so glad he picked this place!  We shared an appetizer that I believe was halibut sashimi with nori and other amazing fixins.  

For my main course, I chose the Udon Noodle Soup with grilled chicken and toasted nori--awesome!  So $10 is a lot for soup; but it was a huuuge bowl and I thought it was worth it so I guess you can say you get what you pay for--quality and quantity.  

The seating is a bit crammed or you can look at it as 'intimate'.  We chatted with the couple next to us which was nice... we oogled a dessert they ordered and ended up getting the same thing.  I believe its was a chocolate truffle cake with coffee ice cream.  I'm not a huge fan of coffee ice cream by itself, but it was delectable with the cake which was a silky chocolaty delight.

Since we came in for lunch, we just walked up; but if you were planning on driving, good luck with the street parking.  I like the white, rectangular, paper placemats with the "house" shape punched out centered on the bottom.. such an inexpensive yet smart way of alluding to the name.
author: Doreen M.

description:
My boyfriend and I ended up at The House while being in Chinatown and doing a search for "nearby" dumpling places on the Yelp app. We saw that The House had fabulous ratings and went in. At first when we got there, we were a little disappointed, because there was only one type of dumpling on the menu, and it wasn't something that either of us wanted. But we decided to stay and I am SO glad that we did. The House was the best restaurant we ate in during our trip to CA. 

We got the deep-fried salmon roll with spicy mustard appetizer, which was so delicious and spicy! For the main course he got a pork sandwich and I got the wasabi noodles with grilled pork. Both of us were "oohing" and "aahing" over our food the entire time. Everything was so fresh and so delicious that we just sat there in epicurean awe. 

The beers listed on their menu went well with the food. They also had an extensive wine and sake/soju list, but it was a little pricy, so we just stuck with beer.

The food was definitely better than anything we were expecting to have in Chinatown, and we will gladly go back during our next trip to San Fran!
author: Lindsey M.

description:
Alright, so I'm FINALLY getting around to writing reviews for restaurants since my friends have been bugging me for so long. So, which place do I choose first to review? One of my favorites of course: The House. 

I've been here several times and I always have a great experience. Honestly, it's so hard writing this review because just thinking about the place makes me crave it!

*Food: 5 stars. Though I haven't tried everything on the menu, there hasn't been a dish I've tried from here that I haven't liked. Pick any dish, I'm sure you'll enjoy it. Here's a few I've tried:

Unagi over Avocado & Wasabi rice: 5000000 stars! WHY HAVE THEY STOPPED SERVING THIS? THIS WAS MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE APPETIZER THEY HAD! The most recent time I had come here, I couldn't find it on the menu. I was most excited about going here for this appetizer. I asked our waitress where it was, and she told me they had stopped serving it because it was too expensive :( My heart broke. Somebody please correct me if they start serving it again (& tell me ASAP so I can get myself over there!)

Angus Flat Iron Steak w/ Wasabi Noodles: 4 stars; I'm not usually a huge steak fan, but I can appreciate something cooked with a lot of care. The steak wasn't too chewy and it was delicious with the wasabi noodles. I love these noodles. Some other entrees with the noodles have the option of changing the noodles to rice, but honestly, I wouldn't do it. Unlike other restaurants who's dishes come with a side of noodles, The House's Wasabi Noodles aren't too dry and have great flavor. 

Kurobuta Pork Chop with Pomegranate Currant Sauce: 4.5 stars; Best pork chop I've ever had! And that pomegranate sauce is absolute perfection. It rests on top of some mashed potatoes which was delicious as well, but definitely was a great supporting side to make the pork chop the star of the show.

Grilled Sea Bass with Garlic Ginger Soy: 5 stars! If I could give it more stars, I would. The House's sea bass will ruin sea bass for you. I can't find a place that serves it as perfect as this. Each bite melts in your mouth. Honestly, you don't need to dip it in the sauce--it's THAT good. I still do because that sauce is just as perfect with the sea bass. What I love about it garlic ginger soy is that it isn't too salty at all. This dish is served with the wasabi noodles and some string beans, but again, you have the option of changing the noodles to rice.

*Service: 4.5 stars. They have their off moments of course, but out of all the times that I've been there, nothing major really stands out. It's a small restaurant, so there's always someone around if you need something. Each waiter/waitress I've had was very polite and gave their honest recommendations for a meal. They didn't come over to check on us too often, but they always kept a close watch in case we needed them.

*Price Range: The few times I've been here, I've spent anywhere between $50 to $95 between two people for dinner. Depending on the items you get and if you get an appetizer, the prices should be about the same range. This place is worth every dollar I've spent.

A few tips: Apparently their new policy for reservations is that you must call before 5pm to make one for that day. The most recent time I went there, I had tried to make a reservation around 6 o'clock for 8pm, but they said they never got it since they only check their voice mail one time at 5pm. Wish I had known that sooner. Luckily for us, it wasn't too busy that night and we were seated after about less than 10 minutes of waiting. 

Another tip: Parking! There isn't much parking around the area. What I've done in the past if I couldn't find any metered street parking is either drive around several times (although I will rarely do this since usually I'm extremely hungry, haha), use the valet a few streets down at the Bocce Cafe (It's either $10 or $15 for non customers from what I remember) or avoid this altogether and take a taxi from wherever am in SF for that day.
author: Jeanelle A.

description:
When people ask me where to eat in SF my automatic response is always The House.  Tucked in the middle of North Beach it really in bodies what SF is really about.  The ambiance, people and quaint space really makes this one of my favorite places to dine at.

The House has a small menu but don't let that get you down.  Each dish is packed with unique flavors that will blow your mind.  I've had the honor of trying many of the entrees here and I have to say, although I have my favorites - I've been satisfied with each and every one of my dish.

Tonight I did try a couple of new things that I never had before.  We started out with quite a variety of appetizers of oysters, scallops and a caeser salad with crispy salad.  They were all very delicious and left me wanting more!  

I ordered my all time favorite which is the niman ranch pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce.  I'm really not a fan of pomegranate but something about this dish really makes me love it.  I highly suggest this dish if you ever get a chance to dine at this place.

Service is always friendly and fast.  Dishes are also quite reasonable for the caliber of food you will eating.  The House has continue to wow me and will remain to be one of my favorite restaurants to eat at in San Francisco!
author: Jenny H.

description: We came here because of all the high Yelp reviews, and were very happy with the lunch. The decor is moderate, but the place was very busy, and the food was good fusion variety.
author: Vikas A.

description:
I. Love. the. House.   My favorite little jem of a restaurant.  Just a step away from the tourist traps along Columbus and completely unassuming in exterior appearance, the place never disappoints.  The menu hasn't changed significantly over the past couple of years but each dish is outstanding...fresh ingredients and always tasty dishes...you can't leave a plate without swiping up every drop of sauce and yummy garnish.   Yes, even the garnishes are worth savoring!  I've pretty much decided that I'll walk in and blindly accept whatever they have as the daily special.  They're THAT consistent in quality.  (as an aside: when in season, the soft shell crab is out of this world.  BBQ oysters *drool)


I've been crazy about this place for a few years and now it has added sentimental value (first date with the BF)... the BF is now a huge fan!

warning: make a reservation! the place is small and doesn't have any space in the front for patrons to wait comfortably (although folks do crowd at the entry and have to suffer seeing all the scrumptious dishes within arm's reach, while they wait for a table)

P.S.  also dig the little 'house' cutouts in the paper place mats :)
author: Roselie E.

description:
Great place

Probably among one of the best moderately priced restaurants in San Fran in terms of sheer food quality and overall experience.

I had followed the guidance here and tried the below with my wife:

Salmon rolls - excellent

Unagi app - excellent 

Wasabi noodles & steak - excellent - combination of spicy noodles, pickled vegetables, and steak

Sea Bass - good - I'm not a huge fan of sea bass though the fish itself is fine and the sides were excellent 

Chocolate cake - excellent

I'd def come back
author: Jeff S.

description:
My husband made a reservation for 9:00pm for my bday dinner 2 weeks ago. Arrived at 8:45 and they seated us immediately. (lucky us). If you are in a car, parking on the street is not likely but there is a $15 parking lot up the alley from The House.

We ordered oysters, warm kale salad, crab cake and wasabi noodles. This was plenty of food for 2. There is also a nice wine-by-the-glass menu with a few good sake options. Everything was delectable. Oysters were some of the freshest we've had, crab cake was sculptural and flavorful. I didn't taste the wasabi flavor of the noodles but, they were good too.

I read about the lady with long hair and bad service but, none of this existed for our visit. You will sit very close to your neighbors but, in our case it sparked a welcome conversation.  It was a wonderful bday dinner.
author: Natalie G.

description: I've had The House a couple of times, and each experience has been progressively worse. The final straw was when my reservation was given to a pestering guest who was there on a first date, my table was extremely wobbly and the sea bass was too salty.
author: Ruby K.

description:
The restaurant should consider expanding. The space is very cramped. Every time the server came over to help the table next to us, her bum was so close to our table that I thought she was going to use it as a chair and sit on it. And it felt so impersonal that her back was against us.

Okay, now let's talk about the food. I got their special, seared duck with blackberry reduction sauce. The duck was placed on top of mashed potato and asparagus. The whole plate was filled with the blackberry sauce with a few blackberries in it. The sauce was so savory. Every bite I had was dipped in the sauce. The duck was also really good. However, I was given a dull knife to eat with. My friend got the wasabe noodles and flank steak (which was also bursting with flavor) and he had the same problem with the knife. The whole night, we were both cutting our meat as if we were trying to saw a tree down. I wouldn't be surprised if the people next to us thought we were crazy.

For dessert, I ordered the nectarine pie a la mode. The nectarine pie was good until I had my 2nd bite, there were blackberries in it too. The combination of blackberries with nectarines was a little odd. A bite of the sweet nectarine with the crumbs and a little bit of ice cream all together was very enjoyable. The blackberry really threw me off. 

At the end of the night, my stomach was plump and happy. Thank you house.
author: Laura L.

description:
Service: 6-star
Apps: 5-star
Mains: 3-star
Total: 4-star+
Fun, exciting, maybe just order all apps and drinks.
author: Brian J.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with my bf with a reservation for 6:30. The place was packed and we weren't seated until 6:45, but I enjoyed the food greatly!

- Seared giant scallops for appetizers were delicious, but you can never really go wrong with this dish
- Sea bass was perfectly cooked, so it was fatty and smooth. My favorite dish!
- Skirt steak with garlic noodles and shoe string fries were also amazing! The steak was flavored well and the noodles were also really good but a little oily.

This was actually too much food for me and my bf, so we took our leftovers to go and ate it as a late night snack. I was surprised how good it still tasted!

I can't wait to go back here to try more of their dishes!
author: Cindy L.

description:
I came here twice in a week... not on purpose but by accident..

Sunday Night
 Ive been here on numerous occasions and I usually get the Seabass or Wasabi Noodles, but since there were  a group of us, we decided to ordered a bunch of dishes off of their special as well as their main menu

Ahi tuna tartare with roasted nori chips - It was good but not my favorite

Steamed mussels with garlic infused shrimp broth - SO GOOD! Mussels were perfectly cooked, they werent chewy at all!

Deep-fried chicken liver with baby greens - i liked everything but the chicken liver? LOL it's an acquiring taste.. and i couldnt!

Papaya salad with kobe special - very good! i love how they topped off the salad with fried garlic or rice? i cant remember

Entrees
Warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak - LOVE LOVE LOVE WASABI OODLES :) I like my steak with salt and pepper...so u get it right?

Niman ranch pork chop with pomegranate currant sauce - very tender and flavorful

Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy - another one of my favorite! u can never ever go wrong with this dish! it's ALWAYS consistent

No dessert this time!



Tuesday Night

Apps
Steamed mussels with garlic infused shrimp broth 
Deep-fried salmon roll with chinese hot mustard
Blue lake bean tempura with pickled ginger soy

All three were my favorite! It's a must get from now on!

Entrees
Christine C got their special ROCK COD - MAN i SO SHOULD HAD GOTTEN THIS DISH! BERRRRRRY GOOOOOD!  Thinking about it makes my mouth water

I got the seabass sub wasabi noodles :)
The rest of my frens got seabass as well!

Desserts
Creme brulee - it was good, but ive had better

Mango pudding - OMG I LOVE mango pudding! I think their mango pudding can be as competitive as Tai Pan's! Actually, I think i like The House more!!!

Apple crumb pie with vanilla icecream - mmMMmm the was soo good too.. the crumbs were surprisingly very moist!

Lastly, Tort chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream - surprisingly very moist! 

But i HEART their mango pudding and apple crumb pie best!!! I WANT MORE! :)

service was 5 stars
Parking was relatively easy on both nights
author: linda L.

description:
I took my boyfriend to dinner at the House to celebrate his birthday.  It was the first for both of us, and my expectations were especially high from all the praise I've heard about this place.

[ FIRST IMPRESSION ]

I was anticipating on taking him to a semi-fancy restaurant, but was immediately disgruntled by how casual the setting was.  The chairs were 100% wooden and uncomfortable, and they used individual paper table settings.  I felt like we had stumbled into a random restaurant in Chinatown that actually happened to be in the middle of North Beach.

I let out a sigh, and decided to let go of my snooty perception of the restaurant before giving the House my final judgment. 

[ DINING EXPERIENCE ]

For appetizers, we shared: 
-  Pan-seared day boat scallops: This was my favorite dish of the night, as it was cooked perfectly from inside out.  The scallops were incredibly crisp on the outside, but slowly melted in your mouth as you continued to devour the buttery greatness. 
-  Oysters on the half shell with spicy cilantro mignonette:  Oysters were good, but not the best that I've had.  My suspicion was that the mignonette sauce was too overwhelming.
-  Caesar salad with crispy scallops: This was one hell of a salad.  I'm not a huge fan of greens, but throw in scallops and I'm satisfied!

For dinner, we ordered:
-  Angus rib-eye steak with teriyaki &  garlic butter: This was my main dish, which I regret ordering after trying the boyfriend's sea bass.  It's not that the rib-eye was dire, but it was so over-the-top drenched in garlic and butter that you couldn't really taste the natural meat flavors.
-  Sea bass with garlic ginger soy: Hands down - this is the best sea bass I have ever tried.  I take that back.  This is the best FISH I have ever had.  Similar to the day boat scallops, each bite left me dazed and yearning for more.

[ FINAL JUDGMENT ]

I would've gladly given the House 5 stars, but after finding a HAIR in the garlic ginger soy for the sea bass, I lost my appetite and (developing) interest.  It's like going on a first date - you can't forget a bad impression!  The thought of someone else's hair in our food lingered in my mind throughout the night.  And although the waitress attempted to make it up to us with free dessert, it just wasn't enough to make it up to me - the snob.  It also didn't help that our waitress was inhospitable and remote from beginning to end.

BUT - service aside and the-hair-in-our-food aside, the food was pretty outstanding.  Since the restaurant is so dark, I just recommend that you sit by the window so you can see if there's hair in your food!
author: Judy C.

description:
keep it simple sea bass is amazing must go to eat again.
tuna tar tar was great too.
Kobe steak
author: Justin I.

description:
This place is legit fusion...if that's even at all possible.

For apps:

Tuna tartare - pretty standard, but consistent and tasty.

Charred octopus and pork skin salad - it was SUPER good.  Love the surf and turf combo.

Shrimp and chive dumplings - pretty standard tasty dumplings

Mexican fried shrimp - super flavorful and well-seasoned.  Money.

Entrees:

Pork chop with pomegranate reduction - mash was good, and had chunks of sweet potato in it which was a nice flavor profile.  The chop was a bit more medium-rare than medium but still good.  Pomegranate reduction was good, not too sweet.

Kobe skirt steak special - mash again, chinese broccoli was standard.  The black bean sauce was good; traditionally black bean sauce is super potent, but this was perfect flavor and depth to let the Kobe still shine.

Dessert:

Coconut Creme Brulee - Passion fruit syrup was a nice touch.  The creme brulee was super silky.  Sugar on top could've used a touch more torching but still good.  

Wine was good too, but it had nothing to do with them.  Didn't hurt either.

Definitely a go-to spot for me now when I'm in the city.

NOTE: it's very quaint inside, so if you have a group, ditch them and go here.  Or break up in to smaller parties of 3-4.
author: Frederick L.

description:
I went to The House on my day trip to SF for dinner. I was so happy my friend recommended this place for me. It was worth the flight! :)
The waitress was super friendly and I loved how intimate the restaurant was. It seems like they really take pride in their food. We ordered the famous pork chop with the daily special of sea scallop with crab meat orzo risotto. IT WAS HEAVENLY. Best pork and risotto  I ever had! On my way back home, the pork was all I was thinking about during my flight! This place is a must!!!!!!!
author: Hanna B.

description:
The House never disappoints... And if your dish is a little disappointing, your company's dish will at least make up for it. 

Everyone is right. The seabass is bomb and totally melts in your mouth. Also good were the wasabi noodles, pork chops, and salmon rolls. The presentation of each dish is superb, almost like eating a work of art (that is mind-blowingly delicious). I've never met anyone who didn't like this place. All the people I ask who have eaten here, their reaction is always the same: THEY LOVE IT. 

The place is really small but the 4 times I've been here, I've never had to wait. I could've been lucky so make a reservation if you can. Lunch menu is cheaper, dinner is almost double. Parking can be hard to find.
author: Anita W.

description:
We had dinner reservations for 6:45. When our waitress came around at 7:10, they were already out of two of the five entrees, and two of the four small plates. WTF? I mean, it was Sunday and all, but please, people, if you're going to mention something when you tell the table what's special that night, have it 25 minutes later when you come to take their order!

That said, food was beautiful to look at and taste. Had the special crispy pork shoulder which was pretty damn amazing. Salmon went over well, as did the octopus salad appetizer, clams small plate, and green beans small plate. 

We'll be back, but we're getting their earlier!
author: Steven M.

description: Contrary to what they tell you in school, "Run... don't walk!"  That's right, get there as soon as you can for their Spicy Miso Halibut.  We came here for a late lunch and this was the day's lunch special.  I had my doubts at first as I asked the waitress whether it was moist or dry and flaky like most halibut dishes.  She had me at "moist" (it was moister than the sea bass).  It is served with bowl of white rice, perfect for sopping that delicious spicy broth with Napa cabbage and other veggie; I do not know the price as I lost our Chinese game of "Who's Gonna Grab the Bill?"  We dined family style on this along with their Barbecued short ribs (Kalbi) and Grilled Sea Bass.  Nice coming here for lunch if you want to miss the crowd madness during dinner time.  You might want to call to confirm that the halibut is on the menu.  If it is.... RUN!
author: Mike C.

description:
Small lunch menu, yet still a variety of options, including a few specials (both apps + main courses). 

Interesting & striking meal presentations. Top tier quality food.

The salmon was truly fabulous and the curry noodles (with chicken) was also quite tasty.

Service was courteous & prompt. 

Definitely plan to go back again soon & try the sea bass and other dishes..
author: Miguel S.

description:
One of my all time favorite places in San Francisco.  It's a tiny little place, and you must have reservations.  A long long time ago, there were two locations, one in the inner Sunset (I think that was the original location) and this one in North Beach.  This restaurant has always been fantastic.  And there's always an excellent choice of wine.  

My boss from many years ago introduced me to this restaurant.  She mentioned that she grew up in the same area as the restaurant owner.  My boss' family was also in the restaurant business, so she knew the owner of this restaurant really well.  The first time I went there, she introduced her small group of employees to the owner.

I was so pleasantly surprised by the uniqueness (especially for that time) of the Asian fusion idea.  And I'm really not a fan of Asian fusion food, but this place is the exception.  I try to come here every year, and this restaurant has never disappointed.  Everything from the food, wine, and the wait staff - superb.  

Perhaps most importantly, I think this is the perfect date spot.
author: Olivia L.

description: Seabass is as good as ever. Best tempura green beans. Loved the mussels and octopus salad. Fantastic!!
author: Hannah P.

description:
You know when you take a bite of something, and you start nodding your head as if someone asked you a question and you were answering yes?  That's exactly what I kept doing every time I took a bite at The House.  Really good food, nice presentation, great service, and sits in a cool location.  Entrees range from $17-26. 

Appetizers: 
-oysters on the half-shell: really clean and fresh
-deep fried salmon roll: really nice crispy outside, slightly cooked inside.
-grilled calamari: served in a sauce that was sweet and spicy.  This was one of their specials for the evening.

Mains:
-Seared black cod: one of their specials for the night...this was ridiculously good.  Melted in your mouth. It should just be part of their regular menu.
-Angus rib-eye: cooked just right.  Served with potatoes and bok choy
-Sea bass: accompanied by noodles and green beans.  Really moist with a hint of salty. 

Dessert:
-Blackberry strudel with nectarines and ice cream: OMFG! I could've ate three of these for myself.
-Nectarine and raspberry sundae: this was okay.  Tasted like something I could whip up at home.

Loved The House.  Only con would be the size of the restaurant.  It's really small. Make sure to make reservations if you're having dinner here.  This place can get pretty pricey if you have a weakness for the bubbly...but it's a great food experience and worth every penny.
author: Maybelline C.

description:
My bf kept raving about this place so I wanted to check it out. Surprisingly, I've been here before, but don't recall what I ate. I think I remembered it being as okay.

However, this time, I remember. We got the pork belly appetizer, which was below average. The pork belly was a bit dry and overcooked. The sauce that came in it was a medley of stuff - tomatoes, celery, eggs, pickles...and prob more. I wasn't a fan. The meal was unpleasantly heavy, while I was hoping for a pleasant, melt-in-your mouth fattiness.  

I ordered the special for the night - black cod. It was delicious. I liked how it was presented with two California rolls laid across the black cod. The rolls were average. The black cod was great! It was flaky, buttery and melted in my mouth. The entire piece was perfectly cooked. I finished it all. I do wish that there wasn't so much soy sauce on the dish.

Service was good. We were seated right away on a Friday night without a reservation. Talk about lucky!
author: Margaret R.

description: We got the deep fried salmon rolls and the grilled ginger soy sea bass, and the miso black cod. Quite a delight.
author: Jack Glab 0.

description:
The house is a really great small restaurant.  Food and service were both excellent!

We had reservations at 8pm for 5 and we got there on time and were immediately seated, even though one person in our party was still missing.  We went ahead and ordered apps, although they never rushed us.  Even at the end of the meal when we stayed to chat a bit after we had paid the check, they did not hover or seem to want to push us out the door and continued to fill our water glasses.

We ordered several small dishes and entrees and shared everything family-style.  The deep fried salmon roll was unique and was good, the Blue Lake bean tempura was better, and the best of the apps order was the baby octopus salad with crispy pork skin.

Every single entrée was quite good, but I do have to agree with most other reviewers and say that the sea bass was the best.  First you taste the flavor and textured of grilled outside and the rest really does melt in your mouth.  But the others: wasabi house noodles with flatiron steak, mushroom rice with grilled prawns (probably my second fave), Kurobuta pork chop (tasty pomegranate currant sauce!), and angus ribeye steak, I have no complaints for if I had to eat just one.

Finishing with the mango tapioca dessert was perfect.  We were all very full from dinner but the tapioca wasn't too heavy or too sweet.  It was a great finish to the meal.  Would highly recommend coming here!
author: J L.

description:
I made a reservation at 7:30 and was promptly seated.  I guess I was lucky because many of the reviews complain of long wait times even with a reservation..

We had this sushi eel thing which tasted like...sushi.  This was good, but tasted like they used imitation crab.  Good, but not top quality.

We  had the cod for an entree which was phenomnal.  Extremley fresh and not dry like most places serve it.

The ahi entree was also good.  It comes rare and tastes great.

The one thing that makes this place good is the sauces they use.  They enhance the flavors of everything!

Warning:

I ordered a beer, but they brought me out a 3/4 full beer, it seriously looked like someone took a giant sip out of it.  I'm sure it was probably the bottle, but the thing that weird was, A. they didn't pour the beer in front of me and B. tasted like Asahi beer instead of some blonde beer I ordered.  The waitress assured me I was drinking the right beer so I let it go.  So make sure they pour the beer in front of you!!!
author: Josh D.

description:
The House does Asian-fusion in such a beautiful and delicious way. Usually Asian-fusion places try too hard but The House definitely gets it right. 

My sister and I shared an order of classic fried calamari and it was the best calamari we've ever tried. The breading was not greasy and it tasted great. Even with the lemon squeezed on top, the calamari never got soggy. I don't know what they do with it but it's great. 

I ordered the seared ahi-tuna and it was SO good. The pieces were the perfect warmth and thickness, the spicy sauce around the edge had just the right kick, and the rice and veggies were fragrant and delicious. I finished everything on my plate. 

I haven't tried everything on their wine menu but they definitely have a delicious selection from what I've tried so far. They really know how to pick out their wines. 

Overall, my experience was wonderful here. The service was polite and prompt and the atmosphere is very soothing. There is definitely a crowd because this place is popular but the noise level never got too bad. The House is a great place for a date or a small party.
author: Christine C.

description: Yum! I sincerely love this place. I came away full from the evening. It's not like any other restaurant where you're wanting more food to satiate your hunger. They are legit. I enjoyed their noodles and dumplings. I'm a huge fan of dumplings, so it's impressive that their menu satisfied my quench for asian fusion. Thanks House! ;)
author: Mei F.

description: We got here and there was a line outside the door. We were in line for 30 minutes and it was worth waiting for the restaurant to open. Now that just tells you that this place must be great and yes it is.   The place is very small so be prepared to be sitting next to someone as you are only about a foot and half a part from each other but that didn't bother us at all.  The presentation of the meal is superb and it was delicious.  The service was superb, the food came fast but you didn't feel rushed... great food... great service... I can't wait to come back to eat here again...and the name of the restaurant is just that... The House... what a perfect name ...
author: Emily G.

description:
I had high expectations after looking at the review and the food.

I found that it wasn't anything special.  Not worth the drive and wait.  It was good but nothing special.

We had the salmon rolls, calamari, fish with noodles and dessert.  I didn't finish my entree or dessert.  Sad because I usually wouldn't waste food when I am paying so much for it.  

I took it home thinking I will finish it later but it just wasn't appetizing enough.  I ended up tossing it instead.
author: Cin T.

description:
My friends and I wanted a nice, final meal after our weekend in San Fran. We are all visiting and The House was recommended by vayable. So we booked reservations at 8PM on a Sunday...it was still packed when we arrived. The place IS really small. It looks like it seats 40-50 people max. 

We ordered calamari, caesar salad with crispy scallops and crispy octopus. 
My caesar salad was basically a caesar salad..the scallops were small bay scallops and there were maybe 4 on the plate. Deep fried and were soggy, not crispy at all..Everything else we ordered was really good. The calamari was crispy and not chewy. I probably would be chose the mussels if I were to go back.

We also ordered the sea bass, the pork chop and the seared ahi-tuna. All winners. Presentation was great. We all came dressed in jeans and I was a bit nervous but nobody said anything and everyone else was dressed pretty casually too. 

Service was great, we got free refills on our lychee black tea and they were ninjas about it because we never even noticed! Originally we wanted to go to Gary Danko, but thinking back on it now, The House was perfect as the price was where we wanted to pay without being too hard on our wallets. We are 20somethings here. The waitress was really attentive and it was a perfect mood to chat about our trip and our favorite things..The House included!
author: Mai H.

description:
Limited seating at this place, so get there early.

Their food is amazing, cooked by a very caring staff.

I've eaten there many times for lunch, but haven't made the trek for dinner.

My all-time fave eats there is their sea bass with garlic/ginger soy sauce.

Check it out...I think you'll love this place too!
author: Derek N.

description:
How is it that I didn't know about The House? Geez. I haven't been Yelping for a while and almost 2000 people go and upstage me by having come here first.

Had a friend visiting from out of town on business and my fav foodie guy picks this place as one of the places he's been dying to try. Arriving a bit early, we waited in the doorway taking photos of the restaurant while waiting for our friends staying in SF to join.

After ordering a bottle of wine to start, we perused the menu and decided to order 3 out of the 4 specials of the day. One was a hamachi plate with tobiko and avocado, served on a bed of large cucumbers. Delicious.

Following that we had a mixed greens salad with figs, grapes and a light dressing. This was good, but I can't remember what else was in it, so it mustn't have been that spectacular.

Then we had a fried soft shell crab. The flavors here were delicious. It maintained it's juiciness and texture, while being easy to eat and cut.

Finally we ordered the scallops which were the jumbo sized, and they had 3 to share. Tender and cooked to a perfect consistency, this was a great way to end the appetizers.

For dinner I forgot what everyone else ordered, but I had ordered the sea bass. The fish was really well cooked, but I have to say whatever sauce they served it with was way overpowering. I generally like my sea bass served with a light broth so that you can really tasted the fish. This sauce was completely overpowering, but I am lucky that they already pair it as a side dish, instead of drizzling it all over the fish.

Fantastic dinner for a weeknight in the city. I'm glad Chiawen was visiting so that we could take a break on a weeknight for great conversations and fine dining over wine with whine.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Not as good as I remember, but it's probably because I tried so many things and it's hard to please one person with every different dish. Overall, still excellent service and excellent food. 4.5 stars

- Tuna Special: sashimi & seared tuna, sauce dip was good with a slight hit of wasabi
- Pork Chop: yummmy tender, the greens were a good accompaniment
- Sea Bass: sooo tender, cooked well and flaky to perfection, light flavor so you can actually taste the fish 
- Fried Salmon Roll: yummy, very spicy mustard sauce
- Unagi Over Rice: i love ungai and this was simply delicious with the slightly fried rice so it was crispy
- Tuna Tartare: fresh
- Mango Tapioca: light, creamy taste, very good
- Chocolate Cake: dense, chocolatety, coffee ice cream was good
author: Linda C.

description: Delicious! We had the dumplings to start, and the samlon and seabass--everything was so tasty! Definitley make a reservation if you can--we showed up at 5:30 on a Wednesday without one. They were able to squeeze us in, but the place was jammed!
author: Katie C.

description: Perfect date night dinner! The pomegranate pork chop was to die for and my girlfriend's salmon was also wonderful. Chocolate cake for dessert was super rich and delicious. Service was fine, nothing special but no complaints either. Parking was a major pain, however. I suggest walking or taking a cab. Make reservations! It was super busy for dinner. We waited an extra 15 minutes on top of our reservation time, and we overheard wait times for walk-ins were at least 90 minutes. My girlfriend and I can't stop talking about when we're coming back to try something else on the menu. Definitely worth a trip into the city!
author: Jeffrey A.

description: Best meal i have had in a very long time, everything I ordered - seabass, salmon rolls, coconut creme brulee - was just outstanding. Nothing out of the ordinary in terms of decor but food compensates for it.
author: Inessa R.

description: This was a quaint place in SF. The ambiance and service was good. I ordered the wasabi noodles with flank steak. The noodles were amazing but the steak was tough and not seasoned very well. I also tried the tempura shrimp with greens...unfortunately the shrimp tasted like dirty sea water. We did inform the waitress and she took the shrimp dish off of our bill. Considering the great customer service and atmosphere I would definitely come back and give this place another try!
author: Eugenia W.

description:
The House benefits from its charming exterior and prime location in North Beach. It is seemingly a tasteful date spot in an intimate space. 

This restaurant was a disappointment for me on all accounts. The food is not horrible but it was the kind of meal you would expect to have on a first class UA flight. I am surprised to see that this place has 4.5 stars and many reviews. We ordered the flank steak with garlic noodles as well as the truffle kobe steak. The asian fusion felt forced; the steak was cooked well but it was layered with needless sauce creations that masked the natural juices of the grass fed beef. Such a tragedy. It's like like forcing a Betty Johnson dress on Audrey Hepburn. 
If you are remotely claustrophobic and value hearing your companion(s) over dinner, this is not the place for you. It's an uncomfortable tight and loud space. There is much better food in the city however, I'm prettty sure this place will continue to be popular.
author: Annie Y.

description: Plate licking good.... I haven't found anything here I didn't like.  And, I think that's the same with everyone else, because this place is always busy.  And most nights have a line out the door.  This is a great place to take people who want to see a great local SF restaurant.
author: Steven C.

description: The meal started off amazing with a small plate of pickled cucumbers that were perfect to cleanse your palate. Next: Absolutely amazing seafood!!! The Halibut, Salmon, Tuna, Sea bass, was all extremely fresh! I swear it was caught that day. The meal was finished perfectly with a coconut creme brûlée that was unbelievably good.
author: Christine R.

description: My date brought me here yesterday. I never Asian fusion before as I am not a sushi person but to my surprise it was great and cooked! I had the soft shell crab and the black cod. Both were delicious. The place is fairly small but never empty, thank goodness we had reservations. I would definitely recommend it, the staff is friendly, lost of specials, delicious food and wine to go with it, what more can you ask for?
author: Vera M.

description: Love the Wasabi noodles and rib eye!  My boyfriend had the sea bass and said it was Excellent!!
author: Leslie K.

description:
The food here really does live up to the hype - lovely food presentation and killer flavor. I would say the only quality lacking here is the service - not that they weren't attentive but our waiter was just SO awkward.. We felt uncomfortable with him and would giggle after he left because he just seemed so clueless in how to be a good waiter. Don't get me wrong, he got the job done, but I would think at a highly rated restaurant the social skills of the waiters would be better. Our waiter just talked super quietly, almost mumbling even, to the point that every time he said something we would be confused and stare at each other quizzically and make him repeat it again. Hahaha. 
To the food - the grilled Seabass and the scallops were fucking amazing. Ooooooh now I'm getting hungry thinking about it. The textures were to my liking hehe, esp the scallops. And the sauces were a perfect combination. The Seabass with the garlic noodles and green beans were kinda oily, but tasty nonetheless. We got a chocolate cake thing after for dessert that was kinda meh and I got a pot of tea because I felt like it would taste good. Meh again.. also it was like $10 for that pot of tea and super mediocre. Don't recommend that.
author: Annie T.

description:
OH MY GOD.

This is definitely one of the most amazing restaurants in San Francisco. 

And if you disagree, then you need to try their sea bass. TRUST ME! IT WILL CHANGE YOUR MIND. And maybe even your life.

The sea bass is literally melt in your mouth, delicious, I've-died-and-gone-to-heaven goodness! I've had a lot of freakin' sea bass in my life. Mainly the sea bass you get from dad's fresh fishing, or your good old Chinese restaurant. I've had some good. I've had some bad. But this.... is UNBELIEVABLE. End of story.

Well, not quite the end of the story just yet. I think we need to rewind just a little bit.

I've been hearing about this place for more than just a while now. The shitty parking is what's been keeping me away. Also, I'm not the biggest fan of calling in reservations. I'm more of an opentable snob. So when I called in and got somewhat of a rude and rushed attitude, I was pretty sure I'd dock them down a point or two with my review.

We ended up making reservations for 6:30 (5 days ahead of time), which we then had to change to a later time (the day of our dinner reservation). The soonest table available for reservations was 8:30, so we went with that. We were told that we could try coming in earlier and potentially getting in sooner than that. So when we got there a bit past 7:00pm, we went up to one of the ladies at the desk what happened, and she immediately remembered my name. Plus plus ++

She put me on the expedited waitlist and said it would be about 20 minutes. We had to wait in the cold for approximately 5 minutes before she came to grab us. Not bad! Plus plus ++ again!

We ordered the crab cakes, asparagus, rib eye, sea bass with garlic noodles, and then added the order of tuna tartar afterwards. I also got myself some chrysanthemum tea!

The asparagus was amazing. Mmmmmm... I could've used a 2nd bowl probably. The seasoning and sauce was just perfection. It was crunchy and fresh. And I know we've all had crappy asparagus where we had to spit the remains out before. Not here at The House; not here.

The crab cake was delicious! Not too fried or crunchy, just the way I like it. I probably could have had the whole thing to myself too!

I tried a bit of the rib eye, which was good. But the sea bass stole the show, and my dining companion could only agree. Trying to describe it any further would still do it no justice, so PLEASE try for yourself and see! The garlic noodles that came with it was also amazing; not dry at all.
