             tables are SOO close that you can't have a decent conversation without 
             hearing what everyone else is talking about.

Still, FIVE Stars all the way!
author: James S.

description:
Can't decide whether or not this is my favorite or second favorite restaurant in the Bay Area.  I believe it's in the North Beach area in San Francisco but all I remember is that it was 2 doors up from a strip club.
  
Despite the "not so fantastic" area and the cramp space you have to dine in the food was FABULOUS.  I don't' know how they do it but the main course dishes we ordered were almost UNBELIEVABLE (I've never had a dish that I would consider UNBELIEVABLE but the dishes we ordered at the House were pretty close).  

We ordered the Black Code and Pork Chop.  Both were cooked perfectly with an amazing sauce.  I heard their other dishes are also FANTASTIC but take it from me, if you've never been there MAKE SURE TO ORDER THEIR BLACK COD!

The overall price is VERY reasonable for the quality you get.  The service is friendly overall except for the hostess (she may be the owner). She's a bit on the rude side but that could be because she's got lots of folks waiting to be seated in a small closet sized restaurant.  If you're expecting a big and roomy restaurant you've gone to the wrong place.  
I've read previous reviews and many people say it's elbow to elbow but it's not that bad.  I'm a pretty big guy and I didn't feel that crampt.  We were definitely close to our neighbors but it was nothing to complain about. 

If you have not tried the House - GO GO GO!
author: Danny K.

description: Food is pretty good. The service was ok... The lady that served us seemed to be in a bitchy mood. A smile would be nice especially if we are dropping a lot of money at your establishment. The sea bass and noodles were bomb. As was the salmon roll and muscles. The wasabi noodles with the steak was ok. Not really impressed with that dish. As for the dessert it was average. Overall I would say it was an average experience.
author: Mark C.

description:
I almost don't want to Yelp about it because it would make last minute reservations next to impossible to get :) 

but really, this place is amazing. 

to start out with -- the food. 

their signature pomegranate pork chop with currant sauce was simply perfect ... and here, the sauces and the sides (asparagus & mashed potatoes) are truly main components of this epicurean affair. 

the black cod was a culinary work of art topped with a delish handroll and garnished with just the right amount of caviar. melt in your mouth heavenly goodness that reminds me of the exquisite tastes of asian dining with the fine attention to detail / texture from a western kitchen. 

the softshell crab tempura was definitely a game-changer for me -- never thought of taking a whole crab and making tempura out of it! the great part was that it was paired with house's famous semi-fried veggies on top of a bed of siracha mixed with hot/sweet noodles. 

and to top it all off, the service. everyone was very attentive, helpful, and engaging. 

truly a "woohoo! as good as it gets!" experience
author: wendy q.

description: went here for a birthday dinner the place is super tiny but great food i orderd the grilled sea bass with ginger soy i had no complaints
author: Donnae K.

description:
Whatever.  This has got to be rigged cuz I don't know how this place keeps their 4.5 star rating.  Quince gets 4?  Boulevard gets 4?  This gets more?  

Noisy shit show ambiance.  Long wait even though we had reservations.  No place to linger.  Finally seated practically sitting in other people's laps.  Fellers to our right couldn't put their iphones away.  One guy kept leaving it on the table and refreshing it so my dinner was bathed in the artificial glow of his screen all dinner long.  LAME.  The screechy people to the left couldn't shut the heck up nor could they stop posing and taking photos of one another with their ridiculously large ipads (who does that in real life?)  One of the gals even pulled out her charger and proceeded to plug it in and charge her humongous phone on the table.  What the hell is wrong with people these days?  Your life isn't that interesting if most of it revolves staring at photos you just posted of yourself on facebook.  Losers.

The food was not impressive.  The fish and meats were cooked well but everything came drenched in the faux "Asianish" sauce and piled up on boring soy garlicky noodles.  Just grab a bottle of Trader Joe San Soyaki and call it a day, folks.  At least you'd save a few bucks.  They were out of tons of stuff.  For fusion it was seriously lacking in creativity and innovation.  Not fresh, either.
author: erin k.

description: Best sea bass ever, lobster salad & coconut cream brûlée with passion fruit sauce! Amazing! Very sweet service, great sake and they even do a little something special if they know it's your birthday;0
author: amanda l.

description:
Made a reservation, cause its tedious here without one. 
Tuna Tartare was delicious. Perfect starter.
Pork chop, insanely good. Sauce was sweet and tangy. 
Flat iron steak with wasabi noodles was so yummy. the noodles were perfectly cooked and fresh. My steak was medium and just right. 
Creme brulee was as it should be texture wise with a tangy sauce, it worked well.
Its loud and crowded but you wont mind when your eating. Get some wine the list is decent and large.
author: claire l.

description: It's been a while since I've dined here but I still remember how heavenly the pork chops were on my plate and palate.
author: Aurora A.

description: Exceptional food served in a small, cozy atmosphere.  My only criticism is that the service can be a little inconsistent.  I've been here 4-5 times over the past 3 years and I have always enjoyed my experience (great food!).  Expect to be crammed in the restaurant (it's small).  Expect to have to wait 45 minutes to 2 hours depending on the day (grab a cocktail somewhere else in the neighborhood).  Expect to have great food.  I don't want that every evening but when I do... there is no place better.  Have fun and enjoy.
author: C. K.

description: absolutely love this place. Miss them being on 9th Irving! Food is GREAT spot on!
author: Thomas C.

description:
This is actually my first review ever.  I have been to many places that I enjoy and have found to be a place I would definitely recommend to my friends... THIS IS NOT ONE OF THOSE PLACES.  The food is terrible.  I had a Kobe steak and they put truffle oil on it.  I had the steamed shrimp dumplings and the shrimp smelled like week old fish.  All in all my experience was terrible.  The staff was very nice, but that was it.  

So to all those people reading the spectacular reviews this place received, they are wrong!
author: Samaj D.

description: House was amazing. Their unique and delicious menu was exciting to say the least. I had the wasabi noodles and steak which was to die for. I started with the fried salmon roll which was big enough to share   . The service and the meal was fantastic. I'll be back next time I'm in SF
author: Josh G.

description: The meal I had at The House ranks near the top for the best meals I've had in my life. The food was delicious, everything cooked perfectly with very well-balanced and deep flavors. We had the fried salmon roll, clams in broth appetizer, scallops appetizer, the sea bass and ahi tuna entrees, and the mango tapioca dessert. Every dish was unique and tasty in its own way - I can't decide on a favorite! The food also came out in a timely manner and the waitstaff was professional and friendly. Tip: Come early on a weekday to avoid a crowded dining experience because yes, the place is small.
author: Brittany L.

description:
I ate here for lunch today. 
This place was really super awesome.
I like the inventiveness in the dishes & the enjoyable presentation.
Tomato cream soup. Awesome. 
Hamachi. Awesome. 
Warm wasabi house noodle with salmon. Super Awesome.
Good friendly service, made good recommendations on the menu. 
I would certainly go back whenever I was in the area & possibly seek it out to keep up on any of their new creations.
author: Christian V.

description:
I brought two out of town guests here about a month ago. Although we had to wait forever (even w/ reservation) and the environment is a bit claustrophobic, the food made up for all of the discomfort. 

I had the infamous seabass and it really was all it's hyped up to be. I loved it! Next time I plan on coming with just one other person and a very empty stomach.

Yay!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Order anything on the menu. You really can't go wrong. I got the noodles and flat iron streak prepared rare. Sooooo good. Top ten best food of all time.
author: Tucker M.

description:
Food: some aggressive asian fusion dishes otherwise standard
Ambiance: simple decor, real estate very limited
Service: excellent, very attentive
People: polite but noses held high

we were walk-ins and were seated within 15 mins, which really caught me off guard considering it was for dinner on a friday night. i expected to wait longer.

ordered unagi sushi rice and salmon roll as appetizers or small dishes as they call it. unagi was good, well prepared and lightly covered with the typical unagi sauce. what i did not like was the bonito flakes scattered atop the unagi roll look-a-like. these bonito flakes had numerous fish bones which was a major turn off. i didnt want to ruin the experience for my friend who was having unagi for the first time so i didnt send it back and tried to discretely remove some of the flakes. the salmon roll on the other hand was all that it had lived up to be. texture of salmon was moist and flavorful. salmon was wrapped in nori and deep fried. there was another layer of flavor in the wrap that i could not put my finger on. the chinese mustard sauce was a perfect dipping sauce compared to the usual wasabi and soy sauce i was expecting. it was much stronger than wasabi and had that extra kick of asian spice to it. the salmon roll was resting on a bed of sweet and spicy cabbage and company which was great.

entrees were good. i ordered the sea bass with garlic soy noodles and green beans. sea bass melts in your mouth and slightly charred on the surface. not overly seasoned but yet not under seasoned to a point where you are left with a fishy after taste. green beans tasted as if they were fresh from grandmas garden but noodles were just ordinary. noodle portion was minimal but since it was just ordinary i didnt mind. dish came with a dipping sauce that was extremely salty. a little dab to my sea bass can only be described as sodium overflow.

dessert should be avoided, well the desserts we ordered should be. we got the mango tapioca and coconut creme brulee with a drizzle of passion fruit puree. the tapicoa was hidden in a thick layer of creme and the mango was very subtle. this dish should have been called hidden mango creme. the brulee also was subtle with its coconut, in fact even more subtle than the mango which would make it almost non-existent. the major buzz kill was the passion fruit puree! we found ourselves doing the duck face as we sampled this dessert. very sour that it conflicted with the sweetness of the creme brulee. a mismatch indeed.

staff as mentioned was great. our place settings were always cleaned and cleared throughout the meal. they were very accommodating and allowed my friend to customize an entree without hesitation. overall my experience was great and i would definitely comeback.
author: Ryan E.

description:
This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the city!  I have never had anything that is not delicious!!

The fried salmon roll with spicy mustard appetizer is perfectly cooked and has a spicy wasabi mustard to compliment.  The prices are a little high, but they give you nice portions, you will leave feeling full.  Make a reservation, especially if you have a larger party.

My one and only complaint is how close the tables are in the restaurant.  You feel like you are having dinner with your neighbors.  Come here for the delicious food, not a quiet intimate experience.  

YUM!!
author: stacy b.

description:
I came here because my 9-month-pregnant sister-in-law was craving their grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy which in fact not only satisfied her but gave her contractions :P She did not go into labor by the way! I had the grilled mahi mahi with california rolls which wasn't bad but the best dishes were our appetizers- seared sea scallops & kobe beef tartare & my brother ordered the angus rib eye with homeade teriyaki & toasted garlic butter. The meat was very tender and tasty!

Service was great, especially since we had a 3-year-old with us.  We went on a Sunday night at 5pm so we didn't have to wait for a table but the place was packed by the time we left.
author: Melissa V.

description: Im not sure if I get the hype. Maybe I had huge expectations after reading all their reviews. While my meal was yummy I cant say it was so good that I'd come back.service was mediocre. Wasabi noodles were as good as everyone says....Overall, it was ayight.
author: Deborah D.

description:
Kind of wish I hadn't read the 2,000+ reviews before trying this place because it was difficult to be objective. However, the sea bass was indeed delicious!

One point: Make sure your ENTIRE party is on time for the reservation. There is no waiting area, so you have to stand in this scrunched corner of the room and try not to get hit by the door while staring awkwardly at everyone eating. Since there is no waiting area, there is no hostess waiting for you. I'd been standing there awhile when I saw what appeared to be an exhausted hostess. I decided to be polite and wait for her to approach me, when an anxious family walked in and tracked her down. After giving said family the death stare, I approached the hostess and told her that I was 'here' for my reservation. She asked if the other half of my party was 'here'. I fibbed a little and said that she'd be there any minute. She told me to let her know when the other half of my party arrived. Gahhhhhhh! Hostess(?) : 1; Erin : 0. She proceeded to seat a couple who came in after me. I'm admittedly new to this trendy restaurant eating thing, but that gets a thumbs down in my book no matter how good your food is.
author: Erin H.

description:
I love this place! even though its a small restaurant but everything else is good.
The food taste great and the service was good as well. You must try the sea bass with garlic noodles and the mushroom soup. The price rage here is decent as well.
author: Jenny H.

description:
If I can give this place a NO star, I will definitely give it to them. although this 1 star will give our sever for our table and may be the food. If u like good food and BAD services you can come here. I came here couple years ago, food were great and the severs were nice.

I never want to a restaurant has this kind of "good" services in San Francisco. We have made a reservation for party of 8, we were late and we called in and told from  the restaurant they will hold the table for us. We had mention we will be 15-20 mins late. Once we got there they refuse to let us seat down since we already have 6 ppls there and we are late. The lady was like "u guys were late, and I have another party coming over in 15-20 mins. I can not let u guys seated until everyone is here?!" We were like REALLY???!! u needed every single one here than we can seated? this is so ridiculous. than why told us will reserve the table and once we got there and refuse to let us seated?? This is not the way how u treat the customers, and the lady give us attitude. Sorry if u don't wanna be a sever please give me some BS attitude like that, otherwise please let me show me some attitude that a sever should have. finally, everyone got there and we can finally seated down at a 6 ppls table, but have to fit in 8 ppls. we ask for the same lady for adding a little small table which right next to us and NO one were sitting there. She refuse to add the table and told us there will be someone seating. really??!!  NO ONE were waiting outside at all. 

OK, thanks god our table sever is a boy and he is very nice. HE did show me some attitude that severs SHOULD have.

I will never come back again, ever though how good the food are (reviews). I will say u CAN NOT really taste the food there, because the sever will serve u some bitter and attitude before u try out their food. Good luck!
author: Janice C.

description: Amazing food! Great service! I strongly recommend the Sea Bass and the Pomegranate Pork Chops.  I cannot wait to return to see what else they have in store for me.  I can guarantee you will enjoy your experience at The House.
author: Jenny J.

description:
Tried to make reservations for today (Tuesday) on Saturday night... nobody ever picked up. I left a voicemail as it told me to and that the reservation desk would get back to me... never did.  Tried Sunday... nobody picked up again. T tried today (Tuesday) thinking I'd give it one last shot... and surprisingly someone picked up! Called around 1pm and asked if it were possible for a reservation at 730 for a table of 4... surprisingly they had space. WOOT! So first time here after seeing all the yelp reviews and even my sister told me to try it out. Parking... can be a total nightmare here. Especially since its on a one way street... be ready to circle around a few times especially during busy hours like dinner.

Appetizers, shared the oysters on the half shell. It was decent, the oysters weren't bad, but they weren't amazing either. What did it was the spicy cilantro sauce that it came with, but looking around at the other tables, I may have been happier with another choice. Also shared the classic fried calamari, now that was good. Definitely worth ordering! Finally, my main was the warm wasabi house noodles with the angus flatiron steak... medium rare... droool. It was really good. The sauce was a bit salty, so near the end the noodles that absorbed the sauce made me beg for more water (figuratively speaking). But everything on the plate complimented each other when you ate it in one bite... the noodle, the steak, and the salad on top. The meal was filling and good. I didn't try my friends dishes but one of them ordered off the special and the other two got the kurobuta pork chop and said they enjoyed that as well.

Definitely worth giving this place a try. It is pretty small in there so I would recommend reservations (if they ever pick up that is). I'll be coming back!
author: Johnson S.

description:
There is a reason The House has 4.5 stars with more than 1000 reviews....their asian fusion style food rocks. Atmosphere is understated but clean. Great place for lunch if you're in North Beach and don't fancy Italian.

I whole-heartedly recommend the 2 dishes I had...the deep-fried salmon rolls with chinese hot mustard sauce and chipotle bbq pork loin sandwich. The later comes with a tasty side salad and is one of the best sandwiches I had in quite some time. They also served a spicy cucumber salad as a pre-lunch treat.

It's the small places like this that make SF a great foodie city.
author: Dave S.

description: The specials were awesome. The oysters were especially delicious!
author: Matt R.

description:
I wish I could give this place 10 stars....food was amazing!  Don't go early for a drink because there is no room for standing, let alone a drink but the food is incredible.  You also have to have a reservation to ge in this place, but we were lucky enough to get in after someone cancelled.

What we had - all fantastic:
Shrimp & chive dumplings
Seabass with garlic ginger soy
Scallops special

No doubt we'll be back!!  This was easily one of the best meals I've had in SF!
author: Kim D.

description:
Overall excellent food, presentation, and portion.  I think where it lacks is the spacing and manners.  You would think that with parking as frustrating as it is in the area, the last thing you would want is your food to arrive with some sour bitter attitude from waitress.  It's sad that potential could be interrupted with this.  But if you're as strong minded as me, and can separate between mind and mouth, you'll have a pleasant meal.  

And as the family always does it, we get to try each others stuff:
-Flatiron steak - good but not great
-Grilled sea bass - My favorite by far and love the fuyikaki seasoning and sauce
-Chicken liver salad - surprisingly good
-Mango tapioca - interesting
-Short ribs - This is good but it doesn't come with very much
-Curry noodles - Something different from your usual garlic noodles, liking it!
-Bitter chocolate cake with coffee ice cream - how could you say no??
author: Vincent K.

description:
The food was a full five stars; the price combined with the service and atmosphere dropped it down to only 4 stars.  

The home-made noodles, as others have said, were outstanding.  I had the sea bass with them, which was cooked perfectly.  Their mussels in broth appetizer was not revolutionary, but was quite good.  Their pork-based main course with pomegranate sauce was likewise amazing.  The two vegetarian appetizers I tried were well done, although it should be noted there are very limited food options for vegetarians in general.  Food was also plated with some nice touches, if you care about that kind of thing.

Now some negatives:
The service was reasonably attentive, but felt rushed and slightly scattered.  For example, we were, we thought, ready to order before she told us there were a bunch of specials.  (Some of this may have been our fault; the fourth person in our party was a no-show).  Prices likewise were not terrible, but felt a bit high, especially on the wine and beer lists, which had markups that were ridiculous even by alcohol list standards.  The place is small (a dozen tables?) and unfortunately, we got stuck with one of the four? in a narrow corridor between the kitchen and bathroom, somehow, which wasn't a very inviting space.

Overall: I'd come back.  I love this style of food.  Make sure you have a reservations.
author: Zachary R.

description:
Him: Where are you going to dinner on your birthday?
Me: The House
Him: Who's house? Your house?
Me: No, THE House!

Yes, THE House, the one and only now.  I had been to The House when it was back in the Sunset and I remember it been quite lovely...that was 9 long years ago.  

This time around, my bf threw me a surprise birthday party here. The food was fantastic, for the most part.  We ordered a couple scallop appetizers which came with a delicate lemon ponzu sauce....could have just slurped that up!  A few of us had the Alaskan halibut in a coconut curry sauce.  I would definitely recommend it...the meat was tender and cooked to perfection.  The sauce was sweet and slightly spicy.  My bf had the steak (which was solidly good, but missing a wow-factor)...

I can't tell you how dessert was...because a friend brought an absolutely divine mango mousse cake from a bakery in Berkeley.  We decided not to have cake at the restaurant because they apparently charge a cake plating fee...wha!?! $3 per slice....
author: Evelyn K.

description:
The food was good, more than asian fusion i would say chinese food fusion, because most of the dishes we tried were chinese flauvored, like the pork chops,the steak, the cod with noodles, etc.
The food was good, really nice, but the service wasnt  good enough 
, we made at reservation and we had to wait for almost 30 minutes in the little entrance, we felt like sardines, then when they finally gave us the table, the waitress wasnt very friendly, for this kind of restaurant you expect good food and good service, we had the first but not the second one
author: Aneli C.

description:
Woohooo! We came here with friends and everything was delicious. It was seriously the _best_ ahi tuna steak I've ever had. I couldn't believe something so thick could be so tender on every bite! My ribeye steak was amazingly delicious. So were both appetizers we ordered. Everything was just spot on. Dinner was rounded out by the creamy delicious coconut creme brulee.

The restaurant is cozy. They don't take reservations though so it can be a wait.... Service was good.
author: Alice C.

description:
I came here with a friend on 3/23/13 and was excited to try out all their dishes as it's been a while since I've been here. Everyone knows not to expect a lot of stretching or sitting room, so my review it's based off of the food only.

Here is what we ordered:

(off the menu)
Sauteed Clams
Yellowtail Sashimi with citrus salsa
Sauteed Scallops with ponzu/lemon and tobiko

(on menu)
Wild Mushroom Rice with Grilled Prawns
Seabass with Garlic Noodles and snap peas
Shrimp and Chives dumpling

Everything was well prepared except for the dumplings. I am a fanatic of dumplings and these just tasted weird. My friend and I were trying to figure out if it was the shrimp or the skins or the sauce and after a few, I realized that the mixture itself tasted strange.. I LOVE Shrimp and Chives, so maybe my expectations were high?? This was the only thing that was 2 stars for me and I ate them all just so I wouldn't waste any food. 

Everything else was excellent!!
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description: Really great seasoning and sauces. Seared scallop appetizer special was really good. Wasabi noodles weren't too spicy. Brought us extra plates when we said we were sharing.
author: Sandra K.

description:
I saw this place on "Check Please!" and decided to take my g/f there for her birthday.

First off, the place is pretty crammed so make reservations unless you want to wait a long time.

Service was excellent. Even though it was a Saturday night and pretty packed with large groups, my glass of water was always refilled in a timely manner. The staff seemed to have good timing that goes along with a nice dining experience (bill arriving on time, water refills etc).

Onto the food. I went with the flatiron steak with wasabi noodles. There are a ton of reviews for this place so I'm not going to repeat a lot b/c I'm sure it's been said. But I will say that I have had better steaks before but I'm putting everything in context b/c this isn't a steak house. It was good no doubt but the entire plate as a whole was superb. The noodles are tasty and spicy. The presentation and plating of the dish was exceptional. You just have to try it.

My g/f went with the sea bass with wasabi noodles. I had a small bite of the fish and it was very good as well. 

Before I forget. We usually don't get dessert but couldn't pass on the truffle cake topped with coffee ice-cream along with small amount of caramel serving as a base for the dish. We ate that up with ease.

One last thing i'll note are the reasonable prices for top notch food. You just don't get that at many places. Two quality dishes with dessert was about 50 bucks. That's hard to beat.
author: James K.

description:
It's always great to go back to a restaurant that has been around for over ten years in San Francisco. My first time at The House was in early 1996. Prior to this evening, my last time was about five or six years ago. The food is still very tasty and well prepared. In fact, not much about the actual restaurant has changed.

From a menu perspective, the blue lake green bean tempura is still there. Main dishes are a 50/50 balance between fish and meat/poultry dishes. The grilled chicken breast with curry noodle is no longer on the menu; that was my favorite item.

My friends and I shared the aforementioned green beans and the asparagus appetizer. I had the flat iron steak with wasabi noodles. We then shared the chocolate cake and the fruit tart special of the day for desert.  Honestly, I didn't taste much wasabi in the noodles, but the soy based sauce really hit the spot and worked well with the meat. It also comes with a topping of kimchee-style Asian slaw.  Both desserts were excellent, but I was already too well lubricated from three glasses of wine to fully enjoy them.

I look forward to eating here again, and I hope it will be sooner rather than later.
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: I was expecting good, but this place was absolutely wonderful!  My new favorite restaurant. I had the sea bass with the tastiest soy/garlic sauce and garlic noodles.  I've never had anything so flavorful. My husband had the tuna and it was wonderful and prepared perfectly. My daughter had the mahi mahi and said it was great with a creamy, earthy sauce. Our friend had the black cod which was not only great and flavorful but beautifully prepared. Chef definitely has an aesthetic eye while pairing the dishes with accompaniments perfectly. We each had dessert and the favorite of the table was pumpkin squash and pecan pie. Delicious. You have to try this place but make a reservation, it's quite small. Excellent service.
author: Dianna M.

description:
This place is tucked away in a great location in North Beach.  We made reservations and were seated immediately even though we arrived 20 minutes early.  The restaurant is cozy and inviting.  

Our server was extremely helpful with the menu and although each and every special she mentioned made our mouths water, we decided to go with a few things on the menu:

Appetizer:  Deep-fried salmon roll with chinese hot mustard - So light and absolutely decadent.

Main dishes:  Grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy - house specialty.  The sea bass melts in your mouth and the wasabi noodles ... nom nom nom.
Angus ribeye steak, housemade teriyaki, toasted garlic butter - my husband was so reluctant to share even the smallest of bites.  He loved it.

This is definitely one of our new favs.  Our only regret is that we hadn't heard of this place sooner.  Our goal?  To try everything on the menu :)
author: Susan M.

description:
five star food and ambiance for a three to four star price means this place is both a wonderful experience and a GREAT deal! fiance and i came here based on the recommendation of an SF aficionado and tried everything that was highly recommended: 

deep fried salmon roll: had no idea what these would be like, but they were AMAZING. an entire roll, sliced into triangles of crispy, salmon buttery goodness:

the sea bass: melt in your mouth, perfect consistency. :) i also like the sweet/salty udon noodles that accompanies this dish

the wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak: this was less impressive to me, and next time i'd try something else like the pork chop. i thought the wasabi house noodles would be phenomenal based on reviews, but i actually liked the udon noodles that came with the sea bass better.

the deep fried pickles that i mistakenly took as peppers were a great accompaniment to the dishes! 

the food and presentation are lovely, as was the service - i'd definitely come back. :)
author: Tiffany L.

description: Fully deserves it's rating of 4.5 stars. The Kurobota pork is fantastic. As were the wasabi noodles. Not sure about the rest of the menu, but for those two items, you will be well served.
author: Dustin B.

description: Amazing food.  Big portions and reasonably priced.  The deep fried salmon roll app is potentially the best thing I've ever eaten.  We enjoyed everything we hate, but that salmon roll still makes my mouth water.
author: Tami S.

description:
Having dined at numerous San Francisco restaurants, The House is my favorite!  The restaurant is rated 26 on Zagat, but it really exceeded my expectation in every way.  Not knowing what to expect, we arrived on time for our reservation and were seated right away.    My first impression was that the restaurant was very small, very unassuming, and it was PACKED.  

We had the crispy salmon roll and seared scallops as our appetizers, and seabass and the wasabi noodles steak as our entree.  Salmon rolls and scallops were to die for!   Sea bass was really good, but I've had better.  Wasabi noodles was decent.  I would just go back for the scallops and crispy salmon rolls, and that's saying a lot since I usually wouldn't want to go back as a visitor.  And it's usually a good sign if I remember what I had since it's been a month since I've dined there. :)  

Don't expect romantic ambiance or 5* service here.  But they'll make it up with the food. :)  Very reasonably price, $100 for 2, and the food is much better than other highly rated SF restaurants on yelp.
author: Uyen C.

description:
What was I thinking? I have lived a block from The House for over 1,5 years and never ate there until this past Saturday. Oh, I did try.....many times, but the place is always so crammed and I am not one who enjoys lines, so I always left for a different place. Mistake I won't make again!

My friend and I were lucky - we were on our way to the Greek restaurant next door, when I saw a little table for two by the window open at The House. I said "Maybe it's our lucky day"! And it was. We were sat right away and had a fabulous - and delicious - time!

Appetizer: seared scallops. Cooked to perfection. I couldn't believe it could be beaten, but it was. My friend had the Angus Ribeye special and I had the Ahi Tuna. I really couldn't pick which one I liked best! The ribeye was melting, fabulously complemented by mashed potatoes, broccoli and mushrooms. The ahi came with jasmine rice, spinach and spicy mustard sauce. It was fresh and full of flavors. Pinot Noir and Sauvignon Blanc to match and we had the perfect dinner. Oh, and did I mention the presentation? It was also a big highlight of the meal.

I would give 5 stars if it were not for the ambiance. It's a very small restaurant, and it feels crammed, especially with the eternal line waiting to be seated. You don't want to feel rushed while enjoying such an amazing meal. It also lacks charm and the right lighting, which definitely is compensated by the good service and spectacular food.

I feel really blessed to have an amazing friend who treated me to such an incredible experience! And we will definitely come back - this time sooner and with a reservation!
author: Simone W.

description: This place has a good vibe and amazing food. The noodles steak dish was fantastic. Sea bass also amazing. Great place for a cool atmosphere great food and casual or dressed up style
author: Ryan T.

description: -1 star for the rude ppl that works their, but this place deserve a 5 star food is amazing
author: Nate K.

description:
A friend and I finally dined here about 2 months ago after the numerous raves i heard.  I imagined this place to be a lot bigger so I wa plas a bit shock to see how small it is.  
I was so happy to find a sparkling red wine on the menu, because not many places carry them.  For dinner, we ordered 2 appetizers, the famous salmon spring rolls and mussels, sea bass and halibut special for main course, and chocolate cake with coffee ice cream for dessert. 
Everything was delicious.  This is the first real fusion place I've been to that lives up to the theme.  East met West without trying to hard or being over the top and not tasty.  For many Westerners, the sea bass might be a little salty, but it was just right for a real Asian like myself.  I would definitely come back for more.
author: Mai-Tam N.

description:
take one star away cuz their service...
but the food are AMAZING!!! 
if their servers can be a little bit nicer
this restaurant is perfect
author: Liang C.

description:
We wandered into this place because it was raining and it had great yelp reviews.  We didn't realize you usually need a reservation to get a seat, but the waitress was accommodating and said if our party of 4 could eat in about an hour, she could seat us immediately. 

The atmosphere was great; it is a small place with limited seats so it was never too loud. Food was definitely expensive, and you don't get much volume. Tasted great, but nothing especially impressive.  Worth trying once, but I wouldn't frequent it due to price and the need to get reservations.
author: Anshu A.

description: I don't get it! There is NO WAY this is an honest rating. The food was mediocre at best. The service was good, however. Unfortunately, I left there feeling cheated.
author: Talley S.

description: Undeniable good food but make sure to RSVP in advance. The place is small, the food is expensive but they have a delicious menu. Try their sea bass and garlic noodles which are full of flavor and will melt in your mouth. Deep fried salmon and other appetizers are great also. Food service was good but one of the cashier girls wasn't quite as nice. That's why I gave the restaurant 4 stars
author: Miss D T.

description:
this is my new favorite restaurant. 
get the pork chops.
get wine.
get appetizers!!
author: Shirley L.

description: Party of 8, yes we squeezed into this small spot. I'm still surprised we were able to do a party of 8. I wasn't expecting too much from this place but it had GREAT reviews on yelp. I took others opinions and selections while deciding on my own meal. I wasn't too hungry since I just got back from the boiling crab a few hours prior. I decided to go into the SMALL section of the menu. I had the Unagi avacado with sushi rice - delicious.. the unagi had this perfect bbq flavor to it.. the sushi had some strong spots of wasabi which was a little intense for me. But overall it was delicious. I also had one of their Specials, bbq oysters. When I think of bbq oysters I think of smoked on the grill served with lemon, Tabasco, or garlic and butter. The house killed it by putting actual BBQ sauce over the oysters. I would suggest them put it on the side for taste. But nonetheless they were still good oysters. I had a taste test of all the other plates at the table. Mushroom rice with prawns was so good, wasabi noodles were good, fried salmon roll was good but beware of the chinese mustard sauce.. soo spicy! (also a good app to share because the salmon gets overwhelming) and the steak was tough and med. rare seemed more like rare. I really wish I could of tried the sea bass.. NEXT TIME... NEXT TIME..
author: Tiff C.

description:
I contemplated not writing a review for The House because I'm sure I really can't say anything that hasn't been said in +1200 other reviews, so I'll make my 2 cents quick.

The House is a tiny, cozy, intimate restaurant that serves amazingly tasty, high quality food for a very reasonable amount.  When we dined there, we had:

-Deep fried salmon rolls with Chinese hot mustard: delicious, perfectly cooked, artfully presented.  I think I may have asked for the mustard on the side.
-Day boat scallops appetizer: I believe it was a special that day, and the scallops were sweet, firm and tender.
-Pork chop with pomegranate sauce: Definitely order this, it was perfect.  The sauce was delicious and a beautiful color and the pork chop was thick and juicy.
-Fish (forgot what kind, it was also a special that day I think) with garlic noodles and sauteed beans: A fair portion of fish, crunchy beans and thick, chewy, tasty noodles.  
-Dessert of kabocha pie and chocolate cake: The kabocha cake blew us away.  It was like a pumpkin pie made with kabocha (type of squash).  It wasn't riddled spices, you could taste the natural sweetness of the squash and it was a creamy, smooth texture.  I think I could've eaten a whole pie.  The chocolate cake was really good too, I think it might have been flourless because it was very dense, thick and chocolatey.  

Parking in North Beach is always a pain, so keep that in mind (we were late for our reservation because parking was nearly impossible).  Give The House a try, I guarantee you won't be disappointed!
author: Laura S.

description:
If you are looking for a nice restaurant for date/ celebration,  
I would recommend this little, romantic place.

My family visited the place after a very long day in San Francisco,
and we had a very healing time with wonderful food.

We ordered Deep-fried salmon roll,  Sea bass dish, Wasabi noodles + steak and pork chops with pomegranate sauce. They were all VERY delicious, my favorite would be the pork chops. I always want my pork to be fully cooked, but here, I followed the chef's recommendations and had them "medium". Soft meat soaked in sweet pomegranate sauce was very very delicious, I strongly recommend this dish.

With the sea bass dish, it was very nice, however the piece was so small I felt the price was a little too expensive. Maybe sea bass is a rare fish...??? I don't know.

The place is very crowded, if you don't reserve a seat, you may have to wait for a while to be seated. 

Customer service was ok, I wouldn't say it's best. 
I don't expect perfect smiles + kindness but I was a little disappointed when
a waitor frowned at my father for not speaking out loud for something..
He seemed truly irritated...
Let's just say... they weren't that friendly (maybe they were far too busy and tired).

But other than that, everything else was perfect and I would denfinitely come back to this place when I visit San Francisco.
author: Alice C.

description:
This place is well reviewed and deserves it!

I was sad they ran out of the Miso Black Cod :-( 
We did get the last order of BBQ Oysters which was my favorite appetizer of the night, Kurobuta pork with Pomegranates was my favorite main dish, Mango tapioca was a pretty dessert.

I wouldn't recommend the passionfruit creme brule, I'm not the biggest fan of it to begin with but Raymond who is a fan was also turned off by the sourness of the passionfruit.  

Parking was a pain
author: Jennifer L.

description: Amazing food!!!  The sea bass and the black cod were both excellent, perfectly balanced. Always get garlic noodles with the sea bass and pretend the rice option doesn't exist.  Slightly on the salty side, but still really great food.  The crab cake appetizer was also delicious.  You really can't go wrong with any of the options on the menu.  Perfect for a date night but it is a bit small inside but the service more than makes up for the lack of space.
author: Sarah C.

description: The House is one of the consistently excellent restaurants in the city. Cramped, but fun and nice
author: Emily H.

description: The pork chop is thick, juicy, and flavorful.  The sea bass that everyone raves about is worth the hype - perfectly flaky and moist.  The fried salmon roll was just okay though.  Would definitely go there again.
author: Frank W.

description:
A jewel!  An absolute jewel!

I'm very picky about fusion places and I have to say the house does has a way to bring out the best of east and west on a plate.  I was pleasantly surprised by the efficient, top quality service and tasteful decor. Fresh seafood, wonderful taste and a delight to the eye. ( Plating/presentation was fabulous without sacrificing taste).  The crabcake appetizer is a little on on the heavy side (creamy) but still held its own.  The cherry that topped off this decadent ice cream sundae of an experience was the fact that it was just as good as I've heard.
author: Shinny L.

description:
Ouch. 
I just got hated on for hating on the West Coast. 
You see, I actually love California. My golden years were spent here. (Go bears!). 
... But I also love to hate. 
   ... It's a hard-knock life. I know. 

Really, I'm just digressing from regurgitating what 543 reviews have said before me. 
... in short, The House rocks. 

Love me some: sea bass and pork chops. 
I wasn't wowed by the creamy crab cake mixture, or any of the appetizers we sampled for that matter. But still... pretty tasty in my book.

If my mom could cook, I wish this would be my house. 
... Of course, she can't. So I grew up eating microwaved fish and cream of mushroom smothered chicken (also cooked in the microwave).
...... But that's another story for another time.
author: Vic C.

description:
Came here again and tried:
grilled sea bass with noodles and green beans - melt in your mouth goodness
chive/shrimp dumplings - pretty good
unagi with rice roll - awesome as always
chocolate truffle cake - decadent goodness

Meal was quite pricey, must be honest. But once in awhile, best treat ever!
author: Carol L.

description: What a great place.i ordered curry noodles and the hubby had halibut.both were incredible. He also had the Caesar salad and i had the mixed greens, those were great as well.we went there based on yelp's recommendation and were glad we did.
author: Joni M.

description:
The food here is absolutely amazing. I went here with my sister on a Sunday night and it wasn't hard to make a reservation for 2 at 7:30 just a few hours before.  We ordered the fried salmon rolls for appetizer with spicy mustard which was alright I would say, I had it here before and I think its slightly overrated and will get something else in the future.  For the main entrees, I ordered the black cod which absolutely melts in your mouth, and my sister ordered the Kobe Beef which was delicious as well.  Both were impeccable but definitely not the healthiest if you're concerned with that, both were very fatty meat hence making it delicious.  After the meal although I felt very satisfied by the meal's deliciousness, I also felt kind of nauseous like I ate pure fat--it didn't quite sit the best in my stomach.

I wouldn't recommend the desserts as highly, we got the mango tapioca and the chocolate truffle cake with coconut (the title is something like this), which I thought were both sub-par and couldn't compete to the high-quality of the entrees.  The Mango Tapioca is definitely "interesting" I would put it, it is pretty creamy and unique as I have never tasted anything quite like it.  I would say if you're not really into a tangy, sweet, asian (bc of the Tapioca balls), I wouldn't order this.  The chocolate cake was also just OKAY, if I were you I wouldn't get dessert here and just stop somewhere nearby for some Gelato in Little Italy if you really need a sweet fix.  

My other complaint would probably be the service, it was very difficult to understand the lady who waited on us as her English was definitely not her first language.  When asking her to describe the individual dishes, she had difficulty explaining to us what exactly each dish was, saying stuff like oh this is "pork", this is "steak" without much elaboration.  She also wasn't the most friendly either.  If the service and venue was better (if the venue was bigger and nicer), the House could get a 5, but its just a bit below that rating in my opinion.
author: Heather Y.

description:
I'm so glad we made reservations for this place.  

The House was packed.  Such a cute little place with very friendly service.  What stood out about the food and service was that even though it was packed and extremely busy, the chef was on with all of his plates - great presentation, food temp, and the quality of the dishes very apparent in the flavors and every dish came out perfect - neither under nor over cooked.  The servers were very good about taking our orders, clearing plates, refilling our drinks and I could tell that they had tried all the dishes here.  Important because of that they were able to make great recommendations (unlike bestbuy employees  =P),   

Between the 3 of us, we ordered 3 appetizers and 2 entrees.  Perfect amount of food.  We started with raw oysters in the half shell with cilantro dressing - 6 so 2 each, very fresh.  We tried the special for Saturday, the papaya salad.  It was tasty, refreshing and loved the crispy rice on top which gave it a crunchy bite and toasty flavor complimented the salad well.  We had to try the customer sig dish, the deep fried salmon roll with spicy mustard sauce.  The salmon was well packed and the sauce was yummy - somehow this dish reminded me of the appetizers at the CheeseCake Factory - cross between the avocado egg rolls and firecracker salmon rolls.  I know you're thinking - "HOW COULD YOU?" dare to compare the two places..

For entrees, we again went with the special of the night, the BBQ Kobe Beef with Shoestring potatoes.  Kobe beef was cooked medium rare - perfect and the shoestring potatoes were so tasty.  I wish the BBQ sauce came on the side.  Great Kobe beef should not be covered with sauce as it was.  We couldn't stop munching on the shoestring potatoes even when we were stuffed.  2nd entree was the Grilled Sea Bass.  Ohhhh, I can't describe how perfectly cooked the fish was.  I didn't even touch the extra garlic ginger soy dipping sauce.  Perfection on a plate.  Didn't care for the greens but it balanced out the food groups and loved the garlic noodles the sea bass came with.  The chef and owner of the restaurant Larry and his wife have done a great job with this little gem.
author: Diana L.

description: Amazing!!! Small and a bit noisy but you forget about that as soon as you look at the menu!
author: Mike C.

description:
My review pertains to the lack of customer service.

Had a reservation at 730p, walked in at 720p and they gave away our table to a group that walked in 30 seconds before us with no reservation. No apology at all, they just had a distressed look on their faces and said it will just be a couple of minutes. A couple of minutes turned out to be another 20 minutes. It wasn't that long of a wait, but at least own up to the fact that you gave away our table and try to play it off. 

The person filling the water for some reason only liked to fill my glass half full. 3 refills of water and each time only half a glass. did not understand that at all when everyone else around me got a full glass of water. 

Overall, customer service sucked. Food was good, no complaints there.
author: Peter C.

description:
My first non-biased 5 star review; this restaurant really deserves all the praise. I made reservations for 2 on a weeknight at 6 but the restaurant still had a few open seats when I arrived (though it definitely filled up with people waiting by the time I left). From the moment our waitress told us the night's specials, I already knew that it would be a great experience.

Great things!
- Steamed mussel appetizer: It was my first time having mussels and I am a believer now. The texture was so soft and not at all fishy-smelling. The broth was such a mixture of delicious flavors. I would eat the broth itself!
- Wasabi noodles with steak: This seems to be a popular dish and rightfully so. Our medium steak was perfectly cooked and the udon was really tasty. This was definitely worth the $18 and then some.
- Miso glazed cod with crab roll: After reading reviews about the wonderful fish, I knew this was something we had to get. The cod was one of the specials but I'm sure all the other fish dishes are great too. The skin was browned and crispy, but the flesh was flaky and soft and seemed to melt in your mouth like butter. The dish was absolutely gorgeous to look at too.
- Speed of service: Plates literally come out in a matter of minutes and you can feel how fresh everything tastes.
- Service: The waitstaff is really attentive, always re-filling drinks and taking dishes away when done.

I really don't have any complaints. I will come back to try everything on the menu! SO GREAT.
author: Shira C.

description:
Wasabi noodles are really good! 

We had to wait 30 minutes even though we had reservations, so just beware and be flexible.
author: Kerry F.

description: If the service was a little better, I would give this place 5 stars. The waiter was a little slow & forgot to bring us our beverages, but that was no biggie. For the prices I think the waiters should be more "on it". But maybe its just because they just opened when we got there. The food here is so good. I'v been here a couple times, but the most recent time I tried one of their specials of the day. It was tempura halibut with caramelized cauliflower with a side of some ginger dipping sauce. I can honestly say that this was downright one of the best seafood dishes I've ever had. I love cauliflower & have never had it made like the way they made it. It had some kind of cream sauce on it as well. I can't even describe how mouthwatering it is. I've been searching pinterest for a similar recipe. Aside from the veggies, I ordered a side of rice to go with the tempura halibut. You can never really go wrong with anything fried, but I was worried bc I was thinking eating fried halibut might ruin the tenderness of the fish. I was wrong because it was seriously so damn good. The ginger dipping sauce with rice just made it that much more good. If you are looking for a good asian fusion meal this is the place to go. The place is fairly small so I can see it getting really packed & uncomfortable. Luckily the last time I went we got there right when it opened. I would definitely come back despite the service.
author: Chaena M.

description: The food is pretty darn good. The fried salmon roll is a favourite. The service however is indifferent at best and at times outright rude. When I'm being asked if I know what I want to eat before anyone asks for your drink order or brings water, you know it's all a numbers game and getting the dinners through as fast as possible. Really do like the food here but it's consider it high end fast food.
author: Sally S.

description:
Woot!  Review #1380!!  ya - so what can i add the other 1379 can't?  well for one, this place has been here for a looooooooooong time.  It was my bday and i wanted someplace special to go in the FiDi.  After looking around I came upon The House.  

Asian fusion menu looked good and I don't think I'd ever been there before.  We made reservations for 8pm on a Tuesday.  They were packed!  

The restaurant is very noisy so beware and the tables are VERY close together so don't share any secrets at dinner or talk about your table mates ;)

onto the food. YUM YUM.  We started with salmon crispy roll.  Yes it is as good as they say.  We also had the special deep fried soft shell crab. Holy crap!  That is some good stuff!

Onto the entrees.  Hubby got black cod with sushi rolls on top.  I got the flatiron steak with wasabi noodles.  Yes, they were both 'all that'.  Hubby's fish was probably the best fish I've ever had in my life.  It was like eating a cloud.  SOOOO good.

We were too stuffed for dessert.   the service was very attentive and teh food was truly amazing.  It was $100 for both of us with drinks.  Very fair for the quality of food we got.

Really people - get over there!
author: julie a.

description:
Incredibly delicious food here.  Came here a couple of days ago during my visit to San Francisco and it happened to be recommended by two different sets of friends.  The calamari we started out with was some of the best I have ever had, not too greasy, but with just the right amount of crispiness and flavor.  And my main course, the miso cooked sea bass, was incredible.  So delicious.  I was like licking the plate, it was ridiculous.  Everyone else was very pleased with their food as well.Dessert we tried a coconut creme brulee with a passion fruit glaze, chocolate cake and an apple cobbler.  Delicious.  
Prices are a little expensive, but I would definitely come back here to celebrate a birthday or something.
author: Jon L.

description: I love coming to The House.  The food is so delicious and the presentation is beautiful.  Reservation is always better.  If you walk in, the wait is long.  I always make reservation.  I typically don't like to wait especially when I am hungry.  This is my favorite place and the price is affordable.  Even though the place is a bit small but its all about the food for me.
author: Hanny H.

description:
Small little gem of a restaurant! Fabulous food and quick service. If you don't mind the crowded space, definitely come here for an excellent meal that isn't too pricey. 

I come here about twice a year and always order the Grilled Sea Bass. It comes with udon noodles and is just AMAZING.

My favorite appetizers are the unaji avocado roll (so much flavor and always delicious) and the tuna tartare. I always order both because they are just so good.
author: Janelle R.

description:
The wait wasn't so bad for such a crowded place (30 mins) but people! Please don't crowd the inside waiting area! Wait outside if its crowded and the hostess will come get you. I had window seat next to the door and there was always a crowd of people looking over my shoulder to see what I was drinking, eating or yelping. Not to mention the unwanted body contact.

We got the grilled sea bass, miso black cod, deep fried salmon roll, and seared scallops. Everything was delicious and beautifully presented. But, if you're a fan of sea bass, take note that The House grills them.
author: Kenneth D.

description:
Very loud, very small. Halibut special was fantastic.  Kobe beef with truffle sauce was blah.  Pass on the desserts as they are nothing special. 

Service is abrupt and they will rush your meal - no time to linger.  They want you in and out ASAP.
author: Dee K.

description:
Went here for lunch and all I have to say is WOW!  This place knocked me off my chair.  

To start we enjoyed these delicious spicy pickles and a side of deep fried salmon rolls. Although it was lunch time, I thoroughly enjoyed the delicious sea bass with amazing udon noodles and perfectly crispy string beans. The sea bass was made to perfection; crisp on the outside and soft and buttery on the inside!  

As much as a glass of wine would top off the meal I went with their Lychee ice tea which was perfect. I wish I had more time for dessert, but I'll save that for my next adventure to N Beach.
author: Tamz O.

description:
I'm downgrading this restaurant.  Of the three people in our party, two of us got sick.  This used to be one of my  favorite go-to restaurants to take locals and out of towners.

I'm thinking the duck entree was the culprit as it was the only dish that the two of us who became sick had that my healthy friend didn't have.  Maybe, it was just an off night for my friends and I.  

I had to keep making mad dashes for the bathroom following dinner until the next day.  Meanwhile, my friend was throwing up on her plane ride home.  She must have gone through three of those vomit bags.  Imagine how horrid it is to be confined to your seat while you're feeling queasy and nauseous!!  (shudders)

In general, I feel that the restaurant has not been as consistent with their food.  Before writing this review, my friend and I have dined there on at least three separate occasions during the course of 1.5 months and we feel the food just isn't as good as before.

I'm saddened to nix House off my list of favorite SF restaurants as I won't be stepping foot inside this House again.
author: Dorothy L.

description: We called before jumping in a taxi and were able to get a seat when we arrived.  Their menu is not very big but everything we had was very good.  I really liked my meal-the wasabi noodles with flat iron steak.  The steak was cooked perfectly and the noodles were a great texture and taste.  I liked the salmon roll too-not something I would normally order but glad we did.  The dishes are all very nice looking too.  My aunt had the pork chop-the bite I had was very tasty.  The service was very good also.
author: Kim P.

description:
The House is a winner.  An absolute winner.  I will go back at the first chance.

Recommended by my stepdad as an affordable (for what you get) yet outstanding new place, it truly fit the bill.  Coming to San Francisco for a limited time, we wanted something very SF, and this had it.

We started with some excellent white shrimp and chive dumplings and a special of monkfish liver in broth.  Like, woah, that was tasty.  The liver was butter-like in consistency, and it came with some thin noodles and broth.

For an entree, I had the Kurobata pork chop, and I'll be thinking about it for a long time.

We skipped the dessert for being too full and went somewhere else on Columbus, but I'd imagine they could complete the trifecta with a great sweet course.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Food: Great fusion style foods.  Ordered the Sea Bass (amazingly cooked), the side sauce was a bit salty for my likings though.  My friend got the mahi mahi which was cooked perfectly as well.  We ordered an appetizer, deep fried salmon roll, which was packed with salmon.  Portions were a good leaned towards the larger size for a lunch.  

Service: Good service, water was kept topped off.  

Atmosphere: Small restaurant, tables are pretty close in the front, if you want more privacy request a table towards the back.  

Price: total price came out to roughly $65 with tax and tip for a party of two; two entrees and one appetizer.
author: Kevin T.

description: I could've sworn I already wrote a review. I've been here a couple of times because my Mom and sister recommended that I give it a shot. Be sure to call ahead and make a reservation because it's small and very popular. The dishes that stood out to me were the garlic noodles , wasabi noodles , pork chops , flat iron steak , Teri- Rib eye , and the fried plantains . I'm not a huge fan of seafood , but my friends loved the crab cakes , salmon egg rolls , and the sea bass. Parking is a litte tough in north beach , so make sure you allow yourself time , or skip straight to one of the parking lots on Broadway . ::HANDLE::
author: Bryan Y.

description:
This place is so highly hyped, especially on Yelp so I just had to try it. I was sorely disappointed, but I guess that's what happens when you hear about "the best restaurant in SF."

We ordered the deep fried salmon skin roll, which was pretty good. However, it was so oily and greasy that I felt kind of gross eating it. I used to happily eat the fat off of meat, so that should give you an idea of how unhealthy the rolls tasted. I ordered the sea bass, which was indeed as tender and melt-in-your-mouth as other reviews had said. But then again, that's the texture of sea bass in general. If I'd just thrown a piece of sea bass in a pan and thrown oil on it, it would've had the same texture. The noodles on the side tasted so greasy, like they were from a cheap Chinese takeout place. I was grossed out and could only stand to eat a few strands. We also had the pomegranate pork chop which was mediocre. Meh. Not bad, not great.

The only good part of the meal was the dessert, which was a coffee chocolate cake with ice cream. It was so soft and creamy, yet rich and decadent. It almost cancelled out the badness of the meal. Almost.

But yeah...this place is way too overrated on Yelp.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
If you're craving wasabi noodles or sea bass from The House come on a weekend for LUNCH!

The food is just as delicious, the plating is just as beautiful, the service is just as friendly, but you won't have to wait in line drooling!  To top it all off, I believe the meals are cheaper as well (the wasabi noodles come with pork or salmon instead of flat iron steak during lunch - still delicious though).  Oh heppy day!
author: Krystle S.

description:
You go spend money and then forget.  This is not one of those places because it really is that good.  I called a day ahead and was surprised that I was able to get an 830 reservation on a Saturday night.  

Arrived there a little early and had to wait 10 mins past my reservation but I didn't mind.  The place is very small but my gf & I was able to get a nice 4 person table.  

We started with fried soft shell crab dipped in pepper fish sauce & scallop appetizers.  I don't know what the sauce was around the scallops, but it was amazing.  The ahi tuna & filet mignon entrees were also excellent.  

I would go back again and I think this might be one of my favorite restaurants in SF.
author: Henry C.

description:
I was quite surprised at how disappointing the meal was at the house. We made reservations but waited a good 20 minutes for our table,which would be ok if it was not such a tiny place and i felt like I was hovering over people who were trying to enjoy their meal.

The appetisers were good but the main courses were disappointing. We tried:

Salmon roll - pretty good, nice crispy springroll skin, nori and medium cooked salmon. went with the sauce really well

Ahi tuna tartare - the nori chips were grossly oily, and the tuna looked grey and unappealing - tasted primarily of wasabi n not much else

Unagi on Avocado rice - very very good. the unagi was thick & juicy with a great creamy well cooked rice mixed w avocado

Wasabi noodles & angus flat iron steak - noodles were ok, great texture not so great flavours but the steak was abysmal. cooked to the right temperature but tough beyond beliefe

Angus ribeye - same issue as the flat iron - so tough i had problems cutting through the meat and we barely made it halfway through. Mash potatoes were ok but we left most of it behind.

Mushroom rice & shrimp - pretty good. The mushroom rice had so much flavour and was cooked a little on the al dente side. shrimps were grilled well.

Sea bass - fish was amazing, cooked well and went well w the soy sauce. Veges and noodles were extremely oily...

The service was quite absent - no one checked on how the food was till halfway through.By dessert, we just want to head over to steps of rome for a better experience.
author: Edda O.

description:
Best Asian food in San Francisco! 

I have to say that this is the best Asian food in the city. I can remember alot of memorable places, but when it comes down to price, quantity, and quality House has got the best overall value. The 3 mainstays that you can never go wrong getting are the 

1. Fried Salmon rolls w/spicy mustard sauce: I love how the outside is crispy while the soft cooked Salmon just melts in your mouth. To describe it imagine eating a salmon flavored M&M, but instead of sweet it was indelibly salty. 

2. Unagi Avocado Roll: Again this appetizer is so good!!! With its flaky crust and soft morsels center, the salty fish and soft avocado melts all the way down your throat. Its nothing like your typical Unagi rolls where the rice is slightly heavy and hard. The softness of the fish and rice gives you a light and delicious flavor. 

3. Special: Butter fish with blue tail tuna sashimi: OMG this is the best seafood dish I have ever tried. From beginning to end the taste was phenomenal, I let out an OMG after every bite. The butter fish is slow cooked keeping its soft texture, but long enough to provide a perfect crispy taste. The sashimi serves as a perfect complement to the dish providing a perfect contrast between the both styles of serving a delicious fish. This was to die for. 

*FYI: This dish is served on different nights with a variation of hamachi or tuna, but I recommend getting it when its the Butter fish* 

You will love this restaurant! just remember to ask for chopsticks, it makes it easier to eat.
author: J Y.

description: The House is always packed and for very good reason. The Wasabi Noodles with Salmon or Sea Bass are memorable and they have served terrific soups the times I went. The House is all about high quality ingredients, which really makes them stand out. It is clear they take great pains to source the best fish. Not a place to go if you are in a rush. Expect to wait for a table even if you have reservations, but it is worth the wait. (Did I mention, MAKE RESERVATIONS).
author: Jordan T.

description: A solid 4* if it weren't for the otherworldly veggies that come with the sea bass. Overall the food was very good, and reasonably priced. We had no problems waiting since they accept reservations even on a busy night. However, since the place is small you can't come here if you have a big caboose as you'll be knocking over other people's drinks. True story.
author: Miko L.

description:
The House rocks! My friends and I came here for lunch on a last minute whim. We called and made a reservation for 1:30pm, sat and ordered 2 pork chop plates and 1 pork loin sandwich. Delicious! I was on a pork overload. Juicy, tender and so flavorful. My friends swore that they've never had the most delicious pork ever in their life. I really want to come back here next time and try their other dishes.

This place is quite small so I'm sure it can get really packed! Be sure to reserve your spot!
author: Joy C.

description:
Came here for my brother's birthday dinner.  We ordered the steak tartare special appetizer and the bbq oyster special appetizer to start.  The tartare may have been my favorite of the entire evening.  I would have wrestled even the birthday boy to eat more of it.  

I got the mushroom rice w/ shrimp which was really tasty.  I tried some of my sister's steak w/ wasabi noodles.  The steak was fine, and since I'm not a big wasabi fan, the noodles were just ok for me.  Of course, that's personal preference, so if you're cool with wasabi, you'll probably like these.

My bro's pork chops were also pretty good, but the currant sauce overpowered the pork.  I also had a taste of the broth of a thai curry style seafood dish, which was really good.

I know some people have had less than good experiences w/ the service, but I actually thought it was really good.  The only thing is that the dinner was super short, just over an hour.  They have to turn tables over quickly because it's small and there's always a line of people wanting to eat there, so I get it, but it would be nice to get the same good food with a little more time to catch up w/ your dining company

I definitely intend on coming back to The House to try other dishes though
author: Naoko M.

description: Still one of my favorite restaurants.. i've come here with a different person every time... and i (and my guests) have never been disappointed.  it is a bit pricey yes.. but OH SO DELISH!
author: Elaine G.

description: one of the best meals when had when visiting SF.  The clams/sauce was to die for, the curry noodles dee-lish as was the salad.  We will def go back our next visit which says a lot since there are soooo many restaurants to choose from in the city.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
This is one of my favourite restaurant in San Francisco.  The food the consistently good.  They always have specials, but I haven't been able to stray from my love of the pomegranate pork chop.  Anyone that knows me, knows how much I love pork chops.  The pork chop here is always perfectly cooked.  It is juicy and full of flavour.  It goes perfectly with the pomegranate sauce.  It also comes with mash potato.  My second favourite dish is the sea bass with ginger soy sauce and rice.  The other dishes on the menu is also good, but those 2 are the stand-out entree on the menu.  For dessert, you can't go wrong with the mango pudding.

They also have a great selection of international beers.

I have never been disappointed by the food or service.
author: Phong T.

description:
Been here 3 times.  Was never impressed.

My biggest critique here is the flavors really never quite worked for me.  For example, on my second trip here, I had a dish with a distinct sauce using a combination of sesame oil, cream, and I think balsamic vinegar.  The thick taste of cream prevented the strong flavor of sesame oil from leaving my palatte.  Really gross in my humble opinion.  At best, if this combination could work, it's not my job to make it work is it?

People all talk about the seabass here.  But really, the sauce has been here for hundreds of years.  It's just the same soy and ginger based sauce Chinese people use for steamed fish.  Why is everyone raving about it?

Seriously, if you want this type of food, please head to LA.  The flavors here are nothing new, and have been among the Americanized Chinese and overseas for years.  Nothing avant garde here - sorry.  3.5 stars at best.
author: Mark M.

description:
Today Rinky and I met Anna and Marian at The House for lunch.  We made excellent time from the East Bay and we found a parking space on Columbus, just around the corner.  We walked up Grant and saw 2 more parking spaces.  It was just before11:30 on Monday.  Made me sorry we didn't have more cars or something.  We had reservations for 11:30.  For once Rinky and I were there first.  Usually Marian and Anna are there first, patiently waiting.  I loved standing around outside the restaurant looking at the old time North Beach neighborhood, remembering how I used to hang out there when I was younger.

We were the first people in the restaurant.  It's small but larger than it looks from the outside.  We were brought lovely little house made pickle pieces, which we quickly demolished.  For $1 we ordered more.  The menu is fairly extensive and there were specials as well.  We ordered the steamed mussels w/ garlic infused shrimp broth and blue lake bean tempura with a pickled ginger soy dipping sauce.  The mussels were a large enough portion for three seafood eaters to share and the tempura was light and perfectly cooked.  The sauce was a tasty accent.  Marian, Anna and I ordered the sea bass, a generous portion accompanied by garlic noodles and what looked to be cut up long beans.  Rinky ordered the grilled Chinese chicken salad with sesame soy vinaigrette.  The bass was tender and moist, the garlic noodles thicker and more subtly flavored than those at Red Crawfish and the beans were al dente and nicely seasoned.  It was an excellent and filling lunch at $20.  Rinky's Chinese chicken salad was artfully arranged and when deconstructed was much larger than it first appeared.  She reported it was very good and took much of it home.  For dessert three of us shared a delicious creme brulée w/ a mango purée.  So good!  

Afterward we walked over to Molinari, where Rinky and Marian bought stuff while Anna and I watched, sated, though it didn't stop us from ogling all the wares.  Then we walked over to Victoria Pastries and Rinky, Marian and Anna all bought little somethings.  It was another great outing in stellar company.
author: Toni M.

description: Busy SMALL place. hard to find parking, but it IS in Chinatown.  So its expected. Wasabi noodles with salmon was delicious.  Curry noodles was good But wasabi was better.  Mussels in shrimp sauce were very soft and flavorful.  Little veggies that accompanied the calamari was excellent as well as the pickled cucumbers given prior to the meal.  Great place.  I found the staff at the time to be friendly, but busy.  So cut them slack.
author: Yourcritic B.

description:
Recently moved to North Beach and was really excited to go to such a highly rated restaurant! 

Made reservations (you definitely have to, at least for a weekend evening) and went on a Friday night. The space is small and relatively intimate (though it can get loud since everyone's kind of seated close to each other) but the food was absolutely amazing and the service is spectacular.

Ordered a bunch of stuff + would definitely recommend the ahi tuna and deep fried salmon roll. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, though. Enjoy!
author: Cristina P.

description: Call ahead and make reservations if you're planning to come for dinner as there is usually a 2 hour wait. I've dined here several times and each time I return, I always order the same dish - the sea bass. It's almost as if I forgot just how good it is. It's that first bite that reminds me why I love the house so much! Tender, perfectly seasoned, melt in your mouth goodness! I can't rave about their sea bass enough! The other dishes are very good as well. I'd recommend the tuna sashimi, green beans and rolls as well. The size of the resto is small but service is good and the worth makes it worth the wait!
author: Cheryl P.

description: Absolutely delicious! The sea bass with the california roll over it is so good! The pork is amazing. Without a doubt a place for a lovely dinner.
author: Ilya Movshovich M.

description:
I didn't get the full experience of this place since I kind of wandered here by accident.  My gf called me from work to go to lunch and I was looking up places near the financial district but like an idiot I ended up choosing one that was closed.  Fortunately, my gf took it in stride, and we ended up stumbling upon The House after a walking a few blocks down.  What a happy accident, I didn't know it at the time, but I later realized we had stumbled into one of the highest rated restaurants in SF!  

I ordered the Wasabi noodles and it was possibly the best noodle dish I've ever eaten!  I rarely order noodles but these were fantastic, the wasabi was not overpowering which was good because I was at the tail end of my tonsillectomy recovery and was a bit worried.  Great textures in this dish with the crunchy slaw and delicate noodles.  The pork was tender and well seasoned.  The presentation was beautiful and not at all what I expected.  My gf ordered the chicken breast which was also delicious, but not as good as the noodles.   

So, if your boyfriend or SO happens to make a bonehead mistake, try to be a little forgiving and cut them some slack, because you never know, the experience might turn out to be a little more memorable after all.
author: Paul W.

description:
I went with the intention of wanting to like this place, on a Tuesday night with high hopes.

Given that we had reservations and told them it was an anniversary dinner, you'd think they'd seat us somewhere decent, not right AT the door.  We could have practically served as the hostess check-in.  Not to mention the tables are literally an inch apart.  I felt bad as I sat on our neighbors food as I slid into my seat.

The restaurant was understaffed.  I overheard complaints from others about not have received dishes, and the two waitresses were unfriendly, wore scowls, and were anxiously dashing around the room.  After 15 mins, someone finally came to take our order but the waitress' anxious energy made for a very stressful dinner.

We ordered the Seabass and the Steak which were flavorful like the other Yelpers have commented.  

However, an hour after getting home, severe food poisoning kicked in.  I guess my experience at the House, just wasn't meant to be.  Unfortunately, I don't think I'll ever go back.
author: Chanelle W.

description:
didn't make reservations that saturday night. they said it would be a 45 minute wait, but turned out to be only 15 minutes.

they gave us these pickled cucumbers with roasted sesame seeds as a free side dish, and it was refreshing to eat. when main course came, i was so excited by the presentation. the grilled ahi tuna was tender and thick. a cloud of fried thin carrot and red cabbage strips garnished the top. the fish was over a bed of blanched spinach and jasmine rice. surrounded by this orange aoli/green wasabi sauce with caviar in little bundles. mmm it was as good as it looked!  

my date had the seabass with ginger soysauce. the fish was cooked perfectly. the noodles and green beans were a little salty though. 

for dessert, we ordered the coconut panna cotta with passion fruit puree. the puree was a but too tangy but still really good overall. 

service was good. atmosphere was cozy. i would definitely recommend this place if you want a nice and delicious dinner.
author: Tes Y.

description:
I had dinner here with some friends a few years ago for my birthday. We made reservations for 7pm for about 7 of us.  We arrived about 5 mins after our reservations and checked in with the hostess...she told us that our table will be ready as soon as possible and that they were really busy that night. (Okkk...) So we agreed and decided to wait outside, because the inside is prettttty small.
