Get the poke...seriously. Mmm. I often split the poke and the noodles with a friend, and it's more than enough food (I can never finish the whole entree when I just get that). And always save room for deserts. I've tried many of them, and they're all delicious. My favorite is the fruit crisp special a la mode...they always have a crisp on the specials menu, usually with different kinds of fruit and ice cream each time. 

As for the prices, well...they're not astronomical by any means. Certainly reasonable for the quality and quantity of food. But because I always have to get the app, entree, dessert and wine, it can add up. If you ever find yourself meandering around North Beach with a hankering for seriously tasty food, I'd recommend this place over any of the Italian joints in the 'hood.

UPDATE:
Went back a couple weeks ago (I never turn down and invitation to go, naturally). I actually tried something different (gasp!). They had a special steak and papaya salad that was just succulent. It was light yet completely full of flavor and had just enough oil to give it that palatable taste and texture that natural fats provide. But most amazing was the papaya. IMO, it's REALLY tough to get a good papaya, and I rarely eat it because it so often has that weird "foot" taste. I trusted The House to overcome this obstacle and they did. I also had the tuna tartare appetizer once again. This time the tuna was fattier than I like (I prefer mine EXTRA lean), but it still tasted great. For dessert we had the coconut creme brule with passionfruit sauce. The BF insisted he was way too full for dessert, so that I should order whatever I want, and then he proceded to eat half of it because it was so yummy. The passionfruit rather overpowered the coconut, but I love passionfruit so this didn't bother me, and the texture was perfect. If you still haven't beeen here, DO IT already! :)
author: Jasmine F.

description: This is my new favorite place.  The food was simply amazing.  We started off with a watercrest and tempura salad and a piece of cooked unagi which was bathed in this incredible sause which I cannot begin to describe.  Main courses included delicious sea bass and a black cod miso that was simply amazing.  Service lacked a little warmth, but the food came out really fast, especially the appetizers.  That was pretty welcome because we were damn hungry.  It felt a little out of place to have this tiny asian fushion place in the middle of north beach, which is great because it makes you feel like you've discovered a hidden gem (even though the line out the door tells you the opposite).  I love this place more than a fat kid loves cake (is this a lame joke now?  I think it is, but I'm still going with it anyway).
author: Jason S.

description: While traveling for a trade show, I met with a friend for dinner. She made reservations for a place called simply, the house (yes, lower case).  It was a an Asian fusion menu. We both had a local Pinot Noir which was smooth and full in flavor, and we washed down our appetizer, which was the fried Calamari with a side of sesame salad. I am usually not a fan of the squidders, but this was well worth it. We followed our app with our entrees. I ordered the Grilled Mahi and mussels (spicy and tender), while my friend order the Blackened Cod. Her meal was out of this world. We then finished off the meal with a couple desserts that we shared. We had the apple/blueberry cobbler and the creme brulee with the toasted crispy glaze. Overall, this food was scrumptious and the service by our waitress, named Summer, was superlative to say the least. If in the Golden Gate city. Stop in and enjoy. Don't miss this one! Everything was exceptional, but the price was a bit steep.
author: Matt M.

description: I will have to give this place 4 stars because I saw and tasted what they are capable of. Superb food. I ordered one thing, and got the opposite. I mean, it was what I ordered, but wasn't what I expected at all. It still tasted great though. You know a place is good if you order the wrong thing and it's still really good. Every single dish is amazing. Solid food, nice cozy atmosphere, extremely helpful waitstaff, and close proximity to MY house makes THE House one of my North Beach favorites!
author: Ben R.

description:
i dont make my way to north beach often. well, when i feel like im being pretentious about something, i like to come to the bars and clubs to remind myself of what pretentiousness really is. but other then that, i dont usually make it to that part of the city.

im a little in the dark as to what northbeach has to offer in terms of restaraunts, though, i have heard pretty negligable things. ate at the house a couple nights ago. had a special: the breaded sole in ponzu sauce....

now, as im writing this, ive realized that im probably not in the best position to review this place. i went here with a couple of friends who were meeting some more people there. i didnt know any of these people and they were all from out of town. 

you know those dinners where you cant really relax or enjoy because youre surrounded by strangers and feel an odd need to be overly courteous and entertaining, but its difficult because you were an insecure and introverted child? and even though the food is fan-F*ing-tastic, youre thinking... "god! when will this hell end?"... that was me circa saturday night at 7pm.

ponzu sauce was pretty good though.
author: N. B. K.

description: Another little secret hot spot, tucked away in the city, that packs a real punch. Had the Ahi Tuna Tartar, and was pleasantly surprised by the freshness and gorgeous presentation. Also tasted the tempura Soft Shell Crab appetizer, which was to die for. Main course was a bit more bland than my other menu selections, but was tasty and perfectly cooked. Ate some of my boyfriend's NY steak meal and was in HEAVEN. Then, the dessert. I LOVE creme brulee, but my boyfriend always jokes that it isn't very creative. Even HE loved this one. Topped with a passion fruit puree that is absolutely divine! Can't wait to go back....
author: Carly D.

description:
My opinion differs from everyone else's I guess. But I thought House was good at best. They attempt to do "Asian Fusion", but it seems to me they simply turn out Asian dishes and try to pass them off as some sort of fusion cuisine. I went with a large group of friends and was able to sample many appetizers. They were all okay, but many of the rolls reminded me of Japanese restaurant food and I didn't come to this restaurant to get Japanese food, I came for Fusion. Their mussels were very fresh and soft, but had very little flavor infused into them. The best items on their menu are probably the fish items. I had a VERY moist and delicate fish dish. The quality of the fish and the way it was cooked was definitely 5 stars, but the rest of the dish accompanying the fish were so so. There was a terrible sauce which seemed like it was just squirted out of a teriyaki sauce bottle and the sushi roll topping the fish was out of place. The size of the restaurant bothered me as well. IT'S TINY!!! The staff was accomodating as we reduced the # in our party, then added one at the last minute during our meal. They need more space and I guess that's not something legitimate to complain about, but the cramped quarters bothered me. 

Overall, it was an okay experience. I wish this place were more "Fusion" than merely "Attempts at Asian". The chefs seem to have good technique when preparing the dishes, just the flavors seemed to not match as well as it could have.
author: Arick R.

description: I love this place. I always come here with my girl friend for special occasions. Especially we like the pomegranate porkchop with it's exquisite sauce. It is so rich with flavor, and matches perfectly with the pomegranate. We once got a waitress without a smile, but overall the service is alright. We went there during lunch time too, though I remember the selections weren't as good as during dinner time.  The crab cake wasn't as good as the other ones on the menu, but overall it's worth 4 stars, or more. You just need to know what to order.
author: Bay A.

description:
the salmon rolls were good but a bit too greasy

the food was just normal chinese food dressed up a bit - and portioned down. it was tasty but not that much more original than your average chinese place.

keep in mind it is located in chinatown and uses the same ingredients as every other chinese restaurant in the area. (i'd rather go to san sun)
there are only so many ways you can stir fry the same exact food.

it looked a lot cleaner than neighboring restaurants, but i'm still doubtful. it is chinatown, after all.
author: Lizzie O.

description: Too hard to rate a place a 5-star on the first visit, but I feel it was that good.  This place was referred by a good friend, so my wife and I came here for our anniversary/dinner date on a Thursday.  The place was packed front to back, but we had made reservations and didn't really have to wait that long, even arriving a little late.  Luckily parking wasn't too bad, someone was leaving as we got there right in front of it.  If that wasn't the case, we probably would of parked a block or two away.  The environment/setting was very nice, decorations, lighting, etc.  We both pretty much ordered the same thing, sharing the deep-fried salmon roll with chinese hot mustard and each had the wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak.  Both steaks cooked as ordered and for the price we paid, we got a nice hefty portion, flavored really good and left satisfied.  Looking forward to coming back soon even though it is at least an hour drive for us.
author: Jason P.

description: This is one of my FAVORITE restaurants.  I didn't want to write a yelp review until I've been there several times and have eaten several other dishes to clearly state that it's one of my favs!!  And YUP.....DELISH.  You can't go wrong with pretty much ANY dish but the tempura fried salmon roll, then the seabass with noodles.  The seabass just MELTS in your mouth.  I would eat here at least once a week if it wasn't so far.  The only downside if I have to say is parking sucks, if you don't make reservations the wait can be quite long...and if you get the unlucky chance of sitting by the door, people stick their asses in your face as they wait for a table.  UM GO OUTSIDE AND WAIT!!!
author: Key C.

description: I have eaten at The House several times over the last decade, and have always loved it. Last night, after more than a 3-year hiatus from the restaurant (it is always very crowded), my husband and I found a parking space near the restaurant and were able to walk in.  I was salivating at the thought of the blue lake bean tempura, which has always been delicious.  The beans arrived and were absolutely tasteless--not greasy, but tasteless.  Not even the strong ginger dip could liven them up.  Then the chive and shrimp dumplings arrived, and they were ordinary at best.  I remember when The House had some of the best Asian fusion in the city.  What happened?  Maybe they just had a bad night, but the food was just not fresh.  We paid our bill after the two appetizers and left.
author: Bathsheba M.

description:
My favorite restaurant in the city.
I pretty much come here whenever I can come up with an excuse. Everything on the menu is somewhat exquisite in its own way and DELICIOUS. Service was good, but more importantly, with good company and a nice bottle of wine, you can make a special outing.
author: Hong S.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF!!! Delicious food, beautiful presentation, reasonable price, and also great service. Make your reservation or come right when the restaurant opens to make sure that you have a table.
author: Lisa B.

description: Asian fusion at it's best. start with the white shrimp dumplings and or salmon rolls. the sea bass is "broke the mouth" good and my favorite! enjoyed this place a dozen times and a special little nugget that always impresses my lunch or dinner guests. fast service and great daily specials. save room for desert as they are outstanding and not to be missed. suggest a reservation if possible but is worth the wait if need be. best for a small group. great place to take your cool foodie client for lunch or good place to show your dinner date that you have culture.
author: Dave B.

description: This is the kind of restaurant that you can walk past and miss a million times because of its narrow size -- but once you've had a taste of their food, it's impossible to forget. I took shelter here on a rainy, cold night, and although it was cramped with patrons, the dishes were worth the wait: fresh, packed with flavor, and inventive.
author: Julie Y.

description: HOLY CRAP - Amazing Pork chop
author: fivewordsorless ..

description:
what a great date night....the bf and i came here for our 1 year dinner before we headed off to watch wicked...we didnt want to expect too much especially after reading raving reviews on yelp, but it definitely surpassed our expectations

we had reservations on friday at 530 and got seated immediately...the place was pretty empty around that time...but it got crowded around 630-ish

our server let us know what the specials were that day (man, she has a super good memory) and we ordered the tempura soft shell crab as our appetizer instantly...along with a bottle of the two hands shiraz (yum! i love australian wine)

- he: flank steak with wasabi noodles (tasty...the noodles had a hint of the wasabi so it wasnt too overpowering)
- me: grilled sea bass (melt in your mouth goodness)
- desert: blueberry bread pudding w/strawberry ice cream

hands down, now one of my most favorite restaurants in the city....apparently the bill wasnt too bad according to the bf

good food
+vip parking (found street parking about a block away from the restaurant  + from the orpheum)
+good bottle of wine
+entertaining musical
+spending it all w/my love
= a perfect night  :)
author: Alice K.

description: I went here with my co-worker for lunch one day as we were wandering in North Beach. I enjoyed the cozy atmosphere as we walked in and were seated. It is a bit cramp but not uncomfortable. All the food was Asian Fusion and was a bit pricey. I had the salmon which was cooked very well and was very flavorful. I generally am not the biggest fan of Asian Fusion food but I must say that this place surprised me. It was quite tasty and I would come here again.
author: Jonathan L.

description: The first time I came here was for lunch with a group of 12 for a friend's late birthday. I have since been making up excuses just to come back. I definitely would've tried the fried sea bass if I wasn't a broke college student, but the curry noodles were just as good.
author: blt l.

description: Great food, good service. I had the Sea Bass and it was fantastic. The only reason I didn't give a full 5 star was because the garlic noodles on the side were a bit too salty. One of co-workers ordered the Flat Iron Steak and it looked amazing. I look forward to trying that next time.
author: Yi-Bing Z.

description: Whenever my parents come to visit, we head to the House. Its that kind of family-- you find something you like and it stays around. You find something you dislike, its on the blacklist. And to have become our staple for off-the-plane grubbing, in the land of Quince and crab meat, is quite a thing. I love the fresh seafood that the House offers and the cold Duvel beer from the bottle. Likely to be a green bean appetizer and a tuna option, i've never been let down. The tea selection is also superb, and this is a nice follow to a lunchtime feast. I recommend reservations and fish first.
author: Rachel S.

description: I miss their location in the Sunset, where I once went for a birthday party. SF, you need to deserve this place! Best fusion food ever (and I hate fusion food, especially when it was all the rage). The one entree you must have here is the sea bass, I don't care that it's overfished and that it's un-PC to order it. It's divine. It's a tightly packed room, sparsely decorated with colorful deco light fixtures and small works of art. The blond-wood tables can get quite crowded and noisy. But you're here for the sea bass.
author: Hao L.

description: I've only ever been here for lunch and I love it.  I highly recommend the ahi tuna roll appetizer if they have it.  The soups, salads and sandwiches are all great.  Great service. Very attentive.  I need to go back soon.
author: Lauren M.

description: I will echo what others have said: a good-cookin', little, neighborhoody, asian-fusion, restaurant.  That pretty much sums it up.  None of the food is disappointing; some if it, I'll admit, is sub-fantastic; the sea bass, however, is the best I've ever, ever had.  The whole family was steadily drawn towards the sea bass--my sea bass, thank-you-very-much--as the dinner progressed; and such a black-hole effect is strong evidence of superness.
author: Ashley A.

description:
hello delicious.  my name is halle.  we met last night at the house, and you were so, so good to my table.  you were all over the white shrimp tempura, the steamed mussels, and the wasabi house noodles.  

I'll never forget what you did to that truffle oil sauce that was meant for the chicken, but instead got devoured by my bread. and that thing you did to the bread pudding? yum.

I'm so glad I know where to find you.  I'll be back to see you real soon.

thanks again,
moi
author: Zuzzi E.

description: After reading so many positive reviews, I decided to check this place out.  And you guys are right...the food here is ABSOLUTELY fabulous!!  We started with the muscles.  I had the sea bass and my bf had the Angus steak w/ noodles.  We ended with a peach sundae.  They were all equally good.  I will DEFINITELY go back.  Minus one star for the small dining space....five stars for the food.  Regardless, the place was packed by 6pm.  Lucky for us, we got there right when it opened so we didn't need reservations.  Our waiter was also very attentive.  My goal will be to try everything on their menu.  I can't wait to go back!!!!!!
author: hello k.

description: I had my parents take my friends and me here when they visited and we all loved it. My parents were blown away by the presentation (they're from Ohio). My mom had this dish that was topped by paper thin flakes of something, that when mixed with the heat from the dish, they moved around like it was alive - kind of trippy but fun. None of the dishes were bland, that's for sure. Some even had a bit more kick to it than I prefer. Service was great, food was great, a solid 4-star performance.
author: Susan L.

description:
My friend raved about this place so I decided to give it a try. I went there around 12:30 and the place was half empty. I ordered Crab Cakes which is not offered during lunch time but they fulfilled my request anyway which is very impressive. I also ordered the Sea Bass because my friend said it was one of the best dish out of the most entrees. Now I understand why she likes it so much!! The fish was so soft, juicy and tender. The sauce was perfect to go with the fish. A little sweet and sour soy with ginger. MmmmmmMMmmm I will eat that any day!  My boyfriend ordered the spicy wasbie noodles with pork and it was very good too. But if you can't take a lot of heat do not order that!! ohhh and we had dessert which was the chocolate cake! OMG THAT cake was soOoOoOOO Good! It really HIT THE SPOT.  The waitress was attentive and very nice. I don't feel rushed or anything so very good. 
*****
One star get subtracted because their HOT TEA price is crazy!! 
A small size of my fist tea pot Jasmine Tea that is chipped doesn't seem clean with decent tea at price of 6 dollars per person is way too much. For 6 dollars I expect them to give me two tea cups so I can share with my boyfriend or put it in a nicer bigger pot!! Tea is not that expensive!! Either way, do not order tea there. Everything else was fair price and very good! Me and my boyfriend had a great time!!!
author: Aylee G.

description: Had the barbecued oysters, crab cake, hamachi, and tuna tartare. All absolutely fantastic. The service was great, even though it was in the middle of the North Beach festival. So good.
author: Candace A.

description: All dishes very well executed, tasty and well plated.  The wait staff was very attentive and friendly to chat with as well.  This is definitely a very well run restaurant.  I can tell the owner runs a very tight shop.  The ambiance is very busy and loud.  The restaurant feels cramped and gets quite noisy b/c it's small and has a long layout (versus open) and the queue waiting up front doesn't help either.  Definitely try this place out if you haven't.
author: J L.

description: Just got back from lunch at The House. So good! Great food, nice people, cozy atmosphere. My favorite kind of place to eat these days.
author: Elguero s.

description: OK AS YOU KNOW I REALLY NEVER GIVE 5 STARS!!!  BUT I WOULD GIVE THIS PLACE A 6!!!!!! Wow food and presentation was AMAZING!!!!!!!  sosososososo good!  The salmon was sooo good!! as well as the chinese chicken salad was the best I have ever eaten!! WOW what more do you need?  I wish I lived up here as I would come here once a week!  Make sure you have a reservation or you will be on the street waiting to get in!!!  I WILL BE BACK!!!!!!
author: Chris W.

description:
I've come here many a time....

the HOUSE is such a refreshing place..amidst the heavy olive oiled italian joints just down the street.   Sometimes the plethora of Italian restaurants down kearney seem to drown each other out and cannibalize a bit.

the House is right around the corner and is a welcome change up.

It's a cozy place..again..the size of a large condo.  Seating is very limited and almost elbow to elbow.  

the food is prepared very well w/out watering down different ethnic foods to compensate for being "FUSION".

the crowd favorite is the grilled chilean seabass.   Seabass is a very delicate and light fish that they serve w/some tastey garlic noodles and a nice sauce.

People rave about the Pork Shoulder dish..(Grace K)..but since I don't eat Pork, I can't speak on that..and will have to take people's word for it...

A smattering of people come here.  Lots of diferent demographics..but overall..similar to the PF CHANG crowd.   the only difference is this food is actually WORTH coming to.

I've been here for dates, special occasions, double dates, birthdays, and did I mention dates?

Prices are reasonable (25-30 per plate) and is definitely worth eating compared to some stuffy steakhouses.
author: Michael L.

description: The food was overall delicious.  The appetizers, calamari and crab cakes, were both delicious.  The angus steak and wasabi noodle dish was good but steak was a bit dry.  The ribeye was extremely good - so juicy it melts in your mouth.  I definitely recommend this place but it may  not be suitable for large parties.
author: Angela C.

description: YuuuMMMMY!  I give the food 5 stars BUT parking was a bitch and the place was really small and squishy. But I'd definitely go back for the food. We started off with the ahi tuna tartare with roasted nori chips which was delicious and nicely presented. For my entree, one of my friends who we were having dinner with recommended the grilled sea bass...OMG, I don't think I've had fish that good! In fact, even the sides were tasty. It came with some noodles and veggies. Now, I'm not really a veggie person but I ate every lil piece that was on my plate. Overall, I LOVED this place but hate the thought of having to drive into the area and search for parking....oh well, the things I will do for good food...=)
author: BrElla4eva H.

description: Make reservations and prepare to wait a little bit too. This place is small, cute, and delicious. We had the crab cake appetizer, which is like no other crab cake I have ever had. First it was the size of a bartlett pear. In fact, it was in the shape of a bartlett pear. We had this fish dish that came with these thick noodles sprinkled with sesame seeds. Those noodles were almost the highlight of the dish.
author: Diana S.

description:
The food is great here, but stick to the seafood.  It's typically prepared to perfection and is always a highlight.  If you want to do meat, try the pork chop, or if they are serving it, the braised short rib.  I liked the Niman Ranch pork chop vs. the Kurobato one they are using now, but oh well.  

Word to the wise: order a special!  They always have 2-4 appetizer specials, 3-4 entree specials, and 2 dessert specials.  I am never disappointed going off the menu and trying something the chef is diggin at the moment.  

Go to the house, you will love it.  It's my go to restaurant when visitors come into the city, and I want to show them what San Francisco haute cuisine is all about.  This is the best moderately priced restaurant (~$65 for appetizer, entree, dessert per person) in the city, hands down.
author: Jerry T.

description: Four stars for food, two and a half for service, this is a neighborhood gem indeed, the seafood and udon dishes are especially delicious; it would be nice if the vegetable dishes are less greasy.
author: J S.

description:
This is one of my favorite eats in San Francisco. 

Came here on a triple date on a Tuesday night and was somehow able to make reservations the night before.  We all made it on time and the place was packed.  We had to wait 30 minutes for our table because the previous party wasn't leaving.  When we sat down, the waitress immediately told us that they were providing us a free appetizer for the wait.  We hadn't complained or anything to them prior to this offer but it certainly helped make the experience better.

In spite of the busyness, the service was top notch.  We definitely had enough attention on us and still had an ample amount of time to just sit and enjoy our dinners.

Our free appetizer was the salmon rolls which were awesome.  It comes with a nice spicy mustard sauce to complement it.  We split two ahi tuna tartare with nori chips and a roasted eel roll.  The tartare was a little spicy (good for me but not for my fiancee) with wasabi.   The roasted eel roll was really good and I would order that again in the future.  It was fairly big too.  

For our entrees, I ordered the porkchop with pomegranate currant sauce.  My fiancee ordered the sea bass.  We both thoroughly loved our dishes.  The House does an extraordinary job of presenting the food and giving great portions.  My porkchop was so good that I almost licked the entire place clean.  There wasn't a trace of food left on it.  The same could be said for the sea bass.  

We paired our meal with a Malbec from Argentina.  

The entire experience was great and I will be back again.  It was really surprising to see how busy they were for a Tuesday.  People were still coming in at 10pm, although the place wasn't completely full.  It makes me wonder how busy they must be on a weekend.  

Make reservations and enjoy!
author: Scott L.

description: Out of all the restaurants I went, I liked their sea bass dish the MOST! I love seabass and I always get it whenever it is offered on the menu but the seabass here is just perfect! It definitely deserves a 5 star!
author: Linda Y.

description: One of best fish dishes I ever had is here - Sake soy seabass. The restaurant is small. The atmosphere is casual. The taste, texture, and presentation of food is exceptional.
author: Jub N.

description: I love love love this restaurant!!  It's asian fusion at its finest!  I think I may have ordered just about everything on the menu and have never been disappointed!  The place is small, so make reservations or get there early...
author: Kristine Y.

description:
The food to die for! Sea bass, garlic noodles, shrimp and chive dumplings, mango pudding, tempura string beans-- nothing was not unique and flavorful and beautifully presented. Our waiter was super sweet and helpful, a rarity in the City. One of the best restaurants food-wise in the City! There are always tons of daily specials on the menu so you can have something different each visit!

And I noticed a few reviewers on Yelp were concerned about the portion sizing. I am a HUGE eater and the entree was plenty huge for me. The food is pretty rich, so if you order the sea bass, no need to fret over the portion size!
author: Mama L.

description: Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  I can't add much to what others have already said.  All I can say is believe the hype and get your ass down there!
author: Chris W J.

description: I miss having you on 9th avenue, why oh why did you have to leave...
author: Michael W.

description:
Totally delicious!  I had dinner with my boyfriend and a past client/present friend/fellow yelper at House last night and had a GREAT time!  We were late for our reservation, but they were extremely accomodating and seated us promptly anyway.  And while the service didn't stand out as sublime, it definitely was friendly, prompt and on par with what I'd expect from a restaurant at this price range.  I had one of their daily specials which was a filet of sole, my friend/client/yelper had the cod (also a special) and my boyfriend had the wasabi noodles with angus skirt steak.  We also had the tempura green bean appetizer (watch out for the fresh thai peppers in the sauce - they are NOT meant to be eaten!!! - OUCH!!!!)   and my dinner companions opted for dessert (although I opted to skip it to try to be "good")  Everything was really wonderful, and as a bonus, it was beautiful too!  The only drawback to the place is that is is SMALL, and therefore crowded and somewhat noisy - though that's common for so many places and just not worth knocking off a star for it.  

I'd highly recommend it - and I'll definitely be back!
author: Luba M.

description:
i enjoy "small bite" restaurants.  i have an affinity for asian food.  put those loves together, and you get a satisfied dining experience at the house.

about 10-12 tables in very close proximity to each other (i enjoyed our neighbors' conversations regarding pregnancy and travel), along with paintings and photos by local artists decorated the narrow interior of the restaurant.  aka make reservations...ideal for groups of 6 or less.

i opted for the ahi tuna tartare with roasted nori chips, the special seared scallops with a flavored butter sauce, and a glass of sake.  my lad ordered the hamachi herb green salad, shrimp tempura salad, and the special bone-out short rib with shoestring fries.

ahi: the tartare looked a bit too mashed up, as if the tuna had been cubed with a less-than-stellarly-sharp knife, ending up in a less-than-stellar presentation.  however, the flavor was there, soy/ginger/a splash of mirin, played to the tuna well.  the long, triangular nori chips provided the right texture balance with the fresh fish.

scallops: were cooked perfectly well. seared and carmelized on the outside, warm on the inside.  presentation was decadent!

my boyfriend doesn't like to share, but of the few bites i did have of his dishes- the hamachi sashimi salad was as expected (not too spectacular, could have done with a bit more dressing), the shrimp tempura was perfectly tender with a crisp coating and it paired well with the cool greens.  

all in all... knowledgeable wait staff, clean decor, spot-on presentation, a happy merrying of asian flavors all under one roof.  the house afforded me an impeccable meal ending my weekend in sf.
author: melissa p.

description: It is a bit sad that the best restaurant in North Beach aka Little Italy, is a Asian fusion restaurant - but don't let that detract from the delicious food that this restaurant turns out. Try for starters their signature salmon rolls.  Now, I am not a huge salmon fan, but this seaweed wrapped and wasabi crusted treat is fried and served with a wonderful spicy mustard sauce.  Next rty the perfectly cooked Sea Bass with garlic noodles.  My mouth is watering.  The wine list is picked to go with the food - what a novel concept - and is very reasonable.  The staff is very attentive and friendly.  The one negative is that sometimes it is hard to hear the person next to you, but who needs to talk when the food is sooooo good!
author: Steven S.

description: Love it!  The food tastes even better than it looks (and their presentation is flawless).  The space is small but cozy and the clientele is mostly city-folks, not too may No. Beach tourists.  The tables are pretty close together, but look on the bright side - you can easily spy on the obvious first date couple sitting next to you.  The salmon roll app is fantastic. Hell, every dish I've had here is fantastic.
author: Kim R.

description:
where have i been?  all this time, this jem has been sitting right around the corner and i... was busy being that-person-without-the-house-in-my-life.  (foolish.)

i'm over it now and i can honestly say the wasabi noodles have changed my life.  i gave the curry noodles a try recently and while they aren't my first true love, i must tell you that i left with a perma-smile.  i've committed to going down the menu, one tasty item at a time (that's how dedicated i am to this place)... more comments to come.
author: julia p.

description:
http://i8that.wordpress.com/

check it, i put up lots of yummy pictures of the experience on my food blog. everything was, on the whole, pretty delish!! service was also attentive and prices very reasonable for the quality and quantity of food.
author: eve l.

description: My all-time favorite restaurant in the city for main 3 reasons:  THE COD SPECIAL, the spicy salmon rolls and the unagi appetizer.  I've been here so many times to the point that I will only go now if they are serving the cod special.  Cooked to perfection with a delicious sauce and a sushi roll on top.  OMG...sooo tasty.  Some of the servers are very curt and cold (this waitress once pulled a fork out of my sister's hand as she had just pulled it out of her mouth), but some of them are very good.  The place is tiny so definitely make a reservation.  Be prepared for a very tight space where you will feel squished.  I think the prices are reasonable for an upscale place.  I really love the food.
author: Michelle M.

description: House is still pretty exceptional. It's been around a long time now and isn't new and doesn't have that "it's special" effect anymore - but I've never had a bad meal and almost always have had a great meal. it's loud in there, a lot of reflective surfaces -- and service varies, but the food is always interesting and yummy. Where else you gonna get grilled salmon over tapioca polenta?? Most people come to NB for Italian (mistakenly believing that we have great Italian in NB) but The House remains one of the top spots in North Beach and well worth the time and money. It's a sort of Asian-fusion meets Calif, no bread served, Asian teas, good wine selection -- things like shitake mushroom dumplings (very good!), grilled rib eye over Wasabi -- sweet pickles -- it's solid even after all these years.
author: R A.

description:
Ah, The House. I had almost forgotten about you it has been so many years! But now that I'm back in the hood, I can wander up there for lunch all the time - yay!

One of my co-workers and I walked toward North Beach searching for some lunch vittles. We were pretty aimless and as we started to cross Grant I recalled in my dim, aged memory having some pretty tasty lunches here once upon a time. So we walked right in (without reservations - whew!) and plopped ourselves down and were thrilled we did!

Co-worker had the ahi tuna sandwich w/ wasabi. I believe his eye rolls, lip smacking and "mmmmm's" were fairly indicative of his general feelings about the food. I chose the grilled chicken with mushroom black bean sauce and I have to say there was a fair bit of lip smacking on my side of the table as well. The chicken was delicious (maybe just a few seconds too long on the grill, but yummy nonetheless) and it was paired with a tangy, slightly bitter bok choy (and maybe some mustard greens?) and a little asparagus which was the perfect foil to the artful pile of creamy mashed taters. And the mushroom black bean sauce was AWESOME. And for only 10 bucks??? I pay that for a medium so-so salad in the FiDi.

Go. Go. Go. It may seem a little odd to find asian solidly in North Beach (oh wait, it's SF, that's not weird at all) and you will be so glad you did!
author: Elizabeth E.

description:
Well another great meal.

We had the pork chop which came which asparagus, mashed potatoes and was served in a pomegranate sauce.  It was soo tender and delish.  We also had the cod with an orzo, corn side.  It was tasty also.  The fish was tasty, albeit a bit dry.  We also had the tempura beans which were really good.

Of course, we had the mango tapioca dessert which I love and a glass of reisling for $90.

The only down side was that the bathroom, which is unisex, was quite dirty tonight.  Time to check on it every 30 minutes or so.
author: Brian L.

description: The food! The food! It really is that flavorful! I highly recommend the cod topped with the fresh California roll (no imitation here). It's perfectly cooked (moist and flaky) and beautifully plated. Oh, and the sauce... We were practically licking the plate. The popular steak and noodles dish is just okay. Maybe the people who rated it highly haven't had traditional garlic noodles? That dish was good, but lacking focused flavors. Our only complaint (which seems to be the running complaint) is the unfriendly hostess. I actually think "unfriendly" doesn't entirely do her justice. She seems... dispassionate? I didn't really take it personally. How can they make such inspired food with such sterile, frowny faces? When we arrived 5 minutes before our reservation, it took quite awhile to receive any acknowledgement. People who came after us received more direct interaction whilst the host only breathed acknowledgement through us. Huh? Not to fret; we were seated first. The cost is also reasonable for the quality and portions. I'll definitely be back.
author: Ash S.

description: I went there for a double date on Friday night, with reservations at 10 PM. When we first arrived, the waitress told us it would "be a few minutes", and the few minutes turned to 45 minutes of waiting outside in the cold. The manager compensated our long wait with fried salmon rolls. Despite the fact that I do not believe my 45 minute wait can be replaced with an appetizer, it was delicious. The black lychee tea was chilled and perfect, along with my sea bass entree.
author: Brenda C.

description: Eaten here twice is 9 years. Both meals were fantastic, as if nothing had changed at this restaurant! The chinese hot mustard sauce that comes with the Deep-fried salmon roll appetizer is worth the trip alone. I'm pretty sure I got the Grilled ahi tuna with spicy mustard aioli and was thrilled. One of the best restaurants anywhere.
author: Graham S.

description: A cozy restaurant that produces delicious fusion cuisine. The fish is incredibly fresh! The lightly fried soft shell crab and seared jumbo sea scallops were marvelous. The batter on the crab was relatively light with just enough seasoning as to not overpower the natural flavor of the crab. The scallops were perfectly cooked and they were paired with a wonderfully subtle lemon/cream sauce. For my main course, I ordered the "tuna special." You need to ignore my poor choice of words to describe the name of the dish because I simply cannot remember what they called it; however, it was amazing, and if they continue to offer it, I highly recommend you order it for dinner. I consider "The House" a culinary oasis among the dreadful tourist traps in North Beach. By the way, what the heck happened to North Beach? It has become a real cesspool! Shame on you Mayor Newsom.
author: Blake S.

description: Probably the least friendly service I've experienced at a restaurant in SF. Server brushed past when we asked for a table for four, hearing but ignoring us. A few minutes later she seated us right next to the door. "Could we have one of the [many empty] tables in the back?", asked my shivering grandmother. "We have a lot of reservations tonight" was the cold response.  Disconcerting service was balanced by the excellent food with delish sauces and large portions. Highlight was the salmon rolls, but everything was very good, except for the blah desserts (head up the street for gelato instead). I thought service with a smile was easier to deliver than high quality cooking. I guess not a The House.
author: Nick C.

description: This place has the best fusion food in town.  The taste of the food is just "multi-dimensional" and difficult to describe unless you are there to try it.  We've been going there since 1998 and we still keep going.  We live in Morgan Hill now and it's kind of far but it's worth every while to be there!  We esp like their fried sushi roll and sea bass.  It's just delicious and you can keep eating the same food for a period of 10 years like us!
author: Guerney C.

description: Went here with SF friends earlier this week and had a great meal!  The sparking shiraz was awesome and went well with the parade of food we ordered.  Unfortunately, the week was such a blur I can't even remember what I ate but I recall they were standouts..oh yes, the noodles were yummy.
author: Anna L.

description: They provided a complimentary plate of pickled cucumbers--a refreshing departure from the usual bread basket.  As an aperitif, I had the sparkling rose' from France that was lip-smacking good.  Next came the tuna tartare that was likeable but unremarkable. On the plus, the tortilla strips offered textural crispness and the pool of sauce had a bright flavor, but the fish quality was so-so.  The grilled sea bass with garlic noodles and green beans was fine, but the main flavor was soy sauce, soy sauce and, oh!, more...soy...sauce--can't fault it for complexity.  The flat-iron steak with wasabi noodles and kimchee veggies was better.  The meat was the requested medium-rare with a good spicy flavor.  In sum, the food and service were better than average, but not tremendously so: 3.5 stars.  I'm rounding up this time, House, but you'll have to woo me for that last star and a half on our next encounter.
author: M A N I K.

description: I saw this place featured on KQED's Check Please! and was really excited to try it for lunch (cheaper that way). I guess I was kinda disappointed by the dumplings and the salmon roll. The textures were good, but I wanted more flavor. We ordered the black cod with the deep fried ginger soy sauce as our entree and by then i was convinced this place was not overrated. the fish was perfectly cooked and the flavors were spectacular to say the least. lychee iced tea is not bad either. i would definitely go back for dinner.
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: May be not the most romantic place (basic interior) in the city but  definitely my favorite restaurant in North Beach. Especially good early in the week (packed on weekends). I always go back to The House after another dissapointing Italian dinner experience in NB (in other words quite often). Even their salads are good!  There is only one single item that  you shouldn't order from the menu (all the rest is simply great): coffee (I guess they don't have enough room for the espresso machine).
author: Mike O.

description:
Out of town friends from Kentucky prompted us to try The House again since they moved from their original Irving St location to the heartbeat of North Beach.  Also, TH was featured on Check Please, Bay Area and all three foodies raved about it 

http://blogs.kqed.org/food/2006/03/30/check-please-bay-area-episode...

First, reservations require a credit card just to make sure no shows don't disrupt the already hectic/efficiency of greeting/seating/serving.  Allow time to stalk street parking or a short walk from the Vallejo/Powell public garage.
Menu is mainly seafood based with creatively matched ingredients that work very well to produce a fantastic entree.  
Reserve your selection until the friendly server describes the specials of the night.  Our night had three entree specials - Ahi, spareribs and a braised pork butt topped with a small piece of foie gras (perfect crust on the outside and fork tender on the inside).
Every dish including the Seabass on the menu was prepared to perfection and the presentation very nicely done.  See my photo posting of these dishes.  
Every plate on the table - clean enough to just load directly into a cheap dishwasher, nothing to scrap or rinse.
If you're into a traditional Belgium beer that's dark and tasty, try the 1554 - even the temperature of the beer is perfect, not too BudLight cold!

Highly recommended, make reservations, give credit card, take cab or park and enjoy The House!  I agree with the 600+ reviews.
author: Randall F.

description: The food was good. I had the sea bass, it was fantastic!!! My friend had the wasabi noodles, it was ok. I felt a little cramped in the restaurant. The decor could've been better.
author: Olivia A.

description:
Most of the time, Asian fusion restaurants end up as nothing but confusion -- neither here nor there, more a frightening Frankenstein of flavors. 

Not here. 

Since moving back to San Francisco after many years on the East Coast and overseas, The House is the only restaurant that has delivered so far. 

Unlike the other highly rated places that underwhelm or made me sick, The House made me say wow. 

Eating my way around the city and the peninsula, as well as Napa and Sonoma, in fancy places and hole in the wall joints, the sea bass at The House so far reigns over everything else. 

The House can cook fish. It's not overcooked nor undercooked. It hits the sweet spot.
author: J C.

description: The space is tiny and packed with modern furnishings and lots of charm! The wait staff are absolutely adorable and accommodating. I would highly suggest placing a reservation in advance. However, be forewarned, the House staff does not rush their patrons out of their establishment during their meal, even when others are waiting with reservations. I ordered the specials of the night, a Kobe beef in reduced shitake sauce - AMAZING!
author: Judy L.

description: Excellent service - great food - nice wine list - I had a really nice dinner here. We had the family salmon roll, which was crunchy on the outside and still rare on the inside. Then we both had one of the specials of the night - tuna two ways, and the hamachi. Now, the only downpoint of the night was the hamachi which was overcooked and not as light as it should have been. But the tuna was perfect. Had the passionfruit creme brulee for dessert which was wonderful!
author: Emily L.

description: This place is phenomenal!!!  We made reservations, so we didn't have to wait long.  The service was great, and the food was soooooo good!  The salmon rolls appetizer was a perfect way to start this perfect meal!  It was the best cooked salmon I've ever had because it's covered with spring roll wrap and FRIED.  Then, I ordered the Kobe beef steak strips special which I thought was pretty good.  But the sea bass and mushroom rice with grilled shrimps are definitely the must-orders of this restaurants!  The sea bass was perfectly cooked and just melts in your mouth!  SERIOUSLY!  I can't wait to go back again!  mmm...sea bass....
author: Siu L.

description: All I can say is the service is great, the food presentation is wonderful the way the food tastes great atmosphere.  The sea bass is great  the appetizers are good, I suggest if there is a special go for that.  I tried the Maine lobster tail salad on valentines day it was Delicious, as well as the shrimp tempura salad I had just a few days ago.  For the dessert I would go for everything but there's no good dessert without a good glass of dessert wine.
author: Emma R.

description: Sea bass is freakin delicious.  Enough said.  It's this tiny hole in the wall place, and it's so good.  My friend took me here, and when we arrived, I looked at her like she was crazy.  I quickly took it back after my plate of food came, because the sea bass practically melted in my mouth.  Totally worth the trip to San Francisco!
author: Kim N.

description: Very close to being 5 stars - wow! This place is great.  The grilled sea bass is amazing (quite possibly the best fish that I have had). It leaves an impression that is hard to forget - and food rarely ever does this for me. The other stuff on the menu is great too. I would not hesitate recommending this place, but it may be hard to have a big group eat in such a small seating arrangement. Street parking is also limited.
author: Fotos C.

description:
even though theres over 600 reviews for this place i just have to put in my 2 cents.  for starters we got tuna tartare... the tuna was great and flavorful.. for our main dishes.. i got the special -- grilled salmon with curry and potatoes.. i love salmon and this just made me love salmon even more.. he got the sea bass, that was really good too.. for dessert we got the ice cream truffle cake.. omg one of the best dining experiences i had =) no joke.

and we even got souvenirs! the table next to us had one of those old school polaroid cameras and they took our pictures! hehe
author: JUDY L.

description: Good food, very flavorful.  Try the lunch menu for reasonable prices since dinner can be a bit costly.
author: Shafaq C.

description: The 1800+ reviews were right on. The food was outstanding. Those flavors jumped off the plate. The kind of flavors that I'm sure I'll be craving from time to time. Everything we ordered was fantastic: roasted eel and grilled calamari to start; followed by wasabe noodle steak and lobe beef and finished the meal with apple crumb and mango tapioca. The service was great too. I will definitely return to The House again and again.
author: Gary R.

description: My boyfriend chose to take me to the house for our anniversary dinner because of their crazy reviews. I have never even heard of this place, but by the raving reviews on yelp, i was dying to try their sea bass. When we arrived to the house, parking was hard but its san francisco, i should have already expected that. we parked a few blocks down in a lot that cost $15. When we stepped into the house, it was extremely tiny. The tables were so close to each other, it felt a little uncomfortable trying to have a romantic date with my man. We started off with glasses of wine to loosen up a bit, and it worked. We started dinner off with 2 appetizers; The deep fried salmon & oysters on the half shell. The deep fried salmon was no joke. it was so delicious! The wasabi sauce on the side had a little kick to it, which made the salmon more interesting. The oysters on the half shell were nothing special, but i still ate it all. =] For Entrees, I had the sea bass of course, and my man had the wasabi noodles with grilled flat iron steak on top. They were both extremely delicious. The sea bass was so soft and buttery, nobody on yelp was exaggerating about this stuff! The wasabi noodles were very delicious as well, almost reminded me of garlic noodles but a little more saltier. I high recommend anyone to try this place!! I also suggest you make reservations. My boyfriend and i were just going to show up, but i made him call in and good thing we did because we were able to get one of the last tables that night!
author: Lien T.

description: So, I go to this place with my best bud. I always trust her when it comes to food. I've been here like 3 times and every time I go the food is great! The place is small, but the food is delicious!! I love the pork chop, and even though I'm not a fan of wasabi I love the wasabi noodles! I think it's a really cute and yummy place to take someone special!
author: Pamela V.

description:
i'm giving this place 4 stars because while i had an awesome experience here, i'm honestly not sure if it was because i was buzzed from the awesomely good riesling we got or if it was because the food was actually that good.  

1. the scallops. (special) i think it was 1 or 2 gigantic scallops covered with microgreens.  we all really liked it.  

2. the salmon roll thingee. i thought it was delicious.

3. sea bass + noodles.  my sea bass was soft and tender. the noodles were fine - i actually really don't like those kind of thick noodles, but the wine made it tasty.  minus the wine, this dish would have been good, but not that special.

4. desserts. good. mango tapioca and a cake of some sort. 

the prices are pretty reasonable. i'd come here again. the service was good. efficient, friendly enough but not ass kissing friendly.  

parking is really bad, so i'll just tell you to save yourself the 45 minutes driving around trying to maneuver 1 way streets after which you still won't find parking. there's a parking garage nearby.  just pay to park there.  it's well worth it.
author: S O.

description: What more can I say?  I walked into the restaurant on a Friday night, no reservation, and was seated within 10 minutes.    Can I get a witnessssssssss?!  Never felt rushed--even though we were informed we could only have the table for an hour and a half.  Food is to die for--I have wet dreams about the eel avocado sandwich.  Make sure you always ask about the specials!
author: Paul D.

description: Walked in at 10:30 on a Friday night and was seated immediately, so I guess I lucked out with no wait!   The restaurant itself is pretty tiny, but the seating comfortably spaced so I didn't feel like I was sharin food with the random people on either side.  Had the scallops with lemon ponzu sauce for starters - quite tasty, great balance of flavors, without overpowering the taste of the scallops, yum.  For the main course, I had the misoyaki cod, it came on a bed of baby bok choy, with a mini california roll sliced and draped on the cod.  Definitely one of the best misoyaki I've ever had!  I also got to "sample" some flat-iron steak and noodles from umm . . . err . . . another patron . . . excellent!  Oh yeah, and the wait staff was quite friendly as well!
author: Jeffrey H.

description: Me and my buddy had a wonderful time there. The service was prompt and efficient.  She had a hangar steak noodles and I had the sea bass for dinner.  DELICIOUS!!!   We also had a wonderful ahi tuna starter.   And the dessert?  Fabulous.   What a great way to start off that weekend for me and her.
author: Chris C.

description: I like this place. We've always gotten seating the food is interesting and good. The price is reasonable. I would recommend the mushroom prawns rice it is my favorite dish there. For appetizers the fried salmon rolls. Excellent. A good date place or hanging out with friends.
author: K T.

description: OK... so 3 stars may seem harsh.  The entrees were amazing!!!  The desserts were great, too.  But the service...  The House has an awesome wine list of reasonably-priced but still yummy bottles.  We ordered a great pinot noir from Merry Edwards, but then they served it in glasses that were so hot, my first glass was killed.  If you're going to serve good wine that like, you need to pay attention to the temperature!  Secondly, my salad had so much dressing it was gross.  The flavor combinations were fantastic, but the lettuce was absolutely drowned.  It was sad.  I love butter lettuce, but this was like having dressing with a little lettuce.  Lastly, our entrees came out while we were still eating our salads, and it was clear they had been sitting around for a while already.  This place has great food, and a great wine list, but they need to tighten up their service.
author: Amy L.

description: Excellent food, the fish tastes fresh and the presentation is a feast for the eyes.  The place is very small though!
author: Stephen H.

description: I'm not sure what the fuss is about.  Ordered the crab cake, unagi roll, shrimp dumplings, and the domestic Kobe steak.  Crab cake presentation was great, but inside it was kind of mushy.  Unagi roll had these flaky dried onions on the outside that made it look like it had been rolled in hay (yes, hay for horses).  The shrimp dumplings were like ha gow at dim sum places, but at twice the price.  The steak had A LOT of gristle.  I was spitting it out into my napkin every other bite.  Maybe they were having an off day, but I won't go back.
author: SiliconValleyShoeGirl L.

description: I'm not sure being the 361st reviewer means anything statistically speaking but the food here was really good. I had the sea bass since everyone recommended it. The only thing was that we had to wait for about half an hour even though we had a reservation. And we were accosted by vagrants while waiting.
author: Christopher U.

description: We started our meal w/ the Spicy Miso Clams... delicious!  I just wish we didn't eat it all so fast.  the broth was really great w/ the toasted bread. After hearing about how great the sea bass was, I decided to try it out.  It was tasty but I was eyeing my bf's Black Cod w/ CA roll and chinese greens.  Not only was his entree more visually appealing, it was much more delicious.  The cod just melted in my mouth and the CA roll was interestingly presented.  For dessert we tried the mango tapioca and the coconut creme brulee w/ passion fruit puree.  The mango tapioca didn't taste much like mango... more of an almond flavor.  it was still very delicious w/ the sago on the bottom (my favorite).  The creme brulee had a really good texture... didn't really taste a lot of coconut.  the passion fruit puree provided a tartness that definitely cut the richness of this dessert.
author: Alice C.

description: I liked the food here but I thought it was SO heavy. Lots of oil used in the cooking. The flavors were inventive and the quality seemed high.
author: Carson H.

description: seriously, just come here. great food, great prices, great service - they have beautiful dishes in a relaxed, unfussy atmosphere. If you come with four people, share two appetizers, two main courses, and two desserts. perfect amount of food. I must rave about the dessert though: a berry trifle that was HEAVENLY - gorgeous berries, cream that was sweetened just the right amount. It was strange to eat such a western dessert after asian fusion but much welcomed and lovely.
author: Betty H.

description:
The food here is WONDERFUL.  Honestly, you would expect much higher prices for food this well thought out, prepared, cooked, and displayed.  My boyfriend and I couldn't be happier that we hit this place up last minute in the city.  I am still dreaming about the ahi and my boyfriend's steak was also amazing.  Great selection of drinks and delicious deserts.
Make a reservation the day before though, as it looks like plenty of people have figured out what a gem this place is, very busy Saturday night, we only got in because someone had canceled last minute.
author: Melissa D.

description: My husband and I come here for Saturday lunch quite a bit since it's so close to our apartment.  I almost always get the sea bass because it's so delicious, well priced at lunch and I'm always craving it.  He almost always orders one of their daily specials and I always end up being jealous of his food.  Order almost anything off the menu (or daily specials) and you will not be disappointed.
author: wingless g.

description:
This place rocks. We have been coming here for 12 years and since moving out of the city have not been here as much. 

Stopped in last night for the first time in a few years and it is still as delicious as it ever was. I had the unagi appetizer and my husband had the tempura shrimp! SO delicious!

For dinner we both had noodles.... hubs had the flat iron steak and mine with Sea bass (thank you awesome waitress for the suggestion). 

I am still thinking about the meal and wishing I had more.

Kudos to these hard working professionals for longevity, consistency and awesome food and ambiance.

Bravo!
author: e S.

description: Well, I used to be more impressed, it seems to have lost some of the charm.  Very crowed, and maybe because it was cold and I was right by the door.  The sea bass is very good as well as other items we ordered, but I am not running back quick after my last visit.  However, I am sure I will be there again!  So an A-Ok rating, that should not be considered mediocre.
author: Jack M.

description: The place I take friends to when they visit the City.  Food is always fesh .   The menu is varied.  Prices are fair. Small but cozy.  The wasabi noodle are a must
author: Bert Y.

description: This has to be one of my favorite restaurants in SF. I'm sorry to say that I've only been here once, though. I want to go there for lunch and dinner everyday! Instead of ordering the highly recommended seafood dishes, I ordered beef ribs. They were absolutely delicious.
author: Pika C.

description: Great food, Good atmosphere , a very cutty locale, A good place to take youre Girl  , friends , or youre mom on a saturday afternoon, I had the Mushroom with prawns, pretty good, but nothing special, the Beef dishes were awesome though.
author: Jimmy K.

description: I came here with my family and my gf for my 21st birthday dinner.... I definitely was not disappointed. We had the mussels, calamari, 2 ahi tuna tartares, and all was delicious, next time i probably will pass on the calamari and get two order of mussels. Now for dinner... we had one pomegranate porkchop, one steak, two cods with what i say are california rolls, and two of the shrimp risottos... every single dish was cleaned completely. Dessert was also delicious... ordered the mango tapioca, coconut creme brulee, and the apple pie. I cant wait to go here again... it a must if you are in the area. Service was great... food was amazing... must eat
author: Anthony V.

description: The House has been in my bookmarks list since last August. Not sure why it took so long to get around to, but one fine day I was walking around SF and happened by. I'm a huge fan of Asian fusion and The House delivers. The scallop special was particularly tasty! However the seabass might have been a bit on the heavy side... sure went well with some sake though =)
author: Will A.

description: Really nice resturant. Small and cute. Food was great! its alittle pricey but its worth it. The wait could be long try to make reservations. but again it is worth it.
author: d n.

description: Had a medium-rare steak - it was extremely well made. Both my friends and I loved it (we shared food). The restaurant is quite small and hence crowded. We had to wait 20min to be seated, but the experience was definitely worth the wait.
author: Jack W.

description: One of the best restaurants in SF, all in.  Miss the Inner Sunset location.  No need for details in my review; just go.
author: John W.

description: This place had such great reviews that I had to try it. I was a bit worried about it being Asian fusion, since I have not had any good Asian fusion food in the past. (I like my Asian food as authentic as possible.) But this place really hit the spot. It got everything right. All the flavors were intense and amazing. We had the Angus flatiron steak with mashed potatoes and the sea bass with stir-fried udon with red cabbage and sauteed green beans. The steak was tender and was slightly reminiscent of Korean bbq in the flavorings. The sea bass was just perfectly grilled and the soy sauce it was served with was full of flavor. Needless to say, our plates were completely empty. I also love how the restaurant is almost hidden and is very unpretentious. It's a truly special dining experience...quiet and intimate, with absolutely perfect food. Just make sure to make reservations.
author: yeana j.

description: My one and only experience here was decent enough a few years ago.  For a special occasion, with friends flying in from Denver, thought it would be a great place to celebrate two of their birthdays.  For a party of seven, a reservation is prudent.  Thus, I call, they say for a party of six or more the owner has to call me back.  I ask for a call back the same day, called before lunch time so figured it would be enough time for a response.  I get a call back the next day.  That's perfectly fine.  I'm told there's no table for the desired time, only 630pm and 930pm.  Since the earlier time wouldn't work, I said I'll take 930pm and will call back if I can't find a different reservation.  I was asked for a credit card to hold the table, if I fail to call and cancel, I will be charged $10pp.  This is fine and dandy but I had to chuckle and tell her no thanks.  Why?  The tone of her voice and the way "Casey" talked to me, I was treated like second class, like I was doing her a favor.  Isn't a restaurant part of the service industry?  Isn't it supposed to be welcoming?  The food is decent not anything to rave about, but thought my friends would enjoy it.  Too bad they will not.  They will instead hear about my bad experience in trying to set reservations where we could've have spent hundreds of dollars.  My friends and colleagues will hear about it too.  O snap!
author: k y.

description: This is one of the best asian fusion restaruants in SF.  Cozy and small, the owners have really created a menu that satisfies.  Try to sea bass there, it is absolutely amazing.
author: Charles C.

description: Still my favorite after 8 years. We went last night for dinner. After starting with their famous Salmon rolls and a scallop special, I was in heaven. For dinner, I had the Korean style ribs, my fellow diners had the Kobe beef special and the hamachi special. All were delicious. And then for dessert, we ate the chocolate flour-less cake. If you have not tried The House before, go for lunch sometime. The noodle dishes and sandwiches are superb. Their consistency rocks and their seafood is some of the best in the Bay Area. Eat it.
author: carina b.

description: Excellent! Try the kobe beef appetizer! (But leave your linebacker friends at home - this place is super cramped)
author: S A.

description:
i have always been a fan of the house - i have been going there for about 8 years, its such a great spot and while i always see that its full, its never that hard to get a table there.  i especially like their seafood.  most of their dishes have an asian style, but its not so specific that everyone can't find something to like.  most recently i went there with a group of friends and everyone enjoyed their meal.  we shared the shrimp and chive dumplings, bean tempura, and asparagus to start.  i dont care for asparagus myself, but the other 2 appetizers were delicious.  i had the fish special for my entree which was delicious.  their specials are almost always great.  our service was right on- especially good since we were a group of 8 and kind of indecisive in the beginning, and ordering lots of wine!
the house will always be up there on my list of faves, such a great go-to place in NB!
author: Carolyn B.

description:
one of my fave restaurants in North Beach. skip the touristy restaurants in NB
awesome wasabi noodles and salmon rolls; my staples
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Fantastic place to eat. The food was delicious, hitting all the right tastes without overdoing the flavors. For the appetizer, we had the salmon egg roll. The hot mustard sauce was perfect. The bed of salad was crisp and seasoned with sesame. We then had the pork chops with pomegranate sauce and black rock cod. The pork chop was absolutely fabulous. It was the best pork chop I have had. The pomegranate sauce was great with the pork chop as well as with the mashed potatoes (who would have known mash potatoes and pomegranate was a good combo). There was a slight hint of basil that worked well to keep the flavors of the sauce from being just a sweet sauce.  My wife had the black rock fish. Since they had a California roll on top, the sauce they used was like the sauce on unagi. It worked well with both the California roll and the black rock fish.

Service was good. It was a slow day due to the rain, so they took care of us. It is a great place. Driving to the area is a little awkward due to the fact that it is a small restaurant on an intersection that wont let you turn onto the street (we were driving from Van Ness Ave going down Broadway). Good thing I read that there was a parking garage on Vallejo and Stockton that was two blocks away.  The seafood items like the Sea Bass and Black Rock fish was $24-25. And the Pork chop was $18. Next time I go, I will try the Sea Bass.
author: Long T.

description:
This is actually the best food my family and I have ever had
This place is very bus so make sure to get reservations before hand, though we did manage to sneak in because someone cancelled on their reservation (score). More importantly the steak was the best steak I had ever had, the special lamb was "The best meal I have ever had", and their cremburle was incredible. Were only in town for 5 days and were going back again.
author: Ethan B.

description: This restaurant got a lot of hype, so we had to check it out.  First, off our reservation got "lost."  We got seated in the back in the very crowded restaurant.  Then came the food.  We ordered the sea bass and the Kobe beef, and some appetizer, I can't recall.  The food was a little bit overly flavored/salty for my palette.  The dessert, however was delicious: creme brulee with a citrusy passion fruit glaze.  Delicious!  Overall, I'd recommend it to just give it a try.  Then, walk around SF and enjoy the ambience.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Make an advanced reservation!  This place is a must! The pork chop with VERY thick pomegranate sauce all over it is very delicious. The apps are great, the black cod is delicious. It is a small place, a little tight and might be loud for some....it is comfortable though, but you will probably see what other 4-5 tables around you are having too...-so, yes, tight but cozy. The food is great and service is quick!  Also, plenty of places to go for b4 & after the meal - heart of NB.
author: M D.

description: In SF for a conference and found this place through Yelp.  We have made reservations but still had to wait a bit for a table.  We arrived at 8:30 and around 9:00 the place was much less busy.  Yes, the sea bass is great and the noodles are delicious.  We also has tuna tartare as appetizer which was also very nice.  I would come back to see whats on their menu next time Im in town.
author: Karen G.

description:
So the thoughtful bf made reservations to celebrate my birthday at Ruth Chris about a month ago to surprise me...a few days before that dinner I told him that I didn't feel like eating anything too "meaty".  The poor thing not only had to cancel the reservations, but had to find another restaurant that he knew that I would like.  Fortunately for him (and me) he was referred to The House by a friend of his.  We had a soft shell crab tempura and scallops (that was a special item for that evening) for appetizers.  The scallops were really good!  Very fresh and the sauce complemented it well....the soft shell crab was good, but it was on top of a cabbage (?) salad that was too peppery for my tastes.  For the entree dishes we got the filet mignon on a bed of spinach and mashed potatoes and the ahi tuna (both were specials).   The fish was also very fresh and came with some veggies.  The filet mignon was tender and yummy.  We shared the chocolate truffle cake with coffee ice cream for dessert.  Yum-o.  The reason why I gave this place 4 stars is because of the seating.  I'm not that big, but I had a hard time maneuvering out of my seat fearing that my  @$$ would knock the plates off our neighbors' table.  If they could spread out the seating arrangement, I would definitely add at least 1/2 a star:)

And yes, after all the trouble of changing reservations, I ended up getting the filet mignon.  What can I say?  I like my meat! :)
author: Betty L.

description: Yummy yummy.  I can't believe that we lived three blocks from here for almost a year without visiting.  The ahi was fantastic.  The seabass was so ridiculously moist that the only adjective that my boyfriend could think of to describe it was "retarded"
author: Alicia A.

description: Wow!  Had a really nice meal here last Wednesday evening.    We ordered a bunch of appetizers and shared, the grilled eel was off the hook.  Soooooo good.  I ordered the buffalo for an entree as I've never had buffalo before.  Excellent selection.  Came with lots of veggies and salad and mashed.  The place was very clean, the service was excellent.  Our waiter was very patient and accommodating.  We were a party of 8 and one of us was 6 years old (awwwww).   Thank goodness we reserved our table, there were people standing for a long time waiting for a table.  Ugh.  I felt bad for them, but knew their wait would totally be worth it.  I'm taking away one star because it was so freakin' loud we had to shout to be heard.
author: Magdalena ..

description: We ate here late at night and it was great.  The Kobe steak was excellent.  Definitely recommend it.
author: Kellen M.

description:
All that  I have to say is deep fried salmon rolls! These were so delicious, melt in your mouth yummy little bites from heaven, dipped in a wasabi mustard sauce, OMG!

I can't even remember what else I had because these were so damn good.
author: Boheme P.

description: Holy smokes, the passion fruit creme brulee knocks my socks off!
author: Han C.

description: freaking delicious! Last Saturday was my food adventure day which i do once in awhile. I go for a long walk and see what look good and try it. i decided to go to The House because my girlfriend recommend it to me and i know my girlfriend knows about good food. I open the door and i was lucky to get a table right away. the place is small but is an awsome place to bring your friends and hang out and talk about anything. I order the Warm wasabi house noodles with grilled salmon. while I was waiting for my noodles they brought me a cold cucumber appetizer which had sesame seeds (Tsukemono style). when i got my food it look freaking good. when i had the first bite i could not believe I could taste the wasabi. most of the time when you cook wasabi with food the flavor of the wasabi is not strong enough or you can't even taste it. However the wasabi with the noddles was just right. I wasn't hungry but i did finish my noddles! I'm coming back for more!
author: Christian P.

description: I've been here for lunch and dinner, and while the dinner menu has more to offer, I loved them both. Their curry noodles (add salmmon) is really good, as well as the salmon rolls. For dinner I had a butterfish special, which was so good I could've dropped dead happy. MUST save room for dessert, they have a KILLER tapioca pudding. I could eat it for days and be the happiest person in the world!
author: Marina K.

description: I came here for dinner after a co-worker enthusiastically recommended it multiple times. The food is absolutely killer and beautifully presented. All of the dishes really showed an attention to detail and looked like something you'd find at a restaurant in Hawaii - lots of fresh fish and bright colors. I was really impressed by the selection of unusual fish on the menu and had a really hard deciding what to order. The only thing I wasn't too keen on was the atmosphere - it's extremely loud and crowded and there are only a few inches between tables. There also isn't much in the way in of decor. I'd definitely recommend The House for an evening out with a small group of friends, rather than a romantic date.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Rarely do I bestow five stars upon a place that I have only dined at once.  The House is truly deserving though.  I went here with 11 people for my birthday and not one of them had a bad meal.  The service was excellent, the atmosphere was great and the food was simply delicious.  I had the miso marinated black cod topped with a dungeness crab California roll and served with asparagus.  Heaven.  I wanted to lick the plate and almost did but restrained myself. Barely.  Dessert was excellent and I had the mango tapioca pudding but, although it was great, I wish I had the passionfruit creme brulee that my other friends got.  That was pure ambrosia and I will definitely be back for my own.  I think their prices were more than reasonable given the great food and the wonderful experience.  I will definitely be back.
author: Jill D.

description: A +++ for presentation and service.  I must say the wait staff is friendly and helpful with suggestions.  The ambience is cozy, yet modern.  The food, complex yet the presentation simple and elegant.  The portions are smaller, yet the flavor is full.  So, you'll leave the restaurant satisfied that you had a great meal without feeling gorged.  The price, moderate.
author: Hiromi N.

description: Small place, but stopped by at 6:30 on a Wednesday and had no problem getting a table for two.  The service was quick and the food was fantastic.  My friend and I split the unagi with avocado-wasabi rice, and it was absolutely delicious.  Then we had the salmon, which was very good, and finished up with the cobbler, which was also very good.  It's a lot pricier for dinner than for lunch, she told me--at lunch most items are under $10, but we ended up spending about $30/person (still not too bad).  A cute, unexpected find in North Beach.
author: Gina K.

description: I took my boyfriend here on his birthday since I heard it was one of his favorite restaurants. We had the steak and (of course) the sea bass - it was melt in your mouth goodness! For an appetizer we also ordered the raw oysters... there's a spicy tingliness that lingers in your mouth. I read some reviews about the long wait and everything, that didn't happen to me. We walked right in, got seated, and our order came right away as well. We didn't spend more than an hour in the restaurant. Once again, the food was DELISH!
author: Ede S.

description: By far my most frequented restaurant in the City.  I've been a big fan since 1998 when I went regularly to the House on 9th.  But since that one has closed, I often find myself going to the one in North Beach.  The menu has plenty of winners like the unagi on rice and ahi tuna appetizers.  It's been a while since my favorite dish the Hawaiian Butterfish was on the menu (but I think it's seasonal).  I always order to share and the sea bass is a must.  The steaks are also very good there.  Opal and the rest of the waitstaff are friendly and unpretentious.  The prices are reasonable for the quality of food and ambiance.  I almost always take out of towners here when they first visit and they're always impressed.  By far my favorite restaurant in SF because it does Asian Fusion the way it was meant to be.
author: Dave L.

description: Great restaurant!  The food is delicious and creative and doesn't leave you feeling overly stuffed.  It's definitely a great place to take visitors.  It's too bad that it is in North Beach so parking is near impossible, but the food is well worth it.  I had a vegetarian noodle dish i loved and my friends had the black cod and the seabass which were awesome.  If you go, get the Mango Tapioca....I've already had dreams about it's creamy goodness..
author: Laura H.

description: I absolutely love this restaurant. Delicious food and great service.
